item.title: Director of Business Intelligence at Bridge International Academies London (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for a Director of Business Intelligence, who will report directly to the CTO and who can take this organisational passion for data and translate it into ever more actionable insights for our internal departments, as well as developing develop data insights that will support additional revenue streams and frame Bridge as the premier learning management platform, extending even beyond the academies that we operate. 


Who We Are

BridgeInternational Academies is the world’s largest and fastest-growing chain of primary and preprimary schools with more than 500 academies and 100,000 pupils in Kenya, Uganda, Nigeria, India, and Liberia. We democratize the right to succeed by giving families living in poverty access to the high-quality education that will allow their children to live a very different life. We leverage experts, data, and technology in order to standardize and scale every aspect of quality education delivery, from how and where academies are built to how teachers are selected and trained, and how lessons are delivered and monitored for improvement. We are vertically-integrated, tech-enabled, and on our way to profitability. Bridge expects to continue its rapid expansion in Africa and India in the coming years.

The Bridge Offer

Roughly 2.7 billion people live on less than $2/day. In their communities, there is a huge gap between the education offered and the needs of the population. Too often the schools available to them fail to deliver for these families. The quality offered results in the average pupil from our communities in East Africa failing to reach proficiency in primary school and on average fail the primary exit exams that are critical to their development. Teachers are unresponsive and occasionally abusive, and fees are often unaffordable. Even government schools can cost families a significant amount of money after all the additional fees are added up. With 47% of classroom teaching time lost due to teacher absenteeism or neglect, 55% of families in our communities end up choosing private schools instead, but then fear for the stability and sustainability of their choice as many schools close after only a few years of service. Both the government schools and the private schools tend to lack well-conceived scope and sequences, instructional materials, student achievement data, and the capacity to react to that data. Families are actively searching for a better academic alternative. Enter Bridge International Academies. As of September 2016, Bridge operates more than 500 academies worldwide, serving roughly 100,000 pupils in Kenya, Uganda, Nigeria, India, and Liberia. Bridge utilises a scripted-learning education methodology coupled with 'big data' (all teachers have tablets for instruction, assessment, and data-gathering) that allows us to make curriculum a little better every day. With plans to enrol ten million students ten years from now, Bridge International Academies offers a tremendous opportunity to grow with one of the world’s most exciting, ambitious, and socially conscious companies, with leadership roles available across a number of competencies and geographies.

Tech at Bridge

Technology plays a critical role at Bridge in enabling us to provide education at massive scale and low cost – it's one of the key elements that gives us the ability to deliver what no one else can. Tech spans Director of Business Intelligence several key functions, from the hardware and software that our academies use to run all aspects of teaching and management, including mobile payments, to the systems that enable our country headquarters to manage massive local operations, to the data backbone that informs all of our strategic and tactical decision making. It’s a lot of custom software development and a lot of back office systems. We've got a ridiculously ambitious mission at Bridge, and it's a place where passionate technologists have a chance to directly change the world. No kidding.  

About the Role

Tech at Bridge is a highly complex, vertically-integrated affair, with systems supporting an ever expanding range of functions and countries, and crossing between software development, IT operations, academy operations, and logistics/supply chain. At the same time, our teams run lean and things change fast – governments make policy decisions that affect us, launching new countries is a frenetic affair, and we still need to evolve our core technology offering. Bridge has been data driven from its inception, using a build-measure-learn approach to all aspects of service delivery. As a scale model business, we have an unprecedented opportunity to bring statistical power to all aspects of our operation, from the academics team using randomised controlled trials to validate the best teaching mechanisms to the customer experience team understanding what is most important to our families to operational teams striving to improve our service delivery efficiency. However, we have reached an inflection point where we need to take our data game to the next level. Instead of just providing data to our various departments, we need to start bringing to bear more sophisticated techniques to unlock the potential of our significant data sets. While we collect tens of thousands of data points every term from each of our academies – from the time spent on each page of a lesson to the billing and payment history of every pupil – we are yet to fully realise the potential energy of these data sets. We’re looking for a Director of Business Intelligence, who will report directly to the CTO and who can take this organisational passion for data and translate it into ever more actionable insights for our internal departments, as well as developing develop data insights that will support additional revenue streams and frame Bridge as the premier learning management platform, extending even beyond the academies that we operate. This role is about really nerding out about data; but also translating that passion into tools that will improve all aspects of our service delivery. It will involve collaborating with experts and data scientists/analysts in other departments to deliver meaningful insights, while also pushing and supporting them with techniques that they could not yet begin to imagine. From adaptive curriculum to fraud detection to predictive analytics, the possibilities are endless. The Director of Business Intelligence will oversee a team that includes data warehousing, ETL, and ad hoc analysis, while also working with software development and UX experts to devise and deliver business intelligence products, such as data dashboards
 
What You Will Do



  • Define, architect and build complex large scale real-time data processing platforms

  • Oversee the design, delivery, and governance of the core data warehouse.  Design and deliver data products (esp. dashboards) to support core Bridge functions, with delivery support from software teams for implementation. Collaborate with data analysts and scientists in other departments to gather requirements and deliver insights. Director of Business Intelligence

  • Work with global and country executive leadership to define and present key business insights, from finance to operations to academies.

  • Leverage advanced techniques, such as machine learning and artificial intelligence, to drive insights on topics like fraud detection, marketing (pupil attraction/retention), and adaptive curriculum – to name a few.


What You Should Have



  • Bachelor's degree in related field with superior academic performance. Experience with visualisation tools such as Tableau, Pentaho, or (especially) PowerBI.

  • Knowledge of programming languages like R or Python. Additional languages a plus: C#, F#, Java, JavaScript and frameworks (esp. D3.js)

  • Familiarity with a variety of databases: MS-SQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, S3, Memcached, Elasticsearch.

  • Knowledge of data science tools, such as iPython, Scikit-Learn, Numpy, Pandas, Word2vec, Matlab, Octave, R, Rapidminer, Bigml, Cytoscape.

  • Experience with tools and frameworks such as Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, AirBrake, Nagios, Storm, Cascading.

  • Experience with analytic tools such as Analytics Google Analytics, Graphite, Kissmetrics.

  • A belief in treating BI as a first-class software citizen – source control (git), testing (e.g. Cucumber), controlled deployments, and Agile development. Comfort working in a company that acts and feels a lot like a startup (dynamic, unstructured, and frequently changing), but at the same time has global reach and ambitious international expansion plans.

  • Excellent verbal and written communications and interpersonal skills.

  • Passion for Bridge's vision of democratising the right for all children to succeed.  


You’re also



  • A detailed doer – You have a track record of getting things done. You’re organized and responsive. You take ownership of every idea you touch and execute it to a fine level of detail, setting targets, engaging others, and doing whatever it takes to get the job done. You can multi-task dozens of such projects at once and never lose sight of the details. Likely, you have some experience in a start-up or other rapid-growth company.

  • A networking mastermind – You excel at meeting new people and turning them into advocates. You communicate in a clear, conscientious, and effective way in both written and oral speech. You can influence strangers in the course of a single conversation. Allies and colleagues will go to bat for your ideas. 

  • A creative problem-solver – Growing any business from scratch comes with massive and constant challenges. On top of that, Bridge works in volatile, low-resource communities and runs on fees averaging just $6 a month per pupil. You need to be flexible and ready to get everything done effectively, quickly, and affordably with the materials at hand. Every dollar you spend is a dollar our customers, who live on less than $2 a day, will have to pay for.

  • A customer advocate – Our customers – these families living on less than $2 a day per person – never leave your mind. You know them, get them, have shared a meal with them (or would be happy to in the future). You would never shrink back from shaking a parent’s hand or picking up a crying child, no matter what the person was wearing or looked like. Every decision you make considers their customer benefit, experience, and value. 

  • A life-long learner – You believe you can always do better. You welcome constructive criticism and provide it freely to others. You know you only get better tomorrow when others point out where you’ve missed things or failed today.

item.title: Scala Engineer at Depop (London, UK)

item.title: Data Engineer, Analytics at Facebook (London, UK)
item.description:
Do you like working with big data? Do you want to use data to influence product decisions for products being used by over half a billion people every day? If yes, we want to talk to you. Our data warehouse team works very closely with Product Managers, Product Analysts and Internet Marketers to figure out ways to acquire new users, retain existing users and optimize user experience - all of this using massive amounts of data. In this role, you will see a direct link between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction. In this role, you will work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, and you'll get an opportunity to solve some of the most challenging business problems on the web and mobile Internet, at a scale that few companies can match.


Responsibilities



  • Manage data warehouse plans for a product or a group of products.

  • Interface with engineers, product managers and product analysts to understand data needs.

  • Build data expertise and own data quality for allocated areas of ownership.

  • Design, build and launch new data models in production.

  • Design, build and launch new data extraction, transformation and loading processes in production.

  • Support existing processes running in production.

  • Define and manage SLA for all data sets in allocated areas of ownership.

  • Work with data infrastructure to triage infra issues and drive to resolution.

item.title: Software Engineer, Systems at Facebook (London, UK)
item.description:
A person in this role will build the systems that allow us to ingest, sanitise, and normalise diverse datasets into meaningful structured data and connections within the social graph. If you're excited by the idea of building out a richly connected knowledge graph and augmenting it with services that allow us to create great product experiences built on top of data, you might be the person we're looking for.


Responsibilities



  • Build infrastructure that enables us to scale our knowledge graph and quickly expand into new domains

  • Work with product teams to deliver great experiences built on top of data

  • Monitor and reduce duplicate entities across the graph (and web)

  • Increase the amount of metadata we have about each entities and the connections between them

  • Improve graph quality by building systems that select and surface the best available data

  • Build tools that allow us to understand and track the quality of the graph over time

Want to build and ship new products or improve existing products like Facebook At Work, Ads, Photos, Videos, Places and Mobile? Want to solve unique, large scale, highly complex technical problems? Facebook is seeking an experienced software engineer to join our products teams in London. This position is full-time and is based in our London office. Facebook is staffing some of its most important engineering initiatives related to our long-term revenue out of London, and it's a huge opportunity for senior engineers to play a strong leadership role in these initiatives.


Responsibilities

  • Build end-to-end products for web, mobile

  • Work closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications

  • Work closely with operations and infrastructure to build and scale back-end services

  • Build report interfaces and data feeds

item.title: Integration Engineer at Facebook (London, UK)
item.description:
Internet.org is a global initiative dedicated to making affordable Internet access available to the two thirds of the world not yet connected. Making the Internet available to every person on earth is a goal too large and too important for any one company, group, or government to solve alone. Internet.org’s partners have come together to meet this challenge because they believe in the power of a connected world. This role is an opportunity to be part of this initiative by working with Network Infrastructure Companies and Internet Service Providers, delivering affordable Internet service to the unconnected in rural areas. As a Partner Engineer you will handle the technical relationship with Internet Service Providers based in rural areas worldwide, and work closely with the Facebook account managers to draft the partnership roadmap to provide affordable and reliable Internet access. This position is full time and is based in London.


Responsibilities



  • Deeply understand the various Facebook platforms and underlying implementation

  • Be a technical expert on integrating Wi-Fi network solutions, Facebook software and internet.org core features with ISPs’ infrastructure

  • Help our partners to launch the internet.org service in their networks

  • Manage the technical relationship with the ISP partners, provide technical support and handle service outages

  • Drive partner requirements, bugs and feature requests with Product and Engineering

  • Write documentation, samples, and other materials to share with the broader Facebook developer community

item.title: Backend Developer at Infinite Codeworks (London, UK)
item.description:
We build great solutions for our customers and we are looking for a talented developer to join our team. It will be fast paced and varied - we are a small team that take on big projects. With our broad experience you will be exposed to lots of different businesses, we are looking for someone who really likes to build solutions.


PHP, HTML, CSS, OOP JS with at least a year of experience with any PHP based frameworks such as: Laravel, CakePHP, ZendFramework, Symphony.


We use Laravel as the core for many of our PHP applications and experience in this is really beneficial, but understanding of common eCommerce platforms would also be good. Take a look at Shopware if you want to know one platform that you would definitely be working with. You should know how to deal with API's of every type REST, SOAP, XML-RPC.. and parsing CSV's. (You may also work on our integration platform: www.infinite-connect.com)


We are looking for a developer who can think about problems and propose solutions - this is really important to us, we don't want people who can just follow instructions.


We are based in Chiswick Park in West London, a great place to work, take a look: http://www.enjoy-work.com


We look after our staff, you will be provided with the tools to do your job as well as training when needed.



  • New MacBook Pro (or PC...)

  • Training: £1500 a year towards any conference/training


It is exciting, it will be fun and there is space to grow, please take some time apply - it does make a difference!


***** We don't work with agencies, no doubt you are lovely people and have just the candidate... but unless your commission rate is 0% we aren't going to be working with you. *****

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer at BookingBug (London, UK)
item.description:
BookingBug is the industry’s most advanced, powerful and versatile appointment and event booking platform, powering the real-time management of appointments made via online, mobile, in-store or call centre for thousands of enterprise clients. Using a combination of cutting-edge front end technologies, and a truly open and scalable cloud-based API architecture, we’re able to design solutions that can accommodate the wildest of client requirements.  

It’s an exciting time to join BookingBug. We’re scaling up our Technology teams, and looking for an experienced Senior Developer to join one of our Dev Squads (affectionately named after video games). The BookingBug platform is built on the AWS cloud platform, and is constantly in a state of expansion. We employ various frameworks, from front-end AngularJS interfaces to MVC frameworks and design patterns for the construction of our back-end APIs.  

Based in our London HQ, you will be working across a range of internal and client projects - including a growing list of major UK and US brands.  This is a full-time position based in London, so willingness to relocate to London is essential!

As a Ruby on Rails Developer, your main responsibility will be for the design, development and implementation of new features to improve the scalability and feature set of our platform, as well as production, modification and maintenance of the web application and user interfaces, working closely with our Project Managers and our own internal testing team. As a senior member of the team, you will also be performing code reviews of other team members’ code and mentoring & supporting more junior team members into great Developers.

item.title: Senior Big Data Technical Lead at Expedia (London, UK)
item.description:
Hotels.com helps our customers find the perfect place and wake up happy is an exciting mission for our Technology team.  We are looking for a Senior Big Data Technical Lead for our technical operations team to help us deliver features to our customers quickly, make sure we are always there for our customers and offer an unsurpassed hotel search and booking experience.


Over 30 million monthly visitors across 70 countries in nearly 40 languages pose some rather interesting technical challenges. Taking complex requirements and delivering them via super simple solutions is what makes our job interesting.


Hotels com are undergoing a major drive to improve the whole of their Big Data Engineering function and we require a highly skilled Big Data Technical Lead to help with the evolution and running of the ops set-up.


Job Responsibilities.


Design QA, Production, Staging and Performance Environments in AWS.


Develop relationships with Dev teams to build robust solutions.


Day-to-day management of requests and issues for all environments including prioritization for the off-shore team


Identify and Implement tools for increased productivity, security, reliability, and performance.


Develop tools for performance monitoring, security monitoring, and AWS resource creation scripts.


Analyze and understand the business requirements, specifications and high-level solution designs.


Work with stakeholders and development teams to provision solution.


Provide guidance and direction to the off-sure team and follow best practices and drive towards business goals.

item.title: Software Development Engineer at Expedia (London, UK)
item.description:
As a Java Software Engineer working in Hotels.com H.Web team, you will participate in the design, development and deployment of web applications that drives Hotels.com user experience. You will help ensure the website is performant, scalable, available and developed to support exceptional demand. In an environment with a DevOps mindset you will manage, automate and make decisions that influence applications and services that serve millions of customers from around the world.


General Responsibilities:



  • Work with the technology and business groups to refine requirements and functional specifications

  • Develop systems and tools and maximize effective efficient delivery without compromising on quality

  • Develop and deliver software in a continuous integrated environment

  • Estimate resources and identify risks to achieve project goals

  • Promote good development methodologies via code review, great software design and brown bags or tech talks

  • Ability to work within a development team, providing support to other team members where necessary

  • Evaluate and recommend tools, technologies and efficient processes

item.title: Senior Server Engineer - 2017's Biggest Mobile Strategy Game at NaturalMotion games ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
The NaturalMotion London team have created something truly unique with the Dawn of Titans project and over three years have established one of the most talented teams in the games industry. Our game will bring a console-quality experience to mobile, featuring ground-breaking graphics, an unparalleled collaborative multiplayer environment and an adventure that will retain players for many years to come. In this bold move to position ourselves as a world leader in AAA mobile game development, server infrastructure with undisruptive seamless gameplay becomes the plinth to our success.


We are on the hunt for a world class senior server engineer with expert Java or Go development skills to join our specialist server team as we approach the launch of a genre disrupting mobile title.

Our small but elite team of server engineers hold over seventy years of coding experience across multiple technical industries, offering high performance from day one and allowing you to reach new levels of coding excellence, always pushing the boundaries of server technology.

What challenges await you?



  • Developing high-performance game logic in a distributed fashion exposed to millions of users.

  • Write robust code that runs on AWS.

  • Maintaining the current code base through its lifecycle over many short development iterations and collaborating with your awesome team to ensure superior quality of code at every step of the journey.

  • Working with our client side games development teams to develop robust extensible systems.

  • Managing the intelligent storage of a huge amount of player and game data.

  • Plan for growth from the infrastructure point of view and solution components accordingly.

  • Improve our games solutions architecture, processes and code base.

  • Operate a live game

  • Keeping the fun - we believe that a team that has fun whilst coding is an essential part of making a fun and engaging experience for our audience.

item.title: Principal Programmer - Brand New Mobile Game IP at NaturalMotion games ltd. (Brighton, UK)
item.description:
Our Boss Alien studio is on the lookout for a Principal Programmer to work on an unannounced AAA strategy mobile title.  As Principal, you will work closely with your game team (developers, artists, designers and producers) to deliver a great player experience ensuring the client architecture is of high quality and the game play is polished, enterprising and above all, fun.


Responsibilities:



  • Create, maintain and optimize game features

  • Produce professional quality C# code

  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks

  • Identify and communicate best practices for both front-end and back-end engineering

  • Proactively highlight and solve potential issues in the code and tool-chain

  • Deliver the Product Lead’s vision of the core game

  • Develop and promote best practices for documentation, unit testing, and code reviews

item.title: Data Engineer - Python or Scala at Toptal () (allows remote)
item.description:
At Toptal, we measure everything and always rely on data to guide all of our initiatives, including both our long-term strategy and our day-to-day operations.


As a Data Engineer, your main goal is to be one step ahead of data scientists and analysts, and support them by providing infrastructure and tools they can use to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems that can be developed rapidly and maintained easily. This is more than building and maintaining ETL pipelines. We need innovation, creativity, and solutions that will have significant impact on our velocity. We, in turn, will give you autonomy and freedom to turn your ideas into reality.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. However, we do things like rent out hotels in Africa or mansions in Thailand, and you will certainly be invited to come work with us.

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer at Toptal () (allows remote)

By joining our team, you’ll get the opportunity to work on many of our various Rails projects with a team of highly skilled Rails experts from around the world. item.title: DevOps / Linux System Administrator at GfK (Amstelveen, Netherlands)
item.description:
GfK Business Applications NL are a small IT division with around ~20 developers. We focus on delivering an end-to-end market research platform which is used by GfK researchers across the world.


GfK DRIVE is a cutting–edge technical platform for end-2-end market research solutions which pushes our business to the next technological level from data retrieval to real time interactive visualizations in a more and more customer-centric world. Our initial success now leads to strong global growth and the need for scale-able and robust solutions based on the DRIVE platform which provides data driven services, tools, Apps and modern Dashboards developed on Linux, MongoDB, Analytic Column Stores, php, Java Script.


The Devops team is tightly integrated with the other ICT teams of GfK DRIVE. We closely work together with the development and data teams to implement new technologies and give advice with regard to system operation and infrastructure aspects. Beside this our tasks are to provide a stable and scale-able 24x7 environment. We are currently using VMWare clusters, MongoDB shards and RIAK for this purpose, to name just a few.


Our current challenges are:



  • Adapting and implementing new technologies required for our global DRIVE platform.

  • "Keeping it running".

  • Identify both system and application problems and have these adressed.

item.title: Hadoop Developer at Department for Work & Pensions (DWP) (London, UK)
item.description:
Do you want to be part of an organisation that is currently undertaking one of the biggest digital transformation programmes in the UK?


Here at DWP we have some fantastic opportunities for Hadoop Developers who are confident working with big data technologies to support new and innovative analytic solutions.


As a Hadoop Developer you will be responsible for delivering all aspects of code development activities to meet user needs to agreed timescales.


You will also contribute to the Loading and running of bulk data transfers, creation of scripts to support the cleansing and scrubbing of data.

item.title: Business Intelligence Developer - Tableau at CentralReach () (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a talented Tableau BI Developer to join our team.  Although we have offices in Pompano Beach, FL, you can work full-time from anywhere in the comfort of your own home (or join us in the office if you prefer, full relocation provided).  Mid and senior (and very senior, and very very senior) levels of applicants with anywhere from 2 thru 20+ years experience are welcome to apply. Though we do not hire based on specific languages or technologies, we currently plan to primarily utilize the AWS stack (i.e. Redshift, Dynamo, EMR) and Tableau for data visualization.


You should:



  • Have a passion for data visualization, reporting, and analytics in general

  • Have proven working experience as a data/bi/business analyst

  • Enjoy and thrive in an agile, fast-moving, ever-changing startup environment

  • Welcome and take on analytics/reporting challenges of all shapes and sizes

  • Be comfortable working in a distributed, semi-virtual environment

  • Be capable of creating and executing on technical direction and tasks for yourself and others

  • Be able to take minimal direction from others and provide maximal output for yourself (and others)


You will:

You must:

  • Display working knowledge of the SQL language and/or SQL-based relational and non-relational database system(s) (i.e. Redshift, SQL Server, Oracle, NoSql systems, etc.)

  • Possess foundational knowledge of mainstream web development and technologies

  • Have a solid command of written and spoken English


The Perks:

  • Work in an office (when you are in the office anyhow) that understands and values employees (especially techies). No cubicles, no unnecessary meetings, the freedom to produce results, excellent hardware, and people that laugh at your jokes

  • Responsibility for your output (and the corresponding accountability)

item.title: 7.5TB per day read from our production MongoDB cluster - Help us scale up! at Sky Betting & Gaming (Sheffield, UK)
item.description:
We have multiple scrums creating rich web applications and forging ahead with the most rapidly changing online gaming experience.  This isn’t just some bookie’s website - this is Sky Betting and Gaming.


What does a DevOps Engineer do at Sky Betting and Gaming?


The delivery of Sky Betting and Gaming's next generation of highly available, high throughput (think thousands of requests per second), low latency services into production. Services that will underpin our rapidly growing customer base's core activities.


We are building systems that can cost more than 6 figures a minute if they go down.  As well as being industry leading bringing products first to market in the betting and gaming industry, such as Apple Pay.


We bridge Delivery and Service Operations.  We sit with the devs, but we are on-call for the services.


If you join us, you'll:
•    Be on-call sometimes 24x7 for the main sites and applications
•    Support internal development, test environments and help the devs
•    Own the release of internal code and push out config changes
•    Help automate things and bring older systems and processes forward
•    Be a guardian of code quality, helping the devs to make not just good features, but good systems
•    Set up monitoring for everything in sight - if it moves, graph it
•    Be a point of contact into Operations for various teams


Can you fix our problem?


We're looking for a developer with sys-admin war stories, or a sys-admin who can get into the code up to their elbows.  Mainly you need to know your stuff.


Data management - SQL, NoSQL, size, performance - these are mere details; you can make the data dance and the engine hum.


Code - you can branch, code, test, (code, test, code, test…), commit and deploy across a complex estate on just one cup of coffee.


Scaling - you can take a server's temperature, read a load-balancer, you know when to throw tin at it and when to go back to the code.


Automation - you understand the quandary of Chef vs Puppet, and you've had to choose; you know Jenkins' little foibles; your bash skills are strong.


Source - you have a favourite source-control system, a least favourite and the one you love to hate, but mainly you can handle the codebase no matter the size.


Systems - you know your Linux, know your sar from your iostat, you can nurse a sick server back to health in the wee small hours and find out how to make a given application fly…


Experience - whether you've been there and done that or are relatively junior, you've learned from every twist and turn and never tire of new things. 


Systems we use


We want you to help manage the LAMP stack but there's other things too - Mongo, Redis and Memcached, RabbitMQ, Tomcat.  There's a lot of internally-written systems.


We write our code in PHP and Javascript, making heavy use of NodeJS.  There's the usual mixture of bash, a little Python, some Ruby.  We use TrafficScript.  Source control is Git.


We have OpenBet systems for the gaming side.  We use Rundeck, Chef, Graphite, Opsview, Splunk, Hadoop, TeaLeaf, Riverbed Stingrays.


We're a RHEL/CentOS house.



Nosy at the office..


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R7x_k7H55cI

item.title: Continuous Delivery Developer - Python at J.P Morgan (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
Athena is J.P. Morgan's cross-market risk management and trading system. It is used in our foreign exchange, fixed income and commodities businesses. Athena includes a globally replicated object-oriented database, a powerful dependency graph and a fully integrated stack across pricing, risk and trading tools. The code is a combination of Python and C++: C++ for speed, and Python for flexibility and rapid but controlled releases. Athena is designed to pull developers close to the business to help increase revenues while improving operational processes and controls to reduce costs. Team Description The Rates Athena team is extending the Athena platform for Fixed Income businesses globally - from New York, London and Tokyo to Sydney and Lima - to provide intraday real time risk & position management, transaction management, and back office integration. The team follows agile practices, adapted to intra-day Continuous Deployment, and supported by regular retrospectives. The components built by this team range from front end trading GUIs to server side components written in reactive programming paradigm, with responsibilities include pricing, trade capture, sales workflows, position & risk management, profit and loss calculation, trade lifecycle management and integration with internal systems responsible for settlement, financing, risk aggregation and regulatory reporting.  Job Description Key Responsibilities:



  • Work closely with customers and analysts to identify and specify complex business requirements and processes, research, evaluate & recommend alternative solutions.

  • End to end ownership of deliveries to production – including analysis, planning, model, design, develop, code, test, debug, document and push to production

  • Plan delivery of work; demonstrate active leadership within the team and agile practices.

  • Become proficient in Python, and the Athena platform’s NoSql OO database, graph-oriented development model and developer toolset

  • Conduct design & code reviews, sign off code for push to production

  • Write supporting documentation and executable specifications.

  • Support system testing, user testing and production implementation.

  • Ensure compliance across the team with project methodology and Information Risk policies

  • Incorporate team and firm-wide architectural standards into design.

  • Care as much about code quality, test coverage and domain modelling as we do


Your Background:



  • You have been developing in Java, C++, C#, Smalltalk, Ruby or Python and looking for a new challenge. You want to spend less time writing boiler plate code and anaemic domain models, getting bogged down in ORMs, DAOs, build scripts and release packaging and more time understanding the business and delivering great solutions. You enjoy working with other talented people and want the career opportunities a top tier global company offers.

  • Essential

    • Good at problem solving and getting things done

    • Effective at working in a globally distributed team

    • Excellent coding, automated unit testing, refactoring, OO design



  • Desirable

    • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in a related subject

    • Python

    • Coaching & mentoring junior developers

    • Continuous Integration, TDD, pair programming

    • NoSql databases, e.g. Cassandra, BigTable

    • Socket programming, ZeroMQ

    • Automated Acceptance Testing / Specification By Example / BDD

    • Low latency design, high performance, memory and CPU profiling

    • Reactive Programming / Complex Event Processing

    • Functional & Graph-oriented programming

    • SQL and relational databases, preferably PostgreSQL

    • XML and related technologies ( XML Schema, XPath )

    • Message oriented middleware ( e.g. MQSeries )





  • Desirable Business Knowledge:

    • Product knowledge of Fixed Income securities ( bonds, options, futures ) and derivatives ( interest rate swaps, exotics & hybrids )

    • Electronic trading markets and protocols ( e.g. FIX )

    • Pricing & Risk analytics, PnL calculation




JPMorgan offers an exceptional benefits program and a highly competitive compensation package.

JPMorgan is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

item.title: Senior OO Developer at JP Morgan (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
Due to ongoing investment and expansion at our award winning Glasgow Technology Centre, we have a number of new opportunities available for talented OO Developers.


Glasgow has been home to JP Morgan’s award winning Technology Centre since 1999. With more than 1400 Technologists designing, building and supporting global systems, our centre is one of the largest IT employers in Scotland. Our firm lives and breathes technology, with over 40,000 tech employees located in 13 strategic hubs around the world.


The Asset Management Suitability program delivers a technology solution to support many regulatory directives and requirements globally. The solution covers many different aspects of the client and trade lifecycle:


· Capturing data from clients, from multiple channels (online and paper)


· Algorithmically determining, from the captured data, the clients’ appetite for risk and their understanding of different investment products


· Calculating the risk the different products clients may invest in


· Pre-trade checks to ensure all trades made for a client are suitable


· Post-trade checks to evaluate various aspects of each client’s overall portfolio


· MIS, enabling reporting to internal compliance and external regulatory bodies


Developers will have the opportunity to work on all the above areas of the overall system. This role is for a developer working on a wide range of technologies within the platform.


The program is global and delivers to all jurisdictions. The group follows an agile development methodology based on the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).


Responsibilities


Key responsibilities shall include but not be limited to:


· Design and implement complex and robust solutions using Java and other languages


· Develop solutions using both relational and non-relational technologies (such as MongoDB or OrientDB). The group is embracing non-relational technologies where possible


Review of epics and stories provided by analysts, and turning those into detailed technical designs
· Creation of appropriate technical documentation


Develop automated unit tests
Participate in peer review sessions
Active involvement in resolving the issues encountered in all environments, including production.

item.title: Staff Embedded Driver Engineer GPGPU at ARM (Cambridgeshire, UK)
item.description:
ARM is looking for a motivated engineer to take a senior position within a team working to develop software at the cutting edge of mobile GPU technology. Working on the next generation Mali™ mobile GPUs and the latest yet-to-be-published Android versions, you will help shape the technologies that the mobile market will see in years to come.


Job Description


You will be joining a multinational and dynamic Agile software development team located in Cambridge (UK). The team is responsible for the Compute Runtime component of the driver implementing the OpenCL and RenderScript APIs. OpenCL allows massively parallel execution of general purpose (C-like) code on the Mali GPUs, often known as GPGPU (General Purpose computing on the GPU). 


Job Purpose


The GPGPU team’s challenge is to provide robust and performant functionality in a highly constrained environment. Compute Runtime is a complex, power-efficient and performance-critical component of the Mali GPU driver stack. Embedded GPGPU use cases include image processing, computer vision, video and virtual reality. 

The Compute Runtime component works in close conjunction with the LLVM-based runtime compiler (developed by a separate team in the same building) and must efficiently interoperate with other parts of the driver stack. You will need embedded software development and optimization skills, but previous experience of GPGPU is not essential.


This role represents a senior engineering position within the GPGPU team, and as such involves not just engineering, but the ability to guide and inspire other more junior engineers.



Join us to help us make GPGPU and Mali a success in other peoples’ hands.


The role involves cooperating with fellow ARM GPU driver stack developers across three continents, with a primary focus on the Compute Runtime component. We have a roadmap of features to be implemented, and at the same time need to continuously improve the driver’s performance, and ensure that existing customers continue to receive a robust and performant product. 

Day to day:

The role will involve the design and implementation of new features and tests, as well as the benchmarking, maintenance and optimisation of existing areas of the driver.

Your day to day role will involve the design and implementation of new features and tests, as well as the benchmarking, maintenance and optimisation of existing areas of the driver. As a senior member of the team you will be expected to guide and mentor more junior members of the team, as well as take a leading role in designs and discussions. We value proactivity and enthusiasm, and look to our senior engineers to encourage and lead others, as well as to be the source of new ideas and initiatives


You will work in a Linux environment, coding and debugging for ARM-based targets including models, FPGAs and silicon from our partner companies (thereby covering past, present and future generations of our designs). As a member of an Agile team you will have the chance to try your hand at all aspects of our work. Engineers grow their expertise through this work, through on and off the job training, and through peer code reviews.


One of the great things about working at ARM is that if you have a question about another component, you can usually speak directly to the designer, whether it’s other software, hardware or tooling. Over the years engineers develop into specialised experts, generalists, or transition to other disciplines such as project and product management.


About the Media Processing Group:


The Media Processing Group produces multimedia hardware and software products for mobile and embedded devices. Our product portfolio includes GPU, Display and Video IP. Our Mali™ Graphics Processors (GPUs) have an advanced, highly programmable architecture for accelerating 2D and 3D graphics, specifically tuned for high performance and energy efficiency. The flagship Mali-G71 series multi-core GPU sets a new standard for graphics and compute performance with low energy consumption. Our OpenGL ES, OpenCL and RenderScript drivers support cutting edge gaming and state of the art user interfaces on operating systems such as Linux and Android. To see the current Mali GPUs in action take a look at the Mali Developer Center (http://www.malideveloper.com).


Our innovative technology is licensed by ARM Partners who have shipped more than 50 billion Systems on Chip (SoCs) containing our intellectual property since the company was formed in 1990. Together with our Connected Community, we are breaking down barriers to innovation for developers, designers and engineers, ensuring a fast, reliable route to market for leading electronics companies.

With offices around the world, ARM is a diverse community of dedicated, innovative and highly talented professionals. By enabling an inclusive, meritocratic and open workplace where all our people can grow and succeed, we encourage our people to share their unique contributions to ARM's success in the global marketplace.

Our mission is to be the number one provider of 2D/3D Graphics technology on the planet. If you have a passion for technology and want to shape the future of mobile devices, then we want to hear from you.

item.title: Student Systems Officer at University for the Creative Arts (Farnham, UK)
item.description:
UCA is a top 40 university, this year entering the Guardian University Guide league table at position 39, with its School of Architecture placed 5th in the Subject listings. For over 150 years the University for the Creative Arts in Canterbury, Epsom, Farnham, Maidstone and Rochester has been leading the way for art and design education.






Student Systems Officer                                                                      


Full Time Post: 36.25 hours per week


 £25,298 to £28,453 per annum                                         Ref: 16-RSS012-0630-2


Farnham


As a member of the Student Records & Systems team, the Student Systems Officer has responsibility for the day-to-day operation of the University’s student records system, currently SITS:Vision. Together with colleagues, you will contribute to the maintenance and development of the student records database to ensure the effective operation of University-wide business processes and services. You will have line management responsibility for the Systems & Process Administrator.


For further details and to apply for this post please visit our website https://jobs.ucreative.ac.uk


The closing date for receipt of applications is 27 November 2016.


Interviews will be held on 8 December 2016.


We value the diversity of our organisation and welcome applicants from all sections of the community.

item.title: Learn and work with ARM architecture as a C++ or Java Software Engineer at ARM (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
If you have a good Computing, Engineering or Science degree qualification and have a passion for Software Engineering then the ARM Design centre is keen to discuss an exciting opportunity to join the team.


Initially this role will be based in Blackburn although in early 2017 we expect this role to relocate to new premises in Manchester as we continue with our growth plans.

We are looking for candidates that have a solid grounding in Java or C++ and are keen to learn about ARM architecture and work with cutting edge SoC designs from ARM's partners.


ARM’s Development Solutions Group provides a range of tools for developers of ARM-based systems. These include C/C++ Compilers, assemblers, GUI debuggers, fast and cycle accurate models of ARM platforms, development boards and hardware debugging tools. These tools are provided for both Microsoft Windows and Linux host environments and support software development for all ARM CPUs both with, and in advance of the availability of, target silicon.


The successful candidate will join the DS-5 (https://developer.arm.com/products/software-development-tools/ds-5-development-studio) software development team to work on various elements of the debug and trace solution.  The candidate can expect to grow their software development skills across a range of technologies including C++, Java, Python, and ARM architecture.


You’ll need great customer focus and excellent communication skills.   You’ll need to be comfortable working in an agile environment in a small team that strives for continuous improvement.  You'll need to be keen to learn a range of new technologies and keep pace with a fast changing environment as an ongoing part of your work at ARM.

item.title: Java Developers x 10 - Amazing Digital & Technology journey at Hermes at Hermes UK (Morley, UK)
item.description:
We are currently recruiting for a number of Java Engineers (at all levels, Junior, Mid & Senior) in Leeds as we embark on an amazing technology & digital adventure.                   


In the words of our Head of Innovation: “Nothing is impossible here at Hermes! As Google is to "search" and Amazon is to "buy", Hermes will be to "delivery".


MyHermes; Augmented Reality; BigData; Mobile; B2C & B2B Web solutions are just some of the projects you will get involved in – they are exciting, game changing and will take us to new levels. 


We are looking for Engineers who enjoy collaborative teams (including pair programming) as we continue to roll out our new agile environment.


You will code for sure, but we also expect you to participate in the design of software solutions, including applications design, database design, data-flows and detailed technical design working with the Solutions Architect as appropriate.


The technology stack is leading edge (not set in stone) and you will get a chance to work with (but not limited to):


Java8, AngularJS, Javascript, Apache Camel, Oracle, NoSQL, Cassandra, RabbitMQ, Selenium, Cucumber, Spring Boot, AWS, Jenkins, Sonar, Vagrant, Ansible & Docker.


We are open minded, love new ideas and we also encourage a work/life balance.


Now is the time to join us on our adventure and we want to hear from you today.


Get in touch today by calling Jody @ MRJ (0161 244 9600) or email us at hermes@mrjrecruitment.com


Hermes is currently working exclusively with MRJ for our Java Development campaign.

item.title: Full Stack Developer - Up for a challenge? :) at PCA Predict (Worcester, UK)
item.description:
PCA Predict is a progressive, forward thinking company that utilises the latest technologies to deliver simple, elegant solutions to our clients that deliver amazing checkout experiences in just a few clicks.


We are looking for a talented full stack developer to join our development team. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years experience in the industry with a solid grounding in the Microsoft stack and also have experience building client side solutions.


You'll work in a cross functional team that will contain members of UX, design, and development. All teams get to interact with senior business stakeholders on a daily basis (we don't believe in offices and ivory towers - everything is open plan with everyone in the business being approachable).


You could sum up our culture as "Just Do It Now" - we like to get product shipped with a minimum of red tape to ensure our clients benefit from releases as quickly as possible. For this reason we implement continuous delivery, automate as many processes as possible and have a high release cadence (at least weekly for some product lines).


During a typical day you can expect to:



  • Take part in stand-ups to keep your team and the company updated on progress/issues (we use Kanban boards along with SCRUM & no-estimates)

  • Work on the core stack (C#/VB.Net) & SQL server

  • Deploy releases out to staging/production using CI tools (TeamCity/Octopus)

  • Creating/updating APIs (as used in our super smart fuzzy address lookup control)

  • Work with various business stakeholders to add new ideas into the backlog

  • Research new technologies that we could help the business and suggesting changes

  • Have fun with our tech team whilst doing what you love - writing code! :)

item.title: Save the Planet with Satellite Data, Python, Django and AWS at Ecometrica (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Ecometrica is presently on the lookout for a Python Developer, based in our Edinburgh (Scotland) UK office. This is an immediate job opening to work on the world’s most widely-used sustainability platform.


We are building a platform to process and make query-able vast amounts of satellite data used by national space agencies, forestry departments etc...


You must:



  • have a good sense of humour;

  • work well in geographically dispersed and time zone challenged teams;

  • have good communications skills in English;

  • deal well with receiving a vague problem description, and take matters in your own hands to make sure it gets solved to everybody’s satisfaction.


The challenges are numerous and great, in all areas – infrastructure, backend, algorithms, frontend design and implementation, etc. We really need you!


In terms of perks, Ecometrica is a great place to work. Schedules are completely flexible, how you work and solve problems is also flexible, and you’ll get a Mac or Linux laptop, your choice (or Windows if you really want that). It’s like working for a startup, but a startup which is already doing well, with lots of blue chip clients, so there’s much less stress. We’re here for the long run, but you get to join while the company is still relatively young.


We are located in a brand new office in the  West End of Edinburgh with unlimited coffee, tea and, a smart new working environment. 


You may get to visit our other offices from time to time, and you need to be able/allowed to travel sparingly to other offices if necessary. We have a good benefits package and 27 days of paid holiday. Salary will depend on your experience, but will be competitive – we are open to receiving applications from very junior up to senior levels and are looking for both a junior and a more senior developer.


The team is great, too. You won’t be simply working in a dev team, you’ll also be working with amazing, fun, very bright scientists both in Montréal and in Edinburgh.


Please include links to sites you’ve built, projects you’ve completed, repos on github or bitbucket where you’ve contributed or are the lead developer, your twitter stream, or anything else that makes sense.

item.title: Saving the Planet with Reactjs and MapboxGL at Ecometrica (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
We are presently on the seeking a Frontend Developer, to work from either our Edinburgh UK, or Montréal, Canada offices. This is an immediate job opening to work on the world’s most widely-used sustainability management software platform for a candidate who:



  • Has a good sense of humour;

  • Has excellent communications skills in English;

  • Works well in geographically dispersed and time zone challenged teams;

  • Deals well with receiving a vague problem description, and can take matters in your own hands to make sure it gets solved to everybody’s satisfaction;

  • Is legally authorized to work in either Scotland, UK, or Canada.  


Ecometrica is a great place to work on successful products alongside a team of smart, and dedicated people. The development challenges are numerous and significant, in all areas – UX, UI design, mapping, data visualization, etc. Schedules and how you work and solve problems are flexible, and you have your choice of laptop to work on. Working at Ecometrica is like working for a startup, but a startup with lots of blue chip clients, so there’s much less stress. We’re here for the long run, but you get to join while the company is still relatively young.


We have development teams in the West End of Edinburgh or in the Mile End district of  Montréa. You may get to visit our other offices from time to time, and need to be able to travel sparingly to other offices if necessary. We have a good benefits package and 27 days of paid holiday per year. Salary will depend on your experience, but will be competitive.


At Ecometrica, you won’t be simply working in a dev team, you’ll also be working with amazing, fun, very bright scientists both in Montréal and in Edinburgh.


Interested and qualified applicants should apply on stackoverflow. Include any links to sites or applications you’ve built, projects you’ve completed, repos on github or bitbucket where you’ve contributed or are the maintainer, or anything else that shows your qualifications.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Python Developers at Novastone Media (London, UK)
item.description:
Novastone is an innovative tech start up that has recently been selected as a finalist for the Financial Times ‘Future of Fintech Awards 2016’ http://on.ft.com/2e4Zk7t 


So what do we do and who are we looking for?


Novastone has identified a gap in the financial sector to strengthen the relationship between financial institutions and their customers by developing a secure chat and media sharing application. The application is designed to build greater trust and better communication between parties.


Our platform brings the following benefits to our customers:



  1. Reduces the friction between the adviser and customer when needed to confirm identity and transactions.

  2. Provides a secure communication channel where the financial institution controls who can talk to each other. 

  3. Allows the financial institution to audit and store all conversations from a compliance and regulatory standpoint.



As a tech start up, we have lots to do and this means we need developers to work closely with real customers to identify how to develop our early stage product into something that is compelling and effective for clients to use.


The quality and security of the product is extremely important especially in the financial sector, so a willingness to take on and adapt to new technical challenges is a must.


The software team are always looking at how we can improve our knowledge and techniques and we expect you to want to learn about agile methodologies such as Kanban as well as learn about DevOps practices.


Culture is really important to us so we only hire people who are truly passionate about making things work and people who recognise working as a team is not optional. Our team are smart and get things done but also friendly and team orientated.

item.title: Full-stack Python Developer at Eporta (London, UK)
item.description:
The business


We are the leading B2B marketplace in the furniture and home furnishings industry, a market worth over $450bn worldwide. We've recently raised a second round of funding and are looking to scale up quickly. This means solving some interesting tech challenges, building exciting new features and laying the foundations for further rapid expansion.


What you'll work on


As part of our next phase of growth we have a number of projects that will significantly impact our future success:


- Search and discovery - we are working hard to help buyers find what they want. This means we're investigating visual search, smarter recommendations and a more intuitive discovery process.


- Making our data work - as the biggest player in the market, we have a lot of data that can help both buyers and sellers. We are working on ways to give them relevant, actionable insights.


- Dev-ops - we invest significant time in our infrastructure and internal tooling. As the company grows we have to stay one step ahead, making sure everything is monitored, scales nicely, runs quickly and stays low maintenance.


- Data warehousing - data and metrics are key to our internal decision-making. We want to give everyone freedom to access the data they need. Building out our data warehouse and reporting layer is crucial to this.


- Integrations - we have a wealth of useful data that other people want access to. We will be building out our APIs and integrations with downstream systems to allow people to power their systems off ours.


What we're looking for


We're looking for a full-stack developer to build features front-to-back in close collaboration with other members of the company. The tech team has an excellent understanding of the business, something essential to making the right decisions. We are looking for someone who can get excited about what they're doing and loves seeing results quickly.


We are a small team but have plans to grow. This role has huge potential and we're looking for someone keen to take on responsibility. There is great scope in both architecture and leadership, so an interest in either or both would be excellent.


Our stack


We use Python, Django, AngularJS, PostgreSQL and MongoDB with search powered by Algolia. Everything runs on AWS and we manage it all with Ansible. We deploy every day and have never rolled back a release. We're really proud of how slick our set-up is and spend a significant amount of time on our internal tooling.


We are always looking for ways to improve our processes and regularly experiment with new approaches and technologies. Nothing is sacred and we will always look for the right tool for the job. Every member of the team has as much input as any other, and the best idea wins.

item.title: Software Engineer Java Backend Services at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

trivago is looking for Software Engineers who are passionate about their craft, versatile and ambitious to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward!

We offer an international, results-driven, fun and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, trivago should be your first choice!

Our engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users search for their ideal hotel at the best rate. Our ambitions reach far beyond just searching for hotels. Our product needs to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from a lot of different areas of computer science, including information retrieval, data processing, data storage, distributed computing, large-scale system design and many more; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a Software Engineer, you work on a small team and on many different projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves.
You will be a leader in the design, implementation and ownership of major modules and sub-systems. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, maintain and enhance software solutions.


Your responsibilities:



  • Build and maintain Java backend applications. Play a leading role in designing and implement new functionality and platform enhancements as needed.

  • Work closely together with members/stakeholders from other teams (BI, Product, etc.).

  • Be creative, challenge yourself and spread the word: contribute to one of our lovely open source projects.


Essential requirements:



  • Sc. in Computer Science or a related technical field.

  • 5+ years' experience in designing and developing large scale web applications.

  • You have demonstrated the ability to master object oriented development in (Core) Java (especially Java Concurrency). JEE experience is not relevant.

  • Extensive knowledge in software architecture, data structures and modern design patterns.

  • Extensive knowledge in building high performance, highly scalable, and fault-tolerant web applications.

  • Experience in using NoSQL technologies (Redis, Cassandra, etc.)

  • Analytical and problem solving skills.

  • Excellent communication skills and you speak English (our company language) fluently.


Preferred requirements:



  • A master's degree or PhD in Computer Science.


Life at trivago is...



  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.

  • The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hoursbased on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Living in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of lifein the world for expats.



Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

item.title: Software Engineer - PHP for API Team at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Apply today and work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries.


Our Software Engineering team is looking for a PHP developer who can ensure that our 120 million monthly users experience the world's fastest hotel search.



What you'll do:



  • Provide different APIs to guarantee we are the fastest hotel search on earth.

  • Become a part of the API team, which creates the interfaces to the heart of trivago.

  • Be courageous and broaden the world of trivago with your ideas and visions.

  • Share your knowledge and become a mentor for other teams as you support them in building APIs.

  • Always challenge the current state and push beyond current solutions to improve our high performing APIs.

  • Work in a cross-functional team with passionate experts from various fields.

item.title: Senior Application Security Engineer at Capital One (Nottingham, UK)
item.description:
Information Security is an integral part of the corporate culture at Capital One UK. It is essential to maintaining our position as an industry leader in electronic payments, and it is the responsibility of each and every employee to safeguard information, protect it from unauthorised access, and ensure regulatory compliance. Information Security has a significant effect on privacy, consumer confidence, external reputation, and it is a priority on everyone's agenda.


The successful candidate will work closely with the UK Application Security group to build and drive the Application Security Engineering function for the Capital One UK Division. This new function will be responsible for collaborating closely with application developers and engineering teams through threat assessment and secure design as part of Capital One's global Application Security program to enable the UK Business.


This role  will provide technical application security expertise to the wider UK Technology and Business. This role within UK Application Security must instill a culture that works toward the highest standards in application security engineering whilst ensuring that business requirements are understood and adhered to, and security risks in new and existing applications are properly understood and mitigated.


Working with groups such as the Software Studio, this position will take a leading role in the development of secure applications for Capital One UK including web, mobile, and APIs in the backdrop of an increased regulatory landscape within the UK.


This position reports to the UK Head of Application Security and can be based at a location that is appropriate for the right candidate.


Job Scope:



  • Provide leadership and hands on direction during the design and development of applications utilising a threat-based approach to support the business strategy.

  • Partner with all relevant stakeholders to embed application security requirements as part of their programs and strategy.

  • Help drive Capital One UK's competitive advantage in payments by facilitating the development of secure web and mobile applications.

  • Collaborate closely with colleagues within the wider global Information Security organisation and technology departments as well as the UK business to establish effective, productive relationships 


Responsibilities:



  • Assist with the creation, adoption, and maturation of threat modeling and application security requirements functions and processes.

  • Coordinate and execute threat modeling activities during agile iterations.

  • Provide targeted application security requirements based on design, threats, industry best practices, and Capital One specific policy.

  • Empower delivery team resources by promoting application security awareness and standards through training, mentoring, and Communities of Practice.

  •  Influence delivery teams in the prioritisation of security activities and issue remediation.

  • Evaluate and recommend new and emerging application security products and technologies in coordination with the global Application Security group.

  • Coordinate the maintenance of the UK application inventory and risk profiles with delivery teams.

  • Perform manual code reviews, open source software evaluations, and tests as needed.

  • Establish credibility throughout the organisation by earning the reputation for being a proactive leader, positive disrupter and change agent.

  •  Provide recommendations to the local management team to increase security effectiveness of organisation and technology solutions.

  • Represent Capital One UK in relevant information security and cyber security communities.

item.title: Lead Software Engineer (API & Integrations) at Capital One (Nottingham, UK)
item.description:
Welcome to a world of innovation, problem solving and engineering excellence.Over the past 20 years we've been a company built on bold, new ideas and entrepreneurial spirit. Today we are amongst the UK's top 10 credit card providers, in no small part thanks to our technology teams. 


Our next exciting journey is a transformation from a financial company with great tech into a technology company that just happens to offer financial products. Across our two engineering centres, in Nottingham and London, we have an obsession for delivering quality products within a maturing agile environment. You could be part of that mission to help customers succeed and change banking for good. The API & Integrations teams are at the forefront of modern banking; whether it's working with a commercial partner, smaller startups or directly with our customers.  


As a senior/lead engineer at our Nottingham office you will work within an agile feature team on a wide array of intriguing problems; such as API authentication, on-boarding external developers and auto-scaling infrastructure. Our teams have a high degree of empowerment to own their products from design to production. We are just beginning a journey into the cloud and want you to help take us there. 


We are looking for a passionate and driven engineer who is not only a world-class Java developer but also comfortable working with stakeholders within and outside the team. You know how to build innovative solutions, engage the team to deliver at a higher quality and can break down technical designs into non-technical language. Each team has only one engineer like yourself; you are the keystone that brings together an array of amazing talent into a vehicle for high-cadence technical delivery. 


This isn't a line management role; we call you an "individual contributor" who is at the top of their game and has a passion to focus on engineering over management. At Capital One we cherish engineers like you and have excellent career development opportunities that don't require you to become a people manager. 


Your Responsibilities 




  • Coach and mentor a highly skilled team of primarily back-end engineers 




  • Collaborating and engaging with Product/Business stakeholders all the way up to VP level 




  • A key technical influencer in company-wide software architecture decisions 




  • Capability to find the right way to unlock business value, not just the "best" or "fastest"

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer (iOS) at Capital One (Nottingham, UK)
item.description:
We’re proud to say that we’re up there amongst the UK's top 10 credit card providers. Since our beginning we’ve been a company built on bold, new ideas and entrepreneurial spirit. In an ever changing financial landscape we’re transforming to a technology company that happens to do credit, always on, and striving for the breakthroughs that will change banking for good. 
 
Changing banking for good is not an idle statement, it’s our core vision and applies to everything we do. For us, it’s a no brainer. A happy customer is a loyal customer. By bringing innovation, simplicity, and, most importantly, humanity to the financial services industry we will succeed in delivering this mission. 


We are transforming ourselves into a FinTech company. We have two development centres; Nottingham and London and in these we are delivering the next big things that will help our customers succeed.  


We’d like you to be part of it. 


An obsession for delivering quality products to our customers is at the heart of everything we do. We are a maturing agile organisation, our teams operate with a great deal of empowerment; collaborating with product owners, designers and stakeholders to deliver great software.     


We are just beginning our journey into the cloud and have problems of scale, security, availability and performance for you to help solve. We try to solve these using internal and external open-source solutions wherever possible. 


We love continuous learning and that’s why we give you 10% of your time to work on cutting edge innovative projects that shape the way we will work in the future. 


Additionally, Capital One has been voted the Best Workplace for the last 3 years. We’re also recognised for our work in treating customer fairly.  


You will excel in end to end software development and have breadth and technical depth in more than one area. Your strong design, analytical and problem solving skills will be crucial to our success.  


As well as technical skill, you’ll need the people skills to collaborate across the business – not to mention creativity and drive to make things happen. 


As a Senior Software Development Engineer, you’ll support the Dev Manager and work as part of a multidisciplinary team of engineers delivering best-of-class software for our customers to use on their mobile devices; changing the way they interact with their finances.  


With excellent programming skills in a couple of languages and extensive commercial experience developing software for the iOS platform (Swift/Objective-C) - in an Agile environment - you’ll be collaborating with product owners and designers on feature development, as well as mentoring other engineers and advising managers.  


Tools like Xcode, XCTest, OCMock/OCMockito, Jenkins and Git are second nature to you. A working knowledge of UI test automation frameworks is a big plus. 


Your passion for software engineering and innovation means you’re always looking to gain experience with new platforms and languages and have a keen eye on what’s coming next. Hackathons are your thing and you’re likely to be actively engaged with the wider development community.
