As a Senior Software Development Engineer, you’ll support the Dev Manager and work as part of a multidisciplinary team of engineers delivering best-of-class software for our customers to use on all their devices; changing the way they interact with their finances.  


With excellent programming skills in a couple of languages and extensive commercial experience developing testable, elegant, responsive web applications - in an Agile environment - you’ll be collaborating with product owners and designers on feature development, as well as mentoring other engineers and advising managers.  


Your passion for software engineering and innovation means you’re always looking to gain experience with new platforms and languages and have a keen eye on what’s coming next. Hackathons are your thing and you’re likely to be actively engaged with the wider development community.

item.title: Software engineer - Tombolo Project at Future Cities Catapult (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for someone who has strong experience in back-end software development using Java and is passionate about data. As a Software Engineer for the Tombolo project, you’ll be a key part of the team building an Open Source software platform to support more effective integration of the urban models - building this platform in collaboration with the authorities of three UK cities. You’ll be working in a core project team of data scientists, developers, designers and a project manager, as well as working with our core partner, a London-based urban planning and modelling agency.


The Tombolo project seeks to address urban challenges, including around social isolation and local citizens wellbeing. We’re helping public bodies map out what makes communities and neighbourhoods able to cope with changes to the city, enabling them to better target policy and inform how they provide services to citizens. At the heart of Tombolo we’re building software for combining data-sources and statistical models in areas such as land use, transportation, and population growth, into integrated urban models to further understand these challenges.


If you’re interested in joining a world-class team of passionate people tackling urban challenges, we look forward to hearing from you soon!


Find out more about the Tombolo project at http://www.tombolo.org.uk/


As for you.... You will be focusing on the back-end development of a software platform for unifying data from various subject domains, using different spatial and temporal reference systems, and transforming it into a homogeneous data representation. As part of your work with the core team, you will iterate over the system specification and implementation of the platform in light of insight from user testing. In order to successfully deliver the project, you will liaise with domain specialists in local councils, academia and industry to pull in expertise on specific modelling projects to support their integration into our platform.

item.title: Lead C++ Developer at Quorate Technology (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
We now seek a very experienced C++ developer to lead the design and development of resources that will enable our customers to create interactive speech applications using our real-time engine.  The successful candidate will also be expected to take on leadership and mentoring roles within the team.  


This role will involve you working very closely with our speech team in order to optimise our speech recognition engine to run in a multi-threaded, multi-user environment.  We would also like you to ensure the efficient use of shared resources and to interact with our customers during the design and development of our recognition engine’s APIs.

item.title: Junior Full Stack Developer at CGscope (London, UK)
item.description:
Do you like working with data? Do you want to make an impact in a start-up? Do you live for Django, AngularJS, continuous deployment, agile development and microservices? If you answered yes to all those questions then keep reading!


CGscope is a London-based tech and research start-up led by young but experienced professionals. It originated as a spin-off of a well-established consultancy, which has specialised in corporate governance for over 13 years. The goal of CGscope is to extract valuable governance information that is buried in thousands of pages of annual reports and supervisory filings by applying machine learning techniques.


It’s an exciting time to join our small, extremely motivated, team here at CGscope, and we have big visions for the future. We’ve secured funding, we’re working towards a live product, and we’re now forming our technology team. We are seeking exceptional developers who identify with our core software architecture, and are prepared to have a huge impact on the product and our company culture, are willing to take ownership of problems end to end, and are able to make difficult decisions.


We think in terms of microservices rather than a monolithic system, and our stack builds on Google Cloud Platform. As a full stack developer your main responsibility will be continuing the development of the CGscope website and database, and you will work closely with our research team to deliver the best possible user experience in the corporate governance sector. More specifically, you will: maintain our code base, design, implement and test new features, and monitor our live system.


In return we offer a great place to work, with people from diverse backgrounds, the chance of taking responsibility, being trusted and valued in the team, and the rare opportunity of experiencing and shaping a start-up.

item.title: Mid-Level Full Stack Developer at CGscope (London, UK)
item.description:
Do you like working with data? Do you want to make an impact in a start-up? Do you live for Django, AngularJS, continuous deployment, agile development and microservices? If you answered yes to all those questions then keep reading!


CGscope is a London-based tech and research start-up led by young but experienced professionals. As a full stack developer your main responsibility will be continuing the development of the CGscope website and database, and you will work closely with our research team to deliver the best possible user experience in the corporate governance sector. In return we offer a great place to work, with people from diverse backgrounds, the chance of taking responsibility, being trusted and valued in the team, and the rare opportunity of experiencing and shaping a start-up.

item.title: Full Stack Web Developer at Upshoot (London, UK)
item.description:
Leading the web development team as we launch a ground breaking new online platform and property search engine Q2 2017. Join us at our Tower Bridge offices as we strive to not only become the UK’s leading property development search & delivery platform but completely disrupt the global property sector through automation, innovation, mapping, design and analytics.


You will lead the web development team, ensuring the site’s growth, innovation, and maintenance. You will be responsible for ensuring targets are set and met. As senior web developer, your role will require the ability to communicate, update and collaborate with the other sections of the company, such as the sales and planning departments.


Are you right for this job?


1.Are you highly ambitious and want to help build an exciting property tech start up into a global presence?


2.Do you want to innovate and watch your ideas succeed?


3.Do you want the chance to lead and inspire members of a team?


If you have run a small team within a larger tech company and are ready to improve on that experience by growing and managing a team, please apply.  Your role will be pivotal as the company doubles in size over the next 2 years. As our company grows, you will identify technical roles needed to deliver the overall vision. You will work directly with the CEO and will help inspire others as we expand through the UK and later, internationally.  As you will be integral, your position and salary will grow alongside the company’s success.

item.title: Scala Developer at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
Position Overview


Why build your career at Hotels.com as Scala Developer?



  • You'll get to work with some spectacular people both from the technology team and wider business

  • You will get to work on a lot of awesome technologies such as Kafka, languages such as Scala and Akka and ways of solving problems such Reactive Streams.

  • We work hard to create a supportive, collaborative, and fulfilling place where you can progress your career

  • We have many of the best bits of a start-up but with the resources of the world's biggest travel company

  • We love open source and actively participate in the open source community

  • We win prizes (Netflix Cloud Prize for one)

  • We do hackathons where you can branch out of your usual area to contribute something different and innovative

  • We host and speak at meet ups

  • We want everyone on our team to have the tools and resources to succeed in their career

  • We get to do all of this in a lovely, comfortable office in a nice, central part of London

  • You will learn a lot about software engineering, architecture and contribute to a cool product



What we're looking for in you



  • We want you to be focused on moving the business forward. We don't just build software for its own sake (notwithstanding deep appreciation for the craft). We build it to help our customers find the right hotel, every time.

  • We want you to have a keen interest in the business, not just any given technical problem.

  • We want you to have a passion for self-learning.

  • We want you to understand the big picture and how your work fits into it.

  • We want you to get excited about big, hairy technical problems like we do.

  • We want you to participate in the Hotels.com technology community, the wider Hotels.com team, and the wider technical community around the world.

  • We live, eat, and breathe travel powered by technology. We work hard and play hard. We're never satisfied. We celebrate success and learn when we sometimes fall short.



Responsibilities



  • Developing in Scala and working in a fast paced agile environment developing features planned as part of a roadmap.

  • Collaborate closely with engineering and stakeholder teams when needed.

  • Write clear, concise and well-tested code.

  • Contribute to the system architecture.

  • Proactively monitor the health of applications owned by the team and address issues

  • Participate in code reviews.

  • Be very focused on delivery whilst not comprising on quality.

  • Encourage people to look at new ways of doing things.


Qualifications


We don’t believe in matching people against a list of buzzwords. We look for smart people with good general programming skills as we believe that clever developers can learn new technologies quickly and well. However it wouldn't hurt if you have experience with some of the following (or at least an interest in learning them):



Extensive experience of Scala



  • Good experience of Java server-side programming.

  • Experience of developing software in an Agile environment.

  • Evidence of self-learning.

  • Attitude is very important! You will need to be passionate about improving quality and processes

  • Value the importance of quality for the whole organization and not just to the application

  • Welcome a changing environment

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

  • Motivated and enthused by difficulty & challenge, coupled with a strong competitive nature to excel and be the best

item.title: Senior Data Engineer (Java / Hadoop / ETL) at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
• The online travel market never stands still. The opportunity is huge and the competition is fierce. At Hotels.com, we're in the thick of it. We live and breathe travel. Our technology team is insanely passionate about using the best technology and processes to give our customers the best possible experience when finding hotels for their business or leisure travel needs. We want them to feel the same passion for travel that we do.


    We are currently looking for experienced and highly motivated developers to join the Hotels.com Data Engineering team, with a primary focus on Acquisition Marketing.



    In this role, you will contribute to the the development of data pipelines on an enterprise-scale Hadoop cluster using technologies such as Hive, Falcon and Oozie, as well as coding in Java and working with relational database systems such as Teradata.  You will be part of an agile team, constantly iterating and improving the way we work and deliver new features to the business.



    Why build your career at Hotels.com?



    • You'll get to work with some spectacular people both from the technology team and wider business

    • You will get to work with massive data sets numbering literally billions of items and approaching a petabyte in total size and opportunities to learn and apply the latest big data technologies on a fast growing Hadoop & Teradata platform.

    • You’ll get to join an established company in a period of exploration and growth into cloud-based data solutions

    • We work hard to create a supportive, collaborative, and fulfilling place where you can progress your career

    • We have many of the best bits of a start-up but with the resources of the world's biggest travel company

    • We love open source and actively participate in the open source community

    • We do hackathons where you can branch out of your usual area to contribute something different and innovative

    • We host and speak at meet ups

    • We want everyone on our team to have the tools and resources to succeed in their career

    • We get to do all of this in a lovely, comfortable office in a nice, central part of London



    Position Description



    The Data Engineer will work on the development of new and existing data pipelines, turning requirements into a finished technical solution and cooperating effectively with colleagues in both technical and business-facing roles.




    Responsibilities



    • Develop data loading/ ETL processes for the Hotels.com/ Expedia Hadoop environment.

    • Write clear, efficient, tested code.

    • Develop code as part of a wider team, contributing to code review and solution design

    • Provide support and guidance to more junior developers

    • Contribute to both program and system architecture as appropriate.

    • Contribute to evolution of development standards and design patterns.

    • Work with business stakeholders to deliver on requirements in an agile manner.

    • Deploy and maintain applications in production environments.

    • Communicate and document solutions and design decisions.



    Experience and Skills



    Commercial experience in a data / software engineering role, including substantial use of the following technologies/ tools:



    • Java

    • SQL

    • Hadoop

    • Commercial experience with Linux, and use of a version control system (preferably Git).



    Any experience in the following would also be desirable:



    • Knowledge of Acquisition Marketing (Search-Engine Marketing, Meta Search)

    • ETL/ data load process development

    • Hive (and other SQL-on-Hadoop tools)

    • Experience dealing with large and/or complex data sets

    • Unit-testing frameworks (JUnit, Mockito etc) and Test-Driven Development.

    • Maven

    • Cloud solutions, particularly Amazon Web Services

    • Massively parallel (MPP) database systems such as Teradata

    • Oozie

    • Falcon






  • Talend






    • Other Hadoop data processing tools (Cascading, Spark, Pig, MapReduce etc.)

    • Other Big data/ NoSQL technologies

    • Microsoft SQL Server



    A Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field is preferred.

item.title: Ambitious Web/ Software Developer at Felinesoft Ltd (Bristol, UK)
item.description: Are you an experienced .Net Software/ Web Developer who loves to work on a variety of projects with different technologies? If you have a thirst for knowledge, a passion for problem-solving and a desire to be working on a varied portfolio of projects and clients then you’ll fit in well.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Inmar () (allows remote)
item.description:
ABOUT YOU


You’ve built sophisticated SPAs using one or more mainstream frameworks like Angular, Knockout, Backbone, Meteor, React, etc.; and you’re chomping at the bit to try another. You’ve built backends in one or more mainstream frameworks using Java, .NET, nodejs, etc. You think in REST and always notice when your CSS is off by a pixel. Modeling the databases and building the engines behind UIs gets your gears turning just as much as animating a button. You know the difference between call() and apply(), but you also know it usually doesn’t matter. Apps that react as fast as you can click have you opening up the source code. Working with more junior developers gets you excited for the coaching opportunities, and more senior developers for the learning. Groking the business requirements is second-nature. You own what you wrote and jump in to help your team support the product when there’s a fire, and when the smoke clears you’re one of the first to say “ok, how can we make sure that doesn’t happen again?”. You’re passionate and opinionated about great user experience; and most importantly, you love building real, working apps that surprise and delight your customers. 



WHAT YOU’D BE DOING


Under general supervision of the Engineering Manager, the Promotions B2B Engineer is a full-stack engineer with a bent for hard front-end problems, performing assignments in one or more of the following areas: providing technical guidance and direction to other staff members; participating in project planning and requirements definition; system/application design, system/application development, unit testing, support during QA and User Acceptance Testing, implementation and integration; customer support for and technical expertise in end-user decision support software tools and end-user computing technology; conducting all activities in accordance with standards and procedures. 




MAJOR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design, develop, test, deploy, and support new software solutions and changes to existing software solutions

  • Troubleshoot technical issues in a variety of application environments

  • Mentor team members and provide thoughtful discussion on tactics and strategies as they are selected

  • Translate business requirements and product specifications into components of complex, loosely-coupled, distributed systems

  • Maintain a focus on rapid delivery of new features to market while maintaining stability and uptime

  • Maintain familiarity with the evolving trends in software development

item.title: PHP Developer at Croud (Shrewsbury, UK)
item.description:
OVERALL PURPOSE OF THE ROLE:


Enthusiastic PHP developer required for a fast growing and technically driven digital marketing agency. The role, which is based in the Shrewsbury office, entails development of our flagship platform; Croud Control and related technologies. With partnerships with key players in paid and natural search, display and paid social, the successful candidate will be a key part of an evolving development team that is producing and managing suite of tools to manage, support and enhance high profile internet marketing campaigns.


This is primarily a PHP development role, involving extensive interaction with third party services and partners, so knowledge of consuming and creating RESTful APIs is also advantageous.


There will also be opportunities for developing junior team members in the future as the team grows as well as project management through liaising with external resource to ensure tasks are completed on time.


The successful candidate will be keen to learn, want to strive for success and have a desire to question everything. An analytical mind-set coupled with the ability to think laterally is a must for this role.


MAIN ACTIVITIES / TASKS:



  • Working directly with the Senior Developer to build components for the Croud Control Platform in object oriented PHP – Follows coding standards, builds appropriate unit tests, integration tests and deployment scripts

  • Providing essential maintenance to the platform and providing support for the users of it.

  • Contribute to the improvement of the platform - suggest improvements to code, technology, architecture & workflow

  • Work with other members of the company to help improve workflow and processes.

  • Project manage external resource.

  • Management of junior members of staff to ensure their further development as well as ensuring the team objectives are met.

  • Assists in defining software architectures

  • Explains progress on the development effort

  • Successful delivery of the solutions to agreed timelines

  • Collaboration with leads to explore existing systems, determine areas of complexity, potential risks to successful implementation, and learn the applications capabilities

  • Contributes to continual improvement by suggesting improvements to software architecture or new technologies

  • Ensure operations requirements are met prior to production deployment

  • Assist triage and resolution for production issues as they arise


ACCOUNTABILITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Responsible for following coding standards, builds appropriate unit tests, integration tests and deployment scripts across the team

  • Responsible for building and implementing designs from wider team to a high standard

  • Responsible for communicating continually with the client and project teams

  • Responsible for translating specification documentation provided by the product team into clearly defined functionality

  • Responsible for developing, compiling and unit test building for delivery to QA

  • Responsible for timely planning and execution of amendments due to relevant third party API updates

  • Responsible for managing and developing junior members of the team


KEY STAKEHOLDERS:



  • Direct Line Manager: Head of Development

  • Key stakeholders: Junior PHP Developer, PHP Developer, Product Manager, Head of Product

item.title: VB.NET Developer - "Uber" for Real Estate Market at KeyAGENT (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for a VB.NET Developer to join us and work with an award-winning group of innovative thinkers, researchers and developers.


If you’ve read ‘The Lean Start-up', 'Zappos – Delivering Happiness', 'Good to Great' or anything similar, you’ll be a perfect fit. ‘Fanatical about delivering exceptional results’. If you haven't read these we'd highly recommend it!


We’re looking for a VB.NET Developer to join us and work with an award-winning group of innovative thinkers, researchers and developers.


You will be responsible for building and maintaining Microsoft SQL Server data-driven Web and Windows applications, with good knowledge of the above. Your primary responsibilities will be to maintain and develop existing VB.NET applications, and to coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to high quality code and excellent debugging skills are essential.


Other projects are written in C# using the latest Web development frameworks, so experience in C#, ASP.NET MVC and AngularJS are all desirable for the future.

item.title: Senior Web Application Developer at Imperial College London (London, UK)
item.description:
Senior Web Application Developer


School of Public Health


Department of Infectious Disease Epidemiology


MRC Centre for Outbreak Analysis and Modelling                                                                                


Salary Range: £44,510 - £53,800 p.a.


The MRC Centre for Outbreak Analysis and Modelling is seeking an experienced and motivated JavaScript/Senior Web Application Developer to lead development of open-source web applications for (a) the analysis and visualisation of disease outbreak data, and (b) remote execution of computer simulations of infectious disease epidemics and visualisation of simulation output. The end-users of these applications will be staff of the MRC Centre, public health professionals and decision makers (e.g. in WHO, Public Health England and the US Centers for Disease Control) and the wider research community. The work will be carried out within the Department of Infectious Disease Epidemiology at the St. Mary’s Campus of Imperial College London.


The successful candidate will be members of both the MRC Centre and the Department, and will be based at the St Mary’s Campus, Paddington.

item.title: Senior JavaScript Engineer (Front-End) at Megalytic () (allows remote)
item.description:
Full responsibility for front-end development of the Megalytic product - a revolutionary SaaS platform for digital marketing reporting.


We are hiring a JavaScript Ninja to take over all the front-end programming for the Megalytic product. You’ll work directly with the company co-founders to get us to the “next level” and implement a major upgrade of our successful product. You will implement new features from scratch, as well as improve the existing codebase.


Most of our front-end programming work is done using pure JavaScript. We don’t rely on any 3rd party frameworks so it’s important that you have a comprehensive hands-on knowledge of JavaScript and the DOM. We do, however, use several libraries such as jQuery, D3, Bootstrap, Firebase, TinyMCE, and PhantomJS for specific tasks. Knowledge of these libraries is not required but is a very big plus.


We are a geographically distributed team. That means you will work remotely and communicate with us on a daily basis using Skype and other collaborative technologies. This job definitely offers the shortest commute you will ever have to make!


You will be responsible to:



  • Design and implement all aspects of the UI.

  • Maintain and improve the existing front-end code.

  • Work with the CEO to design solutions to the data visualization and reporting challenges that our customers need us to solve.

  • Work with the VP of Engineering to implement robust and scalable technology solutions that integrate with our full product stack.

  • Translate sketches / wireframes into working prototypes and then to production-ready code.

item.title: Experienced full stack C++ dev. Any currency trading experience a big plus at Essential Algorithms Solutions () (allows remote)
item.description:
Essential Algorithms Solutions (EAS) has an opening for two (2) experienced senior-level C++ programmers to add to our existing team.  This work-from-home contract style position offers a full time opportunity to each developer selected for the position.


C++ is the main programming language used at EAS; however, candidates are expected to be "full stack" and have experience in developing fully debugged and production-ready software.  Many of the projects we take on are of advanced level and require analysis and planning on an individual basis in addition to code writing.


The projects assigned to our senior level team run the gamut.  Example projects might include (but are certainly not limited to) development of a trading/exchange platform; collection or aggregation of sports statistics; development of risk management tools; creation of random number generators (RNG) and game logic; and development of our Customer Relationship Manager (CRM) product.


For this position, emphasis is placed on the applicant's ability to produce solutions with minimal outside help.  As this is a senior-level position, all applicants are expected to be able to write the required applications from start to finish, including design of any database queries or tables.  Design specifications will be provided for each project prior to commencement.  While actual programming ability is one of the key requirements of this position, applicants for this senior-level posting are expected to show initiative and take a practical approach towards solving real-world problems.


The projects are challenging and quite exciting, and even the most experienced of candidates are certain to learn new skills and techniques while working with our company.

a10:author.a10:name: Capita Digital & Software Solutions - Orange Bus

item.title: DevOps Engineer for Award Winning Digital Agency! at Capita Digital & Software Solutions - Orange Bus (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
DevOps Engineer


2016 Web Development House of Year - The Techie Awards


What we do


As part of Capita Digital & Software Solutions, Orange Bus is a creative and agile agency that builds digital strategies, software and experiences - solving business challenges for international brands and UK Government.


Being backed by a market leading organisation has its benefits, with an impressive scope of clients; you will have a range of exciting industry projects to put your stamp on, for customers such as Philips, Aston Martin Racing and numerous government organisations.


Work is certainly varied here at Orange Bus, whether that is taking a global brand mobile, enhancing the ecommerce functionality of a major fashion website or developing web applications to help evolve government organisations… We do it all!!!


How we do it


We believe that to work in a truly collaborative DevOps environment requires the right mindset, tools and skills. In an office, not far from Haymarket station, Orange Bus hosts a team  of engineers who are dedicated to great software engineering. It is a centre of excellence for agile practices and a hub for DevOps culture and processes.


As advocates of continuous integration, automation, version control and cloud based solutions, Our DevOps Engineers are not only essential in promoting the DevOps way of working and thinking, but they are a crucial element when it comes to innovation. They help us to produce high quality work in a seamless and collaborative fashion, responding quickly to business needs. 


What you’ll do and why you’ll be successful


Our DevOps Engineers work closely with a talented team of Full Stack .Net Developers. They have excellent systems administration skills and are key in managing and supporting our AWS/Azure estates and related services.


Some of the key tasks include:



  • Managing and optimising our Jenkins continuous integration servers and procedures.

  • Look after a multi-layered systems infrastructure in a modern programming environment.

  • Build continuous deployment pipelines, with automated deployment processes.

  • Look after and optimise our deployment scripts and processes.

  • Work collaboratively across the team in a Scrum development environment.


How we will ensure your success:


We appreciate that great DevOps Engineers need to be continuously learning, so if that means taking time out to learn from one of our subject matter experts over a beer or attending tech talks and conferences, then you will have our full support. We are flexible and actively encourage you to take time to complete independent  projects, and we will get you the certifications that you want or need.

a10:author.a10:name: Capita Digital & Software Solutions - Orange Bus

item.title: Creative Full Stack .Net Developer for Award Winning Digital Agency! at Capita Digital & Software Solutions - Orange Bus (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Full Stack .NET Developer


2016 Web Development House of Year - The Techie Awards


What we do


As part of Capita Digital & Software Solutions, Orange Bus is a creative and agile agency that builds digital strategies, software and experiences - solving business challenges for international brands and UK Government. 


Being backed by a market leading organisation has its benefits, with an impressive scope of clients; you will have a range of exciting industry projects to put your stamp on, for customers such as Philips, Aston Martin Racing and numerous government organisations.


Work is certainly varied here at Orange Bus, whether that is taking a global brand mobile, enhancing the ecommerce functionality of a major fashion website or developing web applications to help evolve government organisations. We do it all! 


How we do it


We believe that to work in a truly collaborative DevOps environment requires the right mindset, tools and skills. In an office not far from Haymarket station, Orange Bus hosts a team  of engineers who are dedicated to great software engineering. It is a centre of excellence for agile practices and a hub for DevOps culture and processes.


Our Developers don’t just code, they innovate and drive best practises; seeing through jobs from beginning to end and focusing on the customer experience. We are advocates of continuous integration, automation, version control and cloud based solutions.


What you’ll do and why you’ll be successful


Our developers work directly with client stakeholders and product owners to refine requirements. There is no ‘I’ in Scrum, so you’ll also become a key team player in our Agile (Scrum) environment. Working with the Architect and other members of the Scrum team you will be involved in helping refine and implement proposed architectural designs.


You will also work with/learn:



  • Software design & development principles such as SOLID, Domain-Driven-Design and Object Oriented Development.

  • ORM frameworks, particularly the Entity Framework

  • Test Driven Development

  • Managing source code with Git, including GitFlow Workflow.

  • Dependency Injection & common Inversion of Control containers

  • Following best practise secure coding guidelines, such as OWASP, as well as the team’s coding standards.


How we will ensure your success:


We appreciate that developers need to be continuously learning, so if that means taking time out to learn from one of our subject matter experts over a beer or  attending tech talks and conferences, then you will have our full support. We are flexible and actively encourage you to take time to complete independent  projects, and we will get you the certifications that you want or need.

item.title: Node.js Developer at Chaser () (allows remote)
item.description:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are only considering candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+2.


This role presents an incredible opportunity for someone to really place their stamp on our product and company as we scale.


Our current stack is ES6, Meteor, Node.js 4.x and MongoDB, with Python 3 for our data infrastructure.

Responsibilities

item.title: Senior Frontend Engineer (f/m) at audibene GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Audibene is an award winning health tech start-up which has grown massively over the last years and is now present in 10 countries and employs over 500 people. Our team is working towards building cutting edge technology that will reshape the hearing care industry and improve the quality of life of many people across the globe. Audibene has its headquarters in Berlin, Germany with offices in Miami, Toronto, Kuala Lumpur, Bern, Seoul etc. Join us as we are working towards revolutionizing the hearing aid industry!



 We are looking for a Frontend Engineer (m/f) to join our experienced cross functional team based in Belin



About the role:


We have an experienced and international engineering team and we using state of the art single page React based applications. We are working with industry best practices and looking towards continuous integration and test driven development. As a Frontend Engineer you will design, develop, maintain the User Interface of our global cloud platform. As we are currently building up our teams for a new ambitious project, you will be able to support in shaping and designing the service landscape and contribute to setting the foundation of our platform.


Your core tasks:



  • Develop and support customized Java Script, React based applications, e.g. one-page solutions, revamping our form tool, connections to third-party services, …

  • Discovery of new projects, followed by specification development

  • Work with the whole development team to set and develop an audibene library

  • Collaborate with other developers working on global scale software solutions regarding web development

item.title: 70% of our traffic originates from mobile devices - Is Appium the right tool? at Sky Betting & Gaming (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
The Challenge


Here at SBG we understand that test automation isn’t a silver bullet, but IS a key part of any agile test strategy.  We’re building test automation into our engineering process; test frameworks that live alongside our software, and are managed along with it.  Can you work alongside Developers, Architects, BAs, DevOps and other Testers to drive the frameworks, processes, and coverage?


Our customers come first, and since over 70% of our traffic originates from mobile devices, that’s where we test.  Do you have an interest in on-device test automation using tools like Appium?  Have you built and maintained effective test automation frameworks?  Do have the tech skills as well as a strong QA voice?  Do you hate cutting corners?!?  Then read on…

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Craneware Healthcare Software (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
The DevOps Engineer is responsible for setting up automated deployment pipelines and reducing release cycle times. This role is critical to the business because it increases throughput through Engineering and Systems while at the same time reducing outstanding work in progress and operating expense. 


Core duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.



  • Build and own the continuous integration/deployment system for the rapid release of software to both on premise and cloud based environments.

  • Build and maintain scalable infrastructure to support Development, Test and Production environments by creating reusable automation scripts with flexible configuration capabilities.

  • Maintain various SQL Server environments ensuring databases are backed up, optimised and secure.

  • Establish and monitor a suite of relevant KPI’s to be used for detecting performance bottlenecks, error notification and expansion planning.

item.title: PHP Software Engineer at GfK (Amstelveen, Netherlands)
item.description:
Ever wanted to work at the crossroad where software engineering meets data science? Do you regularly experiment with new programming languages? GfK Business Applications pushes market research to the next technological level from data retrieval to real time interactive visualizations; we create a unique end-to-end Market research platform. And we are looking for you!



You are a highly skilled developer, QA expert, or data nerd? You are passionate about delivering working software, creating the finest tools, having responsibility?


Here is your chance.



We offer excellent primary and secondary benefits; but beyond that an international environment with highly skilled - and nice colleagues; time and budget specifically dedicated to your personal development. As a former start-up, we kept our innovative spirit and a flat structure in which your energy, ideas and enthusiasm are not just accepted but welcomed and expected.

item.title: Software Engineer for Machine Control (f/m) - GEO-713 at Leica Geosystems (Balgach, Schweiz)
item.description:
When building the tallest buildings, the longest bridges and the biggest airplanes, people put their trust in the market-leading measurement and surveying solutions from Leica Geosystems. Our employees develop, produce and distribute what our customers count on, day after day: innovation, precision, reliability and efficiency.


Within our Machine Control Division, based in Heerbrugg (Switzerland), our development team is looking for highly motivated Software Engineer for Machine Control (f/m) whose primary duties will include:



  • Development of software for 3D machine control applications and field positioning solutions, including automated tests

  • Software engineering: analysis, design and implementation for several different OS such as Windows and Linux systems

  • Versatile and challenging tasks within a large and complex system

  • Collaboration in interdisciplinary and international development teams.

  • Application of latest-generation methods and software tools

item.title: Salesforce Technical Architect at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Cognizant delivers world class custom solutions to our clients (many of which are fortune 1000 companies) through diverse, cross-cultural teams working in a highly collaborative environment. It is this creative and supportive working environment that will help your daily challenges be enjoyable and rewarding. Cognizant take pride in our core values and our commitment to helping all employees reach their fullest professional potential while at the same time achieving their personal goals.


Join us and you will benefit from our professional support and investment in your development. You will have the opportunity to learn from and be coached by the best in the business – supportive leaders and colleagues who are driven to pass their industry, technical and functional expertise on to you.


Cognizant’s Salesforce.com / Force.com Technical Architects are responsible for engineering and delivering world-class platforms for our customers, producing enterprise standard solutions and for leading delivery teams to build and deliver them successfully on Salesforce/Force.com. Leveraging complimentary cloud and on premise technologies as appropriate; this role will deliver advanced custom solutions on Force.com heavily integrated with other systems.


Suitable candidates will be highly knowledgeable in Force.com, web application development, SSO, salesforce.com integration and extension.


They will be able to fully utilise OOB features of Force.com, designing solutions using the Force.com API, APEX, Visualforce and other tools to extend the product as needed.

Deep experience in integration of Salesforce with other enterprise systems is a must have.
The successful candidate will be able to communicate clearly and confidently, leading both technical briefings and business requirement gathering sessions.


They will be able to document requirements clearly and concisely, author technical documents and design and document integration needs.


Candidates will be able to manage client expectations and scope effectively.


Suitable candidates will understand both Agile (SCRUM) and Waterfall delivery models and understand the importance of SDLC (Software Development Lifecycle Principles) and SFDC development best practices.


Candidates must be able to travel within UK and continental Europe at least 25% of the time.


Responsibilities:


• Map out the architecture for global implementations
• Liaise closely with the functional and technical teams
• Provide Subject Matter Expertise in Cloud Architecture
• Lead requirement gathering sessions
• Lead technical design sessions
• Authoring technical design documents
• Managing the technical delivery of integrations and custom extensions
• Managing technical scope and client expectation
• Providing hands on expert level assistance to developers on technical issues
• Designing and managing the execution of test plans
• Ensuring quality is delivered

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Ruby) at Deliveroo (London, UK)
item.description:
How does it work?


Try it out if you haven’t before. Go to our website or open up our iOS or Android app. You’ll be greeted by one of our suite of products put lovingly put together by the Deliveroo product and engineering teams. Once you’ve input your location, we’ll provide a curated list of restaurants that will deliver to you. Select your items, choose any modifiers (lemon and herb? Oh come on!) and we’ll take over.


Your order then pings another one of apps that sits on a tablet in the restaurant with your order, then our dispatch engine, Louie, selects a Roo (that’s what we call them, the lovely people with the kangaroo boxes on their bikes) then guides them to the restaurant, and then to your location, in an average time of 32 minutes with the help of our Rider app. Those apps, alongside our suite of real time monitoring tools, all play a critical part in getting that tasty food to you quickly and in great condition.


So why work for us?


Because a great company needs great people, and great people should work at a great company, building a great product, in a great office, with a great deal of food all over the place! Seriously though, you’ll work with and learn from some of the most talented people in the industry. We’d love you to come and join us.


What are we keen on?


Training and Development:


We’re all about helping you reach your full potential, and as a business, we never stop learning. We’ll give you a budget for machinery, conferences, books, online courses, and whatever else you need to develop and learn new skills to help keep Deliveroo ahead of the rest.


Diversity:


We’re a global business, so it’s extremely important to us that our team and environment offer a great environment for all types of people. We’re not your average startup bro monoculture.


Working effectively:


We encourage each product team to get involved in suggesting the most effective way to get things done. We utilise best practices to make sure everything we do is a collective effort, and we encourage everyone to take an interest of all areas of the business; not a designer, but you’ve thought of a way to more effectively present a map? The design team are all ears! No code monkeys here, it’s all part of the whole “reach your full potential” stuff we mentioned earlier. Have a little scroll up if you’d like reminding.


Making you comfortable:


Output, not input. It’s not a problem if you need a little leeway in the way you work, infact if it helps you out, we’re all for it. We’ve got a cycle to work scheme in place, allow for flexible working hours, and are happy for you to work from home on occasion.


Having fun!


Come with us as we go searching for Pokemon in Regent’s Park (hopefully Pokemon Go is still a thing. If not, ping us, and we’ll update this ad), or take each other on in go-karts. If it’s Monday, chances are somebody has baked something delicious over the weekend and brought it in to share with the team. Some of us like to work out in the park at lunch, some of us prefer to...you know...eat lunch at lunch. We’re a sociable bunch, and we love to chill out as a team on Friday evenings after a solid week’s work.

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer (iOS) at Capital One (London, UK)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Development Engineer, you’ll support the Dev Manager and work as part of a multidisciplinary team of engineers delivering best-of-class software for our customers to use on their mobile devices; changing the way they interact with their finances.


With excellent programming skills in a couple of languages and extensive commercial experience developing software for the iOS platform (Swift/Objective-C) - in an Agile environment - you’ll be collaborating with product owners and designers on feature development, as well as mentoring other engineers and advising managers.


Tools like Xcode, XCTest, OCMock/OCMockito, Jenkins and Git are second nature to you. A working knowledge of UI test automation frameworks is a big plus.


Your passion for software engineering and innovation means you’re always looking to gain experience with new platforms and languages and have a keen eye on what’s coming next.


Hackathons are your thing and you’re likely to be actively engaged with the wider development community.

item.title: Mobile Software Engineer at MyDrive (London, UK)
item.description:
MyDrive is a world leader in understanding customer behaviour through data and telematics. We apply the latest thinking in machine learning, data science, analysis and software engineering to motor, smart home, and health automation.


We are looking for a talented Mobile Software Engineer with three to five years of extensive software engineering experience focused on using sensor data (GPS, accelerometer, etc) in a start-up and/or commercial environment to join our team.


The ideal candidate will have a good knowledge of Android and iOS development while also demonstrating commercial experience in app building and architecture.


This position is full time and is based in our amazing office in London Bridge.


Responsibilities




  • Plan and work with design houses and be fully integrated with the DevOps team. Delivering great engineering, issue analysis and resolution, which is well tested and delivered into a CI environment is core to the role.




  • Maintain and develop the Mobile SDK used to collect and manage data within our range of customer Apps and communicate with our RESTful API. You will also be continuously involved in App building, using the SDK.




  • Implement the benefits of automated testing, evaluate software performance for optimisation, maintain test coverage and write automated tests to be pushed to our continuous integration system




  • Gather and maintain lines of communications with different project stakeholders, research and recommend new technologies to develop MyDrive's worldwide Telematics services




  • Work closely with other software engineers, operations engineers and data scientists to design and implement mobile software to interoperate with our web services.




  • Keeping MyDrive up to date with the state of the art in mobile software development, including new features, functionality, security and performance

item.title: Senior Full Stack Developer / Technical Lead (Node.js, Cassandra, Open Source) at *Research (London, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
*Unity http://unity.ac/ is a next-generation platform for academic collaboration. Users can share files, chat and work together on documents in real time. It is provided using the the Apereo Open Academic Environment (OAE) http://oaeproject.org/, an open-source platform that aims to support academic collaboration and networking, embracing a new vision of openness and sharing between academic institutions around the world. https://github.com/oaeproject/


Developed under the umbrella of the Apereo Foundation Open Source community, the OAE is a highly scalable multi-tenant system with a cutting edge technology stack. The product is widely recognised for its intuitive user interface and attempts to offer a world-class user experience.


*Research is a key stakeholder in the OAE and supports and maintains *Unity. We are looking for an experienced, Senior Full Stack Developer to act as Technical Lead for *Unity and, by extension, the OAE.


You will maintain the already high coding standards, set the bar for contributors to the open source project and own the architecture and technical design of the system. This is a genuinely full stack role.


Responsibilities:



  • Define and maintain high standards for on-project developers and other contributors

  • Make key decisions on system design and architecture

  • Develop new features and maintain existing ones on our Node.js / Apache Cassandra / ElasticSearch stack

  • Develop easy to use, maintainable and well documented JSON REST APIs

  • Participate on both ends of our thorough code review process

  • Write lots of automated unit and integration tests

  • Contribute to discussion of technical strategy for *Research


We are based in London, UK and it would be great if you are too but that's not a requirement. Who you are is much more important than where you are. You will be employed by *Research, but your code will be contributed back to the open source project.

item.title: Tools Engineer : C++ Profiling Tools at Codeplay Software Ltd (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Codeplay is looking for an engineer to work on development tools, such as performance profilers. This is a C++ development role working on tools to help software developers deliver high-performance graphics or machine vision software on smartphones, virtual reality and (in the near future) self-driving cars.At Codeplay, we produce the software development tools to lower power consumption and increase performance via open standards. To help developers further, we need to be able to improve the ability to analyse how the software is running across a whole System-on-Chip. The successful candidate will be part of a team working on performance analysis tools across several areas, including open-source projects, customer projects, academic collaborations and research.


This role will involve a lot of new platforms, techniques and technologies as part of a team. The relevant candidate will show enthusiasm for working with others to produce tools that help developers work better.


The position will be based at our Head Office in central Edinburgh.


What We Offer



  • Work on exciting brand-new technologies and standards with well-recognized customers

  • A friendly and relaxed working environment where colleagues support each other

  • Knowledge sharing : our staff frequently give company-wide presentations on new software and technology trends, personal projects and other relevant subjects

  • Great career prospects within a growing company

  • Positions are available at various levels, from entry-level Software Engineer to Senior Principal Software Engineer, depending on your skills and experience

  • We develop our employees and provide training in skills such as project and people management, networking and delivering effective presentations

  • Frequent opportunities to attend conferences and developer meetings, represent the company, and become a recognized expert

  • We encourage engineers to progress quickly in their roles, for example to become team leads (for which training in people management and project management is provided)

  • Codeplay has been recognized as an excellent employer and awarded the Silver Level of the Investors in People accreditation

  • Opportunities to get involved with industrial standardisation initiatives such as The Khronos Group and HSA Foundation, and various European research programmes

  • Working on early-stage technology offers opportunities to contribute/shape new hardware/software and standards

  • Flexible working hours, stock options and pension scheme


Salary range (depending on experience) £27,000 to £53,000


See more at: https://www.codeplay.com/company/careers/view.html?id=39#sthash.erV5foYv.dpuf

item.title: Technical Lead at Secret Escapes Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re now looking for a Lead Site Engineer / Development Manager who has both the technical ability and managerial acumen to oversee the development and growth of this new site. You will work collaboratively with the wider Tech and Product teams as well as stakeholders across the business to ensure the continued delivery of high quality software solutions across all sites


As an ecommerce business, the success of Secret Escapes is inextricably linked to the quality and ability of its engineering team.


Over the years we’ve put together a team of highly capable engineers in multiple locations across Europe which has worked very well for us. Recently we decided to open a software development site in Bristol in order to take advantage of the amazing talent pool on offer there as well as provide a non London alternative to our UK based developers.


This position is ideal for an experienced technical lead who wants to take on wider managerial responsibilities.



Your responsibilities



Provide direction and apply technical expertise in the design, implementation and delivery of
   software features
Guide the local team through the development, testing and implementation stages and review
   the completed work effectively
Participate in architectural sessions to improve the overall quality and stability of the system
Coordinate with the Product team in the planning of features by providing estimates based on
   complexity and effort required.
Identify talent gaps and lead the hiring process in to bring in new talent
Conduct performance reviews of local team members and identify areas of improvement, give
   feedback and make recommendations for further responsibilities
Ensure that Secret Escapes’ values and vision are adhered to and upheld in the remote location

item.title: Ruby Developer at Forward3D (London, UK)
item.description:
Hadoop, Presto, Mesos, Docker, The Cloud, Distributed Systems, Terabyte Scale Data Analysis, Machine Learning and much more… do you fancy working with any (or all) of these? We are looking for mid to senior level Ruby developers to join our team.


A glimpse into what our developers have gotten themselves into:



  • Building real-time analysis systems that drive award-winning ad campaigns

  • Working with self-healing tolerant auto scaled big data clusters

  • Creating 20+ in-house custom products used by 300+ technically skilled analysts

  • Maintaining a system that takes 1 billion lines of data through our ETL pipeline daily

  • Spinning 100,000 Docker containers daily

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Secret Escapes Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
As a member of the platform team you will be working with our distributed technical team who are primarily based in our London head office (Holborn) but also working remotely (Berlin, Poznan, Skopje as well as home working). The role will involve shaping Secret Escapes adoption of DevOps and implementing key changes in infrastructure. Your day to day duties will include working closely with our development team to assist them with the operational requirements of implementing new and maintaining existing applications, optimising our delivery pipeline, maintaining and scaling our infrastructure.


About us


Secret Escapes is a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment where self-starters have an opportunity to make a huge impact in one of the internet’s fastest growing categories. We’re a dedicated and passionate team who work hard to make things happen. You won’t find us standing on ceremony or worrying about corporate red tape (we’re fresh out of that stuff).


Our developers say



  • We're open to exploring and improving the ways in which we build software. We're a team that embraces change and want to work with the best tools, processes and people.

  • We socialize as a team. From team lunches to board games and LAN gaming, we have fun.

  • We work closely with the business. We sit in the same space with the key stakeholders. You get to see the impact of your work right away and get immediate feedback.

  • We believe in working with open source and giving back to the community.

  • We have hack days are once a fortnight where we can work on projects we wouldn’t normally have chance to in our day to day.

  • Professional growth is encouraged with individual budget available to be spent as required on training, conferences, etc


Your responsibilities will include



  • Scaling our continuous delivery infrastructure.

  • Process automation and monitoring.

  • Site uptime, performance and scalability.

  • Security of the production and development environments.

  • Providing solutions for our developers to deliver features in a scalable and reliable manner.

item.title: Designer (Web) at Secret Escapes Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Things you’ll be working on


At Secret Escapes, we have an appreciation of design in everything we do. We believe that good design is not just how a product looks but how it works. We’re looking for a designer who can move quickly, but also takes the time to create broad, innovative ideas. You’ll work among developers and product managers, contributing to product direction with data driven user-centric solutions and crafting pixel-perfect output.


How the magic happens


The technology team is a mix of web developers, mobile developers and designers working closely together across 4 locations; London, Berlin, Poznan (Poland), Skopje (Macedonia). The combination of Skype, Slack, Google Hangouts and TeamViewer means that location is never really a problem.


What we offer



  • Competitive salary commensurate with your skills and experience

  • A range of benefits and flexible working options

  • Opportunity to work in one of London’s fastest growing technology companies

item.title: PHP-Entwickler (m/w) in Willich (Düsseldorf) oder Adelsdorf (Nürnberg) at easybill GmbH (Willich, Deutschland) (allows remote)
