item.title: Lead Real Time Developer at Axis Animation (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
Axis Animation is looking to hire an experienced and versatile LEAD REAL-TIME DEVELOPER to help drive the next generation of interactive and cinematics tools in animation, VFX, VR and theme-park design. This is a full-time role based in the new Real-time Unit at Axis Animation and a unique opportunity to shape the future of an animation studio.


As LEAD REAL-TIME DEVELOPER you will be responsible for developing and implementing new features and workflows to support projects with a real-time or interactive component. Working alongside lighting artists, modelers and technical directors, you will leverage real-time technology across the studio in departments such as Assets, Lighting and FX.


The Real-time Unit works alongside the Research and Development department, who collaborate with all departments to design, develop and maintain artist tools alongside core applications and services used by the studio.


Candidates are required and must be eligible at time of application to work on-site in Glasgow.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Implement, support and extend a real-time engine for use on real-time projects

  • Work with an agile and multi-disciplinary team of artists, designers, and programmers

  • Work with the Head of R&D in the development of project goals and milestones

  • Ensure tools and processes integrate into the overall studio pipeline

  • Test and debug tools and processes to ensure stability and usability

  • Act as a liaison for communicating technical issues to Production, R&D and IT

  • Educate artists on how to work with the cinematics pipeline

  • Create and update documentation explaining our processes and tools

item.title: Systems Administrator at Axis Animation (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
Axis Animation are undergoing an explosive expansion and seeking a SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR to join the tech support team on a permanent basis on site in our Glasgow studio. The role carries a high level of responsibility, providing technical support across 3 studios, and so we’re looking for an experienced administrator, with a broad background and the ability to support multiple technologies.



You’ll be a personable, pro-active, self starter who thrives working in a fast paced environment, capable of handling operational tasks in support of both general IT systems and in the operation of render farm systems. With good communication skills as well as analytical and problem-solving abilities, the ideal candidate will have an understanding and/or appreciation of the challenging nature of the animation/VFX industry. An ability to make decisions and perform well under pressure is essential.



The SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR will be responsible for the installation, maintenance and performance of systems hardware and software, including servers, network devices, workstations and associated kit. This individual will be responsible for supporting and implementing systems within our Glasgow, Bristol and London studios, ensuring that system hardware and software and general operating systems are functioning as required, enabling the teams to work effectively and efficiently.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs.

  • Perform regular security monitoring to identify any possible intrusions.

  • Participate in administration of backup operations.

  • Perform regular file archival and purge as necessary.

  • Create, change, and delete user accounts per request.

  • Support workstation management, imaging, and configuration.

  • Ensure proper documentation of systems and procedures.

  • Support physical security systems and ensure proper functioning.

  • Support in-house application configuration and usage.

  • Maintain asset tracking systems to ensure best management of resources.

  • Assess, troubleshoot, and resolve user hardware/software issues

  • Repair and recover from hardware or software failures

  • Maintain floating license servers.

  • Apply OS and firmware patches and upgrades.

  • Upgrade and configure infrastructure systems and software per as needed.

  • Maintain server room and colocation facility environmental and monitoring equipment.

  • Other duties and projects as assigned.

item.title: Come Join Our Awesome Graduate Programme!! at BJSS (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
BJSS offers a dynamic working environment for talented technologists looking to develop their careers whilst working for some of the most prestigious clients. The atmosphere is relaxed, friendly and social, devoid of politics and other distractions, and our management team are 100% committed to recognising and rewarding our people. If you consider yourself to be among the best in your field and are looking for a role in an environment where excellence is expected and rewarded, and challenge assured, please get in touch! For those who join us, the long-term rewards and prospects for advancement are excellent!


What projects will I be involved with?


Our clients operate in various industries. You can expect to contribute to a live project on your first day, becoming increasingly ‘hands-on’ over the weeks that follow.


How will I be rewarded?


Our Graduates benefit from a very competitive salary package, holiday entitlement, pension, and optional private medical insurance. You’ll also receive support in gaining certified financial training and ISTQB qualifications. Oh and there is breakfast provided and fresh fruit delivered twice a week!


How will I be supported?


The Programme is designed to help you make the most of your potential. As soon as you start, we’ll assign you a mentor who will support you throughout. Teamwork is vital to our projects. So it’s in our nature to work together towards common goals. Your colleagues will always be ready to share their experience and knowledge with you and will help to solve your day-to-day challenges.


Are there any social activities to enjoy?


Whatever your interests, in many locations, there’s likely to be a BJSS sports, interest, and social group that would be keen to welcome you. You can also attend BJSS functions such as our coding challenges, monthly socials, or the annual weekend event.


Which BJSS locations run the programme?


Opportunities are available in the BJSS Leeds and Manchester Project Centres.

item.title: JAVA Software Engineer - It's all about the CODE at BJSS (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
Working at BJSS is unlike anywhere else, working on pioneering technology we frequently find ourselves developing challenging software on large and complex enterprise systems, and winning many awards along the way.


You will get the opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies - Java9 next year (or whenever they get it released!), TDD, CI, The Cloud, whatever the latest and coolest trend is, you will be working with it.


BJSS believes in investing in our employees, to nurture their ambitions of becoming the best software engineers possible. Projects are multi-disciplinary teams, if you want to surround yourself with strong technical people with a passion for technology and a deep-rooted focus on delivering quality, then BJSS is the place for you!

item.title: JavaScript/CSS Front-end Engineer at Heresy (London, UK)
item.description: You’ll join us as our first front-end engineer and help us complete the first version of our main product. You will have the opportunity to take ownership of the development process, participate in discussions and be part of the journey of growing the company. As such, you’ll be working directly with the CEO (previously Managing Director at Stack Overflow in Europe) and CTO (previously freelance developer and consultant, Skimlinks, Mastered, organiser of ShoreditchJS).

item.title: Senior QA Engineer at Airtame (København, Denmark)
item.description:
As a Senior QA engineer at Airtame, you are an advocate for quality. You help push the standard of the product forward, and ensure that customers always receive excellent deliverables. Your role will be working closely with our software engineering team to provide both manual and automated testing at all levels of the product.


Our talented engineers are given significant ownership and responsibility over projects. We value rapid iteration, continuous integration and testing, and we are serious about producing high-quality, maintainable software. Frequent code reviews, linting, and pairing are all integral components of our engineering culture. We encourage experimenting with new technologies and constantly challenge ourselves to improve our code, processes, and systems.

item.title: Cloud Architect at Conclusion (Heerlen, Netherlands)
item.description:
Conclusion is in Limburg op zoek naar Cloud Architecten die het verschil maken. We zoeken gedreven en ervaren medewerkers die beschikken over goede contactuele eigenschappen. Kom jij tot je recht in een informele bedrijfscultuur met korte lijnen en kun je snel schakelen? Dan zoeken we jou!


OVER DE FUNCTIE


Cloud Architect at CFIT


De Cloud Architect is een "hands-on" software architect. We verwachten dat je technisch leiding/coaching kunt geven, maar ook actief bijdraagt aan alle aspecten van agile softwareontwikkeling: planning, tracking, architectuur, ontwikkeling, configuratie management, integratie, verificatie.


Je neemt deel aan diverse technologie gedreven projecten in een zeer flexibel, wendbare en innovatieve omgeving.Je bent zowel binnen als buiten Conclusion actief in de Cloud community wat je in staat stelt om kansen voor Conclusion te signaleren. Je draagt ook bij aan het verwerven van nieuwe opdrachten bv door het initiëren van projectvoorstellen.

item.title: Database Administrator at Fragomen (Sheffield, UK)
item.description:
Fragomen is the leading international law firm specialising in corporate immigration, delivering solutions to numerous high profile corporate clients. The firm has grown considerably over the last few years and we have recently opened a second office in the UK, in Sheffield.


As part of the growth in our Sheffield office we are looking to appoint a Database Administrator to work within our global reporting team, delivering exceptional technical expertise within business intelligence and reporting .


The role of the Database Administrator is varied with a range of responsibilities, these include:  



  • Work with key internal stakeholders to create bespoke reports, including reviewing specifications and design of the reports

  • Develop reports using BOXI, Crystal Reports/SQL

  • Work with other teams across the global I.T department in developing flexible standard reports and maximise their efficiency

  • Work with users directly to complete reports in a timely and efficient manner

  • Troubleshoot issues with reports including data analysis, performance tuning and reconciliation

  • Update ChangeGear regularly and adequately

  • Participate in system upgrades and maintenance activities as required

item.title: Software Developer - Your chance to influence a technology lanscape at Footasylum (Rochdale, UK)
item.description:
Footasylum has several a number of exciting vacancies for C# software developers of all levels to join a newly formed cross-functional development team at our head office in Rochdale.


We have big plans, and need your help to achieve them.


About Us:


We were born in late 2005, with a mission to bring some excitement to the streetwear scene. Going from a single unit in Wilmslow to over 50 high street stores nationwide, our team have a passion for the product and their collective knowledge is what separates us from the competition. In a world where clothes shopping is a stale affair, Footasylum retail environments are unique and intriguing. We move beyond the traditional and aren’t afraid to break the mould in everything we do… including software development.


Always cooler, always faster, always ahead of the game: We are Footasylum.


What skills do I need?



  • Experience working in C# .Net & ASP.NET

  • Experience with web applications

  • Experience with SQL Server

  • Experience working in a cross-functional delivery team

  • Experience working in an Agile software development environment

  • Any experience working alongside Microsoft NAV would be useful


If you don’t have experience in all the above areas, then feel free to get in touch - we have several different opportunities available and you may be just what we’ve been looking for.


What kind of people are you looking for?


You will ideally be:



  • Passionate about software development, we are looking for people who really care and enjoy what they do and can bring that to our business – when you enjoy doing something you always do it better!

  • Innovative, confident coming up with suggestions to try and make things better - that next big idea is just around the corner!

  • Determined to deliver the changes and improvements that we need to succeed - you have the power to make the difference

  • Motivated by an opportunity that allows you to be closely involved with business stakeholders and understand how you can make a difference rather than just working from a detailed technical specification

  • Ready for a challenge, we have a world of opportunities ahead of us but need to work hard to make sure we realize our full potential


The benefits:


There’s no shortage of benefits! These include 20 days’ holiday with an extra day being added on every year of service, generous staff discount and fantastic career progression for the right candidate.


How to apply:


If you really want to play a huge role in the future of the business, then this is the perfect platform and opportunity. Please send your CV to Chris.Walker@footasylum.com

item.title: Software engineer, mobile, iOS central London at BaseStone (London, UK)
item.description:
BaseStone is building the next generation of collaboration and process applications for the construction industry.  We've come a long way since our award winning trip to the Dublin Web Summit and were recent  recipients of a highly prestigious  British Construction Industry accolade of Highly Commended in the Application of Technology Award - the first technology company ever to win


We are looking for a software engineer to join our team in London. This is an on premise position, not remote although some remote working is negotiable.  This is a permanent position, not contract.  Equity is available.  This is a position for someone who wants to be a key member of the team and grow as we grow.


Our ideal candidate is someone who cares about product and craftsmanship. We want you to help us become the team we aim to be. Most of all we want to deliver solutions to real people, solutions that enable our users to work fluidly and with confidence within the confines of construction industry process. If that sounds like your thing then join us and make it happen.


BaseStone believes that diversity in the workplace makes for a better team and better product.  Don't hesitate to get in touch.  We are also interested in hearing from software engineers interested in mobile but coming from other software engineering backgrounds.  If you're a C or C++ developer (for example) join the team and learn the iOS SDK while applying your knowledge and skills.

item.title: SENIOR BACK END DEVELOPER (PHP) at OPEN Health (Marlow, UK)
item.description:
At OPEN Health, we're made by our people. Which means you get to shape not only the role you have right now, but also what your work will be like in future. And whether you extract every single banana from our daily fruit basket, should you so wish.


From the outset, we'd see you delivering the back end development for a broad variety of projects across the OPEN Health group of companies. You'd be joining a teensy little digital specialist group of designers, front end developers and project managers, headed by the digital technical director.


Day-to-day, you'd feel happy:



  • Helping to make sure our projects are delivered on spec and on time

  • Overseeing code quality, including peer review systems

  • Helping to scope and define functionality, including identifying where each project could benefit from additional features

  • Following development processes, and helping to shape these as the team grows

  • Defining style guides and standards

  • Ensuring the correct technology is used for each project, and that new alternatives are considered

  • Identifying where code can be re-purposed for other projects.

item.title: Do you want to work on greenfield projects? Contract role, remote work possible at AOL (London, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
*This is a 6 month fixed term contract, remote work is possible


Working with the global engineering and support teams you will produce and support award winning creatives across desktop, mobile, and video. You will leverage your innovative thinking and creativity to assist clients; debugging their code, understanding their problems and educating them on best practises.


You will use cutting edge technologies like HTML5 and JavaScript to work on innovative projects, and contribute to AOL’s OpenSource culture. You will learn new aspects of software engineering in this global environment, with the opportunity to shape greenfield projects and work collaboratively with the labs team.


Challenges include but are not limited to:



  • Developing cutting-edge bespoke implementations for Blue-Chip advertisers

  • Building interactive proof of concepts

  • Diagnosing, debugging and solving creative production issues that arise through campaign requirements

  • Contributing to our knowledge sharing practises, growing our internal Knowledge Base, technical documentation and Self Help articles for users

  • Discussing future product features, enhancements and functionalities with the Rich Media product team

  • Supporting the distribution, adoption and extension of our technology into broader product offerings

item.title: e-Commerce Software Engineer (Open to willing Magento enthusiasts) at Elsevier (Kidlington, UK)
item.description:
Our website will tell you that we are a world-leading provider of information solutions, enabling researches in the medical, scientific and academia space. However over the last few years we have been behaving very much like a data-driven tech company. Animating our data, making it interactive for our target audience on various platforms.



We have an exciting opportunity within our e-Commerce team for a Magento Developer based in our Kidlington, Oxfordshire offices. Elsevier wants to make our customers experience of finding and purchasing our products and services best-in-class.



You going to need passion and lots of it! Really care about the quality of the software you build and ready to join a fast moving agile team.

item.title: Senior Software Engineering Manager - Siri at Apple (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Want to lead a team that is working on the cutting edge of software engineering, machine learning and big data? Join Apple’s Siri team in Cambridge, UK, and be part of revolutionising human-machine interaction! We are looking to hire a Senior Software Engineering Manager with a proven record in leading multiple teams of software engineers and strong technical skills. Your highly talented teams of engineers work alongside leading machine learning scientists to develop the next generation of Siri. We use world class tools and software engineering practices, and push the boundaries of artificial intelligence with a single aim: make a real difference to the lives of hundreds of millions of Siri users.


Description


Although this is a senior management position, the person appointed will be expected to take an active role in software development. You should therefore expect to spend some of your time with “hands-on” work and the main responsibilities reflect this:


* Lead and continuously develop multiple teams of software engineers


* Grow the team by hiring exceptional engineers and team leads


* Design and develop software as a Scrum team member


* Review designs and code by others and provide constructive feedback


* Identify opportunities to improve engineering practices and take action to implement changes


* Occasional evening meetings with teams outside UK, and limited international travel is required

item.title: Software Engineer at snap40 (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
We are exception monitoring for humans. 


As a snap40 Software Engineer, you will work closely with our engineering team to build out our product and bring it to patients and healthcare professionals. You will contribute at every single stage of the product life cycle, deploy it out into the wild and see its impact on real people. You will work on new features as well as on our existing codebase.


Our IoT software tech stack extends all the way from the patient to the healthcare professional.



  • Embedded code running on a patient’s arm

  • Network protocols reliably handling sensor data transmission

  • A data pipeline that constantly seeks health deterioration patterns

  • Micro-services that power mobile apps, visualisations and push notifications to support clinical decisions


As a startup, you’ll be able to help shape and grow our engineering and our architecture as well as our business as a whole. You’ll have a direct and real impact on every part of who we are.


This job is for an excellent hands-on software engineer who can make an impact on our data pipeline and platform by building robust and secure systems that operate 24/7 to improve patient outcomes.

item.title: DevOps Engineer £40-£60k at Abide Financial Ltd (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for multiple dynamic, driven individuals to join the team that can provide the support required to enable us to continue a period of rapid growth. Our wider team consists of software and operations/systems engineers, who are responsible for and own the code that automates, monitors and scales our cloud based systems and infrastructure.


What you’ll be doing:



  • Cloud vendor management, eg AWS

  • Windows server administration (2008/2012R2)

  • Enabling of continuous integration & continuous delivery

  • Configuration management/infrastructure automation with Chef, Puppet, Octopus Deploy

  • Develop, modify, support and maintain AWS-based components for admin and monitoring features

  • Develop, modify, support and maintain AWS-based components for public facing infrastructure

  • Develop, modify, support and maintain AWS-based components for public facing application Back End

  • Continuous improvement, e.g. ongoing analysis of improvements for environments etc

  • Monitoring

  • Cloud computing/platform including AWS including, Scripting and API

  • Version Control (GIT)

  • Creation and maintenance of documentation for internal and external use

item.title: Big Data DevOps Engineer (100% Remote but must be between UTC-2 and UTC+7) at Hotjar () (allows remote)
item.description:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+7.


Hotjar is looking for a driven and ambitious DevOps Engineer with Big Data experience to support and expand our cloud-based infrastructure used by thousands of sites around the world. The Hotjar infrastructure currently processes more than 7500 API requests per second, delivers over a billionpieces of static content every week and hosts databases well into terabyte-size ranges, making this an interesting and challenging opportunity. As Hotjar continues to grow rapidly, we are seeking an engineer who has experience dealing with high traffic cloud based applications and can help Hotjar scale as our traffic multiplies. 

This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast growing remote startup in a key position.

In this position, you will:



  • Be part of our DevOps team building and maintaining our web application and server environment.

  • Choose, deploy and manage tools and technologies to build and support a robust infrastructure.

  • Be responsible for identifying bottlenecks and improving performance of all our systems.

  • Ensure all necessary monitoring, alerting and backup solutions are in place.

  • Do research and keep up to date on trends in big data processing and large scale analytics.

  • Implement proof of concept solutions in the form of prototype applications.

item.title: Sales engineer for SaaS cloud monitoring startup at Server Density (London, UK)
item.description:
Server Density is a technical product, used by technical people across IT teams, from developers to operations to management. We don't just sell the service to customers and then disappear, instead taking a highly consultative approach, working closely with prospects to understand their requirements and demonstrate how Server Density can help them. This requires a broad understanding of technologies with the ability to go deep into specific details about customer environments.


This position is for an engineer to join our sales team to lead the technical consultation process during the entire sales cycle, from qualification through to closure. You will be involved in the early stages of new deals to help demonstrate the product, discuss technical requirements, guide the customer during their trial, coordinate any requirements with our product engineering team and act as the technical go-to person as prospects become customers. 


We are looking for a Sales Engineer with a background in technical SaaS sales and/or support who can understand all phases of the sales cycle, partnering with sales executives to successfully close deals. You will also participate in the technical on boarding of new customers with the Customer Success team and ensure the smooth deployments of the technical aspects of Server Density.

item.title: DevOps Engineer - Help us Build Smarter Cities at Masabi (London, UK)
item.description:
The IT Operations Team


In IT Operations we follow an “Infrastructure as code” philosophy to deploy and manage the many servers that allow commuters all around the world to buy their tickets on their mobile phones. We recognise that this is a really big responsibility and we are proud and excited to be able to make such a big impact on people's daily lives.


We love our devs! They are an awesome bunch that feel the same way about our product as we do, so we try our best to give them all the support and tools they need to deliver this world changing product. We don't like getting in the way, so in general we try to enable others to do things themselves, by automating as much as possible and giving them the buttons to push. This isn't easy because the environment needs to be PCI compliant, but we see that as a cool challenge, and so far we are doing great!


We also love AWS. AWS services like EC2 and RDS allow us to do so much with so little, so we use it as much as possible and try avoid deploying anything to our in-house VMware cluster. We also like Docker - we don't love it yet, but who knows :)


We have a lot of fun in Ops, mostly laughing at with each other about stupid things, but when the business needs us, we are there for them. We believe that it is our personal responsibility to ensure that our commuter friends in Boston or Athens or New York are able to ride the train/bus with our app, so we do everything that it takes to ensure that happens.


The person we are looking for


You will have some years of commercial experience in computing, either in ops or in development. You will be using Linux as your server OS of choice, but to be fair you’ll use whatever works. You can code.


If you are currently in ops, from day one you have scripted your admin tasks, so you are comfortable talking about your code with a developer. You probably started out on bash, but nowadays you use something more powerful like Python or Ruby because bash just doesn’t cut it anymore.


You are aware of the power of AWS and newer things like containerisation - either from your own commercial experience or because you play with them at home when you get bored. You don't rack servers, but you’ll help the Service Desk guy carry those boxes because he’s an awesome guy and, well, why wouldn’t you?


If you are currently a developer, infrastructure excites you and DevOps seems like an interesting new playground. You enjoy learning different programming languages and are not afraid of trying something new.


Although you enjoy working by yourself (normally at home, just getting things done) you are happier when working with your teammates, solving complex business-critical problems. Your teammates often become your friends, because they have similar interests to you, and you respect their contribution to the group. You get excited when someone can teach you something new. You get excited when someone near you succeeds, especially if you had a little something to do with it.


The Infrastructure


 Linux
 Amazon EC2, RDS, ELB, Autoscaling, CloudFormation
 Puppet, Artifactory
 Jenkins, Bamboo
 Git
 MySQL
 Logentries

item.title: Graduate/Junior Java Developer at eFinancialCareers (London, UK)
item.description:
General Purpose 


We are looking to hire a Graduate/Junior Java/J2EE Developer. This is a brilliant opportunity for a technically sound individual to enhance their career in a role with truly good prospects and excellent benefits.


The successful candidate will be a competent Java/J2EE Developer and ideally will have worked in all phases of the project life-cycle. We are looking for a positive, flexible and hands-on coder who is passionate about writing quality code and emerging technologies. You will be part of a very high calibre team consisting of tech, product, and DevOps working in short iterations, building production ready software.


Responsibilities



  • Work as part of an agile team to contribute to product features from inception to delivery and beyond

  • Investigation of issues and provisioning of fixes as required

  • Collaborate to help design systems including creation of RESTful APIs

  • Develop in a TDD environment and use it routinely in your daily coding

  • Write high quality, maintainable code

  • Support the software your team build including taking part in deployment and monitoring

  • Learn new technologies as required

  • Integrating services into AWS and using automating scripting languages

  • Proactively strive for continual improvement of processes and tools 


Job Qualifications 


Essential Skills 



  • 1 years' experience using Java/J2EE based technologies

  • Sound knowledge of object-oriented development

  • Working knowledge of Spring

  • Web frameworks, JPA, SQL knowledge

  • Web development experience (JavaScript, HTML, CSS and/or Angular is a bonus)

  • Experience with source control ideally Git and GitHub


Desirable Skills



  • Amazon Web Services

  • TDD

  • Experience Hibernate/JPA

  • Use of IntelliJ or Eclipse

  • Ability to design RESTful APIs

  • Exposure to working in an agile (scrum) environment


Required Education and/or Experience



  • A Computer Science degree or related technical field or equivalent practical experience

  • Strong Java programming ability - ability to write high quality and maintainable code

  • A Good understanding of algorithms, software architecture and design

  • An Ability to collaborate within an Agile team and communicate effectively

  • Good problem solving and analysis skills


What we offer you



  • Work in a motivated, fast-moving team

  • Explicit commitment to high quality software engineering

  • A great opportunity to learn and acquire new skills in frameworks and technologies including AWS

  • Real opportunity to apply your knowledge, skill and expertise to the team

  • Competitive salary

  • Benefits: pension scheme, 25 days holidays, private healthcare, Friday Beer O’clocks once a month, annual events, team building activities, etc. 


Working Environment/Physical Activities


We have a casual office environment with ping-pong table, video games, free fresh coffee and a dining area for downtime. Travel will rarely be required, but requires the ability to transport a laptop and peripherals and handheld device.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at MarketInvoice (London, UK)
item.description:
YOUR TEAM:


You will be working in autonomous teams – Some SCRUM, others Kanban – That have the freedom to drive innovation themselves. We have a strong DevOps culture too and believe CI/CD/Testing are the only ways to innovate at scale. You will get hands on with coding, building, testing, deploying, monitoring. We continually look at new solutions to our problems.


When we say innovation we mean it; every Engineer gets one day, every other week to investigate new technologies, expand their knowledge and prototype new ideas or features.


YOUR TECHNICAL ENVIRONMENT:


You’ll be working on our core platform allowing small business to access funding seamlessly through fantastic UX and automation of complex processing such as risk analysis and payment processing.


Our core platform is built in .Net C# and AngularJS but the choice of technology or language is continually evolving. Our data team is currently working in R, python, NodeJS and F#.

item.title: Lead Mobile/Web Application Developer at Toumetis (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
Your role


You will be an experienced developer working on mobile/web applications, specialising on the backend and providing guidance to a team of developers.


You will be reporting to a dedicated Project Manager, as well as working with the QA team to ensure robust functionality within the app is delivered.

item.title: Web Developer at Zuant (Malmesbury, UK)
item.description:
You will write AngularJS/Node apps.  



  • Discuss requirements with the internal product team

  • Produce ultra-lightweight requirements definitions

  • Devise technical program designs

  • Code

  • Test

  • Deliver reliable, elegant and fit-for-purpose web functionality.


We're looking for a confident web developer who understands the importance of writing good quality code.  You will feel strongly about delivering robust software which others can understand, and which can be built upon moving forward.

Good communication skills are important, both verbal and written.  The role will involve working closely with other members of the team, and bringing positive energy to the tasks at hand.  You won't be argumentative, and you'll be comfortable expressing your own ideas whilst respecting the views of others.


Teams work best when everyone is pulling together, and supporting one another - we expect loyalty, team-spirit, diligence and commitment.  In return, we don't micro-manage, and we grant flexibility and autonomy.


Technically, you know Javascript very well, and find web technologies interesting and challenging.  You appreciate that it is easy to create inelegant and brittle solutions unless you're careful.


You're familiar with the terms XP, DRY, SOLID, GRASP, YAGNI, KISS, and why these are relevant when dreaming up program structures and designs.  You're opinionated on how things should be crafted, but not intransigent when discussing technical matters.


It might be that you're reading this thinking that you're not strong enough as a developer.  If so, a chat won't hurt, so why not get in touch and discuss where you are in your career?  We don't bite, and we're a friendly and straightforward bunch.  Our goal is simply to ensure that you'd be an excellent fit with us, and we'll be happy to spend whatever time is required to establish that.  


We also promise to keep your contact with us strictly confidential, and no-one outside the core Zuant team will be party to your application.

item.title: Software Developer at European Bioinformatics Institute (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking an enthusiastic software developer to join the Proteomics Team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI). The team is responsible of the maintenance and further development of the PRIDE (PRoteomics IDEntifications) database and related tools. PRIDE is a world-leading international proteomics database, a founding member of the ProteomeXchange (PX) Consortium that is capturing large-scale mass spectrometry (MS)-based proteomics data from the scientific community and currently managing hundreds of TBs of data. The team is also responsible of the development and maintenance of popular tools such as PRIDE Inspector, the PX submission tool as well as several open source MS software libraries. In addition, we are a major contributor to international standardisation efforts under the umbrella of the Proteomics Standards Initiative (PSI).

The post holder will contribute to the development of open proteomics data analysis pipelines using the OpenMS framework, and participate in the posterior deployment of these pipelines in a cloud environment. The planned work is part of a joint ELIXIR implementation project between ELIXIR-DE and EMBL-EBI. In addition, the post holder will also contribute to other tasks related to the maintenance and development of the services and tools offered by the team

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Help Us Cure Cancer Through Techhnology at Vision RT (London, UK)
item.description:
Specialism: IT / Medical Imaging / Software engineering / Technology Consulting / Software development / R&D

One of the leading organisations within medical imaging and is looking to recruit a Senior Software Development Engineer with C++, C# or similar programming experience to join them in London.

As a Software Development Engineer you will be working as part of a team to lever new technologies, both in rewriting our existing world class software products and introducing new exciting features and products. Experience working in areas relating to 3D graphics, computer vision, image processing, DICOM or medical imaging would be an advantage.

item.title: Service Engineer at GitLab () (allows remote)
item.description:
The rising popularity of GitLab means that our professional services are in high demand. If you have the skills to help our clients we would love to talk to you.


We are looking for skilled people around the world. If you would love to work from home and help GitLab grow, this is the right spot for you.


Responsibilities



  • Engage with our customers—anything from a small advertising firm or a university, to Fortune 100 clients and help them with anything from a simple support ticket to a customer training

  • Communicate via email and video conferencing with potential and current clients

  • Maintain GitLab.com and our other services such as GitHost.io

  • Participate in the rotating "on-call" list to provide 24/7 emergency response availability

  • Ensure that everything we learn from running GitLab.com is set as default or communicated to our users

  • Write and update documentation based on customer interactions

  • Submit and comment on feature requests based on customer interactions


More information can be found on the support page in the handbook.


Junior Service Engineer


Junior Service Engineer's responsibilities cover all the support channels that are supported by a level 3 or 4 SLA, per the definitions on the Support page.


Senior Service Engineer


Senior Service Engineers are experienced Service Engineers who



  • have deep knowledge of GitLab internals and a variety of possible configurations

  • help hire and train new Service Engineers

  • are a go-to person for the other Service Engineers when they face tough challenges

  • improve the support process (Optimize Zendesk flow, suggest rake task additions)

  • write blog articles

  • take ownership of documentation and feature requests that is based on customer interactions

  • create merge requests to fix bugs

item.title: Build Engineer at GitLab () (allows remote)
item.description:
• As a Build engineer your main focus will be on omnibus-gitlab, the software that enables our users to install, upgrade, and use GitLab easily

  • Work on improving various aspects of the omnibus-gitlab package (size, speed, reliability)

  • Implement and bundle new services into the omnibus-gitlab package, for more details see our direction scope

  • Work with the rest of the GitLab development team in supporting newly created features and resolving bugs on the omnibus-gitlab project side

  • Work on making GitLab easier to install and configure for all users (through Chef cookbooks, Puppet modules, Ansible and Salt scripts)

  • Improve package build processes

  • Help community packaging projects (eg. native Debian, native Fedora and native Arch packages)


Workflow 



  • In cooperation with the Packaging team, issues to work on will be sorted per release cycle.

  • Deciding priority of the issues can be found in the handbook under GitLab Workflow.

item.title: Web Developer at R H Environmental (Emersons Green, UK)
item.description:
You will be required to work 35 hours per week on site at our modern Bristol and Bath Science Park office, working hours are 9am-5pm Monday-Friday.


The successful candidate will be responsible for moving our existing products forward through development on new and existing features across our portfolio. As a web developer, you will work primarily on the web application components of our products, including both front and back end.


We love our developers to stretch their skill sets, for example we will support you with mobile app development and in other areas. We also encourage experimentation with new technologies to push the boundaries of our software and deliver more value to our customers.


We use a range of different technologies such as ReactJS, AngularJS, Laravel and SASS to build our products. The ideal candidate must have a good understanding of software development principles in order to adapt to the variety of different technologies. In addition, the ability to multi-task is necessary as you may be required to switch between projects quickly.


The successful candidate will work with the full stack of technologies that make up each of our products. This includes the front end customer facing interfaces, server side back end and databases.


You will need to work effectively in an Agile team of both technical and non-technical people. This includes the ability to effectively communicate software solutions to the business. In addition, you should be able to translate business requirements into a clearly defined software solution.


A typical day at RHE might include:



  • Participating in the daily stand up

  • Crafting user stories and acceptance criteria with the sales team for the product backlog

  • Sketching prototypes to help the sales team realise a software solution

  • Working with our designer to produce designs for new products or features

  • Developing new or existing features with guidance from the senior developers

  • Building and deploying your work to staging and production environments

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at HUGHUB (London, UK)
item.description:
Our developers utilize all the latest technologies and the platform contains a number of highly innovative technical features that differentiates it from anything in existence and the road map of feature/functions will continue to build on its uniqueness. The product has a front-end written entirely in Java/TypeScript, Angular, Node.js and a back end utilizing RESTful web services (.NET WebAPI), CQRS and MongoDB.


The ethos of our development team is that of high performing entrepreneurs with superior technology talent. The delivery style is that of a “consultant developer” working closely with the end client to deliver in a truly DAD style.


The company is young, energetic and driven and we work closely together at our office in Mayfair. 


We are looking for a new team member to join us who has experience with the following technologies:

item.title: SQL-Server Database Administrator at Carfinance247 (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
You will be a joining a growing team focused on the support, and maintenance of our current SQL databases, while helping shape and administer the future of our SQL Estate. You will support your future team with the on-going maintenance of databases, ensuring backup integrity, supporting the disaster recovery strategy and ensuring the databases are available and secure.


Skills & Requirements


We are looking for candidates who have demonstrable expertise in:



  • Microsoft SQL Server 2012/2014

  • TSQL development

  • Scripting e.g.; PowerShell, Batch


As you will be working with and collaborating with an agile team, excellent communication skills are essential

item.title: Enthusiastic Web Developer for small Web Consultancy at HW Technology (Chorley, UK)
item.description: We are looking for an enthusiastic and dedicated Senior Developer who can take the lead on development and implementation of a mixture of websites and web apps. We are looking for someone who can communicate well with clients and other developers. Finally, they’ve got to be a seasoned full stack developer with bucket loads of experience and ready to take on a new challenge.

item.title: Front-End Engineer at LifeWorks (London, UK)
item.description:
Our vibrant company is looking for an enthusiastic Front End Engineer to join our highly motivated and talented team to work on our products.


LifeWorks is a Global Employee Engagement Platform (EEP) serving 50,000 companies with over 15 million users. LifeWorks’ mobile employee engagement and wellness platform puts the employee at the heart of its business. Having recently signed a joint venture with Ceridian the company is going from strength to strength.


At LifeWorks, Front-End is not an afterthought. We believe that only simple and elegant JavaScript code makes delightful user experiences. React has been a game changer for us. We dropped it in the code base on year ago, and the benefits are substantial: easier to learn, easier to write, easier to maintain and easier to debug.


We’re not just using React but some bits of the so-called ecosystem: Webpack, Immutable, inline styles. What’s not to like?! In case you’re wondering, yes we’re using es6.


No lies here, we still have some Angular bits but that makes an exciting challenge to find ways to get rid of it. We favor quality over quantity. That’s why we take time to review every piece of code that gets merged. And we also have the mandatory eslint. But that doesn’t mean we don’t move fast. We’ve switched to the GitHub flow (eg one git branch to rule them all) so that we can deploy to production every day!


All of our team members have side projects. That’s one of our ways to drive innovation, by bringing ideas tested elsewhere. We’ve got a “Monthly Inspirational Front Do” which is the opportunity for one of us to shine :) We’re going to meetups (React, FP, etc.) and we also love fancy pubs and bars (or our very own Battersea-rooftop when it gets sunny!) We are Front-End Engineers with some full-stack experience.

item.title: Backend Developer at LifeWorks (London, UK)
item.description:
Join our highly motivated and talented team to work on the next phase of our responsive, "mobile first" web application offerings.


You will be involved in key platform decisions and work with technologies like Zend Framework 2, Silex, Slim, Symfony 2.5, MongoDB and more. You will be responsible for our PHP backend and internal web projects, and be involved in key architectural decisions. The core focus initially will be driving the development of our PHP backend API project, which use ZendFramework 2 and MongoDB. You will be hand-coding big sections of the backend alongside other members of the team.

item.title: AI Software Developer (multiple positions) at Accelerated Dynamics (London, UK)
item.description: The AI research engineer will be responsible for the development of the AI module for drones and other robots. We are looking for a hands-on person who is not limited by theoretical research but is excited to implement it into practice. You will be responsible for developing algorithms and code for intelligent agents, planning, multi-agent coordination and swarming systems, and you will be involved in all phases of the development - from concept to implementation. Creativity and out of the box thinking is a plus as is a passion for robotics. Experience developing computer game AI is a huge bonus. We are working extensively with drone (quad-copter UAV) technologies and do a lot of field testing flying swarms of drones. This is an amazing oportunity to be a part of the most forward thinking drone and robot intelligence start-up.

item.title: Senior Python Engineer - Tech Start-up, Mobile Venture Builder at Fuse (London, UK)
item.description:
Key Highlights:



  • We are 30 seconds from the tube station

  • We have a discounted canteen onsite

  • We're building brand new products from scratch

  • Our Engineers are constantly experimenting with new technologies

  • Make technology decisions without roadblocks

  • Our technology stack is open and fluid


What you would be doing 


We recently launched Stack, a content discovery app. We’ve had some great user engagement, and are now spoiled for choice as to how we develop the product further. We need someone to help us build the server side parts of some exciting new features, including the implementation of content recommendation algorithms designed by our machine learning specialist, new registration flows, and gamified follower rankings.


What’s it like to work here?


Here’s a list of some of the things that our engineers value. If it sounds like the right kind of environment for you, why not get in touch?



  • We do our best to solve real user problems with our products, and have a data driven

  • approach to finding out if we are doing that.

  • We have high standards, and produce work that we’re proud of. We trust each other,

  • and are personally accountable across the whole team.

  • We’re free to make our own technology decisions

  • We never stop learning


What we’re looking for in a candidate:


We are looking for candidates with a solid understanding of computer science fundamentals. Candidates must have very good communication skills, and be comfortable working in a small team using a wide range of technologies. There will not be a great deal of hand-holding, so we are looking for candidates who are comfortable analysing existing code and working things out. You must have interest in your craft.

item.title: Javascript Developer - Sky Technology, Leeds at Sky (Leeds, UK)
item.description: If you are a Javascript Developer looking for an opportunity to work with a highly successful, well  established company with a start-up mentality then this could be the opportunity you’ve been waiting for!

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Which? (London, UK)
item.description:
Senior DevOps Engineer, London



We’re looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join our Which? Digital team.



About us



Which? launched almost 70 years ago in a Bethnal Green garage.  It’s not our love of toasters that has kept us going all these years, it’s our ability to evolve.



From our high–traffic website to our emerging apps, we want customers to access information in the way that suits them.  As our Senior DevOps Engineer, you’ll make sure our environments are brilliantly built and running smoothly to offer a great online experience.



What you’ll be doing



You’re great at your job, and our customers will feel that when they visit our sites. 



You’ll look after the end-to-end delivery of highly available and scalable systems, involving infrastructure & network design. Using configuration management and automation tools, you’ll improve infrastructure reliability, portability, and repeatability.  You’ll also build and evolve automated software pipelines supporting continuous deployment, automated testing and environment migration in collaboration with the Development and QA teams.



As crucial as the technical elements are, we’re not looking for a robot. It’s so important that you can, want and enjoy working in collaboration with other people.  The rest of the DevOps team will look to you for guidance, and you’ll get a kick out of developing, training and mentoring junior members.



What we’ll need from you



Excellent communication skills are a must.  We’ll also need to see the following technical experience:




  • Amazon Web Services (EC2, RDS, ElasticBeanstalk, CloudFormation)

  • Linux internals and the Linux command line

  • Automating systems and infrastructure configuration (Chef, Packer, Terraform or Docker)

  • Continuous Integration/Deployment tools ( Jenkins, CircleCI or similar)

  • Software build and deployments, troubleshooting applications, databases, networking, cloud and fixed infrastructures.

  • Identifying and managing complex issues and risks

  • Log management and analysis solutions such as Papertrail, Rsyslog

  • Monitoring tools such as Zabbix, New Relic or similar



This role will exist within a DevOps culture; learning, sharing and measurement are key skills for this role.



What we’ll give you in return



Let’s not be modest, our rewards package is one of the best out there. You’ll get 28 days’ annual leave, an interest-free season ticket loan, life assurance, and a pension scheme that increases to 11% after you’ve been here for a year.



The legal stuff



We don’t mean to sound bureaucratic, but there are certain boxes we have to tick.  Eligibility to live and work in the UK is one of them. We need you to confirm in your application that you are able to accept a role without the need for sponsorship.  We really don’t want to waste your time, so please only apply if you are an EU citizen or hold a valid Visa. We will ask to see your passport (or equivalent) at interview stage.

item.title: Cloud Technical Lead / Senior Software Engineer - Connectivity / IoT at Dyson (Malmesbury, UK)
item.description:
Description


Dyson are looking for a passionate and hands on cloud solutions technical Lead / senior software engineer to join our rapidly growing and highly motivated cross functional devops team at Dyson HQ in Malmesbury


Market Overview


In August 2016 Dyson launched its third connected product, the Dyson Pure Hot+Cool Link, which joins our existing products including the 360 Eye robot vacuum cleaner with its companion eco-system, Dyson Link. Dyson Link is our IoT solution to enable Dyson products to work in a connected environment. It includes the key components required to create an exciting connected product experience, from mobile apps, web/CRM integrations and cloud services (provisioning, asset management, message routing, product/app analytics, persistence and scaling).


Function Overview


This team will focus on development of apps and services to support our growing and innovative range of connected products. We are looking for to recruit across a wide range of skill sets within Mobile Application/Connectivity; including Mobile Application Development, UX/UI Designers, Solution Architects, Tech Leads, Project Management, Testing/Quality and Leadership roles to research, design and create mobile applications which will transform the way customers interact with future Dyson products.


Benefits Overview


Dyson monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and pension contributions. Beyond that, you’ll also enjoy a profit-related bonus, generous leave and life insurance. But financial benefits are only the start of a Dyson career. Rapid professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, flexible working hours, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to creativity, innovation and ambition.

item.title: Senior Android Developer for Connectivity Research (IoT) at Dyson (Malmesbury, UK)
item.description:
Description


The Senior Android Developer will be part of the growing Connectivity Research team at Dyson.


Market Overview


In May 2016 Dyson launched the second of its connected products, the Dyson Pure Cool Link, which joins our existing 360 Eye robot vacuum cleaner with it’s companion eco-system, Dyson Link. Dyson Link is our IOT solutions to enable Dyson products to work in a connected environment. It includes the key components required to create a connected product, from mobile apps, web/CRM integrations and cloud services (provisioning, asset management, message routing, product/app analytics, persistence and scaling).


Function Overview


The Connectivity Research Team are responsible for ensuring the next generation of connected products and technologies are properly explored, tested and refined in readiness to transition to the team responsible for producing our IoT solutions. This includes ensuring we investigate and utilise the right technologies, techniques, services and security. Additionally, Dyson products will need to operate in a wider connected environment requiring interoperability to be explored and evolved.


Accountabilities


You will be working in a multi-disciplinary team including mobile and cloud Developers, app and product UX/UI designers and electronics and mechanical engineers. You will often be collaborating with experts from different areas of RDD (Research, Design & Development), designing how connectivity is woven deeply into our products. You must be independent and methodical with excellent problem solving skillls. It is essential to be knowledgeable about the latest trends in connectivity and mobile technology and comfortable with rapidly picking up new technologies. A thirst to overcome problems and limitations in order to reach our vision is absolutely essential.



  • Researching underlying connectivity protocols and interoperability frameworks

  • Architecting connectivity solutions

  • Designing and validating new features, often with prototype hardware

  • Working closely with the UI/UX group to develop the next generation standards for Dyson Link

  • Assist in mentoring other members of the team

  • Communicating and documenting your findings and solutions

  • Help evolve our research processes

  • Working with 3rd party organisations and bodies to understand and enhance standards


Skills



  • BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject or equivalent experience

  • Commercial experience developing native Android (Java, C++, Android Studio)

  • Broad knowledge of the general mobile landscape, architectures, trends and emerging technologies

  • Experience of working with connectivity technologies – REST, Cloud services, Bluetooth

  • Capable of rapidly developing robust research prototypes

  • Methodical and analytical approach to problem solving

  • Experience of working closely with UI/UX design teams with an understanding of Google’s design principles and interface guidelines

  • Track record of documenting and communicating ideas

  • Experience deploying Apps and using analytics to understand usage

  • Understanding and experience of secure networking is desirable


Benefits Overview


Dyson monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and pension contributions. Beyond that, you’ll also enjoy a profit-related bonus, generous leave and life insurance. But financial benefits are only the start of a Dyson career. Rapid professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, flexible working hours, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to creativity, innovation and ambition.

item.title: Senior Android Developer Connectivity / IoT at Dyson (Malmesbury, UK)
item.description:
Bristol / Malmesbury, United Kingdom


Dyson are looking for experienced Android developers to join our connectivity team. The role can be based in our headquarters in Malmesbury or our New Mobile Development Hub in Central Bristol.


In May 2016 Dyson launched its second connected product, the Dyson Pure Cool Link (Winner of T3’s Connected Home Tech of the Year 2016), which joins our existing 360 Eye robot vacuum cleaner with its companion eco-system, Dyson Link. Dyson Link is our IoT solution to enable Dyson products to work in a connected environment. It includes the key components required to create an exciting connected product experience, from mobile apps, web/CRM integrations and cloud services


Accountabilities



  • You’ll be responsible for developing engaging and robust digital experiences to complement Dyson connected products. The work will be challenging, varied, and will help bring Dyson connected products into the evolving world of IoT.

  • Interacting with team including product developers, electronics engineers, embedded software engineers and Cloud developers to ensure our solutions are functional, secure and easy to use.

  • Your software will need to interact with Dyson hardware using a range of wireless technologies to help visualise ‘big data’ for our customers.

  • Your work in scaling solutions to match our growing connected product range and user base will be key your success in this role.

  • You’ll help to mentor other members of the team and contribute to system architecture and development process.


Skills



  • A track record in Android app development – Java and Android Studio

  • A desire to create class leading UX through your apps

  • A user of TDD / BDD development methodologies

  • Experience writing automated unit and UI tests (e.g. JUnit, Mockito & Calabash)

  • Familiar with Atlassian tools including JIRA, Bitbucket & Bamboo

  • Experience with Android build and release tools (e.g. fastlane, Gradle & HockeyApp)

  • Experience developing C++ cross platform libraries & NDK would be a bonus

  • An evangelist for best practice in design, development, test & Agile development

  • Inquisitive by nature, you’ll be enthusiastic about technology and creative and tenacious in your approach to problem solving.

  • Your communication skills will lead your engagement with the Dyson team and wider tech community.

  • You’ll be able to estimate your work and commit to deliveries within an Agile development framework.

  • You’ll thrive in a fast paced, rapidly changing and delivery focused environment

item.title: Quality Assurance Tester at Rare Recruitment (London, UK)
item.description:
You’ll work within a close-knit team of talented developers, designers and data analysts. Our team has developed an exciting API to integrate with third party database software used by our existing clients. We are also developing an innovative new web application with a mobile app to follow soon.


We are great at rapid application development to the prototype stage. Now we need help to implement and, where possible, automate the testing and QA processes that will help us produce robust, scalable client-ready solutions. We're a strong, nimble, flexible body and your work will be the skeleton that allows us to start running.


If you join Rare you will go to sleep at night with a full heart, and you will wake up each morning and actually feel excited about coming in to work.


We can’t wait to meet you.

item.title: Software Engineering Team: C++, Python at JP Morgan (London, UK)
item.description:
Software Engineering Team: C++, Python


Athena Core


Job Description


Athena is a cross-asset platform transforming technology at JP Morgan. It delivers innovative and efficient applications to a wide range of firm's business, including sales, trading, operations, risk and research. Athena combines the best of open source technologies with innovative components developed internally, which gives a potential candidate ability to contribute to wide range of exciting projects. Our developers enjoy working with front office, quants and other technology teams.


We are looking for hands-on developers, enjoying solving challenging technical problems. Ideal candidate should have strong computer science foundations and be able to work across different platforms and languages.  Candidates should be inspired by working in a collaborative, fast-changing environment with a high degree of code sharing and reuse.   Focus on innovations and quality of solutions should be demonstrated by their contributions in previous professional roles or projects (either academic or personal).


Why Athena Core?



  • Work with some of the best technologists in the world, in a collaborative environment 

  • Build new stuff!  You will be working on greenfield projects

  • Make a difference!  Your code can impact thousands of users

  • Develop code quickly – Athena Core is a true continuous integration environment – your work can go live within hours 

  • Variety – you could be working on a Cloud solution, high performance computing, Electronic Trading & Modelling etc  Athena Core is used across out business 


Depending on background and experience a candidate will be working in one of the following areas:


Applications


Athena applications team provides UI and data transformation components for building business applications. The team works on data visualisation, data manipulation, deal entry, workflow and marketmaking/pricing.


Embedded


Embedded team builds applications, solving specific business problems, using the Athena platform. They are present in FX, Rates, Commodities, Credit, Equities and Investor Services.


Kernel


Kernel develops the backbone of the Athena platform. They work on an in-house NoSQL database, communication frameworks, distributing computations, domain specific languages and developer tooling.


Reactive


Reactive team looks after a proprietary language for electronic trading and real-time market data. The team also works with businesses delivering automated trading solutions.


Infrastructure


The infrastructure team builds scalable, resilient infrastructure solutions to support Athena across businesses.

item.title: DevOps Engineer (London or remote, UK only) at The Scale Factory (London, UK) (allows remote)
item.description: You’ll work on new infrastructure builds, typically on AWS but also on other platforms. You’ll work with a variety of customers, working with their development teams on continuous delivery pipelines, and on making their platforms more robust and performant. You'll also work with other members of the Scale Factory on enhancing our products and tools, including our suite of reusable Puppet manifests, and improving the way we deliver our services - this often involves R&D activities with new tools: most recently we've been looking at Terraform and Docker.

item.title: Web Developer - help build our new in-house team at VInspired (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re creating a new in-house development team in our London office and are looking for a full stack web developer to be one of our first members - ultimately helping us grow the impact we make in the world of youth volunteering.


In this exciting new phase of expansion of our digital service(s) we need your help to evolve and scale our existing web platforms. As a founding dev team member, this is an opportunity to help shape how our team grows, operates and continuously improves.


In the last six months we’ve done plenty of digging into our data and understanding our users, plus developing a plan of new products to test and expand.  We’re now ready to bring in the crack development team to help take this forward.


What you’ll be doing


In the first 3 to 6 months you’ll help the team by:



  • Taking ownership of, and iterating on, the deployment pipeline and processes for the production environments based around our AWS infrastructure

  • Expanding current products like our volunteering opportunity listings and associated api to connect to new products in the upcoming roadmap

  • Progressively evolving/refactoring our Ruby on Rails production code base towards current best practices

  • Helping define our agile/lean development processes and continually improving them working with both technical and non technical stakeholders

  • Getting us ready to power on forward over the following 6 months with a new inspired set of web applications and products

item.title: Systems Engineer (DevOps) at LateRooms.com (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Here at LateRooms.com we’re dedicated to delivering value fast and frequently, to support this we have a wide range of technologies in use across a large estate. Our Infrastructure and Operations team looks after the tools and platforms our Product Teams use to deliver multiple releases a day, and we’re looking for our next addition to help shape our future…


Working in autonomous product teams with a collaborative, quality engineering culture, we work with some of best technology in the world to make it happen for our customers.


We’re a problem solving bunch, so we’re looking for somebody who can make decisions and can tackle an issue, seeing it through from start to finish. 


How you can shape our future…


As a LateRooms.com Systems Engineer you’ll have a real passion for technology. You’ll love digging around in systems and getting to the bottom of a problem. We’re embarking on a project to change how we manage, monitor and control our estate, and this is a brilliant opportunity to be a part of that.  We’re looking for someone who is at home with automation, monitoring and Linux - knowing a bit of windows, networking and security would be great too!


And how we can shape yours…



  • You’ll collaborate with our Developers and QAs to get to the bottom of problems

  • Your team will have the flexibility to decide how they should work, and given the space to play around with tech to find the best solutions

  • You’ll be challenged with problems and be considered an expert in your field

  • With opportunities for development everywhere, you are in control of your own career

item.title: Full Stack Architect at Dixons Carphone (London, UK)
item.description:
Full Stack Architect (JavaScript/NodeJS Architecture)


The Full Stack Architect (JavaScript/NodeJS Architecture) role is accountable for the Technology Architecture of one or more Products in the CWS Product set ensuring it meets both functional and non-functional requirements. Products support all worldwide, internal and external clients. The role ensures CWS have Product Blueprints and technical pre-sales documentation for a set of CWS products.


You will:


Product Ownership



  • Produces Product Blueprints for CWS products including the Application Architecture, Data Architecture, Integration Architecture, Deployment Architecture, Security and Operations Architecture for that product.

  • Provides High Level Estimates - a break down by cost and man-days for all stages of the project life cycle including a listing of assumptions, risks and issues related to the estimate.

  • Develops appropriate Architecture patterns, standards and guidelines for CWS Products.

  • Validates technical solutions against the Enterprise Architecture principles.

  • Maintains Requirements Traceability through the Product/delivery lifecycle.

  • Peer reviews estimates, Options Papers, Blueprints and Strategies produced by other Architects.

  • Provides technical guidance, quality assurance and architecture governance during the SDLC.

  • Drives improvements for the assigned product/technology area by undertaking reviews and generating a mix of strategic and tactical initiatives.

  • Provides subject matter expertise technical guidance on domains/products to the rest of CWS.

  • Provides technical leadership for a set of technologies/CWS Products.

  • Maintains excellent working relationship with major technology and consultancy suppliers.
