item.title: Fast-growing Automotive Co seeks Full-stack PHP engineer at UK Vehicle Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
We’ve outgrown our current platform so we’re busy building the next generation, using a best-practice approach. We’re looking for full-stack PHP developer to join our front-end team to work directly for our front-end lead.


Ideally you'll have 3+ years of experience working in PHP as well in high-level front-end development in html, css and javascript.


What we’re offering



  • A competitive package in the range of £42-52k depending on experience.

  • Optional equity in the business via our employee share ownership scheme

  • The opportunity to work with a bunch of clever data scientists and engineers in a fun, flexible working environment

  • The ability to sculpt a product that’s going to disrupt a multi £Bn marketplace

item.title: OpenStack Solution Architect at Ammeon Ltd (Reading, UK) (allows remote)
item.description: We’re a services and solutions partner that helps organisations grasp the opportunities presented by emerging technologies and maintain that leading edge. Our end-to-end set of consulting, learning and technology services and solutions enables our customers to derive value from DevOps, Cloud and related fields. We believe the future should never leave our customers behind and we are committed to realising this vision. Are you up to the challenge?

item.title: Experienced PHP Developer at Perfect Portal (Southport, UK)
item.description:
Do you have a passion for creating software that impresses users beyond their expectations?


Join a dynamic team who does just that!


You will create an incredible user experience using a selection of components.


This product has been developed from the ground up and you have a chance to put your signature on it.


We are expanding our development team and are looking for a passionate and creative PHP Developer to join our existing development team in Southport.


You will be required to make changes to our platform within our development environment as per the team’s development timeline. 


About You


You are proud of products or features you have implemented. You love solving problems. You are a fast learner and have a good attention to detail. You communicate well with your peers and people outside your team.


You code blindfolded in at least one imperative programming language (PHP, OOP PHP, jQuery, PHP MySQLi)


You love coding and understand why you are doing it. You can make sensible and practical choices amongst multiple design solutions.

item.title: Backend Engineer join award-winning developers at One iota (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
One iota helps top-tier retailers provide a seamless experience for their customers across every channel; desktop, mobile, native, and in-store. We're looking for a back end engineer to work on our MESH platform, the centre of our business. Product catalogues, carts, customers, orders and payments are all handled through our RESTful API. We processed over £150M through the platform in 2015, and that's constantly growing.


We have an energetic and inventive team. We were recently runners up at the Retail Week Buzz Hackathon.  MESH won 'Best eCommerce Platform' at this year's Northern eCommerce Awards.


What You'll Do


Working in the MESH Platform Team, you'll take on a varied range of work. You'll build new functionality into the platform, improve resilience, and integrate with client or third-party systems.


Things you could be doing include:



  • Continuing to break down our monolith into microservices

  • Increasing our use of DynamoDB

  • Improving capacity and resilience for our biggest peak season yet

  • A whole host of cross-channel and customer-focused features.


In addition to the technical stuff, you'll collaborate with our clients, and their other vendors, to work out solutions, find the quick wins, and diagnose problems. That's where you can put your tact, diplomacy, and sense of humour to work.


Culture


One iota is a pretty friendly place to work. Our developers are given a good degree of autonomy to design and develop solutions. Teams collaborate and share ideas freely, and we keep hierarchy and bureaucracy to a minimum. We run two hackathons each year, where everyone gets to invent, experiment, and scratch their own itch.


Our offices in the North West get catered lunches on 'Fat Friday', while Pembroke Dock has a constant supply of great fresh coffee from a local roaster. We also have a couple of big social events each year, where the whole company gets together.

item.title: Principal Development Technologist at ThoughtWorks (London, UK)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We’re a diverse community of bright and passionate individuals striving to have a positive impact on the world. We’re dedicated to the art of software delivery, by keeping it lightweight, agile and open-source. Our clients are organisations with ambitious missions, where we deliver complex enterprise systems to help them solve their toughest business problems. As a Principal Consultant at ThoughtWorks you have total responsibility for technical delivery on a client engagement so you are likely to have extensive experience.



Here’s what you will bring:



  • Expertise in multiple technologies (including Java, .Net, Ruby/Ruby on Rails/Scala/Clojure etc) across software engineering, security, data interchange, data management etc.

  • Experience as an architect or leading and inspiring software development teams

  • Solid understanding of the practical application of agile development methods and leading software development teams in an Agile/Lean/Continuous Delivery environment

  • Significant software development and infrastructure architecture experience in designing and architecting enterprise web applications

  • Understanding of the issues businesses face and experience working with them to create robust, scalable, elegant, flexible and relevant software solutions that truly transform industries

  • Experience working directly with senior IT groups in an advisory role

  • Experience working with CTO/COO to create technical strategies

  • Ideally experience contributing to the professional community as a speaker, author or online contributor



As a Principal Consultant, here’s what you can do at ThoughtWorks: 



  • Disrupt, Lead and Innovate.

  • Take the needs and challenges of a client and formulate the technical roadmap and technology solution that will support their business strategies and goals.

  • Provide Technical leadership across all areas of the enterprise, to ensure delivery of exceptional technical solutions

  • Formulate and articulate the technical and political implication of real world solutions

  • Orchestrate the management of technology scope and risks

  • Mentor on approach and execution of solutions, coach on technologies and establishing a team wide comprehension of solution capabilities and direction

  • Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met

  • Drive ThoughtWorks’ Thought-Leadership on engineering and architectural practices and standards

  • Be an inspiration of innovation to the client

  • Become a trusted and valued partner of the client CIO/CTO and team

  • Exploit opportunities for networking and relationship building that arise out of delivery activities

  • Creates and supports sales activities

  • Maintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products

  • Code! We don’t subscribe to the “post-technical” ivory tower leadership style



We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so you’ll be flexible about travel. 



We offer amazing benefits from the day you start including private medical insurance, travel insurance, income protection, critical illness, life assurance, pension scheme, child care vouchers, personal development budget, 25 days holiday and a ride2work scheme.

item.title: Do you enjoy finding new ways to solve old problems? at Aol (London, UK)
item.description:
Be On, a division of AOL Platforms is a truly global branded entertainment platform that brings together content production, syndication and real-time insights to provide advertisers with an end-to-end platform for long-form branded content across all devices. Be On creates and syndicates content across 16 key verticals to 40,000 publishers in over 90 countries around the world. It has offices in the UK, US, France, Germany, Spain, Italy, The Netherlands, Denmark, Sweden, and Norway.


This position is for a Senior developer who wants to deliver quality solutions as a team. More specifically, to deliver discrete components of business value and support our internal and external applications.


The candidate must demonstrate a strong understanding of Java, Spring Framework and JavaScript.


Key Role Accountabilities


Take an active role in defining the shape of the future of online video


Develop high scale and performance applications with service oriented architecture


Build new and engaging web products


Work in agile development methodology


Design and develop using cutting edge technologies


High potential to grow and evolve in an international company

item.title: iOS Mobile Software Engineer at MyDrive (London, UK)
item.description:
MyDrive is going places fast. We are a world leader in using data to build understanding of customer behaviour through telematics. We employ the latest thinking in data analytics and software engineering across a variety of sectors including motor, home and health automation. We are looking for a talented iOS Mobile Software Engineer with five years of intensive software engineering experience in a start-up business and/or a commercial environment to join our team. We are a global player and have an truly international team to reflect this.


We need an iOS Mobile Software Engineer to produce iOS software app development focused on using sensor data (GPS, accelerometer, etc) who can demonstrate commercial experience in app building and architecture.


In this role, you will plan and work with design houses, app agencies, and be fully integrated with the DevOps team. Delivering great engineering, issue analysis and resolution, which is well tested and delivered into a CI environment is core to the role.


You will evaluate the iOS connected car ecosystems now and in the future so we can take advantage of new technology as well as be ready for change so we maintain our clients’ confidence. Part of this will be to maintain and develop the Mobile SDK used to collect and manage data within our range of customer Apps and communicate with our RESTful API. App building, using the SDK.


You will also implement the benefits of automated testing, evaluate software performance for optimisation and maintain test coverage and write automated tests for new production software, including continuous integration and delivery.


We are looking for engineers who gather and maintain lines of communications with different project stakeholders and research and recommend new technologies to develop the MyDrive Telematics offering worldwide.


You will need to work closely with other software developers, operations engineers, and data scientists to design and implement mobile software to interoperate with our web services and systems including coding.


Keeping MyDrive up to date with the state of the art in mobile software development, including new features, functionality, security, and performance is both vital and fun. Each engineer contributes to Hack Days and we take personal development very seriously.


Ideally you will also have superb customer service skills and be able to support the service and undertake remedial fixing if needed.

item.title: Full Stack & Mobile Developer at Nostrum (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Estamos buscando para nuestro cliente, empresa en fase de desarrollo y expansión internacional, un iOS, Android & .NET Developer


Con reporte director al CTO, el candidato desarrollará sus funciones trabajando con metodologías ágiles dentro de un entorno que favorece las tecnologías punteras.


Funciones:


Diseño y desarrollo de proyectos (app, web..)
Digitalización de planta de producción - iIoT
Gestión del equipo de desarrolladores, especialistas en .net, web, Android, iOS.
Colaboración en la definición y diseño de arquitectura para las diferentes Apps públicas y corporativas.
Promover la mejora continua de los procesos, técnicas y herramientas empleadas

item.title: Siri Operations Engineer at Apple (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for an individual to be a part of a dynamic global operations team focused on automation development to support the highly successful Siri application. This position would support our engineering teams, runtime SRE, as well as our High Performance Compute engineering teams to ensure maximum systems reliability across the Siri stack. This position is specifically for someone experienced in building Operation tools for data analysis, automation, and monitoring coupled with a strong background in systems administration. This fast paced position offers potential job growth opportunities as you continue to develop operational tools and enhance process. You will be able to work with next generation technologies at a very large scale where everyone on this global team is a contributor and your enthusiasm and ideas are welcome.


Description


The Siri Operations Engineering team is focussed on the delivery of high quality code and application support. This position includes responsibilities for 3 core areas of Siri Operations (Production SRE, Dev Ops and Build, and HPC). The Production SRE duties revolve around supporting the massively scaled production footprint of Siri. For the Build/DevOps role, you will assist in automation tooling and supporting Siri developers to ensure changes are making their way to the various environments we support. The HPC area will involve debugging complex issues on our large grid and our Hadoop cluster which is used for analysis and enhancing the Siri application.


You should be confident in the following areas:


* Extensive communication and coordination between multiple engineering teams gathering input to design and build operations and automation tools


* Multi-task multiple development projects and manage time accordingly - Develop automation solutions for repetitive operational tasks/processes


* Support the build process for local engineering teams - Support and trouble shoot issues for data science teams using High Performance Compute resources


* Design and develop dashboard and data visualizations for both engineering and management - Identify deficiencies in process/tools/etc. to improve performance and resolution time - 24x7 on-call rotation for issue escalations

item.title: Senior Software Engineer for Medical Robotics at Cambridge Medical Robotics (Cambridge, UK)
item.description: CMR is seeking a highly skilled, enthusiastic, curious, energetic and proactive senior engineer to join our software team, to plan, coordinate, and develop new robotic technology for use in minimally invasive surgery. Our ideal candidate would be capable of coupling rigorous attention to detail with creative approach to problem solving and can work as a lead member of a multi-disciplinary team.

item.title: Senior Python Developer at PRIX (London, UK)
item.description:
We're a startup. For us this means the shared freedom to work on what we want, how we want. We have a strict "no-assholes"-policy but other than that pretty much anything goes as long as we're working in the same direction, having the impact we want (high) and are having fun.


Also, we do the right thing by our team. Which means that we have a health-plan, a good pension-plan, large personal hardware budget and we don't mind flexible hours or remote working.


6 people right now. 3 well-published academics in the US and 3 people here in London.


This role will involve:


- Define the company strategy & product roadmap (we all do this together)
- Develop and optimise our machine learning algorithms and their integration
- Build development, QA and production environments using continuous integration
- Identify defects in the design and implementation, and provide solutions
- Share with the community and generally progress the cause of good tech

item.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at Apple (Uxbridge, UK)
item.description:
At Apple, we rely on our employees’ diverse backgrounds and perspectives to foster innovation through great ideas to surprise and delight our customers. And great ideas can come from anywhere. Will that next great idea come from you? At the Apple Online Store (AOS), its Engineering team is responsible for the global eCommerce platform that serves millions of customers around the world. We are a team highly skilled Software Engineering Managers, Engineers, Product Owners, Analysts and Project Managers based in Cupertino, London and Singapore. The Apple Online Store team in London is looking for an exceptional Full Stack Senior Software Engineer with a proven track record of delivering complex and highly scalable software applications. You will help create pixel-perfect, robust and accessible user interfaces wielding the latest frameworks and tools in JavaScript, CSS, and web templates. You will also develop and maintain a number of Java server-side services and applications that support Apple’s Online Store. As well as writing great code to a high standard of quality, and helping ensure successful delivery of projects, you will need to form strong working relationships with key technical and business stakeholders.


Description


The ideal candidate for this role will demonstrate the following characteristics and experience:


* Conscientious forward thinking individual, ready to aim for and define future visions, rather than simply maintaining status quo.


* An in-depth understanding of Internet technologies and architectures and general application development.


* Flexible attitude and willing to take on new challenges – someone who is dynamic, high-energy and works with a sense of urgency.


* Must possess aptitude for grasping new technical concepts.


* Strong understanding of the full life-cycle development process. Must understand both agile and traditional development techniques, and be eager to influence the processes adopted by the team in delivering projects.


* Adhere and contribute towards architectural & development techniques and standards.

item.title: DevOps Developer and Support Engineer at VPT (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re calling on you to join VPT as a DevOps and Support Engineer. We are a long-standing innovative Big Data consultancy, MicroStrategy partner and provider of multi-terabyte Analytics-as-a-Service solutions. We are in the UK and based in Chiswick, West London and you will be working with some of the most experienced big-data and data warehousing solution experts in the world, so expect to use and grow your technical skills with demands to ‘think outside of the box’.


Working with a full Vagrant / Docker / Web / MPP Analytics stack, your work can involve everything from front-end, back-end, development, deployment, data engineering, support and integration work.


As a DevOps and Support Engineer your role will cover everything from technical support and DevOps through to development and investigating new tech. You will be responsible for deployments into various environments as well as troubleshooting issues with the environment. This is a crucial role that will see you work within an experienced team within a challenging environment whilst embracing new technology and approaches.


Proof of the right to work within the UK will be required.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Developer (100% remote, but UK based) £40-45,000 at Data Interface (Hemel Hempstead, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
Lead the evolution of a distinctive and unique range of services for the Financial Services sector.


Work from home (must be UK based and willing to occasionally travel to our offices in Hemel Hempstead) while being part of a close and informal team who are developing and delivering innovative solutions.


You will be the lead developer using your expertise across the full stack on new and existing web sites and other software systems.  You will work closely with the product owner, a designer and our industry analysts to deliver new services and improve existing functionality.  You will take responsibility for deploying and managing our live websites and servers.  You will use your experience to develop clean well-crafted code.

item.description:
Do you want cutting edge technology at your fingertips!


As leaders in retail gaming with over 130 clubs nationwide, we're continually innovating and using the latest technology to stay ahead of the competition.


We care about giving our customers the best experience possible and understand the important role technology plays, whether that's delivering new products direct to our customers or developing applications for our staff to use.


We are continually looking for the very best C# developers to join our teams and the best managers to lead them.


We are looking for the right person to join our team and help continue the success of one or more of our products:

· Customer-facing multi-tasking touchpad system running WPF

· Staff-facing mobile apps built with Xamarin

item.title: Senior .NET Backend Developer at Yellow Line Parking (London, UK)
item.description:
AppyParking is the UK’s most disruptive mapping & navigation start up developing a range of products for use in Connected City and autonomous vehicles. We are partnered with many leading companies including Google, Vodafone, Ford, and Visa, and are a graduate of the prestigious Microsoft Ventures accelerator programme in 2014. 


Awards; People’s Choice Winners - Virgin Business Pitch to Rich 2015, 2nd Place Start Up Awards 2015, Evening Standard Top 30 Apps 2015, shortlisted Best 2014 App - STUFF magazine, Grand Prize Winner - Traffic Tamer Challenge 2014 - Ford.


Our mission is to become recognised as the world’s leading provider of parking data and we’re now looking for accomplished Senior .NET Backend Developers to help us accomplish that goal. Having raised £1.2m in seed funding last year with investors including Aviva Ventures and Premier Parking, we already have a steady data licensing revenue stream, and launched one new revenue generating product in January. We are on target to launch another revenue generating product in July. We anticipate opening a Series A round in the autumn on the back of these successful product launches.


We are a small company of 12 people all highly committed to disrupting the parking landscape (we’ve just been voted 15th most disruptive start-up in the world http://www.disrupt100.com/#disrupt100). We have a great office culture where everyone is included in planning sessions, company performance and enjoying everything London has to offer!

item.title: Java Full Stack Developer at Cognizant Technology Solutions UK Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
We are currently embarking on a new exciting project with a client of ours – an international Publishing company based in Central London and we are looking to grow the Java Development Team.


The platform you will help integrate will help medical researchers around the world collaborate and share knowledge better and will have a very positive impact on the medical research field.


The company prides itself on a very open, collaborative culture and they work with a number of open-source frameworks.


You will be liaising with business stakeholders across a number of geographies in Europe so it is imperative that you are a confident communicator to understand business requirements and communicate change.


We offer permanent employment up to Manager grade within a global Consultancy which has been a growth leader in its industry for a number of years. We pride ourselves on providing competitive compensation as well as unparalleled career progression opportunities across the globe.

item.title: Front-End JS/React/CSS Web Developer at HyperDigital (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced front-end web developer to join the team full time in our Edinburgh office working on some very novel web and mobile projects we have been quietly prototyping.


The essence of our work is in creating original approaches to explore and interact with information that reveal new insights and experiences of value.


You should should be a creative front-end developer who is as comfortable working on the visual implementation as the code behind it. You should have 4+ years of experience, an eye for design and enjoy spending most of your development time sculpting CSS and Javascript in a way that pushes forwards the interactive and aesthetic boundaries in the browser.

item.title: Full-stack developer with Scala knowledge to join a funded Big Data start-up at Jumbo Data System (London, UK)
item.description:
Full-stack developer with some Scala knowledge wanted to join small development team in a funded Big Data start-up company in Central London (Smithfields/Farringdon) – Real time search, highly distributed parallel processing, big data storage, machine learning (Elastic, Cassandra, Spark).


fortytwodata is looking for an all-round developer to join our talented development team in central London.  You would ideally have some development experience in Scala but what’s critical is an ability to own and solve problems end-to-end in creative and agile ways.  Knowing how to research and use OSS, how to approach a problem, how to fit work into an existing product and how to design your solution to fit the deadline are more important to us than knowing the exact intricacies of Scala.  If you can show evidence of an exceptional software development background we’d love to talk.


Our stack is Elastic, Cassandra, Spark, Kafka, Play/Angular with Docker/Mesos/Marathon for deployment.  You’ll get the opportunity to work on leading edge technology, trying out ideas and new ways to solve problems before getting them into production environments.


You


We need someone who can work in a start-up environment and is prepared to get stuck in as part of team and move the team and product forward rapidly.


You’ll want to be able to own problems from start to finish and have the ability to create technically excellent solutions in a pragmatic way.  You’ll have a desire to deliver and an ability to quickly research and absorb new information.  You’ll be able to work on several tasks at the same time and want to improve the team’s capabilities through approaches and tools.  You’ll be confident to suggest approaches, but flexible enough to understand that sometimes pragmatism must win the day.


You will primarily be a developer who knows how to use technology to solve problems. We would rather have an excellent developer with limited Scala knowledge than a Scala expert with limited real-world development knowledge.  You will want to solve the hard problems and have an opportunity to really show people how good you can be.  If you want to turn the handle on easy problems then swipe left, you’re not for us.


You’ll understand the challenges inherent in large-scale real-time distributed systems and be able to design solutions that are fit for purpose in this type of environment as well as an understanding of the challenges and opportunities of “Big Data”.  This includes knowing how to select the right technical solution for a problem without getting drawn into hype!


Salary based on experience and capability.


No recruitment agencies please.

item.title: Salesforce Developer at OVO Energy Ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
The Salesforce Team is key team in the Technology department of OVO. You’ll work within a multi-skilled agile team to deliver Salesforce projects that meet the needs of those who will use it.


What will I be doing?


Develop business critical Salesforce applications for key business processes within OVO.  You will also develop integrations with other OVO systems and 3rd party systems required deliver an amazing experience for our customers and employees.  


You will manage Salesforce developers using Agile development processes.  You will also work closely alongside our trusted partners who help us deliver high quality software solutions in the Salesforce cloud.



  • Developing APEX code as per OVO development standards as part of OVO’s agile development practices

  • Work with closely with other development teams to build or troubleshoot any integrations with other core systems

  • Gauge the impact to production system when implementing a major, minor existing users on how to optimise Salesforce applications

item.title: Senior Consultant Software Developer at ThoughtWorks (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for passionate developers & engineers who care about software excellence. We want people who are aware of latest trends and know how to adopt the most appropriate technology. We're looking for people who are strong advocates for the best engineering practices and love learning new skills.

As a Senior Developer at ThoughtWorks, here's what you can do:
Work on large-scale, custom-designed, multi-tier, enterprise-level software development projects using languages such as Java, Ruby and/or .NET, Scala, Clojure, Mobile and Python (to name a few)
Help the team to champion software quality and engender technical vision and ensuring clients are satisfied
Champion agile best practices and Continuous Delivery
Be an ambassador of ThoughtWorks and safeguard our reputation
Build strong relationships with business people
Learn something new everyday
Facilitate problem solving and work with a team to make them reality.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchical, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title
Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan
Help to grow the next generation of developers and have a positive impact on the industry
Here’s what you’ll bring:
Hands-on development and delivery experience with a broad mix of languages and technologies
Passion for software engineering and craftsman-like coding prowess
Great OO skills, including strong design patterns knowledge and enterprise integration
Experience working with Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approaches and best practices, such as Continuous Integration, TDD, BDD, Infrastructure as Code etc,
Ability to work in a variety of client settings and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Knowledge of software best practices like Refactoring, Clean Code, Domain Driven Design, Encapsulation etc  
Experience of working in a forward thinking, OSS-centric environment
We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so ideally you’ll be flexible about travel.

We are looking for passionate developers & engineers who care about software excellence. We want people who are aware of latest trends and know how to adopt the most appropriate technology. We're looking for people who are strong advocates for the best engineering practices and love learning new skills. Our current positions require significant experience and the ability to shape a new client engagement, coach other team members, provide technical leadership and be comfortable leading a development team on client site - but our flat organisational structure means you'll be someone who is unconcerned with titles and hierarchy. item.title: Software developer (Ruby on Rails) at Eagle Genomics Ltd (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
Who we are looking for


We’re looking for a software developer who has experience in developing web applications. The application stack is built in Ruby, using Rails, and Javascript of course. This means that previous Ruby skills are a distinct advantage, but they're not essential if you're a bright, experienced developer. We encourage all development to be test-driven, and have regular code reviews and use automated code quality metrics.


We’re big fans of automation, so any experience of that sort of automated software or infrastructure deployment would be of use. Although this is primarily a Ruby development role, you’ll need to be competent in Javascript; any experience of frameworks like React.js is a bonus. You’ll be comfortable working with the command-line on Unix-like systems.


We make extensive use of cloud services, particularly Heroku and AWS, so familiarity with that would be a bonus, although we'll get you up to speed quickly if not.


We like to be up to date, so you will be learning new skills and technologies often.


Ideally we’d like to see examples of web applications on which you’ve worked, and links to Github repositories are most welcome, however we understand that not everyone will be in a position to make these available.


We pride ourselves on working closely with customers, in iterations, so you will be part of a small but very focussed team from day one.


Our customers are mainly in the healthcare, pharmaceutical and consumer goods industries, so you'll be working in some of the most interesting and fastest-moving industries that there are.



What you would have done this month



  • Written code! Ruby, Javascript and more

  • Developed integration and unit tests, and added them to our test suite

  • Worked on two sprints, including planning and reviewing

  • Presented the latest iteration of the application to the product owner

  • Worked with our in-house scientists to get their advice

  • Read lots of Ruby and software-related blogs, watched podcasts and videos to keep up with the latest developments in the field

  • Coached our bioinformatics consultants on the latest techniques in software development


What you may do in future



  • Engage with outside experts (e.g. UI designers, security consultants) to further improve the product

  • Attend training courses or conferences for your technical and professional development

  • Visit customer sites to discuss requirements, present our software, and gather feedback

Part of our Engineering Support function, our Automation and Monitoring Engineers work to maintain and improve our Management Platform and component business critical tools, notably monitoring, automation and data warehousing.



  • Develop and maintain UKCloud’s monitoring and management platforms

  • Provide 3rd Line Support for technical queries and application issues raised by internal and external Customers.  Resolve these queries promptly and in line with support targets

  • Provide Subject Matter Expert level support to internal and external customers, including leadership of technical investigations

item.title: Lead Python Developer (VP) at JP Morgan (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
Lead Python Developer (VP)


Glasgow Technology Centre


Skilled Python developers and technical leaders are required for the Investor Services business. You will initially help to set direction for and to lead the build-out of Athena-based support for OTC derivatives processing within the Third-Party Derivatives Processing group.


Athena is J.P. Morgan's cross-market risk management and trading system, used across multiple trading businesses. Athena includes a globally replicated object-oriented database, a powerful dependency graph and a fully integrated stack across pricing, risk and trading tools.


Clients of the Investor Services business trade financial products across many different asset classes, including equities, credit, interest rates, commodities, fixed income and FX. The Athena build-out in Investor Services is unique in that it will support all these different asset classes, so the team will gain exposure to an exceptionally broad range of financial products.


We are looking for experienced developers with a range of skills, including talented Python developers keen to become expert in cutting-edge financial systems, and experienced Athena developers with a strong track record of delivery.


Candidates should have very good knowledge of Python, be committed to producing high-quality, robust software through pervasive testing, and be familiar with contemporary software development methodology.

item.title: Cloud Development Engineer - JPMorgan - Market Leading Benefits Package at JP Morgan (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
Cloud Development


Cloud Development is a small team responsible for architecting, designing and implementing a new, cutting edge, cloud platform for transforming our business applications into scalable, elastic systems that can be instantiated on demand. The team is comprised of three pillars: Client Engagement, Core Engineering and Service Reliability Engineering (SRE).


Job Summary


Service Reliability Engineer is a highly technical role on the SRE team, responsible for operating the cloud platform and developing and implementing the operational tools and processes necessary to improve reliability. Cloud operations include deployment and maintenance of the platform infrastructure as well as diagnosis and remediation of support issues, or escalation to Core Engineering or Client Engagement where appropriate. The Service Reliability Engineer is expected to drive technical innovation and efficiency in infrastructure operations via hands on development of tools and automation and by providing feedback and design contributions to the portfolio of cloud products.


Core Responsibilities



  • Development and operation of support tools for control, instrumentation and investigation.

  • Development and execution of tests to measure and ensure levels of availability and performance.

  • Development and documentation of mechanisms for deployment, monitoring and maintenance.

  • Diagnosis and remediation of service level issues and engagement with internal support and engineering teams and third party suppliers as required.

  • Deployment, upgrade, configuration and maintenance of the cloud platform.

  • Tracking and management of platform usage and capacity.

item.title: Application Developer - Risk & Finance Technology - Market Leading Benefits Pack at JP Morgan (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
About Us


Risk and Finance Technology (RFT) builds and supports the firm's financial infrastructure to ensure Finance professionals have access to the tools and information necessary to deliver drive success. In partnership with Global Finance Operations, Corporate Systems Infrastructure (CSi), and others, we deliver solutions that meet the requirements of our key clients. RFT provides technology support for general ledger, profitability, cost allocations, treasury, accounts payable, reference data, project accounting and fixed assets, and reporting tools and the Risk applications.


As part of Risk and Finance Technology we help develop the firm’s platforms and reporting solutions for calculating and reporting on the risk, capital and finance calculations across the whole of JP Morgan.  This role is for the Wholesale Loan and Forecasting Program, an exciting multi-year initiative to design, build and implement a suite of calculators for loans at JP Morgan.  The models and integrated platform will support loan forecasts, analysis and sensitivity calculations for the providing a highly flexible infrastructure to implement and execute various analytics models. It will also provide distributed calculation and centralized consolidation, aggregation and further calculations required for reporting requirements and will involve working closely with a Quantitative research team in developing these models.


We are hiring for an Applications Developer who will be working with current and next-gen data technologies. This individual will be providing analytic development in Python and/or SLANG in a risk modelling environment.

item.title: Frontend Software Engineer at Comparethemarket.com (London, UK)
item.description:
An excellent opportunity has arisen to join comparethemarket.com as a Frontend Software Engineer.  The successful candidate will develop first class web solutions in an agile product team under the leadership of the Lead Frontend Software Engineer and Project Manager, guided by the business Product Owners. Following the phenomenal success of the meerkat campaign, comparethemarket.com has grown rapidly over the last three years to become one of the UK's leading price comparison websites. As well as insurance, comparethemarket.com also offers comparisons on credit cards, loans, mortgages, savings accounts and utilities.  The pace is fast but fun and we guarantee that no two days will be the same!


What is the role of a Software Engineer – Frontend at comparethemarket.com?


Working in agile teams you will be developing and supporting enterprise scale applications for the web.  You will be delivering high quality solutions whilst learning from and supporting other members of your team. As part of a product team you will liaise with the business and contribute to the design, specification and analysis of systems.


What does the Software Engineer do on a day to day basis?


Your day starts with your stand up where you and your team look at yesterday’s achievements and discuss what will be done today.  You will take user stories and work up elegant solutions, often pairing with colleagues to produce the highest quality code.  You will be crucial to the success of your team because of your ideas as well as your code and you’ll be contributing to the evolving culture of innovation, enthusiasm and passion that exists at comparethemarket.com

item.title: Software Engineer (Java) Equity Global Risk and Scenarios at Morgan Stanley (London, UK)
item.description:
The Team:


We are looking for a middle tier developer to join the Equity Global Risk and Scenarios (GRS) UI team. The GRS team is responsible for aggregating end of day risk and calculating overnight risk for the front office, including: traders, risk managers and Strats. The processing is performed for all regions running 24/5. The calculation include various Scenarios, PnL Attribution/PnL Explain, and bucketed Greeks that are too compute intensive for real-time risk, as well as Mark Review analysis. The positions that flow through this infrastructure range from Exotic Equity derivatives to vanilla Equity options, Equity Swaps and plain stocks, covering roughly a million positions globally. The results, which are mission critical to the firm, are delivered on a stringent schedule as very senior traders and risk managers use them for trading decisions in each location and to manage risk globally.


The middle tier work we are hiring for is a new effort that is to support an interactive GUI for front office heads that seeks to summarize vast amounts of data to a form and presentation style that would allow these senior people to quickly identify areas of risk that need attention. This includes end of day risk as well as ticking intraday risk and market data. The middle tier is a the critical component of this effort as it will in essence be the front end application, gluing together data from many sources for a very performant presentation to the GUI. This is a very high profile application with a great deal of visibility to the front office.


The Role:



  • You will work as a server-side Java developer and will be responsible for developing the middle tier, which provides data to the GUI.

  • You will be required to solve business problems with the latest suite of java based tools and technologies.

  • You will support and lead different phases of the product lifecycle including analysis, development and testing.

  • Your role will involve constant interaction with front office business users, analysing and gathering requirements.

  • You will deliver high quality code that is comprehensively tested to secure business signoff and finally the deployment of your changes

  • You will be a technically proficient and enthusiastic developer, with a desire to work on the full stack in order to help engineer new and existing components.

item.title: (Senior) Software Developer (Node.js/ JVM) at Mergermarket Group (London, UK)
item.description:
We need Senior Software Developers to work with our Product Development Team in our modern London office, situated near St Paul’s in the heart of Tech City. The role will be working on various initiatives, using cutting-edge technologies, but whilst working within a relaxed Agile/ Lean environment and as part of a highly collaborative team.


At Mergermarket, we 



  • have daily standups and regular retrospective

  • allow 10% time to focus on innovation and professional development

  • work in a pair most of the time

  •  work together with the BA/QA/PO/UX to cover all aspects of a user story

  • promote continued learning: lunch & learns, lightning talks etc

  • openly give and receive honest, constructive feedback

  • focus on the value we can bring with innovation and new technology


Do You



  • have a pragmatic appreciation for the principles of good software development?

  • love writing clean, efficient, readable code?

  • have a demonstrable track record of building mission-critical web applications?

  • communicate effectively with your peers?

  • thrive when working together in a closely-knit team?  


We're currently working with these technologies:



  •     Node.js

  •     React

  •     RabbitMQ

  •     MongoDB

  •     MS SQL Server

  •     Elasticsearch

  •     Docker

  •     AWS


 You'll be responsible for:



  • writing high-quality code, backed by the right tests

  • developing services (HTTP or message-based) using a microservice architecture

  • deploying, running and supporting the services you build

  • mentoring, coaching and motivating the rest of the team

  • championing performance, reliability and security of your services

  • understanding and contributing to the overall tech architecture

item.title: Full Stack Developer (TDD, agile, ANY object oriented language) at Capital on Tap (London, UK)
item.description:
We are lean, innovative and bursting at the seams with people passionate about finance and technology. Our rapid pace of growth means we are seeking enthusiastic individuals to join us in a variety of roles. In return we can offer you the opportunity to work somewhere that you can instantly see your contribution to a company's success!


Far from a beige cube farm, our headquarters near Portobello Road is designed to support a dynamic, relaxed and fun culture complete with pool table, beer tap and 2 friendly office dogs.


About You: 



  • You care about software. You have a passion for what you do which you convey through your actions.

  • You have an eye for software design and draw from your experience, reading and experimentation.

  • For you it’s more than just a job.


Values:


Among other things, we're strong advocates of TDD. We would love to hear how you have used TDD on a recent project and what problems you have faced. We also utilise lean methods, pair programming, refactoring, continuous delivery and deeply embedded, and are constantly striving to improve the way we work.


The Role:


Our teams are cross-functional, self-organising and highly autonomous. No QAs, BAs, project managers, or middle-management here! You'll be working directly with product owners and stakeholders in a highly collaborative manner. The day to day tasks vary a great deal and can involve all aspects of the stack.


Some highlights include:



  • 4 hrs per work on deliberate learning (pluralsight, stackoverflow, or discussing practices and technologies)

  • “Learn with Liam” (presentations to the team on new technologies, practices or insights)

  • Mentoring, studies, 1-2-1s and retrospectives, always striving to make the internet a better place

item.title: SQL-Java Developer at JP Morgan (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
Description


JP Morgan – GWM – SQL Application Developer



Purpose of role


To assist with the maintenance, support and development of our existing Portfolio Performance calculations and reporting for International Private Bank. We are also building a strategic, AM wide application to replace these systems over the coming years. This work started in 2014. It is important to understand that there will likely be a rotation between both roles as part of an inclusive culture to ensure everyone is involved on both initiatives.



What sets this role apart?


The opportunity to help design and build a new, strategic, state-of-the-art application for Asset Management. This role has been referred to as a “career-changing event”. It is listed in the top thirty “2015 AM Global Technology Top Milestones” so there is visibility on this project at a senior management level. Therefore we are looking for smart individuals that are prepared to hit the ground running. We are implementing agile software development methodologies (Extreme Programming, Scrum, etc.) and are looking for developers excited about working in a progressive development environment. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a team of highly talented engineers in a fun and challenging environment where learning and growth is supported and actively encouraged.

item.title: Full-stack Developer at Brand42 (London, UK)
item.description:
Brand42 is an award-winning agency with a diverse range of clients including the BBCW, VisitBritain, MailOnline, Bayer, CNN, Johnnie Walker and Smirnoff.


We’re looking for an ambitious and experienced Mid-Senior Full Stack Developer to join our development team in our London studio. Being part of a collaborative creative agency you will be involved in all stages of a project and have the opportunity to contribute throughout and help us make the right technical decisions. We're technology agnostic so we're not tied to a particular stack though we love doing things the right way, and are always looking for new technologies which can deliver outstanding future proof results for our clients.


You'll be responsible for delivering exceptional coded websites, campaign sites and web apps for our clients. We’re looking for a developer who's able to learn new technologies quickly, stay ahead of trends, can troubleshoot problems, and have an excellent understanding of best practices and keep a keen eye on future trends. 


Reporting to the Digital Director, you’ll be capable of mentoring and inspiring the development team. This is a mid-senior role and while you don't need any fancy qualifications, however professional experience is a must.

item.title: Enterprise Data Architect at Burberry (London, UK)
item.description:
PURPOSE 


Data is the lifeblood of any organisation and especially so within Burberry. We are looking for an Enterprise Data Architect to help us define, and execute against, a vision for information and data use across our organisation. We expect the role to provide recommendations on the business information / entities required to be available and shared consistently such that they can be managed as assets and drive business value.


This role will have the responsibility for discovering the data and analytics requirements for information for all users, providing guidance on its technical implementation, as well as imparting expert guidance to support solutions design and implementation. The Enterprise Data Architect will also be a key stakeholder in a number of key programme’s and will work closely to ensure our critical data assets are protected in the right way.


The purpose of the role is to ensure that the data architecture within Burberry:



  • Supports the organisation, enabling the use of data to meet business outcomes, in an adaptive way;

  • Supports decision making, delivering a future-state view unconstrained by proprietary solutions or technologies and;

  • Protects our Brand and organisation through proper classification of our information assets, taking account of relevant privacy and regulatory requirements.



This person strengthens the impact of, and provides recommendations on, business information that will need to be available and shared consistently across the company through the identification, definition and analysis of how information assets drive business outcomes. Responsible for discovering the data and analytics requirements for information for all uses.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Producing, evolving and refining the enterprise data architecture for Burberry

  • Establishing a target architecture and roadmap, developing this as business evolves, using capability models to support an information-centric view

  • Driving the overall technical and product strategy for the current and any future states of the data roadmap, helping to prioritise what matters most to the organisation

  • Helping to define and agree information principles as they relate to the enterprise data architecture

  • Enabling the data and information management team to rationalise their data sources and repositories, reducing TCO

  • Raise and resolve any architectural issues/risks that could have implications against the security model

  • Engaging risk management functions to ensure that any exceptions are appropriately managed

  • Providing guidance for the implementation of data-centric services and solutions

  • Creating and managing data models in all their forms, including conceptual and logical forms

  • Engaging and directing any ‘Proof of Concept’ or prototyping of applications and solutions

  • Work with our security and information risk management team to govern data more effectively, supporting the development of governance processes and structures

  • Ensuring that delivery projects plan for all required data governance, reviews, sign-offs and checkpoints

  • Engaging and working with suppliers and partners in order to define the best possible solution and the most appropriate deployment of their technology and products

  • Identifying and exploiting the re-use of any components, patterns or techniques and documenting these for re-use by delivery projects, ensuring that projects do not duplicate functionality or diverge from each other and business and IT strategies

  • Ensure that operational and supportability guidelines are factored into the construction of any solution - this will include liaison with the relevant live service and service management teams to ensure that they understand the implications of the data design.



PERSON PROFILE



  • Proven commercial experience in IT, specially within information solution and system design

  • In-depth experience of designing and implementing information solutions, including hands-on experience in implementing data and analytics management programmes

  • Critical to success in this position is an ability to grasp complex technical processes/challenges and using entrepreneurial thinking to create solutions that are pragmatic

  • This is a role that will require an individual to be able to communicate with comfort with both senior business-leaders and IT Leadership

  • All-round experience of a range of technology solutions and a good understanding of the full-lifecycle of enterprise delivery projects

  • Previous experience working within an Enterprise Architecture function is preferred.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist Lead - new role, create and build a team at Abcam Plc (Milton, UK)
item.description:
About the role 


This is a brand new role to join Abcam as a Senior Data Scientist Lead to help us build and expand our Big Data capability.  The role encompasses orchestrating how the company uses both internal and external large/semi-structured/unstructured data to predict future R&D opportunities as well as real-time algorithms to deliver personalised marketing and web experiences.


You will have the ability to make this role your own and influence the decision making and direction of Abcam’s future strategy with your guidance. You will be working on key projects for our organisation and creating your vision of how we can best support our customers while becoming the best-loved brand in life sciences.


About Consumer Insights & Analytics at Abcam


The Consumer Insights & Analytics team, based in Cambridge (UK), is a rapidly developing department.  We have already made a real impact on the business and interact regularly with the decision makers within the organisation influencing our future direction.  Our aim is to empower other teams with insights to advance consumer understanding and drive the company mission.  We do this by gathering and analysing relevant information on the wider market context, on life scientists generally and on Abcam customers, and communicating insights to the appropriate audience.  


Roles & responsibilities:



  • Show and mentor the organisation how to leverage ‘big data’ to answer complex questions

  • Innovate and implement machine learning, text analytics, and large-scale data mining techniques and technologies that discover actionable patterns or informs hypotheses and insights

  • Work in an Agile way to orchestrate cross-functional projects for designing and testing new algorithms and models

  • In some cases (particularly in the early days), be hands-on in building the prototype

  • Perform rigorous statistical evaluation of the predictive accuracy

  • Collaborate with marketers, other data analysts, engineers and software developers to build scalable solutions as needed


About Us


Ever since 1998, when our founder, Jonathan Milner, started selling antibodies from the back of his bike, Abcam has aimed to help scientific researchers make breakthroughs faster.  We now have offices and labs in the UK, the US, China and Japan, and as we continue to grow, we remain ambitious, driven by our customers’ success and their research needs.


It’s our goal to provide a world-standard in protein research tools, technical support and delivery. When you join Abcam, you’ll join a global business with the passion and the vision to become the most influential company, and, best-loved brand in life sciences.


Our culture is our key differentiator. We believe in empowering individuals, with responsibility given at an early stage. The working environment is fun and fast-paced, collaborative and outcome focused, with a strong customer focus. In addition to competitive salaries, we can offer an attractive flexible benefits package which includes share options, a culture focussed on wellbeing and opportunities for growth and development.

item.title: Contractor 3-6mths - Ruby/Java Software Engineer - Farnborough, UK at UKCloud Ltd (Farnborough, UK)
item.description:
You’ll be disciplined, organised and self-motivated focussing on the value creation and delivery.  Working within an agile environment, you’ll be naturally open and keen to share knowledge across teams whilst contributing to technical discussions.  As such your communication skills will be good and your attitude will be “can do”.


UKCloud is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates.  Candidates must be eligible to work and live in the UK and will be required to undergo and maintain UK government security clearance.

item.title: Ruby Developer - to join a growing and award winning Development team! at On the Beach (Greater Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Are you the Ruby Developer we've been looking for?


We're on a mission to build on our existing world-class team of exceptional developers who are dedicated to devising exceptional solutions to challenges in the online travel industry!


The role is for a specialist Ruby developer who will join our existing Ruby team to help build and maintain new products and features for On the Beach’s customer facing website and back office systems. You will be joining a team of skilled and experienced Ruby developers and becoming part of one of the UKs most progressive, talented and successful application development teams. Key to success will be the ability to work in a highly agile environment collaborating daily with both technical and commercial colleagues, to think innovatively and challenge convention and to enjoy being part of a closely knit team of like minded individuals. You will be genuinely passionate about technology and enjoy the challenge of building exciting and innovative new user experiences.


Like most of the talented profiles on Stack Overflow you're in demand and may not be actively seeking a new challenge but - what if we are the company you've been looking for? A company where you’ll never stop learning and have the opportunity to work with some of the top techies in the country in their field. We know how important it is to keep up to date with the latest technologies, which is why we spend every Friday afternoon on research, development and testing out cool new ideas.. This can be either an internal hack session, one of the team presenting some of their ideas, or perhaps an external speaker.  Not only will you learn great skills that can be applied at work, they'll also be useful for your interests and personal projects.


We pride ourselves on continuous improvement so, code reviews and knowledge sharing is a standard, as is our policy of learning and not blaming! We never lose, we either win or learn.


We're growing fast - so this role could be ideal for someone wanting to lead by example.


We offer a competitive package including discounted holidays, flexible working arrangements and a great working environment (including a 9-hole putting course, chill-out areas and summer BBQs). 


If you join our team you will also have the opportunity and support to develop your skills by learning about the many open source languages and technologies On the Beach deploys.

item.title: Front End Developer at OVO Energy Ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
Tell me about OVO…


Love programming? Want to build great software, using leading edge technologies, with smart, passionate people?


The energy industry is changing, and technology is at the forefront of innovations that will transform it forever.


At OVO, technology and digital products are at the heart of our customer experience and they are key to our commercial success.


We were the first energy company to offer our Pay As You Go customers the opportunity to top up using their phone, the first company to offer real time electricity and gas usage data, and the first to release an apple watch App. We’ve been featured in Wired magazine for our ability to develop software to shatter the status quo.


But we’re just getting started.


We need to develop, test, and release software that scales, quickly and reliably. Over the last few years, we’ve built a highly skilled team of software engineers that is making a real impact to our business, and shaking up our industry.


We care about code quality, test automation and continuous delivery. Our developers drive our technology choices and own the software they create from their laptop all the way through to production.


We’re building a better energy company, and we’re doing it one Git commit at a time.


Right, I’m convinced… but where in the world of OVO will I be working?


You will be working as part of our technology team, based in our Notting Hill office.


What will your day look like?


You’ll turn up in the morning, grab a coffee and have a chat with some of your team mates.


You’ll do your daily stand up and be super clear on what you’re doing that day.


You’ll grab a partner and do some pair programming in the morning


When you’ve had enough of each other you’ll test your skills at Rocket League or FIFA


Try to not forget to order your free lunch on Friday


You’ll get back to pairing and finish off that small feature.


You’ll grab lunch with your team mates and talk about the latest and greatest tech


You might have a tribe meeting with all the other front end people from other teams to share ideas


You’re about to get back to coding, but realise you should really have a whiteboard session first


You’ll be thinking about how you can implement some of those great ideas from the tribe


You’ll get back to coding


Time for tea?


More coding, chatting, Rocket League.


Rest.

item.title: .NET Developer at Bridge International Academies London (London, UK)
item.description:
Bridge International Academies is the world's largest education innovation company serving the 800 million children who live on less than $2 USD per day. We strive to provide the highest quality education product to the more than 100,000 students who attend Bridge’s more than nursery and primary schools across emerging markets in Africa and (soon to open) in Asia. We are data-driven and technology-enabled. Using smartphones and tablets, our “closed loop” Learning Lab enables us to monitor teacher and student performance in real time, constantly reviewing and revising to ensure that we are offering a world class education that will prepare our students for the 21st century.  Outside of the classroom, we work with governments and civil society organizations to create customized teacher training modules, English Language Learning curricula, and “pop up” schools for refugees and other vulnerable populations.


Technology at Bridge


Technology plays a critical role at Bridge in enabling us to provide education at massive scale and low cost – it's one of the key elements that gives us the ability to deliver what no one else can. Tech spans several key functions, from the hardware and software that our academies use to run all aspects of teaching and management, including mobile payments, to the systems that enable our country headquarters to manage massive local operations, to the data backbone that informs all of our strategic and tactical decision making.


About the Role


 We are looking for a full time Software Engineer to join our new London-based cross-functional software development team, which will build the software that powers and improves our competitive advantage. The London team will have a special focus on the parts of the system that are more customer facing, experimental, and strategically important.


This person will join an elite team of top tier developers, led by a Microsoft MVP and overseen by a hands-on CTO passionate about delivering high-quality products – we will be building the technology that will take Bridge to the next level. It's a great opportunity to grow and learn, while working on developing software with a mission that few, if any, can compete with. We believe in innovation, continuous delivery, and high impact.


How We Work


Above all else, we’re looking for ambition, organisation, drive, intellect, problem solving, and respect for others. You will be part of the London high-speed team, which emphasises collaboration across all aspects of delivery. We don't have architects or managers – we have people passionate about getting their hands dirty and delivering the hotness.


What You Will Do:



  • Participate in all aspects of software delivery, from inception to development to delivery and support.

  • Analyse and improve server-side architecture with a focus on maintainability and scalability.

  • Collaborate with team and project stakeholders to elaborate requirements and facilitate trade-offs that maximise customer value.

  • Contribute to innovation stream that explores new technologies and approaches applicable to Bridge.


 What You Should Have



  • Experience with commercial, enterprise-grade .NET and/or .NET Core software development.

  • Experience with writing ASP.NET or ASP.NET Core based API's or websites.

  • Degree in BA/BS in Computer Science or related technical field.

  • Familiarity with test-driven development (TDD) and/or behaviour driven development (BDD).

  • Experience with the following are highly valued:

  • Continuous delivery practices and tools (e.g Jenkins, Bamboo, GoCD, Octopus).

  • Cloud environments and architectures, such as AWS or Azure.

  • Infrastructure-as-Code (e.g. Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Docker, boxstarter, chocolatey).

  • MS SQL Server/T-SQL

  • Agile delivery environment

  • Bridge also values developers with diverse experience, so exposure to other languages and ecosystems (e.g. NodeJS, Ruby, functional languages, NoSQL DBs) is a bonus.

  • Bridge is a strong supporter of open source projects – familiarity with OSS projects is a plus; contributions to open source projects is a big plus.

  • We particularly value experience in extreme growth situations.

  • Passionate about Bridge’s vision of democratizing the right for all children to succeed


 You’re also



  • A dedicated technologist – You love coding. Figuring out how to solve a problem with an elegant solution is exciting to you. You read blogs, attend user groups, and probably even work on personal side projects. You don't know what's impossible because you haven't seen it yet.

  • A detailed doer – You have a track record of getting things done. You’re organized and responsive. You take ownership of every idea you touch and execute it to a fine level of detail, setting targets, engaging others, and doing whatever it takes to get the job done.

  • A creative problem-solver – Growing any business from scratch comes with massive and constant challenges. On top of that, Bridge works in volatile, low-resource communities and runs on fees averaging just $6 a month per pupil. You need to be flexible and ready to get everything done effectively, quickly, and affordably with the materials at hand. Every dollar you spend is a dollar our customers, who live on less than $2 a day, will have to pay for.

  • A customer advocate – Our customers – these families living on less than $2 a day per person – never leave your mind. You know them, get them, have shared a meal with them (or would be happy to in the future). You would never shrink back from shaking a parent’s hand or picking up a crying child, no matter what the person was wearing or looked like. Every decision you make considers their customer benefit, experience, and value.

  • A life-long learner – You believe you can always do better. You welcome constructive criticism and provide it freely to others. You know you only get better tomorrow when others point out where you’ve missed things or failed today

item.title: Support Software Engineer - Java OR Ruby - No.1 Cloud Company at UKCloud Ltd (Farnborough, UK)
item.description:
Key Responsibilities



  • Development and maintenance of secure, performant and scalable applications/software services that enable UKCloud to achieve its business goals

  • Deliver enhancements and improvements to existing applications as part of small project teams

  • Promptly respond to application issues raised by internal and external teams from investigation through to coding solutions/patches

  • Actively engage with project and technical teams to improve cross working / team knowledge

  • Input into functional requirements, ensuring these are clearly stated and testable.  Ensure non-functional requirements are addressed

  • Improve software engineering working practices to improve quality and maximise throughput.

  • Write supporting documentation for design, configuration and on-going support

  • Maintain technical knowledge of current technical trends and standards

  • Provide Subject Matter Expert level code and application support when needed, including leadership of technical investigations

item.title: 2 x Senior Web Developers at Independent Strategic Technology (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
• Working as part of the team to design and implement enterprise level functionality and applications.
• Gathering and analysing user requirements.
• Providing technical guidance and collaborating with the team on making technical decisions.
• Keeping up-to-date with tech trends and developments.

item.title: Tech Industrial Placement and Summer Analyst at Morgan Stanley (London, UK)
item.description:
Morgan Stanley is more than a leading financial services firm. With offices spanning 41 countries and talented, passionate people bringing excellence and integrity to everything we do, the firm is truly global. Throughout the firm’s history, diverse and talented individuals have worked together to develop our new ideas and ground-breaking financial products.



Our Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own.


Industrial Placement

Technology Industrial Placement Interns are recruited for 4, 6 or 12 months in London and for 12 months in Glasgow, starting in June. Based on their skills, students are placed into specific development or infrastructure teams. These programs are designed to offer a real-world, project-based experience that will demonstrate first-hand what it is like to be a technologist for a top financial firm. Industrial Placement Interns who excel in the Program may receive an offer to join the Full-time Technology Training Program.

Industrial Placement Interns will participate in an induction process that provides an overview of the Firm and the Technology division. In addition to working on a live project, highlights include senior management networking events, team-building opportunities and a technical speaker series.

Candidates must be pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s or Doctorate degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or a related technology / science / engineering discipline.  Candidates must be on track for a minimum 2.1 honours degree (United Kingdom) or equivalent and be familiar with the foundations of at least one programming language: e.g., Java, C++ or C#.

item.title: AI Programmer at Splash Damage (Bromley, UK)
item.description:
As a member of Splash Damage’s AI Programming team, you be responsible for implementing and refining the Artificial Intelligence for the multi-player as well as single-player components of our games. You will work as part of Splash Damage’s Development Team on all issues related to AI, and work closely with the Design teams, Gameplay and Animation Programmers to co-ordinate deliverables.


Responsibilities at a Glance



  • Work with the Design Team to define AI requirements

  • Implement AI behavioural features and refine as needed

  • Implement AI navigation features and refine as needed

  • Ensure correct operation of AI features in a networked environment where required

item.title: Senior UI Programmer at Splash Damage (Bromley, UK)
item.description:
As Splash Damage’s Senior UI Programmer, you will use your passion for games and your outstanding programming skills to create memorable user interfaces for our current and future games.


Capable of great autonomy and reporting to the Lead UI Programmer, you will work with Splash Damage’s UI and Gameplay teams to plan, build, and maintain the front-end and in-game user interfaces for our games. You will apply your expertise in UI middleware as well as your programming skills to create user-friendly interface code and assets with a focus on performance.


As a senior member of the programming team, you will also help define and champion development methodologies, contribute to technology roadmaps for your field of expertise, and participate in staff development by sharing your knowledge.

item.title: Core Tech Programmer at Splash Damage (Bromley, UK)
item.description:
If you're looking to get your claws in to next gen AAA development then your hunt is over


It's a real exciting time for us here at Splash Damage, we are about to engage in a very well known and highly popular AAA title with next gen technology and we're looking to recruit multiple disciplines to fill our ranks.


As a Splash Damage Core Tech Programmer, you will be responsible for implementing and refining the core engine systems for our cross platform games. Reporting to the Lead Core Tech Programmer, you will work with Splash Damage’s Programming Team on building and maintaining core engine features that encompasses rendering, animation and low level system programming. With a constant focus on scalability, performance and memory usage, you will apply your expertise in data structures and algorithms for modern, multi-core architectures to build state-of-the-art technology for a variety of platforms including PC, mobiles and current & next-generation of consoles.

item.title: Aero System Engineer (CFD) for a dynamic engineering-led F1 Race Team at SCUDERIA TORO ROSSO SPA (Bicester, UK)
item.description:
Scuderia Toro Rosso is looking for an experienced web developer, with Linux expertise, to work within our Aerodynamics department.  The role will primarily be continuous development of the CFD process and results systems. 


Being part of the Aero Systems group based at our wind tunnel in Bicester, the successful candidate will be solution-oriented with a “can do” attitude. You will be expected to contribute during all phases of software development from requirements collection through to maintenance. Candidates must be analytical with a logical approach to problem solving, and exhibit a high degree of attention to detail.


An excellent knowledge of Python and JavaScript is required, along with familiarity with Django. Knowledge of Postgres and Docker would be advantageous, as would familiarity with HPC environments.

item.title: Architect / System Engineer - VMWare at Tesco Technology (Welwyn Garden City, UK)
item.description:
The Role – Architect / System Engineer - VMWare


Whilst specific responsibilities will be dependent upon the changing needs of the Tesco business, the following provides an overview of the role’s key responsibilities and measures:



  • Architect, Design and Deliver solutions using existing Infrastructure components.

  • Where new infrastructure technologies are being introduced, implement them and establish best practice for their adoption.

  • Resolve incidents that have not been seen before and initiate change to ensure that issues can be easily dealt with in future.

  • Contribute to the Technology Roadmap for Tesco Technology Data Centres

  • Evaluate new tools and techniques being able to understand their value and impact.

  • Understand current application development techniques (12 factor app) and their implications to infrastructure

  • Lead group design discussions on my area of expertise and be able to present with authority to a variety of audiences.

  • Collaborate with Software Engineers to understand their requirements and assist them consuming Infrastructure in the most seamless way possible.

  • Coach and mentor system engineers across Technology who are at a more junior level.  Ensure that my own team’s designs are of a high quality and understand the impacts to any other areas of infrastructure.

  • Keep my technical skills up to date and keep track of new technologies, understanding how they might benefit the Technology team and wider Tesco.
