  • Introduce automation to all aspects of my day to day work.

  • This role will best suit an individual who enjoys working as part of a team, is well organised, pragmatic and a lateral thinker with an inquisitive mind who is motivated to make change for the better and, most importantly, puts our customers first.


About The Tesco Technology Infrastructure Team


The Infrastructure Engineering team design, develop and operate all infrastructure used by Tesco Technology across our data centres, offices, stores and distribution centres. This encompasses multiple domains; private and public cloud, connectivity, end-user computing, CI/CD and monitoring toolkit. This includes both 3rd party and internally developed infrastructure applications and infrastructure that support the wider Tesco business.


Key activities include:



  • Designs, develops and operates the Infrastructure platforms that allow development teams and business colleagues to consume infrastructure.

  • Designs, develops and operates the automation to allow Infrastructure platforms to be consumed in a controlled, auditable and repeatable manner.

  • Setting the strategy, objectives and high-level plans for infrastructure.

  • Works with development teams to collaborate in creating appropriate infrastructure solutions.

  • Evaluating partners, software and hardware and finding the right mix to deliver the strategy.

  • Driving innovation at Tesco through infrastructure transformation.

  • Defining and overseeing standards and simplification across the estate.

  • Designing, delivering and operating new and re-usable infrastructure solutions.


The Infrastructure team are supporting both the current Infrastructure and also the work required to continue the transformation of Tesco Technologies Infrastructure to modern platforms that can be easily consumed through self-service APIs, automatically handle failures and use best of breed modern technologies

item.title: Senior & Principal Java Integration Designers - Middleware at Elsevier (Kidlington, UK)
item.description:
Elsevier is in the midst of a major TRANSFORMATION and TECHNOLOGY is simultaneously at the FOREFRONT and the DRIVING FORCE.  Our innovative technology platforms and smart content solutions operate at the cutting edge of big data, semantic web and cloud technology, enabling faster more effective critical decision-making daily across the globe.



We are experiencing a period of growth that is increasing the pressure on the capability of our technology infrastructure.  As we grow, so does our demand on technology and the way we use it.  We are automating, optimising, increasing speed and availability and migrating to cloud services.



We have a number of exciting opportunities within our Data & Integration team for Senior & Principal Java Integration Designers based in our Kidlington, Oxfordshire offices.



This is an excellent opportunity for an e2e Business Process minded Technologist to understand wider business processes beyond the scope of and existing application or function.  It provides the ability to work with a wide variety of business and technical teams across a wide range of technologies and make a real difference to the transformation of Elsevier.  With this wider reaching scope it provides great growth opportunities for the right individuals to work as part of a strong team. Hence why we need a strong communicator and a strong interest in Architecture for integration of large enterprise systems (+100 systems).

item.title: C# Lead Developer for small lean team, inc. training at Glow New Media Limited (Liverpool, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for C# .NET Lead Developer to join our growing team. You will be working with a small team designing and implementing solutions for both web and mobile. The role will allow you to work on projects of all shapes and sizes for a wide range of clients.


This is a senior software role, leading a small but rapidly growing software team and you'll recognise that opportunity to shape the team and take your career to the next level.


Attributes



  • Enthusiasm – you love technology and making it work

  • Completer / Finisher – you finish what you start and love the feeling of getting it done

  • Curious – if you don’t know how it works, you find out

  • Positive – life is too short for grumbling

  • Focussed – you know where to put your time and energy

  • Accurate - you like to dot the i’s and cross the t’s


Key Duties



  • Specifying and creating software applications

  • Work with Technical Director and managers to gather requirements and plan projects

  • Produce detailed specifications, mock-ups and prototypes

  • Help improve and evolve all software development processes to optimise time, risk and cost

  • Mentor all team members on tools, technologies and processes

  • Manage software releases including release scheduling, release notes, deployment and release support.

  • Perform system support for critical system issues

  • Administration and maintenance of both development and production servers

item.title: Test Data Manager at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
With the growth of smart phones, tablets and new operating systems requiring constant updates daily, testing and QA are more critical than ever before.


Our Quality Engineering & Assurance group partners with you to bolster development initiatives, providing reliable support across a range of hardware and software, testing infrastructure, and testing products that ensure test coverage and drive product quality.

Summary of Department Focus:


Cognizant BFS testing practice is a 4500-member unit that has skills varying from core application testing, Test programme Management to test consulting. Cognizant is the preferred testing partner for top 3 of the UK Banks. The selected candidate will be part of fast growing and dynamic BFS testing team in UK.

Summary of Job Purpose:


Cognizant's Banking and Financial Services testing practice are looking to recruit a Test Data Manager based in Skelmersdale, Manchester.

The Test Data Manager is accountable for planning delivery of test data to meet test data requirements; leading the team tasked with sourcing the data


Defining the strategy for the management of test data across multiple environments; formalising and documenting the process for loading; updating, and maintaining data across systems; leading on resolution of defects relating to test data.

Defining test data management strategy for large, complex programmes

Defining Enterprise Test Data Strategy/Policy covering Data Archival, Data Refresh, Data source database identification, Data Sub-setting, Data Generation, Data Masking etc.


Providing process expertise and support through quick resolution of issues related to test data

Liaising with test and deployment leads to ensure delivery of data is factored into plans

Defining requirements acceptance criteria and Handover checklists for Test Data Delivery

Defining roles and responsibilities for creation of requirements and delivery of data to meet them
Lead a team of test data analysts from across different technology


Mentor and guide test data team and bring ideas to implement industry leading practices on test data management

Defining E2E process & workflow from data requests to provisioning for the client


Role focus on leading a central test data management team for the client within their test environment practice


Strong relationship with Application Development & Maintenance, Testing, Environment, Infrastructure and Service Management teams


Responsible for managing the data from Source to Target test regions through the complete Test Data lifecycle

item.title: Front End Engineer (Angular 2) at Festicket (London, UK)
item.description:
YOUR ROLE
We are looking for mid-senior level developers who specialise in JavaScript frameworks (preferably AngularJS and who want to work with Angular 2).



We've just had a big funding round and now we need to overhaul our technology to meet the business's ambitions for the next 5 years. This includes a lot of great technical challenges related to scaling.
We are a team of 10 looking to double in size over the next 12 months. To do this we need your dedication to get work done on time, to train new staff and integrate many new team members into this rapidly growing team while working with the other mid-senior developers to ensure that standards stay high and keep getting higher.



THE STACK
http://stackshare.io/festicket/festicket



METHODOLOGY
We work incrementally but do occasionally take on bigger projects to update our stack and offering. Our current methodology is agile kanban.

item.title: Scala Developer at OVO Energy Ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
Tell me about OVO…


Love programming? Want to build great software, using leading edge technologies, with smart, passionate people?


The energy industry is changing, and technology is at the forefront of innovations that will transform it forever.


At OVO, technology and digital products are at the heart of our customer experience and they are key to our commercial success.


We were the first energy company to offer our Pay As You Go customers the opportunity to top up using their phone, the first company to offer real time electricity and gas usage data, and the first to release an apple watch App. We’ve been featured in Wired magazine for our ability to develop software to shatter the status quo.


But we’re just getting started.


We need to develop, test, and release software that scales, quickly and reliably. Over the last few years, we’ve built a highly skilled team of software engineers that is making a real impact to our business, and shaking up our industry.


We care about code quality, test automation and continuous delivery. Our developers drive our technology choices and own the software they create from their laptop all the way through to production. We’re building a better energy company, and we’re doing it one Git commit at a time.


Right, I’m convinced… but where in the world of OVO will I be working?


You will be working as part of our technology team, based in our Notting Hill office.


That sounds great! What will I be doing?



  • Take ownership of, architect, build and scale parts of our microservice platform.

  • Drive both product and technical improvements

  • Communicate your ideas, engage with different teams and encourage debate and collaboration.

item.title: Scala Developer/Engineer at Jobsite UK (Worldwide) Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Skills:   Scala, Spark, Hadoop, Play, Java, Developer



  • Are you an experienced Scala Developer with a mathematical/analytical background and an interest and/or knowledge within data science?

  • Keen to disrupt the way people find work online and prepared to challenge the accepted way of doing things?

  • Used to working with and being challenged by highly skilled and opinionated technical teams?

  • Looking for a fantastic and unique opportunity?


If so, we would love to hear from you!


About us & your role;


We’re hiring a Scala Developer to assist us with an exciting greenfield project as part of a team of talented Engineers. The project is still in mid-mature stage and the successful candidate will have the opportunity to challenge current concepts as well as explore and implement solutions to new requirements.


This is a unique opportunity to work in a small, independent team whilst remaining part of a well-established company that have the backing of Europe’s #1 online recruitment advertising business.


You’ll be an experienced Scala Developer with knowledge of one or more of Spark, Hadoop or Play.


Some of the technologies that we are using



  • Scala

  • Spark

  • Hadoop

  • Play

  • Java

  • Express

  • Docker

  • JS

  • AngularJS

  • Express

  • Docker

  • AWS

  • ReactJS

  • MongoDB

  • ElasticSearch

  • CSS

  • LESS


Any knowledge and experience in the above in addition to Scala would be hugely advantageous.


You’ll also need to have experience or be passionate about working within an Agile set-up.

item.title: Devops Guru at Arachnys (London, UK)
item.description:
Our infrastructure spans at least six data centres, dozens of physical and virtual instances, and a large number of technologies including Hadoop, ElasticSearch, Postgresql, neo4j, Python, Go and others.


We are looking for a devops practitioner who brings expertise, experience and a clear vision of how to achieve reliability, scalability and security for our blue-chip enterprise customers while facilitating deployments multiple times per day.

item.title: Dont be a baby, grow up and code for Yorkshires finest baby retailer at Direct2Mum Ltd (Barnsley, UK)
item.description:
Direct 2 Mum are offering a brand new and exciting opportunity to work with our growing development team as MVC Web developer. The role will primarily involve developing the website front end pages and features to work seamlessly with the custom back end application.


You will have the chance to make substantial contributions to the company growth and development, converting basic requirements into practical, usable solutions whilst incorporating your own ideas and experience.


You’ll mainly be developing code using the latest Visual Studio (2015) with C#, ASP.NET MVC, and Entity Framework code first, knowledge of SQL would also be beneficial. For the front end you’ll need jQuery, Bootstrap, HTML, and CSS.

item.title: Are you looking to get more customer focused? at Xceptor (London, UK)
item.description:
This role would be ideal for someone with a solid technical background who is looking to spend time working closely with clients whilst still spending time down in the code building solutions.


At its heart this is a technical role, but you will also ensure that everyone understands what needs to be achieved and then take a lead role in delivering the solution.


A typical day would involve a variety of activities, some of which might be as follows:



  • Ensuring that key relationships with the client are developed and maintained; assisting them from project start through to live operation

  • Gathering requirements from customers by liaising with business teams and producing specifications as needed

  • Configuration (developing a client layer) of our product to meet the needs of specific client implementations

  • Working closely with the core product development team where software enhancements are required, at times possibly involved in determining future strategy for the software

  • Management of the development lifecycle to ensure successful implementations of the software

  • Provide product training and support to clients

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Email Gateway Team) at Clearswift (Theale, UK)
item.description:
The Role


The Email Gateway team is responsible for the ongoing development of Clearswift’s award winning SECURE Email & Exchange Gateways.  In order to continue to deliver these high quality solutions the team is currently looking to recruit an enthusiastic and motivated Senior Software Engineer.


As a member of the team you will be developing products that allow organisations to safely use the internet to enhance the way they work, while protecting them from the risks of sensitive data getting into the wrong hands.  These products need to be fast, robust and secure to satisfy a wide range of organisations for which the leakage of sensitive data could cause loss of business and reputation or result in significant fines.  Where many organisations are forced to block the use of Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Skype and many other sites and applications to protect themselves, Clearswift’s customers are able to define flexible policies which allow their users to take full advantage of the collaboration afforded by these modern communication channels while at the same time providing a secure environment within which to work.


Our engineers need to be experts in the protocols and applications that power the ever-changing internet as well as in the systems used to run some of the world’s largest organisations. We develop applications that have to handle millions of emails and browser transactions every day, and keep running “24x7”, 365 days a year, all around the world. 


As the successful applicant you will be working on enhancing our products to satisfy the demanding requirements of our customers.  This will involve extending current software modules, integrating 3rd party components and implementing new ones.  You will be a Linux developer with C++, Java and scripting experience who considers all technologies when designing a solution and chooses the appropriate technology to achieve an efficient and effective result. 


You will be working within a multi-disciplined Scrum team and will be expected to take an active role in capturing and understanding product requirements, producing design documentation, coding and creating automated tests.  You will work closely alongside the rest of the team members to achieve the team goals and will assist others to ensure the team’s sprints are successfully completed.


Key Responsibilities



  • Designing, coding & testing product components to enhance Clearswift’s Email security products

  • Supporting all aspects of the development process by attending and contributing in planning, status and review meetings

  • Working with the internal documentation and localisation team to ensure successful product delivery

  • Providing Technical leadership whilst guiding and motivating a team

  • Working as technical specialist taking overall responsibility for design and implementation in specialist area

item.title: Lead Back-end Developer (Ruby) at Parliamentary Digital Service (London, UK)
item.description:
What we're looking for:


An experienced Ruby developer to join our growing Development team. You will join a team of front and back-end developers and web operations engineers that will total 12 by the end of 2016.


The role:


You'll be working on a new website for Parliament that intends to make the UK Parliament a leader in digital democracy.


The new website will be data driven, have user needs at its heart, be developed incrementally and in the open. The new website will create an information space that will increase engagement, drive understanding and support transactions with Parliament.


You'll work in a friendly and creative agile environment, within multi-disciplinary product teams, spending 100% of your working time developing software for new services.


You’ll provide technical guidance and support for your colleagues and help the team grow and develop.


You'll be working collaboratively with Product Managers, Delivery Managers, User Researchers, Designers, Front-end Developers, Data and Technical Architects, Testers and Web Operations Engineers as well our Data and Search platform team.

item.title: Redhat Platform Developer at Clearswift (Theale, UK)
item.description:
The Role


The Platform team delivers the operating system, common utility libraries, console and installation/upgrade services that form the foundation of the Clearswift product family. The team maintain the consistent provision of platform functionality across a range of Operating Systems. Alongside delivery of the core platform services and libraries, this team also manages all aspects of product installation and deployment ensuring the customer a flexible, reliable and trouble-free installation process across a variety of physical, virtual and cloud deployment options.

The Platform team responsibilities will significantly grow over the next 2 years with the goal of delivering a progressive framework capable of supporting the next generation of Clearswift products. This new framework will provide a secure, modular, extensible service oriented architecture which will form the foundation of all Clearswift products for the foreseeable future.


As the successful applicant you will be working on maintaining and enhancing the current platform functionality as well as working alongside other Senior Developers and Technical Architects to specify, design and deliver our next-generation product range.


You will be a strong, creative developer with a broad range of experience who is keen to explore new technologies and adept at choosing the appropriate technology to achieve an efficient and effective solution.  You will be an engineer who enjoys working directly with Product Owners and Technical Architects and has a proven track record of being able to turn a conceptual product “vision” into robust, secure, scalable, low-maintenance, enterprise-grade software.


You will be working within a multi-disciplined team and will be expected to take an active role in capturing and understanding product requirements, producing design documentation, coding and creating automated tests. You will work closely alongside the rest of the team to achieve the team goals and will assist others to ensure the team’s continued success.


For high-achievers the role offers scope for promotion and progression within the Engineering Department.


Key Responsibilities 



  • Working closely with other Engineers, Team Leads and Technical Architects to specify, design and build our next-generation product architecture.

  • Working closely with Product Owners to specify, plan, size and prioritise new features.

  • Designing, coding & testing enhancements to the existing platform code-base to meet product roadmap commitments.

  • Supporting the Team Lead, helping to develop and grow the team, recruit new staff and mentor/develop existing staff.

  • Supporting all aspects of the development process by contributing in planning, status and review meetings

item.title: DevOps Engineer - Python & Puppet - No.1 Cloud Company at UKCloud Ltd (Farnborough, UK)
item.description:
Part of our Development function, our DevOps Engineers maintain and improve our continuous build, test and deployment delivery system (pipeline) to meet the needs of the Software Engineering teams and release/change management.  An effective pipeline enables delivery teams to rapidly and safely release software, in turn increasing the speed at which our customers and business see value.


Working within an agile environment, we’re looking for experienced DevOps Engineers who can bring something to the table, be part of a fast-paced and rapidly changing company with the customer at the centre of what we do.


Our DevOps team have started rolling out a CI leading to a CD process based on Docker containers.  We put energy and investment into the tooling that makes our environments easier for our teams to use, allowing focus on the valuable software being created.


Key Responsibilities



  • Working with the Development Manager, devise and maintain the UKCloud Continuous Integration Environment (CI/CD) ensuring its use and effectiveness for the consuming teams.  To include all tools and environments from developer check-in to the creation of signed off builds ready to release to production

  • Undertake the necessary technical work to implement, maintain and/or improve the Build Pipeline including administration of the source code repository and servers that form part of the Build Pipeline

  • Production of metrics reflecting the state of UKCloud’s code base and build pipeline performance.  Work with teams to understand how the build pipeline can help teams improve quality and throughput

  • Provide Subject Matter Expert level code and application support when needed, including leadership of technical investigations

  • Ensure effective documentation for design, configuration and on-going support of the pipeline

  • Maintain a “backlog” of changes and enhancements; publish this to engineering management and engineering teams.

  • Ensure Development Teams have sufficient and effective environments for coding and testing activity

  • Evaluate software and services to see if they should form part of the tooling/platform in use

  • Contribute to the creation of technical standards within the development team and UKCloud

  • Actively coach and support the technical development of less experienced colleagues

  • Maintain technical knowledge of current technical trends and standards

item.title: Software Engineer - Ruby & Java - No.1 Cloud Company at UKCloud Ltd (Farnborough, UK)
item.description:
What we do


UKCloud have developed a range of services that are designed specifically for the UK Public Sector.


We were one of the first G-Cloud providers to achieve Pan Government Accreditation (PGA) up to Elevated OFFICIAL, and our services continue to achieve formal UK Government accreditation which make them suitable for all data at OFFICIAL (including OFFICIAL-SENSITIVE). UKCloud services are connected to government networks including the Public Services Network (PSN), the N3 health network, Janet the research and education network and others.


All our services are hosted in either (or both) of our highly-resilient, UK data centres and benefit from QinetiQ’s Protective Monitoring solution (security domain dependent).


Jobs Key Responsibilities



  • Assisting with the technical design and development of UKCloud applications as part of Scrum and engineering teams

  • Developing secure, performant and scalable applications/software services that enable UKCloud to achieve its business goals

  • Actively engage with other project and technical teams to improve cross working / team knowledge

  • Input into functional requirements, ensuring these are clearly stated and testable.  Ensure non-functional requirements are addressed

  • Write supporting documentation for design, configuration and on-going support

  • Maintain technical knowledge of current technical trends and standards

  • Provide Subject Matter Expert level code and application support when needed, including leadership of technical investigations

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at First Utility (Warwick, UK)
item.description:
This is a key role within the development team building advanced software solutions for our growing energy and telco business.  


Projects cut across a wide range of areas, including:



  • Many of the systems that support our customer facing teams

  • Accurate billing for our customers

  • New business opportunities

  • Expanding the capability of our smart meter platform


You will be working in a highly agile environment that continues to encourage DevOps principles and practices to make the software delivery process more efficient, reliable and able to react to the changing demands of a dynamic fast growing business.  The DevOps team are critical to these aims and are responsible for developing and innovating ways to accelerate delivery to react to the changing needs of the business.


The way we build and test is critical to successful delivery as we continue to move towards microservices architecture, continuous delivery and more of the steps required become hands off.


You will be embedded in a development area to support and champion DevOps and continuous delivery principles with that team, whilst collaborating with other DevOps, software and operational engineers to ensure a consistent, resilient and dynamic approach.


As the company grows our teams will continue to be presented many technical challenges, our ability to find and adopt new technologies that support our growth is increasingly important. Some of the technologies we now rely on include Docker, Cassandra and Kafta.


Areas of specific responsibility:



  • Work with delivery teams to support their delivery of quality software solutions through the use of automation

  • Work with other DevOps engineers and technical operational engineers to continually improve the infrastructure and platform

  • Work with delivery teams to support their ability to monitor and manage their own applications in the production environment

  • Delivery automation will encompass a variety of technologies, including databases, web services and web front ends

  • Appropriate documentation to share knowledge about the solutions, processes, frameworks and other technical subjects

item.title: Compiler Engineer at Codeplay Software Ltd (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Compilers are vital for exploiting the performance of specialized processors with modern complex software.


We are looking for enthusiastic software engineers, who are keen to work on implementing and customizing modern optimizing compilers that target the next generation GPUs, Mobile/Embedded CPUs, DSPs and other custom processors. This position requires solid understanding of compiler back-ends, particularly low-level optimizations and efficient code generation to make the most of the underlying ISA, maximizing performance whilst maintaining correctness and compile speed.


This is an opportunity to learn about new processors and platforms, and to contribute to the implementation of tools targeting those platforms. Many of these systems or technologies are not yet publicly announced and therefore require confidentiality, so this is an opportunity to work with brand-new hardware and software before anyone else does!


The candidate should be able to work both independently and collaboratively within teams of various differing skill sets and expertise. The candidate may also be required to help out on other software projects within the company.


The position will be based at our head office in central Edinburgh.


What We Offer



  • Work on exciting brand-new technologies and standards with well-recognized customers!

  • A friendly and relaxed working environment where colleagues support each other.

  • Knowledge sharing: our staff frequently give company-wide presentations on new software and technology trends, personal projects and other relevant subjects.

  • Great career prospects within a growing company:

    • Positions are available at various levels, from entry-level Software Engineer to Senior Principal Software Engineer, depending on your skills and experience.

    • We develop our employees and provide training in skills such as project and people management, networking and delivering effective presentations.

    • Frequent opportunities to attend conferences and developer meetings, represent the company, and become a recognized expert.

    • We encourage engineers to progress quickly in their roles, for example to become team leads (project management training will be provided).

    • Codeplay has been recognized as an excellent employer and awarded the highly respected Investors in People accreditation.

    • Opportunities to get involved with industrial standardization initiatives such as The Khronos Group and HSA Foundation, and various European research programmes.

    • Working on early-stage technology offers opportunities to contribute/shape new hardware/software and standards.



  • Flexible working hours, stock options and pension schemes.

item.title: Senior Developer - The chance to combine a passion for tech and music at 7digital (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re working at significant scale – our service-oriented API Platform is handling billions of requests per month and growing quickly. You’ll be joining an enthusiastic team who enjoy what they do. Things like Pair Programming, TDD/BDD, Refactoring, and Continuous Delivery are deeply embedded and we’re constantly striving to improve the way we work. We know typing is not the bottleneck, so there are plenty of other things going on:



  • You can take part in regular weekly sessions sharing ideas, doing Katas/Dojos and discussing practices and technologies.

  • You will get up to two days “innovation time” a month to investigate new technologies or product ideas.

  • You can attend conferences and community events, both as a participant or contributors - we’ve presented/ran sessions at XP2016, QCon, SPA, Strata + Hadoop World, Agile Cambridge, Agile Manchester, APIdays, XPDay, Agile on the Beach and many others.

  • You can help us host our own popular community event – Devs in the ‘ditch

  • We hold frequent retrospectives (as teams and the department) on how we can improve the way we work.


However, we’re not perfect and not afraid to say so. We recognise we have many problems which need solving and a long way to go on our journey of continuous improvement.


About You


You care about software; you have a passion for what you do which you can clearly convey by your actions rather than just waffly personal statements on your CV. For you it’s more than a job. You like to pick the right tool for the task at hand.


You believe software development involves a lot more than just writing code. You see it as your remit to really understand our domain so we can all deliver as much value to the business as possible. When you do write code you believe it has to be done really well. To you, quality (both internal and external) really matters. These are things we really care about.


Experience otherwise is relative – 2 years working in an agile/XP manner is worth much more to us than 5 in a traditional environment. If you’ve not got working experience with things like TDD and refactoring (maybe you’ve always wanted to but your current job doesn’t allow for it) show us you’re at least familiar with the concepts and that you really want to work in this kind of environment and you’re still in with a good chance.


Technology you'll get to use


Our production systems use C#, Node.js, Python, Java and we're investigating and running many other technologies and languages. We use a mixture of AWS and Google Cloud Platform, based around a distributed data architecture with Apache Kafka at the heart. We’d be interested in you if you’re from any background as long as you have a keen understanding of good programming practices. We have a strong devops culture and like to use services that help us create great products; from CDNs to monitoring to anomaly detection. We’d expect you to be proficient in more than one technology stack. Here’s a sample list of technologies we currently use:



  • C#, JavaScript, Node.js, Python, Ruby

  • REST, Queues, Relational Databases, Document Databases, Infrastructure as code

  • Examples include: Postgres, SQL Server, Solr/Lucene/Elasticsearch, Redis, RabbitMQ and Varnish, Kafka, Spark, Nginx

  • We practice continuous integration, continuous delivery and continuous improvement.


We’re also very keen on open source. We contribute to some of the technologies listed above as well as maintaining our own forks (+ publishing other things we’d like to share) on our GitHub account.

item.title: Senior Software Developer at SIMUL8 Corporation (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
About you

To be part of our team you must be:



  • Passionate about technology. Technology never stops and neither do we. In a competitive market, we need to keep our edge, constantly evaluating the right technologies that help us deliver for our customers. You must be comfortable doing what no-one else has done before.

  • Customer-focused. You will help us build and evolve quality products that are loved by users worldwide. And you will be comfortable talking to non-technical users to help understand their needs and deliver software to make them more productive.

  • A polyglot developer. No technology is the right fit for everything, so you must be comfortable with learning and applying technology across the full stack.

  • Pro-active and driven. Everyone makes a difference to the company. You care about the team, and continual improvement in yourself and others.


What will you do?



  • Deliver technically challenging projects.

  • Help shape the future of our products and our company.

  • Mentor other developers to give them a chance to shine.

item.title: Problem-Solving Software Engineer in Research Park at Xceptor (Guildford, UK)
item.description:
Xceptor requires an intelligent, driven, Software Engineer with experience of designing and building solutions using the .NET Framework with databases to join the core development team for our product suite, which is used by over 35 of the world’s leading financial services institutions.


The primary aim of the role is to work on enhancing the back-end of our product suite, including migrating existing functionality to an updated technology stack.  The role is based in our Guildford office, but there will also be opportunities to work alongside the Implementation Consultants in our London office and on customer deployments with our clients in the UK and abroad.


Reporting to the Technical Lead, this role will work with the development and QA teams to successfully deliver new functionality to customers for our various product offerings.


A typical day could involve a variety of activities, for example:



  • Prototyping new functionality in our trade confirmations platform to compare a faxed document with an original.

  • Analysing how workarounds are used when configuring our product and suggest how this could drive refinements to the back-end design.

  • Optimising the performance of our data hub platform to achieve low latency when implementing fraud checking for a faster payments solution.

  • Contributing to a project to migrate an ASP .Net server-side user interface to use a client-side technology stack based on HTML 5 and Angular JS.

  • Learning about security requirements and related technologies in order to provide a response to a customer’s penetration test results.

  • Working with the QA team to use source control and continuous integration in order to deliver quality, regression-free, code.

  • Investigating and fixing product defects relating to database locks or memory leaks.

  • Collaborating with the implementation and sales teams in order to support sales of our market data platform and deliver new features required for the implementation project.

item.title: Senior Software Developer (Java) at Inspired Gaming Group Ltd (Birmingham, UK)
item.description:
This role plays an active daily role in cutting code, but will also be responsible for supporting the team lead to plan the tasks which members of the team will execute, and the order in which they execute them.


The key requirement is for somebody who has expert knowledge of Java and associated APIs, and who has real-world experience of applying the knowledge to a complex and fast-moving development environment.


Working as part of a team of developers producing code and supporting materials which are both functional and operable.


This will involve:




    • Working as part of a team to deliver operable projects to operations for test and deployment

    • Assisting the team lead in design of components

    • Assisting other developers as and when required




  • Following the strategy and best practices of the group


Task management



  • Log time spent against projects as directed by Project Office

  • Use task tracking tools as directed by Team Lead and Development Manager

  • Provide accurate estimates for development tasks

  • Communicate progress and issues to team lead in a timely manner

  • Engage in project planning and estimation meetings as directed by team lead


Active Development




    • Provide architectural guidance on component design

    • Produce and maintain documentation on developed components

    • Development of component code

    • Provide adequate test coverage for developed components

    • Follow the strategy and best practices of the group

    • Assist other developers as and when required

item.title: Development Manager - RGS Integrations at Inspired Gaming Group Ltd (Birmingham, UK)
item.description:
Inspired are looking for an enthusiastic and ambitious individual who can demonstrate through experience that they have the skills necessary to manage and technically lead a team of enterprise software developers.


Working with the RGS Core Platform Development Manager, the RGS Integrations Development Manager will be responsible for integrating the RGS platform into new customer’s gaming systems. Operating within an evolving Agile delivery framework, and through collaboration with the Product Team, the Development Manager is solely responsible for the on time delivery of RGS Integrations as per the product roadmap, and all associated operational tasks arising from the RGS product development.


The candidate should be able to cope well under the pressures of working with live, high-load systems and be prepared to mobilise resources and turn around solutions within tight fix-times in order to meet contractual SLAs.

item.title: Machine Learning Software Engineer at AimBrain (London, UK)
item.description:
A day in the life



  • Developing and improving biometric authentication algorithms (behavioural, facial, voice);

  • Implementing algorithms in real-world environments (server side and on device);

  • Bringing new ideas to the table.


Our promise



  • Challenging real world problems – your solutions will be deployed to millions of real users;

  • Flexible work hours and location – we realise that everyone’s ideal working conditions are different, and we need you at your best;

  • Opportunity to shape AimBrain – as part of the core team, everything you do will influence the growth and direction of AimBrain;

  • Competitive salary and stock option package.

item.title: QA Automation Engineer at Hippo (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
At Hippo, you will develop tools and ideas to improve our automated testing environment. You will be responsible for testing our Digital Experience Cloud product. The primary task at hand is to build an automated test suite (Selenium and Cucumber) against the Hippo DX Cloud solution (OnDemand). Besides the automated tests you will run performance and some exploratory tests. If you are passionate about automation and releasing quality software, we would like to know more about you!


Responsibilities



  • As part of a cross functional development team, ensure the quality of delivered work;

  • Develop and maintain automated tests with the developers;

  • Actively participate in Scrum meetings and the QA Community of Practice;

  • Manual testing of stories and issues.

item.title: Mid-Lead FullStack JavaScript Developers - Node.js, React, Redux at Elsevier (London, UK)
item.description:
Our website will tell you that we are a world-leading provider of information solutions, enabling researches in the medical, scientific and academia space. However over the last few years we have been behaving very much like a data-driven tech company. Animating our data, making it interactive for our target audience on various platforms.


We have a number of exciting opportunities within 2 of our businesses Mendeley and ScienceDirect for FullStack JavaScript Developers based in our central London offices.


Elsevier is in the midst of a transformation that is being driven by digital technology. Our innovative technology platforms and smart content solutions operate at the cutting edge of big data, semantic web and cloud technology, enabling faster more effective critical decision-making daily across the globe.


About Mendeley


Revolutionizing how research is done. We have won awards such as “Best Social Innovation Which Benefits Society”. We have world-class technology and a product that our customers love. With over 3 million users and a crowd-sourced library of over 600 million user documents we handle a large volume of data. Having been acquired we’re now backed by a resourceful company that fully supports our vision, gives us the opportunity to drive change and have impact on a much larger scale.


About ScienceDirect


The world's leading collection of science information on the web and Elsevier's flagship product.  A new project is underway to replace the product from the ground up with a brand new, cutting edge technology platform that is fast and reliable and enables continuous delivery so the product team can test new ideas, be more innovative and respond more quickly to rapidly changing customer needs.  This exciting new project is being delivered by newly formed agile teams in London, so this is an opportunity to be part of a new and fast-growing cross-functional development group from the early stages and a chance to help shape the culture and the way the teams work.


You going to need passion and lots of it! Really care about the quality of the software you build and ready to join fast moving agile teams.

item.title: QA Engineers (Ruby, Cucumber, Selenium, Jenkins) (Desktop & Web) at Elsevier (London, UK)
item.description:
Our website will tell you that we are a world-leading provider of information solutions, enabling researches in the medical, scientific and academia space. However over the last few years we have been behaving very much like a data-driven tech company. Animating our data, making it interactive for our target audience on various platforms.


We have a few exciting opportunities within our Mendeley team for QA Engineers working on Desktop & Web Applications based in our central London offices.


What you will do



  • Testing new features and bug fixes delivered by the team in bi-weekly sprints. This will be done by working with developers to ensure the right level of unit, integration and automated UI test coverage, helping expose particularly problematic edge cases, as well as performing manual exploratory and acceptance testing

  • Collaborating with testers across the organization to share knowledge and testing solutions, as well introduce common best practice

  • Accepting or invalidating changes done on the application. The Desktop & Web applications have millions of users and we need to keep the quality high.

  • Taking part in defining acceptance criteria for new features and changes delivered by the team, as well as deciding whether a change can be pushed to the users or not.

  • Working with the support team to help debug, identify and assess issues which are affecting our users.

item.title: Senior Java Consultant for PaaS & SaaS technical consultancy at Amido (London, UK)
item.description:
Amido don’t say yes to every project that comes our way. Where a problem is ill-defined, a technology redundant, or a system bogged down in legacy code we frequently say no, but when the right client has the right project – which is happening with increasing frequency as we gain a reputation – we need the power to say yes.


As a Senior Java Consultant you’ll be responsible for planning the Java-based solutions that solve each client’s unique business problems. Working directly with client stakeholders you’ll form an understanding of needs and define solutions, guiding technical direction of the Java stack throughout, ensuring quality coding and adherence to appropriate design patterns.


Your predominant on-project focus will lie with coding. Following Agile methods including TDD and BDD you’ll pick up user stories from the product backlog, take part in daily stand-ups and produce thoroughly tested, deployable Java code, at times guiding other Java Consultants to do the same.


The projects you work on will be Cloud-based with J2EE components built as Microservices and deployed to a Cloud platform. Much of our work is focused on the creation of APIs in Java 8 using Rest or Json, we typically use containers and NoSQL databases depending on the project.


Stacks are determined on a project-by-project basis and with internal discussions constantly driving adoption of the right tech for the right task, this is something you’ll make a key contribution to.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineers - passionate, humble problem solvers. at DueCourse (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
At DueCourse we're looking for engineers who are passionate about developing powerful and effective apps and platforms. We’re looking for people with a keen interest in creating disruptive technology, working within a team, in fast-paced, startup environment, and who are able to collaborate with other teams looking to solve the same challenges.


Software Engineers have a penchant for solving complex and interesting problems. Pushing the boundaries of the status quo, you will perform technological feats in an autonomous environment and will be presented with exciting challenges.


DueCourse is passionate about empowering small businesses through innovative financial technology. Our first product allows small businesses to access the money in their unpaid invoices whenever they like, in just a few clicks.


As part of this effort, you will work in the heart of the engineering teams to build great products and features.

item.title: Senior Java Developer: World's most widely-used security testing software at PortSwigger Web Security (Knutsford, UK)
item.description:
For nearly a decade, we have worked at the cutting edge of the web security industry, and our suite of tools is well established as the de facto standard toolkit used by web security professionals.


Our suite of tools, known as Burp Suite, helps security testers, IT professionals and developers (just like you!) write, deploy and maintain secure web applications. Our product is used by more than 22,000 individuals, in 6,000 organisations, in 100 countries.


The team behind Burp Suite is growing steadily, and we are currently looking for outstanding Java developers to join our core product team.


What will you be doing?


We are looking for developers, who are able to work closely with other high achievers on a highly collaborative team, to help architect and implement new editions of our product suite. We are fanatical about the quality of our software and, therefore, would love to meet candidates who are able to help drive quality and excellence into everything that we build!


Essential attributes:



  • Understanding of Java APIs for networking, threading, reflection, and user interface (Swing / JavaFX).



  • A thorough understanding of Agile/XP/TDD methodologies for collaborative development, with the ability to demonstrate a strong commitment to implementing these practices consistently on a day-to-day basis.



  • Ability to quickly understand a large existing codebase, begin applying incremental changes, and identify opportunities for code refactoring.


Why join PortSwigger?


We are genuinely Agile: we employ rigorous TDD; we pair-program on a daily basis; we work off a single code branch that is always release-ready; we have regular team retrospectives and knowledge-sharing sessions.


We have rapid release cycles with updated versions of our software automatically pushed to our users, so you will quickly see your code deployed to a huge global audience.


We offer a healthy, high-tech working environment. All developers work on the latest Mac Pros, with dual monitors, sitting-standing desks, and (if they are so inclined) walking treadmills!

item.title: Senior Back-end Engineer at Hippo (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you interested in building something revolutionary? How about changing the way digital experiences work?


Responsibilities
As a part of Hippo’s Engineering team, you will be responsible for developing new features for our digital experience platform. You enjoy taking initiative, diving deep into emerging technologies, and working with open source software and projects in an agile and highly collaborative environment.

item.title: Java Developer x n at CroninGroup PLC (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
CroninGroup PLC is a digital company doing chemistry, developing combined chemistry, hardware and software solutions leading to Chemistry's ultimate digitisation. As a vibrant high growth technology company, newly released from academia, we are looking to expand our distributed development team with keen, energetic, talented engineers who share our passion and vision.


For our Glasgow office we are looking for full-time Java developers to commence and head the four core application tiers:Multi-platform front end, cloudable application sever, hardware big data harvester, and Android/IOS App.


What we offer:



  • Commensurate salaries, little red-tape, freedom to innovate, like-minded colleagues, your toolchain and frameworks (within limits), and the ability to design and develop your own implementations to our challenges.


What you need:



  • 3+ years' proven Java commercial development skills, developing one or more of the above tiers.

  • Self-driven, smart creative, numerate graduate.

  • Can-do, "yes" mentality.

  • Ability to work with same.


Job Type: Full-time


Required education:



  • Bachelor's degree,ideally, numerate


Required experience:



  • Java: >= 3 years

item.title: Front end Javascript developer for innovative UX led projects at Zuhlke Engineering Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Zuhlke is a European software engineering consultancy that helps businesses turn ideas into reality. We need people who are capable, talented, and engaged to help build systems for our clients, based mainly near our expanding London office. We take on interesting projects in many domains, including media, finance, heavy engineering, and medical devices.


Your job will involve working in small teams, communicating closely with our clients to develop, test, and ship software that meets their needs. You will be looking both to contribute to the company and to grow personally.


Our reputation is fundamental to our business, so our culture emphasizes quality, reliability and respect. As a privately-held company owned by past and present employees, and run by engineers, Zuhlke takes a long-term view. For example, you will receive twenty days training per year, including a budget to support activities such as conference attendance, our annual technical camp, and participation in focused topic teams. We like our staff to be technically flexible so, if you don’t have a required skill now, we can support you learning it.


Your job will include:



  • Helping our clients understand what they really need

  • Building quality systems to satisfy those needs

  • Working collaboratively with colleagues and clients

  • Working in Agile teams utilising a variety of processes and methodologies including Test Driven Development, Exploratory Testing, Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Scrum, Lean and Extreme Programming


You will benefit from:



  • A generous allowance for training (9% of your time and a budget)

  • An achievement-based career path where you can gain responsibility while remaining technical

  • A competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package

item.title: Senior Android Developer - craft performance into 'on the go' solutions... at Mimecast (London, UK)
item.description:
Mimecast is looking for a highly skilled Android developer to join their Mobile Team.
The ideal candidate will have experience across the full stack of mobile development from client to server and the skills to build high-performance applications. You will have a proactive approach to problem solving, be a source of ideas and be comfortable working in a dynamic environment where interaction is essential for delivering hi-quality applications within tight deadlines.


Primary Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Working in conjunction with other mobile developers in supporting and creating new functionality for Mimecast’s Android solutions.

  • R&D of cutting edge solutions that may influence future developments of the Mimecast platform.

  • Interacting with other teams to optimize software integration and solutions.

item.title: Full Stack Developer - Building applications for media workflows at New Media Research (NMR) (London, UK)
item.description:
This is an exciting opportunity to become a key part of a small software development team at a leading London media technology solutions provider.


You’ll be working on many client projects, from public facing applications to internal engineering tools and integrating the software we sell with third-party systems and services. We are focussed on delivering tools and applications to improve the workflow experiences for our customers and provide insightful business intelligence tasks. We care about system stability and providing excellent customer support. We like to build quickly and evolve and try to find a good balance between predictable stability and rapid development.


You’ll cover both backend services mostly in Python (Django), and front-end in HTML/Javascript (Angular 1/React) along with integrations to RESTful web services.


We work with the Vidispine content management platform and Cantemo media asset management software as well as a host of supporting media technologies, which we deploy on-premise, in the cloud or a combination of both.

item.title: Exceptional JavaScript Engineers, York at Anaplan (York, UK)
item.description:
EXCEPTIONAL JAVASCRIPT ENGINEERS, York


Originally founded in York where our core engineering team continue to be based, Anaplan also has engineering teams at our Headquarters in the heart of San Francisco, Paris and our brand new offices in central London. With major year on year growth, we are a truly global company with 16 offices worldwide.


You may not have heard of us yet…we operate in the enterprise software space but don’t underestimate the success of Anaplan – we’ve disrupted the biggest players through our tech and continue to do so. We’re trusted by hundreds of Fortune 2000 companies, and building on the back of our success, the sky is the limit to what we could be doing!


Now, we need experienced JavaScript Engineers to be part of our rapidly expanding global engineering effort (we are also looking for outstanding Java Engineers and Tech Graduates!)


Anaplan offers the best of both worlds - we have all the perks of a start-up based out of Silicon Valley, we are able to change and adapt quickly but we also have the support of a highly successful, market-leading company. We invest in our staff, providing training from leaders in their fields, send our Engineers to tech conferences all around the world to ensure we stay ahead of the curve and know all about the latest tools and technologies, and a lot of our team have families, so we really appreciate the need for a flexible working environment and a good work/life balance


ABOUT:


Our production system is written in Dojo which we’re in the process of re-building using React with a focus on fixing the quality of our automated testing. The data we work with is large and complicated so performance is a particular focus. QA work closely with Developers, and they use Java to functionally test the application with Selenium.


We use the best of breed tooling to aid collaboration: GitHub Enterprise, Jenkins, WebStorm, IntelliJ and Eclipse. We use Slack for messaging worldwide. We operate in Agile teams with JavaScript Engineers building the main application and the Java Engineers building the backend - everyone runs whichever OS they prefer with a choice of equipment.


JUST A FEW OF THE THINGS WE OFFER:



  • A beautiful, award-winning working environment in a Grade II listed, converted warehouse right on the river in the centre of York.

  • Excellent salaries, bonuses and stock options - we’re serious about attracting the very best in the industry.

  • A long list of comprehensive benefits worthy of a leading Silicon Valley tech firm.

  • A rewarding, progressive career with a company that values diversity, a good work/life balance and invests in you.

  • The opportunity to work with and learn from a diverse mix of of exceptionally skilled people.

  • A family friendly work environment - many of our team have children so everyone knows what to expect…we also have Summer and Christmas parties just for the little ones!

  • Regular social events - we try to do fun things every month, monthly catered lunches, lots of treats on a Friday, fresh fruit deliveries twice a week, a full stocked kitchen and perhaps most importantly, premium coffee machines!

  • Casual dress code, a (discounted) gym right across the road, showers, bike storage, health & fitness clubs and plenty of places to think!

  • The chance to be part of the continued growth and success of a pre-IPO, hyper-growth company worth over $1billion and in the top 30 global Cloud Tech companies (Forbes, 2016)

item.title: Senior Front-end Developer at Hippo (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
We are looking for a Senior Front-end Developer who has experience with web application development. Developers with a talent for writing elegant code and a gut feeling for nice user-interfaces. Your main task is to develop new user interfaces for our product Hippo CMS. In the newer parts of the product we use javascript 6 (ES2015+) and SCSS as core languages, the AngularJS framework to build the UI and our frontend tools include npm for dependency management and webpack as a build system.


Responsibilities
As a Senior Front-end Developer in Hippo’s Engineering team, you will be responsible for researching and developing new user interfaces for our product, Hippo CMS. You enjoy taking initiative, diving deep into emerging technologies, and working with open source software and projects in an agile and highly collaborative environment.

item.title: C# .NET Developer at The Coventry Building Society (Coventry, UK)
item.description:
IT at the Coventry Building Society is changing; we are currently undertaking an exciting transformation project that will shape the future of the organisation. As we progress on our journey we are seeking talented individuals who are passionate about delivering an outstanding experience for both members and colleagues in an environment where you will have the opportunity to be part of the future success of the organisation and work in an environment where personal and professional development is taken seriously.


What you’ll need to succeed:

We are looking for three enthusiastic software engineers who are keen on making a difference, open to collaboration, willing to embrace new technologies and can hit the ground running.

You need to be comfortable working with stakeholders at all levels and show flexibility and adaptability to the business needs in a growing organisation. The winning candidate should be able to demonstrate a passion for code quality and willingness to share this with their colleagues.


About the team:

As a team, we work really closely with each other and various areas of IT. This enables us to maintain a ‘family’ feel to what we do; you’ll support, care and succeed together. Within this close-knit team, you’ll have opportunities to grow with us and to play a key part in a thriving, growing organisation – you’ll feel like you belong. Appealing, right?

That’s not all! We’re passionate about what we do, whether this is conducting our key processes, making change happen to procedures or supporting the local community. We’ll actively encourage you to be involved in a variety of fun, frantic fundraisers that can range from cake sales, to ‘I’m a Celebrity’ style eating contests.

You’ll take pride in being here, and to make sure that you can cram all of this into a typical week as a Software Engineer, we are closely aligned to the Society values. These are designed to make sure you’ll do what’s right and we deliver our main promise; putting members first.



What we offer:


• Salary £36,000 - £47,000
• Pension Scheme –this is 5% of your basic salary
• 15% annual bonus
• Holidays -Minimum 23 days holiday
• Childcare allowance scheme
• Success Share scheme
• Sports and Social Club
• Learning & Development


If you have the required skill set and desire to be part of our success please do not hesitate to make an application.

item.title: Technical Lead - Cloud and Open Source Technologies - Civil Aerospace Project at Elastacloud Limited (Derby, UK)
item.description:
Technical Lead - Derby – Circa 50K


An exciting opportunity to lead the technical deliverables on a variety of projects for a one of our clients, a leading Civil Aerospace Company in Derby.


The Technical lead must have a proven track record of project and product delivery together with outstanding technical and programming knowledge.


Benefits in return, we will offer the successful Technical Lead:



  • Competitive salary.

  • Career progression.

  • The chance to be part of a leading Big Data provider in the UK and to join a really forward thinking, exciting and growing company with a fantastic, relaxed company culture.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Hippo (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Responsibilities
You will monitor, manage and operate our next generation platform, Hippo OnDemand. You’ll be working with concepts such as: agile, scalability, elasticity, PaaS, SaaS, real-time monitoring, self-service, open source, automation and the cloud. You will collaborate with customers, partners and various Hippo departments in order to create a truly groundbreaking product. You will be part of a small, dedicated and cross-functional team where you will have a large and diverse set of responsibilities to support Hippo, its customers and its partners, and build infrastructure and tools to increase automation, improve efficiency of the engineering team.

a10:author.a10:name: Technische Hochschule Nürnberg Georg Simon Ohm

item.title: Softwareentwicklerin / Softwareentwickler at Technische Hochschule Nürnberg Georg Simon Ohm (Nürnberg, Deutschland)

item.title: Experienced Backend Developer at Citrusbyte () (allows remote)
item.description:
Our engineers have experience in a consultative environment, excellent communication skills and a desire to work with talented teams building innovative products. We work closely with our clients, sharing our experience to help them better define their products.


Most of our projects are written in Ruby, so experience in this language is required.


We believe that less is more and value simplicity above all else. This is reflected in the tools we choose to work with. For this reason we tend to avoid using big frameworks like Rails and instead use smaller tools like Sinatra, Roda or Cuba.


We have also done projects in Node.js, Go, Python, Lua, etc. And strive to learn new tools and languages everyday. We believe in always choosing the right tool for the job and we are very open minded about trying different technologies.

item.title: Experienced Frontend Engineer at Citrusbyte () (allows remote)
item.description:
Our engineers have experience in a consultative environment, excellent communication skills and a desire to work with talented teams building innovative products. We work closely with our clients, sharing our experience to help them better define their products.


We are looking for JavaScript experts that are always learning and adapting to the ever-evolving frontend landscape.


The ideal candidate has experience working with React and has a thorough understanding of the options and tools available for managing the application’s state and their underlying functional programming concepts.


We are excited about Elm and interested in ClojureScript and Om Next and we want to work with people who share our passion!

item.title: Software Engineer adept at handling Big Data required at Abide Financial Ltd (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for motivated and forward-thinking Software Engineers to join us in our mission to make financial markets safer - what we do is important to everyone!


You will be:



  • Eager to take on some challenging problems

  • Working as part of a strong and passionate team to deliver key projects

  • Maintaining and improving our existing code base

  • Acting as a point of reference and support for Junior Engineers

  • Able to contribute ideas to the team

  • Developing software to keep us at the forefront of the Transaction Reporting space



  • Engineering solutions to allow us to process large amount of data on tight timescales

  • Writing automated tests

  • Supporting continuous improvement of products and processes

  • Leading by example with regard to best practice in coding

  • Helping to make the financial sector safer for everyone

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Abide Financial Ltd (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for passionate and driven Senior Software Engineers to join us in our mission to make financial markets safer - what we do is important to everyone! We process 15m lines of data every day, and this is increasing month on month.


You will be:



  • An experienced developer with demonstrable experience which will allow you to hit the ground running

  • Working as part of a strong and passionate team to deliver key projects

  • Responsible for maintaining and improving our existing code base

  • Taking ownership of work streams, mentoring junior programmers, and helping to drive the quality of work produced by the department

  • Developing software to keep us at the forefront of the Transaction Reporting space

  • Engineering elegant solutions to allow us to process large amount of data on tight timescales

item.title: Full-stack Engineer #1 at Credit Kudos (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for our first full-stack engineer. By full-stack we mean someone who is content writing a browser/mobile application and then building the backend to run it all. We’re a small, early-stage team and don’t have room for over specialisation; you’ll be doing a bit of everything and need to be cool with that.


We're building a new way of interacting with financial services by democratising the credit scoring process. This is the single most important access point for mainstream financial services and it's broken.


We’re a completely flat/transparent operation, preferring whiteboards over loud voices. We manage our engineering process through a combination of Slack, GitHub, email and duct tape.


What you’ll be doing:



  • Developing beautiful user experiences with the help of React, Redux, Rails and any other tools you see fit.

  • Applying sophisticated machine learning techniques to analyse financial behaviour with Python and Spark.

  • Optimising product deployments to serve thousands of concurrent requests with Terraform and Docker.

  • Working with whatever tools you need to feel productive.

  • Debating the relative merits of London’s many craft breweries, coffee houses and carrot cakes.

item.title: Windows C++ Developer (Software Security) Cambridge, UK at Bromium (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for Windows C++ Developers to join our engineering team in Cambridge. You will be designing and developing a complex enterprise class security product based on micro-virtualization. You will need to attack hard problems and be able to tackle areas that are poorly documented or undocumented and build robust solutions.


We would welcome applications from candidates with proven commercial development experience as well as from recent graduates with C++ knowledge.

item.title: QA Engineer at Masabi (London, UK)
item.description:
The QA Team


Within the world of QA, there is often a reference to the ‘Testing Stereotype’. This stereotype refers to obstacles and separation between QA and Developers. The end result is tension within the team, owing to many issues such as a breakdown of communication. 


Here at Masabi we disagree with this stereotype. Our QA’s are an integral part of our teams, working alongside our product managers and developers to assure quality and completeness. QA is the heart and soul of ensuring that the capabilities which we are providing to our customers are as seamless and bug free as possible. 


What will you be doing as our Quality Analyst?



  • As a QA at Masabi, you will be the key component of ensuring that the quality of our products is the responsibility of the team.

  • You will have the opportunity to work across a variety of applications and services including mobile apps, back office apps, APIs, databases, and even embedded software running the hardware readers that we fit to buses or station gates.

  • We follow agile principles, which means we regularly ship updates to our customers for pre checks and production. You will therefore be responsible for feature and regression testing these updates.

  • The Dev and QA teams are given the power to deploy to our pre-production customer environment, which is the way it should be.

  • Devops is also something which we think is wonderful, however; we do not forget about QA in this. As a QA you will have valuable input into how we can improve our products and environment config. 

  • You will also have access to the chance to play with environment config in your very own test environment, to ensure that we find and squash as many of those bugs as we can.

  • Our test coverage consists of manual and automated testing.


Some tools we use:



  • Testrail

  • Selenium

  • Appium

  • Protractor

  • Puppet

  • Bamboo

  • MySQL Workbench.

  • Charles Proxy

  • HockeyApp

  • Postman

item.title: Lead Full Stack Developer wanted to build and head up new team at Social Circle (London, UK)
item.description:
Our Social Circle keeps getting bigger


A short while ago we saw the need for a platform that tracks, trends, evaluates and reports on social influencers around the globe, so we built one. Now it seems that our customers agree with our decision. We have sales in the UK and US, enquiries from around the globe, a strong sales pipeline and investment to grow the business. 


Originally developed by an outsourced team, we are bringing our dev team in-house, recruiting a number of key team members to help develop the product at speed, grow the platform and scale up the business.


We are looking for someone who wants to be in at an early stage to build a team from the ground up and lead this team to help shape the product and build a global market-leading product.

item.title: Front End Developer at Social Circle (London, UK)
item.description:
About the role


We are looking for a talented ambitious Front End Developer to work in our London office to help shape an exciting product in its early stages.  


Our Social Circle keeps getting bigger


A short while ago we saw the need for a platform that tracks, trends, evaluates and reports on social influencers around the globe, so we built one. Now it seems that our customers agree with our decision. We have sales in the UK and US, enquiries from around the globe, a strong sales pipeline and investment to grow the business. Social Circle is scaling up, not starting up.


We work with many blue chips and have significant profile with brands and marketing agencies in the UK and US, and plans to develop these markets, and many more. 


Originally developed by an outsourced team, we are bringing our dev team in-house, recruiting a number of key team members to help develop the product at speed, grow the platform and scale up the business.


We are about to launch a SaaS version of Social Circle to brands, as well as target two others user verticals and want to build a great team to create a set of market leading best in class products.

item.title: Mid Level Back End Developer wanted to join exciting scale up at Social Circle (London, UK)
item.description:
About the role


We are looking for a talented ambitious Back End Developer to work in our London office to help shape an exciting product in its early stages.  


Our Social Circle keeps getting bigger


A short while ago we saw the need for a platform that tracks, trends, evaluates and reports on social influencers around the globe, so we built one. Now it seems that our customers agree with our decision. We have sales in the UK and US, enquiries from around the globe, a strong sales pipeline and investment to grow the business. Social Circle is scaling up, not starting up.


We work with many blue chips and have significant profile with brands and marketing agencies in the UK and US, and plans to develop these markets, and many more. 


Originally developed by an outsourced team, we are bringing our dev team in-house, recruiting a number of key team members to help develop the product at speed, grow the platform and scale up the business.


We are about to launch a SaaS version of Social Circle to brands, as well as target two others user verticals and want to build a great team to create a set of market leading best in class products.

item.title: Mid-level Web-developer / PHP programmer at Biff New Media (London, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking a web-developer with good working knowledge in server side application development. The candidate should have a proven track record of completing projects on time and generally exceeding expectations. Ideally will have minimum of 3+ years of experience working in PHP as well in high-level front-end development in html, css, javascript.


What is the job?


The position encompasses every elements of day to day web production, programming and production management. 



  • Building standard-compliant HTML from design templates provided

  • Design, building and maintaining server-side application including databases

  • Providing creative solution and guidance for projects 


Currently we searching for developers who have the following attributes



  • A passion for coding

  • Creative, logical and analytical thought processes

  • Ability to work under pressure

  • Excellent follow through (i.e testing and QA)

  • Keep abreast of current technology

  • Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving 

  • Take initiative and work independently but draw upon strength of the team


Recruitment Agencies: Please do not contact us or forward any potential candidate details. We do not use agencies to fulfil our job vacancies.
