POP is a great place to work, and we care about our team and about creating high quality software that we can be proud of.


Some of the things we'll be working on over the next months include expanding our payroll product, and our scheduling and messaging platform, and developing secure document management functionality.

item.title: Micro Services Java Developer at CDL (Stockport, UK)
item.description: If you are an experienced Senior Java Developer with solid knowledge of OO design principles as a minimum then we have a brilliant opportunity available. Our current platform is developing Microservices utilising Spring Boot, Java 8, messaging with ActiveMQ, TDD with JUnit and Mockito, Gradle, Elastic Search Stack, JSON Restful Web Services and Spring Cloud. DevOps automation culture using AWS, EC2, S3, Terraform and Jenkins build pipeline. Agile working with Scrum or Kanban and Insurance knowledge would be useful.

item.title: Software Engineer for an agile and inventive engineering-led F1 team at Manor Racing (Banbury, UK)
item.description:
As a member of the Software Development group, you will be part of an agile SCRUM team dedicated to providing tools and services to the wider business, including Race and Performance Engineering, Vehicle Science, Marketing, Operations and others. You will work on some of the most advanced bespoke software products currently under development in the industry, using the latest technology stacks, cloud infrastructure and development environments.


Role type: Permanent


Reporting to: Software Development Manager


Relationships



  • During your working time you will be interacting with a number of internal product owners, external suppliers and technology partners. 

  • Product Owners/Subject Matter Experts across the business 

  • Cloud Infrastructure Partners/Suppliers 

  • Vehicle Sensor Data suppliers 

  • Technology vendors providing tools and components 

  • Track-side engineering group when in assignment


Main Tasks & Responsibilities


As a software developer within a team that uses SCRUM agile methodology, you are expected to actively participate in the application lifecycle, sizing and estimation of stories and working through the tasks for each story you take ownership of within a sprint cycle.


You will participate in the design sessions with the rest of the team, take ownership of whole or part of a product and you will be expected to invent, create, simplify processes and tools and challenge the status quo if you genuinely believe that there is a better way to do things.



  • Depending on the skills set can be lead on one product and play a supporting role across others 

  • Working closely with developers who lead the development of other products 

  • Deliver across the entire app life cycle – concept, design, build, deploy, validate, release to target environments 

  • Working directly with other developers and product owners to conceptualise, build, test and realise products

  • Gather requirements around functionality and translate those requirements into elegant functional solutions 

  • Build prototypes at the scoping stage of projects to ascertain the most appropriate technology to use 

  • Keep up to date on the latest industry trends in software development and F1 technologies 

  • Attend appropriate events/conferences both on behalf of the team but also our technology

As a senior member of the Software Development group, you will be part of an agile SCRUM team dedicated to providing tools and services to the wider business, including Race and Performance Engineering, Vehicle Science, Marketing, Operations and others. Software Development Manager

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Cake Solutions Limited (Stockport, UK)
item.description:
Cake Solutions is looking for a DevOps Engineer with a real passion for on-going learning and continual skills development.


The role will involve creating and maintaining Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines, to ensure automated and repeatable development processes.  You will be helping to build and deploy system infrastructure in a cloud-focused environment while providing operational advice to developers when appropriate.  Our experienced, cross-functional agile teams enable the delivery of entire solutions not just lines of code.


Cake team members are published authors, prolific bloggers and experienced speakers. They have extensive experience in designing, building and implementing scalable Reactive Applications and are encouraged to continually research, innovate, and to publish thought-leading insights.


Reporting: This role reports to the Lead DevOps Engineer, Core DevOps Team.
Location: Cake Solutions Global HQ - Houldsworth Mill


Role Overview:
A DevOps Engineer in the Core DevOps team is responsible for implementing, and driving best practices for enterprise deployments and software development lifecycle automation. This includes providing solutions that are robust, scalable, and highly available. Ideally, the candidate has previous exposure or experience with distributed system design, which includes cloud-capable systems and deployments.

item.title: Javascript/Angular developer at Colossus Bets (London, UK)
item.description:
We're on the hunt for a talented front-end developer. The perfect candidate is at home in Angular, and has a programming background. You will be part of a very efficient team, producing exciting work at a rapid pace and with the latest tech.


You are a focused self-starter who is now looking to take your career to the next level by joining a dynamic startup environment.

item.title: Senior Cloud Engineer - enabling AWS for global academic research platforms at Elsevier (London, UK)
item.description:
Elsevier is in the midst of a transformation and technology is simultaneously at the forefront and the driving force.  Our innovative technology platforms and smart content solutions operate at the cutting edge of big data, semantic web and cloud technology, enabling faster more effective critical decision-making daily across the globe.


Based from the AlphaBeta Building the role will take responsibility for supporting the Elsevier portfolio and at time will provide direct support to ScienceDirect which is the world's leading collection of science information on the web and Elsevier's flagship product.  


The technology transformation that is taking place across Elsevier is being delivered by newly formed agile teams across the globe.  The Senior Cloud Engineer will be part of the Central Infrastructure Operations team who extensively use AWS, Puppet and Ansible to provide development operations support to the Elsevier products and platforms (ScienceDirect, Mendeley, Scopus to name a few).  The role will be part of and support new and fast-growing cross-functional development groups from the early stages with a remit to help shape the technology platforms which the development team utilise.


The role


We are seeking a talented and self-motivated Senior Cloud Engineer who will assist in the design of a functional and maintainable network who will help build AWS production and development environments and keep systems working at an optimal level within the larger global infrastructure of Elsevier.  You will be joining a new and fast-growing agile team in our Central London offices to help deliver high volume, high availability and high performance web sites.  This is an exciting opportunity to play a leading role in changing the way that web products are delivered within the company, devising and implementing a modern approach to software engineering that enables continuous delivery and releases features on-demand.


The role holder will have excellent stakeholder management skills as you’ll be part of the Central Infrastructure team whilst supporting cross-functional product development groups who use agile management and engineering practices.


Key Tasks



  • Build and maintain the right cloud infrastructure architecture, balancing performance and resilience with cost.

  • Work on projects as wide ranging as:

    • Migration of infrastructure to AWS from on premise servers

    • Building and maintaining a monitoring estate

    • Building and maintaining a set of tools that enable developers to self-serve for most operational tasks

    • Defining, and maintaining a configuration management system

    • Managing a CI/CD pipeline

    • Building and maintaining an auditing and reporting estate that provides all relevant information on current and historic working state of infrastructure.

    • Helping build out process and define structure round a new and growing team that will change as it grows



  • Monitoring live services and responding quickly and effectively to any problems

  • Managing Core services such as JIRA, GIT, Jenkins, etc.

  • Ability to deliver TIO strategy in partnership with the business platforms needs

item.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer - build a next generation Open Science plaform at Elsevier (London, UK)
item.description:
Elsevier is in the midst of a transformation. Technology is simultaneously at the forefront and the driving force. Our innovative platforms and smart content solutions operate at the cutting edge of big data, semantic web and cloud technology, enabling faster and more effective critical decision-making daily across the globe. 


Our goal is to organize knowledge sharing amongst researchers in order to speed up discoveries through better access to Scientific Content and Research. We’re enabling researchers to share their experimental data in real-time and in a secure manner and so promoting collaboration between scientists globally.


This innovative service is based on a new acquisition to the Elsevier portfolio in Hivebench the powerful Laboratory Assistant within a cloud computing platform which ensures protection, ownership and controlled distribution of results.   Our ambition is to become a major player in the “Open Science” (Open Source for Science) and to provide tools with very high added value for our customers.


About us:



  • We are committed to building cohesive teams where communication, support and innovation thrive. Instead of taking a top-down approach to new ideas, all members of the team are empowered to contribute. Great ideas can come from anywhere!

  • We’re a truly global company. We are expanding our capabilities and offer a stimulating environment, enabling bright, passionate people to do their best work.

  • You will be working in a modern and spacious new building, constructed with the sole purpose of encouraging creativity and collaboration.

  • Computer Science degree

  • Extensive experience developing with Javascript

  • Experience building dynamic web-apps

  • Demonstrable experience designing and developing web applications including experience using Full Stack JavaScript

  • Experience working with both backend (Node.JS, Express.JS, MongoDB, etc.) and frontend (Angular.JS, Ember.JS, React.JS, etc.) or Meteor.JS

  • Broad industry knowledge - comfortable with concepts like REST, Behavior Driven Development (BDD) and tools like Heroku, and Amazon Web Services

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, especially the ability to explain complex technical subjects to a non-technical audience

  • Demonstrable experience to provide direction and leadership for a team of engineers

  • Preference to have experience with in-house app deployment (Docker, vagrant, virtual machine environment...)

  • Be an active contributor to Open Source projects on GitHub and/or Stackoverflow


About you:


You’re an expert and passionate about what you do!  You’ll use your extraordinary attention to detail to drive your projects to succeed at the highest level of quality and always look at improving your knowledge.  Things move quickly so you’ll be able to work under pressure and be comfortable with a fast-paced technical environment with changing priorities. You can deliver on short term objectives in an agile environment (Scrumban) without forgetting the bigger longer term goal.   


You will be joining a new Agile team in London where you will support the growth and development of a small and dedicated team and there is the potential in time for this role to take on lead responsibilities for this group to enable the evolution of Hivebench within the Elsevier portfolio.

item.title: Java Developers at CDL (Stockport, UK)
item.description: Here at CDL, we love what we do. On a daily basis we deliver industry-leading software and solutions to insurance market giants such as Tesco Bank and moneysupermarket.com – and now you can join us too. We’ve got an exciting software role up for grabs. We are passionate about Continuous Delivery, Scrum, TDD and Lean delivery practices. If you have the skills to help us we should talk.

item.title: Coffee lovers, can you monitor what is going on! at Sky Betting & Gaming (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
What you tell your friend your friends you do?


We keep the bets coming in.


What you'll really be doing?  


Maintain a stack of hundreds of servers and applications and provide the glue that binds them all together. Automate everything. Monitor everything


How will you be doing this? 


Be a full stack engineer, know your databases to your codebases.  Good team work, planning and incident management


What we worked on in the last quarter  


Platform stability and patching was the main drive but Operations is ubiquitous and we have fingers in all the pies from infrastructure to code.


What a day in the office looks like?


Start with a brew (Yorkshire Tea of course!) there will be lots to do.  Deal with any incidents or near misses from the night before. Proceed with any open tickets or attend meetings to plan for the new day.


The team:


Web Operations is made up of 6 engineers that have strong operational backgrounds across a number of disciplines and skills from developers to infrastructure specialists.  The team works both as a central operations function for the entire Bet Tribe and are also embedded in development teams providing operational support, training and guidance.

item.title: Full stack engineer - react, node.js <disrupting learning> at EduMe (London, UK)
item.description:
At EduMe we are facilitating the emergence of a modern workforce that can work anywhere. As such, we expect to have a profound impact on the lives of the people we interact with.


We are building our in-house development team at the moment, so there is a great opportunity to impact the product and the whole engineering culture of the company.


Tech-wise we're currently using React and Redux on the front end, On the back end we're using Node, as well as using many SaaS services to allow our developers to focus on the most specific problems in our business. We also develop native Android applications and will soon be adding iOS.

item.title: Senior Javascript Engineer (Berlin) at mycs GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Help us revolutionize E-commerce by building real-time 3D customization tools with a world class team of creative, smart and passionate people in the heart of Berlin!


mycs is changing the way we buy things online. Our vision is to revolutionize E-commerce. All our products are sold using photorealistic, real-time 3D customization tools. In the past, we have built Massivkonzept, the leading online shop for customized furniture. mycs builds on this experience and is currently building a team in Berlin, focusing on building cutting edge technology and improving the E-commerce customer experience.


We are looking for a enthusiastic


Senior JavaScript Developers (AngularJS/Node.js) (m/f)


As one of our Senior JavaScript Developer (m/f) you will play a major role in our development team and help us create a fabulous E-commerce platform with cutting edge 3D customization tools.


YOUR TASKS



  • You design and implement efficient and reusable software and web-applications for our Ecommerce platform with its demanding real-time 3D customization tools

  • You work closely with our international, highly skilled and professional development team in an agile development environment

  • You identify and address performance issues

  • You train yourself continuously to ensure that your skills are up to date


OUR OFFER


Join a creative, smart, self-motivated, and experienced group of people at a successful company where your input will make a real difference. We offer a competitive compensation package, flexible working times, and great opportunity for advancement and long-term career building. We invest in the personal development of our people and provide high-end equipment for their work.


We work in short cycles in order to adapt our software continuously to our business needs. We like to use the newest available technologies and mainly use open source solutions when it comes to development. We work in small, agile teams using methodologies such as SCRUM, Kanban, pair programming, TDD/BDD and continuous integration/deployment. Your ideas are always welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better. Besides a dynamic, highly motivated international team, you will find minimal hierarchies, quick decision-making and a pleasant working atmosphere.


For more details: https://de.mycs.com/career

item.title: Python Developer - Possibly the best job in the world at Octopus Investments (London, UK)
item.description:
Exceptional opportunity to be a key part of a small team at Octopus that is building high volume fintech platforms. Our first product, OctopusChoice.com is the fastest growing p2p lending platform in Europe. We have two other fintech products in development, and are also running an Accelerator, so you will be constantly: exposed to innovation, building new products, and engineering for high growth. Fun!


YOU:
 - Python developer with several years of experience.
 - You code because you love to "build stuff".
 - You want the "stuff you build" to be used by loads of people.
 - You spend your evenings and weekends working on your own side-project(s).
 - You have a "can do" attitude and love to experiment, tinker and play.
 - You've failed often enough to know you're not perfect.
 - (But secretly you know you're pretty darn good).
 - One of your side projects (almost) received seed funding.


US:
 - Privately held company, launched in a bedroom 15 years ago, now with 500 employees and £6 billion (with a b) under management.
 - We're one of the largest VCs in Europe.
 - We love entrepreneurs.
 - We're building a series of FinTech platforms that will take the industry by storm.
 - We're happy for you to keep working on your side-projects.


WHAT?
 - You will be a key part of a small team that will build very high volume FinTech platforms from the ground up.


WHY?
 - Flexible working hours.
 - Exceptionally diverse/multinational team.
 - Salary (tell us what you are worth) + benefits.
 - Stunning office.
 - Fun.


WHERE?
We're ideally looking for a candidate who can work from our offices in London, but are willing to consider someone in the commuter belt who would come in to the office 2-3 days per week, and work from home the remainder of the time. We're also willing to consider fully remote.


WHAT NEXT?
 - Send a brief cover letter and a CV.

item.title: Software Engineer- Jruby/Java- Leading Open Source Company at Elastic () (allows remote)
item.description:
Logstash is a popular, open source data processing platform and an important component of the Elastic Stack. Users have downloaded Logstash millions of times for its simplicity and extensibility. Over the last few years, Logstash has evolved to become a powerful server-side data processing platform responsible for ingesting terabytes of data into Elasticsearch and other systems.


The Logstash team is responsible for developing the core infrastructure and its thriving plugin ecosystem. Most parts of Logstash is written in JRuby, but recently core components have been implemented in Java. As Logstash matures into being a ubiquitous data pipeline, our team is building new features to make it resilient, faster, and easier, to drive our next wave of adoption. You'll work with a diverse, distributed and fun loving team based in North America and Europe. The Engineering organization at Elastic is different — we are spread across 30+ countries, have a flexible, family-friendly work schedule, make great software, love autonomy and most importantly, love our users.


What would I do?




  • Design and develop new features in Logstash core and its plugins.




  • Write open source code in Java and JRuby.




  • Explore new stream processing features and implement them in Logstash.




  • Integrate new cloud services with Logstash to expand the reach of its input and output plugins.




  • Our environment is highly collaborative; we use tools like Zoom, Slack and Github heavily. You'll work with other development teams from UI, Cloud and Elasticsearch, support engineers and solution architects regularly as you develop new features.




  • Speak at conferences, meetups and internal events.

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer at Sky (Brentford, UK)
item.description:
Site Reliability Engineer


Sky is the world market leader in digital satellite broadcast technology with over 10 million Sky subscriber homes across the UK and Irish Republic.


Making bold decisions is a big part of our history at Sky – and with talented people like you on board, we’re confident it’s going to be a big part of our future. OTT delivers an exciting range of internet TV products that’s revolutionising the industry, with fresh ideas and the latest technologies.


Joining us in the Reliability Engineering team you will be at the core of ensuring that we deliver all these fantastic products at an industry beating level of availability and performance.  


Background


Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is what you get when you treat operations as if it’s a software problem. Our mission is to progress, protect, and provide for the software and systems behind all of Sky's public services – NowTV, SkyStore, SkyGo, to name just a few - with an ever-watchful eye on their availability, latency, performance, and capacity. 


This is an unusual job, unlike others in the industry. Like traditional operations groups, we keep important, revenue-critical systems up and running  We hire people from both systems and software backgrounds. Strong candidates will have experience with both. 


In SRE, we flip between the fine-grained detail of disk driver I/O scheduling to the big picture of service capacity, across a range of systems and a user population measured in millions. We drive reliability and performance across massive scale by mastering the full depth of the stack. 


As a Software Engineer on the Persistence Reliability Engineering team, you will have the opportunity to tackle the complex problems of scale while using your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis and large-scale system design


Key Responsibilities:



  • Review software to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Sky’s services.

  • Solve problems relating to mission critical services and build automation to prevent problem recurrence

  • Influence and create new designs, architectures, standards and methods for large-scale distributed systems.

  • Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning.


Our benefits package is designed to recognise the essential part you play in Skys success. We offer free Sky+HD, broadband and talk services; private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlements, a contribution pension scheme, a Share scheme so you can have a stake in Sky and our success plus Sky Choices a benefit scheme to help you make valuable tax & national insurance savings.


It’s our people that make Sky the UK and Irelands leading entertainment company. That is why we work hard to be an inclusive employer, so everyone at Sky can be their best.


If you are appointed to this role you will be subject to the successful completion of a Criminal Record Check.


Sky - Believe in Better

item.title: Remote full-stack JavaScript developer for successful open source project at Resin.io (London, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:

Working on Etcher involves both UI-level work focused on extreme usability, and deep low-level work focusing on optimising the writing to flash drives across Linux, Windows, and macOS.


You ...

... are an excellent communicator, fluent in English.
... have a good internet line available so you can join a video call without trouble.
... are comfortable completing projects without too much management.
… are excited by the challenge of developing reliable software that works on all platforms
... have a portfolio of code to show, on GitHub or otherwise.


If so, join us!

item.title: Senior .NET Developer at the NWs Number 1 Digital Agency Episerver, ASP.NET at Amaze (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for a talented .NET Developer to work on a number of leading web design and build projects, as well as e-Commerce implementations for blue-chip customers.


You will be working in our Manchester office in a close team environment with various technologies, including .NET CMS frameworks such as Episerver. We pride ourselves on giving Developers the opportunity to broaden their experience and innovate with new technology.


Ideally, you’ll be able to demonstrate 3-5 years of proven project experience and an ability to very quickly learn new technologies and working practices, as well as embrace the challenges of working in a fast-paced development team.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Input to architectural changes and recommendations on continuous solution improvements.

  • Leading development activity and partake in build breakdown and estimation sessions.

  • Ensure that the delivered websites are efficient, clean and meet the client expectations.

  • Lead investigations into issues and problems. Work closely with the wider production team to identify the root cause. Report on findings and make appropriate recommendations for improvements.

  • Lead software demonstrations or present technical recommendations to the wider team and the client.

  • Strive to improve more junior developers through code reviews, pair programming and formal mentoring.


COMPETENCIES/SKILLS REQUIRED:



  • 3-5 years’ experience with ASP.NET MVC web applications

  • Proven experience of working with major CMS products, preferably EpiServer

  • Proven experience of creating robust scalable web applications

  • Experience of working with GIT based version control systems.

  • Experience of working on e-commerce solutions, EPiServer commerce experience advantageous

  • Code delivery via continuous integration pipelines and through automated deployment tools, knowledge of Team City and Octopus deploy an advantage.

  • Experience of developing Responsive web front ends using HTML5, CSS and JavaScript techniques advantageous

item.title: Java Developer at NCR (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Job description




NCR Corporation (NYSE: NCR) is a global technology company leading how the world connects, interacts and transacts with business. NCR's assisted- and self-service solutions and comprehensive support services address the needs of retail, financial, travel, hospitality, gaming, public sector, telecom carrier and equipment organizations in more than 100 countries. NCR is headquartered in Duluth, Georgia.

As part of its billion dollar transition to a software driven company, NCR has identified Edinburgh as the location for a Centre of Software Expertise. Building upon an existing, highly skilled and successful team we are looking for people to join us in a development environment that emphasizes creativity, collaboration and product ownership.

We are looking for a Software Engineers to join our Edinburgh Centre of Development Expertise. This is a very productive, talented and successful group which promotes an environment that fosters creativity, collaboration, mutual respect and accountability. Staying ahead of the new technology curve is a massive challenge, especially in software development with its constantly changing landscape of products, frameworks and programming models.

We Are An Agile Engineer Led Development Organisation And Operate Continuous Build And Test Across Multiple Technical Disciplines


  • Java

  • Javascript/HTML5/CSS3

  • iOS/Android

  • Spring/Hibernate

  • MongoDB, SQLServer

Job

Software Engineering

Primary Location

Europe-United Kingdom-Scotland-Edinburgh

Schedule

Full-time

item.title: Senior Front End Engineer at Ticketmaster (London, UK)
item.description:
Are you the next senior front end engineers we’re looking for? Join the Ticketmaster team to help us design, build and scale a new generation of products and services with the latest technology like ES6, React and Node. Working with a talented pool of engineers, architects and UX experts in a DevOps culture, you’ll help guide and deliver the engineering vision with a special appreciation for crafting exceptional user experiences.


The future of accessing live events starts here. We provide our Software as a Service to clients to enable fans access to tickets across multiple platforms 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Our systems work at scale; handling tens of thousands of concurrent users, selling thousands of tickets for massive sporting, music, multi-show stadium, touring, festivals and thousands of smaller events globally. Every large event on-sale is a Black Friday for us. Working at this scale and keeping up with rapidly changing technology ensures that even the most innovative person will be consistently challenged and pushed to develop new solutions in a highly collaborative and diverse organisation.


Responsibilities 



  • Take technical ownership of the front end code base and best practice.

  • Create clean, testable JavaScript for dynamic high performance websites.

  • Build cutting edge UI for multiple devices.

  • Drive standards in performance, scalability and reliability.

  • Share knowledge through workshops, documentation, code reviews and coaching.

  • Follow software development best practice.

  • Coach and mentor junior team members.

item.title: JavaScript Developer - award-winning data visualization software at Cambridge Intelligence (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are an award winning start-up based in Cambridge (UK). We make KeyLines, an innovative browser-based visualization software toolkit, which lets organisations see and explore networks in their data.


Continued commercial success means we now need another experienced JavaScript developer to join our engineering team.


You will have worked in a software product-based environment and have a minimum of 2 to 3 years current experience of JavaScript development within a software product environment. You will be passionate and opinionated about software development and code quality. We manage our development in an agile manner with fortnightly sprints and daily stand-up meetings, with early and frequent releases. We maintain close relationships with the developers who use our code, so you should have good communication and interpersonal skills.

item.title: LEAN UX EXPERT (m/w) at LoadFox GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are hiring:


LEAN UX EXPERT (m/w)


Gestalte mit uns den Erfolgsweg von LoadFox - der Mitfahrzentrale für Fracht!


Wir sind ein Münchner Logistik-Startup und verfügen durch unsere Investoren MAN und Boston Consulting Group (BCG Digital Ventures) über eine gesicherte Finanzierung sowie ein breites Branchennetzwerk.


Unsere Online-Plattform LoadFox.eu adressiert ein großes wirtschaftliches, umwelt- und verkehrstechnisches Problem. Europaweit bleibt ein hoher Anteil des LKW-Frachtraums ungenutzt, wodurch jährliche Mehrkosten in Höhe von 100 Mrd. € entstehen. Mit unserer Plattform, die die LKW-Touren in Anbetracht der Routen, Lenk- und Ladezeiten und der Wirtschaftlichkeit kombiniert, lösen wir das Problem.


Als LEAN UX EXPERT (m/w) bist Du für die Entdeckung der Probleme unserer Kunden und für die Lösungsfindung verantwortlich.


Deine Aufgaben sind:


  • Durchführung von Kundeninterviews und Erfassung von User Stories

  • Aufstellung von Kunden-Problem-Lösung Hypothesen

  • Konzipierung und Durchführung von Experimenten zur Prüfung von Hypothesen

  • Erstellung von UI Konzepten anhand von Wireframes

  • Brainstorming im Team anhand des Business Model Canvas

item.title: IT Developer at Hans Anders (Gorinchem, Netherlands)
item.description:
Ben jij constant op zoek naar vernieuwing, puzzel je graag om bepaalde rapportages te kunnen draaien en zoek je een dynamische baan? Kom dan de ICT-afdeling van Hans Anders in Gorinchem versterken met jouw kennis, inzet en betrokkenheid!



IT - Developer


Fulltime 38 uur



Wat ga je doen als IT Developer?
Als developer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verder uitbouwen en onderhouden van onze rapportageomgevingen, onderhouden van bestaande database- en vb.net applicaties en zorg je voor de doorontwikkeling van deze applicaties.


Je werkzaamheden bestaan vooral uit het vertalen van wensen uit de organisatie naar de juiste oplossing(en) en het analyseren van gegevens uit de verschillende databases, enerzijds voor rapportages, anderzijds om problemen op te sporen en op te lossen. Verder communiceer je goed met interne klanten, waarbij de aandacht vooral uitgaat naar het helder krijgen van de vraag maar ook het afstemmen van planningen en het doorgeven van de voortgang horen hierbij. Door middel van het maken van documentatie en vastlegging van (afgehandelde) vragen en problemen draag je zorg voor continuïteit binnen de afdeling en binnen de organisatie. Tot slot neem je ook deel aan projectgroepen om verdere ontwikkelingen uit te werken en te implementeren.


Hans Anders is continu bezig om zowel haar producten als de dienstverlening richting klanten te optimaliseren en te verbeteren. Dat zien we terug in de hoge score op klanttevredenheid! Hoe motiverend is het om aan de slag te gaan op een afdeling die verantwoordelijk is voor een optimale werking van applicaties en de juiste infrastructuur? Zo draag je direct bij aan het succes van ons mooie merk Hans Anders.

Europaweit bleibt ein hoher Anteil des LKW-Frachtraums ungenutzt, wodurch jährliche Mehrkosten in Höhe von 100 Mrd. € entstehen. Mit unserer Plattform, die die LKW-Touren in Anbetracht der Routen, Lenk- und Ladezeiten und der Wirtschaftlichkeit kombiniert, lösen wir das Problem.

item.title: Python Developer @ Sky Tickets - a lean start-up backed by Sky at Sky (Isleworth, UK)
item.description:
As a leading UK entertainment company we’re committed to bringing our customers better choice, better technology and better entertainment. Sky Tickets is an exciting new venture which launched in March 2014.  We’re focused on extending the entertainment we provide in the home to the best entertainment out of the home – we call it ‘sofa to seat’. Our vision is to create a better way to buy sports, music and entertainment tickets.  


Sky Tickets is a lean start-up backed by Sky so we have access to the great marketing, rights holders, technology and commercial relationships across Sky, as well as the benefits of being a small agile team who can flex and change.  Join us as a Python Developer and you'll be part of a dynamic team that makes sure our technology delivers the best experience for our customers. 


Your Key Responsibilities



  • Be a constant source of technical information and direction for the team

  • In weekly iterations using Scrum you will showcase the functionality you have completed to the Product Sponsor, customers and stakeholders and deliver high-quality working software to a production environment.

  • Mentor and develop more junior Developers as we bring them on board with your help

  • Continuously challenge the ways of working to ensure continuous improvement within the team

  • Develop software specific to any number of features/functions of our product.

  • Agile Agile Agile Software development.

item.title: Senior Java Developer - Vehicle Information Platform Squad at Auto Trader (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Here at Auto Trader UK, we work in tribes, each tribe has a different customer focus and is made up of a number of technical squads. Our Vehicle Information Platform squad are part of the Technology & Infrastructure tribe and they’re responsible for developing and maintaining the core advertising platforms for Auto Trader. It’s our job to create flexible and robust services to support all parts of Auto Trader digital advertising. To power our services, we work with the DVLA and industry bodies to ensure we provide the best vehicle information for our retailers to promote their vehicles, giving the public the most accurate information to help them with their purchasing decisions.


We love agile and work in small squads to ensure each squad has a focus and a mission. This way we ensure every squad member counts has a voice, shares ideas and is involved from the moment they join. We deliver great products to our customers and we use test-driven / continuous delivery practices to build RESTful JSON web services, Apache Kafka message streams, Apache SOLR search capabilities and web applications using Java. We make sure our systems can scale to meet the demands of high-traffic services with millions of requests per day. We really care about how performance impacts our customers. We’re looking for people with a deep interest in technology who are comfortable finding and adopting new technical approaches all the way from the browser to the database - it's a fast moving market so we have engaged and responsible self-organising teams.

item.title: Infrastructure and Automation Engineer for Automatic Factory of the Future at CloudNC (London, UK)
item.description:
CNC milling machines are at the heart of manufacturing with almost half a trillion dollars worth of components produced by them each year. Despite this, their software is in the dark ages. Industrial CNC machine in action: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=80iIhfjTm5I


We’re researching and applying breakthrough AI methods to control these machines automatically and more optimally than ever before, revolutionising how the things around us are made. From MacBook cases, to jet engine turbines.


Our mission is to make milling machines one click devices that can produce a part easily, efficiently and with minimal human intervention.


Working with us, your role would be wide ranging. We place an emphasis on using modern configuration management tools to automate both deployments and routine maintenance tasks. You would be responsible for setting up and maintaining our internal services, our production environment and more generally our cloud infrastructure.

item.title: Full stack .Net Developer - Leading automotive retailer with a reach to millions at Pinewood Technologies (Birmingham, UK)
item.description:
Pinewood Technology is part of the Pendragon group, the largest car retailer in Europe. Within the development team we are responsible for the group web operations of Pendragon's flagship brands - Evans Halshaw, Stratstone and Quickco, with a monthly reach in excess of 2 million visitors a month. This means your work would have a massive audience from day one!  


Due to increasing investment in Pendragon's web operations, we are looked, at as a vital part of the group to provide cutting edge web presence to the largest dealership group in Europe. We therefore need talented full-stack developers to join our team and continually innovate to keep us ahead of our competition.


The ideal candidate has worked within a Microsoft development environment, has excellent problem solving skills, and is eager to build new features in an enterprise system, improving our existing code base. 


You will be working in a team of highly talented developers who will value your opinion on how problems can be solved. As part of this team you will be able to regularly make suggestions within grooming sessions and sprint planning that can help shape the system and improve our offering to a large retail audience. We are always eager to encourage staff to learn new things and as such give Pluralsight licenses to our staff, allowing them time within their sprints to improve their skills.


Within Pinewood you will be valued for the work you do as a truly full-stack Developer and be given the opportunity to take ownership of projects and see how you can progress in your career from day one.

item.title: Full stack .Net Developer - SaaS ERP provider to the Automotive Industry at Pinewood Technologies (Birmingham, UK)
item.description:
At Pinewood, our Developers get to influence and enjoy access to the full development life cycle, working within a truly full stack development role.  You could be involved in enhancing a range of features and challenges, in which no two days are the same. We are constantly improving our product so it is fit for a growing global market.


Your core skill set will include:



  • JavaScript

  • jQuery

  • HTML5 /CSS3

  • ASP.Net and C#

  • SQL


We are a multi-skilled team that loves working with people who don’t mind chiming in with their opinions. If you are excited by solving complex challenges and furthering your career in a growing organisation, we’d love to hear from you!


A typical day for one of our developers:


9:00: Get my morning coffee and make breakfast


9:15: Arrive at my desk and catch up on any emails


9:30: Get involved in the morning stand-up and talk about successes you have had the day before


10:00: Start work on a new feature laid out in the sprint plan


11:00: Feedback session with Mentor on active projects planning how I will approach upcoming work 


11:30: Tackle a complex problem within one of my projects I have been working on alongside my team lead


12:30: Go out with the team for lunch


13:30: Refactor a section of code helping to bring our product up to the latest standards


15:00: Spend some time researching a technology on Pluralsight to hit targets in my personal learning plan


16:00: Do some code reviews on TFS of peers


17:00: Handle a few customer support requests


17:30: Finish up on some work


18:00: Maybe use the onsite gym before heading home!

item.title: Full stack .Net Developer - Automotive Retail software at Pinewood Technologies (Birmingham, UK)
item.description:
As a .Net developer with a quality first in mind, mentality you know there’s no such thing as “perfect code that can be left alone, everything has room to improve”.


What you will really be doing



  • Work on the software that drives the profitability and success of car dealerships written in .net.

  • Continuously improving the current code base and driving forward the system with the addition of new features.

  • Actively taking ownership of tasks from sprint planning through to review. Taking pride in the delivery of great features and improvements.

  • Working in a collaborative environment, where you can foster your own talent and the talent of others.


How will you be doing this :



  • You’re part of an agile, multidisciplinary team. You bring your own unique skill set to the table and relish the opportunity to solve problems.

  • You prioritise your work with the team and its product owner, weighing both the business and technical value of each task.

  • You experiment, test, try, fail and learn all the time - with one thing at a time.

  • You are comfortable questioning established practices to further your learning and the skills of those around you.


Team


You will join a development practice of over 60, you get your own team work pod, expert product owners and project leaders help guide the process and represent client’s needs.


We offer



  • Money and a 5% bonus.

  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, have a generous car discounts being part of the largest dealership group in Europe and access to a range of corporate a discounts including holidays internet and much more.

  • Room for you to do things your way.

  • Lots of things you can learn through our learning and development programme with a Pluralsight licenses and progression monitoring from a mentor and team lead.

  • 25 days of paid leave, from day one in the business!

  • An onsite Gym to keep your body as healthy as your mind (if that’s what your into!).

  • We hold regular tech talks in which you can learn and hone new and existing skills.

  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free fruit, Tea, Coffee.

item.title: Senior Developer at Government Digital Service (GDS) (London, UK)
item.description:
You’ll share the responsibility for the digital transformation of government. As developers we work in small agile teams and focus on how we can make things better for users, who are at the centre of everything we do.


GDS developers move between projects on need and request, which allows them to develop new skills and experiences. Above all, you’ll want to make government better, which may sometimes involve challenging the status quo.

item.title: Graphics Modeling Engineer at Apple (London, UK)
item.description:
In this role your main function will be to write code for functional or performance modeling for GPUs and the functional or performance model infrastructure. This includes working with architects and designers to understand the units being modeled and interpretation of functional specifications to derive a model.


Description


Create bit-accurate C/C++ model of the GPU architecture Work with the verification team to identify model and hardware bugs Work with the software team to identify model and software bugs Develop performance model for micro architecture trade-offs Integration of the performance model into the functional model Run analysis on the model Rollup and present results and recommendations Enhance the performance modeling infrastructure

item.title: Full Stack Developer at True AI (London, UK)
item.description:
Would you like to see a machine that can carry on an intelligent and helpful conversation? Love deep learning and language processing? Excited by the start-up environment? Want to be part of the next wave of AI-driven innovation in customer care?


If you answered yes to the above, you could be just what we’re looking for…


True AI is a venture backed artificial intelligence startup that automates customer support using machine learning/deep learning. Our product is the result of our own research, building on top of cutting-edge deep learning breakthroughs. The founders are deep learning experts, with backgrounds at labs of names such as Yoshua Bengio and Amazon. We have just closed our funding round and are now looking to hire our first smart and strongly motivated people.


We need a Full Stack Developer who is passionate about taking AI to the next level, and who is interested in building the company alongside the founders. You will be playing a key role in the development of our main web application and browser based plugins, as well as integration to and development of our backend that enables our deep learning models to provide suggestions to operators.


WE OFFER



  • A full time position as a Full Stack Developer with us in London.

  • An opportunity to work on cutting edge technology.

  • An opportunity to shape a product in multiple development stages and progress it to a fully fledged commercial solution.

  • Continuous learning as you work alongside our technical team, solving some of the world’s hardest technical challenges.

  • As much responsibility as you like. We are a startup, afterall.

  • Competitive salary and stock options.

item.title: Backend PHP Web Developer at My Future Cloud (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for a mid to senior software developer with a strong knowledge of backend language in order to lead our backend web developer team.


MFC works with a wide range of businesses and is constantly evolving the projects we work on. Our customers range from small start-up firms working on their first business idea to large established companies launching brand new services.
We work on everything from WordPress based brochure sites to fully custom built platforms, and we are now expanding into app development.


Here are just a couple of projects we are currently working on:



  • Building a social networking app for business professionals

  • Building an ecommerce store for a new start-up

  • Building a web platform for racing clubs


The candidate will be working on a number of different projects from a backend perspective. This could be anything from a website, all the way up to a full scale app.


We work with WordPress a lot to build websites/platforms, so you might be building & extending plugins for us to work with. You will also have a crucial role in building up the backend of client apps, and linking in with API’s/databases.


We are also looking for someone to bring their own ideas to the table, not just for client projects, but also for future technologies.


Some of our exciting upcoming projects include hybrid app build for a P2P restaurant recommendation service, and a fully custom built ecommerce platform for interior designers.


We are always learning with each new project we take on and constantly seeking to challenge and develop our skills.


Furthermore, by joining MFC you can expect to join a rapidly growing company at a critical stage of its development. As a result, you will be given a significant degree of freedom and responsibility to work across a range of client solutions and projects.

item.title: Python Developer (100% Remote but in a European Timezone) at Hotjar () (allows remote)
item.description:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.


We are looking for exceptional and ambitious Python developers who would love an opportunity to learn more and become full stack developers. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 120,000 users from 184 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.


What are we looking for?


As a developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. Besides Python, you will also be given training on front-end languages and frameworks (such as AngularJS) allowing you to become a full-stack developer.  You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

item.title: Front-end Developer (100% REMOTE, must be in a European Timezone) at Hotjar () (allows remote)
item.description:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.


We are looking for exceptional and ambitious front-end developers who would love an opportunity to learn more and become full stack developers. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 120,000 users from 184 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.


What are we looking for?


As a developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade JavaScript code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. Besides JavaScript, you will also be given training on back-end languages (primarily Python) allowing you to become a full-stack developer.  You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

item.title: Lead Platform Engineer at comparethemarket.com (Peterborough, UK)
item.description:
Design and build core software infrastructure to help every UK household save time and money.


What gets us out of bed each morning is the opportunity to use technology to make customers’ lives even easier.


Is this you?


Creating and promoting the environment for realising Continuous Delivery, where change can be delivered to the hands of customers as quickly as possible with the lowest risk to service, will be what makes you tick. You will have an appetite for leading talented engineers; creating and promoting technical standards and guidelines for teams at comparethemarket.com.


You display a pathological focus on performance and reliability alongside great breadth and specific depth of technical skills, with the mental agility to become expert in new technologies in a proactive fashion. You’ll thrive on contributing to the culture of innovation, enthusiasm, and passion.

item.title: Mid-level C# Web App Developer at Globe Business Media Group (London, UK)
item.description:
Do you want to be part of a company that puts innovation and quality at the heart of all its products?  We are seeking a proactive and passionate web application developer to join the team in our London office.


The successful candidate will be an integral member of the team and will develop, maintain and ensure the smooth running of our websites and web applications.


The web application developer will report into our IT director and will be based in our offices in the vibrant Borough Market in London Bridge.


Why join us


Globe’s people are core to our success: we’re as proud of them as we are of our market-leading products. We know that great people make great products and they also make for a great place to work. Innovation is a core part of our culture; we fuel it with our open working environment, transparency and the freedom we give employees to voice their ideas and opinions.


As a company we believe in having fun just as much as working hard.  We socialise together regularly – whether it’s a yoga class at lunchtime or a pint in the pub, time spent with colleagues outside of work is highly encouraged.


Key responsibilities



  • Iteratively develop new application features so that the stakeholders can evolve requirements as more is learnt about the new feature

  • Write code that follows the company’s patterns and practices, is fit for purpose and secure with automated tests in conjunction with a senior developer

  • Ensure all code is extensible and future proof in conjunction with a solution architect

  • Take part in peer reviews with other developers to improve code quality and share knowledge

  • Ensure all feature work is tested before it is sent for QA

  • Use only technology from the current team technology menu

  • Identify the cause of issues in the application reported by the customer services team and locate the underlying cause

  • Communicate bug descriptions including the impact to customers to the customer services team

  • Communicate the status of your own work in progress and planned work at the daily stand up

  • Participate in the team retrospective, estimating and planning sessions every two weeks

  • Log notes of decision made and other pertinent details in the issue tracking system

item.title: UI Developer at printed.com (London, UK)
item.description:
Role & Responsibilities



  • Implement requirements for new functionality, content and changes to required sites or applications as required by the business

  • Ensure pages/ functionality developed are/is unit tested before system testing

  • Deliver changes as requested for both the BAU and project work streams, ensuring that only changes that have been approved/ signed-off by 'the business' are implemented

  • Hand-write and test elegant cross-browser and backward compatible code, validation to W3C standards

  • Ensure that project progress is communicated effectively; projects are delivered to schedule and ensure that only authorised changes are delivered

  • Support on technical designs

  • Participate in weekly "Think Friday" activities; hack days, presentations and workshops

item.title: C# / .Net Software Developer (f/m) at Chal-Tec GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
What you can expect



  • Work closely with the departments on successful implementation in project-based teams

  • Put your knowledge toward existing solutions based on ASP.NET, C # and VB.Net to make them even more stable and to keep performance strong

  • Use various API connections in the form of REST, SOAP or XML to provide international marketplaces throughout Europe with data and to deal in real-time e-commerce

  • Use the direct database connection and interaction with the ERP system to your benefit

  • Test your knowledge and procedures in documentation and workflow charts available to your team


Your day-to-day work



  • A good mix of different software development fields working on our shops in more than 15 countries

  • With 13 brands in over 50 stores, there is something for every taste

  • Collaboration with a variety of marketplaces provide each project with its own unique expression and thus varied software development

  • Reporting and communication with the relevant departments is quickly and easily maintained in JIRA

  • Sprint planning is done with the teams, and you will be regularly asked for your own assessment with regard to expenses and problem solving

item.title: Java Developer - Customer Experience & Operations at Auto Trader UK (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Are you looking for a role that allows the kind of autonomy and creativity that will enable you to shape our external and internal customer’s journey? If so, the CXO Engineering Squad is the place for you. We’re looking for a Java Developer to join us and play a key role in product development that will ensure we remain digitally at the forefront of customer experience.


The Squad is responsible for numerous products including our custom customer management tools and the new self-serve platform for our retailers. We operate in a lean fashion, always iteratively developing our products. It’s challenging, but the rewards are huge! The squad work in a true agile environment driven by our customer’s needs. The variety is endless, from front end user experience using AngularJS through to telephony integration, the development is plentiful and the opportunity for growth is massive!

item.title: Database Administrator at Auto Trader UK (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Here at Auto Trader our business is split into tribes and squads. Each tribe has a focus and everyone within the tribe has a common aim. The technology & infrastructure tribe has multi-discipline squads and their purpose is to "lead continuous delivery and innovation of the Auto Trader platform."


They are looking for a database administrator to join them and take on this purpose. You’ll be working with a variety of technologies, continually improving our databases and be part of a team that supports the web hosting platform for Autotrader.co.uk.


So what do we think makes an amazing database administrator? Awesome communication skills and ability to work with a wide range of people is a great start, as you’ll be working within an Agile and Kanban delivery model. You will need a broad understanding of managing databases in highly available distributed environments. We’re also looking for someone who is interested in automation, moving towards infrastructure as code and constantly evolving and pushing the boundaries.


So what is involved we hear you ask. Well, on a day-to-day basis you’ll be monitoring and supporting databases including Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, MongoDB and Vertica - ensuring stability and reliability. You’ll be developing and maintaining the database environments and ensuring optimal security and auditing of all database environments. You’ll be installing, configuring and backing up all databases and ensuring patches are applied as and when required. There will be databases that require performance tuning and you’ll be an escalation point for incidents and problems relating to the databases, including out-of-hours on-call cover.


You will also be managing and planning capacity requirements of the databases and it will be your responsibility to create and maintain documentation for all database systems and procedures.


The tribe are a curious lot and they are always on the lookout for new technologies and open to suggestions for continuous improvements to the environment. As you can see, determination and curiosity are two company values that run deep throughout the tribe and they are looking for a likeminded individual to join them. The tribe uses an Agile and Kanban approach to assist with the delivery of any projects and work so you’ll feel comfortable with this way of working. DevOps is very much the mind-set when working with a variety of different people and teams around the business.

item.title: Development Team Lead (infrastructure architecture, large scale web apps) at Envato (Melbourne, Australia)
item.description:
• Leadership opportunity in Envato Engineering

  • Create & drive the Technical Vision for the Platform Infrastructure team

  • Named Australia's Coolest Company for Women & one of the Best Places to Work



We are continuing to grow and we are looking for a Development Team Lead for our Platform Infrastructure team. The opportunity is to lead a team of  platform infrastructure developers. This team is responsible for designing, implementing and operating the infrastructure and tooling used by the many product development teams in delivering their services and systems to our customers.   


We believe strongly in the "You wrote it, you run it" philosophy and our Platform Infrastructure team is charged with helping our development teams and streams do this in an intelligent and efficient way.

Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, Envato is the leading marketplace for creative assets and creative people. With more than 300 staff and contractors worldwide, we've helped a community of creative sellers earn more than $400 Million. Millions of people around the world choose our marketplace, studio and courses to buy files, hire freelancers, or learn the skills needed to build websites, videos, apps, graphics and more. You might be surprised to know that we run some of the biggest websites in the world!

Recently, JobAdvisor awarded us the title of Australia's Coolest Company for Women and we were named as one of the Best Places to Work in Australia in the 2015 and 2016 BRW Awards.


All applicants will be considered for all open engineering roles across the Envato marketplace (Market, Tuts+, Studio, etc.)



Can you Meet the Expectations of Envato's Engineering Team?

At Envato, our Engineers expect certain things of each other. Not all of these are easy to uphold. Are you ready to join the team and meet the expectations of your peers at Envato? Read about the expectations and how they were developed by our team on our technical blog. 



What you'll be doing

As the Development Team Lead  of the Platform Infrastructure team, you’ll be focused on providing their technical vision and leadership.  You'll design, manage and operate systems to solve problems that cross team boundaries in addition to working to raise the bar in the infrastructure space across the whole company.

You will collaborate with the technical leads of other teams to evangelise infrastructure best practices throughout the company.  You'll help identify the need for cross-team services  and offer solutions that range from the creation of "sensible defaults"  to be used by teams when they implement through to fully managed services for them to use.

You will be responsible for the entire lifecycle of your services;  from forecasting and budgeting, the roadmap for the service through to the building operation of systems and services.  

You’ll also play a significant role in company-wide infrastructure architecture discussions.
You may line manage other developers in the group.


What we're looking for



  • Substantial technical leadership and infrastructure architecture experience at least five years

  • Very strong technology skills in building and supporting large scale web applications

  • Strong familiarity with patterns of infrastructure design and system integration

  • Demonstrated ability to communicate complex ideas to nontechnical and technical people

  • Experience managing technical staff

  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills

  • Proven effective in working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment, ideally using Agile processes

  • Highly self-motivated and directed

  • Ability to effectively prioritise and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment requiring adaptability

  • Displays integrity and ethical behaviour; interacts fairly, honestly and professionally in all business dealings

  • Ability to increase the team’s output without slipping quality

  • Ability to establish relationships and work with other business teams (support, marketing, legal, etc.)

  • Ability to take and give constructive feedback

  • Will promote the team within the local and global development communities

  • Displays honesty, openness, fairness, transparency and integrity in line with Envato’s Values



A Great Team and Culture



  • Developers are responsible for features from inception through to them being in the hands of customers. The developers talk directly to customers about what they're working on

  • We do continuous delivery properly: any team member can deploy, and we routinely do dozens deploys a day

  • Our infrastructure is hosted in AWS

  • We publish portions of our code as open source, and contribute back to open source projects we use

  • We were recently named Australia's Coolest Tech Company by JobAdvisor and one of the Best Places to Work in Australia

  • A fantastic culture of creatively minded, hard working people who are passionate about Envato and being part of its growth and success

  • Flexible working conditions – we want you to love your work but also your life outside of Envato

  • We actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from discrimination

  • In addition to hiring for our Melbourne CBD office, we will also consider applications from those who would like to work remotely (Australia wide)

  • Future career progression will be available across the entire business - we're big on internal opportunities and professional growth!



Who should apply?


We care deeply about diversity at Envato, and welcome applicants of all types, and from all backgrounds. If you think you have the skills and experience needed for this role then we'd like to hear from you.



What next?
Submit a cover letter, an up to date copy of your resume and answers to the below questions. Good luck!


We care about your privacy. By submitting your application you are agreeing to our Privacy Policy. If you’re into reading legal documents or you’re keen to know more about how we handle your personal information read our Privacy Policy before you submit your application.

item.title: C# .NET Web Developer (make key decisions, be in charge of your work) at Intrinsiq (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
As a lead developer in Intrinsiq’s UK office, you’ll work closely with the owners of the company with a wide set of responsibilities and the opportunity to contribute across as much of the business as interests you. Intrinsiq’s team is focused on providing the best education management systems to international clients, and we need an engineer who can both produce great software but also work closely with our top clients to deliver the bespoke service they required.  


You’ll work with a wide array of technologies (some of which you probably won’t be familiar with when joining). So a desire and ability to learn new tools is essential. We’re looking for a self-starter who will work on both new development and help modernise our existing codebase and upgrade clients. You’ll be working directly with the our Chief Engineer and UK Manager, to develop the tools that will allow the company to grow in the long term as well as deliver established system upgrades.  


From the first day, you’ll be given a lot of responsibility, so you must be able to work and get things done independently. Although the core role is development, you will need to pitch in where needed (including admin, sales and support).


Duties and Responsibilities


You will:



  • Work on legacy systems and keep them maintained and running until upgrades are complete

  • Manage and upgrade legacy clients to our new products

  • Work on our next generation product, working closely with our CTO

  • Put in place unit tests and quality control mechanisms to improve our codebase.

  • Look after clients and diagnose and resolve their issues.  

  • Visit clients (after training) and collect specifications / modifications required.

item.title: .Net Web Developer at Monarch Airlines (Luton, UK)
item.description:
To be a key member of the Web Development Team by assisting in designing, implementing and supporting core web applications across the groups’ various brands and websites.


Key Objectives



  • Liaise with business owners and project managers, in an agile environment, to ensure functionality requirements are fully understood

  • Provide accurate estimates on development work

  • Take business requirements and deliver well designed, high quality, maintainable and reusable web applications that are well documented

  • Support the production websites

  • Liaise with third party suppliers to achieve development goals and support the production environments

Develop web applications


Take business requirements and deliver well designed, documented, built and tested web applications to the live web environment.


Support the live Monarch group web sites and environment


Investigate reported website issues, work with the team to develop solutions and release in a timely manner to reduce impact to the business.


Ensure technical standards are adhered to and maintained along with the Web Team Leader and team members


Code reviews of peers, documentation of standards and best practices.


Keep up-to-date with current industry developments and new technologies


Ensure personal knowledge and skill levels are maintained and current. Look to implement these skills into the working environment

item.title: MS Dynamics Business Analyst at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Cognizant was one of the first integrators to establish a dedicated support practice for Microsoft Dynamics CRM. We are now a Gold Certified Partner with one of the largest teams in the world. Gartner recently acknowledged us by positioning Cognizant in the "Leaders" quadrant of CRM service providers.


We help our customers get the most out of Dynamics, both as a traditional on premise software or through the cloud. Our services include consulting, roadmap development, testing, maintenance and migration.


We now have an opportunity for a lead Business Analyst to join the practice.


You will be  responsible for leading analysis and functional specification for  Dynamics CRM projects for UK&I customers in target verticals Insurance, Financial Services, Public Sector, Retail and Utilities. 


Key Accountabilities:



  • The primary duties of the role is business analysis and functional specification for MS CRM implementation,   undertaken by combined Cognizant onsite/ offshore delivery team

  • Lead relationship with customer SME and business users to capture functional and non-functional requirements  through techniques including workshops

  • Functional design and specification documentation

  • Undertake configuration of  MS CRM 2011  to 2016 solutions

  • Lead testing, data migration and training workstreams

  • Share responsibility with project  workstream leads for the delivery of  high quality implementation that meets   customer and Cognizant expectations of quality, time and cost



  • Business development



    • Supporting the MS CRM UK Competency Lead and Offshore Centre of Excellence Lead in defining vertical and   horizontal MS CRM offerings

    • working with the offshore centre of excellence to develop these offers

    • consulting with and reviewing offers with vertical teams

    • supporting pre-sales activity to close new business.

    • supporting  proposal efforts

item.title: MS Dynamics Solution Architect at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Cognizant was one of the first integrators to establish a dedicated support practice for Microsoft Dynamics CRM. We are now a Gold Certified Partner with one of the largest teams in the world. Gartner recently acknowledged us by positioning Cognizant in the "Leaders" quadrant of CRM service providers.


We help our clients get the most out of Dynamics, both as a traditional on premise software or through the cloud. Our services include consulting, roadmap development, testing, maintenance and migration.


As a Solution Architect in the Microsoft Dynamics CRM UK Practice you are responsible for leading architecture and design activities as well as guiding the development of Dynamics CRM projects for UK&I customers in target verticals such as Insurance, Financial Services, Public Sector, Retail and Utilities. 


 Responsibilities:


The primary duties of the role is solution architecture and technical design authority responsible for MS CRM implementation, undertaken by combined Cognizant onsite/ offshore delivery team



  • Architect high quality solution to meet customers functional, non- functional and regulatory requirements

  • Overall technical design authority with responsibility for signing off technical deliverables

  • Share responsibility with project workstream leads for the delivery of  high quality implementation that meets customer and Cognizant expectations of quality, time and cost


Business development:

  • working with the offshore centre of excellence to develop these offers
