item.title: Android Developer at Jongla Oy (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
Hello, developer. Do you want to build a messaging product for billions? Would you like to be part of an international and ambitious team innovating a social messaging service for a worldwide user base?  


We are hiring an experienced Android Developer to our team in Helsinki! This role is focused on building the Jongla Android app, involving all the client-side parts of the software, but it can also include the whole spectrum of software engineering tasks.


You will be working in a multidisciplinary team, collaborating to develop and maintain the product. Our ideal co-worker is dedicated, able to learn continuously and comfortable with challenges and change. We value previous experience from working in a startup, but having the right kind of self-starter mentality is what ultimately matters.

item.title: DevOps Engineer, London at Lloyds Banking Group (London, UK)
item.description:
Lloyds Banking Group is changing. We’re rapidly transforming into a digitally-led business on a massive scale in order to better serve our customers. We’re already the largest provider of digital banking products in the UK, with over 12 million active online customers and nearly 8 million active mobile banking customers. It means a big opportunity for you to be part of ground-breaking transformation and it means there’s never been a more exciting time to join.


This is an excellent opportunity for a driven candidate to join us as a DevOps Engineer in one of our cross-disciplinary teams. As DevOps is not a "thing you do" but a cultural change more than anything, you’re expected to drive this change and ensure that we embed agile and DevOps principles in everything we do.


In return, you’ll enjoy an exciting, innovative environment that supports flexible and agile working. You will work in a highly collaborative way to drive efforts to build, support and improve our tools for continuous integration, automated testing and release management.


With our breadth, reach and diversity, we can offer excellent opportunities for career growth and development and we are looking for people who can seize those opportunities. You'll get plenty of support but it's about taking the initiative, building relationships and making it happen. Do this and you can help us make a positive difference to our customers, our colleagues and our communities.


Key responsibilities


As a DevOps Engineer you will automate, automate, and automate – delivering a modern, lean approach to "smoothing the path" our software takes from a developer’s workstation, through develop and test cycles, toward production.


As part of a wider DevOps community you will also help drive continuous improvement of our tooling and build pipelines in a relentless mission to speed up feedback loops, shift testing and shorten delivery release cycles.


You will ensure that build and release jobs are written in a way which is consistent with - and exploits where possible - the collective frameworks, patterns and practices that exist across the wider DevOps community.


It is also very important to understand and apply industry best practices, foster knowledge sharing to provide solutions for complex business problems where no precedent may exist, and ensure implementation of solutions where appropriate.


As a leader, you’re expected to mentor and develop more junior DevOps engineers, providing clear and constructive feedback and creating opportunities for learning and growth.

item.title: Lead Java Engineer, London at Lloyds Banking Group (London, UK)
item.description:
Lloyds Banking Group is changing. We’re rapidly transforming into a digitally-led business on a massive scale in order to better serve our customers. We’re already the largest provider of digital banking products in the UK, with over 12 million active online customers and nearly 8 million active mobile banking customers. It means a big opportunity for you to be part of ground-breaking transformation and it means there’s never been a more exciting time to join.


This is an excellent opportunity for a driven candidate to join us as a Lead Java Engineer in one of our cross-disciplinary teams. As a highly experienced member of our wider Engineering team we expect that you to demonstrate and apply exemplary software engineering practices and skills as well as mentor our more junior team members.


In return, you’ll enjoy an exciting, innovative environment that supports flexible and agile working. You will work in a highly collaborative way and enjoy seeing the impact of your work by shaping the ‘heart and soul’ of our digital customer experiences across web, mobile and tablet applications that are being used by millions of our customers every day.


With our breadth, reach and diversity, we can offer excellent opportunities for career growth and development. And we are looking for people who can seize those opportunities; you'll get plenty of support but it's about taking the initiative, building relationships and making it happen. Do this and you can help us make a positive difference to our customers, our colleagues and our communities.


Key responsibilities



  • Writing modular, well tested code that remains easy to maintain as the codebase and business continues to scale

  • Setting the strategic direction for how components and services are developed within the team

  • Ensure that software is built in a way which is consistent with - and exploits where possible - the collective frameworks, patterns and practices that exist across the wider Engineering community

  • Understand and apply industry best practices, foster knowledge sharing to provide solutions for complex business problems where no precedent may exist, and ensure implementation of solutions where appropriate

  • Mentor and develop more junior Java engineers, providing clear and constructive feedback and creating opportunities for learning and growth

  • Relentless focus on delivering business value through sound engineering methods and principles.

item.title: RACF Security Technician, Gloucester, London, Leeds at Lloyds Banking Group (London, UK)
item.description:
The Banks Mainframes support a significant number of Cat A systems such as Bacs, Chaps, Teller Systems etc. This role sits in the Enterprise Security Technology /mainframe business unit.


In this role that matters you’ll be responsible for implementing and utilising the Z-Secure suite of products and maintaining administration for security, event management and feed information into the ARP Recertification tool. Additionally you’ll assist in the analysis, design, implementation and maintenance of Mainframe Security and Mainframe Security Applications as well as running Conduct Role Based Access Controls (RBAC) review for current and new applications and scheduled access validation of critical applications - This also includes Privilege Access.


Your other responsibilities will include partnering with other Security related initiatives across IT and various business units to discuss access issues, explain access rights and manage process.


Your accountabilities will include assisting with Low Level Mainframe Security Designs, recommending Group/Role access development rules and following up on access management deficiencies identified in risk reviews, self-assessments, risk assessments and internal and external audits. Also, you’ll ensure appropriate remediation measures are implemented and will drive the development and maintenance of new group structure to include Human, Non-Human and System accounts.  And you’ll perform analysis, design, documentation and testing of enhancements associated with new or existing Security functionality coupled with perform unit testing of new Security/system modifications to ensure that the specifications are met and there is no adverse impact on system performance and functionality. Additionally you will review and process all project requests in a timely manner to meet Service Level Agreements and complete all access requests/tasks correctly the first time to prevent unauthorized access and material audit findings.

item.title: FULL-STACK SOFTWARE ENGINEERS at Voovio (Alcobendas, Spain)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer (full-time) to start immediately in our office in Madrid, Spain.


Who we are


Voovio is disrupting the simulation arena. We are redefining the way simulators for process industry are created, used and maintained thanks to our patented technology.


 How we work


The engineering department is organized in full-stack feature teams. That means that the teams do everything from concept, UX/UI, algorithmic and feature development and of course the Backend development (if needed).


Who are we looking for


We are looking for talented and passionate Full-Stack Software Engineers with deep and technological know-how who loves to develop great products. You must have an eye for details, and believe in quality is a must. You enjoy working in a fast-moving and diverse company.


You will be responsible for modules of our products and you will need to help the team make tradeoffs between functionality, time and complexity. Having a keen product sense is very important; being able to understand the needs of our customers is also critical. Finally, decentralized decision-making must be something you encourage and foster in our culture.

item.title: Mobile App Developer at Soft Pauer Limited (Bicester, UK)
item.description: We develop the Official Formula 1 Application for iOS and Android, and are looking for talented technical individuals to work on this exciting product. The code base is a mature cross platform C++ code base, that supplied everything we need on any platform to deliver a consistent service. You'll be working along side a team that delivers a live service throughout the year, and visualizing data captured from numerous sources.

item.title: Talented Senior Developer WANTED at ThoughtWorks (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
When you join ThoughtWorks you join a wonderful community of people who are passionate about learning, and about sharing what they learn. A community that includes the people who write the books on software excellence and innovation, who write the tools that we all use. A community that is passionate about doing great work for interesting clients. Clients that have the most pressing problems of our time, and ThoughtWorks is here to deliver disruptive thinking and empowering technology to help them succeed. 


Our ultimate mission is to better humanity through software and help drive the creation of a social and economically just world. We mix cutting edge thinking, practices and technologies, with tried and tested approaches to give our clients the edge: exciting new customer experiences, powered by the latest technologies, created in the simplest way possible. This enables us to put in practice our final goal: invest in projects which improve lives through software.


Ready? Then reach out - we are looking forward to get to know you!

item.title: Senior BI / MicroStrategy Consultant at VPT (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re calling on you to join VPT as a Senior BI MicroStrategy Consultant. We are a long-standing innovative Big Data consultancy, MicroStrategy partner and provider of multi-terabyte Analytics-as-a-Service solutions. We are in the UK and based in Chiswick, West London and you will be working with some of the most experienced MicroStrategy consultants in the world, so expect to combine strong client interaction and technical skills with demands to ‘think outside of the box’.


Working with the full MicroStrategy stack, your work can involve everything from front-end, back-end, SDK, data modelling, data engineering, mobile and integration work. Finally, we coach and mentor our clients in the rapidly evolving area of ‘Agile BI’.


As a Senior BI MicroStrategy Consultant your role will cover everything from technical consultancy and delivery through to pre-sales. You will be responsible for driving best adoption and practice with MicroStrategy; ensuring all engagements and work produced are of top quality. This is a pivotal role that will see you work with and lead experienced teams within challenging environments whilst embracing new technology and approaches.


Travel across UK and Europe will be required.

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer at Skillstream (London, UK)
item.description: We are looking for an established junior / mid-level Rails developer to help build and scale a heavy-use web app for demanding clients across the healthcare and emergency services sector.

item.title: Business Process Consultant at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Centre Operations to join the Business Process Services Consulting practice within Cognizant for one of the major Healthcare Clients in the UK.


Cognizant Business Process Services help enterprises step-change faster without massive organizational upheaval—by simultaneously being more innovative and efficient. We help accelerate the evolution of a business, without the need for revolution by delving deeply into customer experience, business process design and operating model change. The business unit helps organizations move from 'doing' digital to 'being’ digital more effectively.


In this role you will support the objectives of one of our Health Care Clients which aims at centralizing all its back office operations into a shared services CoE. A successful candidate will be expected to provide conceptual solutions after analysing and assessing the as-is state and the associated business problems/needs, with consideration of associated risks, cost and timescales, becoming a subject-matter expert of the Health Care Contact Centre operations business processes and its functional/non-functional requirements.  


You will work closely with the Client teams in advisory and consulting capacity responsible for process diagnostics, management and governance. You will elaborate market-led requirements into clear and complete User Stories, ensuring clear communication of those findings to the Client stakeholders and enabling the kick-off of solution design phase.

item.title: Temenos Product Specialist at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Cognizant’s Banking and Financial Services practice encompasses consumer lending, commercial finance, leasing insurance, cards, payments, banking, investment banking, wealth management and transaction processing. It is the company’s largest industry segment, serving leading financial institutions in North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. These include 9 of the top 10 European banks and 16 of the top 20 North American financial institutions. The practice leverages its deep domain and consulting expertise to provide solutions across the entire financial services spectrum, and enables our clients to manage business transformation challenges, drive revenue and cost optimisation, create new capabilities, mitigate risks, comply with regulations, capitalize on new business opportunities, and drive efficiency, effectiveness, innovation and virtualisation.


Our global partnership with TEMENOS showcases the expertise and experience of two of the strongest players in banking technology. By integrating Cognizant’s implementation and systems integration services with TEMENOS market leading core banking software, customers of both companies can gain a strong competitive advantage and improved banking processes. Working as a product consultant on Temenos you will be providing solutions.

item.title: UI Architect at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Today’s organizations need to think, act and be digital at scale to serve customers in the unprecedented ways they expect. 


Digital has to become nothing more and nothing less than the way our clients do business throughout their business. We’re past the days when a successful center of excellence or initiative impressed customers and partners, when dabbling in digital was enough.


It’s time to go beyond doing pilot projects to being digital.


To take an enterprise-wide approach to digital technology that unlocks the full capabilities of your organization and improves experiences for all your employees and customers dramatically. That doesn’t mean rejecting existing infrastructure wholesale in search of the latest trend, but helping our clients evolve into a more powerful, progressive version of the great company their already are.


Job Summary:


The User Interface Architect is responsible for working with clients in our digital practice to create great, compelling interfaces that optimise digital whilst delivering great user experience. 


The day to day role will  provide exposure to analyse various web frameworks, UI architecture and provide suitable UI solutions. 


Hands on development opportunity in HTML5, CSS3, JQuery, JavaScript & Various JavaScript frameworks.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Web Architect role doing hands on in Web technologies in HTML5, CSS3, JQuery, JavaScript, & various JavaScript frameworks. 



  • Will be providing inputs at web application Architecture level. 



  • Will assess different web frameworks, compare them and provide appropriate suggestions for best fit.

  • Will research in latest web UI technologies in market and focus oriented to provide best solutions in the area.



  •  Will provide web framework solutions and guide team members on the same.

item.title: Environment Automation Architect at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Cognizant’s Infrastructure Services Practice provides end-to-end solutions covering architecture, design, implementation, management and on-going support across the entire enterprise technology infrastructure.


Our services include a spectrum of management, consulting and systems integration services to help our clients maximize value in their infrastructure resources, while optimizing infrastructure performance and cost.


The Environment Automation Architect will undertake and own software automation development & deployment for key accounts within the UK/I Infrastructure Services Practice


 Key Responsibilities:



  • Extensive development and deployment with Python, Chef, Puppet, Java, C++, HTMP5, Linux, TCP, Storage, Compute

  • Manage the large scale software development & deployment 

  • Handle end to end  project management, team management & client  management delivery

  • Participate in development, transition and technical documentation

  • Handle various teams and facilitate cross-functional requirements

  • Take responsibility for communication and documentation

  • Mentor the managers & team members from Cognizant to ensure that they are delivering a professional, high quality, high value & responsive service experience to the client

item.title: PEGA Lead Systems Architect at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Cognizant’s PEGA Lead System Architects are responsible for mentoring development teams and delivering world-class platforms for our customers on PEGA.   In this role they bring certification and deep expertise using PRPC maximizing the use of OOTB functionality to deliver solutions that have minimal coding and ensuring high performance delivery.


Responsibilities:



  • Participate in architecture and design discussions and review

  • Monitor the daily activities of the team referring to the project plan

  • Resolve technical issues at offshore and resolve issues and ad hoc requests

  • Report weekly project status to Project Manager and provide input for management status review meetings

  • Participate in the Architecture sessions to provide inputs on system Architecture from Pega perspective

  • Ensure compliance with Pega implementation guard rails

  • Own and deliver High Level Design document

  • Define Reuse Scope and Path

  • Establish Development & Deployment Best Practices

  • Mentor Pega Technical Resources

  • Offshore co-ordination and provide inputs to the Offshore team to prepare Low Level Design and build the application

  • Gather and  analyze interface details and provide it to offshore for interface design

  • Conduct code review and provide feedback to build team

  • Participate in QA and UAT Defect Triage

  • Provide QA and UAT Support

  • Participate in Design and code Review with the customer Architects

  • Provide Implementation support in different environments

  • Provide resolution on technical issues

  • Co-ordinate between Onsite and offshore teams

item.title: Technology Consultant at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
GTO provides technology leadership, transformation and innovation services to Cognizant clients. The business unit includes a number of advanced technology laboratories which enable clients to create first of a kind solutions which use emerging technologies. It also has a technology transformation delivery capability. 


In this role you will represent the Cognizant Global Technology Office (GTO) on client engagements and you will take responsibility for shaping, leading and delivering added-value through technology consultancy and through guiding delivery engagements.


You will have proven capability in providing technical leadership, delivering high quality technology advice, creativity and insight; ensuring project success through timely and accurate production of agreed deliverables; with a strong stakeholder management focus and to the benefit of the reputation of GTO.


You will be able to relate business problems to the technology domain and communicate how technology provides business solutions. You should be confident of your ability to perform in complex client engagements when support can be limited. You will be enthusiastic to join an expanding and ambitious team of similarly high calibre, successful technology consultants, and to contribute to our worldwide growth. 


We offer fantastic opportunities to work with cutting-edge technologies with some of the fastest moving, well recognised brands in the world, across all industries.

item.title: Mulesoft Architect at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Consumer technology expectations are rapidly infiltrating the enterprise landscape. Our applications development and maintenance solutions drive efficiency and effectiveness and help our customers build adaptable platforms for the new social mobile enterprise.


Cognizant's Enterprise Application Services  practice provides high quality Service Orientated Architecture integration solutions (Oracle Service Bus, Oracle SOA Suite, BPEL, Oracle Business Rules, ESB) to leading corporations spanning various domains to address their complex integration needs across a variety of geographies; increasing the capabilities of their organization by allowing applications to assume new roles in the business.


We have an exciting role for an expert level Mulesoft Architect to join our EAS team.


This is a role with a global reach, aimed at enhancing the business unit’s Mulesoft footprint in this and other geographies. This role produces design artefacts and templates, develops and tests the code, supports QA, executes / supports the Change and Release processes and provides production operational support as needed.  In addition to assisting with the expansion of internal technical capabilities by mentoring the team

item.title: DevOps Architect at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Businesses today must move at the speed of digital. Traditional software development often can’t keep up. DevOps helps companies accelerate software development and improve software quality. In the past, software was often “thrown over the wall” to infrastructure and operations for deployment and support. Resolving issues required numerous rounds of iterations between multiple groups. With DevOps, software developers, infrastructure administrators, quality assurance and operations professionals collaborate early and often to anticipate potential problems and proactively incorporate feedback throughout the development cycle using an Enterprise DevOps Platform.


Cognizant has extensive experience in DevOps and leverages this expertise to provide customers with comprehensive DevOps services spanning strategy, planning, execution and managed services. Leveraging our DevOps Assessment Framework, Cognizant delivers strategies and solutions that help clients maximize the benefits of their DevOps investment.


We have an opportunity for a DevOps architect to join the team and have real responsibility for development and design of our DevOps architecture. You will be building solutions using DevOps tools such as Chef, Puppet and Jenkins, and working closely with projects to ensure delivery.

item.title: Fellowship seeks Java / Backend developer at IDT Messaging (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
Our owl apparently failed to find you, this leaves us with few ways to contact you. Hopefully, we’ve pointed the tractor beam in the right direction. This is the job you are looking for…


A little about us:


We have MagicWords™ (No, really, we do). Our MagicWords™ technology turns every message into a portal to related information. But one does not simply find the relevant words, for that, you need an AI, an AI so advanced, knowing how to administer the Turing test is considered a plus for a role at IDT Messaging.


About you:


We’re looking for a Backend developer skilled in the ways of Java and/or other JVM languages who has a high initiative stat and can add at least +5 intellect to our team, and the force strong in you must be.


You will work on our MagicWords™ intelligence components, in-chat app framework, as well as our messaging backend, not to mention some truly groundbreaking things we are building in our dungeon. The code must flow.


You:



  • Are at least a Journeyman Java developer/wizzard.

  • Are capable of growing your own potatoes on Mars.

  • Do not sparkle.

  • Know where your towel is at all times.

  • Have passed the Kobayashi Maru and Voight-Kampff tests.

  • Must know the airspeed velocity of an unladen swallow.

  • Must not be a red-shirt, we’d prefer you come back from lunch in one piece.


What we can provide:



  • Elevenses.

  • Ample gold.

  • A work environment that could, at a push, be considered awesome (at very least, great).

  • Exhilarating chat sessions with Kabouter the AI bot.

  • Answer to the question of life, the universe, and everything.


If you close this ad, nothing will change, if you click the apply button, you stay in wonderland and see how deep the rabbit hole goes.


Please send us your CV and tell us how many of the sci-fi & fantasy references you caught  (and a little about yourself and why you’re applying) in the form below! We promise HAL will behave.


Apply soon, winter is coming!


P.S. We’re not all geeks, just the people writing this ad. Geekiness is about passion and that we do all have. We want to change the world with our services and if that sounds like something you’d like to do, get in touch.


Our Messaging app is available in an app-store near you, with group conversations, media sharing, cloud storage, and messaging micro-services. Just search for Presto Messaging!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Digital TV at Samsung (Staines-upon-Thames, UK)
item.description:
SRUK designs and develops key components of Samsung’s flat panel digital television product range. Our software is deployed in products destined for European and sometimes worldwide markets. We have many years of experience with traditional DVB broadcast systems and considerable expertise in interactive TV and IPTV technologies.


As the Television revolution continues then the next generation of Televisions will become increasingly Web-centric in their operation and the Web browser becomes the key technology component. SRUK are looking to grow their existing Web browser development technology team.


Ideally we are looking for people with extensive and comprehensive knowledge of the WebKit or Blink source code. Developers with exceptional C++ skills that have an enthusiasm for WebKit/Blink and Open Source are encouraged to send their resumes. Successful candidates would become part of the Web Browser Team and would perform tasks including the following



  • Development and enhancement of the Blink based browser and related Web-platform technologies for Samsung TV platform.

  • Working with/in the Open Source community

  • Analysis and design parts of a digital television system, which may range from the user interface to the driver level. The majority of this software shall be designed using a combination of MS Word documents and UML2 (with a variety of tools). Good written English skills are essential.

  • Implement these designs in various embedded systems to a high standard. The majority of this software shall be implemented in C++.

  • Ensure that work packages meet requirements, pass quality standards and are integrated with other parts of the system.

  • Report to the project manager for project planning, budgeting etc.

  • Assist other team members with their work.

  • Assist in identifying staff training and development needs.

  • Assist in identifying the need for recruitment of additional members of the team.

  • All work is to be of a professional standard, paying due regard to safety, efficiency, cost

  • Excellent knowledge of the Web Engine (WebKit or Blink) code base. Ideally an active contributor  to the appropriate open source community (reviewer/committer)

item.title: Fellowship seeks iOS developer at IDT Messaging (Helsinki, Finland)

item.title: Polyglot Software Engineer to work on a cutting edge Big Data Platform at Qubit (London, UK)
item.description:
Qubit’s platform consumes and enriches billions of events a day, and serves out millions of personalisations to some of the biggest properties on the Internet. Our platform provides the backbone on which all of Qubit’s rich SaaS products are built.


ARE YOU…


Passionate about software engineering? Do you like hardcore programming in a wide range of languages or are willing to learn to do so? Do Big Data problems keep you up at night? Are you looking to get your hands dirty with some of the hottest technologies in the industry right now? Then look no further and apply for this position.


Experimental? You are happy to embrace new technologies and tools that help us solve the hard problems intrinsic to a rapidly growing, disruptive technology such as ours. The current version of the platform leverages the following: Kafka, Hadoop, Storm, Spark, Dataflow, HBase, BigTable, BigQuery, Hive, Redshift, Redis, Java, Scala, Python, Go, Clojure, Avro, Protobuf, et al. We love open source and so should you.


YOU WILL BE…


Helping us engineer and maintain a low-latency, high-throughput platform that is responsible for capturing, validating, enriching, storing, and serving billions of data points a day.


This entails full-stack engineering from writing real-time processing applications to scaling up our distributed data storage solutions and from tuning JVMs to working with globally distributed infrastructure. Stable, deterministic, well-documented, fully-tested, scalable, and concurrent are some of the keywords that will apply to your code.


What the team has worked on recently:



  • Brought down our end-to-end processing SLA from the order of hours to minutes.

  • Productionised a Javascript and Clojure service under Nashorn in a distributed big data engine (crazy? we know).

  • Upgraded our data ingestion and processing pipeline to support validation and evolution of our clients’ data fabric.

  • Implemented systems for web-scale data lookup and temporal count distinct operations.


Oh, and we get early access to technology before anyone else in the industry. We are also agile with scrums and stand ups but we still maintain the chaos inherent to a dynamic engineering environment: we build and fix stuff as rapidly as we break and scale it.


What you’ll need:


In addition to a zest for problem solving, an ideal candidate should possess the following skills:



  • Experience with at least one programming language (even if it’s esoteric).

  • A degree in Computer Science/Mathematics/Engineering or a related field or equivalent industry experience.

  • “Never say never” approach to challenges.

  • Ability to take up new technologies with ease.

  • Excited by the prospects of working in an engineering team that spans three continents, multiple timezones, and endless enthusiasm.

  • Willing to embrace Qubit’s values: “Voice it. Own it. Do it.”

  • Up for telling the world the Truth About Data


Plenty of perks


As well as the opportunity to solve complex problems, we like to look after our fellow Qubyte, so you'll get:



  • Generous equity options and performance centric bonuses.

  • Acknowledgment and recognition for your performance and skills via the ability to climb up the engineering ladder.

  • Top of the line medical and dental insurance.

  • Free onsite yoga and meditation classes.

  • A competitive office where we play foosball, football, scrabble, go-karting… you name it, we’ll play and ace it.

  • A fridge fully stocked with healthy snacks and the ultimate espresso machine for both your “cookie” and “Java” fixes (puns intended).


At Qubit, we champion diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We embrace difference with open arms and see it as a huge benefit to our community. We are dedicated to equal opportunity regardless of  race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. If you have a disability or need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

item.title: Python Developer at BMLL Technologies (London, UK)
item.description:
In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining web applications that integrate RESTful web services with distributed cloud computing.


Listed below are the skills we need to complement our existing core team, and the technologies we use in each area. The more experienced you are, the broader we would expect your skill set to be. We are, however, also prepared to accept applications from junior candidates. We are committed to our staff’s continued professional development, and expect to help you to keep your skills current with both internal and external training. It goes without saying that we want our staff to reflect the full diversity of society, though at present it is sadly skewed in some respects.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at BMLL Technologies (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for passionate dev ops with strong Python experience. In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining and deploying web applications that integrate RESTful web services with distributed cloud computing.


The devops team use a range of technologies including Python 3.5, Ansible, Jenkins, Docker, AWS, GitHub and Jira.


A passion for new technologies and a drive to find simple and reliable ways to solve complex problems is key.


What will you be doing?


You will be the primary person responsible for Dev Ops, joining a team of developers with varied skills in web development, systems development, devops and quality assurance.


Your primary role will be to ensure the smooth deployment of releases and the maintaince of those releases in the production environment. You will contribute to architecture and technical design of our back-end and of the ecosystem as a whole and to the creation and maintenance of platform documentation.


Your Profile


As mid/senior engineer, we expect you to be an experienced coder and technical designer, with a track record of building, testing, deploying and maintaining multi-server, scalable systems.

item.title: .NET - The hard stuff (and it's all hard stuff) at Zuhlke Engineering Ltd (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Zuhlke is a European software engineering consultancy that helps businesses turn ideas into reality. We need people who are capable, talented, and engaged to help build systems for our clients, based from our expanding Manchester office. We take on interesting projects in many domains, including media, finance, heavy engineering, and medical devices.


Your job will involve working closely with clients to develop, test, and ship software that meets their needs. You will be looking both to contribute to the company and to grow personally.


Our reputation is fundamental to our business, so our culture emphasizes quality, reliability and respect. As a privately-held company owned by past and present employees, and run by engineers, Zuhlke takes a long-term view. For example, you will receive twenty days training per year, including a budget to support activities such as conference attendance, our annual technical camp, and participation in focused topic teams. We like our staff to be technically flexible so, if you don’t have a required skill now, we can support you learning it.


Your job will include:



  • Helping our clients understand what they really need

  • Building quality systems to satisfy those needs

  • Working collaboratively with colleagues and clients

  • Keeping technically sharp

  • Getting things done

  • Sometimes travelling to other locations in the UK and mainland Europe


You will benefit from:



  • A generous allowance for training (9% of your time and a substantial cash budget)

  • An achievement-based career path where you can gain responsibility while remaining technical

  • A competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package


Our work is mainly at or within an hour's travel from our central Manchester office.


If this appeals, then please get in touch.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

item.title: Senior Embedded Linux Developer (m/f) at WolfVision GmbH (Klaus, Österreich)
item.description: As a team member with responsibility for a project, you will independently develop complete embedded systems from the concept stage through to series production. In addition you will support the existing electronics team in the maintenance and further development of firmware for our current product range.

item.title: Senior Cloud Back-End Engineer: Join Rapid7's Research Team at Rapid7 (Belfast, UK)
item.description:
Want to work on truly cutting edge solutions? Love creating and improving upon novel solutions that have an immediate impact?


Rapid7 is looking for Software Engineers to join us on our research team in our Belfast office. We’re passionate about finding engineers who care about pushing the boundaries of software security, network security and cloud technologies, and who truly care about driving quality into everything we deliver.

item.title: Software Engineer at Jinn Capital (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for a Quantitative Developer to join our team. 


Key responsibilities include:



  • Adding functionality to major software modules such as Backtester or Regression-Platform.

  • Maintaining the central database.

  • Handling market data connectivity.

  • Translating code from MATLAB to Python.

  • Maintaining server infrastructure.


Other information: 



  • Contract type: Permanent / Fixed-term / Temporary.

  • Contract hours: Part-time / Full-time.

  • Salary: Competitive.

  • Start-date: ASAP.

item.title: Software Developer at Ideagen Plc (East Kilbride, UK)
item.description:
Ideagen are looking for a Software Developer to add to our existing (80+) Technical Team in the UK.


This role will involve building the current and future versions of our high quality product suite.


Do you have a love of technology and a passion for getting your hands dirty creating "best of breed" software?


What's in it for you?


While we take our work and deliverables seriously, we have a relaxed working environment complete with in-house table tennis, dart board, PS4 Leader Board, weekly five-a-side football, and regular nights out and nights in.


At Ideagen we want our people to be rewarded for their hard work so we offer benefits such as Life Insurance, Private Medical Insurance, Contributory Pension Scheme, Free Fruit, Cycle to Work Scheme and 32 days’ holiday including statutory holidays, plus a day off to celebrate your birthday!


Whether you have a love of web-based software, an obsession with databases, or just an ability to see things differently, Ideagen could have the perfect opportunity for you.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mobile Security at Samsung (Staines-upon-Thames, UK)
item.description:
You will join our team developing security solutions for Samsung OS mobile devices. You will be working within an established team which specialises in the development of Security solutions. You will be responsible for providing expertise in the area of mobile security vulnerability analysis and solution development to strengthen overall device security.


As you will be working in a team, it is essential to have good inter-personal and communications skills.


This role requires strong understanding of Mobile Security including latest technologies and processes. You will assist remaining team in understanding underlying process and options.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Linux Platform at Samsung (Staines-upon-Thames, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic engineer with strong graphics software development background in embedded systems. The candidate will contribute to the window system integration, optimisation and enhancement of GPU device drivers for Samsung mobile and wearable devices running Tizen operating system. Tizen 2.4 has X11 window system and Tizen 3.0 is based on Wayland. 


As a Senior Software Engineer you will be expected to develop and maintain a wide understanding of all Linux based platforms including the graphics components that can be used in Samsung devices and to provide high level technical input to architectural designs. You will be expected to liaise with GPU vendors to ensure that Tizen products are the highest performing in their class.

item.title: Game Ecosystem Engineer at Samsung (Staines-upon-Thames, UK)
item.description:
Working as a Senior Engineer, your main responsibility is to facilitate development of games and other heavily graphical applications on Samsung’s Android-based mobile products. The Ecosystem team exists to ensure that Samsung’s software and hardware systems are easily accessible to developers and offer a world-class experience in terms of performance and ease of development.


The role of Ecosystem Engineer within the Ecosystem group includes taking senior technical responsibility for the tasks allocated and providing a competent level of technical authority in one or more technical skill areas within the group.


An important part of the job will be building relationships with external parties such as game developers and related companies. You must be comfortable with presenting technical data and advice to developers and will be expected to collect and prioritise their issues and concerns so that Samsung can provide advice and solutions.


You will be involved in incubating new projects, which may involve feasibility, design and prototyping work across the complete range of mobile software platforms and applications used by Samsung, its suppliers and customers.


You will be responsible for performing all, or part, of the software development cycle (from Analysis, Specification, Designing, Documentation, Implementation, Verification and Commercialization Support) for a given area of software development (Android). A particular focus will be on optimisation and improvement of the software stack to support high-performance graphics applications.


As a Senior Software Engineer you will be expected to develop and maintain a wide understanding of all Linux based platforms including the graphics components that can be used in Mobile devices and to provide high level technical input to architectural designs within the Core Graphics group and other groups within Samsung.

item.title: Full-Stack Web Developer: Build Web Applications and Platforms at SCL Elections (London, UK)
item.description:
We combine commercial and public big-data sets with large-scale quantitative research to predict everything from whether people are likely to vote through to what products and services they are most likely to buy.


We combine best-practise models from theoretical psychology with state-of-the-art big data analytics to identify hidden behavioural patterns and enable our clients to provide advertising that resonates with the personality of each recipient.


We work with a range of clients range including political bodies, charities and multinational companies.


This is a 3 month opportunity with SCL.

item.title: Mobile Software Engineer at comparethemarket.com (London, UK)
item.description:
comparethemarket.com (ctm) has an office in central London and we need Senior Software Engineers with great experience developing and shipping iOS Apps to join our mobile app team. We are looking to talk to people who enjoy working in teams, being heard and share the passion we have for creating software.  At ctm we look to push the boundaries with new technologies so that we can deliver the very best for our customers. We value everyone’s opinion in building top class software.


Making good choices is crucial for your career and at ctm you choose the kit you work on and you and your team chooses the tech stack – figuring out what language works – innovating and learning as a team. We currently develop for native (iOS/Android) and hybrid (HTML5/ionic) so you’ll be finding the best fit for our Apps.

item.title: Senior Java Developer - (Agile, Java, Scala) at First Utility (Warwick, UK)
item.description:
This is a key role within the Digital Retail Development Team, building advanced software solutions for our on-line business. The Java team are responsible for building a wide range of SOA services that support the development of web and mobile applications.


We take an API First approach to our service development and are looking for people experienced in delivering a wide range of services and capabilities that cut across our entire company business.


Typical projects our services developers have been/will be involved with include :



  • Integration with Artificial Intelligence platforms to help answer customer questions

  • Integration with Big Data cluster to provide deep analytics of customer activity

  • Development of new services to support integration with Social platforms such as Facebook & Twitter

  • Development of services specific to supporting mobile platforms ( iOS, Android )

  • Research and development into the use of predictive analytics to improve customer experience

  • Helping build a truly personalised experience for each customer through the delivery of high performance commerce capabilities including prediction, segmentation and personalisation


What you'll typically get involved in:



  • You'll take a leading role in the development of our API First strategy, helping to deliver a range of services that are used both by internal development teams, external third parties and customers

  • Take a very involved role in the various agile activities, including leading planning and estimating sessions and reporting progress to their assigned project lead and/or project manager

  • Lead design and code reviews and be accountable for the actions taken from these sessions,seeing them through to implementation as agreed

  • Act as a scrum master for small projects, typically as part of a large project under the guidance of a Lead or Principal Software Engineer

item.title: Full stack web developer (C#). Must enjoy challenges. at MPD Group (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for developers who enjoy solving problems, find coding fun, like being part of an agile team, are not afraid to try new approaches, yet easily abandon 'false-starts', like clean code, have strongly developed common sense, and take pride in things they build.


You would be working on Electio - our newly built and constantly evolving SaaS fulfillment management platform (more about Electio). Electio already does some great things which won us major clients, but that's just a start. We're excited to see what else we can make it do, how we can innovate in a challenging market, and delight our customers. 


Electio has to comply with very strict response SLAs and at the same time handle large, 'spiky' volumes of data, therefore designing for performance, reviewing and optimising your code would be essential.


We believe you should test your own code. We're not particular if you cover it with meaningful tests before or after you've written it - as long as you do.


You should also be ok with deploying your own code in a controlled manner. 


We use relatively new technology stack (.Net 4.6.1, C#, MVC 4.5, Nancy, SQL Server 2014, Redis, Dapper, ELK, and Azure Service Bus).


We keep our code in BitBucket, for continuous integration we use TeamCity, we adopted Gitflow as our branching strategy, and we manage our deployments via Octopus. All our environments are deployed in Azure.

item.title: Junior Web Developer at Pelicanconnect (London, UK)
item.description:
BACKGROUND


Are you a talented, smart, conscientious programmer, who wants to gain experience in a fast-growing company?


Join the team at Pelicanconnect, a London-based EdTech start-up building a SaaS-model community software for schools, universities and other organisations.


Launched in 2014, we've signed up 20 customers including primary and secondary schools, sixth form colleges and university departments such Hill's Road Sixth Form College, Francis Holland, Concord College and Watford Grammar School for Girls.


The Pelicanconnect software is built in CodeIgniter/ PHP incorporating some modules from a CMS called Pyro. We've used in-house design and UX and we've gathered detailed feedback from thousands of our target audience to make sure we're giving them a site they like and need!


ROLE


Your role will be to support our other two developers in the web development process, including building core parts of the site. Ideally you'll be great at back end and front end, but we appreciate you might be stronger in one area than another!


We'll give you a few weeks to up-skill but we'd like someone with confidence to take on core areas of the site. We have many exciting new features and functionality to add to Pelicanconnect and we have other projects in the pipeline, so there'll be plenty to keep you challenged.


REWARD


We'll hire you full time. Salary will depend on how good you are. You'll work in a fun, no-nonsense small organisation with very flexible working hours and style - but with a lot of challenge and responsibility.


TO APPLY


Please apply with a short covering letter, your CV, and any relevant links (GitHub, Portfolio, etc).


Unfortunately, at this time we are not able to sponsor foreign working visas.

item.title: Infrastructure Engineer - DevOps / AWS @ FinTech startup at FundApps (London, UK)
item.description:
If you've got high standards and are passionate about customer experience this is the role for you. Our customers rely on us day-in day-out to provide a reliable, responsive and secure service, all whilst scaling to meet the demands of a rapidly growing customer base and data volumes.


We're a heterogeneous Windows/Linux shop, with the core of our main product in .NET and new service buildout currently in Golang. We're not precious about technologies, and we're keen to take the right tools for the task at hand - we've got code across C#, F#, PowerShell, Ruby, Python and Golang. We've adopted a number of AWS services including the use of Lambda for serverless architectures.


We take our software seriously, employing Continuous Delivery through TeamCity, Octopus Deploy and AWS CodeDeploy. Logging and monitoring are key too - with SumoLogic, AWS CloudWatch and PagerDuty key components of our stack.


Having completed a full migration to AWS in the last 12 months, we're currently hard at work making full use of the HashiCorp Suite/HashiStack (Atlas, Packer, Terraform and Consul) to manage our AWS production infrastructure. We're building 12-factor, cloud native applications using best of breed practices from the operations space.


You'll be helping to build out, deploy and maintain a service-oriented architecture (SOA) to support features in our main product and new product development as well as infrastructure work relating to our production AWS infrastructure.

item.title: Web Developer with DevOps experience at Hello Future (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for a talented web developer to work on websites and applications for our clients as well as other in-house creations such as our flagship solution, Adaptive Hosting, which is a flexible way to manage hosting, releases and source code in a scalable and robust way. It can be run almost anywhere, from dedicated hardware to dynamically scaling cloud hosting which allows us, our customers and their teams focus on delivering innovative new features and functionality.


Our team of web developers work across the entire stack, creating innovative and pragmatic solutions that allow the websites, web and mobile applications we create and maintain perform reliably at scale.


You’ll work collaboratively with our team and customers to build, support and improve new and existing digital products. You will be comfortable building and debugging applications from frontend Javascript and CSS issues, backend issues with PHP code to configuring servers.

item.title: Software Engineer at Findmypast (London, UK)
item.description:
Findmypast are looking for engineers that want to make a difference, that believe and adhere to the right practices.  We want passionate people that use the right technology for solving problems and like to deliver in a lean agile environment. You will help us build our new platform to enable us to deliver new features even faster and more successfully to the market. We have opportunities in both our London and Dundee based offices.


You will be part of a like-minded team of engineers who all agree and follow the practice of pairing, TDD and automating the entire delivery pipeline. You will work on a range of aspects from Services, API’s and high availability websites using a range of technologies and constantly striving to deliver at high quality.


Our core languages are Elixir and JavaScript. Our architecture greatly incorporates the micro services paradigm, implementing fault tolerant applications to deal with high levels of traffic and data.


We use technologies such as Apache Solr, Microsoft SQL Server, Riak, Redis, Neo4j, RabbitMQ, etc. We also have a mix of traditional MVC and SPA applications written in ASP.net, Node, React, Angular, Coffeescript. Knowledge and experience with more than one programming language and platform is a distinct advantage.


 We use GitHub for source control and Trello for tracking our work. We have a strong DevOps culture and manage our continuous integration and deployment with Teamcity. We use great communication tools like Slack, Screen Hero and Google Hangouts!

item.title: Web Developer - ASP.Net MVC at Totaljobs Group (London, UK)
item.description:
You & your role;


You’ll be working within one of our dedicated scrum teams, amongst other highly talent Developers, QA’s, BA’s and Scrum Masters.


You’ll undertake a hands on role, joining a team of smart, motivated Developers whom work within a full agile and scrum environment, helping candidates find jobs they love and helping companies recruit great talent, like you!


The ideal candidate will have a mixture of both back end and front end web development experience gained using a range of .Net related technologies gained within an Agile/Scrum environment.


We’re based on the Southbank in the fantastic Blue Fin Building, with great transport links and brilliant facilities including a subsidised canteen, a gym and a 10th floor roof terrace.


Some of your responsibilities as a Developer @ TJG;



  • Full stack development – from using front end technologies like AngularJS to database technologies such as DynamoDB, SQL Server and everything in between – MVC, Web API, WCF, C#

  • Present interesting technologies tools and practices back to the department via brown bags and communities of practice meetups

  • Work alongside dedicated Scrum Master, BA, QA and 3 other developers in a cross-skill team to develop and deliver high quality code in lightning fast time

  • Using XP practices such as pair programming TDD and its variants to develop high quality maintainable code

  • Feed into departmental engineering strategy and platform improvement backlog

  • Feed into our Tech Radar that guides which technologies tools and practices that we should trial, assess, adopt or hold

  • Refactor and iteratively upgrade older parts of the platform to use the latest tech and design patterns while still delivering business value

item.title: Senior Software Engineer for multi-skilling fun at Coniq (London, UK)
item.description:
Coniq is looking to add a permanent Senior Software Engineer to the tech team located near Farringdon.


We hire smart people that get things done. Our small, agile team is motivated by seeing the work that it does making a difference. This senior role will be able to influence the technical direction we take and have the opportunity to take on technical leadership responsibilities without the burden of line management.


We face some interesting technical challenges as we build a SaaS marketing and loyalty platform that caters to the diverse needs of our clients and is handling an ever increasing amount of data. The development work varies, but in the last six months you could have worked on:


• implementing a queueing system with RabbitMQ to handle a high volume of triggered events


• introducing a new columnar analytic database to support near real-time advanced customer segmentation


• improving job scheduling and reducing data usage in our Android applications


• adding new standardised user interface for filtering used across the platform


• migrating our servers and applications to PHP 7


You'll be able to choose your own computer so you can perform at your best. Your day will be filled with meaningful development work that clients actually use. You can take a break at the gym with a free pass from the company, or perhaps grab a piece of fruit before a game of darts or table football.


Must be eligible to work in the UK without sponsorship.


Want to know more?


Start a conversation by sending us your current CV — email it to techjobs@coniq.com with the subject line "Senior Software Engineer -- your name".


RECRUITERS: Please see our policy on working with recruiters at http://www.coniq.com/jobs/#recruiters before contacting us.

item.title: PHP Developer at Octer (London, UK)
item.description:
About Octer


Octer is one of the hottest start-ups in the mobile technology space. We have one ambition:
To make online shopping simple.


In March 2014 investors backed this vision to the tune of $1m in 24hrs on the crowdfunding site, Seedrs. We followed up with a similar round in autumn 2015.


With this backing and our drive and determination we are making it simpler for consumers to get what they want, and simpler for big retailers to find their new customers. We have an awesome team, work in a fun environment and are tackling the biggest issues in shopping which affect hundreds of millions of consumers.


How we are solving this problem.


We’re building technology that enables the big stores to operate as a single digital marketplace, with all of the advantages of a marketplace for smaller retailers (think Amazon and Etsy); 1 stop shop, easy comparison, single checkout.

To do this we need to first amalgamate 3 million products from the top 200 retailers and make sense of them. We need to understand what a product is, it’s true availability (sizes, in stock), how it relates to other products (for comparison) and who to show it to (relevance). Then we need to make those products simple to buy, from multiple retailers, with one click.


The Tech


We achieve this using various search, image recognition, macro, AI and API technologies. Over the past six months we have built a robust, horizontally-scalable and performant back-end infrastructure that processes over 3 million items per day.


Octer's tech stack is run on a LEMP architecture with performance and security improvements earned by integrating LXC virtual containers, job publish/consume processing and search indexing. All our code is integrated using a continuous integration pipeline initialised by hooks from Bitbucket into our Jenkins CI server.


We operate on an Agile software development practice around GIT and JIRA, and implement a custom take on Git Flow branch management. All our code is tested, integrated and seamlessly deployed to our network of virtual servers in the cloud, real time.


*Please note, this is an onsite role only*

item.title: Senior Angular 2 and Ionic 2 Developers - funded London WealthTech company at Netwealth Investments Ltd (London, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
NETWEALTH IS a rapidly growing, cutting-edge and funded WealthTech company. We're looking for Senior Angular 2 and Ionic 2 Developers.


ABOUT YOU


Please note: you must live in the UK and be eligible to work for a UK company without sponsorship


You’ve been developing applications using JavaScript, Angular and other front-end frameworks, and love elegant design. The problem-solving aspect of software development excites you every day. You’ve been wanting to join a FinTech startup, but have been put off by the restrictions of location and working practices. You long to apply your hard-earned skills to one of the fastest-growing, cutting edge areas of tech in the UK. You just haven’t found the right company - yet.


You consider yourself to be an Angular craftsman or craftswoman but also have back-end C# experience. You can deep-dive into JavaScript, Angular and Ionic and have a fundamental understanding of how they work - including front-end build processes. Ideally, you also contribute to open source projects or have your own out-of-hours development projects.


You're so driven by the latest technology that you're already developing using Angular2 and Ionic2.


You take ownership of your work and don't need to be told that something needs a little more polish.


You’ve successfully tackled complex, unfamiliar domains in cross-functional teams. You are comfortable communicating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


WHAT YOU'LL DO


Your main focus will be developing our web and mobile front-ends using Angular2 and Ionic2. We like all our developers to be capable of working on any technology in our stack so we'll expose you to and train you in these areas too.


You’ll be working in a growing senior team of developers, designers and testers building the public and private platforms to support our WealthTech services. These are cloud-based and capable of supporting thousands of customers and millions of transactions. To do this, you’ll have access to the latest software and hardware.


Whether you call it "Work Life Balance" or "Work Life Integration", you'll get it. You'll have fixed points during the day but, as a team, you'll be trusted to manage your location and hours to maximise your productivity.


The code you produce will be fast, efficient, robust and readable.


WHY WORK AT NETWEALTH?


You’ll be joining a hand-picked team, all brilliant in their respective fields.


You’ll be stretched and tested within a supportive team environment.


We love implementing new technologies that support our business needs; and we know our developers love this too. For instance we:



  • developed against ASP.Net vNext whilst still in beta

  • were part of Microsoft's VSTS Release Manager preview group

  • invested early in Microsoft cloud services like Azure Data Factory and Azure ML


You can create a genuine work/life balance. You will be required to get together regularly with other team members, but you won’t have a daily commute if you don't want one. We’re a modern company with modern working practices. You just need to take pride in and ownership of your work and deliver what's needed.


The successful applicant will gain real-world experience of Microsoft's evolving cloud platform - Azure.


FinTech and WealthTech are booming and Netwealth is at the cutting edge.


A PEEK AT OUR TECH STACK & TOOLS



  • Front-end


    • JavaScript

    • Angular 1.5

    • Html5

    • CSS3


  • Back-end Infrastructure (Azure)


    • App Services

    • Computes

    • WebJobs



    • Tables, Blobs & Queues

    • Logic Apps



    • SQL Databases

    • Azure Active Directory

    • Key Vault

    • Azure Data Factory

    • Azure ML



  • Back-end Languages and Frameworks


    • Asp.Net 5 (MVC 6 & WebApi)

    • C# 6

    • R


  • Tools


    • Visual Studio 2015

    • Visual Studio Team Services

    • Azure ML

    • RStudio



WHAT YOU'LL GET



  • Competitive salary

  • The hardware and software you need to deliver first class results

  • Genuine flexible & remote working arrangements

  • Preferential fees on our investment platform


LOCATION


Netwealth is a modern, flexible employer. The majority of our engineering team work remotely and commute in to our Hyde Park offices every week or 2 for meetings. You'll have the flexibility to choose from where you work on any given day. However, you must live in the UK, be eligible to work in the UK without sponsorship, and be able to comfortably travel to our offices, when required, in such a way that your work is not adversely affected.


RECRUITMENT AGENCIES:


Please note that Netwealth is managing the recruitment process for this role and will not be using any recruitment agencies. If you would like to be considered for any future recruitment requirements please email recruiters@netwealth.com.

item.title: Employee Number 3 - C# .NET Web Developer (flexible hours, work from anywhere) at Intelligent Editing (London, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
As Intelligent Editing’s employee number three, you’ll have a wide set of responsibilities and the opportunity to contribute across as much of the business as interests you. Intelligent Editing produces software for editing/proofreading, and you’ll help to develop the next phase of our website and the transformation of our software (PerfectIt) to a SaaS model.


You’ll work with a wide array of technologies (some of which you probably won’t be familiar with when joining). So a desire and ability to learn new tools is essential. We’re looking for a self-starter who will work on both new development and help modernise our existing codebase. You’ll be working directly with the founder & CEO, as well as our Chief Engineer, to develop the tools that will allow the company to grow in the long term.


From the first day, you’ll be given a lot of responsibility, so you must be able to work and get things done independently. Although the core role is development, you shouldn’t be afraid to pitch in where needed (including admin, sales and support). In return, you’ll become well versed in a full set of skills valuable to any (or your own) startup.


Duties and Responsibilities


You will:



  • Develop apps for online Office and add-ons for Google Docs

  • Contribute to the development of the next version of PerfectIt

  • Redesign our internal word usage databases

  • Improve our website

  • Work on e-commerce

  • Put in place unit tests and quality control mechanisms to improve our codebase.

item.title: Senior Ruby Developer at Soho House & co (London, UK)
item.description:
Role Responsibility


We are looking for a number of seasoned Senior Developers to ensure that Soho House's digital offerings are designed and implemented to the highest standards, these are hands on roles so expect to get your hands dirty.  We are embarking on a long term re-architecture project and we need a number of people to fill out the new openings in the team, who will bring extra experience to the conversation with the existing senior developers.


This is a chance to have a real impact on applications that will be used by a worldwide audience and will support the global business going into the future.


The Environment


We currently have a number of services which back our membership, subscription, event booking, content and general member requirements. We have approximately 40 public websites varying in size and traffic and a number of API driven and administration systems which are coming to the end of their working life. We are initiating a large scale rebuild which will service the requirements across all sections of the business for the foreseeable future in some sort of SOA arrangement (TBD...).


We're still a small team so we have all the benefits of being a tight, agile unit while also receiving the benefits of being nested inside a larger business giving us a secure forward thinking environment. We work out of Soho Works, Soho House’s co-working space in the Tea Building, Shoreditch.
 
As a senior developer:
 - At least 8 years experience in software engineering, software design or/and architecture
 - Architectural Patterns (System decomposition, Microservices etc)
 - Good working knowledge of AWS and devops deployment
 - Provide tech leadership and mentoring within the team
 - Have a wide and deep knowledge of software engineering and core web technologies
 - Detailed knowledge of Ruby (and ideally Javascript)
 - TDD approach
 - Agile approach
 - Ideally a working knowledge of modern front end development techniques
 - Code review, process review and improvement
 - Take into account all aspects of requirements - including data quality, customer experience, architecture, security & operations
 - Share & document technical and domain knowledge to improve support and eliminate single points of failure


The new project will encompass the following:
 - Build RESTful web services
 - Integrate with a large number of third party API's
 - Build resilience into the architecture
 - Always consider performance impacts this will be servicing a number of high profile applications both mobile and desktop
 - The services should be scalable to service the business going forward


In return we provide the following benefits:
 - Above market rate salaries
 - Global membership to our clubs
 - Large discounts at our restaurants, spas, stores and other services
 - Clothing allowance (yes....that's correct)
 - Reasonably flexible working hours and locations (although this is very much an on site position)
 - Great working location (The heart of Shoreditch)
 - Conference budget
 - Education budget
 - Technical library budget
 - Personal development time


Company Description


Founded in London in 1995 as a private members’ club for people in the creative industries, Soho House & Co has since opened 17 clubs worldwide including Shoreditch House and Soho House in London, and Soho Houses in New York, Berlin, LA, Istanbul. We also operate a number of other public offerings including the Dirty Burger and Chicken Shop restaurant chains; the Cowshed and Neville brands and also a number of hotels.

item.title: Technology Architect at Cognizant Worldwide Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Technology Consultants in Cognizant’s Global Technology Office (GTO)


We are seeking Technology Consultants across grades to join our Global Technology Office (GTO) ideally with previous consulting background within technology solution development. 


GTO provides technology leadership, transformation and innovation services to Cognizant clients. The business unit includes a number of advanced technology laboratories which enable clients to create first of a kind solutions which use emerging technologies. It also has a technology transformation delivery capability. 


In this role you will represent the Cognizant Global Technology Office (GTO) on client engagements and you will take responsibility for shaping, leading and delivering added-value through technology consultancy and through guiding delivery engagements.


You will have proven capability in providing technical leadership, delivering high quality technology advice, creativity and insight; ensuring project success through timely and accurate production of agreed deliverables; with a strong stakeholder management focus and to the benefit of the reputation of GTO.


You will be able to relate business problems to the technology domain and communicate how technology provides business solutions. You should be confident of your ability to perform in complex client engagements when support can be limited. You will be enthusiastic to join an expanding and ambitious team of similarly high calibre, successful technology consultants, and to contribute to our worldwide growth. 


We offer fantastic opportunities to work with cutting-edge technologies with some of the fastest moving, well recognised brands in the world, across all industries.


Person specification: 



  • A passion for technology and how it can deliver business solutions

  • Ability to interact with clients and stakeholders at all levels

  • Good interpersonal and communication skill - both oral and written

  • A strong teamwork ethic with a proven ability to work collaboratively

  • A track record of developing creative solutions

  • Highly developed critical thinking, interpretative and analytical skills

  • A willingness to learn, grow and stretch in new roles and different industries

  • Positive, determined, confident and resourceful in the face of challenges

item.title: Page content can change 750 times per second; 25 million times per day. Can you? at Sky Betting & Gaming (Sheffield, UK)
