item.title: 300 logins (or bets) / sec and growing...... Fancy it? at Sky Betting & Gaming (Sheffield, UK)
item.description:
What you'll tell your friends you do


Drink good coffee, code, table tennis and repeat. 


What you will really be doing


You'll be responsible for ensuring our customers get the best online gaming experience possible


Are you?


A Java and Javascript Developer with experience of been there, done that, with stories to tell of the triumphs and scars to show of the failures. You'll be a fluent coder with a keen sense of architecture and be able to recognise the patterns that work and those that don't.



Systems we use.


This is a greenfield build on top of a supplied core engine. We're going to be using Java 8 and React but most components are up for debate and selection at this point. We're looking at Chef, Salt, Git, Jenkins, Graphite, Splunk, Drop Wizard, Play, Kafka, Rabbit MQ, MongoDB, CouchDB and Docker amongst many others - bring your experience and help us choose!





What day in the office looks like


Our flexible working hours mean that you can get in to our centrally-located office at a convenient time. Grab a cup of “posh” coffee and catch up with your team before the daily standup. Then get your head into the zone, working closely alongside the other engineers, testers and ops in your squad. When you need a break you can take a ride down our famous slide, or even have a game of table tennis!

item.title: Creative C# or JavaScript developer at Contact Group (Birmingham, UK)
item.description:
We are building interesting things using ReactJS and ASP.net MVC 5 and would like you on our team!


This is an exciting opportunity for a junior to mid-level, full stack developer with a passion for the front-end and making things work on mobile. Working in a skilled, close-knit agile team, you will play an important role in creating a mixture of new projects and delivering new features to current ones, in line with our design guidelines and architecture principles.


We would also like you to develop your skills to by pairing with others and to ensure best practice is being followed within the agile team. Our version of agile involves standups, retrospectives, poker, hack days and show and tells.

You MUST be currently based in the UK to apply for this position. Within the UK, we are flexible on remote working.

item.title: Speculative Applications Software Engineer at iDirect (Cranfield, UK)
item.description:
At our Cranfield based Web Development Centre of Excellence, we are responsible for the development of a number key components of the iDirect product, as well as providing professional services, training and product support to our global user-base. Satellite networks are complex systems; configuration, maintenance, monitoring and reporting is made a lot easier with our innovative web-based Network Management System tools we develop here at Cranfield.


iDirect Pulse, our primary NMS, is made up of three key components; a C++ based Back-End which collects and caches real-time information from around the network, a JavaScript based Front-End which visualises this information for the user, and a Perl/Node based Middle-End, which acts as an interface between the BE and FE. All three components seamlessly work together to allow for management of the wider iDirect satellite platform.


Our organisation as a whole is very much Scrum/Agile focussed, and as such we work in diverse teams where thoughts and ideas are shared and collaboration is actively encouraged. This gives all our staff the opportunity to work across the product, really getting to understand exactly how and why it operates, and how it fits seamlessly within the larger iDirect communication platform.



About you:


We’re looking for the very best candidates to join us in Cranfield, where you will work alongside a wider team of smart, creative and dedicated colleagues. We value a good approach to problem solving, logical thinking and the enthusiasm, passion and ability to learn new skills quickly


Those who are successful within iDirect:



  • Are excited by and demonstrate a passion for the latest developments in web technology

  • Enjoy regularly coming up with clever, creative solutions to difficult problems

  • Have strong communication skills, and enjoy sharing ideas and knowledge with technical and non-technical colleagues across the globe

  • Show a strong ownership ethic

  • Display both flexibility and dedication to their work, colleagues and product

  • Show a genuine interest in learning about satellite communication

item.title: UX Developer (Contract to hire) at iDirect (Cranfield, UK)
item.description:
Come help us create the future of iDirect. We're looking for passionate, create UX developers who are excited about solving new problems. 


We don't expect you to know everything coming in, so it's our responsibility to ensure that you're getting coached and developing your skills as you embark at iDirect. 


What you will do:



  • Evangelize user experience across the organization, both in terms of general best practices and research findings specific to iDirect



  • Analyze real user behavior and make actionable, data-driven user experience recommendations based on a combination of existing knowledge and learnings from our unique user base



  • Leveraging significant knowledge of user experience best practices toward the continual improvement of a new and growing User Experience department



  • Participate in requirements gathering, use case development and design guideline development and present findings and ideas to an organization new to user experience



  • Stay up to date in current and emerging user experience industry standards and trends, web and mobile technologies, digital design best practices, and apply them to project work, as appropriate.

item.title: Senior Java Developer - FT eCommerce Platform at Financial Times (London, UK)
item.description:
Come and join the Technology team at the Financial Times, and be part of the talented driving force building solutions to continue to provide our growing readership with globally respected and world­class FT content.


Based in our headquarters in the heart of London Bridge, you’ll join a large team of Technology specialists in areas which include; Web & Cloud Software Development, Data Analytics, eCommerce, Salesforce, Networks, Infrastructure, Business Analysis, Programme/Project Management, Customer/Supplier Management and Operations.


What it’s like to work for us


From day one, you’ll dive straight in and rub shoulders with some of the brightest and innovative individuals in the industry. We believe in multi­disciplined, co­located teams, who are empowered to choose their own development methodologies (typically SCRUM or Kanban). Most teams choose to practise Continuous Delivery or Continuous Deployment to help ensure we deliver incremental value throughout the product lifecycle.


We ensure our engineers have all the tools they need ­ you’ll be free to choose the OS and device type which suits you best, so you’re ready to go. The FT are strong believers in cloud and web­based systems, so you’ll be using applications such as Google Apps for Work and Salesforce


With such a collaborative culture, there are always opportunities to get involved and help bring your fantastic ideas to life. We run regular hack days, which sees teams compete against each other to pitch their ideas to a panel of industry experts. There are also regular competitions (with prizes!) for ideas which help promote readership engagement and growth. Employees are encouraged to attend off­site conferences and training courses in addition to a growing number of internal events ­ this includes our very own ‘Engine Room Live’. Engineers also have the opportunity to experience new domains and technologies within our Technology group meaning there’s always a new challenge waiting for you.


Projects you might work on in this role



  • FT’s Commerce Platform: Built by our in house technical team, the Commerce platform is cloud first and follows a microservices architecture built on AWS.  It supports the commerce requirements for our customers globally for FT.com, the newspaper and the FT’s associated titles. Following an API first strategy to enable the FT to rapidly adapt to changes in the market and to quickly enable to revenue streams such as our Paid Trial model.

  • FT’s Identity and Access Management Platform: Capturing and manage customer details, authentication requirements and making real time content access decisions across a variety of channels is the key focus of this platform.  Working in this space, you can expect to participate in projects to enable different authentication mechanisms such as Social Login and SSO, contribute to the delivery of our platform API strategy and enable new initiatives such as Google AMP.


Responsibilities



  • Ensure solutions are robust and technically fit for purpose and in line with FT technology strategy and meet required quality and operational monitoring standards

  • Work closely with Operations and Support teams to ensure delivery of efficient monitoring, alerting and documentation.

  • Collaborate with business analysts & product owners to contribute to the definition and understanding of incoming requirements

  • Take complete ownership over solutions such that the team will provide on-going support to the systems that they build

item.title: Java Developers (Senior & Lead) shape performance & scalability in real-time... at Mimecast (London, UK)
item.description:
Mimecast is looking for experienced Core Java Developers (Senior to Lead Software Engineers) to join our high performance engineering team. Ideal candidates will share a passion for tackling complexity with simplicity and building platforms that can scale through multiple orders of magnitude. We are looking for people who think that searching for a needle in a haystack can indeed be exciting and not afraid of exploring unconventional solutions.


The successful candidates will join a core services team whose main function is to developing real-time applications for the Mimecast grid. You will be working within exciting large scale processing environments where integration and performance is critical.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer Technology Consultancy - HTML5, CSS3, Javascript at Amaze (London, UK)
item.description:
The past year has been one of our best yet and, as a result, we’re looking for talented Developers to join our team, helping to ensure we continue to produce award-winning, innovative work. Joining us means you’ll be given the opportunity to work across a variety of technologies: from bespoke micro apps to Global enterprise ecommerce platforms.


As a Senior Front End Developer at Amaze you’ll work with a mixture of established and cutting edge client-side technologies, demonstrating exceptional coding standards and attention to detail with a proven ability to take the lead working in small, focused teams.


Reporting to the Technical Manager and working with multi-disciplinary teams, responsibilities include:



  • Executing a high standard of UI development with understanding of established UX practices and a keen eye for design detail, both with Adaptive and Responsive design

  • Implementing a "Design in Browser" approach to build along with a more traditional component-led PSD / Build approach

  • Collaborating with key internal project stakeholders on job estimations and costing

  • Liaising and communicating with technical client stakeholders

  • Learning and applying new techniques quickly and where required

item.title: Full Stack Developer Node.js, JavaScript, ReactJS at Amaze (London, UK)
item.description:
Due to a recently becoming the global digital partner of a renowned airline, we are now looking for a talented Full Stack Node.js Developer to join our Manchester or London office, working on developing an innovative Web PaaS solution. You will join our super-talented, leading Technical team who are at the forefront of utilising the latest technologies to build the best sites for our global clients.


The primary stack is Node, Express, Elasticsearch and Couchbase


As a Full Stack Developer at Amaze, your responsibilities will include:



  • Refactoring and optimisation

  • Design and implementation of low-latency, high-availability, and performant services

  • Implementation of security and data protection techniques

  • Data repository (NoSQL) coding against Couchbase 

  • Logging using the ELK stack

  • Ensuring good coverage of unit tests

  • Ensuring good source code management using git

  • Deployment using CI techniques, using Team City

item.title: Lead Software Engineer - C# at Spektrix Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for a Principal Software Engineer to assist the CTO with leadership of the technical design, architecture and development of the Spektrix product. You will be passionate about developing robust, scalable, SaaS systems using the latest technologies and techniques and keen to share your expertise with the rest of the Engineering team. If successful, you will join our focussed team of engineers and have responsibility for designing, developing and maintaining our multi-tenant, enterprise grade box office solution. At the time of writing our web-based ticketing system is handling about 9m web requests per day and is selling about £1m worth of tickets per day for our clients.


Our Technology


Our system is a multi-tenant, scalable web application written in C# and backed by SQL Server. We have developed our own web framework to enable us to deliver modern, single page web applications quickly and efficiently. We use Razor HTML templates, SASS and Javascript on the frontend, Nhibernate for data access, RabbitMQ for queuing, NUnit for testing and Jira, Bitbucket and Bamboo for issue tracking, code hosting and CI.


Technical Challenges



  • Our system currently handles 9m web requests per day and sells £1m worth of tickets per day for our clients. The nature of the industry means that there are often peaks of activity many times higher than the normal load.

  • As our client base grows and becomes more complex, we are constantly upgrading the system to stay ahead of these demands.

  • The industry is organic - every client has their own unique way of doing things and our system has to be highly configurable in order to meet these demands but while never customising the software to meet the requirements of any one specific client.

  • As an application that users often use for 8 hours a day straight while serving customers (who at peaks times, may be queuing out the door), it has to have far better response times than the average web application.

item.title: Web Developer: Write Software That Other Developers Will Use at DiffBlue (Oxford, UK)
item.description:
Why do we want you and your skills


We develop software that uses cutting-edge research to automatically create unit tests for our customers. You will help us design and develop a web UI that the customers use to interact with our analysis tools and/or a Node.js application server part of our product which makes sure that the analysis tools are correctly executed, and that the results of analysis are processed and stored in the database in a way that can be presented the UI in a fast and reliable way. Other parts of the system you will work on include account management, billing and payment systems for users, and monitoring system for other developers.


To imagine the scale and importance of the job, think of a CI service that builds customers' code and runs tests. For us, the builds and test running are the easy part. Compared to such a CI service, we produce much more data, and the data is less familiar to the customer. So it is crucial to make sure we work with the data in an efficient way.


What will you learn in this role


Not having any dependency on legacy software, you will be able to learn and use latest web technologies. You will also learn a lot about security when making sure that a single customer's code and data are not accessible to other customers. This starts with preventing simple HTML script injections, and proceeds up to making sure that analysis of customers' code does not have undesirable side-effects. You will also make sure our billing and payment systems are operating securely. Given the type of the analysis and the amount of data we produce, you will learn a lot about performance when improving scalability of your code.


Besides this core knowledge, you will also learn a lot about software debugging, testing and verification. You will get the opportunity to learn internals of various programming languages when writing the Node.js/UI scripts for customers' code.


What team you will be in


The web UI and Node.js team currently has 2 developers, and we are extending it to 4. You will regularly talk to other team members about the requirements put on the UI and the application server, and to our sales people about the customer experience and the improvements required.

item.title: C++ Expert for a Cutting Edge Program Analysis Tool at DiffBlue (Oxford, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for a senior C++ developer to contribute to the development of a compiler / interpreter / program translator for web programming languages.


Our tools currently support C and Java as the languages that can be analysed, and our next step is to extend the tools to handle web languages like JavaScript, PHP or Ruby. This is a challenging task with various interesting subtasks, including parser writing, advanced type inference, and compiler optimisations.


You will be working in a team of 2 to 3 developers on the core of the language frontend, and will closely collaborate with the developers of the analysis tools themselves.


Responsibilities



  • Implementation of C++ modules for the transformation of JavaScript, PHP, or Ruby

  • Build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable C++ code

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation

  • Liaise with the developers of the analyser back-end to discuss required features

item.title: Production Engineer at Facebook (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Production Engineers at Facebook are hybrid software/systems engineers who ensure that Facebook's services run smoothly and have the capacity for future growth. They are embedded in every one of Facebook's product and infrastructure teams, and are core participants in every significant engineering effort underway in the company. Our team is comprised of varying levels of experience and backgrounds, from new grads to industry veterans. Relevant industry experience is important, but ultimately less so than your demonstrated abilities and attitude. We sail into uncharted waters every day at Facebook in Production Engineering, and we are always learning. This position is full-time and located in our Dublin, International Headquarters office.


Responsibilities



  • Own back-end services like our Hadoop data warehouses, front-end services like Chat and Newsfeed, infrastructure components like our Memcache infrastructure, and everything in between

  • Write and review code, develop documentation and capacity plans, and debug the hardest problems, live, on some of the largest and most complex systems in the world

  • Together with your engineering team, you will share an on-call rotation

  • Partnered alongside the best engineers in the industry on the coolest stuff around, the code and systems you work on will be in production and used by millions of users all around the world

item.title: Technical Lead for PaaS & SaaS technical consultancy at Amido (London, UK)
item.description:
Amido don’t say yes to every project that comes our way. Where a problem is ill-defined, a technology redundant, or a system bogged down in legacy code we frequently say no, but when the right client has the right project – which is happening with increasing frequency as we gain a reputation – we need the power to say yes. And to do this, we need Technical Leads.


Sitting at the most senior technical level on our projects, Technical Leads take ultimate responsibility for the design and delivery of enterprise-grade PaaS and SaaS solutions that favour a simple and maintainable approach over a clever and complex one.


A combination of integration and new development, our projects span four clearly defined types: Identity maximises data capture from customer interaction and supports analysis to better understand and target audiences; Hyperscale Transactions allow ambitious brands to handle almost limitless traffic without compromising customer experience; Search and Insight draws data from disparate sources and makes it available to customers via a single Cloud-based search platform; and Systems Integration, Build and Delivery means assembling out of the box Cloud solutions and implementing to mesh with existing systems.


Across each, our Technical Leads drive solutions by matching customer requirements to appropriate technology in collaboration with Business Analysts, Project Managers & client-side stakeholders.


Once an outline solution is determined you’ll sit at the head of a Scrum team likely comprising .NET or Java, front-end, DevOps and QA Consultants (no two projects are the same) to deliver the planned solution, guiding the team through challenges and adjusting their approach as required.


You’ll oversee not just the development of code and integration of services but, with the support of experienced QA and DevOps Consultants, ensure this code is tested at every step of the path to production and deployed via completely automated tooling.


While you’ll work closely with Business Analysts and Project Mangers to clarify requirements, create a backlog and prioritise user stories, as the team’s key technical resource, you’ll also communicate complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders and contribute to client relationships at all levels.


Off project you’ll accumulate market know-how by keeping abreast of industry trends including new SaaS or PaaS products that might enhance Amido’s approach or product set, something we hope will encourage you towards supporting vendor evaluation, influencing decisions on technology investments and networking for new projects.


This is not a small role. It’s challenging and, on a technical level at least, all-encompassing, mixing leadership, planning, consulting and architecture, all in a customer-facing capacity. Having said this, it’s also varied – not every project is intimidating in size, and because we apply similar technology to disparate business problems the role supports a learning curve around project scope & complexity.

item.title: Front End Developer - make a difference to education at Sparx (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for people with a real passion for education and a belief in the power of technology to improve it. Things move fast at Sparx so we need people who assume that excellence is a given and who are ambitious, creative, intelligently sceptical and highly knowledgeable. People who want a challenge; people who want to make a difference.


As a Front End Developer at Sparx, you’ll be integral to the team from day one, helping to make decisions, shaping team objectives and driving both your own and the rest of the team’s technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be involved in the development of the core technical framework of our web and tablet- based system and constantly push its evolution. You’ll work with all members of the team – from data scientists to content developers – to find solutions to the most challenging problems we face when building a system of this scale.


You’ll be involved in designing and creating the key front end components used by students, teachers and content creators, using cutting edge web technologies to create first class user experiences. You’ll also have the opportunity to dive into the backend server code and databases, working on our full web stack.


Our technology stack is constantly evolving as we pick the right tools for the job, but you should expect to be working with web, server and native technologies such as Angular, React, Redux, Immutable.js, Pixi.js, Less, Django, Nginx, Postgres, Sqlite and RabbitMQ, in languages including Javascript, Python, Objective C, C++ and Lua, on iOS, Linux (Debian) and OS X platforms.

item.title: Graduate Developer - make a difference to education at Sparx (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for people with a real passion for education and a belief in the power of technology to improve it. Things move fast at Sparx so we need people who assume that excellence is a given and who are ambitious, creative, intelligently sceptical and highly knowledgeable. People who want a challenge; people who want to make a difference.


As a Graduate Developer at Sparx, you’ll be an integral part of the team from day one, forming the heart of our technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be joining our team of games and software developers, supporting the development of the technical framework of the Sparx system. You’ll get to see software you’ve helped program go live in a classroom the next day. Then you’ll be diving straight back in to making it better, getting into the detail, zooming out to look at the bigger picture, solving each problem and trying out the next idea.


If gaming is more your thing, you’ll be supporting the designing, programming and testing of high quality games for a variety of subjects. The games you help create will need to get under the skin of what makes students tick and, working closely with the expert team around you, uncover exactly what is going to help them overcome each obstacle in understanding that they face.


Things happen at breakneck speed at Sparx and you’ll need to think creatively to help the team get from A to B. Our work is ever evolving so you’ll have plenty of opportunities to make your mark and take on increasing responsibility as time goes on.


Our technology stack is constantly evolving as we pick the right tools for the job, but you should expect to be working with web, server and native technologies such as Angular, React, Redux, Immutable.js, Pixi.js, Less, Django, Nginx, Postgres, Sqlite and RabbitMQ, in languages including Javascript, Python, Objective C, C++ and Lua, on iOS, Linux (Debian) and OS X platforms.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - make a difference to education at Sparx (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for people with a real passion for education and a belief in the power of technology to improve it. Things move fast at Sparx so we need people who assume that excellence is a given and who are ambitious, creative, intelligently sceptical and highly knowledgeable. People who want a challenge; people who want to make a difference.


As a Senior Software Developer at Sparx, you’ll be integral to the team from day one, helping to make decisions, shaping team objectives and driving both your own and the rest of the team’s technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be involved in the development of the core technical framework of our web and tablet- based system and constantly push its evolution. You’ll work with all members of the team – from data scientists to content developers – to find solutions to the most challenging problems we face when building a system of this scale.


You’ll be responsible for designing and implementing components for the Sparx system, writing robust, reusable code that focuses on usability, scalability and innovation. Program it how you want, see how it works in a classroom the very next day and you’ll get instant feedback to be able to dive straight back in to make it even better.


Our technology stack is constantly evolving as we pick the right tools for the job, but you should expect to be working with web, server and native technologies such as Angular, React, Redux, Immutable.js, Pixi.js, Less, Django, Nginx, Postgres, Sqlite and RabbitMQ, in languages including Javascript, Python, Objective C, C++ and Lua, on iOS, Linux (Debian) and OS X platforms.

item.title: Exceptional Java Engineers (all levels), London at Anaplan (London, UK)
item.description:
Exceptional Java Engineers (all levels) – London


Originally founded in the UK and now headquartered in San Francisco, Anaplan has 16 offices globally. We are a rapidly expanding, $1billion Silicon Valley tech firm on a mission to revolutionise how companies analyse and plan their businesses….and it’s working – we’re already trusted by hundreds of Fortune 2000 companies and we’ve only just begun. 



Anaplan is the leading planning and performance management platform for smart businesses. We are a pre-IPO tech company, a global market leader and the winner of multiple awards. Our culture is open, honest and inclusive - we have Silicon Valley sensibilities, strong ties to Europe and are producing seriously scalable and powerful business software. 


We already have award-winning Development environments in York, Paris and San Francisco....our continued growth and success mean we have just opened a significant Development centre in central London (which we hope will win awards too!)


Now, we are looking for exceptional Java Engineers of all levels to join us and we’re serious about attracting the very best in the industry - we offer huge technical problems to solve, a relaxed and flexible working environment (in very cool surroundings!), sustained technical and career progression, superb packages and much more.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Zuhlke Engineering Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Zuhlke is a European software engineering consultancy that helps businesses turn ideas into reality. We need people who are capable, talented, and engaged to help build systems for our clients, based mainly in our expanding London office. We take on interesting projects in many domains, including media, finance, heavy engineering, and medical devices.


Your job will involve working closely with clients to develop, test, and ship software that meets their needs. You will be looking both to contribute to the company and to grow personally.


Our reputation is fundamental to our business, so our culture emphasizes quality, reliability and respect. As a privately-held company owned by past and present employees, and run by engineers, Zuhlke takes a long-term view. For example, you will receive twenty days training per year, including a budget to support activities such as conference attendance, our annual technical camp, and participation in focused topic teams. We like our staff to be technically flexible so, if you don’t have a required skill now, we can support you learning it.


Your job will include:



  • Helping our clients understand what they really need

  • Building quality systems to satisfy those needs

  • Working collaboratively with colleagues and clients

  • Keeping technically sharp

  • Getting things done

  • Sometimes travelling to other locations in the UK and mainland Europe

item.title: Tools & Automation Support Engineer at RPC Consulting (Little Chesterford, UK)
item.description:
We're looking for a Tools & Automation Support Engineer to support our growing Tyche Development Team here at RPC Consulting.


Tyche is a cutting-edge software product that provides flexible mathematical modelling capabilities to companies in the financial sector, and particularly in insurance.  In summary, Tyche provides "supercomputer power in a package that is as easy to use as a spreadsheet".


What Tech Do We Use?


Tyche uses a mix of technologies, including C#, C++, OpenGL, CUDA, AMP, OpenCL, WPF and .NET.  Platforms supported are Windows 7 onwards, and Windows Server 2008 onwards.  Developers use Visual Studio 2015 and ReSharper for development, together with a range of other third-party add-ons, and supporting tools include Git, TeamCity, BitBucket, NUnit, JIRA, JIRA Service Desk and Code Reviewer.


Why Are We Are Offering The Role?


Our team has grown from two a year ago to nine at present, and given the success of our product we are looking to grow further.  At present, all developers share responsibility for maintaining the tools that we use, but this is proving to be inefficient and we have decided that it would be much better for a dedicated individual to perform this task.


What Are The Responsibilities Of The Role?


The engineer will be an integral part of the team here at Chesterford Research Park and will have responsibility for maintaining tools, processes and resources in the following areas:



  • JIRA & JIRA Service Desk.  We are currently in the process of migrating from a server-hosted version to the cloud here.

  • TeamCity.  All of our CI is managed by TeamCity.

  • Test Suites.  We run "accuracy tests" (both unit and system tests) on each code change, and longer "performance tests" (generally system tests) every night.  The work here will involve monitoring the test runs (particularly the overnight runs) and ensuring that errors in the runs are addressed.

  • Git

  • BitBucket

  • Code Reviewer

  • Visual Studio settings

  • ReSharper settings

  • StyleCop & FXCop settings.  We don't use these tools yet, but are looking to introduce them in order to help ensure consistent coding styles among all developers, and address issues that would otherwise arise in code reviews.


Additional work will involve:



  • Providing QA support for Tyche: helping to generate automated tests to augment the test suites that the developers produce, as well as performing manual testing of the Tyche product.

  • Setting up machines for new starters, and maintaining our existing machines (including our build & test server).


The role reports directly to Mark Sinclair-McGarvie, CTO & Partner, RPC Consulting.

item.title: Quant Developer at RPC Consulting (Saffron Walden, UK)
item.description:
The role of Quant Developer is open to a capable and motivated mathematical software developer.  We're looking at a broad range of experience levels here, from new graduates to gurus, and we want anyone coming on board to be prepared to learn and improve their skills.  Although we are part of a larger organisation, we're a young group with an open, relaxed atmosphere, and we're looking for people that are in turn open to new ideas and ways of doing things.


The role involves a broad range of activities:



  • Development of the Tyche software product.  All development proceeds according to modern software development practices such as continuous integration testing, and code produced needs to be mathematically correct and highly efficient.



  • Determining mathematical solutions to problems, and determining how best to express those solutions in terms of computer code.  The problems to be solved may be concrete practical problems such as how to find an optimal investment strategy, or how best to calibrate a mathematical model to data, or more abstract problems such as how best to efficiently execute a sequence of mathematical operations.



  • Testing and quality control.  This is hugely important to us.  Any work needs to be thoroughly tested, and a comprehensive set of tests should be submitted for the work alongside the code, to add to our regression testing suite.



  • Maintenance and support of Tyche.  For this, read bugfixing ;)!  We have a low bug-rate at present, and have very rigorous systems for bug recording and monitoring, but fixing bugs generally takes priority over new project work.


The term "Quant Developer" can be used to mean a broad spectrum of things in the industry.  At one end, there are essentially pure quants who hack programs together, and at the other end there are dedicated software developers with little mathematics.  We don't really fit in to that.  At RPC Consulting we take the software development equally as seriously as the mathematics.  The team here are professional software developers at the same time as being serious mathematicians; we don't compromise on either area.


Please submit a CV and covering letter to Mark Sinclair-McGarvie at RPC Consulting.

item.title: Senior R&D Software Engineer at Synopsys (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
We have a role in our TCAD Mesh Generation Group that would suit a talented software engineer/scientist looking to develop exciting applications used by international blue chip corporations, research institutions and universities worldwide.


The candidate will help the group develop new technologies in the Sentaurus product line. The responsibilities for this position include the design, development, troubleshooting and maintenance of medium to large software projects written in C++. This will also include maintaining structure generation code in Sentaurus Process and Process Explorer, as well as developing code for new applications.

item.title: Senior R&D Software Engineer - C++, Physics at Synopsys (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
The Topography Team in Synopsys is a group of highly qualified and motivated scientists who develop the world's most powerful software for 3D feature-scale simulation of advanced semiconductors technology, which is a part of the well-known Sentaurus TCAD product.


The Role:


In this role you will be responsible for software development in the area of three-dimensional semiconductor topography simulation. The semiconductor fabrication process includes various shape-changing steps such as lithography, deposition, etching, and chemical mechanical polishing. Simulating the three-dimensional shape evolution during these processes is a very challenging task requiring predictive physical and chemical models, advanced 3D computational geometry, and high-performance computational techniques.


This position includes development of new code as well as maintenance of existing C++ code. The development is performed in close collaboration with partners from the semiconductor industry. As a member of a small team, the employee participates in development, documentation, and maintenance tasks.

item.title: Software Developer at Springer Nature (London, UK)
item.description:
We build our software incrementally, iteratively, and continuously, so you’ll be able to see new work go live to over four million visitors around the globe every week. XP and Kanban heavily influence our flavour of agile and if something isn’t working, we change it.


Our teams are cross-discipline so that our work delivers value to both the business and our customers: business analysts and UX designers work with stakeholders to coordinate research and understand requirements, frontend developers and software engineers pair with quality analysts to develop the most robust solutions, and our platform engineers work across the organisation to ensure our infrastructure never lets us down.


What you'll do…



  • Create complex, enterprise-class web applications

  • Use the latest tools and technologies

  • Influence every step of the delivery process and take ownership for what you build

  • Contribute to project priorities and find innovative ways to meet objectives

  • Collaborate and work closely with analysts, designers, testers, operations, and product owners, in a diverse and informal environment

item.title: Software Architect at The Boston Consulting Group (London, UK)
item.description:
FLAGSHIP SOFTWARE ENGINEERING


Our clients are senior business executives who value BCG's strategic, fact-based, and impact-oriented approach supported by highly experienced senior expert teams and rich benchmarking databases and analytical capability. BCG has a number of flagship software products that support our core capabilities. These products are critical to the success of our project teams to deliver superior quality insight and implementation of major change efforts. The Flagship Software Engineering team has been an invaluable partner of the Practice Areas in this endeavor. Together, we have custom developed and deployed a number of software applications with proven success in the field.


POSITION SUMMARY:


The Software Architect will play a critical role in driving next generational development of these software applications, likely collaborating in successful multi-million dollar, multi-year investments. Under general guidance from the Applications Development Technical Lead, and working with Business Analyst and Product Manager, this role will be at the center of development efforts, overseeing application architecture and database design, and ensuring application security, flexibility, scalability, and performance. Key activities will include defining the interaction between application modules, layers, and middleware systems; as well as to communicate design choices and coding standards to third party vendors.


BASIC JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Demonstrate and communicate a passion for digital products and services

  • Apply your knowledge of online, cloud and mobile platforms (Windows Azure, Google App Engine, Amazon Cloud, OS X, Android are essential)

  • Drive analysis of how business requirements can be technically implemented

  • Integrate large and complex system integration projects and collaborate with cross-functional teams

  • Design complex bespoke solutions that require creative and complex investigations and evaluations of alternative architectural solutions

  • Utilize proactive problem-solving to address challenges and functional concerns

  • Demonstrate initiative, self-motivation, creative problem-solving and effective interpersonal/communication skills that support the process of building collaborative teams

  • Institute superior technology capabilities with diligence, attention to detail and technical intuition

  • Implement advanced organizational and planning skills to developmental projects

  • Balance competing priorities while adhering to deadlines and aligning resources with value demands

  • Serve as a thought leader in digital platforms and solution architecture, regardless of the screen, device or deployment environment

  • Design bespoke online and mobile IT architecture, drawing on knowledge of open source and/or commercially available platforms

  • Apply industry best practices and design patterns to create scalable and secure solutions that have superior technical performance

  • Develop system implementation plans/processes and oversee the development, integration, testing and launch stages

  • Defines application architecture as a mean to achieve the business' security, flexibility, scalability, and performance goals; and makes sure that, over time and through the architecture's evolution, all stakeholders requirements can be met

  • Documents and communicates the architecture to the development team, third party vendors (as required), and all stakeholders (to the detail appropriate to the audience)

  • Ensures code development follows the architecture blue print and established coding standards

  • Proposes modeling and proofs-of-concept as required

  • Ensures the architecture is optimal not only for development, but also for operations, deployment, and continuous enhancements

  • When confronted with technical challenges, must find creative, economical, and elegant software engineering solutions

  • Identifies risks and proposes risk mitigation strategies associated with the architecture

  • Evaluate third-party suppliers, products and solutions and engage in/leading collaborative discussions


Other:



  • Mentors and directs other, more junior members of the team.

  • Performs other projects and duties as assigned or required.

  • Moderate amount of traveling – dependent on project requirements.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Geovation (London, UK)
item.description:
About Us


Ordnance Survey leads the world in map making and mapping technologies. Our team are adventurous, curious and always looking for new ways to create something fantastic. That’s why we’ve created our Geovation Hub in London. This location-data lab is a space where some of the industry’s best collaborate, share ideas and discover how to progress current geospatial products and services. 



About You


We are now looking to add 2 Senior Software Engineers to our team, and hopefully, that’s where you come in. 

If you’re a creative and expert Software Engineer with a collaborative work style and a passion for problem-solving, this is a brilliant opportunity to share your expertise and drive excellence within a fantastic Development Team. 

As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll be taking on this sociable role where you’ll play a key part in exchanging and developing ideas and contributing to the Geovation Hub’s collaborative environment. 

Essentially, you’ll be building applications from the ground up all the way to the production environment and acting as the technical consultant for entrepreneurs. This is a varied role that will see you wear many different hats, for some projects you will act as CTO, for others the technical expert and for some you will be rolling your sleeves up and getting heavily involved in the hands-on coding. 

This is a great chance to utilise your expertise and develop new solutions for some of the most exciting start-ups in the market. And the best part? As you are working for a well-funded and fully backed incubator, you will not have the risk of joining a start-up but will have all of the excitement and engagement of operating within the start-up environment. 


Good Stuff




  • Competitive salary




  • Great pension scheme




  • Get 25 days holiday per year (30 days after five years)




  • State-of-the-art workspace




  • Freedom to innovate




  • Sociable culture




  • Tech events




  • Work MacBook Pro




  • Support for your health and wellbeing




With your ‘we’ll find a way’ mentality, positivity and enthusiasm, you will be capable of conversing with entrepreneurs calmly, professionally and in a supportive manner. As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll also need to possess a sense of fun, be able to propose your own ideas and will be eager to keep growing and learning.

item.title: Full Stack Software Developer at DownUnder GeoSolutions (West Perth, Australia)
item.description:
Job Summary


DownUnder GeoSolutions is an innovative geosciences company with a diverse range of capabilities. Our products and services are at the cutting edge of exploration and production services to the global oil and gas industry.


Our software development team play a pivotal role in our success, from creating optimised imaging software for our high performance compute clusters, to developing innovative visualisations and task-focused user interfaces for emerging customer requirements.


We’re looking for software developers to join our efforts to develop the next generation of seismic processing and interpretation applications; developers who are keen to learn new domain knowledge, tools, and techniques, and then extend these into innovative ideas of their own.


As a Full Stack Software Developer, you’ll work with a small team of energetic problem solvers on ambitious software challenges. You’ll use our agile continuous integration process to rapidly deploy advanced features to internal users, while also meeting production schedules for stable releases to external clients. Your enthusiasm for learning will enable you to implement complex features in Java and/or C, and employ your design smarts on new user interfaces, APIs, high performance computing and cluster data challenges. You’ll be highly prized for the breadth of geophysical knowledge you’re building as you solve challenging software problems for your users. When submitting your application, you’ll have shown you read this job description in its entirety by including ‘Shibboleth’ in your cover letter.


Your tasks:



  • high- and detailed-level design of complex geophysical software,

  • implementation, testing, and maintenance of software in Java and/or C,

  • inspection and maintenance of software written by other members of the team,

  • becoming conversant in basic geophysics and petrophysics, common industry workflows, unique DUG algorithms, and competitors' technologies,

  • acting as 3rd-level technical support, for otherwise-unresolvable customer issues,

  • supporting internal users in the company's service divisions, often involving critical, time-sensitive issues,

  • providing and receiving regular, constructive feedback to and from your peers,

  • collaborating on priority and scheduling for rapid product iterations,

  • acting as mentor for an exceptional intern or junior developer.

item.title: Java Software Engineer at J.P Morgan & Chase (Bournemouth, UK)
item.description:
This role is an exciting opportunity to work in our Global Payments Technology department in Treasury Services. This role will be a new feature team formed to do green field development and deploy a new strategic fraud control system for our Corporate Client Payments flow. Candidates will be expected to be best of breed Individual Contributors; possess strong inter-personal skills and work well as a team, as well as proven track record of delivery in application development with technical skills in Core Java, J2EE, SPRING, and a RDBMS.

  • The day to day activities of the role will encompass the full project lifecycle, including:



  • Writing Greenfield mission critical software in the core technologies listed below



  • Designing software and producing very scalable and resilient technical designs



  • Creating Automated Unit Tests using Flexible/Open Source Frameworks using a Test Driven Development approach



  • Digesting and understanding Business Requirements and designing new modules/functionality which meet needs

item.title: Development Manager at J.P Morgan & Chase (Bournemouth, UK)
item.description:
Delivery Manager role responsible for the delivery of the
Intraday Liquidity applications for JP Morgan Investment Bank Technology



Candidates will be expected to manage the development of the real-time Intraday Liquidity (IDL) platform.  The IDL platform is responsible for continuously aggregating Transactions and Balances from multiple statement, ledger, payment and settlement systems in order to calculate, visualize, and monitor critical metrics relating to JPMorgan’s (Cash) Liquidity, Credit Utilization, and Collateral balances and flows.



The role will require proficiency in all aspects of managing software delivery, including:



Release Management



  • Planning of the release contents and dates

  • Coordination and communicate of the stories/bugs/defects in the release cycle

  • Coordination and planning of the release activities

  • Process improvement/Deployment stories/retrospectives  - owner of the stories around releases/deployment

  • Environment management (release & stability)

  • Management of the testing within the release

  • Coordination/Planning/Management of the testing activities needed for each release


Sprint management



  • Work with teams to ensure stories are refined in time for Sprint commitment

  • Ensure all stories in sprints are allocated to teams

  • Planning of sprint stories to make MVP

  • Follow up of current stories in  sprint to ensure it is completed or spilling over

  • Testing improvements – driving out new stories


Application Support Management



  • All prod support tickets/admin is followed up and completed e.g. ITSM, HPSM, Alacrity

  • All production/resiliency activity e.g. db/unix patches/reboots, MQ changes are planned/executed (communications to external team)

  • Ensure all monitoring/infra documentation is up-to date

  • Owner of support stories

  • Environment management (prod parallel, ticking uat) to ensure each db patch/reboot are done

item.title: Front-end Agile Developer at J.P Morgan & Chase (Bournemouth, UK)
item.description:
Front-end Agile Developer


Do you want to join a team that embraces the principles of Agile not just the process? Do you want to learn high-demand and interesting new technologies? Then look no further.


This is an excellent opportunity to join JP Morgan Chase on the sunny South Coast in Bournemouth. You will be working with a bright and collaborative team that is developing the next generation of cross organisation task management and situational awareness systems. This programme utilises much of the latest thinking in UX design, workflow and dashboards to make complex working practices intuitive and efficient.


Agile and Lean principles define our structure and working environment where multi-skilled self-managing teams create great opportunity for developers to broaden their skills and business knowledge and gain experience in leadership, analysis, mentoring and coaching.


Bournemouth is a great place to live with a vibrant night life that rivals Brighton as well as beautiful beaches, great water-sports and fantastic walking and cycling in the New Forest.

item.title: Problem solving Ruby & Javascript developers wanted - Southampton & London at Alliants (Sarisbury Green, UK)
item.description:
Working at Alliants


At Alliants we love to solve business problems; sometimes with technology and sometimes without. We are always looking for creative and enthusiastic people who share that spirit to join our team. All of our work comes from recommendation and the fact we take great pride in the work that we do means that we continue to get recommended.


Our aim is to work in self-sufficient and collaborative cross-functional teams. We develop iteratively, responding to feedback and change, while taking a pragmatic approach to delivery. Communication is a key part of how we function.


We are committed to providing an atmosphere where everyone’s opinions and ideas are respected, work-life balance is valued and all our colleagues have opportunities to learn and grow. We hire people rather than functions and take great care to ensure that the people we hire share our values.


Who Are You?


You care about providing value to the client and want to engage with them to understand their needs. You think about the bigger picture rather than just your current task and are prepared to turn your hand to whatever needs to be done to help the team.


You are keen to share your well considered opinions while also welcoming ideas of others and healthy debate. You are good at what you do, more than that you are so passionate about it that that passion is contagious.


Roles


As a Software Developer you understand and have experience of robust development frameworks including source control, unit testing and daily builds. You see the value in TDD and pair programming but also understand when they are valuable and when other methods are more beneficial. Our current preferred technology stack is Ruby on Rails with Angular or React for web and native iOS and Android apps for mobile. You should be able to demonstrate excellence in one of these. Open source projects which can demonstrate your skills will be highly regarded.


Why Join Us?


Great things we provide to all employees:



  • Investment time to explore new ideas, and work with the wider community

  • An annual training budget to enable you to learn and develop

  • Sponsorship to represent us at conferences and local hack days

  • A budget to spend on hardware of your choice (we’re typically a MacBook crowd)

  • Awesome Fridays with breakfast, lunch and drinks fridge

  • Popular benefits including pension, healthcare, bonuses, child care vouchers and cycle to work.


If you value collaboration, technical excellence and continuous improvement then get in touch and tell us about yourself.


Alliants is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

item.title: Team Lead Web Development at Coolblue ()
item.description:
As a Team Lead Web Developer at Coolblue you will support your team define the shopping experience of hundreds of thousands of people daily.

What you tell your friends you do
"I'm like Yoda. ‘Code size matters not. Judge it by it's size you should not. For my ally is The Code. And a powerful ally it is.'"

What you will really be doing
  • You will work with one or two cross functional teams formed by Back-end and Front-end Developers, UX designers and a Scrum Master.
  • You will act as the technical conscience of the teams, keeping a bird eye view on the state of our codebase and initiating projects to keep it up to date and in tip-top shape.
  • You will help Product Owners in aligning the functional with the technical needs.
  • You will support team members defining their goals and the strategy to achieve them.
How will you be doing this?
  • Actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members, you will make them “a little bit better every day”.
  • Selecting and interviewing candidates for your teams in collaboration with our IT recruitment department and some more HR related tasks.
  • Taking part in team meetings to provide your knowledge and insights where needed.
  • Reviewing code, evangelising best practices and sustaining a culture of pragmatism as well as craftsmanship.
  • Keeping up to date with the latest in Web development, improving our tools and processes where needed.
What we have worked on last quarter
  • Second chance. Giving returned products a second chance by offering them on the website with a discount.
  • High performance authentication system. Customers can now login on the website through a fast NodeJS microservice.
What a day in the office might look like
You arrive in the office in the morning, just in time for a coffee before the daily stand up with your team. You discover Marco is working on a story which is becoming more and more complex, so you help him keeping things simple and at the same time aligned better with the business case. After the stand up you sit beside Rafael who is having troubles working on a Google Analytics API client. You try to understand what is exactly the problem and with your help, Rafael come up with a new approach on how to solve the problem.

You meet a candidate over lunch. You aren’t looking at skills yet, you just want to get to know her. How would her personality match with the rest of the herd? Can she communicate ideas clearly and concisely? Can she talk fluently about the technologies Coolblue deploys? It’s your shot at filtering out candidates that don’t fit the mould. Not bad, not bad at all. She passes. For now. Of course, your senior team members will pick her apart technically later.

In the afternoon, you have a face to face sync with Rafael. You ask if the new approach for the API client is working. Then you talk about what he will be focusing on the upcoming months. He has no clear idea about that and so you ask him questions about which epic motivates him the most and which task he prefers. Rafael has a clearer idea now about his focus and he will think how to keep attention in this. 
Since you have no more meetings in the day, you propose a table tennis tournament with the whole team. The team loves that and even if you lose all of the matches, you have a great time.

Team
You'll work with one or two cross functional teams formed by Back-end and Front-end Developers, UX designers and a Scrum Master. They have different levels of experience and you will support them towards becoming even more amazing than they already are. Your teams, together with other teams in the same family, are responsible for a particular domain of our software architecture.

Required experience & skills
  • (Applied) university-level degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering or Mathematics.
  • Minimum of five years experience as a developer. 
  • Experience in web development is required: our backend technologies are mostly PHP and NodeJS, so having prior background in writing high performance code in these languages is beneficial, but not required (one of our team leads has a background in Ruby).
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving the skills of your colleagues both technical and professional wise.
  • You know how to automate your deployment and quality assurance.
  • Scrum/Agile way of working is almost your second nature.
  • You understand and investigate what a user wants and feels.
  • Experience in large codebases and custom frameworks is a plus.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
We offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.
If you're interested in this position, feel free to apply. We really appreciate if you include the following in your cover letter: why you want to work at Coolblue, what team (work) experience you have and we're curious about your experience/ideas when it comes to improving your colleagues craftsmanship and technical skills.

item.title: Software Engineer - Search & Discovery at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our dynamic Software Engineering department and help shape the future of the world’s largest hotel search. In this team you will be working in the search and discovery area. You will help our users to express their ideas and feelings to us through our website and deliver back the ideal hotel list. If you're looking for a role where you'll get the chance to see the direct impact of your work on a daily basis, read on.



Your responsibilities:



  • Provide 4 million daily visitors with an intelligent and intuitive hotel search.

  • Write clean, composable, and testable code.

  • Contribute in architecture decisions and innovative feature development.

  • Combine different storage technologies to implement efficient and high-performing data retrieval.

  • Use your creativity and problem solving abilities to make a difference.

  • Work in a cross-functional team with passionate experts from various fields, such as Product, BI and Design according to the motto: “You build it, you run it”.

item.title: Software Engineer at Improbable (London, UK)
item.description:
_about us


Improbable’s mission is to make new realities possible. These realities will enrich the human experience, underpin superior decisions, be the foundation for new businesses and create insights into how the universe works.


Our first product is SpatialOS; a distributed operating system capable of producing consequential, persistent simulations at unprecedented scale. SpatialOS is being deployed in progressive game studios and the most critical government institutions across the world.


We are a British technology company with an internationally diverse workforce, unified by our desire to achieve extraordinary things. Fulfilling our long-term vision requires solving some of the most interesting and difficult problems on earth; the journey to new realities provides continuous progression and development opportunities for our world class problem solvers.


_mission


Our engineers are the heart of Improbable. We solve some of the hardest problems around distributed systems, high-performance cloud infrastructures, messaging and much more. Together we are building a world-class engineering organisation to make reality scale simulation possible; our platform, SpatialOS, allows developers to build massive, richly detailed simulations across thousands of machines in the cloud. 


We use the right tool for the job and believe in well-tested, robust code. A lot of our core-systems are built in Java with other teams using a combination of C++, GoLang, Scala & Javascript. We also leverage a lot of open-source (CoreOS, etcd, Fleet, Docker, Prometheus, gRPC) and give back to the community when we can.


We are hiring across of all of our teams (where multiple positions at all levels exist), with a lot of opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects such as:



  • designing and implementing new algorithms to distribute and scale our simulations

  • integrating new workers with our distributed stack

  • core infrastructure that underpins seamless scaling (networking, packing, storage, containers, logging, security across all compute providers)

  • creation of world-class, robust APIs and SDKs for external customers

  • developing tooling to understand, visualise and reason about large real-time simulations

  • researching new applications of our tech and developing proof of concepts

  • customer facing roles working with world-class organisations to explore the possibilities of SpatialOS

item.title: Senior Full Stack Security Developer at Financial Times (London, UK)
item.description:
It takes a cutting edge technology stack to provide the foundation for the cutting edge journalism that the Financial Times is renowned for. Keeping our users - customers and developers - safe is paramount across our diverse technology portfolio of platforms, products and services.


We’re looking for a skilled full-stack developer with a keen interest in security to help us deliver the tooling, practices and processes that keep our systems and applications safe across a wide platform of SaaS, PaaS, and the latest architectural concepts such as containerised microservices and serverless compute (Lambda).


This is an exciting opportunity to work across a range of technologies including Intrusion Detection, Vulnerability Management, Secure Key Storage and API development as a technical leader, with responsibility for making the technical decisions and product design.

item.title: Senior or Mid .NET Engineer - Fastest Growing FTSE 250 Tech Company at JUST EAT (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
As a Mid or Senior Engineer @JUST EAT, you will be working on a product that handles more traffic than Oxford Street on a busy Saturday afternoon!


If you think we’re kidding, please note that globally we have around 1 million orders per weekend... and since we’ve started throwing out big numbers you should also know that worldwide we are close to processing 2 billion pounds worth of orders a year.


Technical and cultural sneak peek:


As part of our technology team you will follow TDD and SOLID principles, with a focus on building scalable, secure and stable systems in a Continuous Deployment cycle..


Our product is ripe for innovation. As a Senior .NET Engineer you will spearhead the development of new consumer-facing functionality and associated back-end services. You will lead the team on architecture and API design, coding standards, testing and operational excellence, and you will deploy and support your own code in production on AWS.


You will work in a cross-functional product team with a dedicated Product Manager, UX Designer and QA Engineer, and you’ll interact with stakeholders from across the business.


When it comes to processes  and methodologies, we don’t believe in “a one size fits all” . So what we do is use a tailored mix of Scrum and Kanban practices that help our teams find the best work  rhythm.


Culturally, we are very into hackathons, meet up’s, conferences and developing our open source tools. Whenever we stumble upon a technical breakthrough, our Engineers evangelise their technical work to other engineering teams and potentially publically (blogs / speaking etc).
