item.title: Development Test Manager at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Sainsbury’s, one of the UK’s largest retailers is investing heavily in digital innovation - its aim being to build a centre of excellence where digital output is crafted using industry leading best practice frameworks and methodologies to produce the world class apps and services. The team is growing rapidly and looking for talented colleagues to help deliver ambitious and market leading services that live up to Sainsbury’s industry leading reputation. 


We are looking for a Development Test Manager to engage with large scale development teams and implement industry leading automated testing practices across a wide range of products. You will be expected to recruit and retain expert colleagues as well as driving Sainsbury’s development testing strategy forward continually improving to create a world class Development Testing function.

item.title: Cloud Competency Manager at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Sainsbury’s, one of the UK’s largest retailers is investing heavily in digital innovation - its aim being to build a centre of excellence where digital output is crafted using industry leading best practice frameworks and methodologies to produce the world class apps and services. The team is growing rapidly and looking for talented colleagues to help deliver ambitious and market leading services that live up to Sainsbury’s industry leading reputation.


We are looking for a Cloud Competency Manager to head up our Cloud Competency Centre within Development responsible for Cloud Infrastructure Architecture and Design for the Cloud Infrastructure Service. The Cloud Competency Manager will support Cloud Competency Centre Architects and Designers in providing visibility to the Head of Architecture & Strategy and the Technical Design Manager of Cloud Infrastructure Service designs to demonstrate design standards are consistent and aligned while also being responsible for ensuring adherence to the Cloud Infrastructure Architecture, promoting the ‘Cloud First’ approach, favouring Public cloud.

item.title: Technology Manager - Fastest Growing FTSE 250 Tech Company at JUST EAT (London, UK)
item.description:
At JUST EAT, Technology Managers manage a cross functional team of software engineers, product managers and designers to deliver against a single, defined, business goal.


As a rapidly growing company JUST EAT are always looking for exceptional people join us. Behind the simple façade of our consumer facing products sit a wealth of APIs, search algorithms and B2B services that we are continuously evolving and we are always looking for the right people to help us build them.


We all work together to “empower consumers to love their takeaway experience”, and now we have a fantastic opportunity open for a Technical Manager to come and lead a global rollout team in the Partner Product Development department.


You’ll have the opportunity to work in a completely autonomous team; working towards a well defined business metric to deliver on a critical part of our strategy for improving the technology we put into our partner restaurants across the globe! This isn’t just an internationalisation team, you’ll be expected to listen to what our countries need and work against our core platform to deliver their changes.


Responsibilities


At JUST EAT technology managers have primary accountability for moving a business metric or goal, ensuring their team is happy, focused, driven and delivering quality in the most effective way possible. You’ll be accountable for:



  • Delivering defined business goals

  • Fostering a strong team

  • Professional development of team members

  • Contributing and adhering to patterns and processes

  • Prioritising work and tracking progress

  • Managing stakeholder expectations

  • Measuring success

  • Management of a team of Software Engineers, Product Managers and UX Designers

  • Ensuring a Minimum Viable Product approach

  • Instilling a proactive attitude to getting the job done

  • Driving change in an agile ‘Discovery → Delivery’ cycle

item.title: Platform Engineer - Cloud & DevOps at Infinity Works at Infinity Works (London, UK)
item.description:
Who we are?


Infinity Works is a leading Software, Cloud and Digital engineering consultancy.  We help our clients solve hard technical problems in a wide variety of domains using a diverse set of technology stacks.


We're looking for people with the soul of an engineer and innovation of a hacker; people who’ll roll up their sleeves and hands on with kind of software and infrastructure projects where others fear to tread.


What does a Platform Engineer do at Infinity Works?


As a Platform Engineer you will be hands on, thinking end-to-end and engineering platforms to operate software applications on a public or private cloud. 


You know (as we do) that cloud infrastructure is a software problem and that DevOps is organisational culture, not a job title and as such will work as part of a delivery team focusing on delivering business value.


You'll have an expert understanding of software engineering, software builds and deployment, debugging applications, operating systems, databases, networking, cloud and fixed infrastructures and automation tools.


You'll also use configuration management, automation and containerisation tools to improve software build reliability, portability and repeatability - maintaining the build pipeline and aiming for continuous deployment.


You are equally at home with cloud, Internet related technologies, protocols and languages along with lean / agile development techniques and DevOps culture all working as part of a team.


Where can I join?


We have open positions in both our London and Leeds locations.

item.title: Pragmatic Full-Stack Engineers with Java experience (Leeds and London) at Infinity Works (London, UK)
item.description:
Who we are


Infinity Works is a leading software, IT and Digital engineering consultancy.  We help our clients solve hard technical problems in a wide variety of domains using a diverse set of technology stacks.


We're looking for people with the soul of an engineer; people who’ll roll up their sleeves and get stuck into the kind of projects where others fear to tread.


It may sound daunting, but it’s fun too – we work hard, but we play hard as well. Because when we do something great, we’re not shy about celebrating it.


What does a Full-Stack Engineer do at Infinity Works?


As a full stack engineer, you will happily be a technology polyglot, excited to learn new technologies and techniques across the full technical stack and product life cycle.


You will primarily be focused on hands on engineering of consumer and business related applications and as such will have an expert understanding of software engineering best practices such as effective source control, code reviews, daily builds, and automated deployments. You are equally at home with cloud, Internet related technologies, protocols and languages along with lean / agile development techniques and Devops culture all working as part of a team.


Above all, you can write highly efficient, stable, secure, maintainable and performant code. And understand the difference between engineering and over-engineering.


Where can I join?


We have open positions in both our London and Leeds locations.

item.title: Senior or Lead .NET Developer at TamTam (part of Dept) (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As Senior or Lead .NET Developer, you know that there is often more than one solution to a problem. With your expertise, you look for that one solution that is best for our client. And you are able to explain in plain language why this is the best solution for them. And you are also a mentor to the other developers. Even though we have very few doors, yours is still always open for the junior, mid-level and senior developers.


Your role


You hang up your coat, have that first cup of coffee and...
...you check your mail. What's on the schedule for today? This afternoon you have an appointment with a client. They want a personal client environment in their app and on their site. You ponder what is the best way to achieve this. How can we couple our systems to theirs? What do we need to achieve this? How much time do we need? Tricky questions. You already know the answer. And this afternoon, you will convince the client.


But first, there's another big project that demands your attention. You have already determined which architecture will be needed for this, together with your fellow developers. You have the end responsibility, but their input is vital. When you don't agree with something, you are able to explain your opinion in clear fashion. This only helps your colleagues to improve. Everyone now knows what it should ultimately look like. And you know what needs to be done today to achieve it. That is why when you are at your best, no one running around in a panic. Now that we mention it... in three minutes we have a stand-up planned! First check to make sure everything is going as planned.


And when is it time to celebrate?


When, thanks to your organisational skills, everything proceeds according to plan and going live has gone smooth.

item.title: C# Software Developer at Kalixa (Stanstead Abbotts, UK)
item.description:
Highly scalable ,Multithreaded, Parallel systems, C#.NET 4.5....... No these are not just listed to attract you. These are just a few of the terms used to describe the systems you'll be working on for this role.


Kalixa are looking for a very strong C# developer to work on new elements of their flagship product. This system is a highly scalable, multithreaded system that has been built using the latest Microsoft technologies. The below is a snapshot of the technologies you will be using on a daily basis;



  • .NET Framework 4.0 and above

  • C# .NET

  • Web API

  • WCF (SOAP and REST)

  • MVC

  • ASP .NET

  • Dapper, ADO .NET, LINQ, Entity Framework and Nhibernate

  • HTML, CSS, Java Script, VB Script, IIS 6.0, 7.0 and 7.5 (Not essential)

  • XML/XSL/XSLT

  • Dependency Injector (Simple Injector or equivalent)

  • Automapper (or equivalent)

  • Moq (or equivalent)

  • ReSharper

  • FXcop and StyleCop

  • Atlassian Bamboo

  • Atlassian Stash

  • GIT

  • Atlassian Jira


The team follow a SCRUM process with daily SCRUM meetings and a true AGILE approach. You will be responsible for and partake in all of the sprint planning as well as working on timings, review, amendments, discussions etc.


You will get your hands dirty from day one an will be working from front to back on the system including looking over production bugs an defects on each sprint completion.


Our ideal candidate will be someone who doesn't just know the theory behind C# development or Design Patterns but can actually demonstrate how you have used it in the past and why. You will be very familiar with TDD/BDD and will have a good understanding of Dependancy Injection, Unit Testing, WCF, SQL SERVER 2014 and Atlassion products.


If this interests you, apply for the role and our recruitment partner will call to discuss things further.

item.title: Senior Middleware Application Developer - Java at J.P Morgan & Chase (Bournemouth, UK)
item.description:
Business Overview: TS International Technology is a global technology organization that is responsible for the systems processing for international Treasury Services branches in EMEA, Asia & LATAM. The team is responsible for Low and High Value payments, DDA, and local clearing links for these branches as well as a number of global utilities, SWIFT and OFAC. The team is based in Bournemouth, Mumbai, Hong Kong, Singapore, Tampa and San Paulo.


CIB Technology - International Account Services (IAS) The IAS Technology group are responsible for developing and implementing banking software for the International Demand Deposit Accounting (iDDA) platform.  International DDA holds all cash accounts needed for banking products including core cash accounting, liquidity products and statement processing.   The application is developed on T24 banking software that provides Online Transaction Processing (OLTP) across 90+ branches across the globe.  The group has multi-phased software development programmes running concurrently throughout the year.   


The group are located in Bournemouth-UK, Bangalore-India and Mumbai-India.


Team Description The successful candidate will form part of a team comprising a mix of JPMorgan staff based in Bournemouth. The role will have a need to closely liaise with the Architecture, Project Delivery, Quality Assurance and Technology Infrastructure groups throughout the various stages of development and implementation lifecycle. Building a successful working relationship with key parties is crucial in this role. RAISe is a high performance real-time middleware platform implemented using Java and providing an integration layer for the tier 1 Demand Deposit Accounting application.


Key responsibilities: 



  • Applicants are sought for an Application Development role within the iDDA Middleware AD team. Application Delivery has ownership of infrastructure build, application design and development, system testing, change control, deployment and implementation of the final solution.

  • The role will encompass a multitude of activities ranging from design and development of the Java application, execution of system & performance testing, and support of subsequent testing lifecycles to implementation of packages.

  • Participation in the out-of-hours support callout rota, providing production support cover.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer | Design & Deploy Systems Processing >200qps at Yieldify (London, UK)
item.description: Yieldify is growing in a very fast pace, adding millions and millions of requests each month. As Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be designing, developing and deploying systems ready to scale with our growth while maintaining the best quality. This role will expose you to various projects our current team are working on - which ranges from tag, data and dashboard projects - all of which interact with over millions of our clients' customers globally. Our diverse team works across different projects so it doesn’t matter whether you’re an mid-level coder or a project lead, we’ve love to hear from all levels of talent!

item.title: Ambitious mobile and full stack software engineers - we need you! at Zuhlke Engineering Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Zuhlke is a European software engineering consultancy that helps businesses turn ideas into reality. We need people who are capable, talented, and engaged to help build systems for our clients, based mainly in our expanding Shoreditch office. We take on interesting projects in many domains, including media, finance, heavy engineering, and medical devices.


Your job will involve working closely with clients to develop, test, and ship software that meets their needs. You will be looking both to contribute to the company and to grow personally.


Our reputation is fundamental to our business, so our culture emphasizes quality, reliability and respect. As a privately-held company owned by past and present employees, and run by engineers, Zuhlke takes a long-term view. For example, you will receive twenty days training per year, including a budget to support activities such as conference attendance, our annual technical camp, and participation in focused topic teams. We like our staff to be technically flexible so, if you don’t have a required skill now, we can support you learning it.


Your job will include:



  • Helping our clients understand what they really need

  • Building quality systems to satisfy those needs

  • Working collaboratively with colleagues and clients

  • Keeping technically sharp

  • Getting things done

  • Sometimes travelling to other locations in the UK and mainland Europe


You will benefit from:



  • A generous allowance for training (9% of your time and a budget)

  • An achievement-based career path where you can gain responsibility while remaining technical

  • A competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package


Our work is mainly at or within an hour's travel from our Shoreditch office.


If this appeals, then please get in touch.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

item.title: Systems Engineer (DevOps, WebOps, Platform engineering) at Government Digital Service (GDS) (London, UK)
item.description:
Over the past five years the Government Digital Service has been established as leaders in the digital transformation of government, providing common platforms, expert advice and support and setting standards that enable a new class of services. Along the way we’ve been reforming government’s relationship with technology, ensuring that we have the skills to make sure technology can inform and enable the best possible services.


We are looking for technical hands-on operations engineers to build and run infrastructure for our services, such as the UK government’s GOV.UK website, open data infrastructure, and many other platforms.  For more details see <links>.


We build infrastructure which is secure, available, maintainable and scalable. We do this using cloud services running Linux, working closely with developers, and sharing responsibility for operational support (in and out of hours).  We use approaches such as infrastructure as code, continuous deployment, and agile development.


We work on many projects with varied technology stacks, and you will have opportunities to move between these.  Our projects are all based on fulfilling user needs, both for cross government teams using our platforms, and for the general public.


Some things you might find yourself doing



  • Working collaboratively with colleagues across GDS

  • Running essential national infrastructure

  • Supporting PCI-DSS/ISO27001 compliant infrastructure

  • Working on robust and stable technologies to ensure that systems actually work

  • Spending time investigating new technologies, and explaining them to others

  • Supporting open source projects, and working primarily in the open

  • Working with developers to debug code in production, reading code written in various languages

item.title: Senior Consultant, Professional Services at Synopsys (Frimley, UK)
item.description:
Synopsys is seeking a software testing and security expert to join our Professional Services team of consultants. Our consultants are responsible for the planning and successful implementation of Synopsys Software Integrity solutions on-site at customer locations. The Senior Consultant leads customers to success in these key areas:



  • Delivery planning: You liaise with customer ahead of delivery to ensure all prerequisites are in place in order to ensure

  • Solution design: You engage with the world’s leading technology companies to understand their business needs and solve critical problems concerning software quality and security

  • Solution delivery: You are involved from project initiation to completion with end-to-end ownership of successful results

  • Custom integrations: You develop custom integrations with other development tools in order to integrate into existing workflows

  • Expert consulting: You become an advisor to our customers providing solution expertise in the domain of software testing and security

  • Sales visibility: You work with sales before, during and after a delivery in order to ensure the account team has full visibility into the success of the delivery from beginning to end of the engagement

  • Account growth: You immerse yourself in existing customers’ business in order to help them identify new opportunities for improved deployments of existing or new Synopsys software

  • Secure Development: You provide expert consulting in advising customers on their Secure Development processes and help them identify areas for improvement and how to carry out those improvements

item.title: Backend Entwickler at vioma GmbH (Offenburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Was erwartet Sie?



  • Aufbau, Weiterentwicklung und Maintenance eines ständig wachsenden Pools an Online Systemen, die auf die Top-Hotellerie spezialisiert sind. Unter anderem gehören dazu bisher schon: Buchungsmaschine, Content Management System, Gutscheinsystem, Gästebefragungssystem, Zentrales Verwaltungssystem etc.

  • Gestalten und Weiterentwickeln von hauseigenen Frameworks in professionellem Umfeld

  • Umsetzung von individuellen Anpassungen unserer Systeme und Bearbeitung technischer Anfragen.

item.title: Software Engineer - Cloud Foundry at Pivotal Cloud Foundry (London, UK)
item.description:
The Cloud Foundry engineering team in Pivotal London is looking for several great engineers to join us in building an open source platform that transforms how the world deploys and scales software.


We are looking for either Software Engineers or Operations / System Engineers who want to learn new skills! 



  • Watch this short video from the engineers at Pivotal!

  • Pivotal Cloud Foundry overview by Onsi Fakhouri


Where


We are based in our brand new fully refurbished offices in The Bower, Old Street London.


You


You love shipping features, but know that well factored code is what lets you keep shipping features in the long run.  Maybe you get antsy writing code without tests, or perhaps you’re a large-scale system operator interested in leveling-up your coding skills.


Either way, you measure  your success by the success of your team; you are dedicated to learning about distributed systems, and you are excited to work on open source and be connected to the open source community.


Us


Cloud Foundry is an open source project co-developed with Pivotal Labs, a leader in the field of agile software development. We are opinionated about how software should be built. We pair program, all day, every day, because we know it delivers remarkable results and supports a cooperative learning environment.


We work in small teams and rotate between them frequently in order to help you gain a diverse set of skills, and to encourage cross team communication and cohesion.  We are committed to working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge, and refocus.

As part of the London team, you'll be immersed in all the latest database technologies — From Cassandra, Redis, RabbitMQ, and more.  A proficient understanding of these services, as well as VM and container technologies (Docker), is a plus.


Desired Skills/ Experience:



  • We are looking for people with either Operations experience or Software Engineers - but you must be interested in the other and be excited to learning new skills. If you have development and operations experience - amazing!

  • We use Golang, Ruby and Java but you don't have to have experience with these technologies - if you have great experience in other programming languages we can train you up on the technologies we use

  • Experience and/or interest in: Test Driven Development (TDD) and agile methodologies, database technologies, and containerization

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience



Perks


To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly lunchtime talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.



We also offer benefits including healthcare, pension and equity in a high growth market.


We’re seeking more amazing developers that complement our London team. Apply by sending us a resume and a cover letter.

item.title: Lead 3D Desktop UI Developer for Automated Factory of the Future at CloudNC (London, UK)
item.description:
CNC milling machines are at the heart of manufacturing with almost half a trillion dollars worth of components produced by them each year. Despite this, their software is in the dark ages. Industrial CNC machine in action: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=80iIhfjTm5I


We’re researching and applying breakthrough AI methods to control these machines automatically and more optimally than ever before, revolutionising how the things around us are made. From MacBook cases, to jet engine turbines.


Our mission is to make milling machines one click devices that can produce a part easily, efficiently and with minimal human intervention.


Working as part of a world-class team, your role will consist of leading the technical development of the client-side application that will provide an interface to our core service. This will involve building, from scratch, a desktop application that can load and display 3D CAD models; provide a UI for interacting with the models to add additional data; and displaying simulation of CNC machining.


We are also passionate about good UI design and a strong user experience. Your role will also include guiding the UI and UX of the application.


We've just closed one of the largest seed round investments in Europe to bring our solution from prototype to market from 42 investors including:



  • Episode 1 Ventures.

  • Paul McNabb, ex-head of strategy for Cisco Systems.

  • Simon Murdoch, ex-VP Europe for Amazon.

  • Charlie Songhurst, ex-head of strategy for Microsoft.

  • Nicolas Berggruen, billionaire investor.

  • Chris Liddell, ex-CFO of General Motors.

  • Chris Barter, ex-head of Goldman Sachs Russia.

  • Chris Mairs, ex-CTO of Metaswitch Networks.


https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/cloudnc

item.title: Experienced Dev Engineer at ING (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
ING is looking for an experienced Development (Dev) Engineer
Think Forward! Our purpose is to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and in business. We are an industry recognized strong brand with positive recognition from customers in many countries, strong financial position, omni-channel distribution strategy and international network. If you want to work at a place where we believe that you can live by the Agile manifesto without jeopardizing the necessary continuity, compliance and QA measures, where we are committed to deliver new features, stable and secure services to end users, and where we have a 'no nonsense' getting-things done mentality, please read on: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NcB0ZKWAPA0


What department?
Chief Information Office Netherlands (CIONL) is primarily focused on facilitating all IT-activities of Domestic Bank. It’s a very ambitious department. You will be working in a Dev Ops team who’s responsible for the change and maintenance of the account management system for savings, loans and current accounts. We named it; Betalen en Dagelijkse Bankzaken (DBZ). How will you help us transform from a former traditional bank to a global FinTech company? How will you change banking?

Job Description
Within this domain Corebank system, Profile, plays a crucial role and is the heart of ING. The Profile application is processing millions of transactions every day. You will be working within one of the ten Dev Ops teams (Squads), CoreBank. The department is working in a Dev Ops manner, where Scrum/Agile method and Continuous Delivery practices are very important. As a Dev Engineer you be responsible for implementing new features, design, build, test and deploy. We release several times a week, but perhaps you can help us with automating the pipeline?


Our stack
We mainly use the following technologies and frameworks: Profile Scripting Language (PSL), Mumps, Python, Java, Shell Script, SQL, C, GitLab, Sonarqube, Fortify, Nolio, Artifactory, Jenkins, Docker. All based on a Websphere/Tomcat/AIX/Linux/GTM/Oracle stack.

item.title: Data Engineer at Infectious Media (London, UK)
item.description:
The Data Engineering team at Infectious Media forms the core of the Platform team, linking all the other departments together and facilitating simple, fast and robust data exchange between each and every system we use. We are looking for someone to support the smooth day-to-day running of our data systems and contribute to ongoing development in the department.


This position within the team provides someone with great data manipulation skills to manage and process the vastly increasing data volumes we are seeing (we record more than 200 million unique events each day), whilst at the same time manage the process of switching from a backend data driven process (where data is processed hourly or daily) to one where data is processed live in real time. Infectious Media are leaders in the Real Time Bidding Industry and data is the key to the cutting edge technology that we use. This role is essential for ensuring we use data in the best and most innovative ways possible. 


Key Responsibilities:



  • Managing the Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) processes of the company to ensure they remain efficient and robust

  • Understanding the data warehousing needs of the company to help identify weaknesses in the current architecture and suggest improvements

  • Identifying and resolving data issues in a timely manner.

  • Maintaining a broad knowledge of all data intelligence systems the company utilises.

  • Helping to improve the efficiency and reliability of data systems and processes by identifying areas that would benefit from automation.

  • Working with other platform Analysts and Managers to support the introduction of new technologies and data streams.

  • Working with the Insights team to support their understanding of the company’s data warehouses.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Infectious Media (London, UK)
item.description:
Infectious Media are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer in order to maintain, develop and enhance our robust cloud based infrastructure that supports a high throughput, low latency application. The role also involves maintaining and improving our existing cloud infrastructure to ensure all our production systems are robust, stable and able to service a growing number of clients in this fast moving, award winning company. Managing data forms the backbone of the role (the infrastructure needing to support the ingestion and processing of 6Tb of data a day, currently) and the development and implementation of smart solutions for analysing and deriving benefit from this data is something that is a regular challenge.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Work closely with our Engineering team to maintain and extend our Google Cloud Engine cloud based infrastructure to a robust, scalable and fault tolerant platform for our data warehouse and business intelligence systems

  • Ensure best practice tools and technologies are used to maximize uptime and recover from downtime

  • Help design and implement new infrastructure to deal with the optimisation of real time bidding (RTB), with a focus on supporting the Data Science team by providing them with an environment to test their algorithms

  • Enhance our data warehouse and ETL systems to handle the processing of more data more frequently, specifically to improve data analysis and optimisation

  • Support the infrastructure during periods of downtime, both by reducing the number of occurrences of downtime, and by reducing the time taken to resolve issues, as well as ensuring adequate team support during holiday periods.

  • Maintain the bleeding edge mentality at the company by attending relevant conferences/ meet-ups to ensure we are aware of and using the very best techniques and technologies.

  • Consult on, guide and implement the company’s cloud infrastructure strategy over the next few years.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at patronus.io (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
YOUR TASKS



  • The development and implementation of our Java backend (Spring Framework)

  • The main focus will be the communication of SQL databases (data extraction application, custom SQL generator framework, etc.)

  • Building a RESTful API that communicates with the web frontend

item.title: Team Lead - Card payments at ING (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
ING is looking for an experienced Team Lead – Card payments


Do you want to work where we believe that you can live by the Agile manifesto without jeopardizing the necessary continuity, compliance and QA measures, where we are committed to deliver stable and secure services to end users, and where we have a 'no nonsense' getting-things done mentality, please read on and check out this video.


Think Forward! Our purpose is to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and in business. We are an industry recognized strong brand with positive recognition from customers in many countries, strong financial position, omni-channel distribution strategy and international network.



What department?
You will be working in the Tribe for Cards. We make all IT for INGDebit and Credit Cards. We handle real time authentication for 60% of the Dutch payment traffic, we support international payment methods e.g. Mastercard credit and debit while enabling all our customers to pay with virtual cards on their phone. For these services we make our own Java API’s, TIBCO and Angular applications and we leverage world leading packages in Base24, Issuer and interchange.


Job Description
When you start at ING as Team Lead - IT Chapter Lead. You will become part of a challenging transformation within our highly innovative environment. For 60% of your workweek you will manage 8 to 10 Engineers including the HR/people cycle and coaching on hard- and soft skills, to support and shape the new way of working. The other 40% you will work as Engineer in your team (Squad).

item.title: Software Development Engineer (Java) at Tesco Plc (Welwyn Garden City, UK)
item.description:
Want to work for one of the largest global retailers in the world? Do you want to be part of pioneering its multi-channel strategy and engineering amazing products for millions of customers?
At Tesco we’re constantly evolving and innovating. We run the largest online Grocery business in the world and have one of the UK’s biggest general merchandising sites, as well as seven international Grocery home shopping websites. We’ve also created one of the most successful loyalty programmes - Clubcard. But it doesn’t stop there, our desire to continually improve and transform these and many other new and existing products reflect our desire to be the best multi-channel retailer in the world.
One of our main aims over the coming years is to move to a Service Oriented Architecture/ Micro services. While this is not uncommon, the scale that Tesco operates at is and provides some extra challenges in implementation. Our services don’t just power the web, they power our tills and weighing scales, our distribution centres and our shop picking services. Very high availability is requirement! If this sounds interesting, then Tesco could be the right place for you.


As a software engineer you will be right at the heart of Technology. You will be designing, developing, testing and running the platforms that will be used by all our customers and colleagues.
You will be involved in the full software development lifecycle. You will work with Product Managers to help shape the backlog and future direction of the product, implement and test features to a very high quality and support your product or service in testing and live environments.

item.title: Software Development Engineer (UI) at Tesco Plc (Welwyn Garden City, UK)
item.description:
Want to work for one of the largest global retailers in the world? Do you want to be part of pioneering its multi-channel strategy? Want to be an integral part of engineering amazing products for millions of customers?


At Tesco we’re constantly evolving and innovating. We run the largest online Grocery business in the world and have one of the UK’s biggest general merchandising sites, as well as seven international Grocery home shopping websites including Poland, Turkey and Thailand. All supported by our successful loyalty programmes called ClubCard. But it doesn’t stop there, our desire to continually improve and transform these and many other new products reflects our desire to be the best multi-channel retailer in the world.
So we’re investing in technology and product development at a brilliant location in Farringdon. Where we are developing products that seamlessly integrated into customer's lives, excite, innovate and deliver convenience any place, anytime and anywhere.


Over the coming months and years, we will be moving to our next generation of websites and applications built on our Service Oriented Architecture and Micro services. If being part of building those new properties, many of which serve millions of customers and hundreds of thousands of colleagues every week (yes that’s right – even our colleague facing sites have to work at scale!) Sounds interesting, then Tesco could be the right place for you.


As a software engineer you will be right at the heart of Technology. You will be designing, developing, testing and running the platforms that will be used by all our customers and colleagues.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Modeling at Quantcast (London, UK)
item.description: Quantcast is a large scale, data driven organization that lives and breathes data, processing well over 2 million transactions a second. Quantcast engineers leverage our large datasets, computational power and analytic tools to build high quality and diverse products that support Quantcast’s position as a world-class leader in online advertising. The London Modeling team’s mission is two-fold: to drive improved performance for advertisers by delivering relevant advertising across the digital advertising ecosystem and to build defenses in order to protect our clients against fraudsters trying to siphon money out of the advertising space.  We are looking for top-tier talent with strong engineering and big data experience to help lead our efforts in designing, implementing and operating large scale ML systems in a production environment.

item.title: Software Development Engineer (UI) at Tesco Plc (London, UK)
item.description:
Want to work for one of the largest global retailers in the world? Do you want to be part of pioneering its multi-channel strategy? Want to be an integral part of engineering amazing products for millions of customers?


At Tesco we’re constantly evolving and innovating. We run the largest online Grocery business in the world and have one of the UK’s biggest general merchandising sites, as well as seven international Grocery home shopping websites including Poland, Turkey and Thailand. All supported by our successful loyalty programmes called ClubCard. But it doesn’t stop there, our desire to continually improve and transform these and many other new products reflects our desire to be the best multi-channel retailer in the world.
So we’re investing in technology and product development at a brilliant location in Farringdon. Where we are developing products that seamlessly integrated into customer's lives, excite, innovate and deliver convenience any place, anytime and anywhere.


Over the coming months and years, we will be moving to our next generation of websites and applications built on our Service Oriented Architecture and Micro services. If being part of building those new properties, many of which serve millions of customers and hundreds of thousands of colleagues every week (yes that’s right – even our colleague facing sites have to work at scale!) Sounds interesting, then Tesco could be the right place for you


As a software engineer you will be right at the heart of Technology. You will be designing, developing, testing and running the platforms that will be used by all our customers and colleagues.

item.title: Software Engineer (Java) at Tesco Plc (London, UK)
item.description:
One of our main aims over the coming years is to move to a Service Oriented Architecture/ Micro services. While this is not uncommon, the scale that Tesco operates at is and provides some extra challenges in implementation. Our services don’t just power the web, they power our tills and weighing scales, our distribution centers and our shop picking services. Very high availability is requirement! If this sounds interesting, then Tesco could be the right place for you.


You will be right at the heart of Technology. You will be designing, developing, testing and running the platforms that will be used by all our customers and colleagues.


As a Software Engineer, you will be involved in the full software development lifecycle. item.title: Senior Java Developer (m/f) - Microservices, Spring Boot, Docker at ePages GmbH (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
As a Senior Java Developer based in Hamburg, you will be part of a tight-knit Scrum team working on a microservice-based architecture for our new ePages e-commerce platform. You will be required to utilise your deep knowledge of software architecture to develop innovative approaches to complex design challenges.

You will be responsible for programming modules in Java, implementing features, testing and bug fixing. It is essential that you communicate design rationales and build consensus around these decisions. In addition you will be responsible for ensuring our software is delivered on time and meets our expected standards; primarily: optimal performance, scalability, modularity and high security are paramount to our goals.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer - C#, MVC6, AngularJS, Azure, SQL at viagogo (London, UK)
item.description:
Overview


The tech team at viagogo is focused on building a platform that will revolutionise the way fans across the globe buy and sell tickets for live events. With buyers and sellers using our website and mobile applications in over 60 countries, 30 languages and hundreds of delivery and payment options, we're constantly taking on tough, exciting engineering challenges - and we're doing it at scale! We are looking for passionate, skilled Developers who want to make meaningful, measurable improvements that impact millions of users.


How We Work


We work in a start-up like manner and we work in small scrum teams of 4-7. Every team member is encouraged to take full ownership of their part of the platform but also to contribute ideas, suggestions and code to other areas of the business. We believe that features have no value until they are in production adding value to our customers so teams deploy fast and often. The tech team is building something that has never been built before so we're always trying to think outside the box. We hold monthly hackathons where team members inside and outside of tech bring their most creative ideas for the product; some of which even make it to production the same night!


Here are some examples of cool things we built in 2015:



  • We built a notification platform (comprised of RabbitMQ, C# Services, SQL Enterprise) which handles thousands of concurrent changes every minute. This reduced the latency for sale notifications from hours to seconds. We built a scalable delivery pipeline that delivers notifications in real-time to website users (via SignalR) and iOS and Android users (via Microsoft Azure Notification Hub).

  • We built a world class, hypermedia driven, RESTful API with outstanding documentationand several open source SDKs written in .NET, Ruby, Python and PHP

item.title: Node.JS / Javascript Developer for our Awesome Team!! at Nexmo (London, UK)
item.description:
We are Nexmo. We are an emerging leader in the $100b+ cloud communication and telecom markets. Customers like Airbnb, Viber, Line, Whatsapp, Snapchat, and many others depend on our communications platform to connect with their customers. As businesses continue to shift to a real-time, customer-centric communications model, we are experiencing a time of explosive growth.


We need a Node.js/Javascript Developer to work with our team in our modern London office, situated right next to Old Street tube station in the heart of Tech City. In this position you will work on major real-time communications applications that are groundbreaking.


Responsibilities:



  • Working on different aspects of the core product and associated tools

  • Assisting with in-life maintenance, testing, debugging and documentation of deployed services

  • Coding


Skills/Requirements:



  • Full-stack development with a focus on backend services using node.js

  • Experience working with real-time projects.

  • Experience scaling both within and across data centers.

  • Analytical approach to performance and a desire to get as low level as it takes to scale efficiently.

  • Enjoy the challenge of debugging large scale distributed systems.

  • Any WebRTC or VoIP experience is a bonus.


Most weeks there is a new technical presentation by members of engineering on technology topics of the speaker’s choice, this is a great way to learn and also optionally contribute your own presentation.


We have big goals, and we want the people who join us to be self confident, focused on customers and delivery, and who are structured and committed in their approach. We iterate quickly, we fail fast, we take smart chances. We value those who will help us continue this spirit.



Why Nexmo...our values!


We value disruptive innovation, getting things done, and working with passion and integrity are the values that matter at Nexmo. We are on a mission to enable simplified communications between enterprises and their customers by empowering our employees. We strive for passion and integrity, both personally and professionally.


We have achieved significant growth by hiring exceptional people. We have big goals, and we want the people who join us to be self confident, focused on customers and delivery, and who are structured and committed in their approach. We value those who will help us continue this spirit. If this appeals to you then we encourage you to apply.

item.title: Team Lead Java Developer at J.P Morgan & Chase (Bournemouth, UK)
item.description:
Candidates will be expected to lead a Feature Team performing AngularJS UI and Java backend development of enhancements to the real-time Intraday Liquidity (IDL) platform.  The IDL platform is responsible for continuously aggregating Transactions and Balances from multiple statement, ledger, payment and settlement systems in order to calculate, visualize, and monitor critical metrics relating to JPMorgan’s (Cash) Liquidity, Credit Utilization, and Collateral balances and flows.


The role will require proficiency in all aspects of Agile sprint based development, including:



  • Working directly with Product Architect and Product Owners to refine and estimate stakeholder requirements, epics and stories.

  • Collaboration with Release Managers to ensure Sprint commitments are in line with priorities.

  • Ensuring adherence to Definition of Ready and Definition of Done.

  • Mentoring in Acceptance Test Driven Development (ATDD) together with Continuous Integration in order to produce a Production ready Release Candidate every two weeks.

  • Designing solutions in a collaborative manner and in line with defined principles


Participation in a rota to provide 24/7 third line application support and to perform weekend releases

item.title: Senior Full Stack Developer at Airfinity (London, UK)
item.description:
Were seeking an autonomous, versatile and curious individual that is fully hands-on and can take responsibility of leading the engineering team.

The product you build with us will transform the way events globally get sponsored and dramatically improve event sponsors ROI.

About You

  • You are energised by the unknowns.
  • You have a deep understanding of the software engineering design trade-offs.
  • You feel comfortable working within an Agile principles context, but are not obsessed by any Agile methodology in particular.
  • You care about Software, as a means to achieve a business objective.
  • You love learning and solving problems

About the Role

  • Own the end-to-end delivery of the full-stack software
  • Proactively contribute to development and product discussions, highlighting challenges and opportunities
  • Carry out complex tasks with a minimum of guidance, you also have the ability to manage multiple complex and time critical projects concurrently.
  • Champion and mentor software engineering best practises within the team, bringing a pragmatic engineering culture to the table.
  • Grow and lead the software engineering team, under the guidance and mentorship of the CTO

Benefits


Salary & Benefits

  • Competitive salary (based on experience)
  • Stock options
  • Join a fast-growing and exciting start-up with excellent growth opportunities
  • Working with a fun, international and highly-motivated team
  • Flexible working
  • Great Apple hardware
  • Central London office with great transport links

NO AGENCIES, PLEASE.

item.title: Systems Administrator at Jane Street (London, UK)
item.description:
This is primarily a technical support role and will reside within our systems administration group.
We have a mixed Windows and Linux environment spread across a physical and virtual computing landscape. This position focuses on our Windows environment providing technical support for our end users and ensuring the health of our estate both on the desktop and server sides.


We're seeking responsible, careful, and passionate people to start or continue their careers with Jane Street. The position will allow new or recent graduates the opportunity to work and learn from experienced members of the windows server, development and desktop administration teams.
Jane Street's trading environment is run on Windows and Linux workstations. It is desired that applicants will have a familiarity with both platforms, but this position will be primarily focused on providing professional support for our Windows systems.


Sometimes the work is intense, but it is always rewarding. Positions for individuals are based on a person's interests as well as their aptitude. Jane Street allows individuals to wear many hats as they find their niche within our organization. We seek talented people and provide them with the tools to succeed with a great company.



Our Working Environment:


We use a variety of platforms and programming languages for solving and maintaining our trading environment, so you should be comfortable working with multiple operating systems and absorbing new technologies as we grow. Teamwork is paramount at Jane Street, so you should be excited about sharing your work with others. The culture is lively and informal. Group discussions are often as humorous as they are technical. We enjoy the challenge and diversity encountered on each day. You will get exposure to multiple segments of our business and will work with our trading desks and international offices on a daily basis.

Become a member of the team that operates and design global backbone networks in the EU (London, Paris, Amsterdam, Frankfurt, Luxembourg) and US (Los Angeles, Miami)! You can join us to work on one of the world's most visited website and enjoy the advantages of playing on the newest routing and switching platforms, developing software defined network traffic optimization solutions serving thousands of servers, and keeping your knowledge relevant.


What you will really be doing



  • Acting as an advanced engineering resource for LAN/WAN routing and switching, QA and review

  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices (Web

  • User Interface Design (UI), API development)

  • Design and deploy software network control systems and solutions.

  • Responsible for the operation and maintenance of Cisco deployment.

  • Conducting research on network products, services, protocols, and standards to remain abreast of developments in the networking industry.

  • Monitoring network stability, availability and performance.

  • Identifying, diagnose and resolve network problems as needed.

  • Proposing designs for network implementations to be deployed

item.title: Client Engineer/Jr JavaScript Engineer at Qubit (London, UK)
item.description:
Qubit: Cutting Edge Big Data Engineering


Qubit’s London office is growing and winning clients, and we need someone who can carry out the technical integration project for each new account.


This is a fantastic opportunity for a recent graduate or someone in the early stages of their career. You’ll work closely with our developers to troubleshoot for new clients and engineer compatibility between their sites and the Qubit platform.


It’s a great way to start your career with a number of options for progression. As one of the Customer Solutions Engineers in the UK, it’s a great opportunity to make your mark early on a growing, international business.


What you’ll be doing



  • Troubleshooting and implementing our JavaScript tags, which are served to more than 1 billion monthly page impressions!

  • Coding A/B and multivariate website tests in JavaScript for our client project team

  • Engaging with our clients to understand their systems and data architecture, and providing troubleshooting and support to those clients


Plenty of perks


As well as the opportunity to solve complex problems in this exciting new era of big data, here’s what we offer:



  • Realistic performance related bonuses

  • Generous equity options mean you’ll own a piece of the pie

  • Excellent health and dental insurance packages

  • A relaxed approach to time off and enough holidays to see several corners of the world

  • Fridge fully stocked with healthy snacks and the ultimate espresso machine for your java fix

  • A competitive office where we play foosball, football, scrabble, go-karting… you name it, we’ll play it

  • Thank Qubit it’s Friday – we have lots of creative ways to let off steam at the end of the week

  • Plenty of opportunities for training and development

item.title: Fullstack JavaScript Engineer at the cutting edge of big data at Qubit (London, UK)
item.description:
Senior Javascript Engineer


At Qubit, the frontend team is focused on building well engineered, beautiful products with JavaScript. Our products provide an intuitive way for marketers to modify their website, understand and target user segments and measure the impact of their changes.


ARE YOU…


A team player? We are an opinionated team looking for like minded people. Are you excited by the prospect of solving complex challenges on an interesting technology stack?


Independant thinker? We like to hire engineers that thrive in a world of ambiguity. We want people that can be given hard problems and can go off and find the best technical solution.


Experimental? We are constantly experimenting with new technologies, right now some technologies that we really like are:



  • React, Flux and Redux

  • ES 2015/16

  • Git(hub)

  • Node.js

  • SuitCSS

  • Docker & Mesos

  • Make

  • Webpack

  • Mocha & Karma


Passionate about open source? Sharing is caring after all. We always contribute back to the open source community. Qubit's array of open source projects include:



  • react-test-tree: Simple and concise React component testing.

  • cherrytree: A flexible client-side router.

  • marty: A Javascript library for state management in React applications.

  • bamboo: HAProxy auto configuration and auto service discovery for Mesos Marathon.


You'll be responsible for:



  • Writing Javascript that will be run in hundreds of millions of browsers every day.

  • Building end-to-end products with Javascript (Node.js, React).

  • Understanding business problems and translating them into technical solutions.

  • Instrumenting, testing and deploying your code to production (We like to deploy multiple times a day).

  • Working closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications.

  • Working closely with operations and infrastructure to build and scale our applications.

item.title: Senior SAP ABAP Developer (f/m) at Delivery Hero Holding GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Delivery Hero  is building the next generation global online food-ordering platform. Our awesome international team already operates in 40 countries worldwide to ensure hungry customers get the fastest way to their favorite takeaway food. The company has grown from its inception in 2011 to become the world's largest food-ordering network. This is an exciting time for Delivery Hero with a huge and rapid amount of growth in countries, market size and opportunities. We are looking for a  Senior SAP ABAP Developer (f/m)  to join our Central Team on its mission as soon as possible. Our ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative and good at getting things done. You can play an active role in our future - an exciting job and a workplace in our brand new Berlin Hero Hub is waiting for you!



Your mission:

  • You translate functional business requirements into technical design specifications

  • You work closely with SAP functional teams and assist the business users in performing acceptance tests

  • You perform and document all unit, integration, performance and regression tests in our test driven development process

  • You continuously extend your expertise and stay on track with new technological developments

  • You proactively review current processes and services, establishing new ones as required, maintaining standards in terms of quality and excellence, process automation to improve efficiency

item.title: Software Engineer, Frontend at SpotMe (Lausanne, Switzerland)
item.description:
Responsibilities
To support our growth, we are looking to recruit in our Lausanne offices a talented Frontend Software Engineer to build new products & features for our SpotMe environment designed around Node.js, AngularJS, and CouchDB stack. As the successful candidate, you will be creating high-quality code that powers our CMS engine which is used to build and deliver more than thousands events and apps globally per year.


We are looking for exceptional individuals who can grow with the company.


Position
This position will let you focus working on our CMS used by our own staff as well as external customers, with the following key responsibilities:



  • Develop new features of the SpotMe Backstage, our CMS

  • Work with other teams on products built around SpotMe Backstage

  • Work on upcoming SpotMe products to be be launched in 2017

  • Participate in brainstorming, specification and design sessions about in regards to new product features and developments


For this position we are looking for:



  • Native JavaScript and CSS speaker with attention to details

  • Experience with Angular, Node.js and CoffeeScript are a plus

  • Demonstrated success in designing and building complex web applications

  • Proactive, willing to get things done

  • Strong analytical skills


This position is based in Lausanne, Switzerland. Relocation and visa support are provided.


Our culture
SpotMe is a company defined by hard-working and result-oriented people. By successfully navigating between technical and human communication areas, each team member is striving to improve users’ experience by contributing into system foundations, sharing the knowledge and best practices.


Working at SpotMe requires excellence in engineering, communication and analytical skills to see the whole picture beyond just your part. Being both demanding in deadlines and quality, and having immediate feedback from users allows a precise understating of current state of things and areas for improvement.

Our Culture
SpotMe is a company defined by hard-working and result-oriented people. By successfully navigating between technical and human communication areas, each team member is striving to improve users’ experience by contributing into system foundations, sharing the knowledge and best practices.


Working at SpotMe requires excellence in engineering, communication and analytical skills to see the whole picture beyond just your part. Being both demanding in deadlines and quality, and having immediate feedback from users allows a precise understating of current state of things and areas for improvement.

item.title: Front-end Engineers, London at Lloyds Banking Group (London, UK)
item.description:
Lloyds Banking Group is changing. We’re rapidly transforming into a digitally-led business on a massive scale in order to better serve our customers. We’re already the largest provider of digital banking products in the UK, with over 12 million active online customers and nearly 8 million active mobile banking customers. It means a big opportunity for you to be part of ground-breaking transformation and it means there’s never been a more exciting time to join.


This is an excellent opportunity for a driven candidate to join us as a Front-end Engineer in one of our cross-disciplinary feature teams. As a highly experienced member of our wider Engineering team we expect that you to demonstrate and apply exemplary software engineering practices and skills as well as mentor our more junior team members.


In return, you’ll enjoy an exciting, innovative environment that supports flexible and agile working. You will work in a highly collaborative way and enjoy seeing the impact of your work by creating digital experiences on our web, mobile and tablet applications that are being used by millions of our customers every day.


With our breadth, reach and diversity, we can offer excellent opportunities for career growth and development. And we are looking for people who can seize those opportunities; you'll get plenty of support but it's about taking the initiative, building relationships and making it happen. Do this and you can help us make a positive difference to our customers, our colleagues and our communities.


Key responsibilities



  • Writing modular, well tested front-end applications that remains easy to maintain as the codebase and business continues to scale

  • Setting the strategic direction for how front-end applications are developed within the team

  • Ensure that software is built in a way which is consistent with - and exploits where possible - the collective frameworks, patterns and practices that exist across the wider Engineering community

  • Understand and apply industry best practices, foster knowledge sharing to provide solutions for complex business problems where no precedent may exist, and ensure implementation of solutions where appropriate

  • Mentor and develop more junior front-end engineers, providing clear and constructive feedback and creating opportunities for learning and growth

  • Relentless focus on delivering business value through sound engineering methods and principles.

item.title: Dev engineer - Global digital channels space - Java, Spring, Javascript, Angular at ING (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
ING is looking for an experienced (mid-senior level) Dev engineer to strengthen its development team that delivers complex mission-critical software solutions for the Global digital channels space.


If you want to work at a place where we care about scoring high on The Joel Test, where we believe that you can live by the agile manifesto without jeopardizing the necessary compliance and QA measures, where we find that the problem chooses the language/technology and not the other way around, where we are committed to fostering a proper engineering culture and building a high-productivity team of smart Dev engineers with the getting-things done mentality, please read on.


Job Description Your main focus will be on building ING’s:



  • New multi-product and multi-country ING Commercial Banking Portal, which gives clients integrated access to Commercial Banking products and services.

  • Access and Identity management solutions utilized across all online channels of ING Commercial Banking including the new ING Commercial Banking Portal.

  • Other in-house software solutions in response to business needs.

  • In addition to developing complex software solutions, you will also contribute to:

  • Streamlining our development process all the way from code check-ins to deployment into production in collaboration with Ops colleagues (using the best tools that we can find: e.g. Jira, git, Jenkins, Maven, Artifactory, …).

  • Improving our continuous integration, increasing our automated test coverage, and helping us get to the next level of maturity with respect to Continuous Delivery.


Your work environment


You will work in the dynamic and challenging environment of the IT organization of ING Global Digital Channels. We operate according to a Scrum Agile development process and strongly believe in the DevOps approach to delivering IT solutions. The focus is on high-quality mission-critical software delivered in time using iterative development with regular milestone demos to the business, so that at the end there are no surprises about what we build.

If you want to work at a place where we you have an impact to work on the mobile app that will be available worldwide to the commercial clients of a leading global bank, where we care about scoring high on The Joel Test, where we believe that you can live by the agile manifesto without jeopardizing the necessary compliance and QA measures, where we find that the problem chooses the language/technology and not the other way around, where we are committed to fostering a proper engineering culture and building a high-productivity team of smart Dev engineers with the getting-things done mentality, please read on.


Job Description


Your main focus will be on building ING’s:



  • Native mobile and tablet applications for Android for our new multi-product and multi-country ING Commercial Banking InsideBusiness portal, which gives clients integrated access to Commercial Banking products and services. The app will be available to our commercial customers world-wide.

  • Streamlining our development process all the way from code check-ins, peer code reviews, static code analysis, to running automated functional regressions test against the backend APIs (using the best tools that we can find: e.g. Jira, Git, Crucible, Jenkins, Gradle, Espresso, …).

  • Improving our continuous integration, increasing our automated test coverage, and helping us get to the next level of maturity with respect to Continuous Delivery.


Your work environment


You will work in the dynamic and challenging environment of the IT organization of ING Global Digital Channels.


We operate according to a Scrum Agile development process and strongly believe in the DevOps approach to delivering IT solutions. The focus is on high-quality mission-critical software delivered in time using iterative development with regular milestone demos to the business, so that at the end there are no surprises about what we build and how far we are.


Profile (desired skills & experience)



  • Master of Science in Computer Science or an equivalent field.

  • You love technology and naturally stay up-to-date on relevant new developments.

  • 5+ years of software engineering experience, preferably in creating high scalability mission-critical applications.

  • You are able to develop efficient and maintainable code with the right balance between solving the problem at hand and not over-engineering your solution.

  • You have real world OO design experience and knowledge of design patterns, combined with an ability to succinctly convey design information using suitable tools (e.g. the UML, BPMN).

  • Excellent knowledge of Java and Android SDK and a minimum of 3 years of solid experience with the Android platform.

  • Knowledge of other modern OO languages especially Swift, Objective-C and ability to develop for iOS, while not mandatory, will be greatly valued.

  • Good knowledge OS fundamentals with the ability to apply it in the context of modern operating systems (e.g. Linux, OS X, Windows Server 2008/2012).

  • A working knowledge of JavaScript and WEB 2.0 applied in the context of Hybrid mobile development using frameworks such as PhoneGap or Titanium is big nice-to-have.

  • Even though not mandatory, experience with at least one modern scripting language (e.g. python, ruby, etc.)

  • You have sound knowledge of relational databases (e.g. Oracle, MS SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc). Knowledge of NoSQL datastores, while not mandatory, is a strong nice-to-have.

  • Great English communication skills, verbal as well as written.

  • You value a multi-cultured environment where English is the working language and you easily get on with people from different cultural backgrounds.


What do we offer


Working at ING means working in a dynamic and international setting. Very important is individual development of our employees and that is why ING offers excellent courses and programs. In addition we offer:


• an excellent salary


• a thirteenth month


• life-course savings scheme


• public transport season ticket

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer - Python, AWS at HERE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
HERE is transforming into a data-driven company!


Data is the critical piece in the toolbox of all modern cloud companies. To support the mission of delivering sensational everyday adventures to our customers across the globe on their phones, in their cars, and on the web, HERE is rapidly transforming our platform to take full advantage of the data that our global cloud collects.


The Geo Insights team of Here Enterprise is responsible for big data crunching, analytics and cool visualization on HERE maps.


As Infrastructure Engineer in the Geo Insight Team, you will work with a team of highly skilled developers, designers, and data scientists to bring visualization, analytics and geo-spatial capabilities to our platform, enabling our customers to explore their complex geographic datasets with our tools and driving forward our objective of becoming a leading, data-driven, location company.      


The Role


As part of the Geo Insight platform team in Berlin, the Infrastructure Engineer will be responsible for connecting the dots: understanding the whole value stream and enable developers, QA engineers and product owners meet each other needs by designing architecture solutions collaboratively. Drawing on your background in building scalable systems, you would be expected to continuously improve the infrastructure, emphasizing reliability and supporting long-term product strategy.


What will you do?



  • Build fast, reliable and scalable “consumer-grade” geo-platform services

  • Contribute to architecture and infrastructure design to support strategic project plans

  • Work across the variety of cloud-based server solutions: from tiny front-end focused environments to terabytes-processing clusters with complex data life-cycles and pipelines.

  • Research new ways of improving both developer experience and production system metrics

  • Represent the team, participate in designing the future architecture, etc.

item.title: Software Engineering Lead, London or Edinburgh at Lloyds Banking Group (London, UK)
item.description:
Lloyds Banking Group is changing. We’re rapidly transforming into a digitally-led business on a massive scale in order to better serve our customers. We’re already the largest provider of digital banking products in the UK, with over 12 million active online customers and nearly 8 million active mobile banking customers. It means a big opportunity for you to be part of ground-breaking transformation and it means there’s never been a more exciting time to join.


This is an excellent opportunity for a driven candidate to take on a leadership role where you would be committed to building and maintaining highly productive software engineering teams instilled with the ethos of delivering quality solutions. In return, you’ll enjoy an exciting, innovative environment that supports flexible and agile working. You would be driving the overarching Engineering strategy and setting the direction for all software engineers within your area, which can range from a handful of feature teams to a £50m change portfolio.


With our breadth, reach and diversity, we can offer excellent opportunities for career growth and development. And we are looking for people who can seize those opportunities; you'll get plenty of support but it's about taking the initiative, building relationships and making it happen. Do this and you can help us make a positive difference to our customers, our colleagues and our communities.


Key responsibilities



  • As part of the leadership team, set the strategic direction for how we build software within the teams, which includes tools, coding standards, quality controls etc.

  • Ensure that software is built in a way which is consistent with - and exploits where possible - the collective frameworks, patterns and best practices that exist across the wider Engineering community

  • Mentor and develop software engineers, providing clear and constructive feedback and creating opportunities for learning and growth

  • Foster knowledge sharing to provide solutions for complex business problems where no precedent may exist, and ensure implementation of solutions where appropriate

  • Establish, maintain and leverage effective working relationships with all areas, not only within Digital, but across the Group to promote Engineering and improve the overall delivery method

  • Relentless focus on delivering business value through sound software engineering methods and principles


PLEASE NOTE ROLES CAN BE BASED IN LONDON OR EDINBURGH. London advertised salary.

item.description:
Corporate Technology & Risk (CTR) delivers streamlined and consistent solutions supporting JPMorgan Chase’s Controls, Compliance, Legal, HR and IT Risk agendas, with a focus on stability, delivery, efficiencies and people. The goal of CTR’s drive to standardization, consistency and simplicity is a JPMorgan Chase architecture that fosters long-term productivity, quality and innovation across the entire enterprise. The disciplines within this organization are Compliance Technology, Oversight & Controls Technology, Legal & e-Discovery, Identity & Access Management, IT Risk & Controls, HR Real Estate & Global Services Technology, and Third Party Risk Management. 


 Control System Technology provides strategic application development and production support to 5 firm-wide organizations whose focus is strongly aligned to the firm’s enterprise wide control agendas: Oversight and Control, IT Risk Management, Sourcing & Procurement, Global Security & Investigations, and Global Business Resiliency


Utilize multiple programming languages and software technologies to deliver applications that are suitable for use and admissible for controlled processing and provide technical guidance to other team members.



  • Test, modify, and implement application codes.

  • Make standard modifications to existing software applications and modules in accordance with high-level specifications, application support and processing control standards.

  • Ensure all delivered code/components are in line with JPMC Risk Management requirements

  • Evaluate service level issues and suggest enhancements as required to address any underlying system problems and/or control issues

  • Create technical design recommendations for developing and integrating programs and regulatory controls per written specifications.
