item.title: Java Application Developer at J.P Morgan & Chase (Bournemouth, UK)
item.description:
SEAL is supporting technology product standard management, application inventory management and application portfolio analysis in many forms in an effort to evaluate innovative ideas and opportunities to reduce cost or to evaluate the impact of changes in technology strategy. To support these efforts an integrated platform is used comprised of third party and in-house applications.  Critical to SEAL is its ability to import data from a set of authoritative sources and to distribute information for which it is the authoritative source to consuming systems.


 The SEAL application developer will have a proven track record in developing applications in an Agile environment with at least 5 years experience in Enterprise Java and web technologies. They will participate in all aspects of the software lifecycle for new critical functionality and enhancements of the platform.


 Role Description 



  • Core development of SEAL’s vendor product and in-house applications

  • Work closely with the Business Analysis team to review and understand the business requirements and design specifications

  • Interact extensively with various members of the team to understand the application functionality and scope

  • Participate in SEAL’s architecture design decisions  

  • Be involved in all Scrum time boxed activities and ceremonies  

  • Assist in keeping up to date SEAL’s technical documentation

  • Provide 3rd line support to the platform

  • Participate in the release management coordination rota

  • Suggest development process improvements. Devise options for achieving targets when progress is not as intended


Innovate! Bring forward ideas, best practices, cutting edge technologies that will help maximize the business value of SEAL

item.title: Senior UI / UX Designer at Voyanta (London, UK)
item.description:
Part of Altus Analytics, Voyanta is a revolutionary software platform that gives real estate investors and lenders effective tools to capture, validate and analyse commercial real estate information.  


Built on Amazon AWS cloud infrastructure, using Agile processes, Java, PHP and JavaScript on primarily Linux platforms with extensive reporting and dashboards; the system combines carefully crafted user experience with in depth data modelling and manipulation, and advanced business information and data analysis tools.


We are looking for an experienced Senior UI/UX Designer who is passionate about delivering both an intuitive and engaging user experience as well as great design. Someone who wants to apply best practices and forward-thinking design principles to new and existing work, and who wants to actively contribute to the long-term success of our product.  A Senior UI/UX designer who wants to own and drive new product features


We want a Senior UI/UX designer with a love for usability design and an exciting portfolio that demonstrates both their user experience design process, and beautiful visual designs. A Senior UI/UX Designer who is passionate for the product, wants to get involved at all stages from product conception to product delivery, and is not afraid to get their hands dirty pruning pixels on a design. Someone who is as excited about designing complex data management systems as they are about designing the marketing materials.


If you want to create rapid responsive interfaces that are engaging, and visually appealing, while enriching your own career and increasing your exposure, this is the Senior UI/UX Designer opportunity to consider.


Here’s what our Senior UI/UX Designer will do:



  • Bring it to life. You will convert complex business requirements into pixel perfect designs; bringing them to life with a variety of usability techniques.

  • Create it. You will create mockups, user journeys, wireframes, and prototypes.

  • Collaborate. You will work across teams, often with Product Managers and Developers, to ensure the design is aligned to the business/user needs and implemented as designed.

  • Balance it. You will balance the urgency of business priorities with the importance of product consistency and interface usability.

  • Own it. You will take on the overall responsibility for the UI / UX design of the platform, ensuring a clean, elegant user interface that places the user at the centre of the design

  • Build it. You will take new features from concept and wireframe stage through to mock-ups and then final interfaces

  • Grow our brand.  You will ensure our brand identity is built upon and grown in original ways.

item.title: Global Head of Cloud Operations at Cloudreach Ltd (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
What does the Cloud Operations team do ?



Cloud Operations are our team of super-human Engineers who support our customer's cloud infrastructure as a managed service.



We have an awesome Bi-Modal service that offers our customers peace of mind with enterprise level, ITIL driven support, as well as offer all the agile, funky advantages that DevOps and Automation provides. They get their hands dirty across a wide range of technologies including AWS, Azure, Linux, MS SQL, Chef, Splunk, Lambda and and many more.



How will you spend your days ?

  • You will take responsibility for and lead & inspire 60+ cloud engineers, team leads and delivery leaders. There will be a commitment to grow the team internationally by at least 30% in the next 12 months.
  • You will work with the leadership team to ensure we have slick, efficient delivery processes, high levels of IT automation and that all staff are inspired with a commercial mindset to maximise revenue from, and value to, our clients.
  • You will own pricing for our standard Ops products and services and also price bespoke solutions to determine if they are beneficial for Cloudreach, our staff and the customer.
  • You will work with our Head of Offerings to continually refine our range of cloud operations services in areas such as highly automated ITIL based service management, full application management, managed security services, financial management and true DevOps.
  • You will carry out monthly business planning to plan recruitment against our predictable revenue growth and work with the business operations team to deliver forecasting
  • You will drive the execution plan underpinning our strategic initiatives, and continually refine Ops strategy to make sure it is aligned with the wider business through consulting with both the Ops team and the wider leadership team
  • You will travel once per quarter to the Vancouver office, occasionally to London and work full time from the Edinburgh office






How to stand out ?

  • A relevant degree (ideally technical) OR work experience equivalent
  • Strong project/program management experience, or direct business management experience with budget responsibility
  • Minimum 8 years experience in an operations team or in an Enterprise technical department that interfaced to operations
  • Experience building and managing technical teams
  • Some consultative selling or pre-sales experience with an ability to take commercial decisions
  • Smart, fast and strategic thinker with excellent attention to details
  • Full of motivation with an understanding of our four core values and an ability to channel them everyday including "Be Easy to Work With."




What are our cloudy perks?

  • MacBook Pro, big screen monitor, personal Google Apps domain and new smartphone (you will have to choose between Galaxy or iPhone - make the right choice !).
  • Unique 'cloudy' culture: our people are diverse, passionate and easy to work with.
  • Enjoy our uncapped holiday policy and your birthday off.
  • Our Season Ticket Loan will make your daily commute less expensive.
  • Cloudy University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunities.
  • Our office in the Tun is filled with free drinks and snacks, an Xbox One and big screen TV, pool table, foosball, bean bags and sofas.
  • "Cloudy Lunch" where every Friday we take over a local restaurant. Enjoy, it's on us!
  • Discount on private healthcare scheme and gym membership. Stakeholder pension with shared employee and employer contribution.
  • We kick-off every new financial year by getting together in a cool secret destination in Europe.

movingimage is in a process of fast growth and therefore looking for qualified senior software engineers for its newly formed teams. item.title: Software Engineer in Test - Flash Memory at Tuxera (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
As a Flash Software Engineer in Test – Embedded Solutions you will take a major role in the company's software quality assurance. You will focus on Tuxera's leading flash memory products and services. Your mission is to guarantee that Tuxera delivers the best possible value to our customers in terms of features, performance and storage lifetime.


As part of our team you will execute projects in collaboration with the world's biggest automotive, consumer electronics and flash vendor brands. You will evaluate Tuxera's and competing solutions and enable our customers to make informed decisions. In the same time you will guide our development team's optimization activities.


Tasks and responsibilities



  • Work as part of internal and customer flash testing projects

  • Design, implement and execute file system benchmarks with focus on flash memory performance and lifetime

  • Carry out problem and performance analysis and debugging

  • Work with the development team to support customers and improve the overall quality of Tuxera products

item.title: Senior Linux System Engineer Bern at Puzzle ITC (Bern, Schweiz)

Puzzle ITC ist ein Open Source Dienstleister aus Bern (Schweiz). Für Puzzle stehen Kunden und Mitarbeiter gleichermassen im Mittelpunkt. Das Team aus Software-Architekten, Software-Entwicklern, Linux System-Ingenieuren, Usability Experten und Projektleitern nimmt sich gerne der Lösung von anspruchsvollen und komplexen Herausforderungen an. Vor 16 Jahren gegründet, punktet Puzzle mit dem Spirit einer jungen Firma und der Etabliertheit bei diversen Grosskunden in der Schweiz.


Deine Aufgaben als Senior Linux Software Engineer:



  • Mitarbeit bei der Konzeption und Umsetzung anspruchsvoller Kundenprojekte

  • Beratung und Unterstützung von Kunden in vielfältigen Themen

  • Engineering in kleinen und sehr grossen Infrastrukturen von Kunden verschiedenster Branchen

item.title: Full Stack Developer (MVC, C#) - Awesome Team and Challenging Technical Work! at Agilisys Digital (London, UK)
item.description:
We are Agilisys Digital.  We build the technology of the future. Our leading edge digital platforms enable businesses to save money. We provide interactive experiences that touch people from all walks of life.  Our cloud platforms underpin digital media.  If you feel you can bring innovation, integrity and passion to us – read on.


The role


Due to the increase in demand for our digital products, we’re looking for technical geeks to join our team. You should be a developer, senior developer, or technical architect - expert with the Microsoft technology stack. If you’ve worked with the Java technology stacks, that would be a bonus. You should be well versed in Design Patterns – to create sustainable architectures. Your passion for technology should shine through.


What you get


You’ll be able to further your knowledge of Agile – working with Product Owners and Scrum Masters.  You’ll have fun while you work and even get to play estimation poker!  You’ll get to lead.  You’ll get to solve complex problems.  We’ll help you learn and grow.  You’ll be awesome.


We guess you’ll want to work with the latest cutting edge technologies & devices - mobiles, tablets, and even PCs.  You will get all of that.  You’ll get to work in our West London offices as well as visit our client base around the UK.  We’ll provide you with fantastic opportunities to build exciting products of the future.


What you need


You should be experienced with ASP.NET, .Net Framework, C# and SQL Server.  You’ll need to be familiar with TDD (Test Driven Development) and the tools to boot.  We expect that you’ll have spent time learning how to create high quality product – right first time.  You’ll be so excited by technology that you’ll be researching new products to improve code all the time.


You’ll understand the importance of using automated testing tools such as Selenium, and have worked with unit testing products such as MS Test.  You will have used tools such as Rhino Mocks to create mock objects.  You will be passionate about quality and will have checked your code coverage using NCover or similar.


It goes without saying that you’ll be a master of Visual Studio & Team Foundation Server.  You’ll probably have knowledge of JQuery, HTML5, MVC 4 and have opinions on apps for devices.  If you know CSLA.NET then you’re a true genius – but if you don’t, it’s cool, we can teach you that!


You will have worked on system integration and any knowledge that you have gained of message brokers such as Biz Talk and WebSphere would be beneficial – although not essential.


We innovate.  We transform.  We deliver.  We are Agilisys Digital.

item.title: UX/UI Designer, join us on the journey to a user-friendly digital bank at Bigbank (Tallinn, Estonia)
item.description:
What you'll be doing
– Supporting product development with the activities of experience mapping (persona, empathy maps, user scenarios, use cases, journey maps, service design)
– Creating wireframes, prototypes and final visuals for new features and testing them on end users
– Working closely with front-end developers and supporting them with design guidance and visual reviews
– Contributing to our living style guide with visual assets and guidelines
– Keeping your eye on the overall customer experience to create a seamless user flow


Why is this important to Bigbank?
We like our customers and want them to have a delightful user experience. In order to achieve this, omni-channel customer experience is key to us. 


How you'll spend your day 
– Collaborating with end users, product team, designers, content creators and management
– Interpreting business vision into user-friendly services
– Combining user expectations, business requirements and legal constraints into user friendly flows and breaking them into design components
– Testing design prototypes and production-ready coded designs in multiple browsers and platforms
– Analysing customer data, heatmaps and user feedback
– Researching user patterns, accessibility issues and UI trends 
– Discussing your work with fellow designers on daily standups and weekly design reviews
– Following and updating the living style guide (Bigbank UI Lab) guidelines and visual assets 
– Enjoying (semi)casual birthday gatherings in the open kitchen with cakes, snacks and the occasional beverage, with bubbles or without

item.title: Senior PHP Developer at belvilla (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Belvilla is looking for a Senior PHP-Webdeveloper,  to help us continue to build our products and services. Together with a team of young, enthusiastic colleagues you develop new tools, maintain and expand existing services and help improve usability and conversion. Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. It’s key that you’re experienced with the Symfony framework. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your coworkers into the application. A basic understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well.


You feel comfortable working within an agile environment that focuses on delivering business value, at a fast pace, in a dynamic fast growing company. The team focuses on building user-centered, modern, mobile, flexible platforms.


What is expected of you



  • Come every day with the energy & drive to achieve greatness, always drive yourself and others to improve

  • Develop, test and implement LAMP stack based, user- centered solutions

  • You deliver software that goes beyond basic functional requirements

  • Building reusable code and libraries for future use

  • You feel the drive to always want to optimize the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Integration of user-facing elements developed by a front-end developers with server side logic

  • You help boost the Symfony framework experience level within the team by coaching and help setting up standards

  • You believe that great quality code is the result of team effort. You have a positive attitude toward team Planning, pair programming, TDD and Lean/Agile Practices.

We are looking for a 'full stack' engineer who is able to move quickly between iOS, Android, low level networking, backend, kernel development, and much more. If you're experienced with various technologies, a fast learner and have a “get things done” mentality, we'd love to hear from you!

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Autonomous Driving at HERE USA (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
HERE is a leader in navigation, mapping and location experiences. We combine highly accurate and fresh maps with cloud technology to enable rich, real-time location experiences in a broad range of connected devices – from smartphones and tablets to wearables and vehicles. Built on 30 years of experience in cartography and drawing on more than 80,000 sources of data, HERE offers "Maps for Life" for more than 190 countries, voice guided navigation in 95 countries in more than 50 languages and live traffic information for 58 countries. To learn more about HERE, including our work in the areas of connected and autonomous driving, visit http://360.here.com orhttps://company.here.com/here/

Join a team of highly skilled and innovative engineers to work on leading-edge Map Platform Services for Highly Autonomous Driving (HAD) systems. Automated Driving industry is rapidly expanding. Join us in building the most precise and detailed map that will make Automated Driving a reality. This is an excellent opportunity to work with an energetic and dedicated team on highly visible, technology-driven problems with a direct connection to the success of the company.

Successful candidates will be able to demonstrate their ability to deliver robust, scalable, and maintainable software services for internal and external clients. They will be comfortable participating in all aspects of the Agile development process from technical requirements analysis through collaborative design, iterative implementation, automated testing and continuous delivery. No prior experience in the domain of Maps is required. We are looking for people who remain learners throughout their career, and whose inquisitiveness and love of technology will propel our products forward.

The development environment is server-side Java 7/8, with an emphasis on RESTful web services, distributed big-data processing (Hadoop/MapReduce/Storm/Spark), and cloud deployment (AWS, Docker, Puppet). There is some exposure to alternate JVM languages such as Scala and Groovy.

As a senior member of the team, you will be expected to contribute at a high-level to many aspects of our collaborative Agile development process:



  • Product and feature design.

  • Technical architectural design and review.

  • Software implementation with automated testing.

  • Peer code reviews, mentoring and knowledge sharing sessions.

  • Continuous process improvement, coding standards, use of code quality metrics.

  • Build, release and deployment automation and monitoring.

  • Customer support & troubleshooting.

item.title: iOS Developer - App used by millions at Catawiki (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:

We take our product very seriously and hope you will too. This way we ensure a mobile platform that is tuned and tweaked to perfectly serve our millions of users.

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Musement (Milano, Italy)
item.description:
We are looking for excellent software developers to join our growing team in Milan. 


Our platforms are written on Symfony3 + JS as our MVC frameworks. Developers choose the tools that work best for them - for instance, we have a mix of Linux, Windows, and Mac workstations in the team. We use Docker and Vagrant to make your development environment up and running in a matter of minutes. 


We have adopted agile scrum development techniques such as test-driven development, pair programming, and continuous integration. 


We hold regular retrospectives to improve our working environment and lightning talks to share cool ideas whether work-related or not. We expect developers to be generalizing specialists, ready at the drop of a hat to refine an algorithm, write a tricky integration test, tune a SQL query, or discuss feature nuances with a product manager.


Responsibilities :



  • You are a web developer who strives to build a top-quality, state-of-the-art web product. 

  • You mix technical skills in front-end development with UX patterns. 

  • Deep knowledge of web standards, responsive and accessible interfaces. 

  • Skills in writing high-performance and reusable code for UI components. 

  • Skills in using Versioning Control (Git). 

  • Strong spoken and written communication skills (English). 

  • You have a big appetite for mastering new skills and technologies and use your spare time to code, loosing count of your GitHub repos. 


Competitive compensation package with possible participation in the company stock option plan.  


Base salary and bonuses will be correlated to your seniority. 


Once a week you can work from your home or wherever. 


Please submit your application including projects developed or references.

item.title: Software Engineer for SEO at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Join our dynamic Software Engineer department as a PHP Developer with a strong SEO focus and help shape the future of the world’s largest hotel search.


Your responsibilities:



  • Build and improve our high traffic web applications for our millions of daily users.

  • Evaluate and estimate the implications of SEO strategies on our technology stack.

  • You support and advise the marketing and product departments with your unique technical insights.

  • Actively question established approaches and raise the level of innovation to stay ahead of competitors in a fiercely contested market.

  • Code reusable, clean, and easily testable software in a huge environment of challenging complexity.

  • Use your creativity and proficiency to make a difference within your team and beyond.

  • Work in a cross-functional team with passionate experts from various fields.



The ideal candidate:



  • Has at least 2-3 years’ experience in PHP/JavaScript development, ideally in a SEO-driven environment.

  • Holds an academic degree in the field of IT or has relevant experience developing large applications.

  • Stays up to date with current tools, libraries and standards (e.g. Google Tools, W3C, ARIA, IETF, HTTP, HTML 5).

  • Has knowledge about accessibility for humans and robots alike.

  • Is passionate about the semantic web and has excellent knowledge of structured data.

  • Always takes the impact of website performance into consideration.

  • Has a solid understanding of software construction.

  • Naturally follows good development practices like test automation, CI/CD, source version control.

  • Enjoys technical challenges and is eager to explore new technologies. An understanding of search engines and their importance in markets worldwide would be a plus.

  • Feels comfortable communicating in English on a daily basis.

  • Can start as soon as possible.


Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Being an active member of our PHP, JavaScript, and UI guilds.
    The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hoursbased on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • Working at our head office in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of life in the world for expats.

item.title: Big Data Engineer - Spark at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries. Enjoy a work environment that encourages new ideas, having fun and challenging the status quo!

Our newly formed Data Engineering team is looking for a big data expert to supplement our cutting-edge analytics team and bring our data platform to the next level. You will achieve this by creating real-time streaming processes to ingest millions of messages every minute. You will design, implement and support data models and ETLs in Hadoop in order to process several terabytes of data each week. You will also set up monitor processes and be first in line to deal with and solve data-related problems or errors. Your role will involve consulting the Business Intelligence team on internal data best practices and training them on real time processing tools so it is essential that you stay up-to-date on the best practices used in the industry. We only work with state of the art technology so we want you to challenge the status quo at trivago and continually investigate new data processing technologies.

item.title: PHP Frontend Developer at iBOOD (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a PHP Frontend Developer at iBOOD in Amsterdam, you will work for a fast-growing e-commerce player, with a unique and distinctive way of working. We are renowned for our daily deals, which we introduced over 10 years ago. Every day, starting at midnight, we offer new products for the lowest online price.


More than 1.3 million customers have an iBOOD account, which provides access to our deals and enables them to participate on the vibrant iBOOD forum.
Having won Website of the Year for each of the last 7 years, we are highly ambitious and want to become even better. Over the past decade, we have grown organically by delivering great deals and enjoying the consequent positive word-of-mouth advertising.


To be able to achieve our ambitions for the coming years, we are working to improve the online platform and expand our organization.


The role


In order to greatly improve the webshop, both functionally and technically, we are pursuing state-of-the-art technological solutions, that are maintainable and can handle the number of visitors we expect to receive over the coming years.


As a member of the PHP Frontend team, you share responsibility for the development of the webshop, with an emphasis on great customer experience. We are looking for someone with strong PHP skills and for whom HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript hold no secrets.


Within the internal development team, you will work together with other developers, under the responsibility of the CTO. On a day-to-day basis, you will be directly managed by the lead developer.

item.title: C++ / UNIX / Linux Contractor - Market Surveillance at Bloomberg (London, UK)
item.description:
Market Surveillance specializes in the delivery of equity real time market data. We develop advanced, distributed software that monitors all the equity markets around the world and performs operations based on trades. We rank securities stocks against each other, compare their current performance with their historical behavior and aggregate similar companies together to reflect trends in markets. Clients use our software to find interesting trading opportunities in the sea of information that are the different financial markets. They access our data through the Bloomberg terminal and they expect it to be accurate, always available and delivered quickly. Most of our application have been at the forefront of the terminal for many years and are also often displayed on Bloomberg TV. Some of these have been around for a long time and are in need of some maintenance. In order to continue delivering a high level of service, we are looking to migrate our diverse backend applications from large big-endian AIX/SPARC UNIX servers to more modern little-endian x86 Linux clusters.

By joining our team and taking on this role, you would help make our software more performant and reliable. You would also help us reduce our maintenance and improve quality by raising test coverage and re-writing difficult to maintain C/C++(98) using modern C++11. You would need to be able to deal efficiently with legacy code and re-architecture part of the code to make it more testable and easier to internalize. You would be working closely with a mentor who would help you identify the biggest issues and discuss possible solutions and would be expected to participate in team discussions and provide ideas to raise software quality.

The Role:



The Market Surveillance team in London is looking for a contractor to work on the UNIX to Linux migration of their backend systems.

We'll trust you to:

  • Re-write modules using more modern coding practices and C++ 11 where applicable.
  • Convert systems to use the latest available database technologies available at Bloomberg.
  • Test ported applications and handle communication with various teams across the company to resolve diverse software dependencies.
  • Master the variety of development tools in use at Bloomberg and be prepared for a challenging learning curve
  • Take ownership of issues and suggest ways to improve things


You should have:

  • Strong knowledge of C and C++ (98/11)
  • Strong knowledge of UNIX and Linux. You should be familiar with both platforms and be able to port software across them.
  • Relevant Experience with legacy systems
  • Experience with big-endian and little-endian machine architecture
  • Good communication skills


We'd love to see:

  • That you have experience in dealing with large distributed systems
  • That you're comfortable working in an Agile/Scrum environment
  • That you are familiar with Test Driven Development
  • That you have a strong background in successful project delivery
  • That you have experience with cross team projects


If this sounds like you:



Apply and we'll get in touch to let you know the next steps. In the meantime, check us out at http://www.techatbloomberg.com/

Bloomberg is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or any other classification protected by law.

item.title: Hackers wanted - Senior Developer / Team-Lead (m/w) gesucht. at freiheit.com technologies gmbh (Hamburg, Deutschland)

  • Du löst gerne schwierige Probleme. Du möchtest in kleinen Teams mit intelligenten Menschen zusammenarbeiten.

  • Von der Konzeption über die Entwicklung und das Testing bis zur Auslieferung bist Du in allen Phasen des Software-Engineerings verantwortlich für Dein Projekt, Dein Team und Deinen Kunden.

  • Du lernst gerne jeden Tag etwas Neues. Du bist ehrlich und hast Humor.

  • Du willst nicht irgendeinen Job, sondern Du willst mit Deinen Ideen und Deinem Können etwas bewegen!


Dazugehören? Schicke Deine vollständige Bewerbung an jobs@freiheit.com.

item.description:
We have positions available for enthusiastic Linux experts for the development of our Linux-based cluster management environment. You will be part of a team responsible for the development of our Linux based cluster management software.


You will be responsible for preparing our software stack for new Linux distributions and new CPU architectures; testing, packaging and maintaining third party software components;  managing software updates; keep track of the latest Linux distribution updates; developing integration between our software and third party hardware (e.g. GPUs, high speed interconnects, FPGAs) and software (e.g. Lustre, Kubernetes, Ceph, Puppet, OpenStack); and further developing our build infrastructure. Furthermore, you will also take part in the development of several Python based tools and applications.


There will be ample opportunity to develop your skills and to take initiative. You will have the opportunity to work with the latest hardware (e.g. GPUs, Xeon Phi and high-speed interconnects such as InfiniBand, Omni Path and 40 Gig-E) and software technologies such as parallel filesystems (e.g. Lustre, GPFS, BeeGFS), Hadoop, Spark, OpenStack, Docker, Kubernetes, Puppet, Open vSwitch and Ceph.


Our development team consists of highly skilled developers that are passionate about building a  software product that meets our customers' needs today and in the future. With your help, we will be adding many new features to our product to allow Bright clusters to be used for a wider range of workloads, and to allow clusters to scale to hundreds of thousands of nodes (i.e. exascale). We will also target new CPU architectures such as ARM64 and Power8/9, and further integrate container technology into the product to allow workloads to scale up and down easily on-premise, and to public clouds.

item.title: C++ Software Engineer Connected Car / Software Update (m/f) (100992) at BMW Group (Ulm, Deutschland)

You will work together with your scrum team to understand the features and their technical implications. You will identify use cases and create automated test cases on different levels (module, subsystem, system) with focus on system integration testing. Your work will take you through test planning, designing and developing test cases and test automation frameworks like xUnit and GoogleTest. Furthermore you will be responsible for making automated tests run. You will also analyze test failure causes and support development teams debugging the problems. In your role as a Software Test Engineer (m/f) you will support development teams in designing their software components for testability. Additionally you will work together with those development teams in creating tests, providing mocks and failure analysis tools which requires both your technical as well as communicational skills. Special attention is given to test automation, where you are responsible for test design, test execution, analysis of test results, defect analysis and reporting. Your range of tasks will be rounded off by the continuous improvement and optimization of test tools and processes.



Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

item.title: Sr Frontend Dev (AngularJS) at the fastest growing adtech company in Berlin! at Glispa Global Group (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
glispa's Ad Tech powers monetization solutions for thousands of publishers. It connects advertisers to their target audiences and shows the most relevant offers to end­users. We build high available, scalable systems from client and campaign management, reporting and automated billing to ad servers, event processing, analytics, data mining and prediction.


We build high available, scalable systems from client and campaign management, reporting and automated billing to ad servers, event processing, analytics, data mining and prediction.


By joining glispa, you will work in small collaborative cross functional teams with an agile workflow. Right from the start you will contribute to one or more components and take on ownership.


With the volumes of data we move, we keep pushing the boundaries of existing technologies - our systems are constantly evolving to keep up with the pace in online marketing. We strongly benefit from open source software and love to contribute back to the community.


As a Senior Frontend Developer you will be responsible for extending and optimizing glispa's user interfaces, such as our internal campaign management and reporting tools or the publisher interface. You will work in a team of developers and designers to build cutting edge, graphical appealing user interfaces that provide a great user experience.


Key responsibilities:



  • Improve, extend, and optimize the company's internal and external user interfaces, such as intranet, publisher interface, etc. using AngularJS

  • Use the latest Javascript/HTML/CSS Technologies to enhance user experience

  • Work with Creative Designers and UX specialists to make interfaces appealing, yet practical

  • Responsibility for parts of the project to ensure timely delivery

  • Work closely with the Product Owner and stakeholders, efficiently communicate task accomplishment, issues and status

  • Support team members with mentorship, trainings and development as the senior team member

item.title: Front-end Developer at BROWZZIN Pte. Ltd. (Singapore)
item.description:
We're an early stage startup with the ambition to revolutionise retail and drive the convergence of offline and online retail with an influencer-driven shopping platform. The founder has experience and contacts in the retail sector and was the CEO and founder of an ecommerce company that was sold for 700 million EUR in 2015. 


We are looking for a passionate, world-class front-end software engineer to be part of our entrepreneurial development team and that helps bring high-level ideas to a scalable platform and live product that will scale and grow to millions of users worldwide.


What we're offering you:



  1. Autonomy and creative freedom – Help shape how the front-end code and a high-performance content management platform work, including libraries and custom features

  2. Flexible Environment - We still don't work out of an office yet, so you can help shape our culture and workflow.

  3. Urban life or tropical Island – we will have an office in London and already have one in Singapore. We will help you relocate, but in the meantime, you can work from home.


Your responsibilities:


You'll be responsible for designing and developing the desktop and mobile-web front-end, both consumer facing but also internal management and reporting tools (everything except mobile apps). You will work alongside our top-notch back-end developer and an iOS developer who has already built a prototype of the mobile app. You will work with both of them on a suitable API for the app and web platforms.


How to apply:


Email jobs@browzzin.com your CV and provide an example of a web or data-driven system/program you've built, including source code (GitHub links or tarballs are fine).


In your email, also please provide answers to the following questions:


Q1) How many years of front-end dev experience do you have? (should be at least 3)


Q2) What relevant experience do you have with the following technologies LAMP, ReactJS, AngularJS, RESTful APIs? Share examples.


Q3) Please share examples of responsive websites you have worked on.


We have someone who will review your code and answers, and if it's good enough we'll contact you for a phone interview.

As MODOMOTO expands internationally, your work will have immediate impact on our customers and the many departments of MODOMOTO that are serving them. You will be continuously developing and optimizing our system with the goal of making it more reliable, scalable, and performant as we grow.


Therefore, we are looking for an experienced, passionate, and self-motivated engineer who will contribute to and influence the direction of this vision.


To be successful in this role, you must be a quick learner and have excellent software development skills. You must also be a great communicator and excel at working in a highly collaborative and cross-functional environment. There is no shortage of opportunities to shape the future of our product.


The Team:


You will be joining a tight-knit team of experts, in which decision-making is open and collaborative. Sharing knowledge and discussing technical strategy is just as much part of our day-to-day as quiet time to deliver excellent code.

item.title: Backend Web Developer (.NET) at Lundalogik AB (Lund, Sweden)
item.description:
Come and work with the Lime Go-team at Lundalogik! We are a happy bunch of people looking for someone who can help us improve and develop our awesome CRM application, Lime Go. Besides writing code you will join us and our other colleagues; at our famous Hack Tuesdays, Cottage Code Camps and enjoy our mandatory “fredagsfika” (everybody eats cake).

What you will do:



  • You will take part in improving and developing Lime Go. Much of the development will be listening to our customers (in some way) and process what they say. Feedback from our customers is a big priority as it affects almost every decision we make in some way or another.


  • When it comes to development we have a lot of awesome buzzwords to offer. Some of them are .NET/C#, AWS, Knockout.js, machine learning, and Elasticsearch. We will encourage you to you to change, add, question and remove buzzwords. Sharing your opinions is mandatory!


What you will get:



  • Beyond the coding
    We work closely with sales, marketing, delivery and support teams in order to understand customer needs and pains. We are a product company and own the entire product lifecycle from development to end-user support. In other words – we understand that Doing Things Right pays off in the end. 



  • Healthy working conditions
    We have a deep understanding of software craftsmanship all the way up to the executive management team. 



  • Job security
    We've been around for many years, with consistent organic growth and real profitability from the start. This doesn't mean we're old and boring – we continuously improve, explore new ways and evolve everything from our products to how we work as an organization.

item.title: Machine Learning Scientist - Customer Insights at Amazon (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Machine Learning Scientist

We’re looking for top scientists capable of using machine learning and other techniques to build new personalized product recommendations and data sets. In this role, you will join Customer Insights, our personalization engineering team at our development centre in Edinburgh, Scotland. We deal with large amounts of training data, rapid prototyping, offline/online testing and high-performance requirements. You will work with a variety of large retail data sets to gain insights into customer preferences. You will use these insights to create new data sets, metrics, measurement techniques and personalization services. Your work will drive changes to key consumer website features and algorithms in personalization, search and advertising and will lead to better selection and lower prices for customers.



Successful candidates will have strong technical ability, a focus on great customer experience, excellent teamwork and communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment.



Our position offers exceptional opportunities for every candidate to grow their technical and non-technical skills. If you are selected, you have the opportunity to make a difference to our business ($100BN annual sales in 2015) by designing and building state of the art machine learning systems on big data, leveraging Amazon’s vast computing resources (AWS), working on exciting and challenging projects, and delivering meaningful results to customers world-wide (300MM in 2015).



Key responsibilities:




  • Rapidly design, prototype and test many possible hypotheses in a high-ambiguity environment, making use of both quantitative analysis and business judgment.

  • Collaborate with software engineering teams to integrate successful experimental results into large-scale, highly complex Amazon production systems capable of handling 100,000s of transactions per second at low latency.

  • Report results in a manner which is both statistically rigorous and compellingly relevant, exemplifying good scientific practice in a business environment.

  • Promote the culture of experimentation and science at Amazon.


 

Basic Qualifications:




  • Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Operational Research, Statistics or a related quantitative field.

  • Experience applying Machine Learning to business problems.

  • Strong computer science grounding in a broad range of algorithms and data-structures.

  • Proficient in an object-orientated programming language (C++, Java, C#, C, Perl/Ruby, etc.)

  • Proficient with mathematical programming environments (R, Matlab, Numpy/Scipy, SAS, etc.)

  • Programming skills sufficient to extract, transform, and clean large (multi-terrabyte) data sets in a Unix/Linux environment.

  • Excellent critical thinking skills, combined with the ability to present your ideas clearly and compellingly in both verbal and written form.



Preferred Qualifications:




  •  Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Machine Learning, Data Science or related field.



Personal qualities:




  • Energy and willingness to formulate, test, and discard or revise many hypotheses.

  • Strong desire to push your ideas into production, overcoming obstacles, in order to benefit Amazon's customers.





In return, we offer a highly competitive salary, and other excellent benefits including healthcare. This is your opportunity to develop a rewarding career in a unique, passionate and international environment, work hard, have fun and make history!

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills.



All offers are conditional on references, verification of the right to work in the UK, and a successful background screening check. This check will include previous employment verification, qualification verification (if relevant) and a basic criminal check. Further details of this policy and procedure will be sent to you along with your conditional offer.

item.title: Senior Mobile Engineer, iOS at RideCell (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
What’s RideCell? It’s one of the most innovative car and ride sharing platform companies you’ve probably never heard of. We’re poised to be the leaders in the Mobility as a Service (or MaaS) space. Why is that important? Because transportation is on the cusp of a massive paradigm shift.


Remember when the primary way we’d get music was to go to a store and buy a CD? After the shift to digital music, the rise of subscription music services has pretty much obliterated the need to own the actual media. If you always have access to whatever music you want to listen to, there’s no reason to drive to the store and pay for an album that costs more than a month’s subscription for unlimited music access. Now that we’re in a world where we subscribe to Spotify or Apple Music, this seems obvious.


We used to buy music. Now we subscribe. Transportation is next.

Come build the next generation of transportation.


Responsibilities:



  • Implementing core libraries to support all RideCell new mobility products like car-sharing ride sharing, on demand, dynamic fixed route.

  • Develop new features like communication between vehicle and the app (lock, unlock, navigational information)

  • Making sure the apps supports dynamic UI and features to help scale products while supporting client needs

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at The Co-op (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Lead Software Engineer
Salary: Up to £62,000 p/a + excellent benefits
Location: Manchester City Centre

We're Co-op, and we're creating our very own digital revolution. By embracing the culture, practices and technologies of the digital age we're building new products and services that are grounded in co-op values of openness, member ownership, and community.

We're now looking to recruit talented Lead Software Engineers to support the growth of our unique business. As a Lead Software Engineer at Co-op you'll work in one of our multi-disciplinary agile teams alongside product owners, product managers, business analysts, architects, researchers and designers. We work together to create solutions that deliver simple applications with the needs of our customers and members at their heart.

We're primarily a Java house, but we also write in Ruby, Python and NodeJS, so we're really flexible when it comes to people's backgrounds. Our developers are polyglot in their approach, comfortable across the full stack and come from a variety of different backgrounds. Whatever your technical background, if you can bring us the passion and commitment to innovation we're looking for, we can offer you the chance to develop your skills and progress your career with a business that's putting digital at the heart of its strategy.

What you'll do:

Take the lead in collaborating with business analysts, architects, business owners and other teams
Take responsibility for mentoring and developing our team of Software Engineers
Take a polyglot, full-stack approach to software development
Use modern engineering practices like TDD, pair programming and continuous deployment
Work within agile teams to create quick feedback loops and focus on the customer
Build services that make a difference to people's lives

What you'll bring:

Extensive experience as a software developer/engineer
Coding skills - you'll be strong in at least one of Java, Ruby, Python, C# or JavaScript
Full-stack approach and solid understanding of how the web works
The ability to adapt and learn new technologies
Good people skills, with the ability to build relationships with different kinds of people
A commitment to putting UX at the heart of the development process - we run fortnightly user research sessions and feed this back into our backlogs

Why Co-op?

172 years ago a group of businessmen in Rochdale created an idea that changed the world. They realised that only by challenging the status-quo could they find solutions to the problems of their age. They were pioneers. And they left us a legacy that's never been more important or relevant than it is today.


We want to change the world all over again. And we know that to achieve our goal, we need to recruit teams that reflect the communities we serve. We’re committed to equal opportunities, and we’re determined to re-discover that defiant spirit on which a British institution was built. If you believe in our purpose, then join us. And make a real contribution to the revival of an iconic brand.


You can find out more about what's going on right now in Co-op Digital by visiting our blog.

item.title: Software Developer at Samskip (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Samskip biedt op dit moment plek voor aanstormend, afgestudeerd informatietalent. Ben jij dit talent, heb je een resultaatgerichte instelling én wil jij je graag jouw kennis van ontwikkeltools in de toekomst naar een hoger niveau tillen? Dan willen wij met je in contact komen!

Ontwikkel je kennis en kunde optimaal bij Samskip
Samskip biedt een intellectuele uitdaging, volop groeimogelijkheden, trainingen en een plaats in een team van Senior Developers die de digital transformation van Samskip realiseren. Als grote internationale vervoerder/verlader met een sterker positie in de internationale logistiek is het belangrijk om onze logistieke processen optimaal te ondersteunen. Dit doen wij middels IT, waarbij OutSystems een belangrijke rol speelt. Voor het uitbreiden en onderhouden hiervan hebben wij jou nodig!

item.title: Platform Engineer (Golang, Ruby on Rails) at Fishbrain (Stockholm, Sweden) (allows remote)
item.description:
We’re the next generation social network focused on sport fishing. Our platform deals with millions of anglers contributing to the community on a daily basis.

Fishbrain's platform team designs, implements, and maintains scalable software architectures that are at the heart of our technology. The team moves fast and plays a pivotal role in ensuring the quality of the backend systems that power our Android and iOS apps.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build, and deploy highly scalable software systems (including microservices) written in Ruby on Rails and Golang.

  • Produce high quality software using TDD in a continuous delivery environment.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.

item.title: Senior Android Developer at Quby (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
We are looking forward to welcoming an experienced Android developer to Quby. You will be part of a professional product development team working on mobile applications within an Agile/Scrum environment.


As an Android Developer, you will be responsible for the entire development and release cycle of the company's Android applications. Together with your team you will be designing and developing Android applications for our smart home solution called “Toon”. As “Toon” is already distributed in over 300.000 households in multiple countries, you will be responsible for multi-lingual, multi-tenant “Toon” mobile software development for tablets and smartphones.

item.title: Senior iOs Developer at Quby (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
We are looking forward to welcoming an experienced iOS developer to Quby. You will be part of a professional product development team working on mobile applications within an Agile/Scrum environment.


As an iOS Developer, you will be responsible for the entire development and release cycle of the company's iOS applications. Together with your team you will be designing and developing mobile applications for our smart home solution called “Toon”. As “Toon” is already distributed in over 300.000 households in multiple countries, you will be responsible for multi-lingual, multi-tenant “Toon” mobile software development for tablets and smartphones.

item.title: Senior Java Consultant @ Backbase Amsterdam at Backbase (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
The opportunity


The (Senior) Java Consultant is part of the Professional Services (PS) team. PS is a team of highly motivated specialists with the specific skills and experience required to make sure that the implementation of our product at our customer’s location goes ahead as smoothly as possible. The PS team also provides product training and implementation support services to all of our customers and partners. Every project has its own set of unique challenges that must be overcome, and PS team members must be able to think and react quickly to find a solution that works for everyone.


Our PS consultants work closely with partners and customers all over the world. They have the professional and personal skills required to develop, teach, support, and lead teams towards successfully delivering our enterprise solution and achieving their goals.


As part of the PS team you will report to the Operations Manager PS. 


As a hands-on java backend consultant you will be responsible for integrating our flagship portal products into the enterprise ICT environments of our international clients. During our pilot and implementation projects you will be part of a highly skilled multidisciplinary team. You work closely with our clients, architects and frontend consultants to define the integration with the client’s back end systems, determine implementation details, and realize those implementations. You will also be responsible for integrating security layers, exposing relevant business data, configuring the Backbase portal, and when necessary develop custom extensions. 


In some cases Backbase uses implementation partners when doing full implementations of the product for customers. In your role and as member of Professional Services you are the expert back end developer responsible for the guidance and coaching of our partners’ back end developers and consultants.

item.title: C++ Software Engineer at IMC Financial Markets (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
IMC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone doesn’t cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win. 


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


SOFTWARE ENGINEERING AT IMC:


We trade in the most competitive markets across the globe.  Our software makes millions of trading decisions daily.  We win by making better and faster decisions than our competition. As a software developer you’ll be working alongside traders to implement strategies which will challenge you to be creative with your implementation. You’ll need to timely produce high quality solutions meeting requirements and managing overall complexity of our systems. You’ll be working in a highly motivated team, controlling end-to-end product development.  We work in an environment where slight oversights can be extremely costly, while new features can be extremely profitable.  As a team we aim to balance the race to production with software quality and testability.  You’ll be placed in an environment consisting primarily of C++ and Java.  We have a build chain which has been designed around the concept of daily production releases.  A variety of systems and technologies keeps life interesting.


Upon joining you will be expected to manage your own time and tasks.  We rely on our developers to drive change by taking feedback from traders, and shaping that into an implementation.  Your ownership of the task continues until a working production release.  Our most successful developers comfortably work in any part of our stack.


Skills & Requirements:



  • Excellent C++ programming skills

  • Development experience in a Linux/UNIX environment

  • Extensive experience with OOP/OOD

  • Strong knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and threading

  • Proficiency in design patterns

  • Scripting knowledge 

  • Non-relational, distributed database experience is a plus (not a requirement)

  • Strong analytical skills and desire to solve complicated problems programmatically

  • Must be self-directed, and able to work productively under minimal supervision

  • Willingness to work closely with traders in a constantly changing environment

  • Interest in the Financial Markets; previous knowledge is NOT required


WHAT MAKES IT FUN?



  • One of the most fun aspects of the job is that we have a very quick feedback loop.  We release early and often to get incremental benefits as they are developed

  • We operate at the bleeding edge of technology.  If something new can potentially bring an advantage we will actively invest in developing and utilizing the solution

  • We really believe in sharing knowledge and technology between the different offices. Much of our technology stack is shared between all 3 regions, and we provide opportunities to travel between the regions both for personal growth and to assist where it has the biggest impact.

  • To get the best results we encourage everybody to gain understanding of both the trading strategy and how exchanges work on a technological level.

  • Working at IMC is also an opportunity to learn about financial markets. We know from experience that a lot of people really enjoy learning about a field beyond their immediate area of expertise, it’s one of the things that makes this job more interesting than others.

  • We employ a broad range of people with varying backgrounds.  What they have in common is their superior technical expertise, their extraordinary smarts and their collaborative approach. We will not accept less.


OUR CULTURE:


We are at the core a trading firm, however we value trading and technology equally and we believe that cooperation between traders and technologists is one of our great strengths. This is also reflected in our organizational and remuneration policies. We believe in fostering a truly flat environment in which great ideas can be recognized as well as put into practice from anybody within our organization

item.title: Lead PHP / Drupal Developer at TamTam (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Lead PHP / Drupal Developer 


Are you a talented back-end developer with quite a few great PHP projects your name? Welcome!


Your role


As a leading digital agency, we are constantly looking for the best, fastest and newest online solutions for our clients. We need you - as a Lead PHP developer with strong Drupal skills - to find and execute those solutions. You won't just be working within your own area of expertise on this, but will also work closely with front-enders and designers in scrum teams. Together we create the most amazing things. Continuous Integration, DevOps and Automated Testing give you as a developer more time to focus on creating and optimising ‘the next big thing’.


You will work for leading brands with an international team at our offices in Amsterdam or Rotterdam. You will also contribute ideas about application architecture and life-cycle management. Want to find out more about the things we make? Take a look here!


What we offer you:


We want you to be able to do your work as well as possible. And that involves quite a lot. such as:



  • An open culture;

  • Opportunities for advancement;

  • Training opportunities;

  • A laptop;

  • A mobile phone;

  • An NS Business Card;

  • Delicious, healthy food;

  • A boot camp that won’t cost you anything - apart from some sweat;

  • Great get-togethers;

  • A epic annual company trip;

  • Very decent financial compensation;

  • The opportunity to do what you do well and want to get better at!


We are TamTam,


One of the Netherlands’ biggest digital agencies. In our modest opinion, we produce great work for clients such as Ziggo, Nationale Opera & Ballet, Oxxio, HBO and Doctors Without Borders. Hierarchy is a word we're not keen on. You won't find it at our agency, either. If you have a good idea, we want you to shout it out! Because only then can we become the best digital agency in Europe.

item.description:
Für ein Projekt unseres Kunden in Zürich suchen wir per sofort eine/n erfahrene/n Java Software Entwickler/in.

  • Konzipieren und realisieren von anspruchsvollen Software-Lösungen basierend auf Standards und Produkten führender Anbieter

  • Selbständige, konzeptionelle Ausarbeitung und Analyse der neuen Anforderungen und Erstellung von Systemspezifikationen

  • Realisierung von anspruchsvollen Java Software Lösungen (Solution Architecture, SW Design, Build, Test, Deploy)

  • Nachführung und Betreuung der Betriebsdokumente

item.title: Backend Developer (m/ f) at Mimi Hearing Technologies GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for a Back-End Developer as a full-time position in our office in Berlin.



// This is your workplace:


Mimi Hearing Technologies, founded in 2014 in Berlin, is one of the most promising startups in the mHealth / sound space. We develop tools for people to explore their hearing health and enjoy a unique listening experience - we strive to be the forefront of sound innovation.


Our skills are deeply rooted in science, psychoacoustics and engineering. The Mimi team is a diverse group of innovators with strong expertise in audio- and sound engineering, product, communication and business design. A few facts:



  • Mimi Hearing Test is the number one hearing test app in the AppStore with over one million tested ears worldwide

  • Mimi Music is revolutionizing the way, how people listen to Music and the upcoming Mimi SDK will enable even more use cases for our technology

  • Total number of app downloads: 650K

  • Two patents filed + two patents in the pipeline

  • Close cooperation with Charité Berlin and medical certification of our products



Our vision is to set a new standard for the way we listen and become the #1 technology for personalized sound and hearing health.



// Who are we looking for?


We are committed to create a culture which nourishes personal growth as the base for company growth. We are a learning organisation which means, we love to work with people who start doing things, fail and learn fast in order to keep moving instead of waiting and drafting the perfect solutions.


As our Back-End Developer you will:



  • Design and build a scalable, secure backend in NodeJS

  • Setup and maintain infrastructure on services like Amazon Web Services, Heroku, Compose.io, Hetzner and more

  • Support our R&D team with research projects based on Python

  • Setup and maintain continuous integration (i.e. Jenkins) services for our app development team

  • Administer a complex cluster of worker servers and database nodes

  • Work on bug fixing and improving application performance

  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize efficiency

You want to change the world of bus travel? Our technology manages more than 1 Million bus trips each day. With real-time prices, with one click and a high-speed search. Cloud based, global, multi-lingual, highly automated. Technology is driving our success!


You are ready to take this challenge? Not afraid of the responsibility to be creative and have an impact? You breath technology and learn fast?


CheckMyBus is searching for you! Become a member of the great team behind the world's leading bus search engine:

item.title: Communications Platform Developer (m/f) at Immobilien Scout GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Role:




  • Your number one responsibility – innovate and create.

  • At its core, this is a Greenfield program of work that essentially builds a social media platform capable of linking people and data intelligently and meaningfully.

  • Work across all platforms – you will be in a constant dialogue with our mobile team to think about solutions holistically.

  • Project is backed as a core strategic program of work. Expect visibility and interaction with senior leaders in the company.

  • Those who join this team will be deeply integrated across the Scout product family – this is not just about property. While we have initiated our effort in ImmoScout, our “One Scout” vision is now moving us into AutoScout.

  • In addition to developing domain knowledge across the property and automotive industries, you will be thinking about leveraging B2C and C2C platform. We need people who can really think about solutions in multiple flows.

item.title: Head of Data Engineering (m/f) at Immobilien Scout GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your tasks:




  • Create the technical vision and strategy for our company-wide data platform to help our Market Segments succeed

  • Lead the journey from a separate (Immo+Auto) DWH era into a OneScout cloud-based world with spread data responsibility

  • Collaborate with our Insights, Data Science and Business teams to develop and execute a roadmap for our data platform

  • With your team help make the Scout24 builders organization (~200 engineers and product managers) more data driven by providing training and tooling

  • Give technical guidance and support the teams in navigating through the vibrant and vast landscape of big data technologies

  • Communicate the progress and prioritization decisions and the added business value to the company

  • Manage and inspire 16 engineers and 2 engineering managers in our Berlin and Munich offices

  • Develop your teams through frequent feedback, coaching and career guidance

item.title: Engineering Manager (m/f) at Immobilien Scout GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your Tasks:


As Engineering Manager (m/f) you will be responsible for the product engineering strategy, leading your dedicated team to successfully deliver on the product roadmap. You will have the perfect platform to use your profound technical know-how, leadership skills and innovative mindset to create excellent customer experience.

  • Develop & Execute a technology strategy, aligned to the functional strategy of IT and business goals

  • Direct line management and capability development of the engineers in your team

  • Technical delivery responsibility for the team roadmap, jointly agreed with the Product Manager

  • Act as the point of interaction with other parts of the Engineering Organization

  • Develop and act as a role model for our organizational culture

  • Continuously improve the delivery process of the teams by offering coaching and the right KPIs for the team to grow

item.title: Web & Database Developer at European Molecular Biology Organization (EMBO) (Heidelberg, Germany)
item.description:
EMBO is seeking a skilled IT professional to join its small in-house Information Support & Resources Team. The team develops and maintains central data storage and workflow management tools and services for all EMBO activities. With its administrative headquarters located on the EMBL campus in Heidelberg, EMBO offers a unique opportunity for a talented web and database developer to acquire a broad spectrum of professional experience in an international scientific setting, with English as the working language.

Specific responsibilities:




  • Maintain and develop the EMBO community web portfolio, which includes systems for the online submission, review and accessibility of data related to science funding and scientific activities (example: people.embo.org);


  • Provide technical user support for the online submission and review systems;


  • Administrate the EMBO webservers, liaising with the IT Services team of our partner institute, EMBL, to ensure their optimal performance; and with the EMBO Communications team, who are responsible for content and features of the main EMBO website (www.embo.org);


  • Contribute to expanding the features of the central EMBO databases for internal workflow management and administration (FileMaker Pro and mySQL);


  • Maintain the EMBO-internal file storage, backup, and collaboration services (calendars, wikis);


  • Develop tools for data collection and retrieval, statistics and reports;


  • Configure the in-house pool of staff computers (macOS) to ensure their smooth operation in the context of the above shared resources and services;


  • Provide basic training and ad-hoc advice to staff regarding shared resources and services;


  • Perform additional tasks as required by the Head of EMBO Information Support & Resources or by the EMBO Director. 


This position will occasionally require duty travel and working outside of the normal working hours, in the evenings and/or during the weekend.

item.title: Projekt- und Teamleitung Softwareentwicklung at Meteotest (Bern, Schweiz)

    Entwicklungsteam

Wir bieten:

  • die Möglichkeit, die Zukunft der Firma unternehmerisch mitzugestalten

  • ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell mit guten Sozialleistungen

  • ruhige Büroräumlichkeiten mit viel Platz in unserem Firmengebäude in Bern

item.title: Webdeveloper at Ambitions ('s-Hertogenbosch, Netherlands)
item.description:
ONLINE GEEK WANTED!


Ambitions heeft voor haar locatie in Den Bosch een vacature voor een



Webdeveloper



Een online duizendpoot die graag bij een communicatiebureau wil werken. Bij Ambitions in Den Bosch wel te verstaan. In ruil voor een super leuke baan met inspirerende collega’s en dito koffie vragen wij de volgende lange lijst met vaardigheden van je:

Front-end:



  • HTML(5)

  • Bootstrap

  • CSS

  • Javascript

  • jQuery

  • XSL



Back-end:



  • PHP (OOP, MVC)

  • MYSQL

  • XML

  • JSON



Diversen:



  • Plesk

  • MailChimp

  • Photoshop, Illustrator (i.v.m slicing en basing)

  • Linux command line

  • DNS-beheer

  • Optimaliseren/uitbouwen CMS

  • Opzetten templates en maatwerk modules



Mooi meegenomen:



  • Frameworks PHP Laravel

  • Kennis van het koppelen van API’s / webshops



Ambitions maakt deel uit van de Blue Dragon Communication Group.
Onze klanten zijn o.a. LeasePlan, Volvo, Only for Men, Bosch en Lindeboom.

De standaard zinnetjes over ‘salaris, voorwaarden en doorgroeimogelijkheden’ geloven we wel: ga met ons aan tafel!

We kijken uit naar je komst. Kijk voor meer informatie op www.ambitions.nl.

Solliciteren op de functie van Webdeveloper
Laat je CV en motivatie achter via onze sollicitatiepagina.


Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

As the team’s lead developer, you are part of an experienced team of highly motivated and talented people and report directly to a management team of seasoned entrepreneurs. With your deep experience in software development, architecture and entrepreneurial drive you will not only help us to extend our conversion relevant applications but also lead the way towards smart, mobile applications and a micro service driven architecture.


What we would like you to do:

  • You will take care of the whole application including Web and Mobile (iOS, Android)
