item.title: QA Automation Engineer at Ireland's Leading Property Website - Daft! at Distilled SCH (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Daft is Ireland’s leading property portal. Founded in 1997, it has revolutionised how consumers in Ireland find property. Nine out of ten properties for sale in Ireland are advertised on Daft, and it attracts over 2 million unique visitors and 250 million page impressions per month across multiple channels.


We are looking for a QA Automation Engineer to help us build and integrate our testing environment on Web Applications. You’ll be working with the development, commercial and design teams in supporting the product strategy. In Daft members of the technology team are encouraged to voice their creative ideas and watch them become initiatives and part of the solution. You will tackle challenging, novel solutions every day and you will be an integral member of the technology team.


Key Responsibilities will include:



  • Reporting to the QA Engineer, you will ensure that our applications are up to standard before releasing to the public.

  • Work with a variety of automated test tools – these may include Selenium WebDriver, BDD, Jenkins, Java, Python, PostMan / SoapUI etc.

  • Working closely with the Web team in the definition of the Acceptance tests.

  • Accepting and managing any manual QA-related activity including test case creation, execution when required.

  • Following established coding standards and techniques and assist with establishing standards.

  • Researching latest tools, techniques, resources and methodologies and constantly contributing to best practice processes.

  • Suggesting and implementing improvements to frameworks.

  • Documenting framework changes and best practices for our organisation.


Benefits 



  • A fast-paced, challenging and fun working environment.

  • An attractive salary and benefits package and career development plan.

  • The opportunity to work with one of Ireland's most known Internet companies.

  • Quarterly hack days

  • Friday treats

  • Discounted parking available

  • The chance to make a lasting difference. The projects are exciting and you will be given wide scope for creativity and innovation.

item.title: Software Developer at one of Ireland's leading classified websites - Adverts.ie! at Distilled SCH (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
We're Ireland's strongest company in Online Classified Advertising.  One of our brands, Adverts.ie is looking for a new Software Developer to join the Development Team!  This is where you come in...


As a member of the Adverts.ie development team, you will be working on site features that are used by thousands of people across multiple devices and platforms. You'll get to make the most of your experience by having input to every stage of the product development lifecycle. We have a very high standard on our development team and are looking for smart, passionate developers. The role is an extremely rewarding one for the right candidate, as you will be given ownership over your own projects from day one.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer at Elsevier (Frankfurt am Main, Germany)
item.description:
What we do?


Elsevier is a world leading provider of information solutions – we transform data and information into a vital, organic system of ideas that produces solutions to critical human challenges. We do this by combining information with digital tools, platforms and analytics to create knowledge that is both empowered and empowering – placing them in hands of authors, educators, scientists, researchers, clinicians, professionals and students.


Click here to see why we are proud to be part of Elsevier!


As a Senior Front-End Software Developer in front-end (JS) development methodologies, tools, frameworks and standards, you will join an international team of software engineering professionals and drive and maintain development of cloud based, distributed web-based applications in the area of Pharma & Biotech content solutions. 


The successful candidate will bring and share sufficient process experience in Agile/Scrum methodology, emphasizing collaboration and teamwork in application to enterprise software development. You will report to a Manager of Software Engineering.


Apply online or send your resume directly to: : Recruitment.Frankfurt@elsevier.com


Your responsibilities on this role would be the following:


Software Development:



  • To develop JavaScript based software as a member of Agile team.

  • To maintain current bio medical data base

  • To design, code, test, implements, maintains and supports application software that is delivered on time and within budget.

  • Modifies and/or writes technical and operator documentation.


 Software Technical design:



  • To recommend technical strategy and direction in area(s) of expertise. Participate in development and evolution of architecture with other team members

  • To conduct complex analysis and provide recommendations on the utilization of emerging and existing technologies.

  • To perform engineering cost/benefit analysis to verify potential effectiveness of new projects.

  • To builds new high level designs per need

  • To recommends and plans use of system and software features.

  • To maintains an understanding of current industry trends.


 Knowledge Sharing and Collaboration:



  • To communicate and proactively influence and educate members of technical and managerial staff on technology issues.

  • Mentor less experienced staff on all aspects of multiple system environments, software and system operations.

  • Work closely with Business Analysis and Project Management functions to ensure correct technical design.

item.title: Senior Data Engineer at Restless Bandit (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
As a Senior Data Engineer you will collaborate with other engineers and data scientists to develop and maintain the machine learning (ML) data pipeline powering Restless Bandit's talent-rediscovery products. Your days will involve architecting, improving, and customizing Restless Bandit's ML infrastructure based on well-established data-processing systems like Hadoop or  while also staying on top of the latest developments in big-data computation platforms.


Culture:


We work hard, but at the same time we have a laid-back, fun work environment. Some of the values that are important to us are:


 - Helpfulness: we appreciate receiving help as well as giving it, and learning from each other as well as sharing knowledge and opinions.


- Professionalism: we trust each other and assume independence and autonomy along with responsibility.


- Curiosity: we’re interested in new ideas and alternative viewpoints; we prefer having our minds’ changed by a discussion to ‘winning’ a debate.


- Relaxedness: we believe that consistent unhurried problem-solving produces better solutions than frantic ‘fire drills.’


- Fun: we're thick as thieves. We have lunch together every day, host regular (and spontaneous)  happy hours, and participate in professional meet-ups.

item.title: Senior JavaScript Developer at Belvilla (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
@Leisure/Belvilla is looking for a Senior JavaScript Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. You will work within our agile team with front-end and back-end developers to build all client-side logic. Together with a team of young, enthusiastic colleagues you develop new tools, maintain and expand existing services and help improve usability and conversion. You feel comfortable working within an agile environment that focuses on delivering business value, at a fast pace, in a dynamic fast growing company. The team focuses on building user-centered, modern, mobile, flexible platforms.


What is expected of you:



  • Come every day with the energy & drive to achieve greatness, always drive yourself and others to improve

  • You bridge the gap between the visual elements and the server-side infrastructure of our applications and you take an active role on both sides

  • You define together with the team how the application looks and functions

  • You deliver software that goes beyond basic functional requirements

  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs

  • Uniform and consolidate existing JavaScript codebase into a consistent framework

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use

  • Participate in daily standups, backlog refinements, sprint planning and retrospective

item.title: Medior PHP Webdeveloper at Belvilla (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
The role


Belvilla is looking for a Medior PHP Webdeveloper,  to help us continue to build our products and services. Together with a team of young, enthusiastic colleagues you develop new tools, maintain and expand existing services and help improve usability and conversion. Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. It’s key that you’re experienced with the Symfony framework. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your coworkers into the application. A basic understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well.


You feel comfortable working within an agile environment that focuses on delivering business value, at a fast pace, in a dynamic fast growing company. The team focuses on building user-centered, modern, mobile, flexible platforms.


What is expected of you

  • Develop, test and implement LAMP stack based, user- centered solutions

  • You deliver software that goes beyond basic functional requirements

  • Building reusable code and libraries for future use

  • You feel the drive to always want to optimize the application for maximum speed and scalability

item.title: PHP-Entwickler (m/w) at Digitalagentur kirchbergerknorr GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Deine Aufgaben ...


Unser Team aus festangestellten Projektmanagern, Designern, Frontend- und Backend-Entwicklern arbeitet eng zusammen. item.title: Database Administrator at Independer (Hilversum, Netherlands)
item.description:
Database Administrator
standplaats: Hilversum
hbo, 40 uur

Independer streeft ernaar de technologie voortdurend aan te passen aan de nieuwste ontwikkelingen. Er wordt daarbij veel aandacht besteed aan IT-kwaliteit en architectuur. Er wordt gewerkt volgens een agile development aanpak (scrum). Wij ontwikkelen in Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 en gebruiken Microsoft Team Foundation (TFS) voor het development proces. Onze databases zijn SQL 2014 en in het business intelligence domein gebruiken wij onder andere Business Objects voor analyses.

Wat ga je doen?
Als Database Administrator ben je medeverantwoordelijk voor het aanmaken en onderhouden van productiedatabases voor onze website, back-end systemen en marketingomgeving. Dit betekent dat je zorgt voor consistentie van modellen en code. Verder zorg je dat onze databases robuust zijn, een goede performance hebben en dat we een veilige omgeving hebben en houden. Je signaleert problemen en lost die op in overleg met de business, webdevelopers en onze IT-Services afdeling.

In ons applicatielandschap ondersteun je ontwikkelaars bij het maken van database modellen en review je door ontwikkelaars opgeleverde SQL code. Daarnaast maak en onderhoud je onze data-import en export processen.

Voor onze marketingomgeving bouw je de koppelingen met bronsystemen, onderhoud je de ETL-applicaties en ontsluiting naar Business Objects. Op deze manier help je onze Marketing en Business Intelligence afdelingen.

Je levert bijdragen aan het verder verhogen van de kwaliteit van onze data en het effectief inzetten van de beschikbare business intelligence capaciteit. Je werkt nauw samen met onze DBA en participeert in verschillende teams met business intelligence analisten, webdevelopers, de ketenbeheerders en/of webmasters.

Waar kom je terecht?
Independer is anders dan anderen, ook als werkgever. Werken bij Independer doe je dan ook voor je plezier! Wij zijn niet alleen de grootste financiële webshop en vergelijkingssite, maar ook nog één van de leukste werkgevers van Nederland.

Independers denken in mogelijkheden, durven fouten te maken, helpen elkaar en verbeteren onszelf steeds opnieuw. En dat alles in een open, ontspannen omgeving waar je niet in pak hoeft rond te lopen, je lunch verzorgd wordt en je zelf mag kiezen of je buiten of binnen je meeting houdt. Met een hecht, betrokken en gezellig team van ruim 250 Independers werken we hard met elkaar om Independer elke dag weer een beetje beter te maken.
 
Wat wij zoeken in onze nieuwe Database Administrator



  • Minimaal vijf jaar relevante werkervaring als databasespecialist (met SQL).

  • Je kunt query plans analyseren en vertalen naar acties.

  • Je schrijft complexe SQL code.

  • Je maakt CLR code binnen de database waar dit nodig is.

  • Minimaal twee jaar relevante werkervaring als ontwikkelaar (met C#) in een complexe omgeving.

  • Een hoog probleemoplossend vermogen.

  • Hbo werk- en denkniveau.

  • Goede kennis van .Net, C#, XML en ETL.

  • Nauwkeurig, resultaatgericht en oog voor kwaliteit.

  • In staat in processen te denken, de keten te overzien en bottlenecks te herkennen en op te lossen.



Wat krijg jij van ons?



  • Jezelf kunnen zijn

  • Vieren als er iets te vieren valt

  • Een open, informele en hechte cultuur

  • Gezellige borrels, feesten en Independer weekend

  • Vergaderen in de zon

  • Kok voor diner

  • Uitgebreide lunch met saladebar

  • Tafeltennistafel / flipperkast/ gameroom

  • Gezamenlijke sport- en funactiviteiten

  • Flexibiliteit in je werktijden

  • Premievrij pensioen

  • Relevante trainingen en opleidingen

  • 30 verlofdagen (bij een 40-urige werkweek)

  • Bonusregeling



Heb je nog vragen?
Neem gerust contact op met Floor van Dam, Recruiter Independer sinds 2013, telefoonnummer 035-6265505. Of kijk voor meer informatie op werkenbij.independer.nl.

Solliciteren bij Independer
Ben je enthousiast en wil je graag aan de slag als Database Administrator? Solliciteer dan nu via het online sollicitatieformulier op onze website.

 Acquisitie n.a.v. deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

item.title: Back-End/Python Developer at Bynder (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Who you are:


Bynder is looking to hire you, a Back-End Developer, who wants to help build the most advanced and easiest to use branding automation software in the industry. Our Development team is building a cloud-based SaaS product for marketeers to automate and streamline their workflow in today’s globalized business environment.


Our clients are some of the world’s largest brands, including Spotify, KLM, Nest, & Logitech to name but a few. We’re looking for someone who understands the challenges involved in creating a globally available, distributed system with four nines of reliability. We don’t take “no” for an answer and we stress the boundaries of what’s available.


We work with a microservice architecture, using multiple asynchronous systems and pushing the limits of both the technology and AWS to the limits to adapt our product to use state of the art technologies.


How we roll


We are hiring for this role in Amsterdam, where our rapidly growing team of developers are situated. The office is situated in the heart of the city.


Our development team is split into autonomous squads, each with responsibility for their own area of the product.


We have perks: each developer gets their own mac. We supply daily lunch at the office. We relax every day with beers, and we have ping-pong tables on hand for when you need a break.


You will join an international team: we have 20 nationalities between our 60 developers - and many more when you include our other offices in London, Boston, Dubai, and Barcelona. Bynder Amsterdam has cutting-edge innovations and free spirited lifestyle, where we bike to work and hang out at the canals.

item.title: Front End Developer - Elsevier.com at Elsevier (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a member of the Product Development team for the corporate website for Elsevier, you will have the opportunity to design and build solutions which will impact the Elsevier.com users. Elsevier.com has 1.2 million visitors a month.


You will be responsible for design, implementation, documentation and maintenance of various elements, participating in the full development lifecycle. You will collaborate with Elsevier software developers, based in the UK, as well as with external agencies, product managers and user experience specialists, forming a team to positively impact the customer experience for Elsevier.com.


The Elsevier.com team is an international team and primarily based in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. You will be reporting directly to the Senior Manager Elsevier.com.


Core Technologies



  • HTML

  • CSS

  • JavaScript


 Your responsibilities



  • Collaborate with the Product Management and User Experience Specialists: Work closely with product management and UX design to define and refine feature specifications



  • Participate in the full development lifecycle: Be involved in the design, estimations, development, testing and deployment of the products



  • Improve our software deployment process: Take part in improving our continuous integration, and helping us get to the next level of maturity with respect to Continuous Delivery

item.title: Java Software Developer at Elsevier (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
We are looking for an all-round Java Software Developer passionate about creating quality products and the best customer experience. We aim to solve large data analysis problems and to create the best tools for the research world.


As Elsevier is transforming from scientific research company to a Technology Solutions Provider, technology is driving the strategy. Our development strategy is agile and we work in small Scrum teams where you and your colleagues will build the next generation of products.


Interested? Please apply online or send your CV to technologycareers@elsevier.com.


Your responsibilities



  • Responsible for design, implementation, documentation and maintenance of various web products as well as deployment systems

  • Design and develop front-end interfaces, underlying APIs and backend systems

  • Work closely with product management and UX design to define and refine feature specifications

  • Be involved in the design, estimations, development, testing and deployment of the products

  • Ensure operational stability of our production systems, by actively monitoring and reacting to production issues

  • Take part in improving our continuous integration, and helping us get to the next level of maturity with respect to Continuous Delivery

  • Contribute to improving the quality of our existing services when comes to their stability and security

  • Propose new technologies and tools suitable to our infrastructure. Be able to explain the choices and to analyze the advantages of adopting them


The team


We are looking for candidates interested in working in an international dynamic environment where we deliver quality solutions. Are you interested to work on moving the entire infrastructure to the Amazon cloud?


As a member of the Research Management Product Development team, based in Amsterdam, you will design and build solutions which will impact the research community. To read more on our products, please visit: http://www.elsevier.com/research-intelligence.

item.title: Android Developer at Hubchat Community Oy (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
We're looking for an experienced Android developer with a good understanding of the user experience on Android devices. We’re building out our mobile apps so that people can take part in their Hubchat communities wherever they are. The team needs a great Android developer to help us on our mission. If you’re interested in doing big things with a growing, ambitious, and fun team then please get in touch.


Who are you?



  • You have a UX and user-centric mindset

  • You have a solid technical understanding of Android and Java, and if possible node.js as well

  • You have at least 3 years of experience in software development

  • You write clean and maintainable code

  • You’re fun to work with

  • You’re able to help our team improve their way of working

item.title: Software Developer (m/f) C#.Net at TeamViewer GmbH (Göppingen, Germany)
item.description:
Your Responsibilities



  • Develop services and applications for growing businesses in the areas of sales, marketing and finance based on the .NET framework and MS SQL

  • Responsible for the automation of work processes and supporting departments with efficient software solutions

  • Use cloud software solutions such as Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services to design enterprise-wide solutions

  • Responsible for further development of our marketing, sales or e-commerce systems, ensuring solutions are scalable and reliable


We Offer



  • Active participation on a successful product that is downloaded and used thousands of times every day all around the world

  • A pleasant and highly motivated team that is diverse, respectful and supportive

  • Attractive workplace with state-of-the-art equipment

  • Prosperous and steadily growing company

  • Be part of a fantastic team where you have freedom to be creative with your approach and the opportunity to deliver real results that have a big impact

  • Opportunity to use new technologies, current trends and developments in the areas of .NET and cloud technologies

item.title: Senior Front End Developer at 3D Issue LTD (Letterkenny, Ireland)
item.description:
We are an organically grown team with over 25 staff developing disruptive tools for the digital publishing / content marketing sectors. We're 10 years old but we still retain our start-up ethos.  We believe in working in small teams developing great products.


3D Issue has built a following of over 15,000 customers including the likes of eBay, Google, NASA and Mensa to name a few.  We have a dynamic, innovative, hard-working and fun team who are responsible for designing, developing and launching enterprise mobile apps for the digital publishing / content marketing markets. You will have the ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic work environment and must be willing to take direction and implement changes as and when required to do so.


Your responsibilities will include:



  • Participate in the architecture, design, development and launching of enterprise web applications.

  • Ensure that all technical requirements are identified, estimated, designed and implemented.

  • Work closely with the analysts, designers, testing and support teams to ensure all technical requirements for new projects are captured, designed and developed accordingly.

  • Write and perform unit and integration tests.

  • Collaborate with team members and other teams and integrate individual components into complex enterprise systems.

  • Work independently on assigned components and tasks.

  • Maintain existing web applications.

  • Identify and resolve any production issues.

  • Work in a fast paced environment and deliver production quality software within tight schedules.

  • Ensure any customer issues are resolved quickly by applying solutions to any identified problems.

item.title: Full Stack Ruby on Rails Developer at Nanameue Inc. (Minato, Japan)
item.description:
You will be a part of our growing web services team, report directly to our CTO and CEO and this is what you will be doing:



  • Develop API backend and Web Application using Ruby on Rails + (PostgreSQL and MySQL)

  • Build and develop frontend part from a designer finished Sketch or PSD file using HTML/CSS and ReactJS

  • Develop and maintain test specs using Rspec and related frontend tests

  • Support and debugging web applications as needed

  • Optimize and profiling web applications using NewRelic and related tools

  • Ignite and present a better solution to solve a problem to CTO/CEO

  • Having fun and share your knowledges and visions with Junior developers

item.title: Software Engineer Internship at IMC Financial Markets (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you someone who is passionate about challenging the status quo?
Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


If so, then join IMC as an Intern Software Engineer! At IMC, Software Engineers don’t just write software and design technology. They are responsible for spotting new opportunities, developing new technologies and solving problems. As a result, they deliver results and make a difference. IMC knows that having the best software is what drives our business.  Software development here is innovative, pragmatic and fun, even as complexity grows. 

As a Software Engineer Intern you will learn what it means to be an Engineer in a real world environment. The 12+ weeks internship program is focused on enhancing your knowledge of algorithm complexity, data structures and writing fluent code. Your responsibility does not stop at programming; it also encompasses knowledge building of our business model and building relationships across our trading and technology teams.

As a Software Engineer intern at IMC you will be supported by both a Mentor and an intern lead who will oversee your projects and professional development. You will have access to pair programming and code reviews, not to mention our incredible social activities and events. Some key points of our internship:



  • Meaningful and challenging projects

  • A structured mentoring program 

  • Housing in Amsterdam

  • Highly competitive salary

  • Possibility for a full time offer

item.title: Softwareentwickler, Software-Developer (m/w) Frontend (HTML/JavaScript/CSS/SQL at Keylane Deutschland GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
Die Entwicklung von Software für die dynamische Versicherungsbranche ist eine hoch komplexe An­ge­legen­heit. Als ein Unternehmen, welches sich diese Entwicklung zur Aufgabe macht, suchen wir Mitarbeiterinnen sowie Mitarbeiter, die auch über den Tellerrand schauen: Soft­ware­entwickler/-innen, die verstehen, dass alles miteinander verknüpft ist und die mehrere Schritte vorausdenken können.


Sie arbeiten in einem internationalen Team an verschiedenen Kundenprojekten, um unser Standard-Software-Paket um spezielle Features zu erweitern. Sie arbeiten daran, die Standardsoftware zu erweitern und entwickeln neue Anwendungen, von denen langfristig alle Projekte profitieren. Aber auch sorgfältige Planung und Koordination sind notwendige Komponenten Ihrer täglichen Arbeit.


Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Entwurf von technischen und logischen Programmstrukturen

  • Programmierung in Java, JSP und HTML/JavaScript/CSS

  • Entwurf und Einbindung von Datenbankabfragen mit Hilfe von SQL

  • Optimierung des Systems im Hinblick auf Leistung und Umfang

  • Optimierung der Datenbankfunktionalitäten

  • Einbindung von Modul- und Systemtests

  • Organisation von und Mitarbeit an der technischen Konzeption und Code-Überprüfungen

  • Implementierung von Anwendungen

  • Regelmäßige Treffen mit Ihrem Team, funktionalen Designern und Kunden

item.title: Release Manager at BMA (Houten, Netherlands)
item.description:
RELEASE MANAGER

Healthcare - Ervaren Professional

Als Release Manager ben je primair verantwoordelijk voor het release proces en de marktvoorbereiding van onze twee productlijnen. Met name het release management rondom de nieuwe productlijn dient nog verder te worden ingevuld en van de Release Manager wordt verwacht dat hij hier zelfstandig invulling aan kan geven.

Verdere taken en verantwoordelijkheden:



  • Naast de eigen taken als Release Manager, de dagelijkse aansturing van testen en markt voorbereiding (waaronder planning en bewaking van de workload);

  • Plannen, organiseren en bewaken van alle releasematig uitgevoerde activiteiten, alsmede het rapporteren daarover Daarnaast het strikt volgen van de QMS-procedures (ISO 13485) en de benodigde afstemming met de diverse afdelingen;

  • Plannen, coördineren en communiceren over releases en release momenten;

  • Inventariseren van functionele wensen uit de diverse markten en de coördinatie rondom deze wensen;

  • Invullen van de Product Owner rol voor de Mosos productlijn;

  • Beoordelen van de werkinspanning en vertaling naar concrete werkopdrachten voor alle betrokken medewerkers;

  • Advisering met betrekking tot het opdelen in logische werkpakketten voor Release Management;

  • Advisering met betrekking tot knelpunten en oplossingen aan de Delivery Manager

item.title: Senior Perl Developer at Textkernel (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
We are currently looking for an experienced Perl developer to join Textkernel’s Research & Development team. You will contribute to our machine learning framework and improve the models that power two of our main products: Extract! (CV parsing) and Jobfeed (job ad parsing).


Products you’ll be working on


Through our Extract! product we process millions of CVs and jobs every month – both as a SaaS solution and as an on-premise installation. It covers 17 languages and is engineered to deal with the diversity of candidate profiles and job ads. Jobfeed, our big data labor market tool, enables our clients from the HR and recruitment world to generate leads and develop their business.


Your responsibilities


You will drive the effort of improving our machine learning framework. On a daily basis you will work closely with our R&D engineers to develop new features, integrate new machine learning packages and improve our evaluation and testing tools. You will also collaborate with our DevOps team to improve the deployment and scalability of our parsing services. Being an Agile advocate you’ll take an active part in our code reviews, collaborate on design and implementation and work towards continuous integration and deployment. This is also a great opportunity to learn about complex machine learning and natural language processing systems.


Who you are



  • You have extensive knowledge of modern Perl, its module ecosystem and OOP

  • You can develop and maintain production level applications on both Linux and Windows

  • You have developed modern API endpoints

  • You have an interest in web development (e.g. Mojolicious, AngularJS ) and NoSQL database (e.g. MongoDB)

  • Good knowledge of algorithms and datastructures


What we offer



  • A fast growing, motivated, international team from over 24 nationalities

  • Good equipment

  • Free lunches, snacks and drinks – whatever you fancy, our kitchen has it all!

  • Friday demos with chilled drinks

  • Monthly chair massages

  • Easy access with public transportation and free onsite parking

  • Yearly week-long hackathon, meetups, trainings, reading groups, scientific conferences

  • Influence on our products


About us


We are a fast growing company developing cutting edge technologies based on NLP, AI, semantics and machine learning in a no-nonsense, informal and professional working environment.  Innovation is at the heart of what we do. We pride ourselves on providing recruitment and HR professionals around the world with solutions that radically improve and accelerate the connection between employers and candidates.


We are small enough to make you matter, but big enough to have a very recognisable impact on the market supported by solid infrastructure.


If you are like us, passionate about intelligent machines, advanced computing and R&D, we might have the right opportunity for you!

item.title: Android Developer at Love Agency (Sydney, Australia)
item.description:
As an Android developer at Love Agency, you will join one of the most progressive Android teams in Australia and we enjoy working with developers who take pride in their code.  We are a fast growing company but a close­knit group of passionate people. Our success over nearly a decade, has seen an increase in greenfield projects that target all types of devices including wearables. 


At Love Agency our native development teams are keen to develop and grow and enjoy sharing new discoveries with each other. Due to the rapid growth we have seen across the business we have gone and got ourselves a new cool, funky office just one minute walk from Wynyard station in Sydneys CBD.

item.title: Software Development Engineer (DevTools) at Capital One (Nottingham, UK)
item.description:
We’re proud to say that we’re up there amongst the UKs top 10 credit card providers. Since our beginning we’ve been a company built on bold, new ideas and entrepreneurial spirit. In an ever changing financial landscape we’re transforming to a technology company that happens to do credit, always on, and striving for the breakthroughs that will change banking for good. 
 
Changing banking for good is not an idle statement, it’s our core vision and applies to everything we do. For us, it’s a no brainer. A happy customer is a loyal customer. By bringing innovation, simplicity, and, most importantly, humanity to the financial services industry we will succeed in delivering this mission. 


We are transforming ourselves into a FinTech company. We have two development centres; Nottingham and London and in these we are delivering the next big things that will help our customers succeed.  


We’d like you to be part of it. 


An obsession for delivering quality products to our customers is at the heart of everything we do. We are a maturing agile organisation, our teams operate with a great deal of empowerment; collaborating with product owners, designers and stakeholders to deliver great software.       


We are just beginning our journey into the cloud and have problems of scale, security, availability and performance for you to help solve. We try to solve these using internal and external open-source solutions wherever possible. 


We love continuous learning and that’s why we give you 10% of your time to work on cutting edge innovative projects that shape the way we will work in the future. 


Additionally, Capital One has been voted the Best Workplace for the last 3 years. We’re also recognised for our work in treating customers fairly.  


You will excel in end to end software development and have breadth and technical depth in more than one area. Your strong design, analytical and problem solving skills will be crucial to our success.  


As well as technical skill, you’ll need the people skills to collaborate across the business – not to mention creativity and drive to make things happen. 


As a Software Development Engineer, you’ll work as part of a multidisciplinary team of engineers designing and delivering tooling to enable and empower agile feature teams to ship their code all the way to production quicker and with less friction. 


With strong engineering skills in any programming or scripting language and solid commercial experience delivering technical solutions, software or otherwise, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with product owners and designers on feature development.  


Experience working in and with Agile teams is a big plus, as is a good working knowledge of test driven development. 


Your passion for engineering means you’re always looking to gain experience with new platforms and technologies; we structure our work and our teams to ensure these opportunities are frequently on offer. You’re probably actively engaged with the technology community, have attended a hackathon or two and have a plenty of unfinished pet-projects.

item.title: Software Quality Engineer at Capital One (Nottingham, UK)
item.description:
We’re proud to say that we’re up there amongst the UK's top 10 credit card providers. Since our beginning we’ve been a company built on bold, new ideas and entrepreneurial spirit. In an ever changing financial landscape we’re transforming to a technology company that happens to do credit, always on, and striving for the breakthroughs that will change banking for good. 
 
Changing banking for good is not an idle statement, it’s our core vision and applies to everything we do. For us, it’s a no brainer. A happy customer is a loyal customer. By bringing innovation, simplicity, and, most importantly, humanity to the financial services industry we will succeed in delivering this mission. 


We are transforming ourselves into a FinTech company. We have two development centres; Nottingham and London and in these we are delivering the next big things that will help our customers succeed.  


We’d like you to be part of it. 


An obsession for delivering quality products to our customers is at the heart of everything we do. We are a maturing agile organisation, our teams operate with a great deal of empowerment; collaborating with product owners, designers and stakeholders to deliver great software. 


We are just beginning our journey into the cloud and have problems of scale, security, availability and performance for you to help solve. We try to solve these using internal and external open-source solutions wherever possible. 


We love continuous learning and that’s why we give you 10% of your time to work on cutting edge innovative projects that shape the way we will work in the future. 


Additionally, Capital One has been voted the Best Workplace for the last 3 years. We’re also recognised for our work in treating customer fairly.  


You will excel in end to end software development and have breadth and technical depth in more than one area. Your strong design, analytical and problem solving skills will be crucial to our success.  


As well as technical skill, you’ll need the people skills to collaborate across the business – not to mention creativity and drive to make things happen. 


As a Software Developer in Quality Engineering you will have a passion for delivering high quality systems. You will play a critically important role in our software engineering teams.You'll be a part the featuredeliveryplanning process and working directly with the developers in order to deliver innovative, best in class software for our customers.Your designs will include identifying user scenarios, establishing quality criteria and building test automation harnesses that will allow complex testing to be performed at a code, API and user interface level.You'll also conduct research on emerging technologies to analyse systems, decompose complicated software systems and design a strategies to test them, building advanced and automated test suites to exercise our ground breaking products.You will provide high quality reporting on product readiness and verify proper testing coverage and procedures both independently and collectively in a team environment. Our current toolbox includes Gherkin, Cucumber, Ruby, Calabash, Java and Selenium.

item.title: Speech Recognition Engineer at Babbel (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Who we are


With millions of regular users and more than 9000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms. We're on an exciting new journey to change the way people learn languages. Our diverse team is at the forefront of the user journey, supporting the marketing department to promote our product. Using innovative marketing technologies, iterative development methods, and empirical data, we work to continuously optimise our product and processes.


How we work


Our team is organized in full-stack features teams. That means that our teams do everything from concept, UX/UI to analytics and DB, and of course web development. We create our product in an agile manner, and have dynamic and a fast growing team. We are continuously trying to identify problems and optimizing our agile engineering and management practices.


Who are we looking for


We are looking for a Speech Recognition Integration Engineer to help bring Babbel’s speech recognition system to the next level. You will collaborate closely with ASR experts at Babbel as well as platform specialists in different teams.


What you will be doing



  • Investigate and improve shortcomings of current system

  • Implement prototypes using third party APIs

  • Own and drive end-to-end ASR user experience

  • Use tracking data to understand and improve system

  • Investigate next generation speech recognition setup

  • Develop testing and implementation plan

  • Drive implementation and further team setup

item.title: IT Security Specialist Luxembourg at Docler Holding (Luxembourg)
item.description:
What you will really be doing



  • Penetration testing our infrastructure

  • Review code written in common coding languages

  • Contribute to security related internal tools and open source software

  • Reviewing security settings

  • Recommend and support changes based on security related tests, audits or reports.

item.title: Software Image Sensor Engineer at Caeleste CVBA (Mechelen, Belgium)
item.description: As part of a team, you will contribute to the development and the production of new CMOS image sensors and technology through the development of software enabling the characterization and testing of image sensor devices and dedicated test structures.    You will concentrate on the interface between the computer and the test system : development of low level IO for test systems, feature support and maintenance of a compiler for a softcore processor, visualizing images, fast image reconstruction and real time calculations. You will be on a fast learning track with one of the best experts in the field. You will be part of the Caeleste system & test team under supervision of an experienced systems manager. You will become our software specialist and will have the opportunity to grow according to your capacities. We welcome experience, but are also willing to hire a promising engineer with a great potential.

item.title: Network and Linux System Administrator (m/f) at EMAKINA Central & Eastern Europe (Wien, Österreich)
item.description: We are currently looking for a Network and Linux System Administrator (m/f) full time for our headquarter in Vienna, Austria.

item.title: Engineering Manager - Mentor ambitious engineers, develop strategy & write code at Intercom (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Intercom is growing fast. We’ve created an environment where product teams, with big ambitions, can ship high quality product to our customers every week. Across a team of more than 60 engineers, we ship changes to production around 100 times each weekday. Our mission is to make web and mobile business personal. Come help us build a world changing product, a long lasting company and the most effective R&D team possible.


We’re particularly focused on building an organisation where people thrive, grow in their careers, and enjoy having high impact through their work. We’re looking for experienced engineering managers to help us grow our capabilities and capacity.


The Intercom platform comprises of several different and connected products. Each product is designed and developed — through invention and iteration — by a single team. As an engineering manager you’ll partner with a product manager to define a product vision, strategy and roadmap.


You’ll be expected to own your space: work with all disciplines on your team to build, launch and iterate. Talk directly with your customers, take part in usability studies, work with data analysts and researchers to ask the right questions and make good use of the answers.


This is an incredibly rare opportunity to join a company that’s still small but on its way to something much bigger, with a meaningful transformative mission. You’ll work directly with a product, design, and engineering team who’ve worked in places such as Amazon, Facebook, Google, Apple and Zendesk. And best of all, be early enough to hold a leadership position where you have a high impact role in our success over the coming years.


This role is based in our city centre office on St. Stephen’s Green, in Dublin, Ireland. Our entire R&D team is based here. You'll report directly to one of our directors of engineering.


What will I be doing?



  • Collaboratively set a product and technical direction with your team.

  • Support an ambitious group of engineers in their career goals. Work with our people ops team to maintain our high performance and high morale.

  • Be actively involved in hiring and growing our engineering team.

  • Care about agility as much you care for scalability and availability. Continuous deployment keeps us focused on incremental releases. Even our biggest technical achievements roll out piece by piece, feature flagged out of sight. Projects are kept short and tightly scoped. Teams build a weekly cadence of releases.

  • Drive, create and improve operational excellence, quality, security and privacy initiatives within your team and the entire engineering organization.

  • Help us evolve our culture.

item.title: PHP + Magento Developer at caseable GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Job description
You will help us to take our highly customized webshop to the next level and maximize our platform for traffic of hundreds of thousands of buyers. You will help to identify all the pain points of our webshop, come up with a solution that scales, implement it, integrate it into our e-commerce platform and see it take off. This is a great opportunity for a hard-working, team-oriented self-starter to make a substantial impact on our business growth. You will experience supportive team members and the freedom to use your technical expertise and initiative to achieve shared goals. This position requires strong organizational skills, multi-tasking, critical thinking and enthusiasm for achieving company and self-oriented goals.


This is a contract-to-hire position aimed at candidates interested in living in Berlin.


What we offer
We offer you the opportunity to be part of an international team who is not afraid of learning on a everyday basis. You will have the possibility to experiment with new technologies and the freedom to choose your own equipment and software (PC, Mac, etc) in a supportive environment where proposals for change and suggestions for improvements are encouraged. In additon, we can offer you flexible working hours, an informal working environment with flat hierarchy, and a competitive salary. You will also enjoy our BBQ’s and events together with the caseable team.

item.title: Front End Engineer - React / AngularJS - Global health platform at University of Oslo, DHIS 2 (Oslo, Norway) (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you interested in improving a platform used globally to improve health care for the underprivileged? Do you enjoy working directly with end-users and understand how your app is used? We are seeking a Front End Engineer who is passionate about building elegant, intuitive web apps.


DHIS 2 is a web-based, open source data platform used by governments, international development agencies and NGOs in more than 60 countries worldwide. The system is used to improve access and use of information within health, education, sanitation, nutrition, disaster relief and other domains. The platform has become a global standard within international development and has a huge impact on the way health systems are being managed.


At DHIS 2, we are changing the way developing countries and NGOs manage their health systems and programs through building a world class data platform. We are working among others with PEPFAR to combat HIV/AIDS in Africa, with Doctors without Borders to manage their field hospitals, with CDC to monitor disease outbreaks and with numerous ministries in developing countries to improve their health systems.


As part of our team you will specialize in building web apps using modern Javascript frameworks such as React and AngularJS. You will be designing and developing front end applications for the open source DHIS 2 platform. You will be part of the design process and have great influence on the end product. You will be developing apps for interactive data analytics and visualizations, complex UIs for system configuration and maintenance, data capture and validation. The role requires a passion and ability for finding innovative engineering solutions to complex problems.

Our platform is built API-first with an extensible app architecture. This means that you will be developing independent apps using the latest development frameworks and standards (React, es6) without being constrained by a legacy stack. You can find our source code on GitHub and see a typical web app here. More information on our web pages.


We offer highly competitive salary levels, flexible working hours and generous vacations. Our main office is located in Oslo, Norway. This position allows for remote working locations.


Responsibilities



  • Design efficient and reusable front-end systems that drive complex web applications

  • Collaborate with project managers, back-end developers and end users to deliver attractive, user-facing applications

  • Implement features and user interfaces for the DHIS 2 platform

item.title: Systems Administrator at Pepper Media Holding GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We offer an exciting opportunity for an experienced Systems Administrator to support and maintain the operations of our existing platforms. Come join Pepper.com and be part of a passionate team!


Pepper.com is an international partner network which is attentively different to other deal platforms - you won’t find lax offers, only the hottest deals by and for price-conscious users. Around the clock the community seeks and finds the best offers in fashion, electronics, traveling and much more. With 400 million page views, over 20 mln users and over 50,000 user submitted deals per month across communities in America, Europe and Asia, Pepper has quickly risen to be the largest community deal platform worldwide!


Your responsibilities would include:



  • You support and maintain the operations of existing projects using a modern toolkit (Puppet, Ansible)

  • You automate the setup of new projects using Puppet, such as server provisioning, monitoring, managing Jenkins servers, etc.

  • You manage and administer servers used by production applications reaching millions of users worldwide

  • You manage and administer servers used by the development team

  • You ensure that any automated process is documented, scalable, and easy to understand

  • You keep track of work completed through a ticketing system

  • You have a keen mind in reducing single-points-of-failure

  • You ensure the availability, security and performance of the platform, eliminating points of failure and bottlenecks


The qualities we are looking for are:



  • You have at least 4 years of relevant experience in Systems Administration

  • You have extensive experience with scripting languages, such as Ruby, Python, or Bash

  • You have proved experience with automated testing and refactoring (get-it-done +then make it better)

  • You are experienced with version control software (Git), you've worked with Linux (Redhat, CentOS)

  • You are familiar with continuous integration and delivery practices as well as publish/release software stacks (Gitlab / Jenkins)

  • Most of our servers will not be physically accessible, which is no new territory for you

  • You are commited to high-quality, easy to manage automation

  • You are an innovator with good ideas, strong problem solving abilities, and a results-oriented attitude; you're always open for improvement

  • You are a quick learner and meeting deadlines is not an empty phrase for you

  • Very good English language skills mandatory, German is a plus


Bonus points for knowing / using any of the following:



  • You're thrilled by the idea of orchestrating and dealing with projects with 25+ individual servers

  • You're familiar with infrastructure testing: You're able to determine a problem and know how to improve it

  • You're experienced with middleware management, sometimes you need something between a <=> b

  • You have a deep understanding of Linux systems, you know how the kernel works and how to better optimize for targeted workloads

  • You're experience with databases, Mysql + MongoDB + InfluxDB + ELK is a big plus

  • You have a command knowledge of (app-specific) monitoring and metrics systems (e.g. ScoutApp)

  • You're familiar with TCP/IP Networking, DNS and routing

  • You're familiar with centralised backup systems such as Bacula

  • You have basic programming skills in PHP - every now and then you'll want to troubleshoot code with a dev

  • You're familiar with MVC web application architecture


Some perks of working for Pepper.com are:



  • A great loft-like office on Torstraße (close to U-Rosenthaler Platz) in the heart of the Berlin start-up scene

  • Any tech equipment/gadgets you want

  • Monthly “Hack” days for learning new technologies and skills

  • We also offer a very competitive compensation package, as well as relocation assistance if required

  • Flexible working hours


Are you the person we are looking for? We're looking forward to receiving your application including a compelling motivation letter and a clearly arranged CV. Please apply here: https://pepper.bamboohr.co.uk/jobs/view.php?id=70&source=stackoverflow

item.title: Programmer - Digiata Product Team at Digiata (Cape Town, South Africa) (allows remote)
item.description:
Add new features to our financial service and integration related product offerings.


Work across the tech stack, from databases and middle-tier business logic, to user interfaces for web, desktop and mobile, as well as deployment tools.


Your Team


Product teams typically consist of a product owner, graphic and usability designers, and two to five programmers, with whom you will collaborate on a daily basis.


A Typical Work Day


Report progress and highlight challenges to your team in the daily stand-up.


Work on user stories in small chunks, reviewing code check-ins with team members.


Join the bi-weekly iteration meeting, which clarifies objectives and priorities.


Join a design meeting from time to time, to plot the way ahead.


Collaborate with your team members, who may be situated anywhere in the world, via shared desktop, voip and chat, as seamlessly as if you are situated together in an open plan.

item.title: Software Engineer - Back-End (m/f) at Foodpanda GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

Read for a new challenge? Up for building a service with top-notch technology and contributing to the migration to a highly scalable microservice-based platform? Then join our team at the foodpanda headquarter in Berlin!

We have built one of the world’s leading online food delivery services in the last four years and are looking now for a forward-thinking, experienced PHP Developer who is eager to create high quality applications.

At foodpanda we are working with PHP5/7, MySQL and Symfony 3.0 on AWS with Docker.

Sounds interesting to you? Well let´s talk then!

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer / Consultant @ Backbase Amsterdam at Backbase (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
The opportunity


The (Senior) Frontend Developer / Consultant is part of the Professional Services (PS) team. PS is a team of highly motivated specialists with the specific skills and experience required to make sure that the implementation of our product at our customer’s location goes ahead as smoothly as possible. The PS team also provides product training and implementation support services to all of our customers and partners. Every project has its own set of unique challenges that must be overcome, and PS team members must be able to think and react quickly to find a solution that works for everyone.


In this role, you are not only a skilled Frontend developer, but you also know how to talk about your trade with other stakeholders. 
Our PS consultants work closely with partners and customers all over the world. They have the professional and personal skills required to develop, teach, support, and lead teams towards successfully delivering our enterprise solution and achieving their goals.

item.title: Backend Developer who wants to improve healthcare with us! at FocusCura (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Do you want to improve healthcare? 


We have a great opportunity for a backend developer. Join us in developing our HomeMonitoring and VideoCare health apps to make sure everyone gets the best possible care. Anywhere, anytime, globally. 


As a backend developer at FocusCura you will be turning our apps into world class healthcare products. Your focus will be on developing scalable APIs, database, and data processing infrastructure for our health apps. And we leave it up to you to decide how much impact you will have. But know that showing initiative and taking responsibility will be highly appreciated. 


Your to-do list will look something like this 



  • Designing backend architecture and development of new RESTful JSON APIs, SQL and NoSQL databases, and data processing infrastructure.

  • Work on challenging topics such as streaming video or wearable sensor data.

  • Discussing the best strategies together with mobile devs, PO, Design, and Content in a scrum team

  • Ensure high test code coverage, documentation of interfaces, and neatly refactored code and architecture

  • Keeping track of relevant developments in the field, especially new backend technologies like Spark, Kafka, and Cassandra.

item.title: Senior Ruby Backend Engineer (m/f) for AppLift at AppLift (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The AppLift Engineering team works on a full-stack self-serve demand platform, which includes real-time bidding, social capabilities, as well as advanced campaign management functionalities. We help app developers to intelligently bid on advertising spaces in milliseconds. We run a multi-continent infrastructure that handles billions of requests a day, crunching huge amounts of data.


We are looking for passionate Ruby Backend Engineer who can work in a challenging and dynamic environment. Have a look at our technology section: http://www.applift.com/technology and our tech blog: http://techblog.applift.com/.



Your Responsibilities:



  • You build and maintain different products that are used by internal and external stakeholders

  • You build and maintain our APIs, infrastructures and data pipeline

  • You work on Backend elements on all of our products, making them perform better and more user friendly

  • You are proactive and pay attention to the scalability, performance, availability and usability of our systems

  • You work closely with product, design and implement solutions based on requirements

  • You write clean code, automate and continuously deploy it

  • You rapidly diagnose and resolve production issues

  • You work on AWS, Mesos and other cloud based solutions

  • You research, and are happy to learn new technologies that will improve our products and development flow


What do we offer:



  • A fun, talented, international and experienced team of engineers

  • Freedom to design and use the latest technologies where relevant (“Best tool for the job” approach)

  • A team culture that supports contributing back to the Open Source community

  • We provide a framework that will help you to constantly improve your coding skills through e-learning, on-the-job training, mentoring, and coaching sessions

  • You can choose your own equipment and the best tools to get the job done

  • Stay on top of current industry trends and join tech conferences to present your work, and meet-ups all around the globe

  • The opportunity to get out of the day-to-day work routine to join AppLift Labs in San Francisco to shape new product initiatives with colleagues from all AppLift offices

  • Enjoy a competitive salary package and benefit from a tailored career development path


Interested? - Submit your CV or LinkedIn profile along with your GitHub Account online.

item.title: Linux Build and Release Engineer (m/f) (107488) at BMW Group (Ulm, Deutschland)
item.description:
NEW SOLUTIONS EMERGE WHEN THINKING ISN’T HARD-WIRED.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.


More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly new solutions. Naturally, that includes flexible working models, so that our IT specialists are free to go in unconventional directions. We want to keep pushing the limits of what's possible, so our team in Ulm is currently seeking a:


Linux Build and Release Engineer (m/f)
Job reference: 107488


BMW Car IT GmbH lives and breathes software. As a fully owned subsidiary of BMW AG we are a cornerstone in the company"s transition into the next 100 years where software plays a crucial role. One of our many areas of activity is the development of Linux-based infotainment head unit systems: a hyper-connected multimedia information and entertainment hub in the car. As a Linux Build and Release Engineer (m/f) you will enable developer teams to build, test, release and integrate their code into a Linux distro running on an embedded device. You will build and package individual software components with cross toolchains and standard Linux tools. Your range of tasks will be rounded off by your desire to automate everything and your scripting fu skills within the context of a comprehensive continuous integration environment.

item.title: Backend developer with AdTech experience at Pocket Media (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Our Tech Team, located in a centric office in Amsterdam is looking for a full-time Senior Back-end Developer to evolve our Ad Serving platform.


As a Senior Back-end Developer you will be in charge of evolving and developing our current Ad Serving platform, to make it stable, fully featured, and outstanding in the market. We have algorithms to pick the best offers for particular users, specially ads that deliver value for everyone involved in the process (users enjoying free apps and websites, advertisers looking for new users, and publishers looking to monetize their work).


We believe that ads should deliver value - and for that's it's crucial selecting the best offer for the right person. In order to achieve it we track the user's countries, preferences, likes and dislikes, and trends in the offers inventory.


We want you to bring us knowledge about the advertising industry; good coding skills to write clean reliable code, and take ownership of the features that will allow us to evolve our product. As the team grows you will coach the new team members in the features, coding style, and how to achieve their goals and improve their skills.


The current codebase is written in PHP and deployed in AWS, where we use intensively EC2, RDS and DynamoDB. We are open to using other technologies, and we want to take our stack to the next level with your expertise and experience. We know we will need to get deeper into interesting stuff, such as machine learning, real time reporting, real time event processing, consider other backend languages for our microservices platform... and who knows what else? 


Join us and help us shape the future of advertising!

item.title: iOS Developer (Berlin) at Futurice (Berlin, Germany)

item.title: Head of Engineering (f/m) at Delivery Hero (Berlin, Germany)

item.title: Data Engineer at GetYourGuide (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Technology to change the way travelers find and book things to do and explore their destination.


We're building a team focused on data products and data infrastructure to tackle impactful problems such as search, recommendations, categorization, analytics and more. Our work involves the development of systems and tools to collect, process, analyze and make GetYourGuide's data available. It also involves the design and development of features and algorithms to improve the relevancy of our product. You will be part of a team of passionate data people and solve these problems! The team will span many disciplines such as big data, search relevance or distributed systems, making it a great place to learn and experiment new skills.


GetYourGuide is the world's largest marketplace for tour and activities with more than 30 000+ things to do in a destination. There's an immense potential in making the travelling experience better with the help of data and algorithms and we're looking to you for help!

item.title: Full stack web developer at kaliber5 (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Interactive communication solutions of a different caliber - that is what we strive to achieve together with you. For clients like the ERGO Insurance Group, the Douglas Holding or renowned athletes like Mario Götze, Toni Kroos or Marco Reus we design and implement interactive websites, web-based software solutions and online product configurators.


You will



  • design and implement exciting state of the art web applications 

  • develop in an agile and test driven way, to always create high quality and beautiful code (TDD/BDD, code reviews) 

  • work with modern development tools (Git, Jira, Bamboo, Gulp, Less etc.), frameworks (Symfony, Ember.js, etc.) and processes (Scrum) 

  • continuously learn new things, through internal workshops, Meetups, conferences or open source projects 


You have



  • a lot of experience with object oriented PHP and MySQL 

  • profound knowledge of Symfony2, and, ideally, some experience with node.js 

  • professional knowledge of modern frontend technologies like HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript, ideally with Frameworks like Ember.js, Angular or React 

  • routine in working with common development tools (Git, Gulp or Less/Sass) and automated software tests (PHPUnit, Behat, QUnit/Mocha etc.) 

  • a passion for clean and beautiful code 

  • positive human qualities such as team spirit, reliability, quality awareness and responsibility 

  • motivation and curiosity, which help to compensate for any remaining gaps in the aforementioned requirements 


You should



  • look for a corporate culture, that accepts you as you are, that gives you the freedom and flexibility to reconcile work and private life, that values performance and quality more than work hours and mere presence 

  • have a strong desire to continuously improve, learn new things and share your learnings with others 

  • enjoy working in small cross functional teams 

  • attach no importance on sophisticated job titles and long meetings, but instead enjoy to haven written some cool piece of working software at the end of the day 

  • do what you do with passion, because only then it can be really great! 



Something missing?



  • fair salaries and vacation policies 

  • modern equipment: 2 x 27" display, Mac or Linux 

  • flexible working hours, remote work possible 

  • drinks and fresh fruits for free


You can find more information about our values, goals, technologies and how it is to work with us at www.kaliber5.de or on our Stackoverflow profile.

item.title: Test Engineer, E-commerce at BESTSELLER E-commerce (Amsterdam, Netherlands)

item.title: Data Scientist at Brown University (Providence, RI)
item.description:
Brown University, Computing and Information Services seeks qualified applicants for the position of Data Scientist.


The Data Scientist will join CIS' Data Science Practice, a central team of data experts who support a range of data-intensive projects across the university. The Data Scientist's primary role will be to collaborate with top researchers in economics at the Rhode Island Innovative Policy Lab (RIIPL) to design, maintain, and optimize secure database infrastructure that integrates sensitive data from various state agencies, and to develop predictive models that inform smart policy.


This is a 2 year fixed-term staff position, with the possibility of promotion to a permanent staff position contingent upon available funding.
