item.title: Junior Bug Detective - QA in a New Way at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Our Quality Assurance team ensures that our website can continue to evolve while maintaining reliability and quality and makes sure that new features are in the best possible shape before they go live. Now we are looking for a detail-focused individual who can assist us in speeding up our testing speed without compromising our high standards. Working as part of a multidisciplinary Scrum team, you will test new features to guarantee that they are functioning correctly and that they integrate problem free into our existing products. You will get the chance to learn how to properly create and develop automated tests as you collaborate with our Software Engineering team. You will identify bugs using automated, exploratory and regression testing, as well as by performing data analysis using business intelligence tools. You will be responsible for making sure that your area is great shape, allowing features to be smoothly and punctually released. In some cases, when unforeseen problems arise, delays will be inevitable, so it is essential that you inform all relevant stakeholders of potential roadblocks so that overly optimistic expectations don’t lead to disappointment.

item.title: Hadoop / Big Data Specialist Hive / Oozie / Impala at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

We like to move fast and work on a large scale. We’re looking for a Hadoop Hero who has experience building Hadoop clusters from scratch to keep our cluster in perfect shape and save us from getting crushed under the weight of big data. You will maintain and develop our Cloudera Hadoop cluster, set up a backup cluster and keep them in sync. You will also consult with our Business Intelligence team regarding the setting up and maintenance of reliable data pipelines. With your hawk-like vision, you’ll monitor our Cloudera CDH installation, fine tuning it to maximize performance. Lightning-quick reflexes and agility will also be required as you may get caught in Nerf gun wars that rage across the office.

item.title: Splunk Architect in VA - 6+ months! at Infraspace (Saint Paul, MN)
item.description:
Infraspace is working with a government agency in the DC area and we are looking for a Splunk Architect for a contract that will last for 6 months, with the possibility of extension. Infraspace is a subcontractor on this project - you would be working thru us and be working onsite with the client. 


This hire may be able to work remotely after a few months on-site. 


$70 - 77/hr. 


Infraspace is a Splunk Certified Partner - one of a select few in the Midwest. We offer cutting edge technology projects not only in Splunk but in Big Data, DevOps, and Performance Engineering. We offer corp-to-corp as well as W2 arrangements. We are flexible!  


Here's what we did for a local Fortune 50 Retailer recently:  


Challenge: Improve Target.com performance to support Limited Time Offering and Black Friday peak loads


Solution:



  • Designed Work Load Model for peak performance,

  • Tested the solution utilizing SOASTA load testing tools

  • Gathered metrics utilizing Splunk from application and infrastructure and optimized for peak load


Outcome/Impact:



  • Infrastructure footprint reduced by 40% and distributed across 4 data centers

  • Improved processing throughput from 30K orders/day to 100K orders/day


Back to the JD for this position: 


Key Job Functions:



  • Architecting and deploying Splunk Enterprise implementations in small to medium sized customers.
    • Administering Splunk and Splunk App for Enterprise Security (ES) log management.
    • Integrating Splunk with a wide variety of legacy data sources that use various protocols.
    • Consulting with customers to customize and configure Splunk in order to meet their requirements.
    • Perform implementation of security and compliance-based use cases based on the NIST 800-53 Rev4 security controls.
    • Technical writing/creation of formal documentation such as reports, training material, slide decks, and architecture diagrams.

item.title: Team Lead Operations (DevOps) (m/f) at InterNations (Munich, Germany)
item.description:
About the Role


Our Operations Team is responsible for both the external, customer-oriented systems as well as for the internal IT infrastructure. As the Team Lead for Operations at InterNations your role will encompass leading the Operations Team and organizing its workflows and processes.


As the Team Lead of Operations at InterNations, you will:



  • play a large role in shaping the system architecture and ensure the high stability and scalability of our internal and customer-oriented systems

  • be responsible for the monitoring and operation of our infrastructure, systems, and services (incl. Nginx, MySQL, PHP, RabbitMQ, Solr)

  • guarantee the smooth operation of our internal IT together with your Help Desk Team

  • gladly pass along your know-how and experience to your team and act as a liaison between your team and other departments


You meet the following requirements:



  • a degree in IT or other relevant technical training with at least 5 years of work experience

  • experience with Linux (Debian) and MySQL administration

  • knowledge of the automation of deployments (CI/CD) and configuration management (e.g. Ansible/Puppet/Chef)

  • experience with networks, firewalls, web server administration, virtualization, load balancing, monitoring, high availability solutions and scripting (e.g. bash, PHP, Ruby)

  • ability to work under pressure, pragmatic, communicative, and have experience leading a team

  • very good German and English skills


We offer:



  • a fast-growing, dynamic company with international scope

  • a friendly work atmosphere and the space you need to pursue your own ideas

  • weekly team breakfasts, fresh fruit & regular team events

  • a central location in a wonderful cosmopolitan city with beautiful natural surroundings


Are you the right one for the job?


Then send us your application today (CV, cover letter, start date, salary expectation) c/o Lars Strojny to:


jobs@internations.org

item.title: Experienced back-end PHP developer at start-up in Amsterdam at Scribbr (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Students and editors generate 50,000 page views a day on the back-end. You will work with the development team to make the entire back-end process more efficient and release new features every two weeks.








The vacancy


SCRiBBR is an online thesis editing platform with 350 affiliated freelance editors.


We help thousands of students every year and our server processes thousands of page views each day.


The best ideas come from the problems that students and our own editors encounter. The SCRiBBR philosophy is to solve problems together, and you’ll be involved in every process – from the design and concept phase straight through to the realization of a solution. No two weeks are ever the same! 




What we are looking for


Ideally you are a PHP back-end developer with at least four years of experience. Experience working with Symfony is a plus. 






What will you actually be doing?



  • You’ll navigate through the Symfony database on a daily basis, to ensure you perfectly understand the functioning of the framework. You’ll explain to a junior developer from the team why the choice of a specific design pattern is so important within our application.

  • You’ll create a use-case for a technical design and coordinate with the rest of the team concerning who will implement different features.

  • As you get to of point of being able to navigate the application blindfolded, you’ll be in a position to start developing new features. You’ll develop new services with our back-end application and ensure that the functionalities are covered by test cases.

  • New ideas for the application are always on the back burner. You’ll propose moving features from the backlog forward to the current milestone, as another developer working on the same component is developing a related feature.

  • You’ll enter deprecations into the current code base through semantic versioning, which will ensure that the major release schedules for later in the year stays on track.

  • When the Symfony component you have used to implement a feature could also use improvement, you’ll put the LTS version on the Github PR and ask the core Symfony team to review it.








Who will you be working with?


The SCRiBBR team is young, international, and dynamic. We all work together to ensure that students are fully satisfied with our services.


You’ll be part of a three-person development team. 








What does a typical day look like?



  • 09:00 – Before your dev-machine even boots, you stepped into the elevator and send a packet from your phone so the coffee maker starts brewing your chai latte. Once you settle in, you start reading the Slack Git history and begin checking out things that are still challenging your colleagues from the night before.

  • 11:00 – Our Spanish growth hacker is at your desk, because her experiment has led to a critical bug. One of the co-founders chimes in that a hotfix release will need to be issued.

  • 12:30 – The bug has been solved with the unrolling of a live update, so you head out for lunch with friends from other start-ups at the TQ tech space.

  • 13:15 – Time to develop a use-case for optimizing the company’s financial processes in relation to an upcoming milestone. A change in priorities means this feature needs to tackled now.

  • 16:00 – Implementation is complete, so you meet with co-founder Bas to discuss the functional operation and get some feedback. The feature’s translation-release cycle needs some attention to ensure it can be rolled out in 11 languages.

  • Around 18:00 – It’s time to get on your bike to go home… or perhaps you decide to join your colleagues for dinner at the office?!


Some of the things we have achieved in the last three months alone



  • We won the Best Entrepreneurial Student Initiative and is nominated for the Deloitte Rising Star 2016.

  • We went online in Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Finland. Even more students now know where to find us!

  • We began collaborating with French, Italian, and Spanish editors and now offer editing in these languages, too.

  • We set a new company record of 20,000 unique website visitors per day.

  • We moved from Tilburg to Amsterdam in order to grow faster. We are now located on the Singel canal (at TQ).

  • The team has expanded quite significantly, and our new office has already proven to be too small. Starting 17 October, we’ll have 18 workstations. :-)

item.title: (Senior) Software Engineer in Test/Automation Engineer (C++, Python, CI) at HERE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a full-stack software engineer to extend our top class E2E map delivery system that serves the most relevant maps to our customers. Are you up for this challenge? Keep reading!


Map Data Delivery team aims to provide HERE customers the most relevant and the most up-to-date maps. The team builds and operates an elaborate system to process, deliver and cater map data over a massive scale to millions of client devices. To accelerate the pace of feeding the data needs of our ever growing customer base, we are continuously improving our system with new concepts, technologies and ways-of-working. We are looking out for people who are passionate about building complex end-to-end systems at our office in Berlin. As a Senior Software Engineer in Test in Map Data Delivery team, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality of our cross-platform data management solution for clients like cars, mobiles and other smart devices.   As a HERE employee, you get



  • An opportunity to work in a world class environment that is fierce on innovation but also encourages a healthy work-life balance

  • Be a part of high energy, motivated team that creates innovative products while still not missing out on fun

  • Be part of a map story that helps millions of users everyday find their way

  • An opportunity to shape the way people commute or travel in the future

  • An opportunity to learn new technologies and bring them onboard to make better products

  • To work with industry-recognized domain experts

  • A chance to be a part of product story that you will be proud of


As a Sr. Engineer in Test, you will be responsible for



  • Driving automated E2E quality setup for map updates – starting from backends to customer specific client environments

  • Building a scalable test framework for testing massive quantities of map update data against a variety of client deployments

  • Understanding customer requirements and translating them into automated test cases

  • Learning and deploying most up-to-date test/automation tools and techniques for improving product quality

  • Collaborating with different teams to share, learn and align test/automation processes

  • Coaching the team on effective use of test framework and methodologies to enhance product quality

item.title: Software Engineer - Core Hotel Data at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

trivago is looking for Software Engineers who are passionate about their craft, versatile and ambitious to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward!
We offer an international, results-driven, fun and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, trivago should be your first choice!

Our engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users search for their ideal hotel at the best rate. Our ambitions reach far beyond just searching for hotels. Our product needs to handle information at the scale of the web. We’re looking for ideas from a lot of different areas of computer science, including information retrieval, data processing, data storage, distributed computing, large-scale system design and many more; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a Software Engineer, you work on a small team and on many different projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves.
You will be a leader in the design, implementation and ownership of major modules and sub-systems. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, maintain and enhance software solutions.

  • Work closely together with members/stakeholders from other teams (BI, Product, etc.).

item.title: Mobile Experience Developer at Mendix (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
At Mendix, we practice what we preach. We develop our feedback and collaboration platform using the Mendix Modeler. The modeler is part of an extensive technology stack that combines the best of breed tools to create and shape a great user experience for our customers.


We enjoy working on a range of applications throughout their lifecycle, from initial design to maintaining and improving them while in production. We believe that if you build it, you should run it. We’re persistent and we like to get to the bottom of things.



For our next team member, these are the things we're looking for:



  • A fan of agile, if not an evangelist

  • Someone who likes to share ideas (and who can communicate them in English)

  • An innate urge to improve the status quo, whether it's product or process

There are many reasons why we like to be part of Mendix in general, but some stand out:

item.title: R-developer at Delta Lloyd (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Over de functie
Als R developer bij Delta Lloyd ben je cruciaal in het professionaliseren van de door onze Quants ontwikkelde modellen. Als R developer ben je deskundig op minimaal R en Shiny en wenselijk ook op data loading. Daarnaast kan je R-toepassingen, gemaakt door de community, hergebruiken en kan je deze plaatsen in een eigen repository en hierover onze quants adviseren. Tot slot houdt je versiebeheer in de gaten en treed je op als vraagbaak voor de Quants. De rol is nieuw binnen de afdeling, wat inhoudt dat het professionaliseren en standaardiseren van werken met R onder jouw verantwoording komt te liggen. Dit zal met name kennisdeling zijn; het organiseren van bijeenkomsten voor zowel key users als management over de mogelijkheden die R als ontwikkeltaal en software omgeving biedt. Ook speel je een belangrijke rol in standaardisering, e.g. gebruik van scrum methode, en bouw je een nauwe samenwerking met collega’s die technisch, applicatie en functioneel beheer taken binnen de afdeling vervullen.

Wij bieden



  • Een uitdagende functie in een ambitieus team van 30 FTE’s

  • Veel verantwoordelijkheid en ruimte voor nieuwe initiatieven

  • Aantrekkelijk salaris en een 13e maand

  • Een moderne en flexibele pensioenregeling

  • Uitgebreide ontwikkel- doorgroeimogelijkheden

  • Interessante kortingen op verzekeringen en hypotheken

  • Gratis gebruik van moderne sportfaciliteiten op kantoor



Delta Lloyd biedt een uitgebreid pakket aan primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden. We investeren veel in onze medewerkers in de vorm van opleidingen en cursussen. Je krijgt van ons alle gelegenheid om te groeien door onze ruime loopbaan- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden. Verdere toekomstige doorgroeimogelijkheden wordt geboden naar specialistische- en leidinggevende functies binnen Delta Lloyd Groep.

Wij vragen



  • WO opleiding, Statistiek, Wiskunde of een andere vergelijkbare studie

  • Ervaring in het gebruik van R, data extractie en reporting

  • Ervaring met Scrum/Agile, en het vermogen om anderen mee te nemen in de methode en toepassing ervan

  • Je bent een echte team player met een proactieve houding naar nieuwe kennis, collega’s en gebruikers van de applicaties

  • Je hebt een doelgerichte houding en hands-on mentaliteit

  • Je beschikt over overtuigende communicatieve vaardigheden (zowel mondelinge als schriftelijke) en bent in staat om met helder taalgebruik de gebruikers mee te nemen in de materie



Interesse?
Herken je jezelf in bovenstaand profiel? Ben je toe aan een nieuwe uitdaging? Upload dan je cv en motivatiebrief via de 'Solliciteer' button. Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met: Kim Buunk via kim_buunk@deltalloyd.nl.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Trefwoorden: Vacature, Fulltime, Amsterdam, R Ontwikkelaar, IT.

item.title: Service Specialist Software (f/m) at COBI.bike GmbH (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wir bei COBI suchen Verstärkung für unser Customer Support Team. Der Service Specialist Software (m/w) ist dabei kompetenter und konstruktiver Ansprechpartner für alle Kundenanfragen rund um den Bereich Software. Hierbei sollte die Zufriedenheit unserer Kunden immer im Vordergrund stehen.


COBI revolutioniert das Radfahrerlebnis indem es dein Smartphone mit deinem Rad verbindet - alles ist über eine Lenker-Fernbedienung über eine elegante und spielerische Benutzeroberfläche auf dem Smartphone steuerbar. Das international ausgezeichnete System integriert eine Vielzahl wesentlicher Fahrrad-Basisfunktionen und stattet Fahrräder und moderne eBikes mit intelligenten Assistenzfunktionen aus. Das Ergebnis: mehr Sicherheit, mehr Komfort und mehr Spaß auf Radwegen aller Art. Mit COBI hat die Zukunft fahrradbasierter Mobilität bereits begonnen. Ganz egal wohin Deine Route führt - mit COBI fährst Du voraus.


Die COBI GmbH – mit Sitz in Frankfurt (HQ) und San Francisco – ist kein Fahrradhersteller, sondern ein High-Tech-Unternehmen in der Fahrradbranche. Herausragendes Design ist unsere Kernkompetenz. Bei uns steht der Nutzer und weniger die Technologie im Mittelpunkt. Bei der Qualität gehen wir keine Kompromisse ein und in der Entwicklung unsere Software und Hardware setzen wir auf modernste Technologien. item.title: Principal iOS Engineer at Babbel (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a Principal iOS Engineer (full-time) to join our office in Berlin, Germany.


Who we are


With millions of regular users and more than 9000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms. We're on an exciting new journey to change the way people learn languages. Our diverse team is at the forefront of the user journey, supporting the marketing department to promote our product. Using innovative marketing technologies, iterative development methods, and empirical data, we work to continuously optimise our product and processes.


How we work


Our team is organized in full-stack features teams. That means that our teams do everything from concept, UX/UI to analytics and DB, and of course web development. We create our product in an agile manner, and have dynamic and a fast growing team. We are continuously trying to identify problems and optimizing our agile engineering and management practices.


Who are we looking for


As an Principal iOS Engineer you will work closely with our iOS developers who work in feature teams.


You will support the iOS engineers in architectural decisions, giving guidance in establishing good patterns and coding guidelines.


While you will work outside the teams you will be in close contact with them, supporting the iOS developers on actual user stories on a regular basis, but also implement technical stories individually.


You will oversee pull requests coming from the teams and ensure that the overall iOS code base is kept in a tested and maintainable state following the principles of clean code.


Your responsibilities also include staying on top of newest development in the iOS community. This includes evaluating new trends, new APIs, useful libraries and frameworks with regards to their contribution to the code-base and the product.


You are self-driven and capable of self-organising, balancing individual work with work in teams and with other stakeholders where you show a great skill in not only creating value, but also alignment on ongoing topics.


As a Technical contact person your knowledge will not be limited to the iOS platform, but you will have a good technical overview and understanding of the product architecture and infrastructure.

item.title: Unity Software Architect at MovieStarPlanet (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Would you like the opportunity to shape the architectural vision of one of the biggest social networks for kids in the world?


At MovieStarPlanet we are building a new platform that will enable the future development of our social network and games.


As our Architect, you will get the opportunity to work with a passionate team of brilliant developers and use your vast experience of Unity to guide them in building a scalable and maintainable Agile platform.


About The Job


Enabling Creativity


The core of our Social Network is friendship, fun and creativity.  All our games have highly customizable avatars, playful and creative user generated content as well as friendships, chat and other social features. We also strive to make our games the safest social network on the planet.


Our new platform encapsulates all of these aspects, and then leaves the rest to the imagination. Our goal is to allow our feature teams to take the platform and build any new game that fits our network, without having to worry about compatibility to the core network.
In short, you will be enabling the creativity of our game teams, who in turn enable the creativity of millions of kids worldwide.


As the Software Architect you will be responsible for the iterative development of the platform architecture and the overall big picture.


Although your main role will be communicating the technical vision, you will start out with being slightly more hands on, iterating on the initial concept together with a very small team. 


With time, and as the team grows, you will help your peers master the Agile Engineering balance, while utilizing the strengths of each to the fullest. This will give you an opportunity to grow, both as an architect and as a mentor and leader, and we will offer you training and support as the role develops.


As Software Architect you will report to the Lead Programmer.

item.description:
Paul Hendrix, VP Research & Development:


“As a Sr. Front End developer in our software team you are responsible for the development of the user-facing functionality. I need someone who can guide us through a process. We’re on a journey to build something new, something exciting. New technology, new functionality resulting in a software package that could be considered disruptive. And we’re facing challenges in realizing this, mostly because we’re figuring out the best way to accomplish our journey. However, we have a great team with smart guys working for us, we have the whole organization backing us and we are confident enough to say we will make this new software a success! I am looking for some-one who has a broad experience as a developer, working with UI5 and can help us in the decisions that need to be made and decide the way forward for our architecture.”

item.title: Product Owner - Mobile Payments at Payconiq (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Payconiq Job profile


Payconiq is a technology-based startup for mobile payments. Paying, buying and selling sound like simple things and they should be. Somewhere along the way, they got complicated. We‘ve been rethinking payments ever since and this has resulted in Payconiq.


Our company has a market unique market position, a deep management team and is backed by strong shareholders. And we're only just getting started. We are rapidly expanding in Europe. This offers challenging new opportunities for leading-edge professionals and highly talented young professionals.


Job description


In order to strengthen the Amsterdam team and prepare for expansion of both the product and geographies, we are looking for an ambitious and forward thinking Product Owner.


The Product Owner is responsible for tackling market problems and act on requirements in business context driving the most effective/efficient set of initiative in collaboration with the rest of the Scrum team. He/She is a true natural leader, taking proactive ownership to translate qualitative and quantitative data points into digestible outcome-oriented initiatives that inspire the Scrum Team to design and iterate best-in-class solutions that generate revenue, adoption and time efficiencies. The Product Owner reports into the CEO.


Your primary tasks/deliverables will be:


Product Owner:



  • Lead business and technical analysis sessions to support new development efforts to meet current and projected business needs

  • Drive the implementation of technology and process solutions from concept to completion

  • Learn new industries quickly, map current business processes to new systems or services

  • Create user stories, user acceptance criteria, epics, process maps, data mapping and formal requirements documentation

  • Provide business analysis and support throughout the product development lifecycle

  • Align stakeholders’ business and system requirements to overall client strategy

  • Managing a team to make sure the delivered product matches or exceeds expectations

  • Work collaboratively with the Head of IT to develop effective team approaches and techniques, creating the necessary approach, framework, controls and analysis practices across project delivery


Project planning:



  • Work with the sales and operations team to fully define scope of work, including resource requirements, timelines, cost estimates and constraints and deliver information in the form of presentations to clients

  • Development of release plan(s) and sprint plans in project management tool

  • Identify new sales opportunities within existing accounts


Project execution:



  • Ensure on-time project risk management, proactively manage issues with scheduling, team or clients and flag accordingly to stakeholders

  • Ensure appropriate tests are completed throughout development


Requirements:



  • Masters degree, diploma or equivalent

  • 3-5 years of product ownership experience and development as well as delivery of product strategy and roadmap

  • Working business analysis experience using modelling and documentation techniques such as User Stories, Use Cases and Process Maps

  • Extensive knowledge of business processes, strategic planning, IT resources and enabling technologies

  • Passion for agile, iterative development and keen in learning, calibrating processes

  • Working knowledge of the software development lifecycle and release/change management

  • Self-starter and proactive by nature

  • Natural sense of ownership and leadership

  • Strong negotiation skills

  • Fluency in spoken English and excellent writing skills


Payconiq is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium and has its international headquarters located in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. This job is based in Amsterdam. More info can be found here: www.payconiq.com.


More info: Rob van Elburg- Global IT Recruiter  - Rob.van.elburg@ing.nl

item.title: Senior UX Designer (m/f) at intive-Kupferwerk GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your Profile


Your role will be to create and design a user experience that will


deliver digital customer products against the common product vision.



As a UX Designer, you will be working closely with the Product Owner


and engineers in a cross-functional team working in an agile manner.


Together with the Product Owner you will specify the product vision


and objectives (e.g. optimized conversion rate or customer experience)


that measure the success of your solution.



You will work in a highly iterative way directly with the engineers to


allow a high-paced and iterative development and delivery process. As


such you need to be comfortable with designing for early MVPs with a


large amount of ambiguity. In this process you will be subsequently


iterating over live designs with input from qualitative and quantitative


data and analytics from real life user testing.


Responsibility



  • Design and deliver product visualization as part of a cross-functional agile product teams based on input from the Product Owner

  • Explore solution space and refine concepts going from early wireframes to high definition designs

  • Build prototypes to help validate and communicate designs

  • Identify and conduct user interface experiments in collaboration with the Product Owner – and conduct analytics based on data from real life experimentation

  • Help Product Leads and Product Owners define both long and short-term vision and roadmap for digital products at client digital unit

  • Collaborate with other designers within and cross-team to problem solve design challenges and maintain a level of design consistency across products


What we offer



  • A job position with a bright future in a fast growing company and innovative industry

  • Exciting products for national and international leading customers as well

  • Demanding projects regarding usability, design and technology

  • A role with responsibilities and creative freedom at same time

  • Being part and working in a competent and motivated team

  • Individual training and education to improve your skills

  • Harmonic work/life balance

  • Competitive salary


Facts



  • Start time: ASAP

  • permanent employment

  • 40 hours / week

  • “Home Office”: Berlin preferred, Ratisbon /Munich as well

  • Regular travel activities: to our developer centers in Germany and Poland

  • Further information available for you in our Jobs FAQ site www.intive-kupferwerk.com

item.title: .Net Developer at Hays Specialist Recruitment Ltd (Thetford, UK)
item.description:
VB.Net Developer opportunity at Multiyork in Thetford working on full Microsoft stack.



Multiyork are looking to expand its multichannel presence. They require a .Net Analyst Developer to get involved in some exciting projects and work simultaneously with web technology and applications.

Based at their head office in Thetford, they require an experienced developer to form a key part of its small yet versatile development team supporting over 50 stores nationally.

The primary responsibilities of the role will encompass full life-cycle development in a test driven environment, though an element of support is required providing user documentation and training assistance where needed. The position provides an excellent opportunity to work on a wide range of projects incorporating HTML, CSS, JavaScript, VB.Net, ASP.Net and SQL Server, this is also a great chance to work with SAP which is run throughout the organisation. A developer with a strong passion for first class coding would exceed in this post and you will have the benefit of seeing the difference your work makes on the business.

Therefore to be successful in your application you will require good commercial experience with VB.Net and a sound knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server as well as a being a keen analytical thinker and strong problem solver. Programming skills consisting of HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and SAP development would be of benefit though are not a necessity, training is provided for those willing to expand their skill set.

The staff retention rates within the IT department are exceedingly good and this is a great reflection of the excellent working environment provided. There is also a healthy benefits package on offer inclusive of Pension, Life Insurance and strong staff discount.

If of interest please apply below or for an informal discussion about the role and organisation please contact Andrew Dennison on 01473 261901.




Hays EA is a trading division of Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited and acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. askCharlie’s Frontend is built with modern Javascript. In addition to our web applications, we are increasing focus on the development of our hybrid mobile application with React Native.

We believe in the empowerment of individuals and we use Agile methodologies to let the team set quarterly objectives, in accordance with the company vision. We manage our own fleet of servers, deploying our services inside Docker containers. Besides, we develop our features in small incremental steps, with a workflow based on GitHub pull requests. We want our code to be well tested and we continuously integrate with Travis CI. The scale of our operations is a sweet spot between the freedom and the agility of a startup and the challenges of a big company.


What we are looking for Our marketplace platform was built over the years by dozens of skilled engineers and we are looking for experienced Frontend Engineers (f/m) who have worked on large web platforms to keep evolving it. You will be working with one of our teams, collaborating with UX/UI Designers and Backend Engineers in the development of new features on our marketplace. Do you want to help us in migrating our clientside architecture to new technologies like React to make our platform faster and easier to develop, test and extend? 


We are looking for passionate and skilled people to join our engineering team and are glad to have you on board as a Frontend Engineer (f/m)!

item.description:
Docler Holding is looking for talented and passionate developers. You will be tasked to work on Java back-end related projects; If you are enjoying hacking with Spring and have a tendency to build high transactional, low latency distributed systems then we are looking forward hearing from you! This is an excellent opportunity to join our newly established office in Amsterdam and be part of something Amazing!


What you will really be doing



  • Participate on the daily team standups

  • Provide your own feedback on retrospectives, we don’t have a “finger pointing” mentality; we try to learn out of our own mistakes

  • Conduct code reviews

  • Actively being involved on the project estimation and sprint planning

  • Design and implement using technologies that meets the projects’ expectations. Be prepared to heavily work with Spring!

  • Pay emphasis on test driven development and aim on increasing test coverage

  • Take ownership of what you develop and actively be involved on production maintenance

item.title: Software Development Engineer III - Scala at Workday (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Workday - Scala Engineer


Workday is built on an exciting ecosystem of multiple technologies running in the Cloud. We are looking for an outstanding Scala Engineer like you to help us to build our distributed, highly-available elastic GRID platform. 


The ideal candidate must have a deep knowledge of software development and cloud infrastructures, microservices architectures and Big Data challenges. We expect you to be an excellent analyst, team builder and problem solver, having fluency in Scala and some other JVM based or functional programming languages.



Responsibilities:



  • Work closely with the rest of the agile team members (SW Engineers, QA Automation Engineers).

  • Be a problem solver: be able to understand the big picture, analyse problems and improvements and suggest solid alternatives and answers to our daily challenges.

  • Be a team builder: you would prefer to collaborate with product owners, architects, quality assurance and infrastructure than being a lonely wolf.

  • Introduce and influence process improvements and act as an agent for change to the organization.

item.title: Software Development Engineer III - Workday Studio at Workday (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
The Studio team are looking for an experienced developer who will contribute to the design and development of the next generation of tools within Workday's Integration Platform.


You will be joining the team who own Workday Studio, the primary tool Integration developers use to build sophisticated and reliable integrations that places Workday within a customer's enterprise landscape. Workday Studio is a successful product with widespread and ever increasing use. It is a visual integrated development environment built atop the Eclipse platform, and our plugins are written in Scala. However, we are constantly looking for ways to further enable our users by extending the tools on offer. 


We are looking for a developer who will bring expertise in building web-browser based user interfaces to the team, but who is confident enough to learn and co-own the current product offering, and who will understand the context within Workday's rapidly evolving cloud platform architecture.


The various aspects of the role will include: working with product management and the team to understand the domain and the users, actively drive the design conversation, rapidly build prototypes, and deliver and own quality product.

item.title: UK Support Security Architect at Capital One (London, UK)
item.description:
The Enterprise Security Architect (ESA) is responsible for delivering architecture intent to Security Engineering and Divisional Information Security organizations.   The ESA partners with stakeholders across the organization to securely achieve requirements of business initiatives. The ESA is a technical authority on information security architecture across the Enterprise.


Job responsibilities



  • Establish strategic security architecture direction for their assigned subject matter domain, including standards and frameworks that are aligned with overall business strategy

  • Work closely with Security Engineering, the Divisional Information Security Officers, enterprise architecture, and infrastructure and operations teams

  • Understand current as well as emerging security threats.  Identify security architecture capabilities and design security architecture patterns to mitigate threats

  • Develop architecture roadmaps for delivering a set of new capabilities where several dependencies need to be managed

  • Assess emerging technologies against security architecture to determine where they fill gaps, overlap with existing solutions or extend capabilities

  • Serve as information security subject matter expert; provide advisory and consulting services as needed

  • Review existing and proposed architectures, identify security design gaps, and recommend changes or enhancements

  • Participate in solution architecture design; lead security efforts assisting with the integration and initial implementation of solutions

  • Knowledge of/experience with international compliance requirements/standards (PCI-DSS, GLBA, SOX, Data Privacy Requirements (e.g. EU/US)) and other international security regulations

  • Stay abreast of new security technologies and integrate into security architecture design when appropriate

  • Coach and mentor junior architects and engineers

item.title: Senior Java Software Engineer at Dimanex BV (Utrecht, Netherlands) (allows remote)
item.description:
Do you know what Additive Manufacturing(AM), high quality 3D printing, will bring about in the next few decades?


At DiManEx we digitize the industrial supply chain, making AM an integral part of it.


Our mission is to print “Any (industrial) part, Anywhere” in the world.


It is about transforming the way Manufacturing is understood around the world and radically innovate the supply chain management bringing it to almost on-demand.


Our solution leads to less scrap material (waste) in the production of parts, having a significant positive impact to our environment.


Imagine the amount of parts in machines, domestic appliances, cars and everything surrounding you. This is our potential market.


By what we do, we bridge two worlds coming together: the old - traditional supply chain and ditto manufacturing; and the new - a digitized, optimized supply chain that has AM as integrated part of it.



To make it happen we need to build a ton of cool features, adopting technologies such as Machine Learning, Blockchain and a strong SOA architecture able to match the highest standards in quality, security and scalability.


What kind of professional are we looking for?


There are a few skills you should master, but don’t be afraid though. We strongly believe it is your character that determines whether you are a good fit for our team or not. Besides your experience and expertise we would like you to bring excitement, speed, creativity and a moonshot attitude to the team. We thrive in a fast-paced, FUN startup environment, taking on many challenges at once. That is what we would like to see with you as well: that passion, the fire within.

item.title: Software Development Engineer (Services) at Capital One (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re proud to say that we’re up there amongst the UKs top 10 credit card providers. Since our beginning we’ve been a company built on bold, new ideas and entrepreneurial spirit. In an ever changing financial landscape we’re transforming to a technology company that happens to do credit, always on, and striving for the breakthroughs that will change banking for good.


Changing banking for good is not an idle statement, it’s our core vision and applies to everything we do. For us, it’s a no brainer. A happy customer is a loyal customer. By bringing innovation, simplicity, and, most importantly, humanity to the financial services industry we will succeed in delivering this mission.


We are transforming ourselves into a FinTech company. We have two development centres; Nottingham and London and in these we are delivering the next big things that will help our customers succeed. 


We’d like you to be part of it.


An obsession for delivering quality products to our customers is at the heart of everything we do. We are a maturing agile organisation, our teams operate with a great deal of empowerment; collaborating with product owners, designers and stakeholders to deliver great software. 
    
We are just beginning our journey into the cloud and have problems of scale, security, availability and performance for you to help solve. We try to solve these using internal and external open-source solutions wherever possible.


We love continuous learning and that’s why we give you 10% of your time to work on cutting edge innovative projects that shape the way we will work in the future.


Additionally, Capital One has been voted the Best Workplace for the last 3 years. We’re also recognised for our work in treating customer fairly. 


You will excel in end to end software development and have breadth and technical depth in more than one area. Your strong design, analytical and problem solving skills will be crucial to our success. 


As well as technical skill, you’ll need the people skills to collaborate across the business – not to mention creativity and drive to make things happen.


As a Software Development Engineer, you’ll work as part of a multidisciplinary team of engineers delivering best-in-class software to allow client agnostic access to our services.


With strong programming skills in one or more languages and solid commercial experience developing software, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with product owners and designers on feature development.


Experience working in Agile teams is a big plus, as is a good working knowledge of test automation frameworks.


Your passion for software engineering means you’re always looking to gain experience with new platforms and languages; we structure our work and our teams to ensure these opportunities are frequently on offer. You’re probably actively engaged with the development community, have attended a hackathon or two and have a plenty of unfinished pet-projects.

item.title: 10 Machine Learning Engineers at ZEISS Group (Oberkochen, Deutschland)
item.description:
To strengthen our Team in the Corporate Research and Development department in Oberkochen or Jena, we have an immediate opening for 


10 Machine Learning Engineers (m/f)


You will



  • Drive the development of ZEISS core algorithms that extract information from the diverse array of data sources present across our complete product portfolio.

  • Take projects from academic and idea stages to a series of prototypes and to continuously support technology adoption and integration into our flagship products. This comprises conceptualizing, initiating, prototyping, as well as scaling and instrumenting methods and evaluating their performance.

  • Shape the future of ZEISS. We have just started to scrape the surface of what can be done with the data our products deliver. You will contribute to realizing the prospects of machine learning, modern computer vision and scene understanding technologies for our customers, as ZEISS continues exploring the data domains of its product portfolio.

item.title: JavaScript Developer at NCR Corporation (Prague, Czech Republic)
item.description:
Would you work for a high-tech company that... ?


… has a global reach and presence in 100+ countries?


… drives innovation in restaurants, shops, banks and at the biggest airports


in the world?


… enables over 600 million consumer transactions a day?


… helped Alan Turing crack the Enigma code back in WW2?


Would you want … ?


… to turn restaurants into a place where you’re being served quickly, get exactly


what you ordered, get great service, be able to provide feedback, be able to pay using mobile devices?


Then join our team as JavaScript Developer and help us make this happen!

item.title: Compiler QA Engineer at Intel Corporation (Gdask, Poland)
item.description:
You will become a part of the Intel Compiler Team that develops leading C/C++ and Fortran compiler products. Your focus will be on ensuring the high quality of the compilers so that we can sleep well after we release a product.

Your responsibilities may include:
- Analysis of stability issues found during testing of the product on different operating systems (Linux, Windows, Mac, Android)
- Analysis of usability and performance characteristics of the product
- Validation of product conformance to programming language standards and other requirements
- Development of test cases to cover new functionality
- Product testing process support
- Communication with developers about issues discovered
- Communication with other product teams to ensure successful releases

item.title: Compiler Development Engineer at Intel Corporation (Gdask, Poland)
item.description: Duties are focused on development open-source LLVM/GCC toolchain for Intel Architecture in Linux and Android target environments. Responsibilities include: design modules and software systems for compiler toolchain, including enabling new IA technology or improving performance and quality of existing functionality. Research fundamental problems and implement algorithm solutions with primary focus on backend compiler optimizations.

item.title: DevOps Engineer - Amazon Web Services AWS at Payconiq (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Payconiq  


Payconiq is a technology-based startup for mobile payments. Paying, buying and selling sound like simple things and they should be. Somewhere along the way, they got complicated. We‘ve been rethinking payments ever since and this has resulted in Payconiq.


For sellers, we’re creating one cohesive service to run your entire business. From a register on your computer to marketing tools that drive new sales. For buyers, we’re making life easier with our Payconiq app (Android and IOS). This enables you to pay with you mobile in a store, restaurant or between friends.


Our company has a market unique position, with a deep management team and is backed up by strong shareholders. And we're only just getting started. We are rapidly expanding in Europe. This offers challenging new opportunities for leading-edge professionals and highly talented young professionals.


Payconiq is based in Brussels, Belgium and has its international headquarters located in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. More info can be found here:


www.payconiq.com


Specialties:


Online Payments, Mobile Commerce, Payment Security, Money Transfers, Payment Processing, E-commerce


Job description


In order to strengthen the Amsterdam team and prepare for expansion of both the product and geographies, we are looking for a dynamic and forward thinking Dev Ops Engineer.


Your primary tasks/deliverables will be:




  • Work with cross-functional teams






  • Manage our new micro-service driven platform






  • Drive our journey towards a container driven landscape






  • Develop automation scripts to maximize our reliability






  • Create a high availability environment






  • Optimize performance




Requirements:




  • Bachelor’s degree / Master in Software Engineering or similar






  • 5+ years of experience as a DevOps engineer






  • 2+ years of experience with Amazon Web Services – AWS






  • AWS certifications are a plus






  • 2+ years of experience with Docker






  • 2+ years of experience with Ansible or Puppet as automation scripting






  • Knowledge of Kubernetes is a plus






  • Experience with continuous Deployment tooling like Jenkins






  • Always curious about new technologies






  • Feel responsible and proud about the product that you are shipping






  • Enthusiastic about IT operations and software development






  • Able to work independently and in a team






  • Fluency in written and spoken English is essential




Payconiq is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium and has its international headquarters located in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. This job is based in Amsterdam. More info can be found here:


www.payconiq.com


Offer



  • Good salary

  • One of the most promising start-ups in Fintech

  • Technical colleagues

  • International environment

  • IT culture


Payconiq is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium and has its international headquarters located in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. This job is based in Amsterdam. More info can be found here: www.payconiq.com


Info:


More info via Global IT Recruiter Rob van Elburg. If interested please send your cv to rob.van.elburg@ing.nl

item.title: Cloud Consultant (m/w) at ipt Innovation Process Technology (Zürich, Schweiz)
item.description:
Über ipt 


ipt ist die IT-Consulting Boutique in der Deutschschweiz, wenn es um Software-Integration geht. Wir bauen innovative Software-Lösungen und arbeiten in Teams von 2-4 Personen beim Kunden vor Ort. ipt ist gross genug, um sich bei den Schweizer Grossunternehmen Gehör zu verschaffen. Mit 110 Mitarbeitenden ist ipt auch klein genug, um den Team-Spirit zu leben. Wir sind «One Team» – Wissen wird geteilt und gegenseitige Unterstützung ist bei ipt zentral.


5 top Gründe um bei ipt zu arbeiten



  1. Top Arbeitgeberin: hochqualifiziertes und motiviertes Team

  2. Individuelle Entwicklung: wir investieren viel in Weiterbildung jedes Einzelnen

  3. Inhalt: Lead-edge Technologien, technische Beratung und abwechslungsreiche Projekte

  4. Fokus Schweiz: kein Near-oder Offshoring

  5. Soziales Engagement: wir teilen Erfolg mit der Stiftung Brändi


Deine Herausforderungen



  • Du berätst unsere Kunden im gesamten Software-Entwicklungsprozess und übernimmst die Verantwortung für Teilprojekte bei wechselnden Grosskunden in der Deutsch-Schweiz

  • Du arbeitest partnerschaftlich in Kundenprojekte mit Themen wie API-Management, DevOps, Cloud Integration, Security oder Simulation

  • Du entwickelst Individualsoftware mit «asset-based Software Solutions» unter Einsatz von führenden Softwareprodukten – mit so wenig Code wie möglich

  • Du implementierst JEE-Komponenten im Back-end und konfigurierst Produkte unserer Technologie-Partner

item.title: Software Engineer - DevOps / Platform-Engineering at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Apply today and work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries.

Want the opportunity to actively shape the technical future of trivago? Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!


What you'll do:



  • Build, setup and automate immutable infrastructure with configuration management tools like Saltstack to ensure trivago's speed is not impacted with its growth.

  • Consult the team on how to build a reliable, fault-tolerant and immutable infrastructure and application design based on best practices.

  • With heavy growth comes new technical requirements. Research new ideas and build prototypes using Vagrant or Saltstack for example.

  • Design, build and maintain custom toolsets when the necessary tool is not on the market.

  • Work hand in hand with other teams and departments in order to make your work more productive.

  • As an expert in your area, you will be expected to share your knowledge and impart your wisdom with the rest of the us by documenting processes and consulting team members.

item.title: Web Test Automation Framework Architect at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Testing a rapidly evolving product with thousands of lines of code that are altered almost daily is a bit of a challenge. Ensuring the quality of web applications in a big-data environment with constant A/B testing, a huge range of supported browsers and various mobile devices can seem like mission impossible. Still sounds like fun to you? Then this could be your dream-job!
Help shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technology in a company that promises a unique work environment and fantastic career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question the status quo, to broaden your horizon and to develop new things!


Your responsibilities:



  • You are responsible for designing, maintaining and improving our testing framework.

  • You support our teams in high-quality tests implementation (code reviews, architecture consultancy on proven principles and best practices).

  • You monitor test results and help to detect and fix flaky tests.

  • You define test strategies and analyse results of the executed tests.

  • You push our software development cycles to the next level with your innovative solutions for quality assurance and automated testing.

  • You work in cross-functionally with teams across Product Development.

  • You analyse our needs and come up with new solutions to increase productivity.

item.title: Software Engineer - PHP at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Join our dynamic Software Engineering department as a PHP Developer and help shape the future of the world’s largest hotel search.


Your responsibilities:



  • Provide 4 million daily visitors with a blazing fast hotel search.

  • Write clean, composable, and testable code.

  • Participate in architecture decisions and innovative feature development tasks.

  • Combine different storage technologies to implement efficient and high performing data retrieval.

  • Use your creativity and problem solving abilities to make a difference.

  • Work in a cross-functional team with passionate experts from various fields.

item.title: Java Developer J2EE / JEE - European Commission at Everis Belgium (Brussels, Belgium)
item.description:
For one of our projects at the European Commission in Brussels, we have a Java Developer job position available.


 
Main tasks:



  • Provide expertise for the IT strategy and the IS architecture.

  • Guide the related projects to more integrated solutions and identify areas for improvements related to Java Enterprise technology, enterprise & web content management, XML, portals, interoperability, Web 2.0, application life cycle management.

  • Provide expertise in IT messaging technologies and web technologies.

  • Assure interoperability between electronic Procurement back offices and front offices applications.

  • Review of Information Systems Architectures.

  • Design and development of component architecture and building blocks and of Web GUIs

  • Analysis of the integration of different information systems.

  • Assistance in the testing, the technical documentation, the deployment, the evaluation and the reporting.

  • Produce software architecture documents, technical specifications and project planning.

  • Provision of quality plans, quality assessments, quality control tests, evaluations and service level agreements associated with information system infrastructure services or projects.

  • Promote best practices for using procurement and financial projects.

item.title: DevOps and backend developer at Keyflow AB (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Job description
In our quest to change the global event industry we are now looking for a talented developer. The position entails developing and maintaining our backend services as well as our backend infrastructure.

Your responsibility will be to ensure our infrastructure meets the company's needs. This includes developing, configuring and upgrading tools to deploy, monitor and execute our backend applications. We mostly use open source products such as: Puppet, Vagrant, MongoDB, Linux, Elastic, Kibana and Python. Our current service provider is Amazon.

When not actively working on our infrastructure you will be part of the backend team developing backend services in Python. We foresee this will be a considerable portion of the position in the beginning. As the volumes in our system increase further the position will shift from backend development to devops development.

You can get a glimpse of what we do at https://www.keyflow.com or http://bit.ly/1P2heZV. Our apps can be found in Apple App Store and Google Play Store (iOS http://apple.co/28JZM8u, Android http://bit.ly/1UQP3LK).

You will become part of a smaller but expanding team. As such you must be willing to learn new things and to be prepared to pitch in wherever needs arise. Keyflow offers a competitive compensation package and a possibility to work in a creative and international environment with short decision paths. We believe you have a couple of years of experience. Sounds interesting? Drop us a few lines at jobs@keyflow.se and tell us what you are looking for and your earlier experience. Applications are evaluated continuously. Earliest start ASAP. Non native Swedish speaking applicants welcome.

item.title: Senior Test Engineer (m/w) - München at intive-Kupferwerk GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Unser QA-Team braucht Verstärkung.


Wenn du denkst, dass du der Richtige für diesen Job bist, dann würden wir uns freuen dich kennenzulernen.


Deine Aufgaben



  • Du gestaltest den Test-Automation-Prozess im Zusammenspiel mit unserer Continuous Integration

  • Du übernimmst die Testplanung und das Management des QA-Teams

  • Du führst automatisierte und manuelle Tests durch

  • Du erstellst detaillierte Testreports

  • Du kommunizierst regelmäßig mit den Ansprechpartnern auf Kundenseite

  • Du präsentierst die Testpläne und Ergebnisse sowohl intern als auch vor dem Kunden

  • Du du arbeitest bei der Erstellung von Angeboten mit



Fakten



  • Startzeitpunkt: ab sofort

  • unbefristete Anstellung

  • 40 Stunden / Woche

  • “Heimatbüro”: Regensburg oder München, gelegentliches Arbeiten an beiden Standorten

  • Weitere Infos in unseren Jobs FAQ

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Swarm64 AS Zweigstelle Hive (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description: We are looking for passionate Senior Software Engineers to take challenges and shape our technologies. Join us and get a closer view on how our software and hardware solution will change the world of databases. You will take responsibility for and provide leadership to Swarm64’s software development efforts to seamlessly integrate our SDA into existing SQL database systems and into other solutions for processing large amounts of data.

item.title: Senior Software Architect (m/f) (105399) at BMW Group (Munich, Germany)
item.description:
SOME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We're ready too, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Software Architect (m/f)
Job reference: 105399


We are offering an exciting opportunity as a Senior Software Architect (m/f) in the field of autonomous driving. You will be responsible for the software architecture of the highly interconnected and innovative functions of autonomous driving. You will work closely with functions specialist and on-board electrical system architects to incorporate individual functions into the overall functional network.  Furthermore you will analyse the structure of the software component architectures within the overall software architecture, using it to design a reference architecture for specialist departments. You will also create prerequisites for reusable software components and interfaces based on unified modelling language (UML) and AUTOSAR. You will fulfil cost-optimal functional and on functional requirements in the exciting field of reusability and resource optimisation. Your results will form the prerequisite for software development and software testing and thus significantly determine the quality of the series software. In your daily work, you will take future challenges, such as shortened product creation processes, new software standards, or new electrical/electron.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer Machine Learning (m/f) (104846) at BMW Group (Munich, Germany)
item.description:
IF AN IDEA DOESN'T HAVE WINGS, IT WILL NEVER HAVE WHEELS.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.


More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly new solutions. Naturally, that includes flexible working models, so that our IT specialists are free to go in unconventional directions. We want to keep pushing the limits of what's possible, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Software Engineer Machine Learning (m/f)
Job reference: 104846


We are offering an exciting opportunity to work as a Data Engineer (m/f) in the field of artificial intelligence and machine learning. As part of a team, you will develop algorithms and software solutions for innovative driver assistance systems and automated driving. Your focus will be on interpretation of events in the vehicle environment and the derivation of sensible and robust driving decisions for the vehicle. You will be involved in the entire development chain from the requirements analysis and conception to the implementation and validation of your algorithms. Additionally you will use machine learning methods to study predictive models from training data and your expert knowledge to select learning method approaches most suitable for respective detection tasks. You will develop strategies for the pre-preparation of data as well as for the optimisation of training parameters. Furthermore, you will work closely with the series implementation of the algorithms that run in the vehicle after a completed training phase. The continuous validation of the performance of your methods, in a simulation environment as well as in the vehicle, rounds off your exciting range of activities.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

item.title: Senior Software Developer Tooling Autonomous Driving (m/f) (105080) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
ELECTRONICS GETS THINGS MOVING. AND NOT JUST THE WHEELS.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.


Success is a team sport. That's why BMW doesn’t simply employ specialists with proven expertise, but real people who understand one other. And we support them with cutting-edge technology and sophisticated processes that still leave room for unconventional thinking. We want to make our team even more innovative in the future, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Software Developer of Tooling for Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105080


A thrilling range of tasks awaits you as Senior Software Developer of Tooling (m/f) in the futuristic field of autonomous driving. In a team of internal and external partners, your task will be to develop software with state-of-the-art tools for highly interconnected functions, thus forming the basis for the industrialisation of driver assistance and highly automated functions. Your tasks will include requirements analyses and definition for systems, developing appropriate solutions and their testing. You will work on virtual integration environments and open-loop/closed-loop simulations of complete highly automated driver assistance functions. Additionally you will manage implementation of your solutions, including the rollout of function and software development. You will ensure content, schedule and quality targets up to rollout within your projects, and you will represent them in various project meetings. Your exciting range of responsibilities will be rounded off by coordination with function developers, test engineers and suppliers as well as with specification definition.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

item.title: Softwarearchitect Hippo at Politie (Zeist, Netherlands)
item.description:
Vacature softwarearchitect Hippo

Ontwikkel jij mee aan de beste website van Nederland?

Politie.nl is in 2015 verkozen tot website van het jaar en maakt kans deze titel dit jaar te prolongeren. Naast deze drukbezochte website (maandelijks 3 miljoen bezoekers) ontwikkelt het team hierachter ook nog een heleboel andere interessante producten. Enkele voorbeelden:



  • Politie-app voor burgers en diverse apps voor agenten

  • Via het mobile media lab (vrachtwagen ingericht als onderzoeksruimte) worden communicatiemiddelen in het land getest

  • Een maatwerkversie van Buzzcapture voor (wijk)agenten

  • Second screen bij Opsporing Verzocht

  • Misdaad in kaart, de Nederlandse crimemap.



Het team dat verantwoordelijk is voor de ontwikkeling en het beheer van deze producten, genaamd Integraal mediabeleid en Digitale media (IMDM), werkt grotendeels vanuit de DevOps methode. Naast de genoemde producten houdt het team zich ook bezig met integraal mediabeleid, de uitvoering van een reputatieonderzoek (nulmeting), het opstellen van een visie op opsporingscommunicatie en een aangifte-volg-systeem.

Voor dit team zoeken we nieuwe collega's die kunnen bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling van cruciale producten waarmee we de verbinding tussen politie en burger kunnen versterken. Heb jij de drive om de online interactie tussen burger en politie te verbeteren? Solliciteer dan nu!

item.title: Senior Algorithm Developer for Autonomous Driving (m/f) (105395) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
SOME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We're ready too, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Algorithm Developer for Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105395


We are offering you an interesting position at the BMW Group to work as a Senior Algorithm Developer (m/f) in the field of Autonomous Driving. Your tasks will include the development of algorithms and software solutions for the environmental and driver model. In close cooperation with the specialist departments, you will develop the architecture of highly networked, innovative software. Here, you will be involved in the entire development chain, from requirements analysis, algorithm design, implementation and validation of the software, through to integration of the software on the control devices. In your position, you will write and optimize complex algorithms, such as for the recognition, classification and fusing (high and low level) of objects and open spaces fit for driving and of situation interpretation, and you will provide support in implementing the algorithms into efficient embedded software. Your thrilling range of activities will be rounded off by the testing and validation of the developed algorithms, as well as testing and functionality throughout the overall vehicle.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.
