item.title: Lead Software Architect/Designer Autonomous Driving (m/f) (105078) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
ELECTRONICS GETS THINGS MOVING. AND NOT JUST THE WHEELS.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR INNOVATIVE SYSTEM FUNCTIONS.


Success is a team sport. That's why BMW doesn’t simply employ specialists with proven expertise, but real people who understand one other. And we support them with cutting-edge technology and sophisticated processes that still leave room for unconventional thinking. We want to make our team even more innovative in the future, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Lead Software Architect/Designer in Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105078


We are offering an interesting opportunity to work as a Lead Software Architect/Designer (m/f) for Embedded Systems. Your tasks will include leading a team of excellent specialists to develop software solutions and for the design and implementation of highly networked, innovative automotive software functions for driver assistance and autonomous driving. You and your team will design a comprehensive, future-proof software architecture for driving strategy, trajectory planning, the environmental or driver model and the interfaces with the sensor system and actuators. Modern development methods and technologies such as continuous integration, agile, test-driven development or domain-specific languages will play a major role in this. Within the area of autonomous driving, you will work along the entire development chain, from requirements analysis to the writing of algorithms and development of software, through to integration of the software into the control devices, based on AUTOSAR.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

item.title: Senior Software Integrator in Autonomous Driving (m/f) (105077) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
IT CAN BE COMPLICATED. TEAMWORK SHOULDN’T BE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.


Success is a team sport. That's why BMW doesn’t simply employ specialists with proven expertise, but real people who understand one other. And we support them with cutting-edge technology and sophisticated processes that still leave room for unconventional thinking. We want to make our team even more innovative in the future, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Software Integrator in Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105077


The BMW Group is offering an interesting opportunity in the future-oriented area of automated driving. Autonomous driving is one of the major challenges facing the automotive industry within the coming years. The department “Software for Customer Functions” plays a key role in development up until series maturity, by developing customer functions in an agile and safety-oriented process. You will perform the operative software integration of functions for autonomous driving on an innovative integration platform as part of a multi-stage continuous integration system. Your main tasks will include software integration, error analysis and validation of embedded and IT software, as well as software development as part of the agile integration process. A fundamental part of your activities will include creative collaboration with experts in software integration and embedded platforms for the conception and implementation of these technical solutions.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

item.title: Senior Product Owner at belvilla (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As product owner you will be responsible for our home owner online platforms. You will own the complete product lifecycle – from the formulation of the strategic direction right the way through to execution. As Product Owner you play a crucial role in driving forward our ambition to be a global Vacation Rental Management Company.


These platforms provide essential support our current home owners, helping them to maximize their revenue. Similarly, the home owner platforms should inform and attract potential home owners to partner with Belvilla. 


You will manage the product lifecycle;  defining, managing and prioritizing the roadmap backlog.  To achieve this, you will work in close collaboration with a team of designers, an agile team of developers and internal stakeholders. With the business case, benchmark insights, user data and user feedback as a starting point, you will lead the creation of a vision for our platforms and translate this into an actionable roadmap.  You will create concepts with our design team and, together with internal stakeholders, decide upon the functional requirements.  These are then translated into design and UX briefings, user stories, acceptance criteria and test plans.  By intensive testing and analyses you iteratively improve the Home Owner platform(s). 


Tasks and responsibilities



  • Be a true HomeOwner customer advocate; understand our users and ensure their voice is part of all decisions

  • Ask hard questions, validate assumptions, connect the dots

  • Measure outcomes and keep on iterating towards the optimal solution

  • Cooperate with stakeholders across the board 

  • Ensure the right balance between pragmatism and quality in product development

  • Prioritise keeping user value and business value in mind

  • Work directly with Agile development teams and UX to make your products real

item.title: Senior Engineer of Validation in Autonomous Driving (m/f) (105073) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
EVEN IN ELECTRONICS, YOU CAN GO AGAINST THE CURRENT.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR NETWORKED THINKING.


More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly new solutions. Naturally, that includes flexible working models, so that our IT specialists are free to go in unconventional directions. We want to keep pushing the limits of what's possible, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Engineer of Validation in Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105073


We are offering an exciting opportunity as a Senior Engineer (m/f) in the innovative field of autonomous driving. Your tasks will focus on the conception and development of testing and validation methods in order to ensure series-production-ready and customer-oriented industrialisation of complex highly automated customer functions. Your activities will include designing necessary testing strategies and defining requirements for the architecture, design and development of functions and components. You will be responsible for the description of necessary infrastructures and the implementation of methods and their tools, up until the operative implementation in projects. Challenges will lie in the conception and development of a high-performance simulation of the vehicle environment and consistent further expansion of the virtualisation and automation of the testing operation. Examples of these tasks include the processing of large volumes of data and taking innovative solution approaches, such as artificial intelligence, into account.  You will work very closely with all relevant process partners in autonomous driving. Additionally, you will steer and represent your project contents within the team, as well present results in specialist and management committees.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

item.title: Software Developer at Exact (Delft, Netherlands)
item.description:
Software Developer

Your role as software developer @Exact
We are team project Connect. We run a corporate startup with the ambition to help entrepreneurs with their biggest challenge: finding new customers. Every company deserves its very own business connector - a business aide who seamlessly connects trusted parties. Think of yourself having your own startup and after three somewhat lesser experiences you are on your own looking for a great design agency. We will get you connected. And to build this magical platform it is you we need.

With ‘project Connect’ we work on an ambitious goal. That has been set. The stack not. The team is growing into a full-fledged team with all disciplines on board to launch a product (design, development, marketing, content, …). All with the same mission. You will nail the stack, push algorithms yet could also face users in the many validation rounds we do. As you can read, we expect you to be all-round, in the morning you might be working on the mobile front-end while in the afternoon you are working on the FaaS back-end.

This job is an excellent opportunity to both shape product and exploring the most modern platform techniques. In addition, delivering an awesome product with these.

According to Edgar Wieringa (Manager ‘Project Connect’) this job is an excellent opportunity to both shape product and exploring the most modern platform techniques. While In addition, delivering an awesome product with these

Match? GET CONNECTED!

As a great Software Developer you;



  • are Ready, Set, Code – #JavaScript, #React Native, #AWS, #iOS, #Android

  • love to code,

  • are comfortable with javascript frameworks (client+server side),

  • love cloud services

  • share gists of code that say even more than your personal introduction can give us.



We Offer @ Delft



  • training and colleagues whom will sharpen your brain.

  • you the opportunity to excel as a team lead.

  • healthy food every day

  • organic coffee from Miss Morrison

  • our own fitness center with a very nice personal trainer Noël

  • Friday afternoon drinks at our bar “Bits & Bytes



Please apply using the 'Apply' button.
You'll be hearing from us soon.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

Keywords: Vacancy, fulltime, Delft, software developer, developer

item.title: Software Quality Engineer (m/f) - Join Intel and design the future! at Intel Corporation (Karlsruhe, Germany)
item.description: Deep understanding of Quality standards and methodologies like GS5000, ISO 9000, Automotive SPICE and CMMI. Deep understanding of SW development practices and methodologies like V-Modell and Agile/SCRUM. Works closely with Sr. SQE and product development teams throughout the product development lifecycle to ramp up and establish necessary processes and methodologies in an automotive environment. Helps to establish and monitor software quality requirements to ensure that goals are met. Drives effective software practices to ensure project work products comply with applicable standards. Tracks and provides software quality metrics to monitor progress of product deliveries according to quality criteria. Participates and drives activities to improve overall product and process quality.

item.title: SW development engineer (m/f) - Join Intel - and design the future! at Intel Corporation (Karlsruhe, Germany)
item.description: As a member of the Application debugger team you will be implementing tools for new application debugger technologies in Intel chips. Our tools are used on Intel SW products ranging embedded Microcontrollers to Enterprise Servers. Our tools are built using industry standard technologies such as GDB, Visual Studio and Eclipse. Software developers work on anything from low-level register access all the way up to UI and user documentation.A candidate who takes responsibility and enjoys working in a multicultural environment will fit the team. In our environment of Agile software development an active participation in defining the team's direction to match product development with customer needs is a required.You should possess a Diploma or a Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent discipline.

item.title: Frontendutvecklare till Stockholm! at Capgemini (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Team Mobile arbetar med frontendutveckling för webb och mobil, några av oss arbetar även med affärslogik och databaser och våra projekt spänner över ett stort antal sektorer. Vårt främsta fokus är digitalisering inom offentlig sektor och att skapa fler elektroniska tjänster för Sveriges medborgare. En del av oss andra arbetar för stora kända svenska företag. Som team är vi nyfikna, modiga och ivriga att hacka fram nya innovativa lösningar.


Som frontendutvecklare kommer du arbeta i varierande projekt inom responsiv webb och applikationer. Projekten är omfattande, långsiktiga och innovativa och du får en möjlighet att arbeta med välkända kunder som gör verklig skillnad i väldigt många människors vardag. Du arbetar med ny teknik och fokus ligger bland annat på att utveckla, modifiera och vidareutveckla våra kunders gränssnitt för att skapa högkvalitativa användar- och webbupplevelser. Du kommer ingår i kreativa team där du diskutera nya tekniska lösningar och bidrar med dina idéer. I rollen får du möjligheter att arbeta mot varierande branscher eller fördjupa dig vidare inom ett specifikt område, allt beroende på ditt intresse.

item.title: Front end developer at Natural Cycles (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
We are looking for a Front-end Developer who is passionate about our product, our customers and our vision and works with us to make Natural Cycles a global success.


Your tasks


You will have a key part in developing and improving our software applications, involving our mobile apps, websites and future exciting projects and platforms (Apple Watch, Apple TV)!


Our technical plans and challenges include:



  • Maintain and develop new functionality for our core product, presented in the form of mobile apps for iOS and Android, as well as browser-based client

  • Ensure highest quality, performance and security of the product

  • Ensure continuous delivery of new software releases while working in Agile way

  • Maintain a healthy and consistent codebase with minimized technical debt and flexibility to expand

  • Have a good coverage of automated end-to-end and unit tests

  • Have routine operations automated (continuous integration, reproducible builds, gulp, livereload, etc)

  • Have a great product team

    • Make working together fun & efficient

    • Allow everyone to take initiative and contribute to the success of the company and product

    • Allow everyone to participate in technical decisions

    • Encourage learning



  • Move towards emerging new industry standards when they become mature and stable (Angular 2, Ionic 2, ES6, TypeScript, ...)

  • Contribute to the open-source community by publishing reusable parts of the code

item.title: Application Engineer, E-commerce at BESTSELLER E-commerce (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Our Platform Operations Team at BESTSELLER E-commerce is looking for a technically savvy Application Engineer. With more than 100 colleagues from all over the world our E-commerce business is constantly growing.


The department and the position


As an Application Engineer you will be part of our Platform Operations team, consisting of 5 dedicated and passionate colleagues, based in our Ecommerce headquarters in the center of Amsterdam.


The Platform Operations team at Bestseller E-commerce is strategically positioned as both a technical service provider for customer-facing departments and acts as a bridge between BESTSELLER brands and internal development teams. As an Application Engineer you will, together with your colleagues, ensure quality across all our systems and work improve and maintain the overall capacity of test, pre-production and production application environments. You will be working in a fast-paced environment, making it important that you are able to structure and prioritize your tasks.


Specific Job Responsibilities:


Your main responsibility will be to respond to a variety of operational challenges, including:



  • Identify, troubleshoot, coordinate and resolve technical issues on our production systems

  • Support our business users being successful

  • Help transition new features and changes successfully to our production environments

  • Continuously improve system & process monitoring and reporting


Moreover your tasks will also include:



  • Refine and analyze end user reports and turn them into solid technical debriefings for specialists and developers

  • Creating and coordinating impact analysis and present them to management and stakeholders

  • Create and distribute technical and non-technical information to teams and other internal departments

item.title: Back-End/Python Developer at Bynder (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Who you are


Bynder is looking to hire you, a Back-End Developer, who wants to help build the most advanced and easiest to use branding automation software in the industry. Our Development team is building a cloud-based SaaS product for marketeers to automate and streamline their workflow in today’s globalized business environment.


Our clients are some of the world’s largest brands, including Spotify, KLM, Nest, & Logitech to name but a few. We’re looking for someone who understands the challenges involved in creating a globally available, distributed system with four nines of reliability. We don’t take “no” for an answer and we stress the boundaries of what’s available.


We work with a microservice architecture, using multiple asynchronous systems and pushing the limits of both the technology and AWS to the limits to adapt our product to use state of the art technologies.


How we roll


We are hiring for this role in Barcelona, where our rapidly growing team of developers are situated. The office is situated in the heart of the city.


Our development team is split into autonomous squads, each with responsibility for their own area of the product.


We have perks: each developer gets their own mac. We supply daily lunch at the office. We relax every day with beers, and we have ping-pong tables on hand for when you need a break.


You will join an international team: we have 20 nationalities between our 60 developers - and many more when you include our other offices in London, Boston, Dubai, and Barcelona. Bynder Barcelona is southern Europe’s newest Tech hub attracting top international top talent, combining Tech and the beach life.

item.title: Embedded software engineer C++ at Sioux embedded systems (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
At Sioux you will develop software for products in the following markets: professional equipment manufacturing, life science & health, automotive and image & printing. Sioux has a broad project portfolio that ranges from electron microscopes to inkjet PCB printers, and from Smart Car systems to Digital 3D imaging. This diversity of markets offers you the opportunity to develop your engineering skills in various domains.


As an Embedded Software Engineer C++, you are involved in each development phase, from gathering the requirements to implementation and testing the software. Together with your team, you make every possible effort to create the optimal solution for the project. You will work at the Sioux Development Centre or at the customer's site. This position is for 36 to 40 hours per week.


Your daily activities:



  • creating a technical design and implementing the software

  • testing software modules, based on the specifications and the technical design

  • integrating the different software modules

  • writing development documentation

item.title: Web Developer at Picnic (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
• Improve the daily lives of hundreds of thousands of grocery shoppers

  • Go where nobody has gone and get wide recognition for world class websites

  • Design, create, own and maintain our web applications

  • Push your limits in creating super clean, well structured, testable, performant, high quality code

  • Develop application tests, including unit, integration, regression and performance tests

  • Keep up with the latest technologies and define our future technology stack

  • Be challenged every day again by our extremely talented team

item.title: (Senior) PHP Developer at Spryker Systems GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced PHP Developer who wants to take responsibility in a powerful startup environment!


With Spryker we launched a new commerce framework based on Silex and Symfony2 bundles. The approach is to provide a modern architecture which ships with a set of reference implementations for the most common use cases. Every single feature can be extended or, if needed, replaced by a more specific solution. Instead of bulky generic code, Spryker provides a lean architecture and clean code.

item.title: Software Developer C++ - relocation to the Netherlands at Amundsen International (Arnhem, Netherlands)
item.description: As a C++ Software Developer you will work on new products that aim to bring innovative solutions for client - companies that offer financial services, like mobile payments. You may also work on high-end solutions for Governments, or for the healthcare industry. The goal is to develop high tech solutions with the purpose of protecting classified information. Due to the nature of the products, we cannot go into details too much. In this job, you will mostly work on Cryptographic middleware and applets.

item.title: Database Developer at LOGEX (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
To support our (international) expansion we are looking for a Database Developerto join our international team in Amsterdam. The current team consists of 7 developers, including Back-end and Front-end.


As a Database Developer you are responsible for integrating new data sources into the Data Warehouse, improving performance of the data sets via projection optimization, ensure the ongoing stability of data integration, and integrate LOGEX’s products into the data warehouse. Our technology stack consists of MS SQL + C#.NET in the backend and JS in the front-end.

item.title: (jr.) Web Developer at LOGEX (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
To support our (international) expansion we are looking for a (jr.) Web Developerto join our international team in Amsterdam. The current team consists of 7 developers, including Back-end and Front-end. As a (jr.) Web Developer you are responsible for designing and programming applications to support the ‘LOGEX Smart Hospital Grid’. You develop web-applications and online tools in order to improve the usability of our advanced analytical models.


You are passionate about innovative technologies. You have a proven ability to comprehend functional requirements, and can translate those insights into scalable and user-friendly solutions. You highly value performance, security and craftsmanship. You keep close tabs on IT-developments and important, you like developing (90%) instead of documenting (10%). You are comfortable with our technology stack, which has MS SQL Server, ASP.NET (C#) and AngularJS (TypeScript)”.

item.title: Java Backend Developer at Sytac IT Consulting (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:

As Sytac’s Senior Backend Consultant you'll be working on critical product/app development efforts with our clients. You are a dynamic, creative and inspiring technologist who loves to dive deep in backend implementations that are key to our clients. You are a consultant who cares about delivering business value and creating added value.

item.title: Use Intercom for personal, fun & challenging engineering support! at Intercom (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
WHAT'S THE OPPORTUNITY?


Do you have a strong need to understand how and why things work the way they do? Are you acutely aware of customer experience and upset when a company you’re dealing with lets you down?


If you have some engineering or web development experience and want to be a part of creating truly exceptional customer experiences then the Customer Support team at Intercom is right for you. We're looking for a support engineer to work an offset week, working three days in the office, remotely both weekend days and taking off two days during the week.


Intercom supports over 13k businesses ranging from bootstrapped startups to large enterprise corporations. Our Support Engineers partner with our customers to tackle the challenging technical issues they face in innovative ways. In this role, you will be directly responsible for helping people integrate Intercom into their products, diagnose and report problems they have, and serve as the bridge between our customers and our product teams.


We use Intercom to support Intercom customers, so whether you’re just starting out in your career or want to get a deeper understanding of fundamental customer motivations and how those are applied to building an ambitious, world-class product, this role provides that great opportunity.


We have all experienced terrible customer service. Robotic agents running through a script of predetermined messages, never helping or sympathizing, just programmatically following instructions. That’s the opposite of who we are.


Our way of providing support is based on the principles of continuity and trust and our style of communication is personal, friendly and fun. We engage in dynamic conversations with our customers and are big fans of visual communication (think emojis, stickers, GIFs) - we believe that visual support is human support!


WHAT WILL I BE DOING?


In this role you will:



  • Debug complex issues with an understanding of both our own codebase and the many technologies employed by our customers

  • Solve technical problems for customers on a daily basis

  • Utilize inherited and learned technical knowledge (including but not limited to: Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Ember.js, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Pusher, nginx, Sinatra, Sidekiq, and lots more) to build tools that will help increase the efficiency and effectiveness of the team and its processes

  • Influence the direction of the Intercom product through daily communication with our customers and consistent collaboration with our product teams

item.title: Software Designer - relocation to the Netherlands at Amundsen International (Nijmegen, Netherlands)
item.description:
The company is active in many different verticals. Depending on your strengths and background, you will work at clients in the Healthcare, high-tech, Automotive and/or Machinery industry. In addition, there are internal projects to work on. In this position, you will work on innovative solutions developed for social challenges in the areas of energy, mobility and sustainable production. The company works with different units, each offering services to clients in the High-Tech, Machine & Systems, Healthcare and Automotive industry.


As a Software Designer you will be responsible for the development and implementation of software for different projects. You will work in complex development environments with plenty of opportunity to learn and develop yourself within certain domains. Of course we expect you to keep up with the latest technical developments and we will offer plenty of opportunity to do so.

item.title: JS Developer (React/Angular) at Sytac IT Consulting (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
"What you really do:"

As Sytac’s Senior Frontend Consultant you'll be working on critical product/app development efforts with our clients. You are a dynamic, creative and inspiring technologist who loves to get your hands dirty in frontend implementations that are key to our clients. You are a consultant who cares about delivering business value and creating kick-ass tools that users love to use.

"Depending on the client/project you’ll:"



  • Deliver frontend experiences worthy of enterprise delight

  • Responsible for the FE stack and the realisation of a solid frontend architecture

  • Enable development process improvements through tools and automation

  • Safe-guard enterprise product quality

  • Conduct Research & development

item.title: Release Engineer to work on software build and integration challenges at Tuxera (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
Tuxera overview


Tuxera is one of the fastest growing software companies in Finland. We are a global organization and the market leader in data storage solutions and interoperability software. With a growing team of over 60 professionals from more than 17 nationalities, we have been recognized with awards such as the Great Place to Work. Our software ships inside 10 billion devices on the market, including smartphones, routers, laptops, cars, TVs, drones and many others.


Our mission: to open the way for people and businesses to reliably store, access, and share any type of data on any device. We envision a future with an infinite number of connected devices. With Tuxera at the heart of every device, data is always accessible exactly when and where you want it to be.


Tuxera is looking for an experienced Software Engineer who enjoys solving software build and integration challenges in diverse embedded environments. You have a passion for fast and correct results and can achieve them both independently and as a member of a team. The software you release will run on billions of electronics devices every day.


Tasks and responsibilities:



  • Manage release process for different products. Improve release process quality, reliability and sustainability. Focus on efficiency

  • Maintenance of tools and configurations related to products and services

  • Triage software build, environment issues 


Tuxera offers you



  • Dynamic and international work environment, with flexible working hours

  • Dream setup: laptop + smartphone of your choice

  • Personal health insurance

  • Lunch coupons

  • Hobby coupons (e.g., for gym, movies, theater, opera, etc)

  • Relocation support


In addition to all these perks, we offer you a flexible work environment in which you’ll have the opportunity to work and drive your ideas forward using the best ways and tools for you to get things done. We’ve been named Great Place to Work for a second year in a row because we enjoy being challenged and value continuous learning and improvement. You’ll be working with some of the most resourceful, brilliant people in the software industry; in products and projects for top global brands. We are also very active in tech communities, organizing, sponsoring and attending software meetups, hackathons, and other industry events. We support your initiatives by offering you an opportunity to spend 10% of your working hours on related side projects, and offer you great possibilities for personal and professional growth. We also offer you the rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you is using the product you built. We’re not just another software company, we’re powering all the devices that are used by real people every day.


How to apply:


This position is full-time and will be filled once a suitable candidate is found. To apply, please click on the link and include your cover letter, CV and any other relevant material to showcase your skills.

item.title: Python Scientific Developer, Schrodinger, Inc. at Schrödinger, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Schrödinger, a leader in the field of computational biochemistry, is seeking a software developer to write and maintain Python application and GUI code across many of our scientific products.


The ideal candidate will combine software experience with a background in chemistry, biology or physics, but we are also open to individuals with less expertise in software engineering and greater scientific experience, or vice versa. This is primarily a software development position rather than a scientific one, so a strong interest in coding is a must.


Although professional experience in software development is a big plus, this is a prime opportunity for junior developers looking to advance and challenge themselves. Through constant collaboration, we mentor developers with constructive feedback, code review, and skill sharing in which everyone participates. This is the perfect position for someone who is eager to learn and share best practices for modern software development.

item.title: SENIOR Frontend Developer (m/f) at zooom productions gmbh (Fuschl am See, Österreich)
item.description:
YOU...



  • have at least 5 years of industry experience

  • love to create excellent user experiences and cool animations are your passion

  • find and follow the latest trends regarding frontend development

  • are a communicative person who wants to share his knowledge with the team

  • have experience creating modular JavaScript using AMD (Require.js/System.js) or other module loader

  • have working knowledge of client side integration with REST/JSON web services

  • have experience with Sass frameworks like Bootstrap and Compass 

  • are familiar with frontend development methodologies like BEM, OOCSS

  • are familiar with scripted build systems like Grunt/Gulp as well Frontend Web Package management tools such as Bower & Yeoman

  • have working experience with Javascript MVC frameworks including Angular.js, Backbone.js

  • have experience using source control systems, preferably Git (Gitlab/Github), branching strategies for collaborative development (Git Flow, merge requests etc), and Continuous Integration systems (Jenkins, Travis CI, etc.)

  • have proficient understanding of webpage performance optimization (Pagespeed or YSlow)

  • have a good understanding of SEO/SEM principles and ensuring that application will adhere to them

  • have working knowledge of CMS frameworks

  • have an extra advantage if you have experience with client side Test Driven Development (Qunit.js, Selenium & Phantom.js)

item.title: Demandware Developer at Suitsupply (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you a Javascript backend developer or do you have experience in Demandware? Have you worked in a high traffic web environment? Are you familiar with Git, Jira, Grunt, Confluence, lpv Bitbucket? We are seeking brand new talent to step up to the plate and develop further as Demandware Developers.


In your day-to-day work the emphasis will be on facilitating best-practice uses of the product as part of an extended/integrated solution, including other technology partners and/or ancillary legacy systems (Payment, OMS, CR, etc). We are striving for the best and we are always busy with finding the right balance between researching the latest technology stack and productivity.


Previous experience in small Scrum teams is appreciated as well as start-up/retail exposure. If your experience matches the previously mentioned technology stack you could contribute to the development and maintenance our in-house built systems and software for the stores, offices, logistics and HQ. We are now working on turning the whole website into a restful API, speeding up processes and improving performance, which makes it an exciting place to be!


This position is based at our headquarters in the Netherlands, so fluency in English is a must and fluency in Dutch is a plus. If you are the one we are looking for, send us your CV and cover letter in Dutch or English.

item.title: Data Engineer at KPN (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you triggered by the idea of working in a dream team with other data engineers, scientists and architects delivering gamechanging (big) data & analytical solutions in a company which will ask and support you to perform and deliver impact beyond your expectations? Then we encourage you to read further.

Your job as a Data Engineer

We are looking for an enthusiastic and creative data engineer who will help create a new chapter of Data Engineering within KPN. Together with your team, consisting of complementary skill sets across data science and engineering, you will have the opportunity to work on diverse and high impact business cases across KPN.

As an experienced Data Engineer you will be responsible for:



  • Creation of a scalable streaming analytical engine with an highly skilled team

  • ETL for analytics on Hadoop

  • Structuring development process

  • Help to find out which storage structures or databases fit the data best

  • Create ingest pipelines for new data sources

  • Help to create a data life-cycle that adheres to privacy and security guidelines

item.title: Embedded Software Engineer - relocation to the Netherlands at Amundsen International (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
The main specializations are biomechanical sensing, photonics, embedded solutions and signal processing. You will have about 20 colleagues, and the organizational structure is quite flat. This means that the communication lines are short, and there is plenty of room for your own ideas. We are flexible when it comes to working with your strengths, and the type of products you will work on. As an embedded software engineer you will work in-house on a diverse range of sensor related products.


Examples of innovative products which you can choose to work on:
- Wearable devices (in example: Fitbit or other devices to measure activity);
- Internet of Things;


- Advanced medical products that run on software;


- Industrial sensors.


You will get a chance to work on a very diverse range of products, from the stage of concept creation. Ideas emerge mostly from academic settings, and you will be the first person to bring the prototype to life. This position is extremely exciting for creators, who are not afraid to go where they have not gone before, and are eager to independently work on innovative concepts.

item.title: Ingénieur Analyste Logiciel Confirmé (Technique) - (H/F) at Capsule Technologie (Paris, France)
item.description:
Dans le cadre de son programme d’amélioration continue et sa recherche de qualité, Capsule a développé une méthodologie unique basée sur les bonnes pratiques de développement logiciel (SCRUM, XP, TSP / PSP) et l'approche Agile telle que définie par l'industrie médicale.


Pour soutenir notre croissance forte et rapide, nous sommes aujourd'hui à la recherche d'un Ingénieur Analyste Logiciel Confirmé. Vous allez tester dans un environnement moderne et flexible qui bénéficie du partenariat Microsoft Gold.


Situé au centre de Paris, vous travaillerez dans un environnement international et multiculturel, avec une atmosphère agréable et conviviale.


Fonctions essentielles



  • Concevoir et mettre en place des procédures de test détaillées sur la base des spécifications fonctionnelles et techniques

  • Concevoir et développer des outils de test

  • Exécuter des procédures de test en respectant les standards et procédures internes et vérifier la conformité des résultats obtenus vis-à-vis des résultats attendus

  • Analyser les déviances et rédiger les rapports d’anomalies

  • Participer aux activités de test des produits dans le cadre d’un développement réglementé (classification FDA « medical device class II »)

item.title: iOS Developer at Urban Massage (London, UK)
item.description:
If you're a recruiter, please read our recruiter notice

ABOUT URBAN MASSAGE

Our purpose is to connect people with high quality health and well-being professionals for convenient treatments that meet their needs, wherever and whenever they want them. We make this possible by our slick technology platforms (apps and website) and brilliant people. Since our start-up formed in 2014 we've grown significantly and now make over 7,000 bookings a month possible with exciting plans to grow. As a place to work, we provide those who share our passion with big roles with huge scope to impact our success, the freedom to apply their talent and ideas however they see appropriate, really fun colleagues and an engaging work environment.

THE ROLE

Here at Urban Massage, we are looking for a great iOS Developer with proven industry experience in your craft skills, who wants to use their expertise to help take our product to the next stage.

What are we working on with our product? Well, we don't want to reveal our hand publicly as you may imagine however it's a really exciting time to be here and the future of our product is looking very bright indeed!

We're driven to create the best booking experience within the wellness industry - one that is accessible to people, intuitive to their needs, incredibly convenient and easy to use. You would play a key role in this.

We already have an industry leading logistics set up with our product. We work on products for both sets of our users - those that book massage treatments and also the therapists who rely on our platforms for their roles.

What's it like working here? As an iOS Developer, you will work in a tight-knit multi disciplinary team of engineers. We work very closely together and often at a fast pace - you'll always be challenged and no two days will be the same. You'll also be asked to speak up and have a strong voice within the team as the expert in your space.

Our leadership in this space works to bring together strategy, creative and technology in agile programmes of work. Our resulting approach as a team is underpinned by a culture of strong development standards, TDD, continuous integration, peer review, test automation and replicable deployment processes.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Code in Swift (and maintain / replace some old objective-c)
  • Apply industry standard best practices
  • Collaborate with colleagues across various areas of the business
  • Lead within your discipline architect using modern front-end stacks and help coordinate delivery
  • Contribute to our overarching technical architecture and vision

Benefits


  • Competitive salary (based on experience)
  • Join a fast-growing and exciting start-up with excellent growth opportunities
  • Well-speced Apple hardware
  • A generous conference budget
  • Free weekly yoga sessions
  • Discounts on at-home massages
  • Fully stocked fridges
  • Central London office with great transport links
  • Working with a fun, international and highly-motivated team. Never a dull moment for sure!

item.title: AI Programmer to work on Hitman at Io - Interactive (København, Denmark)
item.description:
Are you up for a great challenge? Our team of experienced gameplay programmers and designers is looking for a talented AI programmer.


AI has always been key to the Hitman gameplay and experience. You will be part of the team implementing our next AI system and new AI features in upcoming installments of the Hitman franchise.


You will work closely with game designers, level designers, and tech programmers not just to make the game come alive on the screens but to make it an awesome and fun AAA experience.



  • You will participate in the design and implementation of our new AI system

  • Development of new features and bug-fixes for AI currently running in our current AI system

  • The AI team is a part of the gameplay team, so you will be collaborating with core gameplay and animation programmers. Over time, there will be good possibilities for taking different roles

item.title: Senior Mobile Developer -> Android or iOS at HubSpot (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
HubSpot users rely on mobile because it's key to the way modern businesses run. Now that we do most of our work online, marketers and salespeople can do their jobs from anywhere. That means they need the power of HubSpot to engage with contacts, prospects, and customers when they're not at their desks. Cue the HubSpot mobile team.


We're a small team with big goals. We want to empower our users to grow their businesses from their phones, create an intuitive mobile experience, and help teams collaborate through the HubSpot mobile app. So far, we've made an impact by identifying which use cases are most valuable for users on-the-go (for example, the social media tool for publishing and monitoring real-time social content) and building features that compliment the desktop experience.


We work closely with our product manager and designers to set the vision for what we build. Next, we're building new additions to the mobile experience that will make collaboration and communication between teams, prospects, and customers easier.


We're proud of our mobile tech stack and are keen to contribute to the community through open source projects and the HubSpot Product Blog.

item.title: Senior Developer (Full Stack) at eHealth Systems Africa (Monrovia, Liberia)
item.description:
eHealth Africa's team in Liberia is supporting many health systems strengthening projects related to improving the integration of data systems, better reporting from communities, health facilities, and laboratories to help in the prevention, detection and response to disease outbreaks.  Our team is looking for a Senior Developer (Full Stack) to join the team for 3-6 months on location in Monrovia, Liberia.


Summary
The Senior Developer (Full Stack) is responsible for developing and supporting projects, functions and completing specific client work, projects and miscellaneous tasks. This highly responsible position involves using established work procedures to analyze, design, develop, implement, maintain, re-engineer and troubleshoot applications.



Duties and Responsibilities



  • Directs technical aspects of operations related to client accounts or high severity issues 

  • Participates in the evolution of company level software best practices, standards, and policies 

  • Defines objectives by analyzing user requirements; envisioning system features and functionality 

  • Works closely with developers and end users to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction

  • Collaborates with product owners, technical architects and other software developers to plan, design, develop, test, and maintain web- and mobile-based applications 

  • Provides thought-leadership as to emerging technologies and integrate them into business operations

  • Assists in estimation and assessment of feasibility of solutions for upcoming projects

item.title: Front End Developer (m/f) at internetstores GmbH (Esslingen am Neckar, Germany)
item.description:
Everyone has a goal that drives them forward. Our goal is to become the most successful e-commerce company in Europe for Bike and Outdoor. Deep know-how in the core areas of web development, online marketing and the development of our product range have already brought us on the right course. In 2013, we merged with the leading Swedish Outdoor e-commerce firm Addnature in order to further strengthen our international presence. With more than 20 online shops and 1 million page views per day, we are one of the biggest e-commerce firms in Germany. For this reason, we develop and operate our ERP and shop system to 100% in-house and place importance on state-of-the-art technology wherever possible. Buzzword Bingo at its best (JavaScript, HTML, CSS3, MVVM, NodeJs, Mobile, Twitter Bootstrap, MongoDB, Apache Cordova, MeteorJs...).You want to be part of this thriving team? More than 400 motivated colleagues in Stuttgart, Berlin and Stockholm are awaiting your arrival!


As a Front End Developer in our UX team you bring the skills of design and development together. We want you to be the interface between our shop developers and the usability team. You generate new ideas and help develop them. From your experience of creating websites and front end applications you know the ins and outs of CSS and HTML and have a good eye for aesthetics.



Your Tasks:



  • You are part of our UX team and take care of all aspects related to the implementation of new features

  • You provide feedback and collaborate with our designers and developers

  • You help to create and enhance the workflow process for new features

  • You optimize the performance and experience of our shops

  • You improve our products in cooperation with quality assurance and testing

item.title: Mid Level-Entwickler (Java) für Logistik- und Medikationsapplikation at Wiegand AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Erobern Sie mit uns zusammen den deutschen Markt mit einer revolutionären Software für Krankenhäuser und Heime. Werden Sie Mitglied in einem neuen Team und entwickeln Sie unsere Applikation weiter.

Das Software Entwicklungsteam verwendet agile Methoden, sowie modernste Programmiersprachen und Technologien. Wir entwickeln ein SOA-basiertes Gesamtsystem für Medikationssicherheit und Logistik namens MedManager, welches höchste Qualitätsanforderungen erfüllen muss.

Wir befinden sich mitten im Aufbau eines neuen Entwicklungsteams in Berlin und suchen deswegen für dieses Team einen


Java Entwickler


Was ist das Besondere an dieser Stelle?
Kommen Sie in unser junges, engagiertes Team. Entwickeln Sie unsere MedManager Produkte weiter und erobern Sie mit uns neue Märkte. Mit der Software, die Sie entwickeln bzw. bestehende Komponenten verbessern, wird der Medikations- und Logistikprozess innerhalb von Krankenhäusern und Heimen revolutioniert.

Was sind Ihre Aufgaben?



  • Transformation des bisherigen Backends zu einem weiter Standard-orientierten, state-of-art System

  • Konzeption und Umsetzung der Modularisierung der Codebasis, um die fokusierte, zielorientierte Weiterentwicklung der Kernbereiche des Backends zu verbessern

  • In enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem gesamten Entwicklungsteam die Modellierung und Aufteilung der Geschäftslogik verbessern, um die Entkopplung der Komponenten voranzutreiben

  • Ein erfolgreiches Produkt ab einem frühen Stadium aktiv gestalten

  • Den Gestaltungsspielraum über den gesamten Entwicklungszyklus dieser Komponenten hinweg kreativ und sinnvoll nutzen

  • Übernahme der Verantwortung über alle Backend-Komponenten in Absprache mit der Entwicklungsleitung

  • Kundenorientierte Unterstützung des laufenden Projektgeschäfts



Was bieten wir?



  • Start-up Atmosphäre, aber dennoch stabilen Background durch solides Schweizer Mutterhaus

  • Möglichkeit, die erste komplette Software im Bereich der Medikations- und Logistikoptimierung aktiv mitzugestalten

  • Wertschätzung und Gewährleistung von persönlicher Weiterbildung

  • Flache Hierarchien und direkte Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten

  • Flexible Arbeitsgestaltung

  • Umfangreiche Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten im Bereich Medikation und Logistik

item.title: JavaScript Developer (f/m) at iMobility GmbH (Wien, Austria)
item.description:
As a member of our Scrum team you will work together with app developers, backend engineers, product and UX experts to build and extend our platform. We don't compromise on our values and live up to the standard of the manifesto for agile software development and the core scrum framework. We work fast, dedicated and deliver high quality software at technology’s cutting edge to our customers. As JavaScript/HTML5 aficionado you will enrich our team with the skill set necessary to build and maintain our single page web app.


Your duties:



  • Support the product owner and UI/UX designer in planning and concept work

  • Implement user stories and guarantee clean code

  • Implement automated UI tests

  • Support our business intelligence (tracking)

  • Support UX by enabling and implementing A/B tests

  • Support growth hacking with SEO best practices

  • Continuous maintenance, improvement, and optimization of our web app

item.title: Graduate Software Engineers required for fast growing office in Dublin at Arista Networks Inc. (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
As a Graduate Software Engineer your core responsibility is to deliver new product features. A major part of this is writing and owning the code that drives our products. But the role of a C++ Software Engineer is much bigger than ‘simply’ writing code. Software Engineers work on the whole development process, including:




  • suggesting and deciding what features to build




  • driving the design




  • writing the code (of course)




  • pushing, testing, documenting the feature




Engineering Driven. Our engineers have full ownership of their projects. Our management structure is flat and lightweight. Software engineering is run by software engineers -- you are in charge of delivering your work from design to code to test to customer shipment.   


Insane amount of automation! We put a premium on building and using tools that make everyone super-productive. This translates into quicker turnaround times on new features and products for increased revenue with smaller teams.   


We value openness. No part of the company is off-limits, meaning that our engineers have the chance to work on a variety of different areas. Our interns have the same responsibility as our full timers who have the same responsibility as our old timers and all get to work side-by-side on important, customer-impacting projects.

item.title: Frontend Developer (m/f) at GoVios GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Therefore, to strengthen our team in Hamburg we are looking for a


Frontend Developer (m/f)


Your Tasks:



  • Develop the web of tomorrow for the tourism sector

  • Work together and learn from our Senior Frontend Developer

  • Evaluate tools, frameworks and solutions

  • Improve and look after our applications

  • Live our continuous delivery process

item.title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Go, Docker, Polymer) at MEDIGO GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
• Adapt and innovate on new as well as existing services and healthcare-solutions we build with Go and Polymer

  • Support our automatization processes

  • Assist in extending a world class docker-based deployment pipeline

  • Take part in internal and external hackathons to help growth-hack the medical travel market

  • Train and develop yourself and your teammates

  • And lastly, step in where others yield, the startup way

item.title: SEO Full Stack Developer (Symfony2, SOLR, Go) at MEDIGO GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
• Maintain and improve the features of a Symfony2 based marketplace with a focus on speed and SEO-friendliness

  • Take responsibility for all technical aspects of the project, suggest and implement changes by yourself or with the team

  • As a member of the IT-Team, consult our SEO-Experts and related stakeholders on technical possibilities and help steer the SEO-Strategy of our company

  • Support our automatization processes

  • Take part in internal and external hackathons to help growth-hack the medical travel market

  • And lastly, step in where others yield, the startup way

item.title: Backend Developer PHP (m/w) to support our Platform Architecture Team at plista GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for a committed developer (m/f) with a good knowledge of object-oriented programming and an interest in complex and high scalable web applications to develop our technology further. In particular you will develop complex data workflows, which includes the billing system based on PHP as well as the new statistical backend based on the Lambda Architecture Pattern. This combines a layer for real-time and batch views on our statistics.



Your responsibilities:



  • Object-oriented PHP programming at a very high level

  • Development of robust and scalable application components in an agile weekly release cycle

  • Database design and optimization with MySQL and NoSQL such as Redis or MongoDB

  • Knowledge in RabbitMQ is a plus

  • API development for the communication between different system components

  • Test-driven programming

  • Conceptual design, planning and programming of system components

  • Development of specifications together with development team as well as implementation

  • Development of REST APIs

item.title: System Administrator at VMRay GmbH (Bochum, Deutschland)
item.description:
To support our growth and expand our team we are hiring a System Administrator for full-time employment in Bochum


Responsibilities:



  • Design, maintain and document our company’s network and system infrastructure

  • Maintain and monitor network and system security

  • Ensure consistent and scalable network and system infrastructure

  • Install, upgrade and monitor software and hardware (mostly Linux and Windows based)

  • Administer data backup and possible recovery

  • Setup and maintain co-worker desktop and server systems

  • Supervise cloud service (introduce redundancy, create automated backups, etc.)

item.title: Software Engineer Backend / Infrastructure at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Due to trivago’s rapid growth our site's traffic is now reaching around 3 billion requests per month. For this reason we are looking for an experienced Software Engineer with a focus in backend, infrastructure and scalability to join our dynamic Software Engineering department and ensure a reliable, fault-tolerant and scalable production environment. We want all our users to experience trivago at its best, and you are the person who will make this happen. If you work in the backend area of a web stack, are eager for a new challenge and looking for the freedom to experiment with new technologies then we look forward to hearing from you!


Your responsibilities:



  • Build a fault-tolerant and scalable environment to support our rapidly growing business.

  • Research solutions for new projects, pitch pioneering concepts and build prototypes to drive trivago’s technological infrastructure forward.

  • Design and build customized cutting edge tools by experimenting with new technologies.

  • Collaborate with stakeholders and ensure maximum productivity by guaranteeing a reliable production environment.

  • Monitor applications in production (trivago search, hotel management, community etc.) and solve any issues or complications that arise, especially during peak traffic hours.

  • Share your technical know-how with other teams and document your tests, solutions, concepts and approaches for future reference.

item.title: Backend Architect (Node.js) (f/m) at COBI.bike GmbH (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
item.description:
The COBI Software Development Team is seeking a talented, experienced and passionate Backend Architect. He/she is responsible for building fast, scalable and secure backends and services on top of the COBI infrastructure with a strong focus on Node.js and AWS (EC2, RDS, ElastiCache and S3). Future cloud services of COBI will put a strong emphasis on enabling real­time experiences for mobile apps with the Backend Architect playing a leading role in this transition.


What connects us is a passion for cycling, digital technology and good design as well as the desire to try out new things and always question the status quo. We want to make a difference and put ourselves at the forefront of a new movement.


COBI has established a brand new market segment, of which we are the leader. Our partners value this and want to take advantage of this. All of our marketing activities are aimed at making COBI touchable and tangible. We scrutinize every action to ensure that it delivers the COBI experience – whether by trying it out, listening to experiences from others or from a trusted partner. The user, rather than technology, is our key priority.


The ideal candidate will have a great passion for COBI and execute all activities with respect to the COBI brand strategy.


This position is located at our headquarters in Frankfurt/Main, Germany.


Responsibilities:




  • Working together with our Mobile App teams to build fast, scalable and efficient Mobile API syncing services with real­time components




  • Support in defining and building APIs and processes to connect with third party platforms (e.g. E­Commerce, CRMs, ERPs)




  • Building maintainable and high performance database architectures on SQL and NoSQL database servers




  • Ensuring technical procedures meet the COBI quality and security standards




  • Estimating efforts for both features and entire projects




  • Writing unit tests and API tests




  • Support in maintaining our cloud infrastructure on AWS

item.title: Lead Software Development, Senior Engineer at JLI John Locke Investments (Paris, France)
item.description:
John Locke Investments (JLI) is an independent alternative asset management company serving the needs of a wide range of international clients. Based in Fontainebleau, France our team is dedicated to the task of delivering consistently high risk-adjusted returns across a full spectrum of asset classes and markets. A testament to our success is the client base that we have built up since our inception in 2001. Indeed, we are happy to count some of the world's largest financial institutions amongst our relationships.


We believe that the most valuable asset of any business is its human capital. Therefore, we are committed to attract and retain the most talented and highly motivated individuals seeking a career in quantitative investment management.


Your main missions in the team include:



  • Developing and supporting core libraries (C#) and tools used by the team,

  • Building a detailed understanding of current tools and software in order to facilitate team’s decisions and future architectural choices,

  • Working closely with other developers and the operational side to create state of the art software,

  • Promoting coding standard, code quality and software security.

item.title: Engineering Manager at Deliveroo (London, UK)
item.description:
At Deliveroo were striving to build Londons best engineering organisation.

Were dedicated to building a collaborative and supportive culture. We are not directive. We set goals and objectives and offer advice. We empower our engineers to find solutions to problems at the edge of computer science at great scale. We trust them to use their time wisely.

Our teams are solving unique and difficult problems at scale in an energetic and hyper-growth environment. Were growing incredibly quickly and we need experienced technical managers to help us scale.

Were looking for engineering managers at all levels of experience from managing one or two teams (10-12 people) to directing at a group level (25 people and up).

Over the next 12 months youll be:

  • Line manager to one or more teams of backend, iOS, Android and web engineers as well as data scientists and QA Analysts.
  • Working with your team and colleagues right across the company to formulate team goals and then support your team in succeeding against them.
  • More than doubling your team size and nurturing a diverse, highly skilled group of engineers, data scientist and QA analysts.
  • Creating a learning environment for your team and act as a mentor for engineers and up and coming leaders within your group.
  • Becoming instrumental in improving and implementing processes and values that help us continue to be effective as the company scales.

Benefits


  • Fantastic exposure to scaling a tech team at an incredible pace
  • Top end machinery
  • Training stipend - a conference of your choice
  • Subsidised gym membership at a proper fancy gym down the road
  • Regular off-sites with the team, as well as game nights, and the legendary Bun-day Monday
  • Ping-pong table, PS4, dartboard and foosball table as standard office furniture
  • Food. So much food. Nom Nom
  • Located within easy reach of several incredible restaurants

item.title: Technical Operations Engineer (m/f) at Freeletics GmbH (München, Germany)
item.description:
FREELETICS


Freeletics is the most efficient and motivating way to become athletic. Anywhere and anytime. No weights or machines. Athletes receive their training plans, connect themselves and compare their workout times via the Freeletics app and website. We count more than 11,000,000 registered users around the globe. And thousands more every day. We are growing. Rapidly. And this is just the beginning. We are always looking for ambitious, talented and motivated people to join us in Munich. Hard work, passion and an awesome team. The chance of your life.


WE ARE LOOKING FOR TECHNICAL OPERATIONS ENGINEERS (M/F)


As part of our operations team you make sure Freeletics services scales with its users. You will contribute to a lean, friendly engineering team that values collaboration, constant improvement, and positive feedback. High Impact, No Limits. Join the Freeletics team now!


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Run our heavily used production platform in a 24x7 mode

  • Support the team on operations topics - deployment & automation

  • Improve our existing platform concerning scalability, deployments and reliability 

  • Monitor the platform to know issues before our users do


YOUR PROFILE



  • Solid experience in administering Linux/UNIX systems 

  • Familiarity with public cloud environments (e.g. AWS) and platform automation

  • Solid experience with Docker and Docker orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes)

  • Solid scripting skills (e.g. Ruby, Perl, Python, shell)

  • Experience in managing and tuning PostgreSQL servers

  • Experience with platform monitoring (e.g. New Relic, ELK, Nagios, Grafana)

  • Hands on approach with a “getting things done” mentality 

  • Team player, happy working in an Agile environment 


WHY WORK AT FREELETICS?



  • A team of smart and extremely motivated co-workers

  • High impact and responsibility in a fast growing company

  • Social activities (food, drinks, events)

  • Learn & Teach culture (Meetups, Techtalks, training) 

  • Quiet developer room

  • Buddy Programme

  • Freeletics Library

  • Central location - very close to public transport


Would you like more insights? Then check out our team page https://www.freeletics.com/de/corporate


Ready to kick ass? Apply now!

item.title: iOS Entwickler, 70-100% at Threema GmbH (Freienbach, Schweiz)
item.description:
Wir, die Threema GmbH, sind eine kleines Unternehmen mit rund 10 Mitarbeitern. Wie bieten eine kollegiale Startup-Atmosphäre, wo sich jeder einbringen und das Unternehmen und die Produkte mitgestalten kann. Wir lieben die Softwareentwicklung und die technischen Herausforderungen. Ebenso stark halten wir aber unsere Freizeit- und Privatleben in Ehren. Wer sich nach einer neuen Herausforderung in einem kleinem Team mit spannenden Aufgaben und flexiblen Arbeitszeiten sehnt, ist bei uns genau richtig.


Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir einen qualifizierten Software Engineer (m/w) für die Weiterentwicklung unserer iOS-Apps. Es erwarten dich…



  • eine spannende Aufgabe in einem dynamischen, technologiefokussierten Startup-Unternehmen, das von den Gründern und Inhabern selbst geführt wird

  • die Möglichkeit, die Zukunft von Threema aktiv mitzugestalten

  • ein unkompliziertes, motiviertes Team

  • eine optimale Infrastruktur für Entwickler

  • Freiheit bei der Einrichtung der Entwicklungsumgebung und Hardware

  • flexible Arbeitszeiten, Teilzeit und Home-Office-Tage möglich

  • faire Entlöhnung

  • sehr gute Versicherungsleistungen

  • Unterstützung bei allfälligem Umzug in den Grossraum Zürich


Unser Büro befindet sich idyllischen Pfäffikon SZ und ist verkehrstechnisch bestens erschlossen und damit rasch, z. B. von Zürich aus, zu erreichen.


Deine Aufgaben…



  • Du übernimmst den iOS-Lead und entwickelst die Threema-Apps für iOS weiter (GUI und Back-End)

  • Du bringst neue Ideen für Features und allgemeine Entwicklungen

  • Du gestaltest die Entwicklung neuer Produkte mit

  • Du optimierst auch Arbeitsprozesse und wirst beim Business Development miteinbezogen

Wir sind eine digitale, unabhängige Kommunikationsagentur mit 120 Köpfen. Im Herzen von Stuttgart und am Puls von Berlin. item.title: Team Lead Core Platform at Funding Circle CE GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Funding Circle is developing platforms in the peer-to-peer lending space. Our technology stack includes PHP/Symfony, Apache Kafka, Puppet, RabbitMQ, and the usual suspects. The system is composed of multiple services in different languages, uses continuous integration, and has to scale to support millions of payments.


We are part of the global Funding Circle team, so you'll have colleagues in London and San Francisco, that are living at the cutting (and sometimes bleeding) edge with Clojure, Mesos, Docker and more.


Your mission to lead the core platform team in the Berlin office to the next levels of engineering practises and mastery of Symfony and the surrounding tool chain, while ensuring high quality delivery of the stories and epics. Our key metrics include velocity and percentage of first time right stories. The team develops the core operational platform for our business across continental Europe.


Responsibilities



  • Lead development team to deliver features and platforms, reporting directly to the Continental Europe CTO

  • Process improvements across all IT teams

  • Architecture and design of production systems

  • Production system administration

  • Alignment with business stakeholders

  • Safeguard the integrity and coherency of the platforms

item.title: PHP Web Developer at Hays Specialist Recruitment Ltd (Birmingham, UK)
item.description:
PHP Web Developer required £39,924 - £42,742 + 32d Hol + 8 bank holidays + Health & Life cover + many other benefits

Birmingham City University (BCU) is a large, diverse and increasingly popular place to study. They are defined by their core values of "Excellence, People focus, Partnership working and Fairness & Integrity".

The 22,500 students are at the heart of everything they do. They are from over 80 countries and can access an enviable range of facilities with even more planned. The Complete University Guide ranked BCU as top 30 UK University for spending on facilities in 2015.

They are in the midst of transformation. BCU is investing £260 million in its estate including a major expansion of the city centre campus at Eastside adjacent to the planned HS2 Curzon Street station. This provides opportunities to make substantial fundamental changes to our learning environment and operations.
An opportunity has arisen for a proven PHP Web Developer to join a busy in house Development team. If successful, you will be joining a multi-disciplined software development team consisting of backend integrators, web developers, web designers, development DBAs and the QA testers.

Essential Skills:

* 3 years backend PHP experience
* 3 years mySQL experience
* Able to configure apache web servers for hosting of web sites, apps, open source CMSs such as Wordpress
* 3 years front end development experience in JavaScript
* 2 years experience of using jQuery
* 3 years design experience in Photoshop or Fireworks
* Use of source control repositories such as GIT, SVN or TFS.
* Experience of Moodle VLE
* Experience of configuring and developing WordPress

Desirable skills:

* Able to create conceptual designs and take through wireframing & mocking to working pages and UAT.
* Any exposure to ASP.NET and C# or VB.NET would be highly advantageous.
* Experience in Agile/Scrum development methodologies.

As this is a friendly and collaborative team with a positive culture you will need to have good interpersonal skills and have a good standard of written and verbal communication.

The role demands someone who is naturally interested and in-touch with the latest web technologies. You will be confident in communicating at all levels and will be passionate about knowledge sharing to enhance the overall quality of the team. Experience in e-learning environments is an advantage but not essential.

This exciting position is paying a good salary and a very attractive benefits package including 32 days Holiday plus 8 bank holidays, Career Average Pension, sickness & absence entitlement, Private Health, On site gym, Life Assurance, Travel card Scheme, Car parking, Cycle to work scheme, car share scheme and catering.

The immediate location for this role will be North Birmingham with later relocation near to the City Centre scheduled for later on in the year. The post holder will be required to travel between Birmingham sites as per operational requirements.

If you are ready for this challenge and have the necessary experience please submit an up to date copy of your CV outlining your relevant skills and experience, together with your notice period/availability or call Daney on 0121 230 1455.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

You will be part of our app team and work on the Panono Android-App which links the Panono Camera to the Panono Cloud. The app is needed to control the Panono Camera, to download the panoramas from the camera and to upload them to the Panono Cloud service. item.title: Android Application Engineer at ZENLY (Paris, France)
item.description:
We are looking for a Android Developer who loves to create beautiful consumer products in order to participate in the development of Zenly. As part of the application/engagement team you will be dealing with following tasks:


- Ensure the development Zenly's application architecture so it can adapt to any use cases (network environment, various devices, application load...), and evolution of the application.


- Develop UI components, including custom animations, that should run smoothly in all conditions.


- Follow up on the impact on your work to the users through a set of well defined KPIs.


You’ve developed complex applications with elaborate user interface elements and mixed various transitions and animations. You know that any little detail can impact the user experience and some of them may even require a more in-depth look into any given codebase : startup time, animation frame rate, intelligent error handling and so on.


Your motto: the only way to achieve a maximum level of quality is to live day and night with the product you develop and be the first user of your application. You feel right at home in fast paced environments where you'll be constantly outside your comfort zone.


Above all, you want to be proud to be part of a team whose passion, independence and curiosity are the main drivers. You want to learn and become the best in your field.

As a key member of our agile scrum team, you work closely with our development team and take an active role in all testing acitvities to ensure a flawless working product.

item.title: Backend Developer at GitLab () (allows remote)
item.description:
GitLab Inc. is a company based on the GitLab open-source project. GitLab is a community project to which over 1,000 people worldwide have contributed. We are an active participant in this community, trying to serve its needs and lead by example. We have one vision: everyone can contribute to all digital content, and our mission is to change all creative work from read-only to read-write so that everyone can contribute.


We value results, transparency, sharing, freedom, efficiency, frugality, collaboration, directness, kindness, diversity, boring solutions, and quirkiness. If these values match your personality, work ethic, and personal goals, we encourage you to visit ourprimer to learn more. Open source is our culture, our way of life, our story, and what makes us truly unique.


Top 10 reasons to work for GitLab:



  1. Work with helpful, kind, motivated, and talented people.

  2. Work remote so you have no commute and are free to travel and move.

  3. Have flexible work hours so you are there for other people and free to plan the day how you like.

  4. Everyone works remote, but you don't feel remote. We don't have a head office, so you're not in a satellite office.

  5. Work on open source software so you can interact with a large community and can show your work.

  6. Work on a product you use every day: we drink our own wine.

  7. Work on a product used by lots of people that care about what you do.

  8. As a company we contribute more than we take, most of our work is released as the open source GitLab CE.

  9. Focussed on results, not on long hours, so that you can have a life and don't burn out.

  10. Open internal processes: know what you're getting in to and be assured we're thoughtful and effective.


See our culture page for more!


At GitLab, developers are highly independent and self-organized individual contributors who work together as a tight team in aremote and agile way.


Most backend developers work on all aspects of GitLab, building features, fixing bugs, and generally improving the application. Some developers specialize and focus on a specific area, such as packaging, performance or GitLab CI. Developers can specialize immediately after joining, or after some time, when they have gained familiarity with many areas of GitLab and find one they would like to focus on.


Responsibilities



  • Develop features from proposal to polished end result.

  • Support and collaborate with our service engineers in getting to the bottom of user-reported issues and come up with robust solutions.

  • Engage with the core team and the open source community to collaborate on improving GitLab.

  • Manage and review code contributed by the rest of the community and work with them to get it ready for production.

  • Create and maintain documentation around features and configuration to save our users time.

  • Take initiative in improving the software in small or large ways to address pain points in your own experience as a developer.

  • Keep code easy to maintain and keep it easy for others to contribute code to GitLab.

  • Qualify developers for hiring.
