item.title: SOFTWARE ARCHITECT M/F at FlixBus (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Who we are


FlixBus is a European long distance mobility provider with headquarters in Munich, Berlin, Milan, Paris and Zagreb. Since 2013, FlixBuses have offered a new, convenient and green way to travel which suits every budget. Thanks to a smart business model and an innovative technology, the former startup has established Europe's largest intercity bus network in less than four years.

To support our team we are currently looking for Software Architect (m/f) based in Munich and Berlin.


Your tasks


Facilitate Architecture: Instead of enforcing architectural solutions, you facilitate creation and evolution of the architecture collaboratively.
Requirements engineering: You work closely with the Product Owner and the business stakeholders to validate business ideas and their feasibility.
Communication: You communicate decisions whenever necessary but understand that documentation is a living process.
Coaching: Teach teams new architectural patterns and practices to help them grow as engineers.
Evaluation: You evaluate and introduce new technologies and tools that can accelerate feature delivery.
Culture: You foster and establish a culture of Software Craftmanship. You value maintainable, readable and testable code and constantly promote these values within the team.
Hands-On: You work hands-on with the team (pairing, mob programming, prototyping) to validate your own design ideas early.


Our offer


The possibility to work flexibly, goal oriented, and independently in an experienced and professional team.
Come work on a product with incredible non-digital value: We offer the chance for you to change how millions of people commute, spend their weekends, and discover the world.
The chance to develop and implement your own ideas.

item.title: Frontend Developer at Sympa (Lahti, Finland)
item.description:
Paikka globaalin pilvisoftan kehityskärjessä avoinna!


Etsimme Frontend Developeria kehittämään kanssamme maailmanluokan pilvipalvelua, Pohjoismaiden nopeimmin yleistyvää ja Suomen suosituinta HR-järjestelmää. Tuotekehitystiimiimme kuuluu parikymmentä tekijää eri taustoilla: ohjelmistokehittäjistä testaajiin. Sympalaisia yhdistää intohimo töitä kohtaan ja halu kehittyä siinä. Haluatko mukaan joukkoomme?


Tiimimme sijaitsee Lahdessa, tunnin päässä Helsingin rautatieasemalta, Lahden uuden matkakeskuksen vieressä. Yhteensä sympalaisia on 60, Lahden toimiston ja Vantaan pääkonttorin lisäksi kollegamme löytyvät Kööpenhaminasta, Amsterdamista sekä Tukholmasta.


Yrityksemme työkulttuurissa korostuu nopeasta kansainvälisestä kasvusta huolimatta pienen toimijan ketteryys, päätökset tehdään nopeasti ja meitä kaikkia arvostetaan työssämme.


Tarjoamme uudelle Frontend Developerille:



  • Työn modernin, kasvavan ja globaalin pilvisoftan kehityskärjessä

  • Vakaan työpaikan sekä rennon, mutta kunnianhimoisen työilmapiirin, jossa ideoita ja huonoja vitsejä viljellään toimenkuvaan katsomatta

  • Pääset hyödyntämään osaamistasi monipuolisesti, ja haastamaan kykysi joka päivä ketterien menetelmien parissa

  • Mahdollisuuden käyttää parhaimpia työkaluja modernien teknologioiden parissa (ohjelmointikielet, frameworkit, kehitystyökalut)

  • Aikaa myös omille projekteillesi, ystäville ja perheelle. Me viihdymme työpaikalla, mutta arvostamme myös vapaa-aikaamme. Ja niin tekee työnantajammekin!


Haluatko mukaan kasvuun ja huippujengiin?
Kerro meille lisää itsestäsi, lähetä hakemuksesi viimeistään 30.11.2016.


Tai haluatko kuulla lisää tehtävästä tai meistä?
Soita, käydään vaikka yhdessä lounaalla niin kerromme lisää.
Development Manager, Mikko Pantsari + 358 40 5367 535
Lead Architect: Juho Rutila +358 44 767 1369

item.title: Senior Software Developer (f/m) - IoT Open Source Projects at Bosch Software Innovations GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Take on topics that are the future. Be part of fascinating software projects and join a team that is out to move mountains. We’re looking for bright sparks with plenty of passion and commitment.


We offer the topics of tomorrow. Exciting software projects. And a team that wants to work together to make a difference. We are looking for bright minds full of commitment and enthusiasm!


Bosch Software Innovations, the Bosch Group's software and system house, is a leading global technology and services provider. We design, develop, and operate innovative software and system solutions that help our customers all around the world – both in the traditional enterprise environment and in the Internet of Things (IoT).


We are looking for a Senior Software Developer (f/m) for IoT Open Source projects for our location in Berlin, Immenstaad, or Waiblingen.


Tasks:



  • You participate in open source projects in the Eclipse, Apache and Cloud Foundry Foundation as a contributor, committer and development project lead

  • You present these projects at international conferences and promote the use of the resulting software within the Bosch Group and with international partners

  • As an experienced Senior Software Developer, you participate in architecture and design discussions in the community, perform code reviews of external contributions and support new project members as a mentor

  • You support our service and solution developers in the selection of open source technologies and their integration and active participation in the relevant open source projects


Requirements



  • You have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent

  • You have at least 5 years of experience in software development. In addition to in-depth knowledge of the Java programming language and the application of current Java frameworks and Web technologies (for example, REST, JavaScript), the knowledge of other programming languages (for example, C / C ++ and scripting languages) and programming concepts would be a plus

  • You have already gained extensive knowledge in open source projects and ideally you have already successfully participated in the development of open source projects in the area of IoT or have conducted corresponding projects

  • Excellent communication skills (both writing and speaking) in English and German


Are you interested in? Please use our online contact form to submit your application.


Contact human resources: Ulrike Smolny, Tel.: +49 30 726112 177

item.title: Senior Android Developer at Instabridge (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Instabridge is building the world's best wifi client and the world's largest virtual wifi network. We're funded by some of Europe's leading investors and are now looking for a highly skilled Android developer to join our small but ambitious team.


At Instabridge the Android app is not an afterthought and not a clone of an iOS app. It's the main focus of the company. Your work will be absolutely central to what we do.


We are based in Stockholm, Sweden, but we want to hire the best developers out there, and that means not limiting our search to a single, small Scandinavian capital. If you want to move here to work with us, that’s great. If you want to stay where you are, that’s also fine. As long as you ship code, you can work from wherever you like.


What we offer


- An opportunity to get in on the ground floor on one of Europe’s hottest startups (we didn’t say it, blame Wired!)


- Work on stuff that your friends, family and colleagues will use


- Competitive pay and generous stock options program


- Flexible work hours


- A small but very diverse team


- Fun!

item.title: Java Software Engineer at IMC Financial Markets (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
IMC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone doesn’t cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win. 


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


SOFTWARE ENGINEERING AT IMC:


We trade in the most competitive markets across the globe.  Our software makes millions of trading decisions daily.  We win by making better and faster decisions than our competition. As a software developer you’ll be working alongside traders to implement strategies which will challenge you to be creative with your implementation. You’ll need to timely produce high quality solutions meeting requirements and managing overall complexity of our systems. You’ll be working in a highly motivated team, controlling end-to-end product development.  We work in an environment where slight oversights can be extremely costly, while new features can be extremely profitable.  As a team we aim to balance the race to production with software quality and testability.  You’ll be placed in an environment consisting primarily of C++ and Java.  We have a build chain which has been designed around the concept of daily production releases.  A variety of systems and technologies keeps life interesting.


Upon joining you will be expected to manage your own time and tasks.  We rely on our developers to drive change by taking feedback from traders, and shaping that into an implementation.  Your ownership of the task continues until a working production release.  Our most successful developers comfortably work in any part of our stack.

item.title: Senior Rendering Engineer for PlayStation 4 - CRYENGINE at Crytek GmbH (Frankfurt, Germany)
item.description:
Crytek is looking for a Senior Rendering Engineer for the PlayStation 4 Console to join the CRYENGINE R&D team in our Frankfurt, Germany studio.


At Crytek we hire amazing people to make great things happen.


For over 15 years, we’ve been at the cutting-edge of computer graphics performance. We continually invest in our team and tech as we push the boundaries of the digital visual arts on the latest platforms.


Our award-winning CRYENGINE empowers developers and creatives at our own studios and licensees worldwide – from small indies to AAA powerhouses - to deliver unique experiences, create new worlds and ultimately make awesome games.


Join us and we’ll invent the future together.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain CRYENGINE's cutting-edge rendering system.

  • Research, prototype and implement scalable solutions for high-quality rendering in a realtime context.

  • Perform CPU and GPU performance profiling and optimization on several high-end platforms.

  • Work closely with artists and content creators to build up highly efficient production workflows.

  • Work with game teams to achieve visually stunning game experiences.

  • Collaborate with other engineers to form a highly creative and productive team.

item.title: Applications Developer at Whitworth Bros. Ltd. (Little Irchester, UK)
item.description:
In a growing and developing IT environment we have a fantastic opportunity for an ambitious, forward thinking individual to develop a new framework and user interface to deliver a cohesive solution to take the company forward to a new era in this digital age.


The company is evolving and growing rapidly and has identified that in order to continue this growth it needs to invest more in building a company fit for the digital age. The result is a role which will allow the individual to help define and build the processes and environment for a new team within the business. You would be expected to deliver new systems and also enhancements to bring together existing applications within a Microsoft environment. This will involve working at every stage of the development cycle from requirements capture, design, development, testing, release management and providing on-going support to our customers and users. Based at our head office in Wellingborough you will also be working with users across all of our sites across the Company.


You will work closely with the Applications Development Manager and representatives across the company at all levels to identify and deliver benefits to the business. Agility is a key attribute to adapt to changing needs and priorities whilst delivering solutions through continuous development and delivery that bring the business to life in a cohesive and well-designed manner.


We are looking for a forward thinking individual who can work with the business areas to improve and expand the usage of digital systems whilst helping to improve the skills of individuals using the systems we build and also in providing new tools to help improve and define business processes.


The individual will be expected to pro-actively look for new ideas to benefit the business whilst ensuring that any new developments are implemented and accepted by the users based on the improvements delivered.

item.title: Fullstack Developer (M/F) who wants to make the world a more mobile place needed at Move24 GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Move24’s vision is to build the world's leading moving company and to deliver high quality products towards customer and local moving partners. In order to balance supply and demand as well as ensuring service quality, Move 24 will create technology-enabled operations to revolutionize the moving jobs industry. From Berlin's headquarter Move24 operates into different European markets such as Germany, UK, Italy and France and aims to become both the fastest growing moving jobs platform and a strong and trustful brand.


We are currently looking for experienced developers with outstanding PHP and Frontend (HTML5, JavaScript) skills to join our highly professional IT team and to help us successfully build a technically driven business from scratch. In this position you will develop complex and highly scalable business applications, establish architecture and frameworks for future platform development and contribute ideas to product development.



  • Design and development of unique and complex web applications and web services using cutting edge technologies

  • Ensuring code quality and improving development processes

  • Continuous improvement of our platform in terms of availability, scalability, performance and usability

  • Cross functional cooperation with other departments like Product Management, Operations and Marketing

item.title: Performance Analyst/Data Scientist at IMC Financial Markets (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Performance Analyst


IMC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone doesn’t cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technologies win.


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Are you driven by your curiosity and desire to learn?


Role description



IMC is currently looking for a talented and passionate Performance Analyst to play a critical hands-on role in the analysis, optimization, and continuous tuning of our complete trading stack, in order to improve performance of our low latency trading systems on financial exchanges.


As a performance analyst, you will interact heavily with other teams and be exposed to low latency technologies such as microwave links and FPGAs that are being used by thousands of trading applications daily.


Your primary source of information are full network captures that amount to terabytes of data per day. The right candidate is somebody very fluent in pushing this information to databases, cleaning, and analyzing it in multiple ways to find correlations that explain the root cause of very difficult IT pattern


This analysis work is to be complemented with extensive Modelling work, in order to simulate the complete IT infrastructure that we are facing, and suggest performance improvements of our low latency trading systems.

item.title: Sr Backend Developer (PHP) at the fastest growing adtech company in Berlin! at Glispa Global Group (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
glispa's Ad Tech powers monetization solutions for thousands of publishers. It connects advertisers to their target audiences and shows the most relevant offers to end­users. We build high available, scalable systems from client and campaign management, reporting and automated billing to ad servers, event processing, analytics, data mining and prediction.


We build high available, scalable systems from client and campaign management, reporting and automated billing to ad servers, event processing, analytics, data mining and prediction.


By joining glispa, you will work in small collaborative cross functional teams with an agile workflow. Right from the start you will contribute to one or more components and take on ownership.


With the volumes of data we move, we keep pushing the boundaries of existing technologies - our systems are constantly evolving to keep up with the pace in online marketing. We strongly benefit from open source software and love to contribute back to the community.


We are looking for an experienced and passionate Senior Backend Developer (PHP) for continuously improving our service oriented backend system. You will work in a team of developers to further design and implement our RESTful API and to optimize code and database for high performance.


Key responsibilities



  • Develop, improve, and maintain our backend system, specifically focusing on our API

  • Design and implement scalable, clean solutions

  • Process and analyze large datasets

  • Identify use of new technologies, active involvement in providing solutions to technical challenges

Dein Daily Business

nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen



SAP Anwendungsprogrammierer m/w


(Referenz-Nummer 2016-0021)

Tätigkeiten:

    Berechtigungskonzepts

Ihr PLUS:

Erfahrung mit ABAP-Programmierung und -Customizing in den zentralen SAP R/3-Modulen, sowie in der SAP-Basis Betreuung. Eine eigenständige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise, gute Kenntnisse der englischen Sprache und der gängigen MS-Office-Anwendungen, sowie die Bereitschaft zu gelegentlicher Reisetätigkeit runden Ihr Profil ab.

Unser PLUS:
Wir bieten Ihnen eine interessante Aufgabe mit der Möglichkeit, den Erfolg des Unternehmens aktiv mit zu gestalten. Außerdem ein kollegiales Umfeld und eine gute Arbeitsatmosphäre, in der Sie Ihre individuellen Stärken voll einbringen und an neuen Heraus­forderungen wachsen können.

Interessiert? Dann steht Ihnen für erste Auskünfte Frau Cathrin Hellge, Personalabteilung (Telefon 07143/373- 183) zur Verfügung.

Die KOMET GROUP ist einer der führenden Komplettanbieter für Präzisionswerkzeuge. Unsere weltweit über 1600 Mitarbeiter verstehen sich als kreative Experten und Träger des technologischen Fortschritts und bieten unseren Kunden für alle Prozessstufen der Bearbeitung durch maßgeschneiderte, innovative Lösungen ein Plus zur wirtschaftlichen Fertigung.


KOMET GROUP GmbH
Zeppelinstraße 3 · 74354 Besigheim

item.title: Backend-Entwickler / Software Architekt (m/w) at For Sale Digital Internet-Agentur GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Du bist Teil unseres Entwickler-Teams, das für die Programmierung aller Web-Anwendungen verantwortlich ist. Zusammen mit den Kollegen aus Konzeption, Grafik, Web-Produktion und Qualitätssicherung entwickelst Du für unsere Kunden stabile und sichere Systeme – von kleineren Microsites bis zu großen datenbankgestützten Backoffices, von mobilen Anwendungen bis zu komplexen Webauftritten und Shop-Systemen.


Dafür analysierst Du die technischen Anforderungen unserer Kunden und entwickelst daraus die technischen Konzepte. Du entwirfst Datenbankschemata, realisierst die Modelle typischerweise mit MySQL und entwickelst Anwendungen in PHP – alles unter Anwendung der üblichen Versionskontrollsysteme und Testing-Verfahren. Du hast Spaß an technischen Innovationen und bringst neue Impulse in die Prozesse unserer Entwicklung.

item.title: Tech Lead at Doctolib (Paris, France)
item.description:
Doctolib cherche à constituer la meilleure équipe de développeurs Ruby on Rails d'Europe pour concevoir et développer les produits de la e-santé de demain. Tu rejoindras une des startups européennes les plus prometteuses et seras directement rattaché(e) aux CTOs et co-fondateurs de Doctolib.

Notre stack :
- Ruby on Rails 4.0 (upgrade très prochainement) avec du Ruby 2.2
- PostgreSQL et Redis pour stocker des millions de RDV et de patients
- React/Flux/RxJS pour la partie Front
- Beaucoup de tests d'intégrations, Capybara/PhantomJS dans un CI pour recetter en temps réel
- Chef pour tout déployer sur notre cloud privée
- Git pour source control
- Un état d'esprit agile pour nous permettre de déployer en production tous les jours

Missions :
- Designer et implémenter de nouvelles fonctionnalités en collaboration avec le Product Manager
- Travailler en équipe pour assurer la qualité et la maintenabilité du code
- Surveiller attentivement les performances et les erreurs afin de garantir une expérience unique pour nos utilisateurs
- Développer rapidement des Proofs of Concept pour avoir un retour de nos utilisateurs quotidiennement
- Travailler sur toutes les briques applicatives de Doctolib (API, mobile, SEO)

item.title: Frontend Javascript-Developer (m/f) at Civey (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Are you interested in politics? And a Frontend Developer (m/f) who is in love with the modern technology stack like ES6, React and Webpack? You seek for a position with responsibility and impact?! Do you want to work in a fast growing successful company with flat hierarchies and customised working environment that fits your needs? Use your skills for democracy in real time and apply!


Your Work


You develop, test, document and maintain our JS driven web application. You ensure quality code with reviews and alignment with strong engineering principles and standards. You cooperate with backend developers to develop high-quality products with a focus on scalability. You also collaborate directly with product management, marketing, design and our other developers


Your Benefits


We combine a precise business model with the desire to advance society. We value fairness, transparency and constructive criticism. You can expect a steep learning curve and the possibility to advance your career. We offer full-time work in a dynamic and friendly environment, a fair salary and family-friendly work hours


Skills & Requirements


You have strong JavaScript skills using newest coding, testing, debugging, and automation techniques and are up to date with the latest topics in frontend programming. You have at least 2 years of experience working as a developer and can provide good insights on the tradeoffs between frontend JS frameworks like Angular, React, Knockout, etc. Developing highly functional, data-rich web applications with dynamic, JS-driven interfaces is no problem for you. You are familiar with Jenkins or other automated build tool.

item.title: DATA ENGINEER M/F at FlixBus (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Who we are


FlixBus is a European long distance mobility provider and a brand of the FlixMobility group. Since 2013, FlixBuses have offered a new, convenient and green way to travel which suits every budget. Thanks to a smart business model and an innovative technology, the former startup has established Europe's largest intercity bus network in less than four years.

We want to grow our successful German business and therefore we are looking for a Data Engineer (m/f) to join our Data Science team based in Berlin.


Your tasks


You will be responsible for building a platform for running machine learning models at scale, collecting and combining data from various data sources, and helping Data Scientists to automate their routine tasks to boost their productivity.



Our offer


The possibility to work flexibly and independently in a goal-oriented, experienced and professional team
Be a part of an elite international team – we are from 12 countries and counting!
The once in a lifetime chance to participate in the development of the next big thing in a totally new and innovative market
The chance to develop and implement your own ideas
Professional training and continuing education

item.title: Software developer Patient Data Management at Brainlab AG (Feldkirchen, Germany)
item.description:
Nowadays, patient treatment involves many different stages. From admitting a patient, to preliminary consultations in offices or meeting rooms through to treatment in the operating theatre, different information is required at the right place at the right time.


In order to cover more and more complex medical scenarios, a software infrastructure on separate systems is required which allows the coordination of separate software components and the processing of necessary steps and calculations in a suitable order. In addition to this, the synchronization and networking of many hospital systems is vital - between Brainlab systems as well as with systems from other manufacturers, for example with PACS or hospital information systems.


As a member of our project team, you are responsible for developing this infrastructure to manage software applications and the increasing amount of data which is part of this complex and broad field. You work as part of our team responsible for "Brainlab Operating System" and thereby create a solid base upon which our other developer teams can run their applications. Through these tasks, we ensure a uniform software environment and user experience for all Brainlab systems, both local and cloud applications.


Together with a team of software developers, project engineers and project managers, you will be making an important contribution to intelligent workflow control, intuitive interfaces and intelligent data management, which optimize the working processes used when treating patients.

item.title: Android Developer at Degoo (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
“How about we give 100 GB free cloud storage to our users”


That’s what we said after we designed and tested our new highly efficient storage that will change the way we store data online. We are a team of 4 working to revolutionize the cloud storage industry forever.


4 million users later, we are now one of the fastest growing startup in Stockholm with more than 500.000 users signing up in the last 20 days. We’re also rapidly catching up with the big providers, such as Dropbox and Google Drive. And now running towards increasing our user base by another 10X.


What’s the next big challenge?


The only way to achieve 10X more active happy users is to make their user experience delightful and our overall product offering so compelling that we become the number one choice when people think of a cloud storage provider.


So, we are looking for a truly passionate Android developer who can help us make our Android app one of the most popular cloud storage app in the world.


We believe, you love to polish to seemingly tiny details and understand that it’s the relentless focus on the user experience that separates an average product from insanely great product.


Your typical day? Nah, there’s nothing like that.


You will be doing a very varied set of fun and challenging tasks that ensures that you will learn something new every day.


One day you might creating a split test for a new feature we’ve built and the next day you’re involved with important strategic decisions or advanced code optimizations. If you want to be constantly challenged and build something that has very large impact then we are waiting to talk to you.


Who are we and What do we offer?


We are an ambitious team of 4 awaiting to give you an opportunity of a lifetime to influence the direction of a product used by millions. If you love solving large scale problems in an organization with minimal bureaucracy and internal politics then there’s a chair waiting for you.


Together we will offer the best possible user experience for our millions of Android users.


We are constantly meeting amazing developers for this position, so if this intrigues you, apply today and we'll get back to you asap.

item.title: Python Qt Client Software Engineer at SpiderOak, Inc. (Kansas City, MO) (allows remote)
item.description:
SpiderOak is looking for an energetic and enthusiastic mid-to-senior level Python / PyQt developer to join the engineering team. SpiderOak ONE is the original and leading Zero Knowledge cloud backup and file sync tool. You will be working with the ONE product team to drive new features and advance the UX of the product. You'll also be working with our business-side product team to turn customer asks and user stories into fully-fledged features within the product. Our goal is not to present just the best UI for privacy-centric products, but the best UI, period. We take the security and privacy of our customer's data very seriously, so some understanding of the seriousness of our goals is important- if you believe mining user data is the key to monetization, or security is a secondary concern, we will not be a good fit.


You'll have a lot of latitude in crafting the right solutions to problems you've been given to solve. We're a global team with an all-remote Engineering workforce, and we make heavy use of our tools to keep flowing and working with each other- using git, videoconferences, issue tracking, wiki, and Semaphor to communicate and understand what each other is up to. We enjoy working with remote team members who are remote because they happen to like where they live, not because they're working remote to avoid human interaction.

item.title: Cloud Engineer (Senior) at inQdo (Utrecht, Netherlands)
item.description:
Al bezig met goede voornemens voor 2017? Wij wel! Onze markt en ons bedrijf groeien sterk. Daarom zijn wij op zoek naar minstens 2 nieuwe collega’s die met ons mee willen groeien in het nieuwe jaar voor de functie van:

Cloud Engineer (Senior)

Ben je een ervaren system engineer die al zijn sporen verdiend heeft op het gebied van opzet en beheer van complexe High Performance Enterprise omgevingen op een Cloud platform en het liefst met AWS? Heb je de DevOps en Agile werkwijze al omarmd? Dan maken we graag kennis met jou!

Wat ga je doen?
Als Cloud Engineer bij inQdo ben je verantwoordelijk voor het adviseren, ontwerpen, beheren en optimaliseren van AWS-omgevingen van je eigen klantenportfolio. Je zorgt voor een naadloze onboarding van nieuwe projecten en klanten en je blijft verantwoordelijk voor het dagelijks beheer van hun omgevingen. Je configureert en ontwikkelt highly-automated infrastructuren en helpt je klanten met betere systeem performance, continuous integration en continuous deployment. Uiteraard lever je ook support, analyseer je complexe problemen en los je deze op. In deze functie werk je zowel in-house als op locatie van je klanten.

Wie zijn wij en wat doen wij?
Wij zijn inQdo, opgericht in 2010 met het idee dat applicatie integratie simpeler moet en simpeler kan. Naast consultancydiensten op het gebied van applicatie integratie hebben wij een state-of-the-art Cloud Integratieplatform ontwikkeld, inQdo Connect, dat in meerdere sectoren kan worden ingezet. Door de kennis en ervaring die we als pioniers met AWS hebben opgedaan, zijn we een volwaardige AWS-partner geworden in Nederland en bieden wij AWS-consultancy en managed services diensten aan. Dit doen wij vanuit een mooi kantoor in een markant industrieel monument, een verbouwde soja-fabriek, op een schitterende locatie in Utrecht. Kijk voor meer informatie op www.inqdo.com.

Wat bieden wij?



  • Zelfstandigheid en vrijheid om te pionieren en innoveren: naast je werk bij de klant krijg je de ruimte en tijd om bij te dragen aan de verdere ontwikkeling van inQdo.

  • Prettige werkomgeving en werksfeer.

  • Interessant klantportfolio.

  • Veel projecten: je bent verantwoordelijk voor meerdere klanten en projecten per week.

  • Primair aanspreekpunt voor de klant: dus een 1-op-1 relatie met bijbehorende verantwoordelijkheden.

  • Kleinschaligheid, platte en informele organisatie.

  • Het Nieuwe Werken.

  • Gezonde werk-privébalans.



En daarnaast bieden wij je:



  • een concurrerend salaris;

  • bonusregeling;

  • 26 vakantiedagen + 5 extra kwaaldagen;

  • auto van de zaak of een mobiliteitsvergoeding;

  • telefoonvergoeding;

  • iPad (na succesvolle proeftijd);

  • goede pensioenregeling.



Wie zoeken wij?
Je hebt een stevige basis als senior system engineer en de nodige ervaring met Cloud infrastructuren. Wat je doet, doe je met overtuiging, en je omgeving neem je daarin mee en leid je naar resultaten. De grootste professionele voldoening haal je uit samenwerking met collega’s en erkenning door vakgenoten, maar vooral uit de waardering van tevreden klanten.

Je hebt:



  • sterke scripting-skills; bijvoorbeeld in Powershell, Python, Bash, Ruby, PHP of Perl;

  • ruime hands-on ervaring met systeemadministratie (Linux en Windows) in een Cloud-omgeving zoals Amazon Web Services (AWS);

  • kennis van IP-networking, VPN’s, DNS, load balancing en firewalling;

  • kennis van Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA en REST), VMware vSphere & vCenter;

  • ervaring met revision control source code repositories (Git, SVN, Mercurial, Perforce en/of TFS);

  • ervaring met het beheren van grote databases, SQL of NoSQL;

  • een hbo- of wo-diploma in de richting van IT.



Interesse?
Denk je dat je voldoet aan het profiel dat wij zoeken, dan ontvangen wij graag je sollicitatie en cv: reza@yme-projects.nl.

Heb je nog vragen? Wij beantwoorden die graag. Neem daarvoor contact op met Reza Atlaschi: 06-50 24 65 89.

Procedure
Zien wij voldoende aansluiting voor een eerste kennismaking, dan volgt een telefonische kennismaking en eventueel een uitnodiging voor een eerste gesprek met een partner. Daarna kunnen één of (hooguit) een paar gespreksrondes met toekomstige inQdo collega’s volgen. Bij een wederzijdse klik volgt een arbeidsvoorwaardengesprek, waarna je aan de slag kan bij inQdo. Het kan dus heel snel gaan!

Voor deze vacature is inQdo een exclusieve samenwerking met YME-projects aangegaan; acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

item.title: Integratie Consultant at inQdo (Utrecht, Netherlands)
item.description:
Al bezig met goede voornemens voor 2017? Wij wel! Onze markt en ons bedrijf groeien sterk. Daarom zijn wij op zoek naar nieuwe collega’s die met ons mee willen groeien in het nieuwe jaar voor de functie van:

Integratie Consultant

Ben jij al een Integratiespecialist met kennis van SOA-, EAI- en BPM-standaarden? Heb je kennis van en ervaring met middleware en integratietools, liefst met webMethods of SAP Netweaver PI/PO? En wil je de uitdaging aangaan om jouw kennis en kunde in te zetten voor een eigen klantenportfolio in het Hoger Onderwijs, Industrie en Gezondheidszorg? Dan maken we graag kennis met jou!

Wat ga je doen?
Als Integratie Consultant bouw je een langdurige relatie op met de klanten van inQdo. Je treedt op als vertrouwd adviseur en zoekt de juiste oplossing voor complexe integratie-vraagstukken. Je werkt in kleine maar ook grote projecten bij grote en middelgrote organisaties op het gebied van implementaties, migraties en upgrades en nieuwe functionaliteiten. Je begeleidt je projecten van A-tot-Z; van intake en onboarding tot en met dagelijks beheer en support. Dit alles natuurlijk gerelateerd aan onze core business; integratie. In deze functie werk je zowel in-house als op locatie van je klanten.

Wie zijn wij en wat doen wij?
Wij zijn inQdo, opgericht in 2010 met het idee dat applicatie integratie simpeler moet en simpeler kan. Naast consultancydiensten op het gebied van applicatie integratie hebben wij een state-of-the-art Cloud Integratieplatform ontwikkeld, inQdo Connect, dat in meerdere sectoren kan worden ingezet. Door de kennis en ervaring die we als pioniers met AWS hebben opgedaan zijn we een volwaardige AWS-partner geworden in Nederland en bieden wij AWS-consultancy en managed services diensten aan. Dit doen wij vanuit een mooi kantoor in een markant industrieel monument, een verbouwde soja-fabriek, op een schitterende locatie in Utrecht. Kijk voor meer informatie op www.inqdo.com.

Wat bieden wij?



  • Zelfstandigheid en vrijheid om te pionieren en innoveren: naast je werk bij de klant krijg je de ruimte en tijd om bij te dragen aan de verdere ontwikkeling van inQdo.

  • Prettige werkomgeving en werksfeer.

  • Interessant klantportfolio.

  • Veel projecten: je bent verantwoordelijk voor meerdere klanten en projecten per week.

  • Primair aanspreekpunt voor de klant: dus een 1-op-1 relatie met bijbehorende verantwoordelijkheden.

  • Kleinschaligheid, platte en informele organisatie.

  • Het Nieuwe Werken.

  • Gezonde werk-privébalans.



En daarnaast bieden wij je:



  • een concurrerend salaris;

  • bonusregeling;

  • 26 vakantiedagen + 5 extra kwaaldagen;

  • auto van de zaak of een mobiliteitsvergoeding;

  • telefoonvergoeding;

  • iPad (na succesvolle proeftijd);

  • goede pensioenregeling.



Wie zoeken wij?
Je bent in staat onze visie op integratie op een overtuigende manier over te brengen. Je combineert technische kennis en inzicht met sterke adviesvaardigheden. Wat je doet, doe je met overtuiging en je omgeving neem je daarin mee en leid je naar resultaten. De grootste professionele voldoening haal je uit samenwerking met collega’s en erkenning door vakgenoten, maar vooral uit de waardering van tevreden klanten.

Je hebt/bent:



  • kennis van integratie standaarden;

  • bekend met middleware en tools als SAP BC/XI/PI/PO, webMethods;

  • bekend met iDoc, ALE, EDI, XML, Java & Web Services;

  • kennis van communicatieprotocollen als HTTP(S), FTP, SMTP, AS2, SOAP;

  • bekend met Agile/Scrum (certificering scrummaster is een pre);

  • bekend met Prince-2 (certificering is een pre);

  • hbo/wo werk- en denkniveau, bij voorkeur een afgeronde opleiding in bijvoorbeeld economie, bedrijfskunde, econometrie of informatica;

  • affiniteit met de onderwijswereld is een pre.



Interesse?
Denk je dat je voldoet aan het profiel dat wij zoeken, dan ontvangen wij graag je sollicitatie en cv: reza@yme-projects.nl.

Heb je nog vragen? Wij beantwoorden die graag. Neem daarvoor contact op met Reza Atlaschi: 06-50 24 65 89.

Procedure
Zien wij voldoende aansluiting voor een eerste kennismaking, dan volgt een telefonische kennismaking en eventueel een uitnodiging voor een eerste gesprek met een partner. Daarna kunnen één of (hooguit) een paar gespreksrondes met toekomstige inQdo collega’s volgen. Bij een wederzijdse klik volgt een arbeidsvoorwaardengesprek, waarna je aan de slag kan bij inQdo. Het kan dus heel snel gaan!

Voor deze vacature is inQdo een exclusieve samenwerking met YME-projects aangegaan; acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

item.title: C++ Core Applications Developer at Optiver (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Technology at Optiver
In order to be successful in our trading domain, we constantly need the most advanced technology, trading software and connections to the market. In short, we need the best technologists to develop, optimise and support our systems and tools. With 12 datacenters and thousands of servers we run ten thousands of trading components executing hundred thousands of trades every day. These systems produce a lot of data that needs to be wrangled to turn it into valuable information for different areas of the business.


What you’ll do
As member of the Core Applications team you will be focusing on the infrastructural and strategic components of our software landscape. We provide the rock-solid software backbone on which the business relies every single day, and we lay out the technical arena in which the trading-focused development teams can continue to innovate.
 
As developer in our team you will not only be challenged on your technical knowledge and skills, but also on your capacity for producing simple and elegant solutions in face of a hectic and ever changing business environment

item.title: Drupal Developers: Brussels is waiting for you! at Novabase (Brussels, Belgium)
item.description:
Novabase is seeking a Senior Drupal Developer to join a variety of projects.


We are looking for candidates motivated for long term projects, who will be part of a multicultural team.


If you are seeking for high visible end user impact projects, with a European and worldwide dimension, this is the right project for you!

item.title: Engineering Manager (m/f) Search and Discovery at Immobilien Scout GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your tasks


As the engineering lead of the Search team, you will be responsible for the people who build a critical part of both our infrastructure and the user experience. You will therefore need to …




  • Identify technologies and techniques to help us both scale our growing user base and improve the user experience through search and recommendations.

  • Work with Product Managers, Engineers and Designers to surface content through our web, iOS and Android apps and deliver measurable change.

  • Provide support and consultation to other parts of the ImmobilienScout24 product organization.

  • Recruit and hire talented engineers and ensure they get up to speed.

  • Provide both technical and personal guidance to your engineers.

  • Be aware of work status, remove blockages and ensure the people are doing the most important work.

item.title: Oracle E-Business Suite developer (f/m) at myToys Group (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
As an Application Developer (f/m) ERP (Supply Chain / Finance / Retail Store) you work autonomously in an international agile team. Within the framework of projects you develop and configure the company processes on our innovative ERP system (Oracle E-Business Suite). In the course of your work you cooperate intensively with professional users, advise them, meet their requirements in a professional manner and receive direct feedback in a collegial atmosphere. You have a wide range of responsibilities which includes work in all stages of the software development process. You try out new methods, work with the latest Oracle technologies and expand your know-how in dialogue with other IT professionals.


you work autonomously in an international agile team. Within the framework of projects you develop and configure the company processes on our innovative ERP system (Oracle eBusiness Suite). In the course of your work you cooperate intensively with professional users, advise them, meet their requirements in a professional manner and receive direct feedback in a collegial atmosphere. You have a wide range of responsibilities which includes work in all stages of the software development process. You try out new methods, work with the latest Oracle technologies and expand your know-how in dialogue with other IT professionals.

item.title: Software Ingenieur/in C# / .NET - GEO-452 at Leica Geosystems AG (Balgach, Schweiz)
item.description:
Beim Bau der höchsten Gebäude, längsten Brücken und grössten Passagierflugzeuge wird auf die marktführenden Vermessungslösungen von Leica Geosystems vertraut. Unsere Mitarbeitenden entwickeln, produzieren und vertreiben, worauf sich unsere Kunden Tag für Tag auf der ganzen Welt verlassen: Innovation, Präzision, Zuverlässigkeit und Effizienz.


Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams innerhalb der Construction Tools Division suchen wir eine/n Software Ingenieur/in C# / .NET (f/m). Ihre Hauptaufgaben umfassen dabei:



  • Entwirft Softwarekonzepte und implementiert kommerzielle Client-Server Applikationen mit Hilfe der Microsoft .NET Plattform für den Geschäftsbereich Präzisionsbaugeräte

  • Entwickelt und implementiert nutzerorientierte grafische Oberflächen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem Produktmanagement

  • Erarbeitet Software Anforderungen und Spezifikationen für interne und externe Softwarepartner und koordiniert diese

  • Entwickelt Software Teststrategien für Unit-, Integrations- und Systemtests, um die Qualität der Software innerhalb der Division sicher zu stellen

  • Übernimmt neue Herausforderung in einer Position mit einem hohen Mass an Verantwortung und Flexibilität

  • Arbeitet in einem internationalen und interdisziplinären Umfeld mit guten Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten

item.title: Lead UI Artist (Games) at DIGIT Game Studios (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Our goals for this role



  • Your goal is to help DIGIT continue the growth of our hit title Kings of the Realm

  • You will bring our title to the next level, helping DIGIT to truly push the boundaries of UI design in the game

  • As Lead UI Artist, you will be hands on, as well as leading a small experienced team of games UI designers.


Here's what you will be doing



  • Provide art direction and own the UI for the game

  • Rapidly deliver intuitive and rewarding user interfaces to millions of players for all new game features

  • Design fully responsive user interfaces, that work seamlessly across multiple mobile devices

  • Concept, create and validate UI designs for the game (from user flows through to release)

  • Assist in rapid iterations and testing ideas (using wireframes and sketches, in-engine mockups etc.)

  • Create clean and easy to implement UI assets, which can seamlessly move straight over to the development team and into games production

  • Own the UI pipeline - create and define style guides and monitor consistency and quality across your team

  • Lead and technically manage a small skilled team of UI designers - review work daily, act as technical mentor and guide, set goals etc.

  • Guide the UI vision and art direction across the team (explorations, colour, composition, iconography etc.)

  • Innovate and try new things - always push the quality bar on every single topic.

item.title: Software Tester at Otravo B.V. (Halfweg, Netherlands)
item.description:
The ultimate customer experience is the goal and trying to break it is your game! Do you have an open and proactive devops personality? Are you a hands-on creative and with a good eye for detail? And are you eager to make things work and would you like to make an impact? Looking forward to meeting you.


Software tester




The company
Otravo is an international online travel company well known by brands like Vliegtickets, WTC and most recently Flygstolen and Tripmonster. Every day over a 100.000 visitors are welcomed to our websites and since 1983 millions of people have travelled through our brands. Otravo is a very healthy and innovative company with a growing yearly turnover of over 500 million euro’s and a team of more than 200 professionals.

The department
The ambition of our business is heavily relying on technology advancements. Hence continuous investments are being made in IT innovation. The IT department combines new technologies to reinvent and re-create our omnichannel customer portals to provide personalized dynamically packaged travel bookings in one automated full service environment.
At the same time, the international high volume game in e-commerce ticketing challenges us to provide our customers with the most seamless experience possible.
Daily these challenges drive our teams to combine the power of new technology and be agile and creative. This is why we are scaling up with minds alike.

item.title: Senior Android Developer (f/m) at Fyber GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description: Our platform deals with huge amounts of data and billions of requests. Each engineering team works with a clear mission in mind, taking accountability for every part of the system from deployment to production 3rd tier engineering debugging. Our teams are multi-disciplinary and consist of Developers, QA Engineers and Product Managers. As Senior Developer you develop the Fyber SDK and build new features that add value for players and developers of mobile apps.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Site Reliability (m/f) - Munich, Germany at Westwing Home & Living (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Westwing mission is to inspire and make every home a beautiful home. We are on a quest to bring the wonders of eCommerce for home & living to our more than 26 million members in 14 countries on three continents. In less than 5 years on the market, we have grown to more than 219 million Euros in annual sales, and the opportunity ahead of us is massive.


The Westwing team is the secret to our success. Our more than 1,500 team members balance creativity and style with innovative technology and strong business fundamentals. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious, and looking for the challenge to transform an industry and take it into the future.


Do you think this could be you? To pursue our ambitious expansion strategy, we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer - Site Reliability (m/f) to join our Site Reliability Group. In this position you will work with a team of skilled people ensuring that our applications fit all the technical requirements to run in the cloud under high standards of availability, stability and performance.

item.title: Sr. Automation Engineer (C++/Python)-Automotive at HERE (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
What will you do? 


In the automotive group of HERE we build best-in-class navigation experiences, work on in-vehicle enablers for highly automated driving and driver assistance systems.

For a brand-new team based out of the Netherlands we are looking for experienced Test Automation Professionals.

We are currently growing our team and looking for a Senior Automation Test Engineer to support the development of our products on auto-grade quality standard. In our Team we are strong believers in Continuous Delivery and Automation. We practice automation on every level and automate tests and deployments all the way up to production. You will be working within a highly skilled international team, with more than 20 different nationalities. 

As a Senior Automation Test Engineer in our Connected Driving Team, you will: 



  • Concept, write, maintain and execute test automation for the full E2E solution of our products

  • Follow, improve and implement processes to assure that we are reaching the agreed quality standards 

  • Maintain and integrate tests into our Continuous Integration infrastructure 

  • Provide reliable software releases through building, packaging and integrating tests 

  • Research and assessment of new technologies and tools 

  • Assure that we are building solutions of the highest possible quality

item.title: Python and TypeScript developers for genome engineering web platform at DTU Biosustain (Kongens Lyngby, Denmark)
item.description:
Our team is looking for a talented and enthusiastic software engineer to expand our software platform supporting experimental and computational activities at our center just outside Copenhagen.


DTU Biosustain is an independent research unit at the DTU that conducts research on the development of microbial “cell factories”. Those are microbes that produce economically valuable chemicals at competitive prices and with less harm to the environment than other methods. An example of a cell factory is yeast for beer and wine production — instead we use genome editing to develop cell factories for fine chemicals that are usually refined from petrochemicals and proteins with medical applications. We are applying an engineering approach to the research of building new cell factories to bring them to market faster and cheaper.


We work closely with our scientists to give them the right tools to do their work more efficiently. In this position you will develop services, web applications and user interfaces for our platform supporting our experimental data management and data mining activities. The front end consists of an integrated web UI with many individual components. It is supported by a collection of services for data storage and analysis methods.


We seek one or more software engineers to expand this platform in together with other software engineers and with the input of our researchers.


You should have a cooperative nature and be willing to develop your own talents and those of your teammates.You will join a small team that is expanding just now. We're looking for people with a combination of front end and back end skills. Your focus will depend on your background and interests.


Primary areas of responsibility:



  • Develop UI components, visualizations and services for a web platform for synthetic biology

  • Communicate with researchers and other developers to collect requirements and jointly create and improve components of the platform

  • Design data models, methods and APIs for services

  • Distribute, collaborate on, and deploy services using version control (git), continuous integration (CI) and Docker

item.title: Software Developer Full Stack at Data Access Europe (Hengelo, Netherlands)
item.description:
Java stack zoals HTML, CSS, Java en  SQL spreekt je aan! Lees dan snel verder....


We blijven ons team uitbreiden, daarom zoeken we enthousiaste, leergierige Software Developers die net van school komen of al enige ervaring hebben.


Als je bij ons start beginnen we met een maatwerk opleidingstraject. Hoe dit opleidingstraject er exact uit komt te zien is aan jou en afhankelijk waarin je je wilt verdiepen en welke technische basis je al hebt. Je krijgt de mogelijkheid dingen uit te proberen en te experimenteren, waarbij je de hulp krijgt van onze senior developer uit Hengelo alsook van collega's uit een internationale werkomgeving.


Je komt te werken in het Projects & Services team. In dit team hebben we een veelzijdigheid aan werkzaamheden. Denk hierbij aan het bouwen van uiteenlopende oplossingen voor diverse nationale en internationale klanten en support aan klanten via diverse communicatiekanalen. Onze software oplossingen betreffen betrouwbare administratieve database systemen op Windows Client/Server. Daarnaast realiseren wij oplossingen die voor internet en op mobile devices moeten functioneren, iOS, Android, Windows, online en offline. Dat betekent dat je al gauw diverse kennisgebieden goed moet beheersen, of snel eigen weet te maken zoals bijvoorbeeld de bekende Java stack (oa. HTML, CSS, Java, SQL) en C.


Onze applicaties zijn in principe database onafhankelijk, de klant bepaald vaak welke database het uiteindelijk moet worden. Daarom is het een pre als je naast goede kennis van Microsoft SQL Server ook ervaring hebt met Oracle, DB2 of Pervasive SQL.


Web technologie blijft constant veranderen. Het zit in jouw DNA dat je altijd weet wat speelt en welke nieuwe technologische kansen we moeten evalueren en zien te benutten.

item.title: MS Dynamics Developer at BearingPoint Ireland (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description: We are currently recruiting CRM Technical Consultants for our growing Microsoft Dynamics practice. The CRM Developer will be a senior technical resource responsible for planning, designing, and leading the implementation of CRM solutions and ADX Portals for our clients. Coming from a strong Microsoft development background, you will be expected to have broad and deep technical skills and experience designing and implementing enterprise solutions based on the Dynamics platform.

item.title: Software Delivery Manager at BearingPoint Ireland (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
At BearingPoint Ireland, we are growing quickly and have a number of exciting new projects to challenge the very best Developers. We are working with a wide range of clients, on a number of complex projects that are transforming the way business is being done in Ireland. We are looking for talented Development Leads to join our Software Development team. As a Development Lead, you will join a team delivering a range of enterprise and web/mobile solutions for our clients using the latest technologies and Agile methodologies.


The role
We currently have an opportunity in our Dublin office for a Development Lead. In this role, you will work closely with Development, QA, Analysis, Project Management and Architecture personnel in on large scale delivery projects.


The role will involve:



  • Leading software delivery projects from an organisational and planning perspective

  • Adapting and implementing Agile oriented delivery methodologies

  • Liaising with clients and senior project stakeholders on project matters

  • Team coaching and mentoring

item.title: .NET Software Developer at BearingPoint Ireland (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
At BearingPoint Ireland, we are growing quickly and have a number of exciting new projects to challenge the very best Developers. We are working with a wide range of clients, on a number of complex projects that are transforming the way business is being done in Ireland. We are looking for talented .NET Developers to join our Software Development team. As a .NET Developer, you will join a team delivering a range of enterprise and web solutions for our clients using the latest technologies.


The role:


Responsibility for design and implementation of software projects and play a key role in ensuring the quality of solutions we build.

item.title: DevOps Engineer (Java) at BearingPoint Ireland (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
At BearingPoint Ireland, we are growing quickly and have a number of exciting new projects to challenge the very best DevOps Engineers. We are working with a wide range of clients, on a number of complex projects that are transforming the way business is being done in Ireland.


The DevOps Engineer (Java) will be responsible for maintaining and improving an enterprise continuous integration / delivery framework. This person is responsible for recommending, developing, and implementing the automated frameworks to maximize the efficiency of the build and release process. You will work within an Agile delivery environment and support multiple project teams and codebases to enable the deployment of application releases to controlled test and production environments.


The role:


We currently have an exciting opportunity in our Dublin office for a DevOps Engineer. As a DevOps Engineer, you will work within our Release Management Team and work closely with the Development and QA Teams on all software builds and releases.


The role will involve:



  • Collaboration with Software Development, QA Engineers, and System Architects to continuously improve the efficiency and reliability of build and deployment processes to support all phases of development, QA and production releases.

  • Providing and maintaining a detailed understanding of the structure and inter-dependencies of systems and leverage this knowledge to improve our build and release processes.

  • Maintaining and enhancing our Continuous Integration environment on a real-time basis, monitoring builds, maintaining configuration, and developing automation.

  • Demonstrating expertise in a range of automation tools and approaches in a Unix environment (e.g. Jenkins/TeamCity, Maven, Ansible), as well as other scripting languages.

  • Automating the build, Continuous Integration (CI) and deployment processes.

  • Supporting automated build, release & test solutions, internal tools development for automation, maintenance of build environments, etc.

  • Coordinating releases including pre-release checks, validation of release change sets,    release schedule, code freeze, SVN to GIT migration, etc.

  • Creation of new environments and updates to these environments including configuration of Jenkins and application support.

  • Solid experience of the SVN/GIT, Jenkins/TeamCity for Continuous Integration builds.

  • Experience working with DevOps methodologies.

  • Experience with rapidly troubleshooting application configuration issues in Unix environments.

item.title: Java Developer - All Levels at BearingPoint Ireland (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description: BearingPoint Ireland has exciting new projects to challenge the very best Java Developers.  We are working with a wide range of clients, on a number of projects that are transforming the way business is being done in Ireland and across Europe.  We are expanding our team and are current looking for talented Java Developers to join us.

item.title: Back-end PHP Web Developer at AdviceRobo (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
AdviceRobo searches senior Back-end Web developers to join our team. The mission of AdviceRobo is to help the globally 4,5 billion people that are underserved. People that are self employed, millennials, migrants etc. have no access to banking and cannot borrow money because they do not have a financial history. We apply behavioral science and machine learning to develop credit scoring that predict their behaviour and gives the lender/bank a better indication of the creditworthiness of these people. So lender can lend money to them without increasing their own credit risk.


To get there we combine the best of a small team of a scale up company (nimble, fast iteration, high trust and ownership) with a highly professional team with appealing experience and proven track record.  


Do you want to change the way people are being serviced by financial institutions fundamentally? Do you have talents and skills to reinforce our team significantly? 


We want to talk to candidates that are looking for:



  • Taking a step in their career and develop professionally

  • Designing, developing, testing and deploying advanced back-end software infrastructure

  • Combining frontend and backend work

  • Developing web apps, but on the enterprise level

  • Using state-of-the-art web technologies and DevOps

  • Entering into complex challenges, such as big data analytics, natural language processing, encryption and artificial intelligence


You'll have the following responsibilities:



  • Further design and develop the needed infrastructure of the intelligence platform

  • Implement the models and algorithms developed by the data scientists

  • Design and build the frontend for users of the platform

  • Propose new approaches & solutions

  • Explore what happens in your profession worldwide and bring in new ideas

  • Working closely with data scientists and product leads

item.title: Junior OutSystems Developer at Vopak (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Junior OutSystems Developer
Ref: 3254942207

Work for the world of tomorrow
Royal Vopak is the global market leader in storage and handling of bulk liquid products. At our 67 terminals in 25 countries we can store over 34 million cubic metres of oil and chemicals. Software plays an essential part in increasing the safety and efficiency of our terminals. To develop and maintain our applications, we are looking to fill several posts:

OutSystems junior DevOps
Saying that IT is important to Vopak would be an understatement. Automation already plays an essential part in all our processes, but with the rise of the internet-of-things and data analysis our field is about to get very interesting. As DevOps you will play a defining part in the future of our company and you will help us to retain a leading position in sustainability, safety and efficiency; a position we have built up over the past 400 years. We prefer not to fall in line – we create the line; our position at the forefront of innovation was recognised when we received the OutSystems Innovation Award 2016.

Job description
Your base of operations will be our head office in Rotterdam – your business card will read developer or engineer. As part of a scrum team, including some OutSystems gurus, you will develop and manage applications on the OutSystems PaaS platform. You will fill the role of developer or engineer in a team that is responsible for designing, implementing, releasing, deploying and configuring applications.

If you are just getting started in IT, Vopak is the place to be. We will enable you to gain knowledge, skills, experience, and generally make an effort to help you grow from starter to star. We are a relatively flat organisation; the atmosphere is pleasant and informal, but expect a lot of responsibility from the start. With all that responsibility, and our experts’ guidance, you will be an OutSystems specialist in no time.

Our DevOps do not spend all of their time at their desks, and neither will you. Expect to be on the move; free to fly, sail or drive to any relevant course or seminar. You will work with project owners and end users, witnessing first-hand how your software solutions contribute to solving real-world challenges. We know that variety keeps you on your toes, that is why you will have time to explore and experiment: to work on proofs of concept or your own projects.

What do we offer?
As well as a challenging, international environment, you will be offered many opportunities to improve yourself. Our employment conditions and fringe benefits are downright excellent, including an ample supply of days off. We guarantee that your friends will be jealous.

Working in Rotterdam
Our headquarters is located in Rotterdam, Europe’s biggest port and one of the Netherlands’ most innovative cities. This lively world city, which is not far from Amsterdam or The Hague, is in its prime, offering fresh and unique experiences to guests and inhabitants alike. We would love to help you discover, or even settle. To learn more about Rotterdam, visit https://en.rotterdam.info/

Cup of coffee?
Are you a starting developer or engineer, familiar with agile development and just as excited about OutSystems as we are? Then we should skype, or you could pay a visit to our head office in Rotterdam. Send your CV and a covering letter to Pieter van den Eijnden, HR Officer Recruitment at Pieter.van.den.eijnden@vopak.com. For questions about this job, please call 0613063956.  

Or apply online via the 'Apply' button.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

Keywords: Job vacancy, Full-time, Rotterdam, DevOps specialist, OutSystems engineer.

Royal Vopak is the global market leader in storage and handling of bulk liquid products. At our 67 terminals in 25 countries we can store over 34 million cubic metres of oil and chemicals. item.title: Quality Assurance Automation Engineer at Bynder (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic Quality Assurance Automation Engineer to join one of our teams. You will work within a team which is responsible for a specific part of the application. You will build on our existing achievements to further improve the quality of our solution, and increase our customer satisfaction as a result.


As a Quality Assurance Automation Engineer at Bynder you are the quality expert when it comes to your team’s mission, and you will help your team to achieve the quality you want to see in our application.


You will be actively working with the product team, development and business stakeholders to clarify requirements in terms of testability, consistency, and completeness. You know that it is crucial to have all information complete before development, and if any detail is missing lacking during the process, then you will make it your mission to ensure completeness, and communicate these changes to the team.


With an eye for detail, you will create, review and automate test cases. You will be working closely with the devops team, making sure that the correct scenarios are automatically run over the latest build prior to release. You will be actively studying the results of each automated test run, when finding a defect or possible issue you will investigate and report them clearly in detail with all information attached and will work with the team to resolve them. On your company-provided Apple equipment you will work with Jira, Github, Browserstack, Jmeter; write BDD (Behaviour Driven Development) scenarios and automate them with Selenium, behave and Python.


Participating proactively in daily standup meetings, team retrospectives, suggesting and implementing improvements, you know you can make a difference. The best argument wins!


You will describe yourself as:



  • Positive minded and solution-oriented

  • Critical and quality-oriented

  • High attention to detail

  • Possessing an agile mindset, fast to adapt to constant changes and feeling comfortable with it.

  • Naturally questioning everything

  • Fluent in English with excellent communication skill, both within and outside the team.

  • Able to accurately evaluate and report test results, test progress, and product quality

  • You work effectively to define testable user stories, acceptance criteria with your team

  • Able to plan and organise your own work

  • You have experience and are up to date with the latest developments within the QA field

item.title: Java Programmeur at Rijksoverheid (Groningen, Netherlands)
item.description:
Java Programmeur
Dienst Uitvoering Onderwijs (DUO)



Functieomschrijving
In het onderwijs maken we veel gebruik van software en applicaties in Java. Jij kent deze programmeertaal op je duimpje. Als ondernemende Java-programmeur bij de Dienst Uitvoering Onderwijs bouw je applicaties waarvan Nederlandse studenten en onderwijsinstellingen dagelijks gebruikmaken.


Je werkt in een dynamische omgeving, met veel nieuwe uitdagingen en de nieuwste technologieën en werkwijzen. Denk aan DevOps, cloud en User Experience. Samen met een gedreven club professionals bouw je onderwijsapplicaties. Hiervoor maak je gebruik van frameworks zoals Maven, Spring, Hibernate en AngularJS.


Jij bent expert in je vakgebied, maar wilt ook blijven leren. Je komt met vernieuwende ideeën, enthousiasmeert je collega's en samen vertaal je de ideeën naar software-oplossingen. Zo lever je een substantiële bijdrage aan de kwaliteit van de DUO-applicaties, en breng je de softwareontwikkeling binnen de Dienst Uitvoering Onderwijs (DUO) naar een hoger plan. Jij draagt zelf bij aan het creëren van jouw ideale werkomgeving. Bij DUO vinden we jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling belangrijk en bieden we ruime opleidingsfaciliteiten.

Make your mark. Apply now.

item.title: Intermediate/Senior Linux Sysadmin at Kira Systems (Llan-non, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
Intermediate/Senior Linux Sysadmin


Kira Systems is looking for an intermediate or senior Linux System Administrator to join our Systems Team. Our ideal candidate would have good familiarity with technologies mentioned below, the drive to learn more about them, and some demonstrated ability to dig into ambiguous problems and find a solution.


The objective is to keep our servers and code running smoothly, this includes: availability, code deployments, automation, optimization, performance, change management, scalability, logging, monitoring, alerts, emergency response, capacity planning, security.


We also want someone for whom the idea of building automation is attractive — we have build a lot of it, and need to build more, and the ideal candidate would love to get their hands dirty with it.


Main Responsibilities:



  • maintaining and monitoring our production and development environments

  • supporting our infrastructure and application

  • supporting client-hosted installations of our software

  • documenting client questions and incidents


Personal Requirements:



  • available during UTC business hours

  • clean background check

  • good oral and written communication skills

  • a curious-minded and independent work ethic

  • troubleshooting-oriented

  • at least 5 years' experience in relevant areas


Technical Requirements:



  • experience in multi-server Linux systems administration

  • strong knowledge of system security

  • knowledge of AWS (EC2, Autoscaling, Route53, CloudFormation, etc)

  • proficiency with RDBS and SQL

  • proficiency with scripting for automating tasks (we use Python, Bash, Ansible, among others) 


Nice to have:



  • knowledge of VMware, Docker, RabbitMQ, and Zookeeper — we use these

  • knowledge of SELinux

  • knowledge of orchestration tools (especially Ansible)

  • knowledge of Linux internals applied to troubleshooting or optimization

  • experience with CentOS/Red Hat Linux

  • experience with PostgreSQL

  • experience with JVM-based languages (Clojure in particular)

  • experience with highly-available systems in general

  • experience building distributable virtual machines

  • experience with logging and monitoring tools like Zabbix, ELK

  • experience working remotely

  • a university degree in computer science (or relevant field)


How to apply:


Does the above sound interesting? We'd love to hear from you. Be sure to send us a CV and a cover letter (really — we want to know why you're interested in us, and what motivated you to apply).  Email to kirasystems-krsy0946@applications.recruiterbox.com, and see https://kirasystems.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk06gnq to apply via the web.

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer (m/f) at Springer Science + Business Media Deutschland GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
The way we do business



We build our software incrementally, iteratively, and continuously, so you’ll be able to see new work go live to over four million visitors around the globe every week. Our flavour of agile has been heavily influenced by XP and Kanban, and if something isn’t working, we change it.


Our work delivers value to both the business and our customers, our teams are cross-discipline: business analysts and the user experience team work with stakeholders to coordinate research and understand requirements, whilst our frontend developers and software engineers pair with quality analysts to develop the most robust solutions, and our platform engineers work across the organisation to ensure our infrastructure never lets us down.

We generally follow a mix of agile and lean practices with an overall philosophy towards continuous delivery. We’ll rely on each and everyone´s expertise to adapt and improve these processes to serve the team, project and company as best fits their current contexts.



Responsabilities:

Hexagon has over 16‘000 employees and is a worldwide provider of information technologies. item.title: CT-OMG! We are looking for you! at Jobbatical (Tallinn, Estonia)
item.description:
CTO? More like CT—OMG! Because that's how we'll react when we see your application.



In all seriousness, if you choose to accept this mission, you'll be the one leading our technical roadmap and taking responsibility for the evolution, development, and delivery of our core platform and architecture. We'll trust you to have what it takes to empower a team and communicate effectively. So if you like—no, if you love the idea of having a significant impact on the company and the future of a next-generation product in the talent acquisition industry, carry on reading!



You're the kind of person who thinks about tech in business terms, and business in tech terms—you can’t make a tech decision without considering the business implications, or a business decision without thinking of the tech implications.



Our current team is pretty amazing. They’re not just great at coding, they’re incredible people to boot. We want them to grow and feel challenged, as well as have an interesting and manageable workload. That's where your innate leadership ability comes in. You know how to ask the right questions to lead developers and managers to solutions that are elegant, scalable, and exciting.



To fit this team like a glove, you absolutely need to be kind, honest, and humble. If we aren’t honest about where we’re failing, we can’t grow. But if we can’t be kind while being honest, we won’t thrive. And we really want to do both! We believe that humility is one of the keys to great leadership, so massive egos need not apply.

item.title: Senior Android Developer in a well-funded new startup at OnTruck (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
The challenge



  • The road transportation industry has been stuck in the same way of doing things for the past 30 years, with complex over-the-phone transactions that could be sped up and more efficient using the right technology. Figuring our product out and getting users to switch is a tough challenge and we want your insights and experience.


The team



  • Every one of us has had several start-up experiences and on average we have 10+ years of experience in somehow similar challenges. We know success, we know failure; we've built platforms from scratch, we've dealt with large legacy systems. We care about each other and about the product we're building.

  • Some of the past projects where our engineers have been involved before joining OnTruck are: building the billing system for one of the largest telephony operators in Spain, building up and optimising complex marketplaces handling millions of orders a month, building real time video chats, building a global oauth/identity provider, improving the garbage collector of the JVM, creating social network libraries even before Facebook existed, building the Eurofighter simulator used to train pilots, building kernel modules to deal with real-time processor allocation, creating NLP algorithms to score user comments and timeline recommendation algorithms, building software to manage a backbone network and dealt with the logistic platform of a big supermarket chain.

  • Investors like our concept and team and we've been quite successful in fundraising and gathering resources to support our future growth.


The engineering culture



  • We value speed of iteration and best practices and we care about our craft: both our API and key JavaScript code have 100% test coverage, for instance.

  • We get engineers as close to the business problems as possible, so everybody can be involved in product decisions. We have mechanisms to enable anybody in the company to bring their new ideas to decision makers since we believe that innovative ideas come from everywhere.


The stack



  • We have a decoupled architecture, based on REST APIs and asynchronous services. We work with React in the frontend platforms (customers and admin), native in mobile apps (drivers), Python/Django in the backend and we're currently evaluating Elixir for some services. Our DB is PostgreSQL and the queues run on RabbitMQ.

  • We use a dedicated ERP to avoid reinventing the wheel there and we also have built a DWH/Analytics platform which takes advantage of external solutions.


What we offer



  • An office in downtown Madrid (Chamberí).

  • A laid-back culture where everybody is encouraged to participate in discussions and contribute.

  • Opportunities for personal growth and learning (we hold regular tech talks and encourage working on different parts of the platform).

  • Good salaries and stock options packages. We want our engineers to have ownership and participate in company success.

  • Flexible schedule (though no regular remote working since we believe in face-to-face communication).
