item.description:
We’re building something very special and for this we need very special developers who like a challenge. See www.ixara.com for details.


iXara is looking for an experienced back-end JavaScript developer to work on the creation of ground-breaking, cloud-based applications. You will be part of a new distributed team, building a new slick product, using the very latest, state of the art web technologies.


Contract or Permanent. Competitive salary dependent on experience, plus (for permanent employees based in the UK) benefits including company pension contributions & private medical insurance.


If you have the right skills and the determination to succeed, this is your opportunity to work on a product that will be used by millions of people, and to contribute to the most amazing, slickest, web-based creative tool being developed today.


Location


Remote working or UK office based. You can work from anywhere you like (but within +/- 3 hours that of the UK), with occasional visits for face to face meetings with the rest of the team, most of whom are also remote workers.


Please do not apply if you are outside these time zones as your application will be ignored!


The UK office is based  at Gaddesden Place, Hemel Hempstead, Hertfordshire, a country mansion (see Gaddesden Place), with snooker table and swimming pool, that offers a friendly, relaxed working environment.

item.title: Software Engineer (Ruby on Rails) at FiNC (Tokyo, Japan)
item.description:
Open positions


We have a big vision to make a positive impact to the health and wellness of millions of people. To help achieve that goal we are growing our engineer team. We need experienced full-stack engineers.


If you are looking for a rewarding job, then please get in contact. We support your relocation, visa, and your lives in Tokyo.


About FiNC


(You can also get to know us here)


* Bringing wellness to our users.


At FiNC we believe there is a 'wellness gap'. Global life expectancy is increasing. People are living longer, but many find their later years are plagued with ill-health. We believe that encouraging long-term healthy habits can extend their years of health. We want to close the 'wellness gap'.



* Personalized wellness


FiNC leverages data science, custom-built artificial intelligence, mobile technology and a network of certified health professional, to identify scientific research relevant to each user based on genetic markers, physiological attributes and current health status.



* At FiNC we have many interesting and exciting projects:


- We are combining health professionals with artificial intelligence technology to create the world's first Wellness AI.


- Building collections of unique datasets to interprets everyday habits in the context of long-term health. Applicable to wide range of industries including fitness, food production, pharmaceuticals, healthcare, insurance, et al.


- We are using social, competitive, online-to-offline experiences to drive user engagement.


- We are creating of vast health & wellness knowledge base.

You will contribute to the design and implementation of brand name mobile phones, automotive software, multimedia devices and storage products. The code you write will run on millions of electronics devices every day.

  • Problem and performance analysis, optimization, resolution

  • Work with our Engineering team to support partners

item.title: Build and Release Engineer at KeyNexus (Victoria, BC, Canada)
item.description:
KeyNexus is a Silicon Valley backed enterprise key management and storage company. Our clients and partners include the most recognized names in technology, security and internet infrastructure on the planet. We don't spend our days fixing 20 year old, obsolete application code nobody ever uses. We are building new systems and platforms that hundreds of millions of people will use to protect their privacy and personal information and that is something we are all passionate about. We have a small and distributed team with some of the best talent in the industry and we are looking to expand.


We are seeking a build and release engineer to assist our development teams with build and deployment automation. If you enjoy working on new systems and platforms, improving efficiency and finding innovative ways of solving problems then you will LOVE this job.


Main responsibilities



  • Define and unify repeatable build procedures for staged releases

  • Maintain various software feature branches and integration

  • Write build scripts and integrate outside tools in order automate deployment and testing

  • Help on-board new engineers and train them about KeyNexus’ source control procedures

  • Assist with testing and quality assurance

  • Stay current with industry trends, techniques and technology


We are looking for self-starters where key capabilities include:



  • Experience in building in Java or PHP

  • Experience in deploying and configuring web-based applications

  • Proficiency with build automation and dependency management tools such as Maven or Gradle

  • Proficiency with source code management systems such as Git or Mercurial

  • Experience with Agile development methodologies

  • Familiarity with technical practices such as test-driven development and continuous integration

  • Able to effectively communicate in both a technical and non-technical manner

  • Ability to multi-task and stay organized in a dynamic work environment

  • Possess a positive attitude and willingness to contribute to the ongoing performance of the team


Nice to have



  • Experience with AWS, Azure, Google cloud, or similar cloud infrastructure providers

  • Experience with Docker and VirtualBox

  • Experience managing Windows or Linux-based servers

  • Knowledge of secure coding and development best practices

  • Experience with JIRA, Slack, Confluence, BitBucket, Bamboo and/or Git


Qualifications requested



  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in Computer Science or a related discipline, or equivalent job experience

  • Fluency in English (written and oral)


We can’t wait to hear from you!


The position is available immediately. As our team is distributed, we will consider applicants from both Victoria and elsewhere.


For information on other jobs available at KeyNexus visit http://keynexus.net/company/careers

item.title: Senior Mobile Developers at Teamwork.com at Teamwork.com (Cork, Ireland)
item.description:
Here at Teamwork.com we've gone as far as we can with Cross-Platform Technologies for our mobile apps.  But it's just not good enough.  We want to take advantage of the very best that each platform offers.  It's not enough to be able to just get stuff done with our apps - we want them to be so good that people become addicted to using them.


So we're going fully native and we're putting together the best mobile team in the country to do it.


If you're a die-hard iOS or Android developer, this is your dream job: No legacy code, and the freedom and resources to do the best work of your career.


What We Expect:



  •  Strong attention to detail.

  • Willing to learn. You must have an open mind, be able to pick things up quickly and enjoy working with passionate people.

  • Fundamentally, this position is for a senior developer role, so we want to see that you've made some beautiful apps that you're proud of.


Ideally we'd also expect you to be familiar with the list below, but the main thing is your portfolio. Show us with the stuff you've done. Definite bonus points for putting together something using our API (http://developer.teamwork.com) - doesn't matter how small. 


What we we're not looking for:


 Ninjas. (Although if you want to do some martial arts in your free time that's fine too.)

item.title: Software Engineer / Data Scientist Java Backend Services at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
trivago offers a highly dynamic, international, and result driven environment, where you’ll get the chance to make a meaningful impact on millions of users. If scale and complexity excite you, trivago should be your first choice!

We are looking for a Software Engineer with a solid background in data science who wants to join our Backend Services team and help us to optimize our revenue growth by building models and algorithms that improve our CPC bidding market. In your new role you’ll cooperate closely with individuals from Product Management and Business Intelligence, as well as engineers, and take full ownership of your work as a team – from the initial idea generation to the implementation in our search core. You should be passionate about your craft, versatile and ambitious to push our business forward.


Your responsibilities:



  • Work in a cross-functional team that takes full ownership of its products, from ideation to the rollout of fully fledged features written in Java/Python.

  • Contribute with your technical expertise to the development of new algorithms that improve our traffic monetization.

  • Conduct rigorous testing of your work and monitor its impact on both our tech and business metrics.

  • Be creative, challenge yourself and help take trivago to the next level.



Essential requirements:



  • Minimum 2 years of relevant work experience.

  • Master’s degree (PhD preferred) in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.).

  • A very good understanding of Java with a strong focus on concurrency.

  • Knowledge of at least one scripting language, e.g. Python or R.

  • You have experience implementing multi-core/distributed software, preferably in a Linux environment.

  • Exposure to SQL and relational databases.

  • You are comfortable communicating in English (our company language).



Preferred requirements:



  • Experience with Cassandra, Redis, MongoDB, or Spark.

  • Interest in machine learning.

  • You are knowledgeable in packages such as Pandas and NumPy.

  • Excellent English communication skills: you have the ability to easily convey your message to team members and other stakeholders.

  • You have worked with the Hadoop Ecosystem.


Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Being an active member of our PHP, JavaScript, and UI guilds.

  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hoursbased on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • Working at our head office in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highestquality of life in the world for expats.



Start date:



  • As soon as possible.


Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

item.title: Software Development Engineer (SDE) - 2017 Graduate - Amazon Video at Amazon (London, UK)
item.description:
At Amazon Video, we're fundamentally changing the way millions of customers access, consume and interact with video content worldwide. Inventing on behalf of our customers is in our DNA: Prime Video, X-Ray, Amazon Studio Originals (The Grand Tour, The Man in the High Castle, Transparent, Shaun the Sheep) and add-on subscriptions (Showtime, Starz, Comedy Central) are just a few of the features and capabilities that delight our customers. It's a green-field space overdue for disruption and we'd like you to join us in our mission to enable everyone to search, discover, consume and interact with video content anytime, anywhere and on any device.

We're looking for talented, motivated Software Development Engineer Graduates who can join us to offer a great customer experiences. If you are graduating in 2017 and have an interest in building large-scale, high-performance, customer-centric products and think end-to-end, this may be the job you've been looking for.

Since we have a wide variety of projects and technologies, we are looking for different profiles, from engineers interested in front-end development (for our hybrid mobile applications and website) to back-end engineers to develop the systems that power our warehouse (focused in solving complex multi-objective resource allocation problems), including machine learning engineers for our recommendation or fraud detection systems.

Development opportunities:
As a new graduate you will join your team at Amazon Video between August and October 2017, and will go through induction training. You will drive your own learning and development with guidance and coaching from your manager, buddy and colleagues around you - not to mention the excellent long-term development prospects you’d expect from one of the world’s leading online businesses.

We will also make sure you’re well rewarded. We offer a competitive salary, stock units and a range of other benefits (including healthcare and an employee discount), in addition to a study support package and the excellent long-term development prospects you’d expect from one of the world’s leading online retailers.



  • Working towards a degree in Computer Science or related field (expected graduation in 2017)

  • Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design

  • Computer Science fundamentals in data structures

  • Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis

  • Experience developing in at least one of: Java, C, C++, or Perl



  • Interest in developing web services, or other large scale distributed systems

  • Interest in designing and developing interactive experiences for games consoles, mobiles and tablets.


Our Deadline is December 16th, 2016. We would encourage you to apply early to avoid disappointment.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

All offers are conditional on references, verification of the right to work in the UK, and successful background screening check. This will include previous employment verification, qualification verification (if relevant) and a basic criminal check. Further details of this policy/procedure will be sent to you along with your conditional offer.

item.title: Lead DevOps Engineer at BBOXX (London, UK)
item.description:
Who we are

BBOXX is a UK based venture-backed company providing an affordable solar solution to meet off-grid customers energy needs. We are fully vertically integrated, controlling every part of our customer experience. Our market leading products and appliances coupled with our SMART Solar platform bring machine-learning and customer experience optimisation to rural Africa. Our ground-breaking financing structure has brought off-grid solar into the Worlds financial markets. Whilst our human centred design approach to our retail business ensures that the BBOXX ecosystem is poised to massively scale during 2016. With over 80,000 systems deployed so far, 350 staff across 5 offices in China, UK and East Africa are waking up every morning to work with BBOXX to electrify 20 million people by 2020. We invite you to join us on this journey to electrify rural Africa.


The role

We are seeking a hands-on DevOps engineer who is looking for their first management/team leader role. The ideal candidate should have practical experience in a DevOps environment and will lead a small but growing team of DevOps engineers who support BBOXX's expanding number of users, systems and servers.

We are looking for someone with strong Amazon Web Services experience. You will create cloud formation templates to build AWS services that support our stack based on Angular, Python and Postgres. Youll need to build and maintain the architecture to support the whole stack, whilst focusing on important topics such as recovery, security and reliability of our systems which are used in several countries around the world.

In this role, youll work collaboratively with our software engineering teams to deploy and operate our systems. You'll be working to automate and streamline our operations and processes, as well as building and maintaining tools for deployment, monitoring and operations. Finally you will also be troubleshooting and resolving issues in our dev, test and production environments.



Benefits


  • Starting date: Negotiable. From November 2016 onwards.
  • Location: BBOXX office in West London, UK
  • Full time, permanent contract. Salary negotiable based on experience
  • Dymanic development environment
  • Sand-box time we spend 10% of our time on new projects which you propose
  • Monday morning breakfast
  • Regular BBOXX Family Nights and social events

item.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer at Airtame (København, Denmark)
item.description:
As a Senior Full-Stack Engineer at Airtame, you and your team will be responsible for developing our cross-platform desktop application, which allows users to wirelessly mirror their desktops on Airtame-enabled displays. The application is built in NodeJS using the Electron framework, but it is not your typical Javascript project. Delivering a beautiful user experience for wireless streaming on all major platforms comes with a set of unique challenges, and as such, our engineers must be able to comfortably navigate both frontend and backend development.


Our talented engineers are given significant ownership and responsibility over projects. We value rapid iteration, continuous integration and testing, and we are serious about producing high-quality, maintainable software. Frequent code reviews, linting, and pairing are all integral components of our engineering culture. We encourage experimenting with new technologies and constantly challenge ourselves to improve our code, processes, and systems.

item.title: Senior C/C++ Software Engineer at Airtame (København, Denmark)
item.description:
As a Senior C/C++ Software Engineer at Airtame, you and your team will be responsible for developing the core of our wireless streaming software, which is responsible for capturing, encoding and transmitting audio and video data, then receiving, decoding and rendering the content on the Airtame device. This is low-level software which runs under CPU, memory and time constraints, requiring significant focus on performance, concurrency, and resource lifecycles.


Our talented engineers are given significant ownership and responsibility over projects. We value rapid iteration, continuous integration and testing, and we are serious about producing high-quality, maintainable software. Frequent code reviews, linting, and pairing are all integral components of our engineering culture. We encourage experimenting with new technologies and constantly challenge ourselves to improve our code, processes, and systems.

item.title: Senior Full-stack Developer at INFARE (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Location: Copenhagen or Vilnius


We are a looking for talents willing to help us take our products to the next level.
You will join our development team of 15 people consisting of a graphical designer, frontend developers, junior developers, full-stack developers and product architects based in both Copenhagen and Vilnius.
We have an interesting application portfolio ranging from sophisticated web-crawler technology, modern Single Page Applications, Windows Services and a wide range of internal websites.


Main Tasks



  • Development in all layers of the applications

  • Architectural discussions with peers

  • Ensuring consistency between domain model, specifications and software

  • Help identify emerging technologies that can aid Infare


You will be given lots of freedom to innovate and create amazing applications for our customers. You will have ambitious co-workers and frequent play-days to explore new technologies or work on personal projects.

item.title: Digital Delivery Managers at The Co-op (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Digital Delivery Managers 


We believe that co-operatives are a better way of doing business for our members, customers and communities. By embracing the culture, practices and technologies of the digital age we’re building new products and services that are grounded in co-operative values of openness, member ownership, and community. Help us discover a whole world of opportunities for this new era.


We’re looking to recruit experienced agile Delivery Managers to join us and help shape our future. We’re agile, user centred and responsive to change.  We believe in the power of small, self-directed teams, loosely joined in a growing community of makers, and guided by an inspiring mission.  We can offer you a whole world of opportunity, a great salary, and an amazing benefits package.


As an agile Delivery Manager at the Co-op, you’ll be the person who forms teams- bringing experts and specialists together to deliver products and services built around the needs of users. You’ll be experienced building a collaborative culture and removing obstacles so your team can be 100% focused on doing what they do best. And you’ll be working alongside world-class product managers, architects, researchers, developers and designers to create an environment where creativity and innovation can thrive.


What you’ll bring: 



  • Agile delivery experience, and a proven track record supporting the development of digital products and services

  • The ability to lead, motivate and facilitate

  • Amazing communication skills

  • Energy, inspiration, and a burning desire to ask the difficult questions and make great things happen


Why Co-op?


172 years ago a group of businessmen in Rochdale created an idea that changed the world. They realised that only by challenging the status-quo could they find solutions to the problems of their age. They were pioneers. And they left us a legacy that’s never been more important or relevant than it is today.


That’s why we’ve gone back to being Co-op. We want to change the world all over again, and we hope you’d like to join us on our journey. If you believe in our purpose, and you’re keen to help us re-discover that defiant spirit on which an institution was built, then join us. And make a real contribution to the revival of an iconic British brand.


Find out more:


For an expert perspective on the role of a Digital Delivery Manager, check out this blog post by the lovely Emily Webber, and to see what we’ve been working on recently check out the Co-op digital blog.

item.title: Programmer for an Internet mapping project at UPMC (Paris, France)
item.description:
As the Internet measurement project developer, you will be responsible for the development of an Internet mapping system, with the aim of creating a continuously updated map of the routers and networks in the Internet. You will take over responsibility for a client-server system that is currently deployed on PlanetLab Europe (PLE), a testbed consisting of hundreds of servers around Europe that are connected to the Internet. This mapping system consists of: measurement agents deployed on PLE servers, a central control system that monitors and directs the agents, and a database that collects these measurements. The measurements are made using tools such as ping, traceroute, and iperf.


 You will be working with a team of researchers at UPMC Sorbonne Universités and elsewhere who are developing new ways to understand the structure of the Internet and how the network evolves over time. You will be the principal developer of the measurement system on which the researchers will run their experiments. The researchers and interns will contribute to the system as they create algorithms to direct the measurements, and they will do so under your technical guidance. There will be systems engineers to ensure the functioning of PLE and other servers that you use. Your supervisors will be UPMC faculty members Timur Friedman and Olivier Fourmaux.


Prime considerations in your work will be the reliability and performance of the measurement system. The PlanetLab servers and the network in between are subject to failures, and taking this into account is essential in the design of a distributed system that as a whole continues to function even when individual servers are down or unreachable. Also, we envision collecting large amounts of data and making the data accessible to researchers for computation-intensive analysis, and the databases must be able to scale accordingly. 


You will take over a functioning initial system. You will then have considerable autonomy in determining future development directions for the system, including the choice of language (it is currently written mostly in Python), webservice API (it currently has a RESTful API), and database technology (it currently uses PostgreSQL).


You will create online documentation and tutorials to support users of the measurement system.


You will work in a French-speaking environment, and you must have some basic knowledge of French in order to start the job. To be effective in your job, a working knowledge of English is also required.

item.title: BI Developer at eVision Industry Software (Den Haag, Netherlands)
item.description:
As market leaders, we have high expectations of ourselves – quality, reliability, safety of our products – and strive for continuous improvement. We work with the best, to be the best, and the secret of our success is simple: we keep learning and exploring. We’ve set our eyes on the world – we want to offer our safety software globally, to complex businesses in many industries. Care to join us?


As an integral member of our product team, the Business Intelligence (BI) Developer is responsible for the entire development cycle of our mission-critical enterprise BI solution. Working with cross-functional teams, you will take responsibility not only for design and development of the platform but quality assurance and maintenance as well.


Using your skills and experience as a BI Developer, you will then shape the underlying architecture of our data warehouse according to business needs identified and projected by the Product Manager.


We are looking for BI Developers.


Accountabilities:


As a Business Intelligence Developer within eVision, your accountabilities will include (but not be limited to):



  • Participate in design and analysis of our solutions

  • Assist Product Manager with translating business requirements into product specifications

  • Implement and guard technology best practices, guidelines and development processes

  • Work closely with Chief Architect to ensure seamless integration with our core products

  • Streamline Quality Assurance by automating tests

  • Provide support to eVision Professional Services to ensure the availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal stakeholders

  • Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members and Professional Services teams

item.title: Software Developer / Data Engineer at KNMP Holding B.V. (Den Haag, Netherlands)
item.description:
Ben jij de ICT-expert die graag luistert naar de klant en samen tot een oplossing wilt komen? Zie je het als een uitdaging om onze core-systemen naar het volgende niveau te brengen? Heb jij daarnaast affiniteit met de apotheek-/zorgsector? Dan is deze baan iets voor jou!

Software Developer / Data Engineer
fulltime, Den Haag centrum

Je hebt de vrijheid om bij andere producten en teams mee te helpen. Denk hierbij aan de KNMP Kennisbank, Apotheek.nl, SFK Select, knmp.nl, pw.nl, zindex.nl, sfk.nl, de appotheek, de oncologie app, de verminderde nierfunctie app, de verkeersdeelname app en verschillende andere apps en websites. Daarbij werk je met bijzondere data en de 'next generation' informatievoorziening voor de zorg.

Wat ga jij in deze functie doen?



  • Ontwikkelen van de back-end van onze core-systemen waarmee wij onze unieke informatie ontsluiten voor de zorgsector binnen Nederland.

  • Herkennen van structuren en patronen in data door het analyseren van onze meer dan 40 unieke kruislings verbonden bronnen.

  • Koppelen met andere systemen en het bedenken van nieuwe manieren om onze informatie te delen met anderen via layering, API´s en webservices.

  • Steeds verder uitbouwen en doorontwikkelen van het bestaande producten- en dienstenpakket middels het ontwikkelen van nieuwe functionaliteiten.

  • In kaart brengen van wensen en eisen voor nieuwe functionaliteiten en wijzigingen bij de business.

  • Opstellen van een functionele ontwerpen aanleiding van de requirements.

  • Werken met agile, waterval of hybride projectmethodieken.

  • Testen van de ontwikkelde code.

  • Bedenken van manieren die de data-integriteit hoog houden en de voorspelbaarheid maximaal (door bijvoorbeeld invoerprocessen te harmoniseren).

item.title: Webdeveloper Frontend (m/w) at AVANCE (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
Du fühlst dich im Web zu Hause und bekommst bei Usability verachtenden Webseiten zitternde Finger?


Dann suchen wir genau Dich für unser unser10-köpfiges Digitalteam aus Frontend-, Mobil-, CMS- und Backend-Spezialisten an unserem Standort Stuttgart. Du wirst an vielfältigen Projekten arbeiten und Dich je nach Deinen Interessen und Fähigkeiten einem Teilgebiet zuwenden. Du verantwortest die Implementierung von Enterprise-CMS-Lösungen, entwickelst mobile Apps auf Basis von HTML5 und Cordova. Auch Konzeption ist in deiner DNA und testen und optimieren gehören für Dich ganz selbstverständlich dazu.

Avance
AVANCE ist der spezialisierte Partner für messbares Vertriebsmarketing, Entwicklung und Beratung. Unser Digitalbereich konzipiert passgenaue und zukunftsweisende Websites, Apps und Lösungen für mobile Geräte, die messbar zum Erfolg unserer Kunden beitragen. Dabei haben unsere Entwickler die sich permanent veränderten digitalen Trends und Anforderungen immer im Blick und entwickeln als Full-Service Agentur internationale Unternehmenswebseites, digitale Tools, Apps und Bewegtbildformate. AVANCE ist mit über 65 Mitarbeitern von Stuttgart und München aus für Kunden in ganz Deutschland und der Schweiz tätig, u. a. für Allianz, Michelin, Commerzbank, Festool, Schweizerische Post, Daimler, AVIS, Zürich Versicherung, Sunrise, Duravit, Know How AG und Object Carpet.


Das bringst Du mit:
- Ein abgeschlossenes Informatik Studium oder eine vergleichbare Berufsausbildung
- Fundierte Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen im Umgang mit HTML, JavaScript und CSS sowie dem objektorientierter Programmierung mit JavaScript
- Eine visuelle Vorstellungskraft und gestalterischen Anspruch
- Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift


Das darfst Du von uns erwarten:
- Welche Technologie Du auch beherrscht: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Enterprise-CMS-Lösungen, HTML5, Cordova, AngularJS, jQuery, ECMAScript 6, LESS, Bootstrap, Node.js, Git – wir verstehen Dich!
- Hoch motiviertes Team mit starkem digitalen/technischen Background
- freie Wahl der Entwicklungswerkzeuge (Hardware + Software)

- Home Office, flexible Arbeitszeiten und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge

Das ist unser Kontakt:

item.title: Trainee (w/m) für den Bereich Informationssicherheit in der Automobilbranche at Volkswagen AG (Wolfsburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Im Zuge der immer schnelleren Digitalisierung gewinnt die Informationssicherheit weltweit immer mehr an Bedeutung.
Die Konzern Informationssicherheit des Volkswagen Konzerns gehört zu der Konzern IT und verantwortet alle relevanten Themen der Informationssicherheit. Das oberste Ziel ist die Gewährleistung eines angemessenen Schutzes der Informationen des Volkswagen Konzerns sowie einer sicheren IT- Umgebung. Zu den Aufgaben der Informationssicherheit zählen u.a.:



  • Identifikation, Bewertung und Management von Risiken sowie Definition adäquater und umsetzbarer Schutzmaßnahmen

  • Definition der schützenswerten Informationen des Konzerns gemeinsam mit den Fachbereichen

  • Überwachung der Umsetzung von Informationssicherheitsmaßnahmen über KPIs, Monitoring und Vor-Ort-Assessments

  • Umsetzung von Vorgaben und Richtlinien in standardisierte konzernweite Prozesse und Lösungen gemeinsam mit den Fachbereichen

  • Bereitstellung von standardisierten und skalierbaren Sicherheitsprozessen und -technologien

  • Schnelle Reaktion auf kritische Feststellungen sowie Unterstützung bei der Schließung von Schwachstellen

  • Koordination von proaktiven Schutzmaßnahmen und der Einsatz von Tools zum Detektieren von Hacker-Angriffen sowie forensische Analysen bei Vorfällen

  • Definition und Umsetzung der Schutzziele in der Shopfloor IT sowie im Umfeld Connected Car u. der Mobilen Online Dienste


Wir suchen Trainees für das 18-monatige Programm StartUp Cross:


Während der Projekteinsätze in diversen Unternehmensbereichen lernen Sie Konzernstandorte im In- und Ausland kennen. Dieses bietet Ihnen die Möglichkeit, interdisziplinär und global erfolgreich zu lernen und eine große Chance, eigene Netzwerke aufzubauen. Insgesamt eine einzigartige Möglichkeit, einen umfassenden Einblick in die komplexen Zusammenhänge eines internationalen Konzerns zu bekommen.


Nach dem Traineeprogramm wird der Bereich Informationssicherheit Ihr Zielbereich sein.

item.title: Trainee (w/m) für den Bereich IT Services in der Automobilbranche at Volkswagen AG (Wolfsburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Ohne IT läuft schon heute in einem Automobilunternehmen nichts mehr! Die Digitalisierung und damit die Durchdringung der IT im Unternehmen schreiten stetig voran und die IT dringt in immer mehr Bereiche vor - vom Fahrzeug bis zum Automobilkunden. Für Volkswagen ist es daher umso wichtiger, dass zuverlässige, kosteneffektive und innovative IT Lösungen zur Verfügung stehen. Dies verantwortet die Konzern IT als der größte IT Service Provider im Volkswagen Konzern - rund um die Uhr und rund um den Globus, in internationalen Teams mit Marken, Gesellschaften und Partnern.


Ein wesentliches Element der Arbeit im Bereich IT Services ist der IT Servicekatalog, in dem das IT Serviceportfolio beschrieben ist. Der IT Servicekatalog ist damit die Grundlage für die finanzielle Steuerung, die Sourcingaktivitäten, regelmäßige externe Benchmarks sowie insbesondere für eine zuverlässige Leistungserbringung. Um für die zukünftigen Herausforderungen im Rahmen der Digitalisierung vorbereitet zu sein, ist die weitere Standardisierung und Steuerung der IT Services über Marken und Gesellschaften eine grundlegende Voraussetzung.


Der IT Servicekatalog mit begleitenden Instrumenten wird nun für den konzernweiten Einsatz vorbereitet und ausgerollt. Als Teil eines internationalen Projektteams haben Sie die Möglichkeit, den Rollout zu begleiten und spannende Aufgaben selbstständig und unterstützend wahrzunehmen.


Wir suchen Trainees für das 18-monatige Programm StartUp Cross:


Während der Projekteinsätze in diversen Unternehmensbereichen lernen Sie Konzernstandorte im In- und Ausland kennen. Dieses bietet Ihnen die Möglichkeit, interdisziplinär und global erfolgreich zu lernen und eine große Chance, eigene Netzwerke aufzubauen. Insgesamt eine einzigartige Möglichkeit, einen umfassenden Einblick in die komplexen Zusammenhänge eines internationalen Konzerns zu bekommen.


Nach Beendigung des Traineeprogramms wird der Bereich IT Services Governance & Compliance Ihr Zielbereich sein.

item.title: IT System-Administrator at AVANCE Gesellschaft für Marketing und Vertrieb mbH (Stuttgart, Deutschland)

IT System-Administrator


VOLLZEIT Relenbergstraße 80, 70174 Stuttgart, Deutschland Mit Berufserfahrung

Außerdem verfügst Du bereits über sehr gute Kenntnisse im Bereich Netzwerktechnik (TCP/IP, VPN, SIP, iSCSI) und kannst auch sicher mit PowerShell umgehen und arbeiten. Eine wichtige Aufgabe ist hier auch der First-Level-Support für die Anwender.


Wenn Du Dich hier siehst, bist du bei AVANCE genau richtig! Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Termin eine/n IT System-Administrator.


Das erwartet Dich:



  • Einrichtung und Administration von Servern und Clients im Microsoft Umfeld

item.title: Front End Developer with Angular at WalletHub (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
item.description:
WalletHub is a high-growth start-up based in Washington, D.C. .Our fast-paced environment and can do attitude have already earned us several prestigious awards including this year's Gold Stevie for best financial services website from the American Business Awards and a gold medal as one of the products of the year from the Consumer World Awards.  We're seeking hardworking, like-minded individuals to help us disrupt personal finance and make a tangible difference in people's everyday lives.


More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:



  1. Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.

  2. Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.

  3. Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.


In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.


Responsibilities include:



  • Communicate with backend person in order to integrate API's with UI.

  • SDK integration of FB, Twitter, and Google SDK's. Know how each one is used and interacted with.

  • Be able to slice PSD's to pixel perfection including margins, paddings, line heights, and font sizes.

  • Keep up-to-date with the latest standards and techniques concerning CSS, JS and the libraries we are using like jQuery, Knockout, Require, etc.


Note: This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed either remotely (outside the U.S.) or from WalletHub’s offices in downtown Washington, D.C. Expected work schedule is 45 to 50 hours per week.

item.title: Linux System Administrator at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Can you spot safety issues at a glance? Can you think like a hacker to boost security? Do you think differently? Join our Data Center Operations team and help ensure the safety and stability of the world's largest hotel search as you maintain and protect our site's servers. We’re always considering what we can change in order to improve so we’re looking for an experienced, creative tech-head who can give us a fresh perspective. You will monitor and maintain our multi-data center infrastructure and monitor the workload of critical systems, deciding on what changes we will need to make to cope with future workload. You will identify and strengthen vulnerabilities and protect trivago from attack. Think logically to troubleshoot reasons for critical malfunctions and set up automated processes for monitoring, error detection and system setup. You’ll have to find the perfect balance of safety and accessibility so that our users have the best experience possible. We want someone who will question our current approaches to technical problems and who can make sure that we stay on the cutting edge of technology as we rapidly expand. If you feel you can help us move forward, step up and show us what you’ve got.



The ideal candidate:



  • Has at least 4 years’ networking experience in organisations with large networks – preferably in a web environment.

  • Holds a bachelor’s degree or has completed an apprenticeship in Computer Science or has equivalent experience.

  • Has hands-on experience working with and troubleshooting network-related issues using Linux or FreeBSD-based tools. For those unfamiliar with FreeBSD, although you will need to use it on a regular basis, we will provide training and only require that you are an avid learner.

  • Has advanced know-how of monitoring systems (Nagios/Icinga/Cacti) and Apache httpd web server.

  • Possesses an up-to-date knowledge of network-based attacks and their mitigation.

  • Has solid scripting skills.

  • Will speak up if they sense any problems and is fully able to communicate their thoughts, needs and intentions so that any potential misunderstandings are avoided.

  • Couples razor-sharp analytical abilities with a strong sense of responsibility, urgency, and drive.

  • Speaks English (our company language) fluently. German language skills would be a plus.

  • Can start as soon as possible.



Life at trivago:


trivago is an exciting hub of multicultural activity where nationalities from all around the world come to share their knowledge and work together on redefining the travelling experience for millions of people. We nurture all our talents and provide them with the support they need to develop professionally as well as personally. We encourage fanatic learning through regular code workshops, Hackathons and constant feedback as well as promoting quick decision making in keeping with our trial and error philosophy. Flexible working hours are in place to create a trusting environment where productivity is measured through goals rather than hours spent in the office. For our internationals, we help with relocation and provide language classes for those wanting to learn and practise their German.
Join us at trivago – a place where talented minds meet, crazy ideas are shared and innovation is born.



Important additional information:



  • Please note that non-EU citizens will require a university degree in order to receive a work permit.

  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

item.title: US/Canada Magento Developer (Remote) at CyberSolutions LLC (Thousand Oaks, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Full Job Description Available Here:


https://jobs.alongside.com/details/uscanada-magento-developer-remote/13454?utm_source=stackoverflow


We are a Magento exclusive development company with over 18 team members working daily towards addressing all of our Magento client's needs. We pride ourselves in the ability to work effectively in remote locations, using the latest technologies, and ensuring all team members can work from anywhere!


We are looking for an additional Magento developer to add to our team and assist with daily Magento tasks. This position is a remote hourly position, you will log your time using a provided desktop application, and communicate with other team members and managers via our development integration systems.


Please only apply if you are an individual we are not looking to hire other companies, but rather individuals who wish to grow with us as a team.


Responsibilities:


 Position #1 - Modifications Deployment Specialist (US/Canada - Native English Speakers Only)



  • Assist in deploying completed work to production sites. In order to do this you will utilize GIT and pull changes from the repo. You will also apply any Magento configuration necesarry for the changes occurring (Necesarry deployment configurations will be provided)

  • General SSH experience is required.

  • Must be available to work sometime between the hours of 7AM Pacific - 5PM Pacific


Position #2 - Advanced Magento Developer (Intl OK - But must be highly proficient in English language)



  • You will be addressing advanced Magento tasks which you may need to coordinate directly with the client via our ticket system.

  • GIT experience required and must work in your local development environment and commit changes to the repo for review/approval

  • No SSH experience required (although you can mention if you have it)

  • Flexible working Time Zone (work on your own time zone)



Qualifications:


- Magento Frontend Development Experience (CSS and/or HTML changes, Responsive design)


- Magento Backend Development Experience (Custom Modules, Local Overrides, Modifying Controllers)


- Experience working with GIT (Commit, Push, Pull, ..etc)


- Available for minimum of 20 hours a week (M-F)


- Citizen of United States or Canada (Position #1 Only)


- An individual or Freelancer (No Companies)


Experience:


3 - 11 year(s) (Required)


Skills:


- SSH


- PHP


- Magento


- jQuery


- GIT


- HTML


- CSS


Additional Information:


 Working with us means the freedom to choose when and where you work.


Position #1 - You are expected to work sometime between the hours of 7AM - 5PM Pacific (M-F) to address the duties/tasks which are assigned to you and help make progress as a team.


Position #2 - There is no set schedule (work on any time zone), although we do expect you to be reliable and consistent. That means working at some point every day during the week (M-F) to address the duties/tasks which are assigned to you and help make progress as a team.


We don't do phone conferences or weekly meetings! 


Apply here only:


https://app.alongside.com/profile/step/1/apply/13454?utm_source=stackoverflow

item.title: Senior Backend Developer (PHP) at VONQ (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
You are a technically curious Backend PHP Developer that wants to be part of a core development product team. You do understand (and maybe even have already harvested) the power of things like TDD, DDD, CQRS ? Then apply for the position of Senior Backend Developer (PHP) at VONQ and be part of our team that builds our flagship product, tools and APIs that serve global customers! #gettingthingsdoneright

Senior Backend Developer (PHP)
Rotterdam and / or Amsterdam, fulltime position (32 - 40)
You can be based either in Amsterdam or Rotterdam. The choice is yours!

Description

As a Senior Backend Developer in the VONQ Product Team, you will be leading critical product development efforts and get your hands dirty in the implementation of our revised core platform. You'll be working closely with our CTO and our product development. You will be developing new product offerings, improve existing ones, roll out products to production and ensure all works well in our DTAP. Key to success is automation. Together we will be paving the path to Continuous Delivery.

What you actually will do



  • Contribute to development process improvements through tools and automation and proper DTAP environment setup (working close to our devops engineer)

  • Contribute to design and implementation of scalable and performing production

  • Contribute to design and development of revised application platform on basis of big data technologies that fit current and future data usage scenarios (think of ELK stack)

  • Lead design and implementation efforts of core applications, APIs and services

  • Mentor team members

  • Safe-guard enterprise product quality of APIs and GUIs

  • Strengthen environment, data & application security

  • Realize a path to Continuous Delivery 


Which boxes do you tick?
(Psst...You do not need to tick all the boxes below in order to apply...)
What you see below, paints the ideal picture. Obviously, we also work well with people that have appetite to excel, foundation to build on and potential to succeed.

If things below are in your bucket list and dying to put your hands into, then do Apply!

"Our perfect picture":



  • Bachelor degree or equivalent relevant work experience

  • Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum / Kanban)

  • Product development experience - knowing what it takes to build a future-proof product...

  • Fan and evangelizer of solid development practices (TDD, CI etc.)

  • Experience with rolling out products to production (incl. proper version mngt)

  • Experience leading development efforts and aligning with FE engineers & Data designers

  • Have worked before in distributed team is a plus

  • Love to code (weapons of choice: Symfony, phpunit and phpspec for testing are in your armory)

  • You see beauty in engineering (event sourcing, CQRS, event driven design, scalable architectures)

  • Experience with solid API design is a big plus

  • Experience working with Relational and non-Relational (NoSQL) Databases;

  • Experience with scalable reporting solutions is a plus (think of Logstash / ElasticSearch / Kibana)

  • Experience with multilayer application design & integrations and dependencies management

  • Experience with TDD and end–to-end testing is plus

  • Experience with data visualization projects is a big plus

  • Experience with data driven products is a big plus

  • Excellent communication skills in English 


Things we cherish



  • Business-focus

  • Entrepreneurial spirit

  • Technical curiosity, critically open to new tools and technologies

  • Caring for good, extensible architecture across board

  • Good communicator (in English)

  • Pragmatism

  • Goal driven personality

  • Lame jokes (what can I say...) & beer on Fridays and often BBQs at our terrace ;-) 


What’s in it for you
First of all, you’ll be working with experienced colleagues with a strong vision on web development and software architecture, giving you a full intellectual challenge every day. Secondly, every two weeks you’ll have dedicated R&D time to move the development of our Job Marketing Platform to the next level. Thirdly, you'll participate to meetups/conferences.

What’s more



  • Laptop of your preferences and two extra screens on your desk

  • Flexible working hours

  • Time and budget for training

  • 5 weeks paid holiday per year

  • Good salary and additional incentives

  • Fixed term contract with an option for perm


So, does this sounds appealing to you?
Please apply by clicking on the 'Apply' button.


If you have any questions, please send an e-mail to Dimitra Retsina (CTO/CPO) -> dimitra(at)vonq.com.

Keywords: PHP, product Engineer, Symfony, CQRS, big data

item.title: Frontend Game Developer- Streamed video environment at NetEnt (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Do you feel that you want to be more creative? Looking for real problems to solve and real technical challenges? Then you should continue reading. Because the development of NetEnt’s LiveCasino is not a walk in the park. It’s a highly challenging job where your creativity would be tested to its limit. But at the same time, if you have what it takes, you would love it.



What’s so challenging about it? Well, we are developing a live streaming product in a gaming environment, a live casino, with dealers working on the other side of Europe. We need to deploy to several servers and this for all web browsers and operating systems. For desktop, tablets and mobile phones.


What we do


Writing code from scratch, decide how the client should look like. This is a product we are building right now and how this should be done is up to you and your team. You would be a part of a highly competent team of developers to create an amazing large scale product and experience. We work in small, collaborative Scrum teams where ownership of the outcome is the key.


How we do it


We build for the long term with focus on maintainability and quality. And we breathe TDD. A day here would look something like this: Coffee, stand up meeting, discussing a technical problem, coffee, design, implementation, writing unit tests, collaboration with testers. You would also probably eat some lunch there in between.


In the LiveCasino team we chose our own OS and always strive to work with the best and most suitable technology such as EcmaScript 6, Karma, Mocha.


Who are you?


Creative! And a problem solver, I know it’s a cliché, but with this this product there’s no other way. Equally important, you’re a team player who like to cooperative and communicate with people.


To enjoy NetEnt you need to respond positively to an environment where flexibility and adaptability to swiftly changing situations is required. Hopefully you’re curious and like to explore new technologies.


And, important; you enjoy challenges. Others are doing what we are building, but we are here to do it even better.


Do you want to hear more about the work life at NetEnt, for instance our 6 weeks of vacation, 5000 SEK in health benefits, why we have a person working 100% with health and energizing activities or our innovation events? Then apply and our LiveCasino development Manager, Fayan, will tell you all about it.

- Experienced with automation techniques and tools.
- Knowledgeable in developing and using front-end frameworks. Focused on maintainability, quality and building for the long term.

- Hands-on experience working in an Agile/Scrum development environment.

Who are you?

- A curious and fast learner, eager to embrace new technology and techniques.


Interested?


We look forward to your application in English, including your CV and a letter in which you introduce yourself and tell us about your interest in the specific position.


Join the NetEnt journey – warm welcome with your application!

item.title: Java Developer at The Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
Salary range: £24,226k to £39,142, dependent on experience, plus excellent benefits

We are seeking an experienced full stack Java developer to work in the development of high throughput Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) to meet the increasing informatics needs of our world class scientific institute and collaborative projects.

We develop a large scale LIMS to assist in the tracking of scientific data generated in our labs, as well as bespoke support for our faculty groups. See http://www.sanger.ac.uk/science/groups/mouse-pipelines for more information on the work we do. Our LIMS is used to support many other groups, both within the Sanger Institute and around the world.

You will become part of a relaxed but professional software development team, with access to world class computing resources and many opportunities for furthering your knowledge of robust web development, user interface design, Java and relational databases.

This role involves gathering and implementing user requirements and discussing the impact of new features with the senior developers in the group and other members of the team. We operate a separate ticketing system to track and manage user issues and bugs.
We develop primarily in Java using a web stack running on Apache Tomcat and using Oracle as the database layer.

Our user interfaces are built with JSP, JavaScript and SASS.

Depending on the successful candidate's experience we are able to offer either a senior or intermediate level position.

Essential Skills

  • A reputable degree in Computing science or demonstrable equivalent experience of the same level
  • A minimum of two years' work experience in practical software development.
  • A good working knowledge of Java and web development.
  • Experience with current software development tools and practice including Eclipse/InteliJ, Maven, unit testing and version control (SVN/Git).
  • Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.


Ideal Skills

  • Knowledge of the Spring Framework APIs.
  • Design and manual querying of relational databases (preferably Oracle).
  • An interest in user experience and user interface design.
  • Development with jQuery and CSS/SASS.
  • Development with JDBC and experience of bespoke SQL querying.
  • Agile project methodologies.


Other information



The Sanger Institute is a charitably funded research centre focused on understanding the role of genetics in health and disease. We use state of the art large-scale genomic approaches to drive world-leading projects to uncover the basis of genetic and infectious disease. Our goal is to provide results that can be translated into diagnostics, treatments or therapies that reduce global health burdens.

The Institute is located near Cambridge, UK on the stunning Wellcome Genome Campus. This growing and dynamic site is the British hub of genomic science. It hosts the European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI), Open Targets, a Biodata Innovation Centre and will soon host Genomics England Limited's 100,000 Genomes Sequencing Centre. Its vision is to inspire a range of audiences both on the Campus and beyond it, and make the world of genomics open and accessible to all.

Our Benefits include: Defined Contribution Pension Scheme, Group Income Protection, Healthcare scheme, Childcare Vouchers, Workplace Nursery and 25 days Annual Leave, increasing by one day per year up to a maximum of 30, plus Bank Holidays. We also have a gym, two cafes, dining facilities, and a free campus bus service. Our thriving Sports and Social Club provides many opportunities to meet with people working across the campus.

Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute welcomes applications from all candidates irrespective of age, disability, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief, or marital or civil partnership status.

Please include a covering letter and CV with your application.

Applications will be considered on an on-going basis.

item.title: Consultant (m/w) Schwerpunkt iOS at finarX GmbH (Darmstadt, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wir suchen ab sofort für unseren Standort in Darmstadt einen


Consultant (m/w) Schwerpunkt iOS
zur Festanstellung


Die FINARX GmbH ist ein junges innovatives Unternehmen am Standort Darmstadt mit Alleinstellungsmerkmalen insbesondere im Bereich Mobile Business & Mobile Finance. Unsere Produkte, FINARX Timesheet, FINARX Scan und FINARX Reisekosten, sind unter den Top 25 der Business Apps. Wir bieten individuelle mobile Lösungen. Kunden wie Web.de, die Deutsche Telekom, der Bundesverband Deutscher Banken, BHW Postbank arbeiten ebenso mit unseren mobilen Applikationen für iOS und Android wie das ZDF, die Tafeln und viele weitere Kunden.


WAS SIE ERWARTET
- Beratung: Sie stehen unseren Kunden beratend zur Seite und finden maßgeschneiderte Lösungen.
- Entwicklung: Sie konzipieren, entwickeln und implementieren innovative native Applikationen für iOS (iPhone / iPad).
- Partizipation: Sie sind in alle Phasen des App-Lebenszyklus involviert, von der Ideenfindung über das Konzept bis hin zur Entwicklung und Veröffentlichung.


WAS SIE MITBRINGEN
- Ausbildung: Ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium im Bereich Informatik, einer themenverwandten Fachrichtung oder eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung.
- Kenntnisse: Gute Kenntnisse der iOS Plattform und Erfahrung mit Xcode. Erste Erfahrung im Bereich objektorientierter Analyse und Design. Erste Einblicke in die Programmiersprache Swift.
- Enthusiasmus: Begeisterung für die neusten Apps und Smartphones. Die Motivation hochwertige Lösungen gemeinsam im Team zu realisieren. Reisebereitschaft und Mobilität.


WAS WIR IHNEN BIETEN
- Innovation: Spannende und trendweisende Projekte und die Möglichkeit sich mit den neusten Technologien zu beschäftigen. Top ausgestattete Arbeitsplätze mit allem was das Entwicklerherz begehrt.
- Team: Dynamische SCRUM-Teams und eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Dienstwegen. Regelmäßige Firmenevents. Kaffee, Kuchen und Club Mate inklusive.
- Benefits: Flexible Arbeitszeiten, eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance, eine leistungsgerechte Vergütung und moderne Büroräume direkt am Hbf und nur wenige Minuten von der Autobahn.


Werden Sie Teil eines jungen, vielseitigen und innovativen Unternehmens und verfolgen Sie gemeinsam mit uns das Ziel unsere Kunden durch elegante und maßgeschneiderte Lösungen zum Erfolg zu führen.


Wir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Bewerbung mit Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und des möglichen Starttermins an:


Reihana Sarif • Lise-Meitner-Straße 10 • 64293 Darmstadt • (0 61 51) 850 69 11 • human.resources@finarx.de • www.finarx.de

item.description:
Have you dreamed of building the future? relayr has become Europe's leading platform for the Internet of Things, enabling the interaction between diverse systems, and creating new scenarios in which we interact with the world around us. If you would like to work with a great team and technology to build the infrastructure for the next generation of connected devices.


Then relayr is the right place for you!


Relayr is bringing things to life. We have three technical pillars: an Internet of Things Platform as a Service, open SDKs and a Hardware development platforms designed to allow developers and enterprises to quickly build Internet of Things solutions.


We are looking to recruit a diverse group to be able to best handle the diverse problems in the emerging market of Internet of Things. Currently we are seeking a Backend NodeJS developer to join our team.


Note:  In order to support fair hiring practices and combat sources of bias, we ask you to provide CVs without pictures.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Experian Bulgaria (Sofia, Bulgaria)
item.description:
We are currently looking for a Senior Java Developer to take part in the development of an enterprise, component based framework, following receipt of system/program requirements.


Responsibilities:



  • Formulation of the technical requirements

  • Comprehensive and accurate program/system design

  • Development of robust, resilient, scalable and easily maintainable systems

  • Support of existing Java based software solutions

  • Production of unit tests and maintaining good code quality

item.title: Senior Rails Developer at Whitespectre (Barcelona, Spain) (allows remote)
item.description:
We have been building on an elegant microservice architecture of 17 loosely coupled Rails services (http REST, async queuing etc) for the last 2+ years. It's in production, supporting multiple brands and driving millions of dollars of revenue every month from US sales.


We are looking for 2 experienced and smart developers to join our team and help us deliver more features, faster for our long-term client. Are you an experienced developer looking for a new challenge? Does working in a company that specialises in high performing distributed teams sound exciting?


What do we offer?



  • Work as part of a talented, globally distributed, successful team

  • A focussed adherance to our agile/scrum processes (we really believe it helps getting good work done)

  • Hard problems to solve (you won't find all the answers on Stack Overflow) - and the opportunity to own the solutions

  • A great working atmosphere where you can share and learn with other smart people

  • The best-in-class toolsets: Slack, CI/CD with Docker etc

  • Meetups in our Barcelona offices for our remote folks

  • Competitive rates

  • A long term working relationship: at least a year working on this project, then others.


You'll be:



  • Working within a fast moving team (working 11am - 8pm Central European time)

  • Solving hard business logic with elegant software design

  • Identifying bottlenecks, using tools to diagnose and refactor code for scale

  • Ensuring the robustness, performance and failure characteristics of the system.

  • Writing well tested (rspec), defect free code with CI/CD

  • Taking ownership of production applications - managing issues, releases and ensuring quality

  • Occasionally going full stack and also building functionality for the SPAs in javascript (experience in node/react/backbone is useful) 


Good english verbal and written communication skills are essential.


This is a contract position with a long term outlook (12 months+ full time project) for the the right candidate. We are looking for remote workers (most of the company is remote) or have openings based in our Barcelona office.

item.title: Systemutvecklare till Orio! at Orio (Trollhättan, Sweden)
item.description:
Orio är i en ny fas med ny strategi och spännande utmaningar. Genom att bredda deras erbjudande och utöka den nuvarande kundbasen fortsätter de att växa och utvecklas. Nu riktar Orio fokus framåt, förhoppningsvis tillsammans med dig!


OM TJÄNSTEN


Orio är ett globalt reservdels- och logistikföretag med stark, innovativ anda. Bland deras smarta och konkurrenskraftiga lösningar finns både logistik och ingenjörskunnande i världsklass. De kommer som enda distributör av Saab Original reservdelar att fortsätta stödja och förse Saab Service Centers med tillförlitlig service och kunskap, precis som de gjort i snart 70 år.


Academic Work söker för Orios räkning en systemutvecklare som ska jobba i team med kompententa kollegor och bidraga med sin kunskap och arbeta med C#.net-utveckling.


Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och Orios önskemål är att alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till Academic Work


Tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Academic Work men du kommer anställas direkt hos Orio.


ARBETSUPPGIFTER


Till Orios funktion Product Portfolio, Information & Engineering, med placering på kontoret i Trollhättan behöver de utöka sin organisation med en systemutvecklare.


I den här rollen kommer du jobba teambaserat och tillsammans med en kollega ansvara för framtagning, leverans och/eller publikation samt underhåll av applikationer för beredning av teknisk produktinformation till en global marknad i enlighet med kunders behov och beställning. Du kommer vidare att ge stöd i framtagandet av teknisk produktinformation, kvalitétssäkra produktinformationen i enlighet med Orios interna funktioner (Inköp, IT, Sales och Marketing) och deras verkstäders behov. Du kommer också att ansvara för datasupport i olika format, ge råd och stödja verksamhetens projekt.

item.title: Fullstack Developer (full-time, m/f) - Help build Europe's leading Mobile Wallet at Stocard GmbH (Mannheim, Deutschland)
item.description:
Join us as a FULLSTACK DEVELOPER (full-time, m/f) and help us to improve and maintain the backbone of our app that is used by millions of users!


YOUR CHALLENGES


Be an integral part of our development team and play a key role in developing our app. Help us develop backend services as the foundation for existing and new features of our mobile clients, write server side code in order to deliver scalable backend solutions. Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables. Push your comfort zone and gain insights into the world of iOS and Android. It’s all about teamwork – use your resourceful and entrepreneurial attitude to build an amazing product together with our mobile development teams.


You’ll be part of a motivated and ambitious team of technical generalists in a product-focused culture. We are always open to new technology & paradigms and always strive to get the most out of our tech stack. Our backend is written in node.js, our docker swarm is hosted at AWS, and we are looking for you to create new micro-services and take care of existing ones. Our work environment is fast paced, inspiring, friendly with a flat hierarchy.

item.title: Automation Dev (Cloud exp) needed asap - near Swindon, Dublin or Derry at Intergraph UK Ltd - Hostsure (Dublin, Ireland) (allows remote)
item.description:
The Automation Developer is an integral member of the SmartPlant Cloud Automation team and key to ensuring on time and quality project delivery. Supporting the other team members and management, the individual will work on a variety of projects including setup, configuration and testing of automation framework components, PowerShell module scripting, Workflow analysis and design, Workflow Scripting as well as assisting in Research and Development efforts during Proof of Concept phases designed to enhance the Automation framework. Additionally, the Developer will help coach non-developer team members to improve their PowerShell Coding and module creation where possible with a focus on code quality and adherence to team standards.


It is expected that the role will be developed to the individual’s strength’s and become more specialised over time, particularly where a natural aptitude or desire is shown towards a specific area or application.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop required PowerShell Modules and Azure Automation Runbooks in accordance with best practices.

  • Produce documentation supporting the development lifecycle.

  • Contribute to the automation framework and methodology development.

  • Support and learn from automation engineers and developers in a variety of automation workflows.

  • Coach non-developer team members in development methodologies and best practices.

  • Attend regular project, team and customer meetings where required.

  • Liaise with Microsoft Azure Teams when required to help deploy new features and enhancements released on the Azure Automation platform.

  • Participate in R&D efforts to improve methods, toolsets and processes used by the automation team.

  • Support Automation Workflows and code throughout its lifecycle from Development to Test/Integration and then into the Production environment.


Intergraph Process, Power & Marine (PP&M) offers challenging work and a global team environment where your opinion counts. We also offer a competitive compensation and benefits package including opportunities for professional development and learning. To learn more about our company visit www.intergraph.com. To view all of our EMIA region employment opportunities or to apply for this job visit http://www.intergraph.com/careers/emia/default.aspx

item.title: Student Systems Officer at University for the Creative Arts (Farnham, UK)
item.description:
Full Time Post: 36.25 hours per week


£25,298 to £28,453 per annum                                                                Ref: 16-RSS012-0630-1


As a member of the Student Records & Systems team, the Student Systems Officer has responsibility for the day-to-day operation of the University’s student records system, currently SITS:Vision. As part of the wider Academic Registry, you will contribute to the maintenance and development of the student records database to ensure the effective operation of University-wide business processes and services. The post-holder has line management responsibility for the Systems & Process Administrator.


You will have previous operational experience of system administration and the development and implementation of system functionality. You will also be familiar with the interrogation of information systems and the management of electronic data transfers and large and complex data sets. Ideally you will have experience of collaborative working relationships preferably within a Higher Education environment.

item.title: Senior Java Developer X2 at Nagra Media UK (Cwmbran, UK)
item.description:
Senior Java Developer jobs in Cwmbran - Up to £60K + benefits - Innovative and dynamic technology company


(Java 6, JEE, AWS, Cloud, Big Data, Open Source, Jboss, SOAP, RESTful Web Services, JavaScript, Node.JS, CSS, HTML, SVG, JSON, AJAX, JSF, Groovy, MongoDB, SQL)


Your new company


An excellent job opportunity has arisen for a skilled Senior Java JEE Developer to join Nagra Media, a global leading technology company. Nagra Media are a technology company that develop cutting-edge solutions for the multimedia industry. The organisation are in a period of rapid expansion due to increased workload. They boast an impressive portfolio of UK and international based clients. This is an opportunity to be at the forefront of innovation, working with cutting edge technologies.


Your new role


Nagra Media are in the process of embarking on an ambitious technology transformation programme. As a result, they are recruiting for multiple Senior Developers who have the ability to suggest new technologies and contribute towards an ever evolving technology stack.


The organisation are currently exploring a number of Open Source, Big Data and Cloud technologies (AWS) so if you have any experience in these areas it would be a distinct advantage but it is not essential.


You will have the opportunity to work with a wide range of different technologies including Java 6, JEE, Jboss, SOAP, RESTful Web Services, JavaScript, Node.js, CSS, HTML, SVG, JSON, AJAX, JSF, Groovy, MongoDB and SQL.


You will take an active involvement in the design and implementation of projects, in addition to helping to mentor more junior members of the team.


What you'll need to succeed


You should have proven experience with Java JEE. If you have any experience with any of the other listed technologies this would be an advantage but it is not essential. We are interested in hearing from high calibre software engineers that have a genuine interest in increasing their technical skill set. You therefore do not need experience with all of the listed technologies, as we are keen to hear from experienced Java Developers that have a genuine passion for exploring new technologies and projects.

item.title: Director ABOUT YOU Shop Development (m/f) at ABOUT YOU GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
:: ABOUT THE JOB


Our Shop team develops our high traffic fashion shop ABOUT YOU on desktop and tablet. In 2-week-sprints they implement new features with the target to steadily improve our shop. They are our „regatta-sailors“: fast sprints, proficient, mvp-focused, multicultural. You want to code state-of-the-art in an output-driven, structured work environment? You like fast implementation of ideas? Then you are the perfect fit for our Shop team who is searching for a Director ABOUT YOU Shop Development (m/f) at the moment.



:: ABOUT WHAT TO EXPECT



  • Responsibility, planning and further development of all technical projects and requirements

  • Management of touching points and cross projects with other technical leads and teams

  • Responsibility and further development of all technical and architectural decisions regarding our shop in coordination with our CTO

  • Controlling of our shop development team

  • Management and prioritizing of relevant stakeholder's requirements

  • Flat hierarchies, lean processes and very short decision making processes

item.title: Operations Engineer at ABOUT YOU GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
:: ABOUT THE TEAM AND THE JOB


Our operations team takes a great responsibility for our high traffic platform. They operate all the different services that are needed for a uninterrupted 24/7 business - even when one of our famous special promotions take place and we have to deal with ten times or even more concurrent users. The team is our “Power-Shipyard”: always keen on new ideas, constantly working on improving our diversified infrastructure. Shipping secure and reliable services to all the other teams, automating the whole harbor, working closely with developers, trying exciting stuff with containers and other ways to ship products are just a few of their responsibilities. You want to contribute your ideas and see how they work at our great project to build an awesome fashion shop? You want to work in a professional and multicultural work environment? Then you are the perfect support for our Ops team who is searching for a Operations Engineer (m/f) at the moment. 


:: ABOUT WHAT TO EXPECT



  • Responsibility to maintain, run and continuously improve our highly available and scalable infrastructure

  • Possibility to contribute your ideas and know-how

  • Supporting our Developers with build and deployment processes

  • Supervising and monitoring our software in integration, staging and live environments

  • Working with an ecommerce infrastructure that is completely developed in-house from scratch

item.title: Java Developer or Front-End Developer- Work in an open source company! (Finland) at Vaadin Ltd (Turku, Finland)
item.description:
We are looking for several passionate Java experts  and Front-End experts to join our fight for simplifying the lives of developers all over the world. Vaadin Framework has already conquered the hearts of more than 150,000 developers worldwide, and we are hungry for more.


Join the Vaadin team and help us define the future of open source!


What you can expect from us


We value technology and innovation over convention and status quo. We are all rich with ideas, ardent towards developing new and better solutions and love bending the limits of what is possible on the web. We are free from frivolous bureaucracy and you get to work with cutting edge technologies and pick the tools you need to succeed. We encourage you to put 10% of your working time into your personal projects that help moving Vaadin forward. We are truly proud - not only of the fact that our open source technology is used by thousands of developers worldwide, but also of our brilliant team. We challenge and support you to grow as a professional in our creative environment.

item.description:
We’re expanding again.


To spice up our development team, we are currently looking for seasoned Java Developers who are passionate about the latest web technologies. Yes, we said passionate. Because you will help building a state-of-the-art, mobile-first responsive web shop for 2.5 million customers. Sounds interesting to you? Perfect. You’ll get all the support you need within our agile ecosystem, working in forward-thinking, self-organised teams.
