item.title: Self-empowered DevOps/System Engineer, to create scalable & reliable environment at eSailors IT solutions GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Our mission is to disrupt the online lottery business with innovative and engaging products. Product discovery through user testing, prototypes and qualitative research help us validate ideas at an early stage. Quantitative analysis and conversion rate optimization help us to iterate products and improve performance. Self-empowered and autonomous teams foster ownership and a drive to exceed expectations. Collaboration nurtures trust, inventiveness and a willingness to be bold. As a multicultural team with over 150 employees from 15 countries, we develop and run a state of the art e-Commerce platform.


In order to scale and hit the needs of the market, we are looking for a DevOps/System Engineer who is able to write infrastructure as code within an agile environment. If you want to create scalable and reliable environments, enjoy peer reviews, hackathons and cross-functional team work then we should get together and find out if we’re a match.


Your development branch at eSailors:



  • You itch to automate manual, repetitive ‘no-brainer’ tasks.

  • You still want to automate things people tell you only happen rarely every eight weeks.

  • You strive for Continuous Delivery / Deployment of Web Applications using CI Tools like Jenkins.

  • Cross-functional teams are your catalyst to expand your horizons.

item.title: Infrastructure Team Lead at Magine (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
We are building a globally distributed video streaming platform and all that it entails as far as infrastructure, architecture, operations, latency, reliability, uptime and so on. As developers we need to build software that will handle humongous™ load while still keeping low response times and correctness. We want our systems to be up for the challenges of the real world and we want you to join us in making it happen. 


Your role


We’re looking for experienced Software Engineering team leads experienced in Infrastructure Automation to lead our Infrastructure team in Stockholm and to help us further evolve our infrastructure to support a rapid growth of users and global expansion. The objective for the infrastructure team is to ensure scalability, performance and high availability of our services and to help other teams to increase their productivity by providing a Platform-as-a-Service to the development teams. If you like hands on work as well as being the point of reference for your colleagues this might be the position for you.


Responsibilities



  • Team coordination and support in decision making processes.

  • Day to day hands on work responsibilities related to design and development of our global       distribution system.

  • Support team members and become their point of reference technically and organizationally.

  • Interface with other development teams and the operation team in order to negotiate technical solutions and guarantee a high level of efficiency of our Infrastructure.

  • Collaborate with and help people inside and outside of the team.

  • Transfer business knowledge from stakeholders to the team.

item.title: Mobile App Developer at mPort (Macquarie Park, Australia)
item.description:
Advanced Aussie Tech Startup – Mobile App Developer


We are now in a position to expand our team, hiring experienced (post-)agile software developers, team leads, and modern architects. Our technologists have talent, curiosity, and a passion for innovating and crafting world-changing software.


Our current mobile app targets both Android and iOS using Xamarin, but with some native components written in Java and Objective-C / Swift. We’d like to harness more of the native capabilities of each platform while also leveraging responsive web content. You’ll work with and help enhance a RESTful API delivering resources in both HTML and JSON, have a working knowledge of HTTPS, cloud-based CI/CD for mobile apps, and App Store management.

item.title: (Sr.) Software Engineer( Java/Scala/Go/C++) at HERE (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
HERE, the Open Location Platform company, enables people, enterprises and cities to harness the power of location. By making sense of the world through the lens of location we empower our customers to achieve better outcomes – from helping a city manage its infrastructure or an enterprise optimize its assets to delivering drivers to their destination safely. To learn more about HERE, including our new generation of cloud-based location platform services, visithttp://360.here.com.



HERE CTO Office Applied Technologies is building a new team of specialized software engineers and researchers to work on cutting-edge research and technologies. 



The team has a mission of bridging the gap between research and engineering at HERE and provide best-practice engineering support to development teams. We assess new technologies and their potential, work on proof of concepts, early product development together with our business units, and in some cases take responsibility of the product from end to end. 



We define and uphold best-in-class software engineering practices for the company, and support the teams adopting those. Projects and products have a wide range, including Embedded Linux, Virtualization, 3D Rendering Technologies, Distributed Processing and Analytics in the Cloud, as well as defining best practices for ways of working. 



You will:



* think and create solutions for improve HERE location services


* develop, review code and apply best practices to ongoing work


* collaborate with research to bridge innovation into production


* influence how the team evolves and improves




You can expect from us:



* to work in a brand new office and modern environment; conveniently located next to Eindhoven


  station


* to work with a team that always keeps your mind busy


* to work on bleeding edge technologies and tools


* to have good options to configure your equipment


* and, we're always working on the coffee quality!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Java / RubyonRails) at Pocketmath (Singapore)
item.description:
The Sopranos team (backend) develops and maintains numerous services that backs Pocketmath products. We are responsible for the bidders that integrates with supply-side platforms and bid on behalf of our customers. Our bidders can handle up to 40 million HTTP bid requests per minute, achieving a median of 5 milliseconds for processing each bid request.


We are looking for senior engineers who create well-designed services that are built to last. We value maintainability, performance at scale, reliability, quality, and simplicity.


Our toolchain consists mostly of Java, Go, Spring Boot, Docker, MySQL, HBase, New Relic, Git, Jenkins with an assortment of other technologies like AWS Kinesis, RDS, Data Pipelines, Redshift.


The Powerpuffs team (frontend) is looking for a senior developer with a passion for building great products, crafting user experiences and a desire to work with awesome data and analytics. You will primarily be working on our Ruby on Rails stack but a good working knowledge of Node.js, Sinatra and Go would be an advantage.


Together with the rest of the development team, you'll help us build out new features and capabilities across the entire platform.


You'll get to solve cool problems while aggressively learning new languages, frameworks and toolkits.


There's never a dull day here at the Pocketmath team!

item.title: Go Developer at BookerZzz (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Can you make a great contribution to the development of our high traffic websites, thanks to your knowledge of Go in a high performance environment?! Do you want to work within a fun, and innovative scrum team and dynamic working environment? Then we are looking for you!


BookerZzz is in the process of completely overhauling their tech stack and we’ve chosen Go as our primary implementation language. We are creating a scalable service architecture to further grow our business. Your role would be to bring in your experience with Go, expand our knowlede on (we’ve been using Go for almost 2 years now), and help bring our products to the next level!


Due to our (inter)national growth, we are looking for an enthusiastic, ambitious and experienced:


Go Developer


What will you focus on?


Together with your colleagues of the Development Team (Golang / PHP), you are responsible for the development of the various and international websites like HotelSpecial.at and Bungalowspecials.


Whether you optimize the commercial frontend, build a new search engine, improve our A/B testing capabilities or implement a new microservice.


Your main task is to (further) develop and maintain the websites and other applications. Progressive techniques and technologies offer you a helping hand. Your activities are varied and challenging whereby you get a lot of responsibility and independency to carry out the projects.


Within the IT department we work with 4 Scrum teams, coached by our own dedicated Scrum Master, three of them are Golang based.



  • Designing, building and maintaining web applications which are serving lots of users every day;

  • Writing new services in Golang;

  • Improving reliability and performance of core components;

  • Develop API endpoints for new features;

  • Shipping new production systems quickly and iteratively;

  • Writing unit tests for all of your code;

  • Actively participate in our Scrum teams.

item.title: IT Architekt/ -in e-Commerce Plattform at AUDI AG (Ingolstadt, Deutschland)
item.description:
In der Abteilung Marketing & Sales IT Solutions werden die IT Lösungen für den Webauftritt der AUDI AG gesteuert. In enger Abstimmung mit den Fachbereichen entwickeln wir Konzepte, die wir dann gemeinsam in die Tat umsetzen und sicher stellen, dass wir dies innerhalb einer zukunftsfähigen, skalierbaren und performanten Systemlandschaft umsetzen.
Neben der Audi Webseite, den Konfiguratoren und den Fahrzeugbörsen gehört auch das Themenfeld e-Commerce in unseren Verantwortungsbereich, das nicht zuletzt im Zuge der fortschreitenden Digitalisierung immer mehr an Bedeutung gewinnt. In diesem Umfeld suchen wir Ihre tatkräftige Unterstützung!


Ihre Aufgaben




  • Als technischer Product Owner für die e-Commerce-Plattform der AUDI AG sind Sie gemeinsam mit Ihren Teamkollegen verantwortlich für Architektur, Code, Stabilität und Performance der Plattform, die weltweit ausgerollt und betrieben wird

  • Sie betreuen die Plattform und entwickeln sie gemeinsam mit den Applikationsverantwortlichen weiter. Dafür arbeiten Sie eng mit unseren Enterprise Architekten, dem Betrieb sowie den Kollegen in den jeweiligen Vertriebsbereichen zusammen, um in diesem relevanten Themenfeld auch für die Zukunft optimal aufgestellt zu sein

  • Die entsprechend beteiligten IT Dienstleister steuern Sie selbständig und eigenverantwortlich

  • Des Weiteren sind Sie technischer Experte für die Plattform, der auch in Strategieworkshops und Planungsrunden ein aussagekräftiger Vertreter ist

item.title: Software Development Engineer in Test at Amazon (London, UK)
item.description:
At Amazon Video, we're fundamentally changing the way millions of customers access, consume and interact with video content worldwide. Inventing on behalf of our customers is in our DNA: Prime Video, X-Ray, Amazon Studio Originals (The Grand Tour, The Man in the High Castle, Transparent, Shaun the Sheep..) and add-on subscriptions (Showtime, Starz, Comedy Central..) are just a few of the features and capabilities that delight our customers. It's a green-field space overdue for disruption and we'd like you to join us in our mission to enable everyone to search, discover, consume and interact with video content anytime, anywhere and on any device.



The Amazon Video (AV) Web team owns the website experience for all AV customers worldwide. This includes the AV Homepage, Detail Page, Search, Browse, Watchlists, Your Video Library, Account Settings and the Getting Started experience. We're building AV's next generation website architecture and customer experience using technologies such as Node.js, React, Scala and machine learning.



As an Software Development Engineer in Test on the AV Web team, you will design, implement, and deploy software tests/testing strategies to evolve and improve the functionality of the Amazon Video Website for our customers. In addition, you'll collaborate with your peers on the team on projects that improve your team’s software, making it better and easier to maintain, contribute to operational excellence, assist with reviewing other people's code and mentor junior software testers.


  • BS Degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Previous experience as an SDE in a commercial environment, contributing to the design, implementation and successful delivery of high quality software using best practices

  • Experience mentoring junior SDEs

  • Ability to recognize discordant views and contribute to constructively resolving them

  • Fluent with the entire software development life cycle (coding standards, source control, build process, testing and operations).

  • Solid understanding of Computer Science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, data structures, algorithms, problem solving, and complexity analysis and how and when to apply them

  • Track record of ownership, focus on the end customer and delivering the right results




  • Hands-on experience as a full stack software development engineer (front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between)

  • In depth experience with Node.js & React

  • Experience with Scala


Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disability/Vet



machine learning, scala, node, node.js, react, javascript, amazon video, prime video, the grand tour

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer (m/f) for Helpling in Berlin at Helpling GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
About Helpling


We at Helpling love helping people to find the cleaner they want. On our website or app, you can outsource the time-consuming housework within a couple of clicks. For cleaners, our technology platform makes it easier than ever to access new clients and to manage when and where they want to work. For our vision to digitize the world of home services, we have raised more than 56 million Euros from renowned internet pioneers such as Lakestar (Airbnb, Facebook, Spotify) and Mangrove Capital (Skype). Today, we are already a team of 300 and two thirds of us are based at our headquarters in the vibrant heart of Berlin. If you want to make a difference and help changing a whole industry, then Helpling is the right place for you.


Currently, we are looking for a Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer (m/f) to enhance the technical architecture behind the scenes.


How we work


Our application is build on top of Ruby on Rails framework using PostgreSQL database. We use Redis and Memcache as well, and Sidekiq as a queue system. We have integration with Stripe, Adyen, Nexmo and Twilio.


We have a strong agile culture, where some of the teams uses Scrum or Kanban.


We believe that testing should be part of the implementation and not something to (rarely) do later. We do TDD with Rspec for Unit and Integration test and we use Capybara for feature tests.


We develop on a fully reproducible environment using Vagrant and provisioned by SaltStack that we can completely create from the scratch in less than 10 minutes.


We deploy several times a day to Heroku and AWS through a continuous Integration pipeline with Snap-ci and Jenkins.

item.title: Infrastructure Engineer - (1ST, 2nd Line Support) at National Crime Agency (London, UK)
item.description:
Closing Date - Tuesday 1st November 12pm


What do you know about enterprise level cyber and organised crime? If you are intrigued by complex and sophisticated processes together with technological challenges, keep reading. Here at the National Crime Agency, we need people like you who are excited about experimenting, building and evolving our unrivalled resourceful technology and capabilities. Because of the nature of our work, we always have the latest kit in stock. It rivals a majority of global blue-chip organisations.


We are now searching for an Infrastructure Engineer who is seeking to diversify their career path. You will be supporting projects for our operational and intelligence work. You could be someone who is currently in 1st, 2nd 3rd line or application support looking to step in to an Infrastructure role.


Our environment can only be described as a unique, no two days are ever the same.


Are you still interested?


Your day will include, but not limited to the following:



  • Develop and support critical key services and technical capabilities

  • Design of new systems throughout the system life cycle.

  • Provide 1st and 2nd line support to live services, for local and remote users.

  • Assist technical and non-technical users for incidents within sensitive operations.

  • Identify and monitor suspicious or anomalous activity.

  • Decide on appropriate action ensuring implementation of best security practices for NCCU systems design and service operation.

  • Research and propose new technologies for current and future NCCU technical projects.

  • Take a hands on approach. Support engineering and develop projects using a wide range of project, service and software methodologies

  • Maintain NCCU Asset Management records

  • Conduct Asset Management reviews.

  • Build working relationships as appropriate with internal and external partners, across government

item.title: Machine Learning Specialist/in at AUDI AG (Ingolstadt, Germany)
item.description:
Sie bewerben sich auf eine Stelle im Team "Innovation und Vorentwicklung" in der Audi IT. Unsere Aufgabe ist es relevante Trends und Technologien frühzeitig zu erkennen und für Audi nutzbar zu machen. So wollen wir unsere Innovationskraft nachhaltig stärken.

Durch POC (Proof of Concept) weisen wir die Relevanz und Nutzbarkeit von ausgewählten Innovationen nach und begeistern durch konkrete Use-Cases. Das Thema Machine Learning hat in diesem Zusammenhang zur Zeit höchste Relevanz für uns.


Ihre Aufgaben


Wir sind der Überzeugung, dass durch Technologien wie Machine Learning bestehende Prozesse signifikant optimiert und neue Geschäftsfelder erschlossen werden können.

Sie sind ausgewiesener Machine Learning Experte. Mit entsprechenden Toolkits und Programmiersprachen sind Sie vertraut und können diese sicher anwenden. Es macht Ihnen Spaß im Team hands-on zu arbeiten und Proof of Concepts (POCs) von der Idee bis zur Umsetzung zu begleiten und zu verantworten. Die Chancen und Möglichkeiten von Machine Learning können Sie einem breiten Publikum anschaulich vermitteln und beispielsweise in Workshops konkrete Use Cases identifizieren und bewerten.

item.title: Frontend Engineer gesucht mit Homeoffice und Weiterbildungsbudget at STUDITEMPS.TECH (Köln, Germany)
item.description:
Als Frontend-Entwickler bei STUDITEMPS.TECH schreibst du nicht nur Code. Du bringst dich als Teil deines Scrum-Teams mit deinen Fähigkeiten ein und gestaltest die Produkte eigenverantwortlich mit.


Im Zentrum unserer Arbeit steht das Ziel, den Arbeitsmarkt für Studenten zu revolutionieren. Unsere Vision ist, jedem Studenten eine Jobgarantie aussprechen zu können.  Ob du an unserer Inhouse-Rekrutierungs-Software, unserem Vertragsservice, dem Innovationsteam oder unserem Studentenportal Jobmensa arbeitest – als Entwickler bist du an der Konzeption von Features beteiligt und kannst deine eigenen Ideen einbringen und umsetzen. Dazu gehört zum Beispiel, dass du User-Interfaces konzeptionierst und sie dann in Haml, Coffeescript und SCSS umsetzt.


Du bist an verschiedensten Prozessen von der Ideenfindung bis zur Implementierung von A/B-Tests beteiligt und arbeitest direkt mit dem UX-Team zusammen. Wenn du Spaß an Pairprogramming hast, bist du bei uns richtig.


Wir arbeiten selbstorganisiert und eigenverantwortlich. Deswegen entscheidest du zusammen mit deinem Team, wann du Homeoffice machst, Urlaub nimmst oder für welche Konferenzen du dein Weiterbildungsbudget nutzt.

item.title: Migrationsverket söker databasutvecklare till enheten för IT-utveckling gemensam at Migrationsverket (Norrköping, Sweden)
item.description:
Vi söker databasutvecklare till enheten för IT- utveckling gemensam. Har du den personlighet och professionella kapacitet vi söker? Då erbjuder vi ett rikt och ansvarsfullt arbetsliv med många karriärvägar.


OM TJÄNSTEN


Som medarbetare på Migrationsverket kan du förvänta dig ett givande arbete i en dynamisk miljö som präglas av ett fokus på ständiga förbättringar, samarbete och respekt för människan. Du erbjuds även en gedigen introduktion och goda möjligheter till fortlöpande kompetensutveckling.


ARBETSUPPGIFTER


Som databasutvecklare hos oss jobbar du med att vidareutveckla, underhålla och dokumentera de databaser som ingår i migrationsverkets olika system. Arbetet kommer utgå från ett linjeansvar och stötta utvecklingsteamen.


Du kommer att jobba med modellering och design av databaser samt hantera och koordinerar förändringar i olika db-miljöer. Du kommer att stödja systemutvecklare och projekt i databasfrågor, skriva SQL-satser i samband med underhållsarbete och uttag av information. Du kommer även att arbeta med ständiga förbättringar av databaser kring optimering och användning. Du kommer att ha ansvar för att dokumentera databaser och granska förändringsförslag i databasen. Vidare kommer du att jobba med omvärldsbevakning och övervakning/datasäkerhet.


Vad vi förväntar oss


Vi förväntar oss att du är god en representant för Migrationsverket och har ett respektfullt bemötande såväl internt som externt. Du deltar aktivt i vårt förbättringsarbete och visar engagemang för vårt uppdrag och dina arbetsuppgifter. Du står även för Migrationsverkets värdeord: tydlighet, empati och mod.

item.title: Director Software Engineering (m/f) at Rocket Internet (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About us

We aim to make people’s most needed and cherished products and services accessible to them no matter where they are in the world. To achieve this, we identify and build proven web and mobile business models, transfer them to untapped markets and seek to scale them into market-leading companies. We operate in an international network of more than 110 countries across 6 continents, bringing our technological and operational innovation to new markets.

What we value in our employees

Working at Rocket means taking ownership from day one and giving everything for our projects to make a meaningful and sustainable impact. For our businesses to go from zero to launch, we remain focused while being confident. Our colleagues from more than 70 nationalities act as an interconnected team that exchanges across country borders to ensure maximum efficiency. We expect to win with every company we build and every action we take.

About the position

At Rocket, no two days are the same. As Director Software Engineering at Rocket Internet, you will guide technical teams building systems and products that may be used by tens of millions of people around the world every day from our headquarters in Berlin.

You will manage one or more cross-functional teams, taking them from concept to production, while remaining involved from a hands-on technical standpoint.

item.title: Software Design Engineer at ASML (Veldhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
Introduction










Would you like to start – or make a change in – your software engineering career and join a small collaborative and fast moving team that provides you the freedom and innovation of a startup but at the same time the safety and stability of a big multinational? Is solving complex software challenges one of your hobbies? Then this might be the job for you. We are looking for a Software Engineer with a brilliant mind who loves designing C++, Python and Java Software modules using a Linux/Unix environment.




Job Mission


Your mission is to deliver high quality modular software components in C++, Python and Java to improve our Brion products and integrate them with ASML machine specific knowledge and systems.




Job Description

item.title: Webentwickler / Web Developer (m/w) SEO in München at Blue Summit Media GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
AS HABEN WIR VOR:


Wir bauen das digitale Marketing der Zukunft.


Die PHP-basierten Landing Pages unserer namhaften Kunden sollen optisch ansprechend, intuitiv, dynamisch und suchmaschinenoptimiert gestaltet werden.


Dazu muss die genutzte Software auf dem neuesten Stand der Technik weiterentwickelt, laufend getestet und optimiert werden.


Und dafür brauchen wir Sie!


DAS SIND SIE:
- Sie beherrschen die ojektorientierte Programmierung mit PHP sowie Frontend-Programmierung mit JavaScript, jQuery, HTML und CSS.
- Sie sind fit in der Pflege, Verwaltung und Entwicklung von Datenbanken auf Basis von MySQL und phpMyAdmin und haben auch schon mit UNIX(Shell) und TortoiseGit gearbeitet.
- Sie besitzen bereits Grundlagenwissen über SEO und möchten Ihr Wissen im Online Marketing schnell weiter ausbauen.
- Kenntnisse in XML und im Bereich Web Services sind ein Plus.
- Sie entwickeln neue Ideen, arbeiten gerne kreativ und sind dabei effizient und gut gelaunt.
- Sie haben Lust darauf, im dynamischen Umfeld einer Agentur zu arbeiten.


DAS WIRD IHR JOB:
- Sie implementieren neue Module für Landingpages auf Basis von PHP.
- Mit Hilfe von HTML-Templates, CSS und JavaScript passen Sie Frontends an.
- Sie pflegen Datenbankinhalte, Cronjobs und API-Schnittstellen und sind für deren Funktionalität und Qualität verantwortlich.
- Sie optimieren die Conversionrate und Usability der Kunden-Websites.
- Sie betreuen selbständig Projekte mit dem Fokus auf die Konzeption und Implementierung von SEO Maßnahmen bei unseren Kunden.
- Sie stehen Kunden und Kollegen beratend zur Seite (technisch und inhaltlich).
- Sie finden Schnittstellen zu unseren anderen Produkten und haben Ideen, wie man diese verbessern kann.


DAS WIRD IHR UMFELD:
- Bei uns erwartet sie ein aufgeschlossenes Team, welches interdisziplinär arbeitet und Sie somit in Kontakt mit den unterschiedlichsten Themengebieten kommen um sich sehr schnell fachlich weiterentwickeln zu können.
- Rund 25 SEO-Profis in München, Hamburg und Frankfurt sowie weitere 140 Kolleginnen und Kollegen an allen Standorten
- Lösungsorientiertes Arbeiten und schnelle Entscheidungen
- Stetiges Lernen während der Arbeit
- Planbare Arbeitszeiten
- Technische Top-Ausstattung des Arbeitsplatzes
- Zentrale Lage unseres Münchner Büros
- Gratis Kaffee, Wasser und Obst
- Gemeinsames, wöchentliches Frühstück


LERNEN SIE UNS KENNEN:


Unsere Erfolgsgeschichte, Vision und unser Team lernen Sie hier kennen:


www.bluesummit.de/jobs


IHRE ANSPRECHPARTNERIN:


RUBINA HAJI
+49 (0)89 540 469 472


ONLINE BEWERBEN UNTER: http://bit.ly/2eoRM1w

item.title: Scrum Master (m/w) - mit guten Kenntnissen im Bereich Software Engineering at Magora Group GmbH (Stockern, Österreich)
item.description:
Magora – Not perfect, but AWESOME.


Zuhause im herrlichen Waldviertel entwickeln wir Online Softwarelösungen auf internationalem Top-Niveau – das ist unsere Leidenschaft. Unsere offene Unternehmenskultur ist geprägt von Entscheidungsfreiheit und Eigenverantwortung unserer MitarbeiterInnen, wo auch das Fehler machen erlaubt bzw. erwünscht ist, solange man bereit ist, aus ihnen zu lernen. Denn wer ist schon perfekt?!


Zur Verstärkung unseres Social Media Tools Development Teams suchen wir ab sofort einen:


Scrum Master (m/w 38,5h)  - mit guten Kenntnissen im Bereich Software Engineering


Als Scrum Master unterstützt du das Team und den Product Owner, entlang der kompletten Entwicklungsprozesse unserer Produkte. Das Team wird von dir betreut und auf dem Weg zur Selbstständigkeit begleitet. Du erkennst etwaige Barrieren und räumst diese für das Team aus dem Weg. Die Strukturierung und Priorisierung von technischen Entwicklungsanforderungen sowie die Erstellung von technischen Anforderungen auf Basis von User-Stories und der Abhaltung sämtlicher notwendigen Meetings zusammen mit den administrativen Prozessen rund um laufende und abgeschlossene Sprints bestimmen deinen Alltag.


Dein Aufgabenbereich



  • Planung und Abhaltung von Sprint Meetings und Sprint Reviews

  • Tägliches Sichten und konkretisieren von User Stories

  • Laufende Evaluierung von Stories und Erstellung von konkreten Anforderungen

  • Überwachung des aktuellen Sprints

  • Ausräumen von undefinierten Dingen um das Team zu entlasten und die Sprintziele erreichen zu können

  • Abstimmung und Koordination div. Themen mit allen Mitarbeitern und Führungskräften im Haus

item.title: Systemarchitekt Java (m/w) at Ray Sono AG (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
• Fachliche Führung eines Projekt-Entwickler-Teams. Dazu gehört: Steuerung des Entwicklungsprozesses gemäß agilem Vorgehensmodell, Anleitung und Coaching von Entwicklern, Verteilung von Aufgaben, Qualitätssicherung, Konfliktmanagement, Unterstützung in der Projektleitung

  • Technische Konzeption und Architekturdefinition sowohl mit internen Entwickler-Teams als auch mit Kunden und deren Partnern

  • Etablierung von agilen Prozessen und professionellen Methoden wie Continuous Integration, Test Automation, Unit Testing, TDD und Peer Reviews

  • Analyse von Kundenanforderungen sowie selbstständige Kalkulation und Erstellung von Angeboten, Präsentation von Angeboten beim Kunden, ganzheitliche Begleitung von Software-Projekten vom Angebot bis hin zur Inbetriebnahme

  • Beteiligung an der Programmierung technisch und qualitativ anspruchsvoller Web-Applikationen auf Basis moderner Java-Technologien und -Frameworks

item.title: Senior PHP Developer (Unique opportunity, crack team!) at Sam Media Sdn Bhd (Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia)
item.description:
As a Senior PHP Developer in Sam Media, you get a chance to work in what is probably one of the best development teams you've ever been part of.


We don't make statements like this lightly!


Over the years (it takes time to build up a crack team!), feedback from our developers and sysadmins started to indicate that the quality of the people they work with was the main reason for them to join and, more importantly, to stay in our company.


Other feedback we often receive is that people really like our location (Kuala Lumpur) because it is ideal to explore and experience the South East Asia and the Pacific regions.


Of course it also doesn't hurt that we offer a very competitive package which includes quarterly and yearly performance bonuses, medical insurance, tax relief assistance, interest free loans and relocation assistance to name but a few.


Why this ad?


Our business has seen significant growth over the last 10 years and the amount of data we generate has been growing even harder.


To deal with all this, we have three scrum teams taking on an ever growing product backlog, packed to the rafters with projects that are beyond cool (and admittedly, also a few on the other side of the bell curve!)


Besides that, our in-house incubator, which we set up a little over a year ago, is also starting to produce some very interesting and promising results that require more and more IT resources.


To support all this, we are looking to expand our development team with one or more top-notch developers who have the ability to consistently perform on the highest level.

item.title: Senior Frontend-Entwickler: HTML/CSS/JavaScript (m/w) at Ray Sono AG (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
• Als Frontend-Entwickler HTML/CSS/JavaScript realisierst du anspruchsvolle Web- und Mobile-Projekte und wirkst in der Konzeption solcher Projekte mit

  • Du verwirklichst in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den kreativen Gewerken anspruchsvolle Web-Frontends auf Basis aktuellster HTML5- und CSS3-Technologien für Browser und mobile Geräte und setzt interaktive Elemente in JavaScript und jQuery um

  • Du unterstützt unsere Projektleiter und Konzeptioner mit fachmännischer Beratung, Machbarkeitsanalysen und Aufwandsschätzungen in deinem Bereich

item.title: QA Automation Engineer at CMP group (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
CMP Group is looking for a QA AUTOMATION ENGINEER for a High Traffic Site in a challenging and fun environment!


We are a mid-sized and quickly growing company and we want you to be an ambassador of quality within a cross-functional development team.


Responsibilities:



  • Support developers in understanding how to write more testable and robust code and software with the appropriate level of quality.

  • Collaboratively work across all areas of IT development, actively liaising with developers and business stakeholders to improve overall quality and performance.

  • Provide technical advice and guidance to your development team around strategies and production deployment plans with the team ensuring high availability of service.

  • Educate your team in getting the best return of investment from test automation.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at FRISS (Utrecht, Netherlands)
item.description:
As .Net Senior Software Engineer and member of our Development scrum team, you are responsible for our innovative solutions. You help to outline new enterprise applications and think actively, in collaboration with the team, about software design and technical solutions. Furthermore, you have your own ideas about architecture and are not afraid to share your knowledge.


A fullstack Developer at FRISS is eager to grow, not afraid to take chances and thinks out-of-the-box. You combine this with excellent knowledge of C# and JavaScript, our main languages, through which you create new possibilities and advantages.


The function


By keeping an eye on the latest insights and trends, you have your own say in how products of FRISS can be optimized and used at our clients. You apply quality improvement processes like unit testing, code reviews and continuous delivery and are familiar with design patterns and architecture principles as dependency injection and Service Oriented Architecture. Moreover, you apply problem solving patterns such as reliable messaging and improve the scalability and reliability of the FRISS platform.

item.title: Python Developer @Developers.nl at Developers.nl (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
WHY WORK @ DEVELOPERS.NL
Our employees find greater meaning in their work and balance the other things in life that matter to them. Our people are our greatest asset. They are exceptionally skilled, knowledgeable, team-oriented, and mission-driven individuals who want to do work that matters and benefits the public.


WHAT ARE WE WORKING WITH
Our mission is to deliver the best solutions using state of the art platforms and technologies. 
We are looking for a passionate Software Developer who can help us build and integrate different kinds of solutions. You will work with cutting edge technologies to realize a smooth integration of back-end processes and enhance the customer experience. It's a fast-paced, Agile work environment where each team member has the opportunity to make a real impact.

item.title: Développeur iOS confirmé ou sénior at Smart&Soft (Paris-2E-Arrondissement, France)
item.description:
Nous recherchons un développeur iOS expérimenté ou senior disposant d'une expérience significative en Objective-C et idéalement en Swift (v2.3, voire 3.0).


Vous intégrerez le pôle iOS composé de 7 personnes et dirigé par deux responsables de pôle garants de la veille technologique, de la capitalisation, de la formation des équipes. Vous participerez à la réalisation de projets pour nos clients et sur des projets internes. Vous travaillerez en concertation avec un pôle de pilotage de projet constitué de 5 personnes, avec le pôle de conception — spécifications fonctionnelles détaillées, wireframes, maquettes, guide lines — et avec une personne en charge du marketing opérationnel et du pilotage des KPIs des applications — analytics, notifications riches segmentées, supervision, régies publicitaires, tests A/B, calcul de la lifetime value (voir le paragraphe de description de Smart&Soft). Vous serez au contact des équipes Android (9 développeurs) et Windows UWP (2 personnes).


Sur un cinquième de votre temps, vous vous consacrerez à des activités en dehors des projets clients, afin de nous aider sur de la veille technologique, de la capitalisation sur des briques logicielles et des frameworks, de la formation et de l'auto-formation, du rayonnement de Smart&Soft en participant et en animant des conférences et en rédigeant des articles. Ce mode opératoire est une marque de fabrique très forte chez Smart&Soft et vous offre l'opportunité de dépasser le cadre de projets clients.


L'émulation et le travail d'équipe est au cœur de notre manière de travailler : vous côtoierez des experts qui vous enrichiront de leur expérience et de leur vision, et vous pourrez vous accomplir en participant à l'enrichissement des actifs logiciels de Smart&Soft tout en travaillant sur des applications très exigeantes à fort traffic et critiques pour nos clients. Vous ne vous contenterez de participer à l'excellence du développement logiciel, vous serez embarqué dans une vision beaucoup plus large de l'écosystème mobile, dans une ambiance détendue mais intense.


Nous rejoindre, c'est vous assurer d'accélérer votre niveau d'expertise dans une agence mobile qui poursuit une croissance maîtrisée et qui considère véritablement le génie logiciel comme un actif fortement valorisé, de vous offrir l'opportunité de travailler de manière collaborative dans une équipe déjà très complète, dont la valeur dépasse la sommes des individualités.

item.title: Application Development System Administrator at Acumen, LLC (Burlingame, CA)
item.description:
This is an opportunity to work with a small team of developers to research and install new products as well as develop best practices, and work on automation of companywide processes


 The application development team at Acumen, LLC is looking for an experienced System Administrator with a background in working with an Application Development team.  Acumen, LLC is a fast paced and rapidly growing research company, devoted to answering cutting edge health care policy questions.  We have petabytes of secure, online data and 100s of large servers.  We develop applications to assist our teams to manage data, facilitate research and monitor our own security.  We are looking for a smart, enthusiastic and organized sys admin to help us manage our development zone, including development servers of various types and installation of third-party components like activeMQ and Jenkins (experience with any continuous integration servers is a big plus). You would also help research new tech and develop best practices for new tech usage.  You would help document configurations, as well as installation or maintenance procedures.


Job Responsibilities



  • System Administration: Install, upgrade, and maintain tools and systems in the development zone.

  • New Technology: Research and install new-third party technologies.  Assist in evaluation and selection of new tools. Help develop company standards and baselines for the use, installation, and configuration of the technology. 

  • Training and Collaboration: Work with other departments on software rollout, security impact assessments, and other coordination activities. Assist the IT department in the installation and configuration of both new third-party and internally developed software. Assist IT, where needed, in monitoring internal software products in production.

item.title: Head of Engineering (m/f) at Rocket Internet Company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
As the Head of Engineering (m/f) for one of our companies, you will guide technical teams building systems and products that may be used by tens of millions of people around the world every day from our headquarters in Berlin.


You will manage one or more cross-functional teams, taking them from concept to production, while remaining involved from a hands-on technical standpoint.


About the position:



  • You are responsible for the development and supervision of a team consisting of developers, testers and system experts and will be interfacing with a product counterpart.

  • You find and hire talented people to build up great teams.

  • You lead the development of multiple high-traffic sites and mobile apps.

  • You learn from and share knowledge with other Rocket ventures worldwide.

  • With your deep knowledge, you are able to solve complex problems and support your team in a hands-on manner.

  • You are in charge of code quality and architecture.

  • You manage projects, timelines and releases.

item.title: Senior Test Automation Engineer at Milestone Systems (Brøndby, Denmark)
item.description:
A driving force with a collaborative mindset 


To our agile Linux team, we are looking for a skilled Senior Test Automation Engineer who has a broad knowledge of software technology and a collaborative mindset. You are open, outgoing with a supportive attitude, and you enjoy the interaction with colleagues, partners and end-customers. You will be a vital part of creating, extending and maintaining our Linux-based products as well as secure our ability to quickly deploy new functionality and value to our customers.   Being part of a cross-functional team, you will interact closely with your fellow team members as well as coordinate with the rest of the organization on cross-team dependencies and issues outside the team domain. By interacting broadly throughout the organization, you add a lot of value smoothening integration, ensuring continued operation of our products as well as keeping good and collaborative relationships with the rest of the organization.  A glimpse of your everyday include:  



  • Ensuring focus on testability 

  • Developing automated tests for new functionality as well as extending the existing tests 

  • Designing, building and enhancing test systems to meet our needs 

  • Performing manual testing where no automatic testing is achievable cost effectively 

  • Actively contributing with best practices to enhance the team performance 

  • Effectively responding to customer/partner input and support with workarounds or fixes 


Incubation department


Incubation’s mission is to cultivate, incubate and accelerate new game changing businesses in video surveillance with the goal to become the category market leader within cloud, IOT and embedded software solutions. We have focus on customer needs around the globe and contributions from many locations, although the majority of our employees are in Copenhagen and Silicon Valley.  


The Linux team is a part of Incubation, which is currently on a journey of transforming our VMS services into cloud-based services. We are building customer solutions based on cloud services and integrations to edge devices. This is a unique opportunity to join a team with great ambitions and the freedom to choose new directions to achieve our goals.  


Competencies and strengths needed for this role 


The team is working using agile methodologies and SCRUM so being a team player and adaptive to change is key in this role. Other desirable competencies and strengths are: 



  • Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science or Software Development 

  • Solid experience with software test and automated test 

  • Solid experience with Scrum 

  • Some SW programming experience, preferably in languages like C# 

  • Professional experience with multiplatform product development and Linux 

  • Good understanding of protocols, network and IT security involved in internet based applications 

  • Knowledge of the following tools and technologies will be an advantage: Linux, Jenkins, Bash, GNU Make, Wireshark, Fiddler, Web technologies 

  • Punctuality according to documentation of your work 

  • Professional working proficiency in English 

  • Strong communication skills 


Join the movement, be a game changer


We look forward to receive and read your application and CV in English. Do not hesitate as we will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis and hire the right person, when we find you.


If you want to know more about our company or the job, please visit our website www.milestonesys.com or contact Senior Technical Manager, Philippe Rostock at +45 25 529 312.

item.title: Dev Ops Engineer (m/f) for Data Science at XING AG (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world.
Help us shape the future – for a better working life!



The Data Science Team at XING in Hamburg or Barcelona has an open position for a
 


Dev Ops Engineer (m/f) for Data Science


Our Data Science team is responsible for turning data into services and products for XING. 18 Data scientists, architects and engineers work together to create highly scalable solutions that serve more than 14 million users. We work with the latest technologies in a highly international environment. If you want to get things done rather than sit in meetings, like helping others and learning from them, you will have fun in our team!



A challenging task:



  • Manage and operate a large Hadoop cluster including data ingestion and interfacing with different components of the XING platform

  • Implement services dealing with massive amounts of data and a high number of concurrent users

  • Solve challenging problems related to infrastructure for search and recommender systems using state-of-the-art technologies

  • Work on products that will be used by millions of users on a daily basis

item.title: Senior Android OS Developer at Loxone Electronics (Kollerschlag, Österreich)
item.description: We’re looking for an experienced Android OS developer. To be clear, this is NOT an Android app developer. This is a developer to work in C/C++ on the Operating System of Android to customize the operating system. Someone with an understanding of how the Android kernel interacts with device drivers and who preferably has written, architected, or supervised the development of a display, network, or radio/modem driver. Alternatively, experience with notification handling at the OS level or development work on the windowing system would be equally valuable.

item.title: Fullstack Developers: Estonia is waiting for you! at Novabase (Tallinn, Estonia)
item.description: Novabase is seeking a Developer to join a variety of projects. We are looking for candidates motivated for long term projects, who will be part of a multicultural team. The candidate will have the opportunity to join an Agile team and work with the latest technologies.

item.title: A Senior .NET developer, ready to work with us! at Nmbrs (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
We are Nmbrs®! A payroll software company always challenging the status quo and looking for ways to do things differently. We are constantly looking at and implementing the newest technologies to make our software even better (A.I. in payroll? yes we can!).


You are responsible for the solution design, development, implementation, quality, scaling and performance of our products and internal processes; You work on Visual Studio for coding, Jira for sprint planning, TeamCity and Octopus for continuous integration and features validation with your squad.


A typical Developer workweek at Nmbrs


Monday morning you check in with your colleagues here in Amsterdam and via Slack with your colleagues in Lisbon. You tell all about your weekend and hear about theirs.


Then you will go to the Jira board and pick up the top priorities. This can be implementing a new feature or solving maintenance issues, always prioritizing based on business value (either pair programming or by yourself) or you can be meeting up with some of the other developers to spar on designing a solution or improving the code base.


Twice a week you will attend your squad meets: the planning and the retrospectives. On your request  and the depending on the seniority of the team, this meetings can/will be attended by your agile coach to implement the agile workstyle even better and also to help you and your team grow and get better.


When you start with us you will probably have one or two catch-ups  a week with your mentor, who helps you to become a senior Nmbrs employee. If you work at Nmbrs for a longer period, you will probably be a mentor yourself.


You play an active role in designing the solution to our customers needs. On Thursday you will check if all signs are green for our weekly release. After the release you monitor if all lights stay green and take ownership over potential live issues.


You can join one of the many initiatives to do a sport (bouldering, crossfit, pub-quiz) or fun and games, but that is only if you want. Each day we have lunch together in the office. On Friday we have a drink together to end the week.


Your multifunctional squad will have the following expertise


As a .NET dev you will be part of a multi-disciplinary self steering team which takes full ownership of their part of the product. You will collaborate with the team to improve the product, prioritize your product backlog and improve the teamwork.



  • Quality expertise

  • Customer focused expertise

  • Product Expertise

  • Technical expertise


Your specialist team consist from the following people


Our specialist team of developers consist of  16 people. The average age is 29 years. 13 developers are working from our Lisbon office, 3 are based in Amsterdam.  The majority of our developers have a Master or PHD Degree.


What we offer


International, young and bold company. We want to bring payrolling to another level.


Ambitious environment, constantly challenging ourselves.


Lots of ways to develop yourself and get lost in the newest techniques, workstyles and software engineering best practices, like code reviews, continuous integration and automated testing.


Agile working environment.


Working in Lisbon is possible on occasion. We have an apartment there, which you can use, when empty.


We have a boat which we use to cruise the canals together. In weekends or on days the boat is not reserved you can take it with your friends.


Helpful, smart and fun colleagues.

item.title: iOS Developer at NetworkingUp (Barcelona, Espagne)
item.description:
We are hiring an iOS Developer, to develop and deliver the Company technology stack and platform components to enable accelerated development of our company, providing technical leadership and expertise from idea to exit. You will need to be passionate about creating clean, beautiful, well-crafted, maintainable code and have strong experience working on UI/UX and user-focussed design.


As our iOS Developer, you will help NetworkingUp break new ground, create and test new concepts to accelerate our growth. You will play a role in establishing one of the most innovative business units within the corporation.


You will be part of a collaborative team of technical and design specialists, to develop the full technology stack for NetworkingUp, its activities and range of ventures. You’ll be involved across the innovation process, from idea to MVP, developing alpha and beta products and core components of our software architecture to make our operations run fast and constantly move forward.


You’ll need flexibility, adaptability and a healthy dose of pragmatism when providing expert support and advice to our ventures while never slowing things down. You will build strong relationships with technical partners as required to accelerate the growth of our ventures. You’ll provide a supportive environment for our technical talent that prizes innovation, continual personal improvement and effective product development methodologies.


You will distill technical ideas into simple effective plans, working closely with your team of developers, designers to drive their execution within the challenges of an agile startup environment. You will evolve our thinking, and help identify and develop our capabilities across the back-end, front-end, UX, as well as machine learning and optimization techniques.


You’ll have the chance to develop and define the requirements for the core platform, ensuring NetworkingUp is a business that is synonymous with technical excellence and innovation. The choice of technology or language is continually evolving and it’s up to you to shape and keep our activities at the forefront of technology.


The importance of a strong corporate culture


Because most of our time we are at the office, that is most than important to take pleasure of it. 
We want to implement and create a positive innovation culture in a collaborative environment. 
Because your team is also your core product, we give to our employees all of the tools to start in the best way an honest relationship. 
Our guys need to forge close working relationships with our leadership team to meet the need of the organisation. But work has also to be a place where you could realize yourself. That's why we dearly support our employees to find their places in the project.  
To summarize, we create and nurture a sense of ownership and commitment amongst the engineering team.
Finally we would rather hire people who have a deep thirst of knowledge. We support and encourage self-improvement of our employees.

item.title: Software Architect JavaScript at trivago (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

JavaScript is a central technology of the trivago Hotel Search. Faced with high performance requirements, our JavaScript engineers work relentlessly on speeding up the application while keeping the code modular and maintainable.
We are currently looking for a JavaScript Architect who will support us in our efforts by maintaining and improving our existing tools and frameworks. Are you an innovative thinker? Do you create solid architectures that are well-structured and extensible? Would you like to create plugins for Babel and webpack? Then we should definitely talk!
You’ll become a vital part of our expanding JavaScript architecture team and will be given the chance to work and experiment with the newest technology. Your daily work will allow you to work on various parts of modern front end development, ranging from inventing ideal design patterns to hunting down performance bugs. As part of our JavaScript architecture team, you’ll be given the chance to hold workshops and spread your knowledge throughout our entire company.


Your responsibilities:



  • Maintain and refine our webpack-powered build setup by adding custom plugins and loaders.

  • Extend Babel with custom transpilation steps.

  • Dive into a modern JavaScript framework and become its new core developer.

  • Create documentation and spread best practices.

  • Create productivity-enhancing developer tools (Chrome addon, etc.) for our framework.

  • Develop and maintain a template compiler to take our client-side rendering process to the next level.

  • Work on our next generation virtual DOM library.

item.title: Java-arkkitehti at Hesburger / Megavest Oy (Turku, Finland)
item.description:
Hesburger on uusimassa toiminnanohjausjärjestelmiään ja hakee nyt Turkuun


Kokenutta Java-arkkitehtiä


Jos Java-teknologiat ovat lähellä sydäntäsi ja Linux-palvelinten hallinta on sinulle tuttua, saatat olla etsimämme henkilö. Olet hankkinut jo useampia vuosia kokemusta IT-alalta, ja toiminut osana isompia tietojärjestelmäkehityshankkeita.


Sinulla on osaamista selainpohjaisten järjestelmien suunnittelusta ja toteutuksesta sekä Linux-palvelinten ja niiden päällä pyörivien ohjelmistopalvelimien konfiguroinnista ja ylläpidosta. Olet jalat maassa –tyyppinen tiimipelaaja ja innostut haasteista. Olet työssäsi tiedonhaluinen ja valmis syventämään osaamistasi tarpeen vaatiessa.


Odotamme



  • modernien ohjelmistotuotannon menetelmien tuntemusta, esim. jatkuva integrointi (CI)

  • osaamista Linux-palvelinten konfiguroinnista ja klusteroinnista

  • vähintään viiden vuoden kokemusta Java-ohjelmistokehitysympäristöistä

  • tuntemusta työkalupakistamme löytyvistä teknologioista: Java EE, Vaadin Framework, Mule ESB, MySQL/MariaDB , MyBatis, Tomcat, Eclipse IDE, Jenkins, JUnit, Ant+Ivy, Subversion

  • sujuvaa suullista ja kirjallista suomen ja englannin kielen taitoa


Tuntemus ERP-järjestelmien kehittämisestä katsotaan eduksi tehtävää täytettäessä.


Arvostamme



  • Vuorovaikutus- ja tiimityötaitoja

  • Kykyä ymmärtää liiketoimintatarpeita ja hakea niihin ratkaisuja.


Haluatko mukaan? 


Tarjoamme kokoaikaisen ja vakituisen työn viihtyisässä ympäristössä Turussa Aurajoen rannalla, osana osaavaa ja asialleen sitoutunutta IT-ryhmäämme. Tule osaksi tiimiämme hakemalla tehtävää 30.11.2016 mennessä lähettämällä hakemus ja CV sähköpostiosoitteeseen: rekry@hesburger.fi. Mainitse myös palkkatoiveesi. Haastattelut aloitetaan heti ja paikka täytetään sopivan henkilön löydyttyä.


Lisätietoja tehtävästä osoitteesta heli.hagelberg@hesburger.fi.

item.title: Systemutvecklare Telematics till nytänkande Toyota Material Handling Europe at Toyota Material Handling Europe (Gothenburg, Sweden)
item.description:
Testdriven utveckling, agila arbetsmetoder och att bryta ny mark? Är dessa saker viktiga för dig i din nästa roll som utvecklare? Toyota Material Handling Europe Logistics Solutions söker nu systemutvecklare till sitt kontor på Lindholmen i Göteborg.


OM TJÄNSTEN


Hos Toyota Material Handling Europe kommer du att bli en del av ett agilt team som jobbar med utveckling av programvara för styrning och utnyttjandeoptimering av både automatiska och manuella truckar samt kringutrustning för materialhantering.


Inom affärsområdet Telematics arbetar de med digital innovation, d.v.s. med att identifiera nya lösningar som ska leda till nya affärsmöjligheter i den digitala framtiden. Som Systemutvecklare inom .NET hos TMHE Logistics Solutions kommer du att bli en del av ett drivande och kompetent team som jobbar med Internet of Things (IoT) teknologi och ISite deras fleet management lösning för truckar som är den bästa på marknaden. TMHE ligger i framkant, inte bara i Sverige, utan även internationellt med sin programvara och efterfrågan ökar snabbt.


ARBETSUPPGIFTER


Du kommer att arbeta i .NET-miljö, i Visual Studio med C# på serversidan då programvaran är serverbaserad och kommunicerar med truckar via mobildatanätet. Toyota Material Handling Europe jobbar med testdriven utveckling vilket innebär att du själv skriver dina tester och implementerar din kod i efterhand. Du kommer till exempel att:



  • Arbeta med att utveckla framtidens materialhanteringslösningar

  • Arbeta i flera projekt samtidigt

  • Delta i möten kring projekt och därmed få bidra med tankar och idéer för hur utvecklingen ska drivas framåt

  • Jobba mycket teambaserat med exempelvis parprogrammering


Hos Toyota Material Handling Europe råder kulturen ”Toyota Way” vilket hjälper företaget att gå från ord till handling. Toyota Material Handling Europe tror att starka individer bygger starka lag. Som medarbetare hos Toyota Material Handling Europe förväntas du ta ansvar för dina handlingar, vara engagerad och uttrycka din åsikt, visa respekt för människorna omkring och sträva efter ständiga förbättringar.

item.title: Mobile App Development Team Manager at Rakuten (Setagaya, Japan)
item.description:
We're looking for a leader to take charge of a team developing online marketplace mobile applications.  You will be leading a team of engineers working on the development and global expansion of Japan's largest online shopping mall(shop count: 40 thousand, item count: 14 million, yearly transaction: JPY 1.4 trillion).  Sounds interesting?  We'd like to hear from you!


Responsibilities:



  • Manage and lead the mobile development group from a technical and product development perspective

  • Develop the long/short-term strategy of the group

  • Manage and execute project plans against delivery targets

  • Manage the activities of the engineers team within an Agile/Scrum environment

  • Manage resources, staffing, mentoring and development of the engineer team

  • Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to stakeholders

item.title: Full Stack Developer - Help Us Onboard New Hires Faster at Appical BV (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
To expand our (remote) development team locally, we are looking for Full Stack / Frontend / Backend developers. Our development team is responsible for growing the tech side of our product. We service enterprises with our award winning onboarding platform and you get the chance to evolve the looks and inner workings, to make sure we make the right technical decisions so we remain scalable and innovative.


You will work with our existing team to prototype new features, improve the current platform and make our product keep on evolving. Together with the Product Owner you will continuously improve our product and service. You have a passion for SaaS, Enterprise software, mobile and innovation. We offer the possibility to create game-changing software!


What we offer:



  • The opportunity to change the experience of thousands of new hires around the globe by building the best HR product.

  • Work with the coolest colleagues in our Amsterdam office.

  • A competitive salary with extra benefits

  • The opportunity to work for an exciting start-up conquering the world

  • Flexible hours

  • Regular and fun team activities


You will work from our office in Amsterdam, currently consisting of 15 team members. Are you interested to join our team? We look forward to hearing from you!

item.title: Software Engineer - Platform Engineering at Magine (Stockholm, Sweden)

We want our systems to be up for the challenges of the real world and we want you to join us in making it happen.

You’ll be working with bleeding edge technologies, distributed payment platform, third-party integrations, performance optimization, APIs and security. In short, we do everything we can to make it as easy as possible for our merchants to run their business.api-des

item.title: Junior C# Engineer for our APIs and SDK Team at Milestone Systems (Brøndby, Denmark)
item.description:
Are you up for the challenge of developing SDK and APIs for the next generation video surveillance software, enabling our partners and the video surveillance community in general to create astonishing integrations?


Your daily work includes



  • Designing and building APIs, libraries and samples as well as new product features according to specification

  • Developing own high technical insight into more technology areas 

  • Coding, unit testing and documentation in compliance with the development processes

  • Implementing test automation for new features

  • Actively contributing to best practices to enhance the team


You will mainly be developing in C#, targeting the windows platforms, delivering features primarily for our SDK and APIs, but also for both sides of the client and the server architecture in our video surveillance software products.


At Milestone Systems knowledge sharing and teamwork is in focus. You will be contributing to the ongoing enhancement of our high quality software development processes in collaboration with Test, Technical Support, Technical Communications and Product Management in order to continues delivering #1 VMS (Video Management Software) in the world.


Your profile



  • Master’s degree in Computer Science or Software Development and gladly newly graduated

  • Solid experience with C#

  • Experience with protocol frameworks and network protocols, e.g. WCF, RTSP

  • Knowledge about high performance computing, multithreading and scalability

  • Professional working proficiency in English

  • Holistic approach to new solutions/technologies

  • Innovative and proactive with an ability to challenge existing solutions

  • Curious and with a desire to maintain and extend a broad technical knowledge

  • Responsible and conscious about the quality of work with the will to bring assignments all the way

  • Adaptable to changes and open for new challenges

  • Interest in interaction with the developer community

  • Positive contributor to the ongoing sparring and sharing with your colleagues


 The perks 



  • Individual career path – technical and personal growth, enhanced by regular feedback 1:1s with your manager

  • Multicultural work environment with skilled IT colleagues with diverse national backgrounds

  • Healthy work environment - company sponsored “All Inclusive” program with breakfast, lunch, afternoon snack, fruit and beverages, health insurance, massage and company bikes

  • Social work environment – active Employee Club driving events like cooking classes, tasting events, outdoor activities, cultural events, Friday bar and annual Christmas and summer parties

  • Work life balance – flexible working hours and 5 extra vacation days


Start your career here – the future is up to you


Start your career here and become part of our exciting developer community.  Grab your keyboard and submit your CV in English and a transcript of your grades. Do not hesitate and miss this chance, as interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.


For more information, please contact Engineering Manager, Peter Posselt Vergmann at +45 25 606 716 or visit our website: www.milestonesys.com


The future is up to you!

item.title: Software Engineer and Web Application Developers (2 roles) at GeoSLAM (Bingham, UK)
item.description:
(1) The role of Software Engineer


Central to our business is the development and hosting of our primary Intellectual Property asset, a novel Simultaneous Localisation and Mapping (SLAM) algorithm and the integration of sensor hardware that can utilise it.    We are currently seeking software engineers with hardware integration experience to enhance our product development team.


Key Responsibilities



  • Integration of new sensor hardware

    • Developing applications to control and capture data from hardware sensors using manufacturers drivers and SDK

    • Interpretation and conversion laser, IMU and video camera data

    • Modifying open source tools and drivers for internal use



  • Development and implementation of enhancements to existing SLAM code

    • Productising prototype C++ code running on Linux platforms

    • Modifying existing C++ and Python code to add new functionality

    • Porting C++ applications and libraries on Windows based platforms

    • Debugging research code and developing unit testing



  • Implementation of a real-time version of the SLAM algorithm

    • Productising real-time C++ applications and libraries

    • Writing new tools utilizing the SLAM algorithms




(2) The role of Web Application Developer:


Central to our business is the development and hosting of our primary Intellectual Property asset, a novel Simultaneous Localisation and Mapping (SLAM) algorithm used for to generate 3D maps from mobile laser scanning systems. We are currently seeking web application developers with web services and Javascript experience to enhance our software development team.


Key Responsibilities



  • Maintain and improve the existing AWS based Cloud data processing service

    • Maintain and improve PHP based Web Services (REST and SOAP) and internal reporting/management tool

    • Maintain and improve Python/bash based data processing scripts

    • Maintain and improve MySQL database

    • Manage and maintain Amazon Web Service operations (including EC2, S3, SQS)

    • Maintain and deploy Ubuntu/Apache web servers (internal and AWS)



  • Develop web based applications for client side data processing

    • Design and implement new features and functionality to our cross platform desktop application built on the Electron platform using Node.js, React, Redux, SCSS

item.title: PHP Developer at IN10 (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Combining creativity, technology and empathy is a successful formula which works really well for IN10. This formula is why we can provide strong brands with a lot of beautiful digital touchpoints. Therefore, we seek to strengthen our development team with a PHP Developer.


The job


You are always motivated to move forward and you've got an eye for detail. You will work in collaboration with other specialists to develop websites, platforms, smart tools and digital campaigns.


A fascination for challenging development work is the basis, but you also like to think about the bigger picture. You play an active role in the entire process and you are involved early in the design and front-end phase. You'll consult with colleagues, partner parties and customers. The goal is always to develop groundbreaking digital productions. You've got a shared responsibility with the team.

a10:author.a10:name: Springer Science + Business Media Deutschland GmbH

item.title: Agile Project Manager (m/f) at Springer Science + Business Media Deutschland GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
The way we do business
We build our software incrementally, iteratively, and continuously, so you’ll be able to see new work go live to over four million
visitors around the globe every week. Our flavour of agile has been heavily influenced by XP and Kanban, and if something isn’t working, we change it.


Our work delivers value to both the business and our customers, our teams are cross-discipline: business analysts and the user experience team work with stakeholders to coordinate research and understand requirements, whilst our frontend developers and software engineers pair with quality analysts to develop the most robust solutions, and our platform engineers work  across the organisation to ensure our infrastructure never lets us down.


We generally follow a mix of agile and lean practices with an overall philosophy towards continuous delivery. We’ll rely on each and everyone´s expertise to adapt and improve these processes to serve the team, project and company as best fits their current contexts.


Although we don’t face the same level of stress you’d find in most projects around scope, schedule and cost, keeping the project on track is still important to us and wherever possible we’ll keep projects small, fast and healthy.


Using your combination of traditional and agile PM skills you’ll be leading one of our co-located cross-functional teams to
continuously deliver for our portfolio of projects and products.


We’ll rely on your strong leadership skills to keep the team motivated, excited and focused on clear value-driven goals, product quality, and frequent delivery and engaging with customers and users to maximise the benefits we can deliver to them. You’ll ensure the team are able to reach sensible decisions quickly and effectively with minimal stress and know when to step in and when to step back.


You’ll sustain our culture of continuous improvement both from a process and technical perspective ensuring that working Software is delivered frequently, engineering quality is upheld, customer issues are addressed quickly, communication and collaboration is effective and the team are clear at all times what’s going on, what’s important and what needs to be done.


On a day-to-day basis you’ll act as facilitator to the team, scheduling and supporting stand-ups, iteration reviews, retrospectives and planning activities. You’ll collaborate with various stakeholders to report regularly and openly on the status of your projects and people to address needs and issues rapidly whilst helping us all learn, share and improve how to run our Projects better every day.


You´ll be responsible for...

  • Working with the Product Owner, UX, BA and Tech Lead to create clear user-focussed goals and aligning the team around them

  • Fostering team spirit and collaboration and developing a high performing, empowered team with a clear purpose

  • Planning and delivering software that is of high quality and valuable to our customers

  • Providing support and input to all aspects of the product lifecycle – from product definition, technical decisions and user
    experience through to marketing and sales

  • Coaching the team on agile and lean principles if needed

item.title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst (m/f) at GetYourGuide AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
GetYourGuide is busy revolutionizing the tours and activities space, fundamentally changing how people discover and book things to do in their destination. We come to work everyday because we are passionate about turning our customers’ trips into amazing experiences.


Our business intelligence team is small and empowered, which means you can contribute and take ownership from day one. You will contribute to the vision of the team and data analysis, work with the different business units to establish best practices for the data supply chain, data storage and reporting solutions.


Why is it important to us?


Data is the lifeblood of our growing business. It drives our decision-making on a daily basis and keeps the organization focused on the biggest and most fundamental opportunities for our customers. As a key member of our Business Intelligence team, you will act as glue between our departments, helping uncover issues, communicating opportunities, and keeping the organization aligned. Responsibilities will include building deep and actionable insights out of our data, defining and developing metrics, automating key analyses through reporting, and presenting clear findings to stakeholders from functional teams to the executive team.


Your responsibilities



  • Design and implement metrics, dashboards and reports

  • Develop quantitative analysis, ad hoc reports to support business decisions

  • Explore large datasets, identify opportunities and present findings to stakeholders

  • Use data analytics to investigate and help resolve issues in our product or processes

  • Help uncover data quality issues and be part of key initiatives in that area

  • Serve as a liaison between the business teams and the data engineering team
