item.title: Anwendungsentwickler (m/w) Java EE Client-Entwicklung at ING DiBa (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
item.description:
Jetzt Anwendungsentwickler (m/w) Java EE Client-Entwicklung am Standort Frankfurt werden.


Mit deiner Stärke zum gemeinsamen Erfolg.


Geht es um State-of-the-Art-Technologien, bewegen Sie sich auf sicherem Terrain und Sie sind kaum zu bremsen, wenn Sie mit Begeisterung Entwicklungen vorantreiben. Ihr Einsatz ist für das ganze Team erfolgsentscheidend und auch menschlich ist auf Sie Verlass. Damit bringen Sie die wichtigsten Fähigkeiten für die IT Business Services der ING-DiBa schon mit.


Ihre Aufgaben: Im Bereich Baufinanzierung suchen wir einen Java-Profi mit Leidenschaft für Software und Technologien: Sie entwickeln webbasierte Clientapplikationen und unterstützen Ihre Ansprechpartner aus den Fachabteilungen, wenn es um Konzeption und Design neuer Anwendungsoberflächen geht. Hier vertrauen wir ganz auf Ihr Qualitätsbewusstsein kombiniert mit Lösungskompetenz. Letztere ist besonders gefragt, wenn Sie an DV-Konzepten sowie der Prototyperstellung mitarbeiten. Und es gibt noch mehr zu tun: Sicherstellung der Entwicklung nach Architekturvorgaben, Begleitung von Lasttests, Anwendungsdeployment sowie Fehlerbehebung und Problemanalyse. Kurz, Sie zeigen, was Sie können.

a10:author.a10:name: EOS GmbH Elektro Optical Systems, Krailling

item.title: Gruppenleiter (m/w) Software-Entwicklung Cloud Services/Partner Integration at EOS GmbH Elektro Optical Systems, Krailling (Freiberg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Interessiert an einem persönlichen Austausch?
Treffen Sie Bernd Biechele, Head of Software Development, auf der VDI in München und kommen Sie zu unserem spannenden Vortrag „Agile Software-Entwicklung in der Additiven Fertigung – mit EOS auf dem Weg zur Industrie 4.0“ am 17.11. um 12.15 Uhr.


Zielsetzung der Stelle ist der Aufbau und die Leitung einer Software-Entwicklungs-Gruppe am Standort Freiberg (Sachsen) zur Entwicklung von Systemen und Software-Produkten im Bereich Additive Manufacturing. Die Schwerpunkte liegen dabei auf der Entwicklung von Cloud Services zur Anbindung und Auswertung von Daten aus Maschinenparks sowie der Erweiterung und Neugestaltung von Komponenten und Schnittstellen zur verbesserten Anbindung und Integration unserer Partner-Software-Lösungen.


Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Aufbau sowie fachliche und disziplinarische Leitung der Software-Entwicklungs-Gruppe in Freiberg in enger Kooperation mit dem Abteilungsleiter Software-Entwicklung, HR und den anderen Gruppenleitern in Krailling bei München

  • Übergreifende Verantwortung und innovative Gestaltung für Software-Module und -Architektur in den verantworteten Bereichen sowie Abstimmung mit den weiteren Software-Gruppen hinsichtlich Architektur, Schnittstellen und gemeinsam verwendeter Komponenten

  • Analyse und ständige Weiterentwicklung der Software-Prozesse sowie abgestimmte Auswahl, Einführung und kontinuierlicher Einsatz sinnvoller Werkzeuge zur Optimierung des Entwicklungsprozesses und der daraus entstehenden Ergebnisse

  • Verantwortung für die Arbeitsergebnisse hinsichtlich Qualität, Aufwand, termingerechter Lieferung und Dokumentation, dazu auch Koordination von Test und Freigabe der Software-Komponenten

  • Fachspezifische Mitarbeit bei der Festlegung der Technologiestrategie, Feature-Roadmap und Software-Architektur sowie bei Bedarf Mitarbeit in Projekten oder Projektleitung

  • Regelmäßige Reisetätigkeit zum Firmenhauptsitz sowie zu Kunden

item.title: (Junior) Projektmanager (m/w) Software Development & Processes at Hemmersbach Holding GmbH (Nürnberg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Du bist bei einem der besten IT-Serviceprovider weltweit als Generalist/in in der IT-Landschaft für die Anforderungs­analyse, -spezifikation und IT-Projekt­steuerung verantwortlich. Durch Deine tägliche Arbeit können unsere inter­nationalen IT-Projekte implementiert werden, unsere internen Web­applikationen weiter­entwickelt sowie neue Tools geschaffen werden. Du bist der/die zentrale Ansprechpartner/in für unsere inter­nationalen Service Delivery Manager sowie für unsere zentralen Software­entwickler/innen und schaffst mit jedem Kontakt ein positives Serviceerlebnis:



  • Du verantwortest die Definition der Anforderungen und die Umsetzung der Bedürfnisse unserer Fachabteilungen sowie die Implementierung in den Software-Entwicklungszyklus

  • Du analysierst und erkennst unsere vorliegenden Geschäftsprozesse und stehst Deinen Kollegen/-innen mit gutem Rat für ihre Anforderungen zur Seite

  • Du gibst die eigenentwickelten Anwendungen frei und präsentierst Deinem Ansprechpartner das Ergebnis

item.title: .NET-UTVECKLARE TILL AMBITIÖSA PRODUKTFÖRETAGET BARIUM! at Barium (Gothenburg, Sweden)
item.description:
Värdesätter du en arbetsplats där varje medarbetares egna initiativ och kompetensutveckling tillsammans med företaget uppmuntras? Vill du få möjlighet att jobba med utveckling av en unik och modern produkt som nyttjas av företag som IKEA, ICA och Selecta? Ta då chansen och sök tjänsten som .NET-utvecklare hos växande produktföretaget Barium idag!


OM TJÄNSTEN


Har du erfarenhet av utveckling i .NET och vill jobba på ett växande svenskt produktbolag? Då kan du vara den perfekta medarbetaren i Bariums utvecklingsteam som nu behöver förstärkas för att fortsätta skapa lösningar i framkant inom Business Process Management.


Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och Bariums önskemål är att alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till Academic Work


Tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Academic Work men du kommer anställas direkt hos Barium.


ARBETSUPPGIFTER


Som utvecklare hos Barium blir din uppgift att arbeta med utvecklingen av Bariums moderna webbprodukt Barium Live, med målet att skapa hållbara och användarvänliga IT-lösningar för små och stora företag inom området Business Process Management. Fokus kommer ligga på kontinuerlig förbättring och utveckling produkten och du kommer arbeta i ett team tillsammans med engagerade utvecklare, UX-designers och testare där sammanhållning, kunskapsutbyte och korta beslutsvägar utgör grunden för Bariums framgångsrika produkt och resa!


Teknikerna som används är .NET MVC, NoSQL, Javascript, HTML5, CSS3 och teamet arbetar agilt, med målet att arbeta med continuous delivery. I ditt arbete kommer du få vara delaktig i hela processen från behovsanalys till driftsättning i produktionsmiljön.

item.title: Full-Stack Web Developer (m/f) - Join Our New Team in Lisbon at Nezasa - Travel Technologies (Lisbon, Portugal)
item.description:
Nezasa is one of the most innovative start-ups in travel technology. We’re opening up an engineering office in Lisbon and we’re looking for an inspired and motivated Full-Stack Web Application Developer to be part of the core team of this new location. In this position, you will work on our leading, cloud-based planning and booking platform for individual travel packages.

We Offer:



  • An international, yet small, agile and highly skilled engineering team

  • Working on a product that can make a big difference in the travel tech market

  • Working with modern and exciting technologies and tools (e.g., Scala, Play, MongoDB, Ember.js, Cloud Deployments, Slack)

  • An attractive workplace in Lisbon

item.title: Java-Entwicklerin oder Java-Entwickler at Deutsche Welle (Bonn, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wir suchen für die Abteilung Projekte und Entwicklung am Standort Bonn zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt


eine Java-Entwicklerin oder einen Java-Entwickler
in Freier Mitarbeit*.


So arbeiten Sie in unserem Team



  • Entwicklung mit Open-Source-Software ist Ihr Alltag

  • Sie sind beteiligt an der Erstellung von Konzepten und Prototypen und an der Continuous Delivery von Software in einem agilen Team

  • Sie haben Spaß am Erlernen und Einsetzen neuster Frameworks oder Bibliotheken, wie AngularJS, Swagger und Hystrix

  • Sie erweitern ständig Ihre Fähigkeiten und Fertigkeiten und halten Ihr Wissen auf dem Laufenden – mit Schulungen, Workshops und User Groups sowie durch wöchentliche Tech-Talk-Runden

  • Mit Ihrer Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Architektur sind Sie Ansprechpartner für die Kolleginnen und Kollegen im Team

  • Bei Sprint Reviews, Code Reviews und Pair Programming teilen Sie Ihr Wissen mit dem Team und sind offen für Verbesserungsvorschläge


Das bringen Sie mit



  • abgeschlossenes oder laufendes Studium der Informatik oder eine durch langjährige Berufserfahrung erworbene vergleichbare Qualifikation

  • Java-Know-how und Erfahrung in der Entwicklung moderner Webanwendungen

  • sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse


Das bieten wir auch



  • ein umfangreiches Weiterbildungsangebot

  • die Teilnahme an Entwicklerkonferenzen und Hackathons

  • Zeit zum Experimentieren und Forschen

  • Büros mit direkter Lage am Rhein und in der schönen Bonner Rheinaue

  • ein ausgezeichnetes Betriebsrestaurant

  • regelmäßige Bereichsevents wie Kicker-Turniere und Tipp-Kick-Meisterschaften


Kontakt

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Apple (London, UK)
item.description:
Come help us build the next generation cloud platform to support internet services across Apple. Our Platform Infrastructure Engineering team develops and deploys software which forms the foundation for some of our most exciting services, including iTunes, iCloud, Siri, Maps, and more. Our software ensures that Apple's services are reliable, scalable, fast, and secure. We support both open source and home-grown technologies to provide internal Apple developers with the best possible platform. In this role you will have the unique opportunity to own and deliver some of the world's largest-scale cloud services. At Apple, we manage services that support millions of users. This brings an entirely new dimension to the word “scale". If you have dreamt about controlling, managing, and scaling thousands of servers, then read on!


Description


Working in Apple’s Platform Infrastructure Engineering team is the definition of variety. Our team provides infrastructure and support for large Internet facing applications by building and maintaining clusters and application stacks. On any given day, you may find one member of the team fault-finding low-level driver issues, while another is analyzing a highly distributed workflow. As a member of the Infrastructure Engineering team, you will be empowered to work across many organisational units to improve and expand our current deployment.


This may include:


* Design and implement new software to streamline system automation


* Capacity planning to meet future requirements, or a new project


* Triage production issues when they occur with other operational teams


* Conduct ongoing maintenance across our large scale deployments across the world


* Participate in new builds which back new releases


To meet these needs, Apple is looking for talented and well-rounded DevOps engineers who meet the below key qualifications.

item.title: Web developer - Javascript - Innovative company in Rotterdam at Pointlogic (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Due to an increasing growth of our software development team, we are currently looking for a self-standing and experienced web developer.


About the job


Join Pointlogic’s development team (approximately 35 international software developers) and develop web applications using innovative and experimental techniques.


You will be independently developing single page applications, with a keen eye for user experience (UX) design. You will keep the (internal) requirements of our clients aligned during the entire project and communicate closely on project progress and improvements. Thanks to your prior experience, you will understand all that matters within professional software development, such as writing test scripts, design patterns and applying continuous integration. You not only know how to execute these elements, but you’re also able to improve them.  Our software development team works agile and so will you. 


“Pinpoint” is Pointlogic’s software platform, which is used to plan multi-media campaigns (such as TV, online (video), radio, print, outdoor media, etc.). The underlying data is a combination of continuous panel data and census data (big data). By using these extremely granular datasets, and combining them in a smart way, Pinpoint is a unique software solution in the world of cross over media planning. 


 Our offering



  • Competitive salary and benefits

  • Personal and professional development opportunities

  • Flexibility in working hours and location

  • Exciting development projects and clients

  • An open, respectful and multicultural atmosphere

  • Time for socialising and fun

  • 25 days of paid leave

  • Reimbursement of traveling expenses

  • Daily fruit snacks


If this vacancy appeals to you, please send your motivation letter and CV to careers@pointlogic.com. We prefer to receive responses to this vacancy by e-mail.

item.title: Technical Application Specialist at Optiver (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Do you get excited about designing, implementing and managing Microsoft based communication platforms? Are you the person that will make our business applications as cutting edge as our trading applications? As a Technical Application Specialist you could be part of the team which owns the Optiver IT business systems on premise and in the cloud. 



What you'll do
As a Technical Application Specialist you will work closely with the business to understand their needs and translate those into strategic technical solutions. You will show the business how to make the most of the systems they use. Within our team you will have the freedom to lead projects and work independently, but you will also co-ordinate, communicate and work in partnership with other technical teams to deliver cross platform distributed solutions. As our new Technical Application Specialist you will bring expertise in Microsoft Exchange / Office 365 and Lync / Skype for business to optimize our use of these platforms. Furthermore, you will liaise with Global counterparts in our Sydney and Chicago offices to contribute to the innovation of solutions in and around your core competencies.
In short, as our new Technical Application Specialist you will be:



  • Responsible for the functional and technical performance of our Microsoft applications like AD, Exchange, ADFS;

  • Responsible for the functional and technical performance of video conferencing with Skype for Business;

  • Responsible for managing daily operations including fixing incidents and solving technical problems;

  • Automate these daily operations as much as possible with PowerShell.

  • Sie planen, dokumentieren und verfolgen Projekte für unsere weltweit eingesetzten Infotainment-Systeme

  • Sie stehen in engem Kontakt mit unseren Kunden, stimmen Anforderungen direkt mit diesen ab und koordinieren die Zeitpläne

item.title: Sr. Mobile Automation Engineer(Java/JS/Objective-C) at HERE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are offering an exciting opportunity for you, a test automation enthusiast. A job position like this with colleagues like us is not open every day. 


About HERE


HERE is a leader in mapping and location technology. We enable rich, real-time location applications and experiences for consumers, vehicles, enterprises and cities. Our open location platform is accessible to all customers who seek to leverage the power of location in their businesses.


We are interested in your willingness to develop your skills with us more than your CV. You are, like us, on a quest to make software testing better, an important and integral part of the product development. Together we are on a world mapping adventure that makes us proud now and in the future. 

We have found our skills in test automation to be above the par in the industry. We aim higher and need new members for the team. 


You will be using tools like cucumber, espresso, calabash, git, jenkins, selenium and whatever suits us best. Experience in these is not mandatory but the desire and curiosity to learn is mandatory. 


Responsibilities:


  • Expand and maintain well designed automated tests for HERE consumer products on Android, iOS and/or web

  • Plan what to test and what not to test using automation, what should be tested manually and what not at all

  • Communicate the feedback you gathered through testing patiently and effectively to the right persons in the organisation

  • Continuously make our practices and results better

  • Develop your own skills and spread them to others

item.title: Software Engineer Big Data at Bol.com (Utrecht, Netherlands)
item.description:
Do you want to apply your Big Data skills to help personalize the bol.com experience? 


One of our 40+ autonomous Scrum teams is looking for a Software Engineer Big Data!


Everybody in The Netherlands and Belgium knows bol.com. With over 6 million customers, 28 million monthly visits and 10 million products, bol.com is the most successful online retailer in the Dutch language region. As these numbers imply, bol.com is also a big data driven organization that ‘breathes’ IT. We currently employ over 1.000 people, 300 of which are IT-professionals, divided into 40+ Scrum teams. Together, we strive to make bol.com into the best, most customer-centric shop possible.


As Software Engineer Big Data you’ll join a Scrum team in the Shopping Experience Space, one of three feature spaces where agile en continuous delivery are the norm. In this space, everything revolves around the customer experience. Focus areas range from responsive websites, so the customer journey is optimized on all devices, to personalization on the bol.com platform. That platform will become your home away from home. Together with your Scrum team members – Software Engineers with bits and bytes for blood cells – you develop, test and deploy big data / Java solutions that facilitate personalization. Innovation, both from a functional and a technical standpoint, is a daily reality, because there is still a world to be gained. You also analyze and solve performance issues, e.g. by utilizing Hazelcast. We focus on resiliency, e.g. with Hystrix, and on creating transparency in our application portfolio by devising indicators and using dashboard visualization.


Your role:



  • Develop, test and implement big data / Java solutions, especially for (but not limited to) our personalization platform

  • You work in an autonomous team; together you oversee software from development to production.

  • You are and feel responsible for your software; You Build IT, You Run IT, You Love IT!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer: Payments at Twitch (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twitch is building the future of interactive entertainment. The services we create for our users have deep, lasting effects on their lives. For many of our partnered broadcasters, streaming on Twitch is a career, and our payments system is central to making that possible.

We're looking for a software engineer who gets why the story, "I bought a sub using my favorite streamer's sub button so I can talk in sub-only chat" starts off looking simple, but isn't. You like wrangling existing technologies together to solve business problems. Maybe you've built an e-commerce site or two. On our team, you'll specialize in payments and related products like emotes and Turbo. Together, we're transforming the gaming world, $4.99 at a time.

item.title: Hey, help us (Canva) build our Android App! at Canva (Sydney, Australia)
item.description:
At Canva, we’re transforming the way the world designs. Our mission is to make beautiful design possible for everyone. But making design simple is not easy and we need to continue to build a world-class team to pursue the many huge opportunities in front of us. So if you want to play a key role in one of the world’s fastest growing startups, this job could be for you.


Due to incredible growth throughout the past three years, we are now seeking to build one of Sydney’s best Android software development teams to bring the Canva platform to Android users.  This is an opportunity to make waves in the mobile world by delivering a world class product to millions and be one of the first Android Engineers at Canva.


Responsibilities



  • Work closely with designers and product managers to deliver Canva’s Android offering

  • Create and ship high quality code that gets used by millions of people all over the world

  • Participate in design and code reviews; contribute to the look and feel of the Android application

  • Engage in in-depth technically and product design discussions with the team

  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks – with passion for performance debugging and benchmarking

  • Collaborate with other team members to determine the best solutions to difficult engineering and user experience problems

item.description: Werde als Entwickler von anspruchsvollen Web-Anwendungen Teil unseres Teams. Unsere Projekte sind dabei so vielfältig wie unsere Kunden, bei itemis baust du Erfahrungen in unterschiedlichen Branchen auf. Wenn du stets offen für Neue Menschen, Projekte und Technologien bist und Lust auf Arbeit hast, die wirklich Spaß macht, dann bist du in unserem Team genau richtig!

item.title: Forward-Thinking Scala Developer with experience in backend application (f/m) at eSailors IT solutions GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Ready to hack your career? 


Here’s your opportunity. We are looking for fully-fledged software engineers who are obsessed with building resilient, reactive applications using Scala and Java. It needs to be your obsession, because you will be helping us build back end applications with tough requirements for responsiveness, resilience and reliability whilst handling zero-downtime deployments and highly elastic levels of incoming traffic.


 A great challenge, and we have everything in place to support you within our agile ecosystem – an open environment consisting of forward-thinking, self-reliant teams. Are you also into open-source and as passionate as we are about pair programming, devops, micro-services, brown bag sessions and hackathons? Fantastic.


 Let’s look at the requirements in detail.


Technologies & Challenges:



  • Design, build, test and maintain our advanced Akka and Scala backend applications

  • Data modelling and operations for distributed NoSQL databases, in particular Cassandra

  • Understand the impact of distributed, clustered applications and databases – Help take care of our continuous integration and continuous delivery pipelines using

  • Ansible, Jenkins and Docker

  • Build RESTful interfaces using hypermedia and application profiles

  • More than a passing familiarity with Linux

item.title: (Senior) Scala Developer (m/f) at Risk.Ident GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are currently looking for well experienced Scala Developers to support our Development Teams. All three of these cross-functional and international teams have many interesting challenges waiting for you: One team is developing a large scale cloud service for fraud prevention, building distributed responsive and resilient solutions which evaluate transactions in real-time. The second team is building on-premise solutions for business customers, ingesting wide varieties of data for automatic classification of events, as well as providing a presentation layer for manual review/classification. The third team is developing a scalable platform for real-time data processing, analysis and prediction, turning insights and models supplied by our Data Science Team into the production code that forms the backbone of our fraud prevention solutions.


Your Tasks:



  • Development and maintenance of our main software components

  • Continuous refactoring of our codebase

  • Bringing in your ideas of how to improve our software by new technologies

  • Code reviews of your fellow developers

  • Supporting the release and deployment process

  • Working together with our Data Science Team to develop and integrate new approaches for fraud detection

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Android at HERE (Berlin, Germany)

If you are passionate about innovation, software, and smartphones, eager to learn and work with new game-changing technologies, and want to work in an entrepreneurial environment together with a team of very motivated individuals in HERE's Berlin office,  then you are the perfect fit for our team.  A strong track record of developing and delivering world-class client-side native smartphone applications is a must.


Key responsibilities:



  • Design and build advanced location-based functionality for the Android platform

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features, with a focus on end-to-end quality

  • Create intuitive, custom UI controls and interfaces that match our great user experience

  • Write unit and acceptance tests to validate robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability

  • Create and maintain technical documentation for new features and applications

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer (m/w) at Career Partner GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Die Career Partner GmbH ist Deutschlands größte und am stärksten wachsende private Bildungsgruppe. Wir sind Innovationsführer in der Digitalisierung tertiärer Bildung. Hochschulangebote der renommierten Internationalen Hochschule Bad Honnef · Bonn GmbH werden für internationale Studierende auf Englisch sowie im dualen und Fernstudium an über 30 Standorten angeboten. Die fachschulischen Angebote werden von der Steigenberger Akademiedurchgeführt. Die CP hr Training GmbH und die PROAKTIV Management AG verantworten das Trainings- und Weiterbildungsgeschäft, mit denen die Gruppe inzwischen in Deutschland die Marktführerschaft erreicht hat.


Unterstützen Sie unser Team ab sofort in Vollzeit an unserem Standort in München oder Hamburg


Ihre Aufgaben:


- Mitarbeit an anspruchsvollen Web-/Mobile- sowie App-Projekten
- Umsetzung professionellen, UX/UI-optimierten Designs für Web/Mobile
- Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Designern im agilen Umfeld
- Innovations-Treiber neuer Frontend-Technologien, die spür- & sichtbar die Erfahrung der Nutzer verbessert


Ihr Profil:


- Experte in Frontend-Technologien wie CSS3, SVG Animationen, Bootstrap, HTML5,
- JavaScript (Schwerpunkt jQuery)
- UI Erfahrung für mobile Websites und Knowhow mit Frameworks wie jQuery-Mobile
- Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Entwicklung professioneller Web-/Mobile-Applikationen sowie mit Grid Systemen und Git
- Gute Kenntnisse in Site Performance sowie Geschwindigkeitsoptimierungen
- Gespür für gute Usability und Liebe zum Detail, Kommunikationstalent


Wir bieten:


- Eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten und flache Hierarchien
- Einsatz moderner Technologien und Möglichkeiten zur persönlichen Weiterbildung
- Zusammenarbeit in Teams auf Basis agiler Werte und Prinzipien
- Flexible und familienfreundliche Arbeitsbedingungen (HomeOffice)


Sie finden sich in diesem Profil wieder und suchen nach einer neuen Herausforderung? Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt online über unser Karriereportal bis zum 13.11.2016.


Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter www.careerpartner.eu


Online Bewerben - https://jobdb.softgarden.de/jobdb/public/jobposting/applyonline/click?jp=622120

item.title: Backend Developer C++ (m/f) at CeleraOne GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are a team of highly motivated software architects and mathematicians from diverse backgrounds - from text mining, routing algorithms, and social networks to compiler technologies and mathematics. We combine our knowledge to improve CeleraOne's technology and products every day. 


We develop our backend mainly in C++ 11 and Python. The frontend is based on modern JavaScript technologies. We strive for high code quality and rigorous testing. Each line of code must pass peer review.


About the Job




  • Enhancement of CeleraOne’s in-memory architecture and JIT compiler technology based on LLVM




  • Development of efficient algorithms and data structures for real-time processing of large data volumes




  • Multi-threading in C++ by using state of the art technologies (C++ 11, Boost, ZeroMQ, Intel TBB)




  • Design of highly scalable distributed architectures

item.title: Backend Developer at Netquest (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Netquest is the online fieldwork provider for the market research sector leader in Spain, Portugal and Latin America. We currently have more than 1,000,000 consumers willing to give us their opinion in 21 countries, and the latest technology to manage and survey them.


We are now looking for a talented Backend Developer to join our development team.


Several years ago we built our own panel profiling platform and due to the evolution of the business and the technology, we want to rebuild it from scratch adapting it to our current and future needs, and the volume of data we're currently dealing with, and also prepare it to handle the business growth we're experiencing.


We have more than one million collaborators (panelists) whom we store profiling information structured in thousands of variables. Our platform needs to model those variables, store all the information we've got about our collaborators and offer an almost real-time data process which allows our users to see what we've got in our panel.


WHAT WE OFFER:


We offer a place in one of the development teams working in Netquest. In the IT team we are about 20 mates, among developers, systems/dev-ops & QA.


We develop based on Agile methodologies: XP + Scrum, always adapted to our needs. We have two week sprints with demo and retrospective after each sprint. On the XP side we encourage to use TDD as well as code reviews and code conventions meetings.


We are open-minded about choosing the technology that suits better in each project, so we love learning new technologies (languages, frameworks, tools, …) so we can widen our choices.


Between our current development tools we can find:



  • Eclipse / IntelliJ IDE

  • git / GitHub

  • Jenkins CI & testing automation

  • Jira + Agile

  • JProfiler, JMeter, Gatling

  • Artifactory, Maven, Sbt

  • AWS

  • Docker


Regarding the project we're recruiting for, we are envisioning a large set of applications with a Service Oriented Architecture to enforce separation of concerns.


We're currently evaluating a wide set of technologies for persistence systems and data processing, and we are also open to choose the proper language that suits the needs of each service.


We need a team member who can help us outline the component's architecture and participate in the definition of technology stack and the design of the involved services.

item.title: VBA Entwickler (m/w) für Workflow-Management-System at Hemmersbach Holding GmbH (Nürnberg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Du bist bei einem der besten IT-Serviceprovider weltweit für die Weiter­entwicklung unseres gewachsenen Workflow-Management-Systems verantwortlich. Unsere Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen arbeiten ausschließlich mit eigen­entwickelten Anwendungen, die Du und Dein Team zusammen für den rein internen Gebrauch programmieren. Dein Fokus liegt auf der VBA- und (T)SQL-Programmierung. Du erweiterst mit Deiner Arbeit den Leistungs­umfang unserer Prozess­management­software, treibst dadurch unsere Geschäfts­prozesse voran und erleichterst durch automatisierte Report­erstellungen das Arbeitsleben Deiner unter­nehmensweiten Kollegen/-innen:



  • Du übernimmst die Wartung, die Weiterentwicklung und das Trouble­shooting unserer Kern­applikation auf VBA Basis mit Access Frontend

  • Du implementierst Workflows durch die Para­metrierung existierender Funktions­bausteine

  • Du lebst Deine Leidenschaft aus, Anwendern eine angepasste und funktionierende Applikation zur Verfügung zu stellen

item.title: PHP Entwickler (m/w) Webapplikationen at Hemmersbach Holding GmbH (Nürnberg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Du bist bei einem der besten IT-Serviceprovider weltweit für die Neu- und Weiter­entwicklung unserer internen Web­applikationen verantwortlich. Um die Vielzahl unserer internationalen Projekte transparent und effizient zu bearbeiten, entwickeln wir für unsere Kollegen/-innen weltweit eine Anwendung, die die tägliche Arbeit zur Erbringung unserer Services vereinfacht und beschleunigt. Du setzt unsere internen Prozesse zur Auftrags­bearbeitung in Form eines klar definierten Workflows inner­halb einer neuen webbasierten Anwendung um und stellst damit automatisierte Prozess­schritte sicher:



  • Entwicklung neuer webbasierter Portal­lösungen für unsere internen Abteilungen weltweit

  • Funktions­erweiterungen unserer bereits bestehenden PHP-basierten Web­applikationen in Zusammen­arbeit mit dem zuständigen Requirements Engineer

  • Du hast Spaß daran, Prozesse zu analysieren, diese in Web­applikationen umzusetzen und damit eine einzig­artige Software zu schaffen

item.title: Head of Development (m/w) at mobileJobs GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Über uns


mobileJob.com ist aus der etventure-Familie entstanden und hat sich mithilfe namhafter Investoren zu dem wohl vielversprechendsten Start-up im HR-Markt entwickelt. Weit über 400 Kunden sowie zahlreiche Start-up-Auszeichnungen zeigen: mobileJob.com gehört die Zukunft. Wir bieten die erste funktionierende Mobile-Recruiting-Lösung für den gewerblichen Arbeitsmarkt.


Als junges Unternehmen arbeiten wir jeden Tag hart an unseren Zielen, wissen allerdings auch, wie man Erfolge gebührend feiert. Unser Unternehmensstandort Berlin bietet den idealen Rahmen dafür. Seit der Gründung im Jahr 2014 bieten wir unseren Mitarbeitern glänzende Perspektiven in einem wachsenden Markt.


Aus Gründen der Lesbarkeit sind in dem Stellenangebot die männliche und weibliche Sprachform nicht nebeneinander aufgeführt. Bewerbungen sind gleichermaßen von Frauen und Männern gewünscht.


Was Dich bei uns erwartet



  • Aufbau, Führung und Weiterentwicklung unseres Development Teams

  • Du übernimmst Verantwortung für unsere Softwarearchitektur unserer mobileJob Plattform

  • Du bist verantwortlich für alle technischen Entwicklungen unseres Tools

  • Du unterstützt unser Produktteam bei der stetigen Weiterentwicklung unseres Tools, von der Ideenfindung bis hin zur operativen Umsetzung

  • Ressourcenplanung und Budgetverantwortung für das Development Team

  • Aufbau und Durchführung des Test-Driven Developments

  • Planung und Implementierung von Features in verschiedenen Applikationen

  • Entwicklung von Web-Applikationen mit Ruby on Rails auf Basis agiler Methoden (Scrum)

  • Konzeption, Entwicklung und Implementierung neuer Module und Komponenten

  • Pflege der bestehenden Plattformen sowie der Datenmigration deren Weiterentwicklung


Das bringst Du mit



  • Architekturverständnis, Kreativität und hohe Ansprüche an Software-Qualität

  • Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Umgang mit Ruby on Rails

  • Du verfügst über erste Erfahrung im Aufsetzen von Schnittstellen und in der Anbindung an externe Systeme, idealerweise zu ATS oder Jobportalen

  • Du bist mit den gängigen Security Themen vertraut

  • Continuous Deployment ist kein Fremdwort für Dich

  • Testautomatisierung ist für Dich ein bekanntes Instrument

  • Fundierte Kenntnisse zu verschiedenen Web-Applikationen

  • Erste Erfahrung in der Führung von Entwicklern

  • Erfahrung im Umgang mit Git, Spring bzw. Hybernate

  • Idealerweise erste praktische Erfahrung im Umgang mit agilen Entwicklungsmethoden (insbesondere Scrum)

  • Wenn es um Trends zu neusten Technologien geht, hältst Du Dich immer auf dem Laufenden



Deine zukünftigen Kollegen freuen sich auf



  • Einen motivierten und loyalen Arbeitskollegen

  • Einen klugen Kopf, der seine bisher gesammelte Erfahrung für das Unternehmen einbringen will

  • Eine Person, die die Energie und das Engagement hat, etwas Großes mit aufzubauen

  • Einen Mitarbeiter, der sich nicht scheut, Neues zu lernen


Das bieten wir Dir



  • Die Möglichkeit dein eigenes Team aufzubauen und dieses optimal zu entwickeln

  • Einen großen Verantwortungsbereich und jede Menge Freiräume diesen optimal auszufüllen

  • Ein innovatives Produkt, welches sich sowohl an Geschäfts- als auch Endkunden richtet und das Potenzial hat, den Recruiting-Markt zu revolutionieren

  • Eine offene und dynamische Kultur, die auf schnelles Lernen und Umsetzen ausgelegt ist, in der jeder Mitarbeiter an der Entwicklung des Ganzen teilnehmen kann

  • Ein Management, dem Deine persönliche Entwicklung am Herzen liegt

  • Ein tolles und offenes Arbeitsumfeld, in dem die Zusammenarbeit Spaß macht

  • Regelmäßige gemeinsame Aktivitäten und Mitarbeiterevents

  • Ein gut erreichbares Büro direkt an der U-Bahn-Station Oranienburger Tor im Bezirk Mitte

item.title: Backend-kodande Team Manager till Projectplace at Projectplace (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Vi söker en ny kollega som nördigt mycket älskar utveckling och som vill arbeta och växa tillsammans med likasinnade människor. Som kodande Team Manageringår du i en grupp med mycket erfarna utvecklare samtidigt som du har fulltpersonalansvar för Projectplaces alla backendutvecklare.

Som Team Manager ingår du i Product Development. Där jobbar vi i korsfunktionella team med utvecklare, testare och designers i nära samarbete med produktägare. Vi arbetar i en agil miljö med teknik i framkant.

Vi söker dig som har ett brinnande intresse för människor men som vill ha kvar en fot i tekniken. Du trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra och vet att ett bra team överträffar den bästa individen.

item.title: Developer.NET at EBA CLEARING (Paris, France)
item.description:
The post



We are looking for a full-time, permanent employee to support our Project Management Office (PMO) team in their work on new initiatives and projects.



The successful candidate will reinforce the PMO team of EBA CLEARING in the Paris office of the Company.



Main responsibilities



Your tasks will include:




  • supporting and upgrading existing applications, programs, and systems;

  • analysing requirements, designing, developing, implementing and testing new applications which provide solutions to business’ needs;

  • supporting the development of our intranet (Microsoft SharePoint) and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) application;

  • developing and maintaining technical documentation;

  • writing, updating and preparing explanatory documentation or presentations on the software tools, applications, systems, programs as well as operating procedures;

  • updating statistics and reports as well as preparing new reports and enhancing the way the data is displayed;

  • assisting in resolving problems reported by team members.



Within this post, you will be reporting to the management of the PMO team.

item.title: (Senior) JavaScript Developer (m/f) at Risk.Ident GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description: We are looking for a (Senior) JavaScript Developer to currently maintain and later on rebuild the current FRIDA user interface. As a JavaScript Developer at Risk.Ident, you will be responsible for maintaining and extending existing products, and developing the UI technology for new products. Additionally, he or she would have a good eye for design and an understanding of „Information Architecture“, being able to apply his or her knowledge to making UX improvements and suggestions.

item.title: Senior Frontend Software Engineer (m/f) - Company at Rocket Internet SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About your new role


As a Sr Frontend Software Developer in one of our companies, you will help to launch a successful startup company and build systems at scale that matter to many people around the world, as well as having the chance to see for yourself how a company grows and develops. 


At Rocket companies, no two days are the same. The following tasks will be part of your new role:

  • Entitlement for your own projects and daily tasks

item.title: Lead Developer JAVA/JEE (H/F) at Nat System (Maisons-Alfort, France)
item.description:
Nat System renforce son Pôle Délégation de Compétences et recherche un Lead Developer JAVA/JEE (H/F) ayant une double compétence : technique et gestion de projet. Vous interviendrez en tant que référent technique sur l’ensemble du cycle de développement (conception, mise en œuvre, production et livraison)


Rattaché au Directeur de projet, vos principales missions seront :


Sur l’aspect Technique :
- assurer une continuité dans l’expertise sur l’écosystème JAVA/JEE
- participer à la conception et à la réalisation de logiciels (applications web, batchs, outils transverses)
- réaliser l’étude et l’implémentation d’Architecture (audit, migration, mise en conformité, réalisation spécifique)
- instaurer et contrôler l’application des bonnes pratiques de développement
- coordination de l’équipe (« pizza team » – 5/6 pers)


Sur l’aspect Projet :
- gestion de planning (Excel)
- planification et suivi des charges
- gestion de projets complexes s’appuyant sur une maîtrise des technologies JAVA/JEE
- rédaction de réponses à Appels d’offre (ponctuel)
- veille technologique


Quelques exemples de projets :
- conception et supervision du développement, des tests et de la mise en production de l’application VIGIE (évaluation de la veille qualité) pour le compte de la SNCF
- expertise sur l’intégration des contraintes d’infrastructure pour les applications NatJet au sein d’HSBC
- supervision du développement et responsable architecture pour la refonte de l’application Encaissement de l’INPI
- amélioration de la qualité R&D

item.title: Senior PHP Developer IT Backbone (m/f) at ABOUT YOU GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
:: ABOUT THE TEAM AND THE JOB


Our Backbone team is our latest project. As our API for all shop data-flows they renew our core IT with the goal to condition incoming and outgoing data-flow and ensure quick and correct data outputs. They are our „data-inspectors“: manage high volume of data, love complexity, detect errors. You want to code mvp-focused with great impact on our core system. You like to contribute your ideas to a new project with lots of challenges? Then you are the perfect support for our Backbone team who is searching for a (Senior) PHP Developer (m/f) at the moment.


:: ABOUT WHAT TO EXPECT



  • Development of a brand new backend platform in PHP

  • Agile processes, that are adapted to the team’s and project’s needs

  • A modern and high-performance technical setup

  • Great software architecture with many opportunities to learn and gain knowledge

  • Fast team, flat hierarchies and very short decision making process

  • A highly motivated and experienced team

  • Actively internal knowledge sharing

item.title: C++/Golang Software Engineers (SaaS, 150K customers, Awarded Best Place to Work) at Campaign Monitor (Sydney, Australia)
item.description: Campaign Monitor is seeking several Senior C++ Software Engineers to join our Platform Team; someone who will work on automating and scaling our systems for ever-increasing growth. We send over 1.5 billion emails every month and our infrastructure needs to scale accordingly so we can deliver the best user experience possible.

item.title: Fullstack Software Engineer - C#/.NET/React/SOA (SaaS, $250M funding Series A) at Campaign Monitor (Sydney, Australia)
item.description:
We're looking for several Software Engineers for our massively growing Sydney office. This is the perfect opportunity for a smart Software Engineer with at least 5 years experience developing elegant and scalable solutions in an agile software environment.


What you'll be working on


As a Software Engineer you will have the benefit from working on some really challenging and fun projects. Depending on your skill set and desire, you will be working in either our Product or Platform team on anything from exciting new feature development, tackling scalability, Microservices, Distributed Architecture,  while using technologies such as MVC 5.2, C#, Octopus Deploy, React, and much more. Sure our tech stack is mostly .NET/React, however don’t worry if you don’t have prior experience in that tech, we'd rather hire solid language agnostic software engineers who are keen on learning on the job.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer (m/f) at Allianz X GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Our software engineers develop next-generation products that give our entrepreneurs a head start in developing start-ups in the InsurTech space. As a software engineer, you work in a small team and can switch teams as our fast-paced start-ups grow and evolve. With your technical expertise, you will manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You will also be involved in agile development processes, create new systems around scalable, reliable performance architecture to deliver an intuitive, cross-device and cross-browser experience for all our products. Your focus is to build a large, scalable and pluggable cross-platform architecture.


Specific responsibilities may include:



  • You are responsible for backend development and design of new, exciting products

  • You independently choose the best approach and frameworks

  • You establish our start-ups’ technical vision and lead all aspects of the technological development

  • You conduct research and case studies on leading edge technologies and make proposals for implementation

  • You conduct code reviews and specification conformance testing

  • You establish an application deployment and quality assurance process

  • You monitor analytics regime to ascertain system traffic

  • You protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the data and servers

  • You collaborate with a team of excellent engineers and product managers


 Required skills:



  • Senior level knowledge in Python (flask, Django) as well as MySQL, MongoDB, Oracle, PostgreSQL, Big Data and ElasticSearch

  • Senior level knowledge in JavaScript (AngularJS and NodeJS)

  • Very good knowledge of Linux and Amazon Web Services

  • Knowledge of iOS and Android development

  • Good understanding of MVC and RESTful APIs

  • Good knowledge of Java and PHP is a big plus

  • Fluency in English (German is a plus)


 Qualifications:



  • Successfully completed degree in Computer Science Engineering, Software Development or equivalent experience

  • Attention to detail - always thinking, “How do I make this better?”

  • Consider yourself a curious, high-level thinker

  • Passion for writing clean, solid, readable code that scales and performs well

  • Experience with rapid prototyping, agile methods and/or Scrum

  • Ability to work tactically and strategically at the same time

  • Eagerness to learn new languages and technology

  • Market interest and awareness for general internet software development trends, consumer tendencies


What we offer:



  • Great environment with an international team of motivated colleagues

  • Opportunity for an exceptional career within a disruptive company and the opportunity to expand your skills on a daily basis

  • Casual workplace, rooftop terrace office located close to Munich’s center - easy to reach by public transportation


Interested?


Does this job description sound perfect for you? We’d love to hear from you. Please send us your CV along with relevant documents and your earliest possible starting date and salary expectations; the position is initially limited for 2 years. Don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions. Your contact person is Christian Wastlhuber.

item.title: Senior Backend Developer (f/m) @ the fastest-growing tech start up in Germany at Blacklane GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Blacklane provides an outstanding ground travel experience in over 200 cities and 50 countries worldwide. Our success comes from a collaboration of nearly 200 people from 40 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us! Help us solve the challenges of moving travelers around the world and support a thriving community of professional drivers.


Senior Backend Developer (Ruby or Javascript) (f/m)


Your challenge:



  • Develop our exciting and innovative product in a large market based on in-house software solutions covering mobile apps and diverse tailor-made platforms.

  • You will be part of a motivated, open-minded and nerd-friendly team determined to improve ground transportation.

  • We use, support and like to write open source software: 


    • https://github.com/troessner/reek

    • https://github.com/isaiah/jubilee

    • https://github.com/lipanski/slow-down


  • You can freely choose your workstation (MacBook Air or Pro / Lenovo Thinkpad).


About you:



  • Proven work experience with Ruby or Javascript.

  • Interest in other programming languages like Elixir, Go or Rust.

  • You know your HTTP codes better than your Pokémon and have some experience with using and or developing APIs.

  • You are test-driven (Rspec, Capybara), quality-minded (code reviews and pair programming) and put emphasis on agile development (Kanban, Scrum).

  • Experience in Ansible is a plus, but not mandatory.

  • Fluent in English, any additional language is a plus.

  • You are highly motivated and passionate about programming, you are a team player and you think things through on your own and can convincingly present alternative approaches based on your expert level in team discussions.

  • You show organizational and communication skills and the ability to prioritize your workload.


More than a job:



  • You will work in the exciting and innovative market of global ground transportation.

  • You will become part of an unique, international and professional team, that is characterized by flat hierarchies, a family-like atmosphere, flexible working hours and an open feedback culture.

  • You will have the tremendous opportunity to grow with us and develop your skills, supported by our talent training team.

  • You will work in a modern office with a variety of fresh fruits and drinks, regular company & team events and a lot of fun games.

  • We will support you in visa, relocation and other administrative issues.


If you want to be a part of an award-winning company that promises a consistently exceptional experience around the world, please apply through our contact form. We look forward to hearing from you!

item.title: Software Development Engineer at Amazon (London, UK)
item.description:
Television is changing. Amazon Video (AV) would like to offer every film to everyone to watch instantly anywhere. Would you like to join us to help shape the future of TV?



AV deliver films and TV shows instantly to PCs, portable devices, consoles, and TVs worldwide. We have opportunities for talented engineers, designers, testers, product managers, and technical leaders to join our development teams in London to work on global features in our web services platform, web development, big screen devices, and mobile/tablet devices development teams. You will be encouraged to see the big picture, be creative, and positively impact millions of customers. This is an evolving business where creativity and drive can have a lasting impact on the way video is enjoyed worldwide.



The AV Platform team is seeking strong software development engineers with distributed services and web service experience to build the services that power all of Amazon Video devices and web globally. As an Amazon software engineer you will design, develop, test, and run operations for core platform services. A successful candidate will have an established background in developing services for consumer-facing products, a strong technical ability, excellent organizational skills, great communication skills, a motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment, and, of course, a passion for TV and film.

- Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience

- Hands-on technical experience as software developer, or related role

- Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design

- Computer Science fundamentals in data structures

- Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis

- Experience developing in at least one of Java, Scala, C++, or Perl



- Experience developing web services, or other large scale distributed systems, that have been successfully delivered to customers

- Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

- Experience influencing software engineers best practices within your team

- Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between

item.title: Senior Android Developer + relocation to Australia at Insight Timer (Sydney, Australia)
item.description:

Design and implement the next generation Android app
Work closely with, and incorporate feedback from, product management, UI designers, platform lead and other engineers on a tightly knit team cross-functional and agile team
Help define best practices

Help to establish an excellent plan and deliver on it, iterating and improving along the way

item.title: Sviluppatore Microsoft .NET at Ulixe (Turin, Italy)

item.title: Full Stack JAVA Developer at Anritsu (Bucureti, Romania)
item.description:

item.title: Senior IT Professional - JavaScript at Roche (Warsaw, Poland)
item.description: Fullstack & Mobile Applications team within Roche Global IT Solutions center is looking for talented and highly motivated  Senior IT Professional - JavaScript We develop applications for the entire Roche. Our user base is tens of thousands of diversified worldwide professionals whose productivity depends on our solutions. Our work spans across different business domains, including financial, collaboration & productivity, and research. Our organisation is a home for the finest in JavaScript developers using cutting edge technologies. The job of the team is to develop code, evaluate existing solutions, consult our business functions on the technical solutions to be taken. As a "Senior IT Professional – JavaScript developer", you will be responsible for developing and implementing application software within project timelines and Roche quality and documentation standards, applying knowledge of systems and tools and problem solving skills to support core business and informatics processes and solutions; proactively resolving or escalating problems when appropriate; You will be required to participate in the execution and documentation of system testing, as well as to maintain and develop own knowledge within the software development domain while supporting colleagues with your solid expertise. You will also participate in organizational development concerning frontend and backend with use of JavaScript.

item.title: Software Tester (m/w) für das SCHUFA-Kern-System at SCHUFA Holding AG (Wiesbaden, Deutschland)
item.description:
Durch Ihre Qualitätssicherung sorgen Sie in einem agilen Scrum-Team dafür, dass die Software des SCHUFA Kernsystems auf Herz und Nieren geprüft wird, bevor sie produktiv geht. Das Kernsystem, eine Eigenentwicklung auf Basis des Java Enterprise Frameworks, verwaltet die Daten aller bei uns registrierten Privatpersonen und führt darauf zentrale Kerngeschäftsprozesse wie die Meldeverarbeitung und die Auskunftserstellung aus. Wenn Sie in einem agilen Team die Qualität der zentralen SCHUFA-Auskunftei-Software sicherstellen möchten, sind Sie bei uns genau richtig.


Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Spezifikation und Auswertung von manuellen funktionalen Testfällen

  • Programmierung der Testskripte mit Hilfe geeigneter Automatisierungswerkzeuge sowie Generierung von Testdaten (z.B. mittels SQL-Skripten)

  • Fehleranalyse und Log-Analyse sowie anschließendes Tracking der Fehler und Pflege im Ticketing Tool (Jira)

  • Aufbau und Pflege der Testumgebungen

  • Fortlaufende Optimierung der Testumgebungen und Testverfahren


Ihr Profil:



  • Abgeschlossene IT-Ausbildung oder Studium der Informatik

  • Erste bis mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Software-Testing

  • Gute Kenntnisse in einer Programmiersprache (idealerweise Java) sowie Grundkenntnisse in einer Skriptsprache

  • Freude am selbständigen und eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten

  • Analytisch, strukturiert und qualitätsorientiert

  • Verhandlungssichere Deutsch-Kenntnisse

item.title: FULL STACK DEVELOPER ANGULAR/NODE.JS at Oneplanetcrowd (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
We are looking for an awesome, experienced full stack developer to create our world-saving crowdfunding platform in a small innovative startup!


CHANGE THE WORLD, ONE LINE OF CODE AT A TIME


The smart guys in our development team built our system from scratch and they're eager to share all their insights. It is a custom built crowdfunding application, integrated with several advanced off-the-shelve fin-tech solutions. We are busy expanding our system using a micro service architecture, based on Node.JS in Docker. We are reforming the current financial industry by creating a disruptive alternative to conventional bank loans, enabling the way for more innovative dreams to come true. This needs a progressively advancing web application. Are you ready to join us in this challenge?


You will get a lot of responsibility and opportunities to influence the decision making process and roadmap.


Who are we looking for?



  • Together with the rest of the team you develop both front and back end of our system

  • You design and implement new features and translate user-stories into technical requirements

  • You proactively identify possible technical challenges and come up with solutions

  • You build responsive reusable component-based UI’s

  • You build back end functionality using JavaScript and Node.JS

  • You want to learn new technologies, and use them if appropriate

  • You advocate for best practices and standards

  • You find and tackle performance issues

  • You have (some) affinity with sustainability and/or finance

  • You understand the balance between perfection (things can always be better) and timely delivery

  • You want to work on-site in our team and have a valid permit to work in NL / EU


What do we offer?


Oneplanetcrowd is a young successful company situated in a beautiful building in the heart of Amsterdam (Royal Tropical Institute). You will be challenged and have lots of opportunities to grow. The atmosphere is informal but ambitious and we think personal development is of crucial importance.



  • A lot of responsibility and room for initiative

  • Work worth doing: disrupting the traditional financial industry

  • The opportunity to hop onto a fast moving train

  • 25 holiday days

  • Pension scheme

  • Good gear (pick your own tools!)

item.title: Development and Operations engineer (DevOps) for Nordea at Nordea Bank Denmark (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Do you want to grow with us and be a part of shaping Nordea’s Continuous integration model?



The position we offer


Counterparty Credit Risk IT in Capital Markets - Nordea is looking for an infrastructure engineer who will not only do operations, but also heavily participate in actual development of new tools and practices. We are currently in a transformation process where monolithic database centric applications are being broken down to smaller pieces of software developed in Java.   


We are at the same time moving towards a continuous integration model, in which you will play an important role.   


We have a very challenging and demanding business who actively expanding and heavily investing in technology. Examples of used and futured used technologies:  



  • Java 8 and in-memory processing (ActivePivot)  

  • Linux environment  

  • Microservices architecture, which means complex deployments  

  • Docker  

  • NoSQL databases  


Your responsibilities:   



  • Create and maintain fully automated CI build processes for multiple products  

  • Work closely on a high-performing, experienced, Agile development team to design, develop and enhance a state-of-the-art deployment pipeline to allow for rapid development, deployment and testing  

  • Collaborate closely with the development team during design and implementation to ensure testability, deployment consistency, scalability, and 100% service uptime  

  • Work closely with the architects to brainstorm, design and implement technical build and deployment solutions  

  • Work with the QA Team to automate and test new deployment software  

  • Develop an automated build and test system using containers technology  

  • Build out the scripts and configuration needed to automate deployment in different environments (dev, test, production)  

  • Produce clear installation and deployment guides  

  • Establish a proactive application monitoring environment  

  • Create an environment where product upgrades can take place with near zero maintenance window  

  • Continual maintenance and improvement of automation

item.title: Senior Java-Entwickler (m/w) für SCHUFA Web at SCHUFA Holding AG (Wiesbaden, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wir suchen Verstärkung für die Weiterentwicklung und Pflege von SCHUFA Web.


SCHUFA Web ist eine Anwendung, die den Geschäftskunden der SCHUFA über das Internet Zugang zu verschiedenen Auskunftsprodukten ermöglicht. Diese basieren auf SCHUFA-Daten sowie auf Daten von weiteren mit der SCHUFA kooperierenden Wirtschaftsauskunfteien.


Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Mitwirkung in einem agilen Software-Entwicklungsteam, das bedeutet:


    • Planning

    • Review

    • Retro

    • Refinement

    • Time-Boxed Stand-Up

    • Pair Programming

    • Code Review

    • Testen (automatisiert und manuell)

    • Requirements-Analyse

    • Begleiten von Produktivnahmen

    • Weiterentwicklung und „leben“ des DevOps-Ansatzes

    • Erstellen von Dokumentation

    • Bearbeitung von Support-Tickets



Ihr Profil:




  • Sie haben ein Informatikstudium oder eine vergleichbare Hochschul-Ausbildung abgeschlossen




  • Sie verfügen über mehrjährige praktische Erfahrungen im Bereich der Java Entwicklung, vorzugsweise Version 6 und höher




  • Sie haben zumindest Grundkenntnisse in möglichst vielen der unten aufgeführten Technologien, Systemen und Methoden.




  • Sie sprechen verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und besitzen Grundkenntnisse in Englisch, vorwiegend in der schriftlicher Kommunikation

item.title: Senior Java Entwickler (m/w) at SCHUFA Holding AG (Wiesbaden, Deutschland)
item.description:
Sie suchen Gleichgesinnte, um in einem agilen Projekt eine Anwendung zu entwickeln, auf die sich unsere Kunden 24 Stunden verlassen können? Sie sehen sich als Teil eines Teams, das gemeinsam seine Visionen verwirklicht? Dann sind sie bei uns genau richtig!

  • Sie haben Spaß am agilen Arbeiten

  • ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und Lösungsorientierung

  • Verhandlungssichere Deutsch-Kenntnisse

item.title: Scrum Master med passion for entreprenørskap at PasientSky (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
Scrum Master med passion for entreprenørskap



Vi i PasientSky har fått en fantastisk start på vår reise for å digitalisere Helse-Norge.


Gjennom sikker og riktig bruk av ny teknologi samt fokus på samspillet mellom pasient og behandler, har vi skapt en av Norges ledende digitale plattformer innen for helse.



Mange spennende og krevende prosjekter venter på oss til neste år, derfor ønsker vi nå å styrke vårt team med en dedikert Scrum Master som kan identifisere seg med vår kultur. Noen nøkkelord knyttet til vår kultur og arbeidsmiljø er; åpenhet, entreprenørskap, høy kompetanse og viljen til å stadig utvikles.



Som vår Scrum Master, kommer du til å ha tids og ressurs ansvaret for selskapets utviklere og fagspesialister, og din viktigste oppgave er å sikre god estimering, gjennomføre og kvalitetssikre effektive og verdiskapende prosjekter/ utviklingsløp. Prosjektene varierer i kompleksitet, størrelse og varighet, fra mindre prosjekter som går over noen måneder til store komplekse utviklingsløp som pågår over flere år.



Rett kandidat har erfaring innen systemarkitektur og systemutvikling eller teknologiledelse, samt har ledet utviklingsløp fra tidligfase/ estimering til utrulling og forvaltning. Utdannelse innen IT og eller business/økonomi - sertifiseringer knyttet til Scrum er et pluss. vi ser etter en handlekraftig og fremoverlent kandidat.



En viktig del av jobben som Scrum Master i PasientSky er å være løsningsorientert, samt å kunne kommunisere på en god måte for å få frem ønsket budskap overfor våre utviklere og ledergruppen.



Vi inspireres til å gjøre en god jobb gjennom å:




  • Utvikle og skape samfunnsnyttige løsninger

  • Bygge et solid kompetanse/ pioner miljø innen E-helse og digitalisering

  • Jobbe hardt i perioder for å nå våre mål, koble av og hente ny energi med 8 ferieuker.

  • Ha et godt sosialt miljø. Vi møtes minimum en gang i måneden til sosiale sprell i tillegg til at vi drar på weekendturer 1-2 ganger pr år.

  • Jobb i nye flott lokaler med egen kokk sentralt på Skøyen

  • Kontinuerlig utvikle oss selv- som igjen utvikler selskapet



Om dette hørtes interessant ut, ser vi frem til å motta din søknad. Ta kontakt med Headhunter Mads Folke Nordmark, mob: 47179343, mail mads@panamera-search.no om du ønsker mer informasjon om stillingen.

item.title: JavaScript/React Developer (Munich) at Futurice (Munich, Germany)
item.description:
Do you want to be challenged by your work, and learn from equally skilled and passionate colleagues? As a JavaScript Developer you will help us concept and build exciting new user experiences, and work in integrated teams to design and develop user-journeys, systems, services and API’s with some of Europe’s most interesting companies and industries.


The Futurice way is to have fun with your colleagues, while giving back to the community, inside a collaborative organization with flat structures and transparent decision making processes. Find out how you can become part of our team.
